forms: With voc. of δειλός. See δειλός 3.a, 3.b.

etym: [perh., with ἀ-1 for ἀν-1, ἀάϝατος, fr. ἀϝάω.  See ἀάζω.]
defs: Thus, not liable to ἄτη, that cannot be taken in vain, unimpeachable, decisive: ἆάατον στυγὸς ὕδωρ Il. 18.271: ἄεθλον ἀάατον Od. 21.91, ἄεθλος ἀάατος Od. 22.5.
Unbroken, unbreakable: ῥόπαλον Od. 11.575.
(1) To smite with blindness of the mind, infatuate, make reckless Il. 21.237: Od. 10.68, Od. 11.61, Od. 21.296, 297. So in mid.: Ἄτη (Ἄτην) ἣ πάντας ἀᾶται Il. 19.91, 129.

(2) In mid., to be so smitten, be made infatuated or reckless: ἀασάμην Il. 9.116, 119, Il. 19.137. Cf. Il. 9.537, Il. 11.340, Il. 19.95. So in pass.: μέγ' ἀάσθη Il. 16.685. Cf. Il. 19.113, 136: Od. 4.503, 509, Od. 21.301.

etym: [app., with ἀ- for ἀ-1, fr. ἅπτω.]
defs: Thus, not to be touched, irresistible: χεῖρες (χεῖρας) Il. 1.567, Il. 21.450, Il. 11.169, Il. 13.49, Od. 3.503, etc.: Od. 11.502, Od. 22.70, 248.

forms: 3 sing. aor. act. and pass. ἀάζω.

defs: Not to be restrained, ungovernable: μένος Il. 5.892. Of grief, uncontrollable: πένθος Il. 24.708.

forms: 3 sing. pres. mid. ἀάω. See ἀάζω.
Except in Il. 22.218 in contr. form ἆτος.
defs: Insatiate of, indefatigable in. With genit.: πολέμοιο Il. 5.388. Cf. Il. 5.863, Il. 7.203, Il. 11.430, Il. 13.746, Il. 22.218: Od. 13.293.

forms: Hence, to be ignorant, fail in recognition Od. 4.249.
App., feeble, weak, gentle: χεῖρα Il. 5.337, τείχεα Il. 21.178: θάνατος Od. 11.135, Od. 23.282.

defs: With united noise Il. 13.41.
With genit., to miss, fail of meeting: ἀλλήλοιιν Il. 10.65.
(1) Well-born, noble Il. 14.113, Il. 21.109: Od. 4.611, Od. 18.276, Od. 21.335. Absol.: τοῖς ἀγαθοῖσιν Od. 15.324, οὐκ ἀγαθοῖσιν Od. 18.383 (v. l. οὐτιδανοῖσιν).
(2) Warlike, soldierly, stout, skilful in fight Il. 1.131, Il. 4.181, Il. 7.478, Il. 13.314, etc. Absol.: ἀγαθοῖσι μάχεσθαι Il. 13.238. Cf. Il. 21.280 (twice), etc.
(3) Passing into 4: ἀ. πάϊς Ἀλκινόοιο Od. 8.130, 143.
(4) Good, worthy, serviceable, skilled: ἰητῆρε Il. 2.732. Cf. Il. 3.179, 237, Il. 13.666, Il. 23.770: πὺξ ἀγαθόν Od. 11.300. For βοὴν ἀ. see βοή 2.

(5) In moral sense, good, of right feeling: ἀ. καὶ ἐχέφρων Il. 9.341. Of the mind, showing discretion, good judgment or discernment, well-balanced: φρεσὶ κέχρητ' ἀγαθῇσιν Od. 3.266. Cf. Od. 14.421, Od. 16.398, Od. 24.194. Sim. φρεσὶ μαίνεται οὐκ ἀγαθῇσιν Il. 21.360.

(6) Of things or abstractions, good of their kind, good, excellent, fine, helpful, in place, or the like: βουλάς Il. 2.273, ὄψιν (his fair . . .) Il. 24.632. Cf. Il. 9.627, Il. 11.793 = Il. 15.404, Il. 23.810: βίον (pleasant) Od. 15.491. Cf. Od. 9.27, Od. 13.246, Od. 15.405, 507, Od. 17.347, 352, Od. 24.249, 286.
(7) Absol. in neut. ἀγαθόν.
(8) Absol. in neut. pl. ἀγαθά.

forms: Very famous, glorious, splendid, worthy Il. 16.738, Il. 17.716, Il. 21.379 Il. 23.529.

defs: To exult Il. 12.114, Il. 17.473, Il. 18.132. To exult in, take delight in. With dat.: πτερύγεσσιν Il. 2.462, πώλοισιν Od. 3.222. Cf. Od. 5.176, Od. 7.272.
(1) An ornament, a glory or delight Il. 4.144: Od. 4.602, Od. 4.300, Od. 19.257.
(2) Of things offered to the gods: πόλλʼ ἀγάλματʼ ἀνῆψεν Od. 3.274. Cf. Od. 3.438, Od. 8.509, Od. 12.347.

forms: Fut. infin. ἀγάσεσθαι Od. 8.565, Od. 13.173. ἀγάσσεσθαι Od. 4.181.
3 sing. aor. ἠγάσσατο Il. 3.181. ἀγάσσατο Il. 17.71: Od. 4.658.
defs: (1) To wonder, marvel: οἵ κʼ ἀγασσάμενοι οἶον ἐπόρσειαν Il. 6.41 (admiring his chivalry; or perh. in sense 3,  grudging him honour): ἀγάσσατο θυμός Od. 4.658. Cf. Od. 16.203, Od. 18.71.

(3) To be jealous, bear a grudge Il. 14.111, Il. 23.639. With dat. of person: οἱ Il. 17.71: Od. 5.122, ἡμῖν Od. 8.565, Od. 13.173. With complementary infin.: θεαῖς ἀγάασθε παῤ ἀνδράσιν εὐνάζεσθαι Od. 5.119. Cf. Od. 5.129, Od. 23.211. With acc.: τά Od. 4.181.
(4) To be offended or hurt Od. 23.175.
(5) To be indignant or offended at: κακὰ ἔργα Od. 2.67. Cf. Od. 23.64. With dat. of person: εἴ πέρ μοι ἀγάσσεαι Od. 1.389.
Very snowy, snowclad. Epithet of Olympus Il. 1.420, Il. 18.186.
(1) Gentle, mild, affectionate: ἐπέεσσιν Il. 2.164, 180, 189, Il. 24.772: ἀ. καὶ ἤπιος Od. 2.230=Od. 5.8, μύθοις Od. 15.53.
(2) Soothing, effecting propitiation, winning acceptance: δώροισιν Il. 9.113, εὐχωλῇσιν 499: Od. 13.357.
(3) Of the shafts of Apollo and Artemis, bringing painless death Il. 24.759: Od. 3.280 = Od. 15.411, Od. 5.124 =  Od. 11.173 = 199.
Gentleness of disposition, mildness Il. 24.772: Od. 11.203.
Of gentle disposition, mild: ἀνήρ Od. 3.467.
(1) = ἀγαπάω 1 Od. 16.17. In mid.: οὐδ' ἀγαπαζόμενοι φιλέουσιν Od. 6.33. Cf. Od. 17.35 = Od. 22.499, Od. 21.224.
(2) To play the host to: ὰθάνατον θεόν Il. 24.464.
(1) To welcome, greet, caress Od. 23.214.
(2) To be contented: οὐκ ἀγαπᾷς δ . . ; Od. 21.289.
Showing kindliness to fellow-men, courteous. Epithet of heroes Il. 8.114, Il. 13.756, Il. 15.392, Il. 23.113 = 124: Od. 6.170.
Beloved, darling Il. 7.401: Od. 2.365, Od. 4.727, 817, Od. 5.18.
Strongly flowing. Epithet of the Hellespont Il. 2.845, Il. 12.30.
Much groaning, roaring. Epithet of Amphitrite Od. 12.97.

Of persons, an epithet of general commendation, noble, illustrious, or the like: κήρυκες Il. 3.268. Cf. Il. 5.277, Il. 6.386, Il. 11.1, Il. 17.284, Il. 19.281, Il. 24.251, etc.: μνηστῆρες Od. 2.209. Cf. Od. 2.308, Od. 7.55, Od. 11.213, Od. 13.272, etc. In superl.: ἀγαυότατον ζωόντων Od. 15.229.

A message, news, tidings: ἀλεγεινῇ Il. 2.787, ἐμὴν ἀγγελιην (about me) Il. 19.337. Cf. Il. 6.416, Il. 15.174, etc.: πατρός (about your father) Od. 1.408. Cf. Od. 1.414, Od. 2.30, Od. 14.374, Od. 24.48, etc. In cognate acc.: ἀγγελίην ἐπὶ τυδῆ στεῖλαν (dispatched him on a message; ἐπί adverbial. ( ἐπί I.4)) Il. 4.384, ἀγγελίην ἐλθόντα (having come on a message) Il. 11.140. In genit. denoting scope of action: σεῦ ἕνεκʼ ἀγγελίης (on a message concerning thee) Il. 3.206, ἀγγελιης τευ (on a message concerning someone) Il. 13.252, ἀγγελίης οἴχνεσκεν (used to go with messages) Il. 15.640. (In the last five passages the word is also taken as a masc. ἀγγελίης = ἄγγελος.)

(1) To bear a message or order, make an announcement or communication Il. 8.398, 409, Il. 9.617, Il. 11.185, Il. 19.120, Il. 24.77 = 159: Od. 16.150. With dat.: ποιμένι λαῶν Od. 4.24, 528. Cf. Od. 4.679, Od. 7.50, Od. 15.458, Od. 18.186 = Od. 22.434 = 496. With dat. and complementary infin.: Πριάμῳ λύσασθαι Il. 24.145: κείνοις οἶκόνδε νέεσθαι Od. 16.350. Without dat.: λέξασθαι Il. 8.517. Sim. with dat. and ὅττι Il. 22.439.
(2) To announce, communicate Il. 10.448, Il. 15.159, Il. 17.701: Od. 23.22. To give news of Od. 14.120, 123. To herald Od. 13.94.

A messenger or envoy Il. 1.334, Il. 2.786, Il. 5.804, Il. 10.286, Il. 11.652, Il. 22.438, etc.: Od. 5.29, Od. 8.270, Od. 15.458, Od. 16.468, Od. 24.405, etc. With dat. and complementary infin.: ἄμμι θωρήσσεσθαι Il. 11.715. Cf. Il. 18.167, Il. 24.194. Sim. with dat. and ὅ Od. 12.374. Of birds of augury Il. 24.292, 296, 310: Od. 15.526.
A vessel or receptacle Od. 2.289. For milk Il. 2.471 = Il. 16.643: Od. 9.222, 248. For wine Od. 16.13.

etym: [imp. sing. and pl. of ἄγω used interjectionally.]
defs: (1) ἄγε.
(b) With 1 sing. subj., come, I will . . . : ἀλλʼ ἄγ' ἐξείπω Il. 9.60. Cf. Od. 20.296, etc.– ἀλλ' ἄγε δή Od. 13.215.– εἰ δ' ἢ ἄγε Od. 9.37, Od. 24.336.

(c) With 1 pl, come, let us . . .: ἄγε νἦ ἐρύσσομεν Il. 1.141. Cf. Il. 6.299, Il. 14.314, Il. 22.391.– ἀλλ' ἄγε Od. 3.257, etc.: Od. 4.776, Od. 8.34, 389, Od. 10.44, Od. 13.13, 296, Od. 14.393, Od. 16.348, Od. 17.190.– ἀλλʼ ἄγε δή Il. 1.62, Il. 3.441, Il. 4.418, Il. 5.249, Il. 11.348, Il. 23.537, Il. 24.356, etc.: Od. 17.274. Elliptically: ἀλλʼ ἄγε δεῦρο θεοὺς ὲπιδώμεθα Il. 22.254.
(d) With fut.: ἀλλʼ ἄγε πειρήσομαι Od. 7.126. Cf. Od. 13.344, 397.– ἀλλ' ἄγε δή Od. 3.351, Il. 21.60: Od. 10.286, Od. 13.215.– εἰ δ(ὴ) ἄγε Il. 1.524, Il. 23.579: Od. 21.217.
(e) Introducing a question: ἀλλʼ ἄγε Il. 6.36: Od. 19.24.
(2) ἄγετε.
(b) With imp. pl.: ἀλλʼ ἄγετε Il. 6.193, etc.: Od. 4.294, Od. 10.460 = Od. 12.23, Od. 21.134, Od. 22.252. With sing.: ἀλλʼ ἄγετ' ἐπαρξάσθω Od. 21.263.
(d) With 1 sing.: ἀλλʼ ἄγετʼ ὲνείκω Od. 22.139.

forms: Aor. ἤγειρα Il. 17.222: Od. 2.41. ἄγειρα Od. 14.285.
Pass. 3 sing aor. ἀγέρθη Il. 4.152, Il. 22.475: Od. 5.458, Od. 24.349.
3 pl. plupf. ἀγηγέρατο Il. 4.211, Od. 3.13: Od. 11.388, Od. 24.21.
defs: (1) To bring or gather together, cause to assemble Il. 1.142, Il. 2.438, Il. 3.47, Il. 9.544, Il. 17.222, etc.: Od. 2.41, Od. 3.140, Od. 16.349. Absol. Od. 2.28.

(2) In mid. and pass., to come or gather together, assemble: ἐπεὶ ἤγερθεν Il. 1.57. Cf. Il. 2.52, Il. 3.209, Il. 4.211, Il. 18.245, Il. 23.287, etc.: ἠγείροντο μάλ' ὦκα Od. 2.8. Cf. Od. 2.385, Od. 4.686, Od. 11.632, Od. 14.25 (the herd of swine), Od. 20.123 (v.l. ἐγρόμεναι fr. ἐγείρω; cf. ἐγείρω 4), etc.

(3) In reference to things, to get together, collect: πολλά Od. 14.285. Cf. Od. 3.301, Od. 19.197. In mid.: ἀγειρόμενοι κατὰ δῆμον Od. 13.14. To get by begging Od. 17.362. In reference to something immaterial: θυμὸς ἀγέρθη (his spirit was rallied) Il. 4.152, Il. 22.475: Od. 5.458, Od. 24.349.
Belonging to a or to the herd. Of oxen Il. 11.729, Il. 23.846: Od. 10.410, Od. 17.181 = Od. 20.251, Od. 22.299.
That drives or carries off the spoil. Epithet of Athene Il. 4.128, Il. 5.765, Il. 7.269 = 279, Il. 15.213: Od. 13.359, Od. 16.207.
In a herd Il. 16.160.

forms: An epithet of commendation of peoples and persons of uncertain meaning Il. 2.654, Il. 11.36, Il. 5.623, Il. 6.343, Il. 10.430, Il. 16.708, Il. 21.584: Od. 11.286.

defs: Wonder, amazement, confusion: ἄγη μ'  ἔχει Il. 21.221: Od. 3.227, Od. 16.243.
(1) Courage, spirit Il. 12.46, Il. 22.457.
(2) The quality in excess or with arrogance. In pl. Il. 9.700.
(1) Manly, bold, courageous Il. 9.398, Il. 10.299, Il. 24.42, etc.: Od. 2.103, Od. 11.562, etc.— ;App. ironically (of Thersites) Il. 2.276.
(2) Conveying at any rate a shade of blame (indicating the exhibition of the quality in excess or with arrogance) Il. 9.699, Il. 21.443: Od. 1.106, 144, Od. 20.160, etc.

forms: Acc. pl. ἀγήρως Od. 6.94. Not subject to old age Il. 8.539, Il. 12.323, Il. 17.444: Od. 5.136 = Od. 6.257 =  Od. 23.336, Od. 5.218, Od. 6.94.

defs: To be wondered at, admirable: εἶδος ἀγητοί (i.e. in that only) Il. 5.787 = Il. 8.228, εἶδος ἀγητόν Il. 22.370. Cf. Il. 24.376: Od. 14.177.
(1) In reference to domestic animals, to drive, lead, bring Od. 14.105, Od. 20.213, Od. 22.198. To a hunting dog, to take with one Od. 17.294.
(2) To persons, to lead, conduct Il. 18.493.
(3) To things, to fetch, bring, carry Il. 24.784.
To take up in the arms Il. 17.722.
The bent arm Il. 18.555, Il. 22.503.
A fish-hook (app. (at any rate sometimes) of metal; cf. Il. 16.408) Od. 4.369 = Od. 12.332.
A bend; hence, a glen or valley Il. 18.321, Od. 3.490, Il. 22.190: Od. 4.337 = Od. 17.128.
To hang up on. With dat.: χιτῶνα πασσάλῳ Od. 1.440.
Of crooked counsel, wily. Epithet of Cronos Il. 2.205, 319, Il. 4.59, 75, Il. 9.37, Il. 12.450, Il. 16.431, Il. 18.293: Od. 21.415.

forms: Epithet of τόξα Il. 5.209, Il. 7.322: Od. 21.264.
Of ἅρμα (referring to the curved form of the front) Il. 7.39.

defs: Armed with curved bows, bearing bows. Epithet of the Paeonians Il. 2.848, Il. 10.428.
With curved lips; hence, with hooked beak Il. 16.428:= Od. 22.302, Od. 19.538.
(2) An angle (of a wall): ἀγκῶνος τείχεος Il. 16.702.
To glory or take delight in something Il. 10.331.
(1) Splendour, beauty, glory Il. 7.510 = Il. 15.267: Od. 17.310, Od. 18.180, Od. 19.82.
(2) A source of honour or distinction: κῦδός τε καὶ ἀ. Od. 15.78 (the two words hardly to be distinguished).
(3) In pl., personal adornments, bravery Od. 17.244.

forms: Bearing goodly fruit: μηλέαι Od. 6.115 = Od. 11.589.
An epithet of commendation of somewhat indefinite meaning.
defs: (1) Of things or abstractions, splendid, fine, goodly, bright or the like: ἄποινα Il. 1.23, ὕδωρ Il. 2.307. Cf. Il. 1.213, Il. 2.506, Il. 6.203, Il. 19.385, Il. 23.262, etc.: ἱστόν Od. 2.109, ἔργα Od. 13.289. Cf. Od. 3.429, Od. 4.589, Od. 7.291, etc.
(2) Of persons, goodly, fine or the like Il. 2.736, 871, Il. 11.385 (see κέρας 4), etc.: Od. 3.190, Od. 11.249, etc.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἠγοίησε Il. 1.537, Il. 2.807, Il. 13.28: Od. 5.78.
3 sing. pa. iterative ἀγνώσασκε (contr. fr. ἀγνοήσασκε fr. ἀγνοέω) Od. 23.95.
defs: (1) To fail to know or recognize Il. 2.807, Il. 13.28: Od. 5.78, Od. 20.15, Od. 23.95 (continually showed that she did not recognize him), Od. 24.218.
(2) With dependent clause, to fail to perceive something as to (a person): οὐδέ μιν ἠγνοίησεν ὅτι . . . Il. 1.537.
(1) Of goddesses, holy, pure Od. 5.123, Od. 11.386, Od. 18.202, Od. 20.71.
(2) Dedicated to a god, hallowed: ἑορτή Od. 21.259.

forms: Nom. dual masc. pple. ἄξαντε Il. 7.40, Il. 16.371.
Pass. Genit. pl. fem. pres. pple. ἀγνυμενάων Il. 16.769: Od. 10.123.
3 sing. pf. subj. in pass. sense ἐάγῃ Il. 11.559.
defs: (1) To break, shiver, smash, shatter: ἄγη ξίφος Il. 3.367, ἆξον ἔγχος διομήδεος Il. 7.306, etc.: πρὸ κύματ' ἔαξεν Od. 5.385 (broke their force, beat them down), αὐχὴν ἐάγη Od. 10.560, etc.
(2) To wreck (a ship) Od. 3.298.
(1) Unknown Od. 2.175.
(2) Not to be known, unrecognizable Od. 13.191, 397.
To dry up: ἀλωήν Il. 21.347.
(1) To sit in assembly, hold debate Il. 2.337, Il. 4.1.
(2) To speak or discourse in an assembly or company Il. 1.73, 253, etc.: Od. 2.24, Od. 4.773, etc.
(3) To utter in an assembly: εὐχωλάς Il. 8.230.
(1) To hold (an assembly): ἀγορὰς ἀγόρευον Il. 2.788.
(2) To speak or discourse in an assembly or company Il. 1.109, Il. 2.250, Il. 6.361, Il. 12.213, etc.: Od. 1.382, Od. 2.15, 36, Od. 8.171, etc.
(3) To utter or say in an assembly or company: ταῦτα Il. 6.357. Cf. Il. 6.359, Il. 22.377, etc.: Od. 2.184, 210, Od. 8.505, etc.
(4) To speak or tell of, make known, expound, in an assembly or company: θεοπροπίας Il. 1.385: δήμιόν τι Od. 2.32, 44.
(5) In gen., to speak, say Il. 2.10, Il. 5.218, 832, Il. 15.53, Il. 17.35, etc.: Od. 1.214, Od. 4.76, 157, Od. 8.570, Od. 10.34, etc. To counsel, advise Il. 5.252.

(7) To speak or tell of, declare, make known, relate, recount: ταῦτα πάντα Il. 1.365. Cf. Il. 9.369, Il. 12.176, Il. 18.142, Il. 21.99: Od. 1.174, 179, Od. 3.254, Od. 4.836 (tell his fate), Od. 11.381, etc. To propose Il. 22.261.

(1) A general assembly (cf. βουλή 1) Il. 2.95, 808, Il. 4.400, Il. 8.2, Il. 9.33, Il. 15.283, Il. 18.106, Il. 19.34, etc.: Od. 1.90, Od. 2.26, 257, Od. 3.127, 137, Od. 4.818, Od. 9.112, etc. In pl., of a single assembly: ἀγορὰς ἀγόρευον Il. 2.788.
(2) In pl., speaking in the assembly: ἔσχ' ἀγοράων Il. 2.275.

(3) The place of assembly (app. used also as a place of judgment (cf. ἀγορῆθεν) and no doubt for other public purposes) Il. 1.490, Il. 2.93, Il. 6.382, 414, Il. 9.13, Il. 11.139, 807, Il. 16.387, Il. 18.245, 274, 497, Il. 19.45, 88, 173, 249: Od. 2.10, 37, 150, Od. 7.266, Od. 8.12, 109, 503, Od. 10.114, Od. 16.361, 377, Od. 17.52, Od. 20.146, 362, Od. 24.420. In pl., app. of a single place: ἔμπληντ' ἀγοραί Od. 8.16. Cf. Od. 6.44.

forms: From the place of assembly Il. 2.264.
From the place of judgment Od. 12.439.
To the place of assembly Il. 1.54, Il. 2.51, 207, Od. 3.4, 16: Od. 1.372, Od. 2.7, Od. 8.5, Od. 17.72.

defs: Oratory, eloquence Od. 8.168.
A leader, commander, chief Il. 3.231, Il. 4.265, Il. 5.217, Il. 12.61, Il. 13.304, Il. 23.160, etc.
The palm of the hand; or perh., one's grasp Il. 11.425, Il. 13.508 = Il. 17.315, Il. 13.520 = Il. 14.452.
Dwelling in the fields: βοός Il. 10.155, Il. 17.521, Il. 23.684, 780, Il. 24.81, ποιμένες Il. 18.162: πόιες Od. 10.410, βοός Od. 12.253, Od. 22.403.

forms: Only in imp. ἄγρει followed by an imp. Come!: ἀ. ἔπορσον Il. 5.765, ἀ. καταχεῦαι Il. 6.459. Cf. Il. 11.512, Il. 14.271: Od. 21.176.
So in pl.: ἀγρεῖτε κορήσατε Od. 20.149.

defs: (1) The chase, sport. Of birds of prey chasing smaller birds Od. 22.306.
(2) The game Od. 12.330.
(1) Of  animals, wild, untamed Il. 3.24, Il. 4.106, Il. 8.338, Il. 9.539, Il. 15.271: Od. 9.119, Od. 14.50. Applied to flies Il. 19.30. Absol. in neut. pl. ἄγρια, wild creaturesIl. 5.52.
(2) Of men, fierce, savage, raging Il. 7.97 = 278, Il. 8.96, Il. 21.314. Of Scylla Od. 12.119.
(3) Not conforming to the traditional order of society, uncivilized, barbarous, savage Od. 1.199, Od. 2.19, Od. 7.120 = Od. 9.175 = Od. 13.201, Od. 6.206, Od. 8.575, Od. 9.215, 494.
(4) In gen., fierce, raging, ungoverned: χόλος Il. 4.23, πτόλεμος Il. 17.737. Cf. Il. 8.460, Il. 9.629, Il. 17.398, Il. 19.88, Il. 22.313: Od. 8.304.
(5) Absol. in neut. pl. ἄγρια, fierceness: ἀ. οἶδεν (has fierceness in his heart) (see εἴδω III.12) Il. 24.41.
Harsh of speech Od. 8.294.

forms: From the field or country: κατιόντ' ἀ. Od. 13.268, ἀ. ἐρχομένην Od. 15.428.

defs: Of the country, rustic: ἀνέρες Il. 11.549 = Il. 15.272, λαοί Il. 11.676: βουκόλοι Od. 11.293. Absol., a rustic or boor: νήπιοι ἀγροιῶται Od. 21.85.

forms: To the field or country Od. 15.370, 379, Od. 21.370.

defs: Haunting the fields or country: νύμφαι Od. 7.106.
(2) In sing., a farm: ἐπ̓ ἀγροῦ Od. 1.190. Cf. Od. 11.188 (at the farm), Od. 16.27, 330, 383, Od. 17.182, Od. 23.139, 359, Od. 24.205, 212. So in pl.: ἀγρῶν (at the farm) Od. 4.640.
(3) In sing., the country: ἀγρῷ (in the country) Il. 5.137: ἐπ̓ ἀγροῦ ((drawn up on the shore) in the country) Od. 1.185 = Od. 24.308. Cf. Od. 4.517, Od. 5.489, Od. 18.358, Od. 22.47, Od. 24.150.

etym: [in form comp. fr. ἀγρός. Of the country (as opposed to the town).]
defs: (2) Epithet of Artemis, roaming the fields, the huntress Il. 21.471.
A hunter Od. 16.218.
To catch, take Od. 5.53.
Some kind of clover or grass Od. 7.90.

etym: [said to be the Aeolic form of ἀγορή.]
defs: A gathering-place Il. 16.661 (where the corpses lay heaped), Il. 24.141 (cf. ἀγών 3): Od. 3.31.
To collect, get together Od. 19.284.
Fighting at close quarters or hand to hand Il. 13.5, Il. 16.248, 272, Il. 17.165.
(2) App., soon, shortly Od. 19.301.
Of the sea, deep close in shore Od. 5.413.
In close intercourse with the gods: φαίηκες Od. 5.35 = Od. 19.279. (Cf. ἐγγύθεν 2..b.)
(1) Absol. ἐξ ἀγχιμόλοιο, from close at hand: ἰδών Il. 24.352.
(2) In neut. sing. ἀγχίμολον as adv.
Applying the mind closely, sagacious: ἀγχίνοος καὶ ἐχέθρων Od. 13.332.

etym: [perh. formed fr. *ἄγχιστις, abstract noun fr. ἄγχι. Cf. προμνηστῖνοι.]
defs: Close together, one on another, in a heap or in heaps: κέχυνται Il. 5.141, ἔπιπτον Il. 17.361: Od. 22.118, Od. 24.181, 449.
(1) In neut. ἄγχιστον as adv., nearest. With dat.: ἀ. αὐτῷ Od. 5.280.
(2) So in pl. ἄγχιστα
(b) With regard to resemblance, most closely, very closely. With dat.: νέστορι ἀ. ἐῴκει Il. 2.58. Cf. Il. 14.474: Od. 7.152, Od. 13.80.
Near, close to. With genit.: δειρῆς Il. 14.412, στήθεος Il. 23.762: ἐλαίης Od. 13.103 = 347.

forms: With genit.: πυλάων Il. 24.709: κυκλώπων Od. 7.5.

defs: To choke, throttle Il. 3.371.

forms: Acc. sing. masc. pple. ἄξοντα Il. 8.368: Od. 11.623.
Infin. ἀξέμεναι Od. 23.221. ἀξέμεν Il. 23.668. ἄξειν Il. 16.832, Il. 19.298: Od. 13.212.
Aor. imp. pl. ἄξετε Il. 3.105, Il. 24.778: Od. 14.414.
Infin. ἀξέμεναι Il. 23.50. ἀξέμεν Il. 23.111, Il. 24.663.
Mid. Fut. ἄξομαι Il. 9.367: Od. 4.601, Od. 21.214.
3 pl. aor. ἄξοντο (v. l. ἄξαντο) Od. 8.545.
(ἀν-, ἀπ-, δι-, εἰσ-, εισαν-, ἐξ-, ἐπ-, κατ-, προσ-, συν-, ὑπ-, ὑπεξ-.)
defs: (I) In act.
(II) In mid. (often hardly to be distinguished from the act.).
(1) An assembly.
(b) An assembly brought together to view contests Il. 23.258, Il. 24.1.
(c) App., the body of competitors: παντὸς ἀγῶνος ὑπέρβαλεν Il. 23.847.
(2) A place for contests: τάδʼ ἄεθλα κεῖτʼ ἐν ἀγῶνι Il. 23.273. Cf. Il. 23.451, 495, 507, 617, 696, etc. : εὔρυναν ἀγῶνα Od. 8.260. Cf. Od. 8.200, 238, 259, 380, Od. 24.86.

(3) In reference to the Greek ships drawn up on the beach: νεῶν (νηῶν̓ ἐν ἀγῶνι (in the gathering-place of the ships, i.e. the camp) Il. 15.428 = Il. 16.500, Il. 16.239, Il. 19.42. So μετʼ ἀγῶνα νεῶν Od. 3.33.
Ignorance, want of experience or skill. With complementary infin.: ἀμφιπολεύειν ὄρχατον Od. 24.244.
Ignorant of, not experienced or versed in. With genit.: μάχης Il. 5.634, Il. 13.811; κακῶν Od. 12.208, πληγέων Od. 17.283.
Not shedding tears, tearless Il. 1.415 : Od. 4.186, Od. 24.61.

forms: Inflexible. Of Hades: ἀμείλιχος ἠδʼ ἀδάμαστος Il. 9.158.

defs: (1) Fearless, without fear Il. 6.117.
(2) Bold, too bold: κύον ἀδεές Il. 8.423, Il. 21.481 : Od. 19.91.

forms: Genit. ἀδελφειοῦ (for -ἀδελφεόο) Il. 5.21, Il. 7.61, Il. 6.120, Il. 13.788.

defs: Harsh, untoward, unkind: ἀλέθρῳ Od. 4.489, φῆμιν Od. 7.273, πότμον Od. 10.245.
Of a hide, undressed Od. 20.2, 142.

forms:
also written ἁδέω 
[prob. ἀ(σϝ)αδέω, to be displeased, fr. ἀ-1  + ἀ(σϝ)αδ-, ἁνδάνω.]
defs: To have too much of something. In pf. pple. ἀδηκότες, sated; hence, worn-out: καμάτῳ Il. 10.312 = 399. Cf. Il. 10.98, 471: Od. 12.281. Sim. μὴ δείπνῳ ἁδήσειεν (lest he should be disgusted with . . . ) Od. 1.134.
To the full, to satiety Il. 5.203. So ἁ. ἐλόωσι πολέμοιο (will drive him to satiety in the matter of war, give him his fill of war) Il. 13.315. Cf. Il. 19.423: Od. 5.290.
Free from strife: πόνος (i.e. unfought) Il. 17.42.

forms: App. orig. expressing quick incessant motion.
defs: (1) Of bees, flying in swarms Il. 2.87. Sim. of flies Il. 2.469. Of sheep, thick-thronging Od. 1.92 = Od. 4.320. Of the heart, beating, throbbing Il. 16.481: Od. 19.516. Of weeping, thick-coming, vehement Il. 18.316, Il. 22.430, Il. 23.17, Il. 24.747. Of the Sirens, trilling their song Od. 23.326.

(2) In neut. ἁδινόν, as adv., of the expression of grief, with thick-coming bursts, vehemently: στοναχῆσαι Il. 18.124: γοόωσα Od. 4.721. Of the incessant lowing of calves Od. 10.413. So in pl. ἁδινά: στεναχίζων Il. 23.225. Cf. Il. 24.123, 510: Od. 6.274, Od. 24.317. So also in neut. comp. ἁδινώτερον: κλαῖον ἁ. ἤ τʼ οἰωνοί Od. 16.216.

forms: Of sighing, with thick-coming repetitions: ἀνενείκατο Il. 19.314.

defs: (1) Not broken in: ἡμίονοι Od. 4.637.
(2) Unwedded Od. 7.109, 228.

forms: Not broken in : βοῦν Il. 10.293. Cf. Il. 23.266, 655: Od. 3.383.

etym:
-ου, τό
[ἀ-1 δύω. Not to be entered.]

defs: (1) To engage in a contest for a prize or as a trial of strength or skill Il. 4.389, Il. 23.274, 737.
(2) To toil Il. 24.734.
(2) A contest as a trial of strength or skill Od. 8.108, Od. 21.117.
(3) In pl., the material for a contest : τόξον θέμεν σίδηρόν τε, ἀέθλια Od. 21.4. Cf. Od. 21.62, Od. 24.169.
(1) A contest for a prize or as a trial of strength or skill Il. 16.590: Od. 4.659, Od. 8.22, 133, 160, 197, Od. 19.576, Od. 21.135, Od. 22.5, etc. A verbal contest Od. 11.548.
(2) In pl., a series of contests as a part of funeral rites: ἑταῖρον ἀέθλοισι κτερέϊζε Il. 23.646. In sing., one of the contests Il. 23.707, 753 = 831.
(4) The material for a contest: καταθήσω ἄεθλον, τοὺς πελέκεας Od. 19.572. Cf. Od. 21.91.
Carrying off prizes: ἵππους Il. 9.124 = 266. Cf. Il. 11.699, Il. 22.22, 162.

forms: Fut. pple. in mid. form ἀεισόμενος Od. 22.352.
defs: (1) To sing: μουσάων, αἳ ἄειδον Il. 1.604. Cf. Il. 2.598, Il. 9.191: ἀοιδὸς ἄειδεν Od. 1.325. Cf. Od. 1.154, 155, Od. 8.45, 87, 90, 266, Od. 10.221, 254, Od. 14.464, Od. 17.262, 358, 385, 520, Od. 22.331, 346, 352. With cognate acc.: παιήονα Il. 1.473, Il. 22.391. Cf. Il. 18.570: Od. 17.519. Of the nightingale Od. 19.519. Of a bowstring Od. 21.411.

(2) To sing of, tell of in song: μῆνιν Il. 1.1. Cf. Il. 9.189: Od. 1.326, 339, 350, Od. 8.73, 83 = 367 = 521, Od. 8.489, 492, 538. With infin. : πόλιν κεραϊζέμεν Od. 8.516. With clause : ὡς . . . Od. 8.514.
(1) Something causing marring or disfigurement Il. 24.19.
(2) In pl., unseemly conduct Od. 20.308.
(1) Of mean personal appearance Od. 7.242, Od. 13.402. Shabby, worn: πήρης Od. 17.357, χιτῶνα Od. 24.228. Mean, wretched: κοίτη Od. 19.341, δίφρον Od. 20.259.
(2) Hard, grievous: ἀλαωτύν Od. 9.503, ἄλγος Od. 14.32.
(3) Causing disfigurement: πληγῆσιν Od. 4.244.
(4) Cowardly, spiritless Il. 14.84.
(1) In unseemly wise Od. 16.109 = Od. 20.319.
(2) So as to impair one's vigour Od. 8.231.

(1) Unseemly, not right or fitting Il. 11.142, Il. 22.395 = Il. 23.24: Od. 3.265, Od. 4.694, Od. 11.429, Od. 15.236, Od. 16.107 = Od. 20.317, Od. 23.222. Absol.: ἀεικέα μερμηρίζων Od. 4.533. Cf. Od. 20.394, Od. 22.432. In neut. in impers. construction : οὔ τοι ἀεικές [ἐστιν] Il. 9.70. So with infin.: οὔ οἱ ἀεικὲς ἀνασσέμεν Il. 19.124. Cf. Il. 15.496.
(2) Inadequate in amount or value Il. 12.435, Il. 24.594.
(3) Shabby, worn: πήρην Od. 13.437, Od. 17.197 = Od. 18.108. Absol. : ἀεικέα ἕσσο (ἕσσαἰ Od. 16.199, Od. 24.250.
(5) Baneful, baleful Il. 1.97, 341, 398, 456, Il. 9.495, Il. 14.13, Il. 16.32. Horrid, horrifying : στόνος Il. 10.483, Il. 21.20: Od. 22.308, Od. 24.184.
(6) Involving disgrace or degradation: πληγῆσιν Il. 2.264, ἔργον Il. 19.133, Il. 24.733.
(7) Of the mind, not giving right guidance Od. 20.366.
(8) In neut. ἀεικές as adv., in unseemly wise Od. 17.216.

forms: 3 pl. aor. subj. ἀεικίσσωσι Il. 16.545, Il. 19.26.
1 pl. aor. opt. mid. ἀεικισσαίμεθα Il. 16.559.
defs: (1) To treat in unseemly wise Od. 18.222.
(2) To work despite upon, mutilate (a corpse) Il. 16.545, 559, Il. 22.256, 404, Il. 24.22, 54. Of flies marring (a corpse) Il. 19.26.

forms: Contr. acc. pl. masc. pple. αἴροντας Il. 17.724.
3 sing. aor. ἤειρε Il. 10.499. ἄειρε Il. 19.386, Il. 23.730, 882.
Mid. Contr. 2 sing. aor. ἤραο Od. 24.33.
3 sing. plupf. ἄωρτο (written  also ἄορτὀ Il. 3.272, Il. 19.253.
defs: (I) In act.
(II) In mid.
(III) In pass.
A ppl. form = ἀέκων1: ἀεκαζομένην μνῶνται Od. 19.133. Cf. Il. 7.458: Od. 13.277, Od. 18.135.
Baneful, baleful Il. 18.77.

(1) Against the will of, without the good will of: θεῶν ἀ. Il. 12.8. Cf. Il. 15.720: Od. 3.28, Od. 4.504, 665, Od. 5.177, Od. 7.240, 287, Od. 12.290, Od. 17.43, Od. 24.444. Joined with ἀντία: ἀντίʼ ἀθανάτων ἀ. θεῶν Od. 1.79.
(2) Doing violence to the will of, doing despite to: ἀ. σέθεν Od. 3.213, Od. 16.94, σεῦ ἀ. Od. 15.19. In spite of the resistance of: αργείων ἀ. Il. 11.667.
(2) Not having one's desire, desiring something different: Τρωσὶν ἀέκουσιν ἔδυ φάος Il. 8.487.
(3) Acting without intention: εἰ κινήσῃ ἀ. Il. 16.264.
(2) A whirl or cloud of dust Il. 13.334, Il. 16.374.
To despair: ἀελπτέοντες σόον εἶναι (pple. of the impf.: they had been in despair of his safety) Il. 6.310.
(1) To increase, enlarge, strengthen: μένος Il. 7.261. Cf. Il. 12.214, Il. 17.226.
(2) To rear up to man's estate Od. 13.360.
(3) to cherish or foster (grief) Il. 17.139: Od. 11.195, Od. 17.489, Od. 24.231.
(4) To cause to prosper, bless (a farm) Od. 14.65, Od. 15.372.
(5) To cause to be brought forth or produced: [οἶνον] Od. 9.111 = 358.
(6) In pass.
(b) To grow up to man's estate: νέον ἀέξετο Od. 22.426.
(c) Of a farm, to prosper Od. 14.66.
(d) Of the day, to grow towards noon: ἀέξετο ἦμαρ Il. 8.66 = Il. 11.84: = Od. 9.56.
Idleness, laziness Od. 24.251.
Not working or exerting oneself, idle, lazy Il. 9.320: Od. 19.27.
Lifting the feet, high-stepping. Epithet of horses: Il. 3.327, Il. 23.475. Applied to ἵπποι in sense chariot (see ἵππος 3) Il. 18.532.

forms: In pl.: ἑπόμην ἀεσιφροσύνῃσιν (in (childish) thoughtlessness) Od. 15.470.

etym: [perh. fr. weak stem ἀϝε- of ἄ(ϝ)ημι + -σι- + φρήν. Cf. ἄημι 3.]
forms: Thus, subject to gusts of passion Od. 21.302.
Blown about in mind; hence, weakened in will, volatile, flighty Od. 3.183, Il. 23.603.

defs: Dried up, dry: βῶν Il. 6.239, δρῦς Il. 11.494, οὔρεος Od. 3.491: ὕλης Od. 9.234.

forms: App., dry dirt or mould Od. 22.184.

etym:
-ές
[prob. for ἀδια(σ)εχής, fr. ἀ-1 + δια- 6 + (σ)εχ-, ἔχω. Thus neg. of διεχής, separate, and = συνεχής.]
defs: (1) Incessant, continuous Il. 15.25, Il. 17.741.
(2) In neut. ἀζηκές as adv., incessantly, continuously Il. 4.435, Il. 15.658: Od. 18.3.

forms: To reverence, stand in awe of, respect Il. 1.21, Il. 5.434, 830: Od. 9.200, Od. 17.401 (τό γε, to that point.).
With infin., to shrink from doing something: λείβειν οἶνον Il. 7.267: ξείνους ἐσθέμεναι Od. 9.478.
With μή clause: μὴ νυκτὶ ἀποθύμια ἕρδοι Il. 14.261.

defs: To dry up, parch Il. 4.487.
The nightingale Od. 19.518.

forms: Infin. ἀήμεναι Il. 23.214: Od. 3.176. ἀῆναι Od. 3.183, Od. 10.25.
defs: (2) To blow upon (something): πόντον ἵκανον ἀήμεναι (so as to blow upon it) Il. 23.214.
(3) In pass., to be blown upon: ὑόμενος καὶ ἀήμενος Od. 7.131. Fig.: θυμὸς ἄητο (was blown about (by gusts of passion)) Il. 21.386.
(2) A body of mist, a cloud: ἠέρι ἔγχος ἐκέκλιτο Il. 5.356, οἵη ἐκ νεφέων ἐρεβεννὴ φαίνεται ἀ. (app., a dark streamer of cloud detaching itself from the main body)  864, ἠέρα τύψεν Od. 3.446.
Unjust, unseemly, evil Il. 5.876.
A blast or blowing (of wind) Il. 14.254, Il. 15.626 (v. l. ἀήτη, fem.): Od. 4.567, Od. 9.139.
Thus, vehement, violent, fierce: θάρσος Il. 21.395.
(2) Absol. in pl., the immortals, the gods.
(b) Fem.: ὑμῖν ἀθανάτητͅσιν Il. 6.32. Cf. Il. 18.86: Od. 5.213, Od. 7.16, Od. 24.47, 55.
(3) Absol. in masc. sing., one of the gods: ὥς τέ μοι ἀ, ἰνδάλλεται Od. 3.246. Cf. Od. 5.73, Od. 7.309.
(4) Of a thing, of or pertaining to a god: δόμοι Od. 4.79. Of the aegis, everlasting, indestructible Il. 2.447.
Not honoured with funeral rites: νέκυς Il. 22.386: σῶμα Od. 11.54, Ἐλπήνορα 72.
Without the good will of the gods: οὐκ ἀθεεὶ ἵκει Od. 18.353.
(1) Regardless of right Od. 18.141.
(2) Absol. in neut. pl. ἀθεμίστια, what is wrong : ἀ. ᾔδη (had no regard for right in his heart, was given over to lawlessness (see εἴδω III.12): Od. 9.189. Cf. Od. 9.428, Od. 20.287.
(2) Unworthy to share in the benefits of law: ἀφρήτωρ ἀ. ἀνέστιος Il. 9.63.

forms: To slight, be indifferent to, think little of Il. 1.261: Od. 8.212.

defs: Thus, not suited to the utterance of a (beneficent) god; hence, portentous, terrible, terrifying: ὄμβρον Il. 3.4, Il. 10.6: ὤρινε θάλασσαν ἀθέσφατον (so that it became . . . ) Od. 6.273. Of winter nights, endless Od. 11.373, Od. 15.392. Unlimited in amount: σῖτος Od. 13.244.– In number Od. 20.211. Excessive in amount: οἶνος Od. 11.61.

etym: [ἀθήρ, ear of corn = λοιγός. Consumer of ears of corn.]
forms: App., a shovel by which grain to be winnowed was thrown against the wind ( ͂πτύον) Od. 11.128 = Od. 23.275.

defs: To toil Il. 6.453, Il. 15.30.
An athlete Od. 8.164.
(1) To look, gaze Il. 10.11.
(2) To see, note, notice, observe. With complementary pple.: βλήμενον Il. 12.391. Cf. Il. 14.334. Absol. Od. 12.232, Od. 19.478.
(2) In one sum: ἀθρόα πάντʼ ἀποτείσεις Il. 22.271. Cf. Od. 1.43.
(3) Collected together for use or convenience: ἀθρόα πάντα τετύχθω Od. 2.356. Cf. Od. 2.411, Od. 13.122.
A plaything Il. 15.363: Od. 18.323. In pl., gewgaws Od. 15.416.

(1) αἲ γάρ with opt. expressing a wish = εἰ 2..b: αἲ γάρ μή τις φύγοι Il. 16.97. Cf. Il. 4.288, Il. 10.536, Il. 18.272, 464, Il. 22.346, 454: αἲ γὰρ δύναμιν περιθεῖεν Od. 3.205. Cf. Od. 4.341, Od. 7.244, Od. 8.339, Od. 9.523, Od. 15.156, 536, Od. 17.132, 163, 251, Od. 18.235, Od. 19.22, 309, Od. 20.169, 236, Od. 21.200, 402. Of the present: αἲ γὰρ ἡβῷμι Il. 6.132. Cf. Il. 2.371, Il. 4.189: Od. 4.697, Od. 16.99, Od. 21.372. See also αἴθε 1. With infin.: αἲ γὰρ παῖδʼ ἐμὴν ἐχέμεν Od. 6.311. Cf. Od. 24.376.
(2) With fut. indic. and κεν, subj. and κεν, and opt. and κεν in the protasis of conditional sentences = εἰ 5. For the examples and constructions see Table at end (III).
(4) In object clauses, whether.
(b) With opt. and κεν  = εἰ 10 c.β: εἰπεῖν αἴ κέ περ ὔμμι φίλον γένοιτο (and see whether . . .) Il. 6.387.
(1) The earth: ὕδωρ ἐπικίδναται αἶαν Il. 2.850. Cf. Il. 3.243, Od. 8.1, Il. 9.506, Il. 23.742, Il. 24.695: κατέχει αἶα Od. 11.301. Cf. Od. 24.509.–
(3) The surface of the earth, the earth, the ground: ὅσον τʼ ὄργυιʼ ὑπὲρ αἴης Il. 23.327.

etym: [app. fr. αἰγ-, αἴξ.  Goat-spear. Used against goats in Od. 9.156.]
forms: A hunting-spear, a spear Il. 16.589, Il. 2.774: = Od. 4.626 = Od. 17.168, Od. 9.156.

defs: Of a goat or goats: ἀσκῷ (of goatskin) Il. 3.247, τυρόν (of goats' milk) Il. 11.639: ἀσκῷ Od. 7.78, κυνέην Od. 24.231.
A beach or shore of the sea: ὡς ὅτε κῦμα θαλάσσης αἰγιαλῷ μεγάλῳ βρέμεται Il. 2.210. Cf. Il. 4.422, Il. 14.34: Od. 22.385.
Browsed on by goats. Of Ithaca Od. 4.606, Od. 13.246.

etym: [sense unknown. Traditionally explained as fr. αἰγ-, αἴξ + λιπ-, λείπω, so steep as to be deserted (even) by goats.]
forms: Of a rock: πέτρης Il. 9.15 = Il. 16.4, Il. 13.63.
Epithet of Zeus Il. 1.202, Il. 2.157, Il. 3.426, etc.: Od. 3.42, Od. 4.752, Od. 5.103, etc.

etym: [perh. the orig. idea was that of a storm-cloud, whence the sense hurricane-wind. Cf. ἐπαιγίζω.]
defs: The terror-striking shield of Zeus Il. 4.167, Il. 17.593. Wielded by Athene Il. 2.447, Il. 5.738, Il. 21.400: Od. 22.297. By Apollo Il. 15.229, 308, 318, 361. Lent by Athene to Achilles Il. 18.204. Used to cover Hector's corpse Il. 24.20.
(1) The light of the sun or moon Od. 4.45 = Od. 6.84.
(2) Radiance, brightness Od. 7.45. The gleam of polished metal Il. 2.458, Il. 19.362.
Radiant, bright. Epithet of Olympus Il. 1.532, Il. 13.243: Od. 20.103.

forms: App. a general name for eagles and vultures. (The αἰ. preys on live birds (Il. 17.460: Od. 22.302), but is not represented as preying on carrion. Cf. γύψ.) Il. 6.59, Il. 13.531, Il. 16.428, Il. 17.460: Od. 16.217, Od. 22.302.
3 sing. subj. αἰδέσεται Il. 9.508. αἰδέσσεται Il. 22.419.
Pple. αἰδεσθείς Il. 4.402, Il. 17.95. From αἰδ-
3 sing. aor. αἴδετο Il. 21.468: Od. 7.66, 329, Od. 8.86.
defs: (1) To hold in reverence or honour, pay due respect to, stand in awe of, regard, fear: ἱερῆα Il. 1.23 = 377, βασιλῆα Il. 1.331. Cf. Il. 4.402, Il. 9.508, 640, Il. 21.74, Il. 22.82, 124, 419, Il. 24.208, 503: πατροκασίγνητον Od. 7.329. Cf. Od. 9.269, Od. 14.388, Od. 16.75 = Od. 19.527, Od. 17.188, Od. 21.28, Od. 22.312 = 344. Absol. Il. 10.237.
(2) To be restrained by reverence, dread or respect from doing something. With infin.: συλεύειν Ἀχιλῆα Il. 24.435. Cf. Il. 21.468: Od. 14.146, Od. 20.343.
(3) To be moved by regard for the feelings of, spare Od. 3.96 = Od. 4.326.

(4) To be moved by respect for the opinion of, fear what . . . may think or say: ἀλλήλους Il. 5.530 = Il. 15.562. Cf. Il. 7.442 = Il. 22.105: Od. 2.65, Od. 8.86. Absol. Il. 5.531, Il. 15.563, Il. 17.95.
(5) To be ashamed, think shame, not to like, to do something. With infin.: ἀνήνασθαι Il. 6.93. Cf. Il. 24.90: Od. 7.66, 221. Absol. Od. 18.184. To be shamefaced Od. 17.578.

forms: Destroying, working destruction or harm, baneful Il. 2.455, Il. 5.880, 897, Il. 9.436, Il. 11.155: Od. 8.309, Od. 16.29, Od. 22.165, Od. 23.303.
In destructive wise, ruthlessly: κτείνεις Il. 21.220.

defs: (1) Worthy to be held in reverence or honour, having a special claim to one's regard: ἑκυρός Il. 3.172, βασιλῆος Il. 4.402. Cf. Il. 2.514, Il. 7.250, Il. 10.114, Il. 11.649, Il. 14.210, Il. 18.386 = 425, Il. 18.394, Il. 21.75, 460, 479, Il. 22.451: παρακοίτι Od. 3.381, ἱκέτῃσιν Od. 6.165 = 181. Cf. Od. 1.139 = Od. 4.55 = Od. 6.175 = Od. 10.371 = Od. 15.138  =  Od. 17.94 = 259, Od. 3.451, Od. 5.88, 447, Od. 8.22, 420, 544, Od. 9.271, Od. 10.11, Od. 14.234, Od. 17.152 = Od. 19.165 = 262 = 336 = 583, Od. 18.314, Od. 19.191, 254, 316. Absol. in pl., those who have a special claim to one's regard: αἰδοίοισιν ἔδωκα Od. 15.373. In comp.: αἰδοιότερος πᾶσιν Od. 11.360.
(2) In neut. pl., the private parts: αἰδοίων τε μεσηγὺ καὶ ὀμφαλοῦ Il. 13.568.
(3) Shamefaced, bashful, shy: ἀλήτης Od. 17.578.

forms: With due respect and regard: ἀπόπεμπον Od. 19.243.

defs: (1) Ignorance. In pl.: ἀϊδρείῃσι νόοιο Od. 11.272.
(2) Lack of experience, heedlessness Od. 12.41. In pl. Od. 10.231 = 257.
Ignorant, unintelligent Il. 3.219. Ignorant of. With genit. Od. 10.282.
(1) Reverence, respect, regard: αἰδοῖ εἴκων Il. 10.238. Cf. Il. 24.111: Od. 8.480, Od. 14.505.

(2) Sensitiveness to the opinion of others, fear of what others may think or say, shame: ἐν φρεσὶ θέσθʼ αἰδῶ Il. 13.122. Cf. Il. 15.129, 561 = 661, Il. 15.657, Il. 24.44: Od. 20.171. As exclam. ( = ἐν φρεσὶ θέσθʼ αἰδῶ): αἰ., Ἀργεῖοι Il. 5.787 = Il. 8.228. Cf. Il. 13.95, Il. 15.502, Il. 16.422.
(3) Something to be ashamed of Il. 17.336: Od. 3.24. The private parts: τά τʼ αἰδῶ ἀμφικαλύπτει Il. 2.262. Cf. Il. 22.75.
(4) Modesty Od. 8.172. Sense of propriety, delicacy Od. 8.324. Shamefacedness, bashfulness Od. 3.14, Od. 17.347, 352.
Always, ever, for ever, continually, constantly, without omission or intermission:
(αεί) [cf. αἰεί, αἰέν] = αἰεί Il. 12.211, Il. 23.648: Od. 15.379.
Having being for ever, immortal. Epithet of the gods  Il. 2.400, Il. 3.296, Il. 7.527, Il. 6.53, Il. 14.244, 333, Il. 16.93, Od. 3.104: Od. 2.432, Od. 14.446, Od. 23.81, Od. 24.373.
In pass. sense, removed from sight, invisible: δράκοντʼ ἀΐζηλον θῆκεν Il. 2.318 (u.l. ἀρίζηλον).

forms: In full bodily strength, lusty, vigorous Il. 16.716, Il. 23.432.

defs: (1) Blackened by smoke (failing to escape by the smoke-hole) Il. 2.415: Od. 22.239.
(2) Of ashes, blackened by fire, dark Il. 18.23 = Od. 24.316.

(1) With opt. : αἰ. θεοῖσι φίλος γένοιτο Il. 22.41. Cf. Il. 4.178 : αἰ. τελευτήσειεν Od. 6.331. Cf. Od. 14.440 = Od. 15.341, Od. 17.494, Od. 18.202, Od. 20.61. Of the present: αἰ. τόσον σέο φέρτερος εἴην (would that I were . . .) Il. 16.722.
(2) With ὤφελλον, ὤφελον, ὄφελον. See ὀφέλλω1 4.

(1) The upper air, in which the clouds float and the meteorological phenomena take place: ἐν αἰθέρι καὶ νεφέλῃσιν Il. 15.20. Cf. Il. 8.556, 558  =  Il. 16.300, Il. 11.54, Il. 15.686, Il. 16.365, Il. 18.207, 214, Il. 19.379: οὖρον ἐπαιγίζοντα διʼ αἰθέρος Od. 15.293. Cf. Od. 19.540. Regarded as the home and realm of Zeus: αἰθέρι ναίων Il. 2.412. Cf. Il. 4.166, Il. 13.837, Il. 14.258, Il. 15.192, 610: Od. 15.523. As the way to or from heaven: αἴγλη διʼ αἰθέρος οὐρανὸν ἷκεν Il. 2.458. Cf. Il. 17.425, Il. 19.351 : ἐξ αἰθέρος ἔμπεσε πόντῳ Od. 5.50 (on the way from Olympus).
(2) Clear air as opposed to mist (ἀήῤ · ἐγάτη διʼ ἠέρος αἰθέρʼ ἵκανεν Il. 14.288, πολέμιζον ὑπʼ αἰθέρι Il. 17.371 (cf. 368).

(1) A portico or covered colonnade running round the αὐλή Il. 7.243, Od. 3.11 (in the palace of Zeus), Il. 24.238 : Od. 8.57, Od. 20.176, 189, Od. 21.390, Od. 22.449. Used as a sleeping-place for visitors : δέμνἰ ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ θέμεναι Il. 24.644 (for Priam and the herald in the dwelling of Achilles) := Od. 4.297 (for Telemachus and Peisistratus in the house of Menelaus) = Od. 6.336 (for Odysseus in the palace of Alcinous), ἐν λεχέεσσι ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ Od. 3.399 (of Telemachus in the house of Nestor) = Od. 6.345 (of Odysseus in the palace of Alcinous).

(2) A portico across the gateway of the αὐλή: ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ αὐλῆς Il. 9.472. Cf. Il. 24.323: Od. 3.493= Od. 15.146 = 191.–αἰθούσης θύρας, the gate of theαὐλή Od. 18.102 (named thus from the portico across it).
Clear sky Il. 17.646: Od. 7.44, Od. 12.75.
Born in the upper air: βορέης Od. 5.296.

forms: App., exposure to cold air Od. 14.318.

defs: Some kind of diving sea-bird: αἰθυίῃ ἐϊκυῖα Od. 5.337, 353.
(1) Epithet of metals and of objects made of metal, bright, shining, gleaming: σιδήρῳ Il. 4.485, Il. 6.473, Od. 3.372, λέβητας Il. 9.123 = 265 = Il. 19.244, τρίποδας Il. 24.233: σίδηρον Od. 1.184.
(2) Epithet of the lion tawny Il. 10.24 = 178, Il. 11.548, Il. 18.161. So of oxen Il. 16.488: Od. 18.372. Of the eagle Il. 15.690.
(3) Of horses, app., sorrel or brown Il. 2.839 = Il. 12.97.
Flight, rush: τόξων Il. 15.709.
In unseemly wise: σὲ κύνες ἑλκήσουσʼ ἀ. Il. 22.336.

(1) Blood: ἔρρεεν αἷμα Il. 4.140, μεθʼ αἵματι (i.e. the bloody corpses) Il. 15.118. Cf. Il. 1.303, Il. 5.100, Il. 10.298, Il. 22.70, Il. 23.697, etc.: πεφυρμένον αἵματι Od. 9.397. Cf. Od. 11.96, 420, Od. 13.395, Od. 18.97, Od. 22.19, etc.

(2) Race, stock: [τούτου] αἵματος εὔχομαι εἶναι Il. 7.211= Od. 3.241. Cf. Od. 4.611, Od. 16.300. Blood relations collectively: κήδιστοι μεθʼ αἷμα 583. In genit., by blood: οἵ θʼ αἵματος ἐξ ἐμεῦ εἰσίν Il. 19.105, οἳ σῆς ἐξ αἵματός εἰσι γενέθλης 111.
A wall, app. of stones without mortar: αἱμασιὰς λέγων (λέξοντες) (i.e. the materials for them) Od. 18.359, Od. 24.224.
(2) Of the colour of blood Il. 2.267, Il. 16.459.
Bedabbled with blood, exuding blood: κρέα Od. 20.348.
Cursed in one's valour Il. 16.31.
(1) To praise, commend Il. 10.249, Il. 23.552, Il. 24.30.
(2) Absol., to approve, assent, concur: ἐπὶ δ' ᾔνεον ἄλλοι Il. 3.461. Cf. Il. 8.9: Od. 12.294 = 352, Od. 16.380 (i.e. will resent), 403, Od. 18.64.

forms: Strengthening αἰνῶς by reduplication Il. 6.97. (The form has not been explained. Cf. οἰόθεν οἶος, μέγας μεγαλωστί.)

defs: Doomed to an evil fate Il. 22.481: Od. 9.53, Od. 24.169.
Suffering dire ills Od. 18.201.
(1) Praise, commendation, compliment Il. 23.795: Od. 21.110.
(2) A discourse or tale Il. 23.652: Od. 14.508.

(1) Dread, dire, terrible, grim Il. 3.20, Il. 4.15, Il. 5.886, Il. 17.565, Il. 18.465, etc. : Od. 10.219, Od. 11.516, Od. 12.257, Od. 19.568, Od. 22.229, Od. 24.475. In comp. : οὐκ αἰνότερον ἄλλο γυναικός Od. 11.427. In superl. : στείνει ἐν αἰνοτάτῳ Il. 8.476. Cf. Il. 14.389: Od. 4.441, Od. 8.519, Od. 12.275. Absol. in neut. pl.: αἰνὰ παθοῦσα Il. 22.431. In neut. pl. as adv., miserably, calamitously: τεκοῦσα Il. 1.414. Cf. Od. 16.255.
(2) Of persons. In superl., most dread: αἰνότατε κρονίδη Il. 1.552 = Il. 4.25 = Il. 8.462 = Il. 14.330 = Il. 16.440 = Il. 18.361. Beyond endurance, unbearable Il. 8.423.

(3) Of feelings, etc., extreme, sore, overwhelming: ἄχος Il. 4.169. Cf. Il. 6.215, Il. 8.449, Il. 10.312, Il. 22.94, etc. : κάματος Od. 5.457. Cf. Od. 15.342, Od. 16.87, Od. 18.274. In neut. pl. αἰνά as adv., grievously, bitterly: ὀλοφυρόμεναι Od. 22.447. In neut. superl. αἰνότατον as adv., very grievously or sorely: περιδείδια Il. 13.52.
(1) To take hold of Od. 22.500. Of a feeling: πόθος μʼ αἴνυται Od. 14.144.
(2) To take for one's use, take into one's hands: ὀϊστόν Il. 15.459: τυρῶν (partitive genit.) Od. 9.225, 232. Cf. Od. 9.249, Od. 21.53.
(3) To take away, remove, deprive of Il. 4.531, Il. 11.374, 580, Il. 13.550, Il. 21.490.
(4) To take, select, pick out: σύντρεις Od. 9.429.
(1) To such a degree as to cause apprehension Od. 22.136.

(2) In reference to feelings, etc., in an extreme degree, strongly, sorely, deeply, heartily: δείδοικα Il. 1.555. Cf. Il. 5.352, Il. 7.441, Il. 8.397, Il. 9.244, Il. 10.38, 93, 538, Il. 13.165, 481, Il. 18.261, Il. 19.23, Od. 3.29, Il. 22.454, Il. 24.358: φιλέεσκεν Od. 1.264. Cf. Od. 2.327, Od. 4.441, 597, Od. 7.168, Od. 9.353, Od. 18.80, Od. 19.324, Od. 24.353. Sim. λώβη τάδε γʼ ἔσσεται αἰ. (will be a sore . . .) Il. 6.97, αἰ. με μένος ἄνωγεν Il. 24.198.
(3) In reference to resemblance, strangely, strikingly: αἰ. θεῇς ἔοικεν Il. 3.158. Cf. Il. 10.547: Od. 1.208.
(4) As a gen. intensive, in a high degree, of a surety: μοχλὸς διεθαίνετο Od. 9.379, τάδε εἵματʼ ἔχω κακά Od. 17.24.

A goat: ταύρων ἠδʼ αἰγῶν Il. 1.41, ἰξάλου αἰγὸς ἀγρίου (i.e. of goat's horn) Il. 4.105. Cf. Il. 2.474, Il. 3.24, Il. 9.207, Il. 10.486, Il. 13.198, etc.: Od. 2.56, Od. 9.118, Od. 14.101, Od. 17.213, 247, Od. 18.44, etc.
To shift rapidly to and fro Od. 20.27.
With glancing θώρηξ Il. 4.489, Il. 16.173.
With glancing μίτρη Il. 5.707.
Having nimble horses Il. 3.185.
(1) Glancing, gleaming, flashing Il. 5.295, Il. 6.222, Il. 16.107.

(2) The notion of glancing light passing into that of rapid movement. (Cf. ἀργός 2.) Of wasps: σφῆκες μέσον αἰόλοι (flexible about the middle) Il. 12.167. Of a serpent and worms, wriggling Il. 12.208 (or this might come under (1), glistening), Il. 22.509. Of the gadfly, darting Od. 22.300. Of the rapid motion of a horse's feet: πόδας αἰόλος ἵππος Il. 19.404.
(1) Steep, sheer: μυκάλης κάρηϝα Il. 2.869. Cf. Od. 3.58: Od. 7.123. Rocky, rugged: καλυδῶνι Il. 13.217, Il. 14.116.

etym: [app. for αἰγιπόλος, fr. αἰγ-, αἴξ + -πολος, conn. with πολεύω.]

defs: (1) Falling steeply down, flowing fast Il. 8.369, Il. 21.9.
(2) Of cities, set on a steep Il. 13.625: Od. 3.130= Od. 13.316, Od. 8.516, Od. 11.533.

(1) Steep, sheer: ὄρος Il. 2.603. Cf. Il. 2.811, 829, Il. 5.367, 868, Il. 11.711, Il. 15.84: αἰπεῖα εἰς ἅλα πέτρη (running sheer down into the sea) Od. 3.293. Cf. Od. 3.287, Od. 4.514, Od. 19.431. Applied to walls Il. 7.327, Il. 11.181: Od. 14.472. Of a noose, hung from on high Od. 11.278.

(3) Fig., difficult, hard. In impers. construction : αἰπύ οἱ ἐσσεῖται Il. 13.317. Of ὄλεθρος (thought of as a precipice or gulf), sheer, utter Il. 7.57, Il. 10.371, Il. 11.174, 441, Il. 12.345, 358, Il. 13.773, Il. 14.99, 507=Il. 16.283, Il. 16.859, Il. 17.155, 244, Il. 18.129: Od. 1.11, 37, Od. 5.305, Od. 9.286, 303, Od. 12.287, 446, Od. 17.47, Od. 22.28, 43, 67. Sim. of φόνος Il. 17.365: Od. 4.843, Od. 16.379. Of the toil and moil of war, hard, daunting Il. 11.601, Il. 16.651. Of wrath, towering Il. 15.223.

forms: Infin. αἱρησέμεν Il. 17.488, Il. 18.260. αἱρήσειν Il. 2.37, Il. 13.42.
Mid. Nom. pl. pres. pple. αἱρεύμενοι Il. 16.353.
1 pl. εἱλόμεθα Od. 9.157, Od. 11.21. ἑλόμεσθα Il. 11.730.
3 sing. ἕληται Il. 12.150, Il. 16.650, etc. : Od. 12.123.
(ἀν-, ἀποπρο-, ἀφ-, ἐξ-, ἐξαφ-, καθ-, μεθ-,  συν-.)
defs: (I) In act.
(II) In mid.

forms: contr. acc. pl. masc. pple. ἀείρω.

defs: (1) αἴσῃ, in the measure of, at the value of: ἐν καρὸς αἴσῃ Il. 9.378.
(2) (Due) measure.
(b) ὑπὲρ αἶσαν, unduly, unfitly, improperlyIl. 3.59 = Il. 7.333. Beyond measure; hence, preponderatingly: φέρτεροι ἦσαν Il. 16.780.
(3) A share or portion: ληΐδος αἶσαν Il. 18.327. Cf. Od. 5.40 = Od. 13.138.

(4) One's portion or lot in life, one's fate or destiny: αἷσα τοι μίνυνθά περ (thy lot in life is but for a little time) Il. 1.416, κακῇ σʼ αἴσῃ τέκον (with an evil fate before thee) 418, κακῇ αἴσῃ τόξʼ ἑλόμην (in an evil hour) Il. 5.209, ὁμῇ πεπρωμένον αἴσῃ (having his fate fixed with a like portion before him, appointed to a like portion) Il. 15.209, πεπρωμένον αἴσῃ (with a fate, i.e.  death, before him, appointed to death) Il. 16.441 = Il. 22.179, οὔ τοι αἶσα πόλιν πέρθαι Il. 16.707, ἰῇ γιγνόμεθʼ αἴσῃ (under a like fate) Il. 22.477, εἴ μοι αἶσα τεθνάμεναι Il. 24.224, ἐν θανάτοιο αἴσῃ (a lot consisting in death,
              i.e. death) Il. 24.428, 750: κακῇ αἴσῃ οἴχετο (in an evil hour) Od. 19.259. Cf. Od. 5.113, 206, 288, Od. 8.511, Od. 13.306, Od. 14.359, Od. 15.276, Od. 23.315. Sim. ἔτι ἐλπίδος αἶσα ((there is) yet a portion for hope, room for hope) Od. 16.101, Od. 19.84.
(5) Fate that comes upon or overtakes one, evil fate, doom, death: αἴσῃ ἐν ἀργαλέῃ φθίσει Il. 22.61. Cf. Od. 9.52, Od. 11.61.

(6) Fate or destiny as decreed by a god: ὑπὲρ Διὸς αἶσαν Il. 17.321. So αἶσα alone, the decrees of fate (cf. μοῖρα 7): ὑπὲρ αἶσαν Il. 7.487. This and (2) ((due) measure or estimation, (fitting) place in a scale of honour) app. blended: τετιμῆσθαι Διὸς αἴσῃ Il. 9.608.
(7) Fate personified Od. 3.127: Od. 6.197.

forms: To breathe or gasp out: θυμόν Il. 16.468, Od. 3.403.

defs: (1) In (due) measure: ἀμείνω αἴσιμα πάντα Od. 6.310, Od. 15.71, τίσειν αἴσιμα πάντα (all that is fitting) Od. 8.348, ἔργα (inspired by justice) Od. 14.84, ταῦτʼ αἴσιμα εἶπας (just, right) Od. 22.46, φρένας αἰσίμη (well balanced in . . .) Od. 23.14.

(2) Absol. in neut. pl. αἴσιμα, what is just or right: αἰ. παρειπών Il. 7.62, Il. 6.121. So (see εἴδω III.12) ὅτʼ ἄγγελος αἰ. εἰδῇ (can say the right thing) Il. 15.207: αἰ. εἰδώς (having justice in his heart, just) Od. 2.231 = Od. 5.9, αἰ. ᾔδη Od. 14.433.
(3) In neut. pl. as adv., in due measure Od. 21.294.

(4) Decreed by fate, fatal: αἴσιμον ἦμαρ. See ἦμαρ 4.a. In neut. sing. αἴσιμον in impers. construction, (it is) fated or destined: μὴ ἡμῖν αἰ. εἴη φθίσθαι Il. 9.245. Cf. Il. 15.274, Il. 21.291, 495: Od. 15.239.
Showing moderation, gentle, courteous; or perh., of good omen (cf. ἐναίσιμος 2): ὁδοιπόρον Il. 24.376.

forms: (ἀν-, ἀπ-, ἐπ-, μετ-, παρ-, προσ-, ὑπ-.) In all moods, to rush, fly, dart, of persons, animals, or things.
defs: (2) In various shades of meaning.
(b) In mid., of a horse's mane, to stream Il. 7.510 = Il. 15.267.
(c) In pass., of reins, to slip (from the hands) Il. 16.404.
(1) Gone, vanished Od. 1.235, 242.
(2) Sent to destruction Il. 14.258.
To cause to vanish or disappear Od. 20.79. In pass., to vanish, disappear Od. 10.259.

forms: Absol. in neut. pl. αἴσυλα, what is unjust, unseemly, or evil: αἰ. ῥέζων Il. 5.403. Cf. Od. 3.202 = 433, Il. 21.214: Od. 2.232 = Od. 5.10.

etym: [app.  αἶσα + μνη-, μνάομαι. One who is mindful of justice.]

forms: In pl., stewards of games Od. 8.258.

defs: The most ill-favoured or ugly: ἀνήρ Il. 2.216.
(1) Shame, disgrace Od. 11.433. A cause or occasion of shame or disgrace Od. 18.225. In pl., shameful deeds: αἴσχεα πόλλʼ ὁρόων Od. 1.229.
(2) Insult: αἴσχεος οὐκ ἐπιδευεῖς Il. 13.622. In pl., insults, reproaches Il. 3.242, Il. 7.351, 524: Od. 19.373.
(1) Absol. in neut. αἰσχρόν, a shame, a disgraceIl. 2.119, 298.
(2) Of words, insulting, reproachful Il. 3.38 = Il. 7.325, Il. 13.768, Il. 24.238.

forms: With insult or reproach: ἐνένιπεν Il. 23.473: Od. 18.321.

defs: (1) To disfigure, mar, spoil the beauty of Il. 18.24, 27. To mar, mutilate Il. 18.180, Il. 22.75, Il. 24.418. To defile (the marriage-bed) Od. 8.269.
(2) To bring shame upon, act unworthily of: γένος πατέρων Il. 7.209. To put to shame, discredit: ἐμὴν ἀρετήν Il. 23.571.–to throw blame upon Od. 2.86.
(3) In pass., to feel shame, hesitate: δείσας αἰσχυνόμενός τε Od. 6.305. Cf. Od. 18.12. To feel shame at the prospect of, hesitate to incur: αἰσχυνόμενοι φάτιν ἀνδρῶν Od. 21.323.

To ask for, request: ἵππους Il. 5.358. Cf. Il. 13.365, Il. 24.292: Od. 10.17, Od. 20.74. With acc. of the person from whom something is asked: ᾔτεέ με δεύτερον Od. 9.354, αἰτήσων φῶτα ἕκαστον (to ask alms from . . .) Od. 17.365. With infin., to ask to. . .: σῆμα ἰδέσθαι Il. 7.176. With acc. and infin.: ᾐτέομεν θεὸν φῆναι τέρας Od. 3.173. With double acc. of person and thing: ᾔτεέ μιν δόρυ Il. 22.295. Cf. Od. 2.387, Od. 24.85, 337. Absol., to ask alms Od. 18.49.
(1) To ask for, collect: κειμήλια Od. 19.273. Absol., to make a request Od. 4.651.
(2) To ask as alms: ἀκόλους Od. 17.222, σῖτον 558. To ask alms from Od. 17.346 = 351, 502, Od. 20.179. Absol., to ask alms Od. 17.228, Od. 20.182.

Blameworthy, to blame: οὔ τί μοι αἴτιοί εἰσιν Il. 1.153. Cf. Il. 3.164, Il. 13.111, 222, Il. 15.137,  Il. 19.86, 410, Il. 21.275, 370: οὐκ ἀοιδοὶ αἴτιοι, ἀλλὰ Ζεὺς αἴτιος Od. 1.348. Cf. Od. 2.87, Od. 8.311, Od. 11.559, Od. 22.155. With genit.: αἰ. πάντων (for everything) Od. 22.48.
To throw (the spear): αἰχμὰς αἰχμάσσουσιν Il. 4.324.
(1) The point of a spear: ἀνεγνάμφθη οἱ αἰ. Il. 11.348. Cf. Il. 4.461, Il. 5.293, 658, Il. 11.237, Il. 16.115, Il. 17.600, Od. 3.416, etc.
(2) A spear: αἰχμὰς αἰχμάσσουσιν Il. 4.324, εὐήκεος Il. 22.319. Cf. Il. 12.45, Il. 13.504 = Il. 16.614, Il. 13.562, Il. 14.423.
(3) Spearmanship, the spear: αἰχμῆς ἐῢ εἰδώς Il. 15.525.

forms: Also αἰχμητά͂ Il. 5.197 (prob. orig. a voc. turned into a nom.).
defs: (1) A spearman as opposed to warriors otherwise armed: Ἄβαντες ἕποντο, αἰχμηταί Il. 2.543.

(3) With implied notion of stoutness or skill: αἰχμητὴν ἔθεσαν θεοί Il. 1.290. Cf. Il. 3.49, Il. 5.197, 602 = Il. 16.493 = Il. 22.269, Il. 5.706, Il. 6.281, Il. 11.739, Il. 12.128, Il. 13.171: χεῖρας αἰχυητὴν ἔμεναι καὶ ἐπίφρονα βουλήν (in strength of hands and wise counsel) Od. 16.242. Cf. Od. 2.19.

forms: Straightway, forthwith, at once, quickly, soon: αἰ. μάλʼ ἐλθέ Il. 4.70. Cf. Il. 1.303, Il. 2.664, Il. 5.242, Il. 7.370, Il. 8.127, Il. 12.369, Il. 17.116, etc.: αἰ. δεῖπνον ἕλοντο Od. 9.86. Cf. Od. 1.392, Od. 2.292, Od. 4.283, Od. 15.193, Od. 16.359, etc.
Quick: ἀγορήν (quick to disperse) Il. 19.276: = Od. 2.257, αἰψηρὸς κόρος γόοιο (soon comes on one) Od. 4.103.
3 sing. impf. ἄϊε Il. 10.532, Il. 21.388. ἄ͂ϊε Il. 11.463.
defs: (1) To perceive, feel. With genit.: πληγῆς Il. 11.532.
(2) To perceive, see: οὐκ ἀΐεις ὅτι . . .; Od. 18.11.
(4) To have seen or heard, have learned, know (cf. ἀκούω 5): οὐκ ἀΐεις ὡς . . .; Il. 10.160. Cf. Il. 15.248: Od. 1.298.
To breathe out Il. 15.252.
(1) One's lifetime, one's life: μινυνθάδιος αἰ. ἔπλετο Il. 4.478 = Il. 17.302. Cf. Il. 9.415: Od. 5.152.
(2) Life, the state of being in life: ἀπʼ αἰῶνος ὤλεο Il. 24.725.

(3) The animating principle, the vital spirit, the soul, the life, life, one's life (cf. θυμός I.1.b): λίποι μʼ αἰ. Il. 5.685. Cf. Il. 16.453, Il. 19.27, Il. 22.58: αἰῶνος εὖνιν Od. 9.523. Cf. Od. 5.160, Od. 6.224, Od. 18.204.

etym: [sense unknown. Traditionally explained as fr. ἀ-1+ κακός, the guileless, or fr. ἀκέομαι, the healer.]
forms: (Prob. orig. a voc. turned into a nom.)
neut. pl. of ἀκαλός, cited in sense peaceful, still (cf. ἀκή(ν) + (σ)ρέω.]
defs: Silently or gently flowing. Epithet of Ocean Il. 6.422: Od. 19.434.

forms: Tireless. Of a river, ever-flowing, always full: Il. 16.176.
Of a boar, untiring, steady in fight Il. 16.823.
Of the sun, regular in his course Il. 18.239, 484.
Epithet of fire, steadily or fiercely blazing Il. 5.4, Il. 15.598, 731, Il. 16.122, Il. 18.225, Il. 21.13, 341, Il. 23.52: Od. 20.123, Od. 21.181.

defs: In pl., thistle-down Od. 5.328.
(1) To cause grief to, grieve: ἀκάχησε τοκῆας Il. 23.223.

(2) In pass., to be grieved, troubled, or borne down, to grieve or sorrow: ὡς μὴ ἀκαχήμενος εἴη Il. 5.24, θεοὶ ἀκαχήατο Il. 12.179. Cf. Il. 5.364, Il. 17.637, Il. 18.29, Il. 19.312, 335: ὁρόων ἀκάχημαι Od. 8.314. Cf. Od. 4.806, Od. 9.62 = 105 = 565 = Od. 10.77 = 133, Od. 10.313, Od. 13.286, Od. 15.481, Od. 19.95, Od. 20.84, Od. 23.360. With genit. of what is grieved for: ἀκαχήμενον ἵππων Il. 11.702. Cf. Il. 24.550.
(1) To cause grief to, grieve, trouble, vex Od. 16.432.
(2) In pass., to be grieved or troubled, grieve, sorrow: μὴ λίην ἀκαχίζεο Il. 7.486. Cf. Od. 11.486.

(1) Furnished with a sharp point: δούρατα Il. 12.444. Cf. Il. 17.412, Il. 21.72. Withdat. expressing the material: ὀξέϊ χαλκῷ Il. 10.135 = Il. 14.12 = Il. 15.482: = Od. 1.99 = Od. 15.551 = Od. 20.127.
(2) Furnished with a sharp (double) edge: πέλεκυν (φάσγανον̓ ἀμφοτέρωθεν ἀκαχμένον Od. 5.235, Od. 22.80.

forms: Also (Il. 16.29: Od. 14.383) ἀκείομαι (ἀκεσίομαι, fr. ἀκεσ-, ἄκος).
defs: (1) To heal, cure
(b) A wound Il. 16.29, 523.
(2) To quench (thirst) Il. 22.2.
(3) To make good a blunder: ἀλλʼ ἀκέσασθε Od. 10.69. Sim. ἀλλʼ ἀκεώμεθα Il. 13.115 (app., let us heal the breach between Achilles and Agamemnon).
(4) To repair (a ship) Od. 14.383.
With unshorn hair. Epithet of Phoebus Od. 3.39.
A means of cure, a remedy: ἀκέσματʼ ὀδυνάων Il. 15.394.
That can be healed: ἀκεσταὶ φρένες ἐσθλῶν Il. 13.115 (app., are open to propitiation).

(1) In silence, without speech: βῆ ἀ. Il. 1.34. Cf. Il. 1.512, 565, 569, Il. 10.85: Od. 9.427, Od. 10.52, Od. 11.142, Od. 14.110, Od. 17.465 = 491 = Od. 20.184, Od. 20.385. Indeclinable: ἀκέων δαίνυσθε Od. 21.89. Undistracted by speech of others: δαίνυσθαι ἀκέοντε Od. 14.195. Cf. Od. 2.311.
(2) Silent (indeclinable): Ἀθηναίη ἀκέων ἦν Il. 4.22 = Il. 8.459.
Without funeral rites: ἐξαπολοίατʼ ἀκήδεστοι Il. 7.60.

forms: With genit.: εὑ Il. 14.427, μευ Il. 23.70.

defs: (1) Paying no funeral rites Il. 21.123.
(2) Not honoured with such rites Il. 24.554: Od. 24.187.
(3) Careless, neglectful Od. 17.319.
(5) Vexed by no cares Il. 24.526.
Proof against sorcery: νόος Od. 10.329.
(1) In silence, without speech: ἴσαν Il. 4.429.

forms: Of wine, pure, unmixed Od. 9.205 (app. by confusion with ἄκρητος).

defs: (1) Unharmed, intact Il. 15.498: Od. 17.532.
(2) Pure, undefiled: ὕδωρ Il. 24.303 (cf. ἀκηράσιος.).
(1) Lifeless: βέλος ἀκήριον τίθησιν Il. 11.392. Cf. Il. 21.466.
(2) Spiritless: δέος Il. 5.812, 817, Il. 13.224, ἥμενοι ἀκήριοι Il. 6.100.

forms: App., of less account, less to be regarded Od. 5.217, Od. 8.169, Od. 18.130.

defs: Without strength, feeble: ὀλίγος (κακὸς) καὶ ἀ. Od. 9.515, Od. 21.131.
Not to be reached. Absol. in neut. pl. ἀκίχητα, the unattainableIl. 17.75.
(1) Unwept: νέκυς Il. 22.386. Cf. Od. 11.54, 72.
(2) Not weeping Od. 4.494.
(1) Without fame, inglorious Il. 12.318. In neut. ἀκλεές as adv. = ἀκλειῶς 1: ἥμενοι Il. 6.100.
(2) (So as to be) the subject of no tidings: παῖδʼ ἀνηρείψαντο θύελλαι ἀκλέα Od. 4.728.
(1) In inglorious wise: μὴ ἀ. ἀπολοίμην Il. 22.304.
(2) So that no tidings come: ἀ. μιν ἅρπυιαι ἀνηρείψαντο Od. 1.241 = Od. 14.371.
Having no (considerable) portion of land: ἀνδρί Od. 11.490.
An edge: ξυροῦ Il. 10.173.

forms: With genit.: σίτοιο Il. 19.163, πόσιος καὶ ἐδητύος 320.
In its prime, flourishing: θάμνος ἐλαίης Od. 23.191.

defs: (1) Not tired, fresh Il. 11.802 = Il. 16.44.
(2) Tireless Il. 15.697.
An anvil-block Il. 18.410, 476: Od. 8.274.

etym: [prob. conn. with ἄκανθα in sense spine, prickle.]

defs: A husband, one's husband Il. 15.91: Od. 5.120, Od. 21.88.
A scrap or morsel Od. 17.222.
Lack of tendance or care: ἄλη τʼ ἀκομιστίη τε Od. 21.284.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἀκόντισε Il. 4.496, Il. 5.533, Il. 8.118, Il. 13.183, Il. 17.304, etc.
Genit. sing. masc. pple. ἀκοντίσσαντος Il. 4.498, Il. 15.575.
Infin. ἀκοντίσσαι Il. 13.559, 585, Il. 16.359. ἀκοντίσαι Od. 22.263.
defs: (1) To throw the spear: ἀνδρὸς ἀκοντίσσαντος Il. 4.498 = Il. 15.575. Cf. Il. 16.336, 359: οἱ ἓξ ἀκοντίσατε Od. 22.252. Cf. Od. 22.255, 263. With genit. of the person aimed at: Ἕκτορος ἀκόντισεν Il. 8.118. Cf. Il. 13.502, 559, Il. 17.608. With dat. of the weapon: δουρί Il. 5.533. Cf. Il. 4.496, Il. 5.611 = Il. 17.347, Il. 11.577, Il. 13.403, 585, Il. 15.573, Il. 16.284, Il. 17.574: Od. 8.229. With genit, and dat. Il. 4.490, Il. 13.183, 516, Il. 14.402, 461, Il. 15.429, Il. 17.304, 525.
(2) To throw (a spear): αἰχμάς Il. 12.44, Il. 14.422: δοῦρα Od. 22.265, 272, 282.

forms: A (skilful) spearman: υἷες ἀκοντισταὶ Ἀμισωδάρου Il. 16.328. Cf. Od. 18.262.
A contest of throwing the spear: οὐδʼ ἔτʼ ἀκοντιστὺν ἐσδύσεαι Il. 23.622.

defs: Insatiable in, never having his or their fill of. With genit.: μόθου Il. 6.117. Cf. Il. 12.335, Il. 13.621, 639, Il. 14.479, Od. 3.2.
A cure or remedy Il. 9.250: Od. 22.481.
Disorderly, marked by turbulence: ἔπεα Il. 2.213.

forms: To have barley for food, be corn-fed: ἀκοστήσας ἐπὶ φάτνῃ Il. 7.506 = Il. 15.263.

defs: To listen to, give ear to. With genit.: ἀοιδοῦ Od. 9.7, Od. 13.9. To hear of. With double genit. of person from whom one hears of a thing and of the thing: δαιτὸς ἐμεῖο Il. 4.343.
(1) A sound Hom. Od. 16.634.
Without male offspring Od. 6.64.

forms: Dat. pl. masc. pres. pple. ἀκουόντεσσι Od. 1.352.
2 sing. fut. in mid. form ἀκούσεαι Il. 15.96.
Infin. ἀκοῦσαι Od. 2.375, Od. 4.553, Od. 12.187, Od. 17.115, etc. (ἐπ-, ἐσ-, ὑπ-.)
defs: (1) To hear: τέρπετʼ ἀκούων Il. 1.474. Cf. Il. 4.198, Il. 11.603, Il. 15.129,  Il. 17.245, Il. 18.35, etc.: ἐθέλω ἀκοῦσαι Od. 4.553. Cf. Od. 11.380, Od. 12.48, Od. 15.98, Od. 23.135, etc. With dependent clause: ὡς ἐβόησας Od. 4.281.
(2) In various constructions.
(3) To listen, hearken, give ear: θεοὶ πάντες ἄκουον Il. 8.4. Cf. Il. 12.442, Il. 17.408, Il. 19.81: ἥατʼ ἀκούοντες Od. 1.326. Cf. Od. 1.352, 353, Od. 12.37, Od. 15.393.
(4) To listen to, give ear to.

(5) To have heard, have learned, know (cf. ἀΐω1 4, πεύθομαι 3): τὰ μέλλετʼ ἀκουέμεν Il. 14.125. With infin.: καὶ σὲ ἀκούομεν ὄλβιον εἶναι (infin. of the impf.) Il. 24.543. With acc. of person heard about and dependent clause: Ἀτρεΐδην ἀκούετε ὡς . . . Od. 3.193. With genit. of person from whom one has heard about something Od. 4.94. With this genit. and clause: οὐδὲ πατρῶν ἀκούεθʼ οἷος . . . Od. 4.688. With elliptical construction Od. 2.118. Absol.: εἴ που ἀκουεις Od. 15.403.
(1) Not accomplished, not carried out: ἔργον Il. 2.138.
(2) Not to be fulfilled: ἔπεα Od. 19.565. In neut. ἀκράαντον as adv., without hope of fulfilment, to no purpose Od. 2.202.

forms: Of wind, blowing at height; or perh., blowing with the right velocity or from the right quarter Od. 2.421, Od. 14.253, 299.

defs: (1) The highest point of a city Od. 8.508.
(2) κατʼ ἄκρης, down from the top. Of a breaking wave, with full forceOd. 5.313. Fig., utterly, to total destruction: ὤλετο Il. 13.772. Cf. Il. 15.557, Il. 22.411, Il. 24.728.
(3) A cape or headland Il. 4.425, Il. 14.36: Od. 9.285.

forms: Unmixed: οἴνῳ Od. 24.73. Cf. Od. 2.341, Od. 9.297.
So σπονδαὶ ἄκρητοι (ratified by libations of unmixed wine) Il. 2.341 = Il. 4.159.

defs: A locust Il. 21.12.
A hill-top: ἠνεμοέσσας Od. 9.400, Od. 16.365, διʼ ἄκριας Od. 10.281, Od. 14.2.
(1) Indiscriminate or reckless in speech Il. 2.246.
(2) Hard to be discerned or interpreted ὄνειροι Od. 19.560.

(1) Indiscriminate, endless: μῦθοι Il. 2.796. Endless, never-ending: ἄχεα Il. 3.412, Il. 24.91. Endless, never brought to reconciliation: νείκεα Il. 14.205 = 304. Absol. in neut. pl.: ἄκριτα πόλλʼ ἀγόρευον Od. 8.505 (app., held much and indiscriminate or inconsistent debate).
(2) In neut. sing. ἄκριτον as adv.
(b) Endlessly, continually: πενθήμεναι Od. 18.174, Od. 19.120.
With confused or massed foliage: ὄρος Il. 2.868 (i.e. the separate trees are indistinguishable).
In pres. pple. ἀκροκελαινιόων, of a river, with black or dark surfaceIl. 21.249.
Wearing the hair in a topknot (the hair round this being app. cut short or shaved off). Epithet of the Thracians Il. 4.533.
(1) The summit or crest of a hill Od. 11.597.
(2) A cape or headland. Of Sunium Od. 3.278.
(3) An end or extremity: ἐπʼ ἄκρῳ δῆσε ζυγόν Il. 5.729. Cf. Od. 9.328, 382.
(4) The extreme surface: [νύσσης] Il. 23.339.
The highest part of a city, the citadel. Of Troy Od. 8.494, 504.
Topmost, the topmost part of: ὄρεσσιν Il. 5.523: Od. 19.205.
With a piercing or sharp point. Epithet of spits: ὀβελούς Od. 3.463.

(2) Outermost, the extremity of: πόδας Il. 16.640. Cf. Il. 17.264 (see ἠϊών 2), 309, 599, Od. 3.227: οἰήϊον Od. 9.483 = 540. The edge of: χείλει Il. 12.51. Growing on the extremity: τρίχες οὐραῖαι Il. 23.519. At the end of a row: νῆες Il. 15.653. The base or root of: χεῖρα Il. 5.336 (cf. 458).
(3) The surface of: ὕδωρ Il. 16.162: ῥινόν Od. 22.278. App. in neut. ἄκρον as adv., on the surface: ἀ. ἐπὶ ῥηγμῖνος θέεσκον Od. 3.229 (v. l. ἀ. ἔπι, taking ἀ. as sb., the surface; see ἄκρον 4).
(4) In superl. ἀκρότατος, -η, -ον (in Od. 12.11 of two terminations), much like the positive.

(b) The extremity of: ὄζῳ Il. 2.312. Sim. ἀκρότατον παρʼ οὐδόν Od. 22.127 (app., to one side of (and passing at right angles) one of the extremities of the threshold). Predicatively: ὅθʼ ἀκρότατος πρόεχʼ ἀκτή (where the beach ran furthest out) Od. 12.11.
(c) The surface of: χρόα Il. 4.139, χαλκόν Il. 6.246.
Corn or meal: ἀλφίτου Il. 11.631, δημήτερος Il. 13.322, Il. 21.76: ἀλφίτου Od. 2.355, Od. 14.429.

(1) A beach or shore of the sea: ἀκτὴν εἰσανέβαινον Il. 18.68. Cf. Il. 12.284, Od. 3.50, Il. 23.125, Il. 24.97: ἐπʼ ἀκτῆς καθήμενος Od. 5.82. Cf. Od. 5.151, Od. 10.140, 509, Od. 13.234, Od. 15.36, Od. 24.378.
(2) A projecting part of the shore: ἀκτῇ Il. 2.395: ἀκταὶ προβλῆτες Od. 5.405. Cf. Od. 5.425, Od. 10.89, Od. 12.11, Od. 13.98, Od. 24.82.
Not possessed of, lacking. With genit.: χρυσοῖο Il. 9.126 = 268.

forms: Dat. pl. ἀκτῖσι Od. 5.479, Od. 19.441. ἀκτίνεσσι Il. 10.547: Od. 11.16.
A ray or beam: ἠελίοιο Il. 10.547. Cf. Od. 5.479, Od. 11.16, Od. 19.441.
Prob., the fruit of the ilex.

defs: (2) In generalized sense, the dart: ἐπιστάμενος ἄκοντι Il. 15.282.

forms: To or into the sea: νῆα προέρυσσεν Il. 1.308. Cf. Il. 2.165 = 181, Il. 5.598, Il. 9.358, 683, Il. 12.19, Il. 14.97, 100, 106: νῆʼ εἴρυσεν Od. 2.389.
With εἰς: ποταμῶν, οἵ τʼ εἰς ἁ. προπέουσιν Od. 10.351.
A shouting in distress: ἀλαλητῷ φεύγοντες Il. 18.149. Cf. Il. 21.10.
A shouting in war, the war-shout: ἀ. ἀνὰ στρατὸν ὀρώρει Il. 4.436. Cf. Il. 12.138, Il. 14.393, Il. 16.78.

defs: Thus, the guardian or protectress. Epithet of Athene Il. 4.8, Il. 5.908.

(1) To ward or keep off Il. 9.605, Il. 21.548, Il. 23.185: Od. 4.167. With dat. of person protected: κύνας οἱ Il. 17.153. Cf. Il. 19.30, Il. 21.138 = 250: Od. 3.237, Od. 13.319. With genit.: Τρώων λοιγόν Il. 21.539. With dat. and genit. of part: κρατός τοι κακὸν ἦμαρ Od. 10.288.
(2) With dat., to succour, defend, protect: οἱ Il. 22.196.
To be distraught or sore distressed Il. 10.94.

forms: Pple. ἀλαλήμενος Od. 13.333, Od. 14.122, Od. 17.245, Od. 21.327.
Infin. ἀλάλησθαι Od. 2.370, Od. 12.284, Od. 15.276, Od. 20.206. (ἐπ-.)
defs: To wander, rove: κὰπ πεδίον ἀλᾶτο Il. 7.201. Cf. Il. 2.667, Il. 8.482, Il. 10.141, Il. 23.74: μαψιδίως Od. 3.72. Cf. Od. 2.333, 370, Od. 3.73, Od. 4.91, Od. 5.336, etc.

forms: Blind: μάντιος ἀλαοῦ (for ἀλαόὀ Od. 10.493, Od. 12.267.
A negligent or careless watch or lookout: οὐδʼ ἀλαοσκοπιὴν εἶχεν Il. 10.515, Il. 13.10, Il. 14.135: Od. 8.285.

defs: To blind: ὀφθαλμοῦ (of his (my) eye) Od. 1.69, Od. 9.516.
(1) Weak, feeble, ineffective: στίχες Il. 4.330, σθένος Il. 5.783 = Il. 6.257, Il. 8.463: Od. 18.373. Comp. ἀλαπαδνότερος Il. 4.305.
(2) Having little power or influence Il. 2.675.

(1) To deprive of vigour, take the strength from: Ἀχαιούς Il. 12.67. To ruin: Ζεὺς ἀλάπαξεν (brought all this to nought) Od. 17.424 = Od. 19.80. To work havoc in (opposed ranks) Il. 5.166, Il. 11.503.
(2) To slay Il. 11.750.
(3) To destroy or sack (a city) Il. 2.367, Il. 9.136 = 278, 328, Il. 24.245.
To find things intolerable: ἠλάστεον θεοί (raged (impotently)) Il. 15.21. So in aor. pple. ἀλαστήσας, giving way to such a feeling, breaking out in protestIl. 12.163.

(1) Unforgettable, that never leaves one: πένθος Il. 24.105: Od. 1.342, Od. 24.423, ἄχος Od. 4.108. In neut. ἄλαστον as adv., of mourning, without power of forgetting, unceasingly: ὀδύρομαι Od. 14.174.
(2) Applied to a person (app. by transference of the epithet from acts to the agent), doer of deeds not to be forgotten, wretch: Ἕκτορ, ἄλαστε Il. 22.261.
A blinding Od. 9.503.
To suffer (bodily) pain or discomfort Il. 2.269, Il. 8.85, Il. 12.206: Od. 12.27.
So much the worse, all the harder: ἀ. τῷ ἔσσεται Il. 18.306. Cf.  Il. 18.278: Od. 17.14, Od. 19.322. Without construction Od. 4.292, Od. 16.147.

forms: Most difficult or hard: ἀλγίστη δαμάσασθαι Il. 23.655.

defs: (1) Pain, distress: ἀ. ἱκάνει θυμόν Il. 3.97. Cf. Il. 7.450, 462, Il. 18.395, Il. 22.53, 54: ὅπως μοι ἀ. ἀλάλκοις Od. 13.319. Cf. Od. 2.41, 193, Od. 15.345, Od. 19.471.
(2) Definitely distinguished as bodily pain or suffering Il. 5.394: Od. 14.32.

(3) In pl., distresses, woes, cares, hardships: Ἀχαιοῖς ἄλγεʼ ἔθηκεν Il. 1.2. Cf. Il. 2.667, Il. 9.321, Il. 13.346, Il. 18.224, Il. 24.568, etc.: πάθεν ἄλγεα Od. 1.4, ἄλγεσι θυμὸν ἐρέχθων Od. 5.83 (i.e. expressions of grief). Cf. Od. 2.343, Od. 3.220, Od. 8.182, Od. 20.339, etc.
To cause to wax or fill out: μέλεα Od. 18.70 = Od. 24.368.
(2) Causing or apt to cause injury or harm: πνοιῇ βορέω Il. 14.395. Cf. Il. 17.749, Il. 24.8: = Od. 8.183 = Od. 13.91 = 264, Od. 18.224.
(3) Fatal, baneful: ἀγηνορίης Il. 22.457.
(4) Difficult, troublesome: δαμήμεναι Il. 10.402, Il. 17.76. Troublesome, irksome: νηπιέῃ Il. 9.491.
(5) App., bringing repentance in its wake: μαχλοσύνην Il. 24.30.
With neg., not to care for, trouble oneself about, have regard for. With genit.: σέθεν οὐκ ἀλεγίζω Il. 1.180. Cf. Il. 1.160, Il. 8.477, Il. 11.80, Il. 12.238. Absol. Il. 15.106.
To take one's part in, partake of (a meal): δαῖτας Od. 1.374. Cf. Od. 2.139, Od. 8.38, Od. 11.186, Od. 13.23.
(1) To care, be concerned: οὐκ ἀλέγω Il. 11.389: Od. 17.390.
(2) To be careful of one's duties, show due regard for another or others: ὅτις οὐκ ἀλέγει Od. 16.307. Cf. Od. 19.154.
(3) To show concern for, busy oneself with, the right: λιταὶ ἀλέγουσιν Il. 9.504.
(4) To attend to, busy oneself about: νηῶν ὅπλα Od. 7.268.
(5) With neg., not to care for or concern oneself about, regard or heed: θεῶν ὄπιν οὐκ ἀλέγοντες Il. 16.388. With genit.: σκυζομένης σευ Il. 8.483. Cf. Od. 9.115, 275, Od. 20.214.

(1) To escape, evade, avoid, keep out of the way, reach or influence of, avoid incurring (something coming upon or threatening one): κῆρα Il. 3.32 = Il. 11.585 = Il. 13.566 = 596 = 648 = Il. 14.408, Il. 16.817. Cf. Il. 11.794, Il. 13.669, Il. 16.36, 213 = Il. 23.713, Il. 17.374: χόλον γυναικός Od. 1.433. Cf. Od. 5.326, Od. 7.273, Od. 13.148, Od. 19.373, Od. 24.229.
(2) To elude the notice of Od. 16.477. Absol., to evade questioning Od. 4.251.
(3) To shun, avoid, keep clear of or away from: πάτον ἀνθρώπων Il. 7.202. Cf. Il. 11.542, Il. 23.422.
(4) With infin., to shrink from doing, hesitate to do: κτεῖναι Il. 7.167, ἀλεξέμεναι Il. 13.356.
A means of escape Il. 22.301.
Wheaten flour Od. 20.108.
An offender: τείσεσθαι ἀλείτην Il. 3.28. Cf. Od. 20.121.
Unguent, oil Il. 18.351, Il. 23.170: Od. 3.408 (app. here some kind of polish or varnish), Od. 24.45, 67, 73.

forms: Nom. dual masc. pple. ἀλειψαμένω Il. 10.577.
defs: (1) To oil, anoint with oil Il. 18.350, Il. 24.582: Od. 7.227, Od. 19.505.
(2) To stop (the ears) with wax: ἐπʼ οὔατʼ ἀλεῖψαι (ἄλειψἀ Od. 12.47, 177. To put (wax) in the ears Od. 12.200.
(3) In mid., to anoint oneself: ἀλείψατο λίπʼ ἐλαίῳ Il. 14.171. Cf. Il. 10.577, Il. 14.175.
Protecting from the wind: χλαῖναν Od. 14.529.
One who wards off or stems: ἀλεξητῆρα μάχης Od. 3.396.

forms: Tending to avert evil: μῆτις Il. 10.20.
Acc. sing. masc. pple. ἀλεξήσοντα Il. 7.109.
Aor. infin. mid. ἀλέξασθαι Il. 13.475, Il. 15.565, Il. 16.562: Od. 18.62. (ἀπ-, ἐπ-.)
defs: (1) To ward or keep off, avert Od. 3.346. With dat. of person or thing protected: Δαναοῖσι κακὸν ἦμαρ Il. 9.251. Cf. Il. 9.347, 674, Il. 17.365,  Hom. Il. 20.315 = Il. 21.374.
(2) With dat., to succour, defend, protect: ἀλλήλοισιν Il. 3.9. Cf. Il. 5.779, Il. 7.109. Absol., to afford succour, defence, or protection Il. 1.590, Il. 11.469, Il. 13.356.

(3) In mid., to ward or keep off from oneself, defend oneself against, encounter: ἀλέξασθαι κύνας Il. 13.475: τοῦτον ἀλέξασθαι Od. 18.62. Absol., to defend oneself, offer resistance Il. 11.348 = Il. 22.231, Il. 15.565 = Il. 16.562: Od. 9.57.

forms: 3 sing. subj. ἀλέηται Od. 4.396. ἀλεύεται Od. 14.400, Od. 24.29.
defs: (1) To escape, evade, avoid, keep out of the way, reach, or influence of (something coming upon or threatening one): ἔγχεα Il. 7.226. Cf. Il. 3.360, Il. 5.34, Il. 15.223, Od. 3.147, 281, etc.: νοῦσον Od. 9.411. Cf. Od. 9.274, 277, Od. 12.157, Od. 16.447, Od. 20.305, 368, Od. 22.260, Od. 24.29.

(2) Absol., to escape Od. 3.302. To avoid a missile Od. 20.300. To flee, take to flight, take oneself off, save oneself Il. 5.28 (as it seemed to the onlookers), Il. 13.436, 513: Od. 4.396. To keep out of harm's way Il. 18.586.
(3) To shun, avoid, keep clear of or away  from, refrain from: μύθους ὑπερφιάλους Od. 4.774, σειρήνων φθόγγον καὶ λειμῶνα Od. 12.159, νῆσον 269 = 274, ὅμιλον Od. 17.67.
(4) With infin., to shrink from doing, hesitate to do: ἠπεροπεύειν Il. 23.605: Od. 14.400. To take care not to do: λίθου ἐπαυρεῖν Il. 23.340.
To grind: καρπόν Od. 6.104.
A female slave employed in grinding Od. 20.105.
To grind: πυρόν Od. 20.109.
(1) Shrinking from the foe Il. 24.216.
(2) A means of defence: δηΐων ἀνδρῶν (against . . .) Il. 12.57, Il. 15.533.
(1) App., not forgetting, careful, anxious: χερνῆτις Il. 12.433.
(2) Absol. in neut. pl. ἀληθέα, the truthIl. 7.382: Od. 3.254 = Od. 16.61, Od. 13.254, Od. 14.125, Od. 17.15, Od. 18.342.
(3) In neut. sing. ἀληθές as adv., truly Od. 3.247.
Without share of booty; hence, not rich in possessions Il. 9.125 = 267.
A vagrant Od. 17.376, Od. 19.74.
(2) To go to and fro: κατὰ δῶμα Od. 17.501. Cf. Od. 22.291.
To become whole or sound: ἄλθετο χείρ Il. 5.417.
Blowing over the sea Od. 4.361.
(2) In neut., ἀλίαστον as adv., without ceasing Il. 24.549.

forms: With dat.: ἀστέρι καλῷ Il. 7.401: ἀθανάτοισιν Od. 8.174.

defs: (1) A seaman Od. 24.419. With ἐρέτης Od. 16.349.
Seaward flowing Il. 21.190. Of a river at its meeting with the sea Od. 5.460.

forms: Absol. in fem. pl., sea-goddesses Il. 18.432.

defs: (1) Ineffective, effecting nothing, useless, idle, vain, fruitless: πόνον Il. 4.26. Cf. Il. 4.158, 179, 498 = Il. 15.575, Il. 5.18, 715, Il. 11.376, 380, Il. 14.455, Il. 16.480, Il. 18.324, Il. 24.92, 224: ὁδός Od. 2.273, 318. Of a person, inefficient: σκοπός Il. 10.324.
(2) In neut. ἅλιον as adv., in vain, without result Il. 13.410, 505 = Il. 16.615.
(1) To make of no effect, frustrate: Διὸς νόον Od. 5.104 = 138.
(2) To use to no effect: βέλος (did not hurl it in vain) Il. 16.737.
Floating on the sea, in the state of flotsam: τείχεα Il. 12.26.

etym: [ἅλς1 + (app.) πορφύρα, the Phoenician shell-fish called the murex, the dye got therefrom.]
forms: Thus, dyed in sea-purple: ἠλάκατα Od. 7.53, 306, φάρεα Od. 13.108.

defs: (1) In a throng, in swarms: μέλισσαι ἁ. πεποτήαται Il. 2.90. Cf. Il. 3.384, Il. 22.473.

(2) In abundance, in plenty, in great numbers: ἁ. οἱ ἦσαν ἄρουραι Il. 14.122. Cf. Il. 9.137, 279, Il. 17.54, Il. 21.236, 319, 344, 352, Il. 22.340: χαλκὸν ἁ. δόντες Od. 5.38 = Od. 23.341. Cf. Od. 2.339, Od. 6.295, Od. 13.136 = Od. 16.231, Od. 15.77 = 94, Od. 16.389 (with notion of excess), Od. 17.298, 376, Od. 24.486.
(3) With copula to be supplied, (it is) enough: ἦ οὐχ ἁ. ὅττι . . .; Il. 5.349, Il. 23.670. Cf. Il. 9.376, Il. 17.450: Od. 2.312.

forms: 3 sing. ἁλοίη Il. 17.506. Masc. dual pple. ἁλόντε Il. 5.487.
Fem. sing. ἁλοῦσα Il. 2.374, Il. 4.291, Il. 13.816.
Infin. ἁλώμεναι Il. 21.495. ἁλῶναι Il. 12.172, Il. 21.281: Od. 5.312, Od. 24.34.
defs: (1) To be taken, captured, seized: βέλτερον δ'ς προφύγῃ ἠὲ ἁλώῃ Il. 14.81. Cf. Il. 5.487, Il. 11.405, Il. 21.495. With θανάτῳ, to meet one's death Il. 21.281': = Od. 5.312, Od. 24.34. Of towns, to be taken Il. 2.374 = Il. 4.291 = Il. 13.816, Il. 9.592: Od. 22.230.
(2) To be slain: ἠὲ κατακτάμεν ἠὲ ἁλῶναι Il. 12.172. Cf. Il. 17.506, Il. 22.253: Od. 14.183, Od. 15.300, Od. 18.265.

forms: Non-thematic pres. pple. mid. ἀλιτήμενος Od. 4.807.
defs: (1) In both voices, to sin or trespass against, fail in duty to: ἤλιτέ με Il. 9.375. Cf. Il. 19.265: ἀθανάτους ἀλιτέσθαι Od. 4.378. Cf. Od. 5.108.
(2) In mid., to transgress, infringe: Διὸς ἐφετμάς Il. 24.570, 586.
(3) In pres. pple. mid. ἀλιτμενος in adjectival sense, sinning, sinful: θεοῖς (in the eyes of the gods) Od. 4.807.
(1) = ἀλιτήμων.: δαίμοσιν (in the eyes of the gods) Il. 23.595. Playfully Od. 5.182.
(2) Not showing due regard, showing ill-will Il. 8.361.
A means of defence, a safeguard. With dat. of person defended: τρώεσσιν Il. 5.644. With genit.: Ἀχαιῶν Il. 11.823.
(1) Defence, help: οὔτε κλέος οὔτʼ ἀ. Il. 5.532 = Il. 15.564, οὐδέ τις ἀ. γίγνετο (γίγνεταἰ Il. 21.528: Od. 22.305, οὐδέ τίς ἐ ἀ. Od. 12.120.

(2) Prowess in defence or offence, mettle, courage, spirit: συΐ εἴκελος ἀλκήν Il. 4.253. Cf. Il. 3.45, Il. 5.299, Il. 6.164, Il. 9.706, Il. 16.157, Il. 19.36, etc.: ἀλκὶ πεποιθώς Od. 7.130. Cf. Od. 9.214, 514, Od. 17.315, Od. 22.226, 237, Od. 23.128, Od. 24.509. Personified Il. 5.740.

(3) Showing of fight, resistance: οὐκ ἀπολήγει ἀλκῆς Il. 21.578. Prowess displayed in action, deeds of prowess,  fighting: εἰδότε ἀλκῆς Il. 11.710, ἔπαυσεν ἀλκῆς Il. 15.250. Cf. Hom. Od. 13.116, 197, Il. 15.490 (from Zeus), Od. 3.256, etc.: οὐ δεδαηκότες ἀλκήν Od. 2.61. Cf. Od. 4.527.
(4) The upper hand, victory: ἀπείρητος οὐδ' ἀδήριτος ἤ τʼ ἀλκῆς ἤ τε φόβοιο (whether in the matter of . . . or . . . , whether the result be . . . or . . .) Il. 17.42.

(1) Stout, courageous Il. 5.529, Il. 7.437, Il. 11.483, Il. 12.349, Il. 16.689, Il. 17.429, Il. 21.586, etc.: Od. 1.302 = Od. 3.200, Od. 10.553, Od. 22.138, 232. With complementary infin.: ἀ. μάχεσθαι Il. 15.570.
(1) A protector: ἀρῆς (against . . . ) Il. 14.485. Cf. Il. 18.100, 213.
(2) A means of protection: κυνῶν Od. 14.531, Od. 21.340.
The halcyon or kingfisher Il. 9.563.

(1) Adversative particle, but Il. 1.24, 25, 94, 116, 125, etc.: Od. 1.6, 16, 22, 42, 48, etc. Elliptically: ἀλλ' οὐ γάρ δ' ἐθέλω . . . (but I say no more, for . . .) Il. 6.242: ἀλλ' οὐ γάρ τις πρῆξις ἐγίγνετο (but they soon gave over, for . . . ) Od. 10.202 = 568, ἀλλ' οὐ γάρ οἱ ἔτʼ ἦν ἴς ἔμπεδος (but it was of no avail, for . . . ) Od. 11.393. Cf. Od. 19.591.

(2) Introducing an apodosis, yet, nevertheless: εἴ περ γὰρ . . . ἀλλʼ οῦ πείσονται Il. 8.154. Cf. Il. 1.82, Il. 12.349, Il. 16.38, Il. 24.771, etc.: εἰ . . . ἀλλ' ἤδη παῖς τοῖος Od. 19.86, etc. Introducing a statement: ἀλλὰ μάλ' ὤφελλες (why . . . ) Od. 4.472.

(3) With imp. (or infin. as imp.) in command, challenge, entreaty, remonstrance, persuasion, encouragement, indignation, etc., nay but, come now ! ἴθι Il. 1.32, πίθεσθε Il. 1.259. Cf. Il. 1.393, Il. 1.508, Il. 1.565, Il. 2.163, 360, etc.: μέν' αὖθι Od. 2.369, ὧδ' ἔρδειν Od. 7.258. Cf. Od. 3.323, 380, Od. 4.28, 35, 379, etc. Sim. with subj.: ἴομεν Il. 7.526, etc.: φραζώμεσθα Od. 2.167, φθεγγώμεθα Od. 10.228, etc. With opt.: ἐπιτρέψειας ἕκαστα δμῳάων ἥ τις . . . Od. 15.24. With fut.: ἐρέω Od. 12.156. With ἄνα. See ἄνα1. For ἀλλ' ἄγε (ἄγετἐ see ἄγε.

forms: To pick up, gather up: ὀστέα Il. 21.321, Il. 23.253.

defs: (1) Unceasing, never still: ἄη νότος Od. 12.325. Unceasing, implacable: θυμόν Il. 9.636.
(2) In neut. ἄλληκτον as adv, without intermission or pause: πολεμίζειν Il. 2.452 = Il. 11.12 = Il. 14.152.

One another, each other: ἀλλήλοισι κέλευον Il. 2.151. Cf. Il. 3.9, 15, 115, 155, Il. 4.449, 472, 536, etc.: ξεῖνοι ἀλλήλων Od. 1.187. Cf. Od. 1.209, Od. 2.149, Od. 4.620, Od. 5.79, Od. 7.211, Od. 9.55, etc.

forms: App., known to be other; hence, strange, foreign: δήμῳ Od. 2.366.

defs: (2) Absol., a foreigner or alien Il. 3.48, Il. 16.550: Od. 3.74 = Od. 9.255.
Of another, i. e. of strange, appearance: ἀλλοειδέα φαινέσκετο πάντα Od. 13.194 (ἀ. to be scanned in three long syllables; v. l. ἀλλοειδἔ ἐφάνετο).
(2) From another or strange land, from abroad: εἰλήλουθεν Od. 3.318. Cf. Od. 7.283, Od. 6.33, 52, Od. 16.26, Od. 17.112, Od. 20.360.
(1) In another place, elsewhere Od. 4.684, Od. 16.44, Od. 18.401. On his part, he too: κλαῖεν Od. 21.83.
Speaking a strange tongue, foreign, alien Od. 1.183, Od. 3.302, Od. 14.43, Od. 15.453.
Of another sort or kind: ἔργῳ Il. 4.258: ἀ. φάνης Od. 16.181, ἄνδρα Od. 19.265.

forms: 3 sing. subj. ἅληται Il. 21.536. ἅλεται Il. 11.192, 207. (ἀνεφ-, ἐκκατεφ-, ἐξ-, ἐσ-, ἐφ-, καθ-, κατεφ-, μεθ-, ὑπερ-.)

defs: One thing to one person, another to another, doublefaced Il. 5.831, 889.

etym: -η, -ο. Crasis with τά gives τἆλλα Il. 1.465, Il. 2.428: Od. 3.462, Od. 12.365.
defs: (II)
(III) Of other kind or sort: οὐκ ἔα πόνος ἄλλος Il. 5.517 (i.e. it was no time for curiosity), ὄρνεον ἄλλο Il. 13.64. Cf. Il. 13.622, Il. 21.22: ἄλλῳ αὐτὸν θωτὶ ἤϊσκεν Od. 4.247. Cf. Od. 11.54.
(IV) Contextually

(V) Implying in terms the inclusion in a class of a person or thing not in fact included in it: αὐτὸς κάθησο καὶ ἄλλους ἵδρυε λαούς Il. 2.191. Cf. Il. 5.485, 621, Il. 11.189, etc.: ʼοδυσσεὺς ἠδὲ καὶ ἄλλοι φαίηκες Od. 8.368. Cf. Od. 1.128, Od. 5.489, Od. 7.84, Od. 11.470, Od. 15.407, etc.
(VI)
Elsewhither, elsewhere Od. 23.184, 204.
(1) At another time, at other times Il. 10.120, Il. 13.776, Il. 19.200, Od. 3.53, Il. 22.171, Il. 24.511.
(3) With ἄλλος: ἀ. ἐπʼ ἄλλον (now on to one, now on to another) Il. 15.684: ἀ. ἄλλῳ (now to one, now to another) Od. 4.236.
(4) At another time, on a former occasion: ἀ. με ῥίψεν Il. 1.590. Cf. Od. 3.90, 187.

(1) Of or belonging to others, not one's own Od. 3.298: Od. 1.160, Od. 9.535, Od. 11.115, Od. 18.280, Od. 19.119, Od. 20.171, 221, Od. 24.301. As if not one's own: γναθμοῖσι γελώων ἀλλοτρίοισιν Od. 20.347 (not expressing their real feelings). Absol. in neut. pl., things of others, what is not one's own: ἀλλοτρίων χαρίσασθαι Od. 17.452. Cf. Od. 17.456, Od. 18.18.
Having no crest: κυνέην Il. 10.258.

etym: [ a first element poss. conn. with ἠλεός + φρονέω.]
forms: Troubled or dashed in spirit Od. 10.374.

defs: (1) ἀ. ἄλλος, some or part in this direction, some or part in anotherIl. 11.486, 745, Il. 12.461, Il. 17.729, Il. 21.503: Od. 5.71, Od. 7.138, Od. 14.25, 35.
(2) ἀ. ἄλλῃ. See ἄλλῃ 2.c, 3.b.
(1) Otherwise, differently, so as to bring about a different result Il. 14.53. In other circumstances Od. 15.513. Reversing a previous decision: μετεβούλευσαν Od. 5.286.
(2) In some other form: εἰ ἀ. δοίης δωτίνην Od. 9.267. For some other reason Od. 17.577. In novel fashion: ἑψιάασθαι Od. 8.429.
(3) καὶ ἀ., as it is, at the best of times, without that: ἀγήνωρ ἐστὶ καὶ ἀ. Il. 9.699. Cf. Od. 3.99: Od. 8.87.

(4) Otherwise (connoting improvement): πάρος οὐκ ἔσσεται ἀ. Il. 5.218. In other and better wise, better, more effectually: σαωσέμεν Il. 19.401. Cf. Il. 11.391: οὔ κεν ἀ. θεὸς τεύξειεν Od. 8.176. Cf. Od. 20.211, Od. 24.107.
(5) Otherwise than with due regard to truth, idly, at random: ἀ. ψεύδονται Od. 14.124.
(6) With other result than that hoped for, in vain, fruitlessly: ἀ. ἠρήσατο Il. 23.144.
