Jumping, leaping Od. 8.128. In pl.: περιγιγνόμεθʼ ἄλλων ἅλμασιν Od. 8.103.
(1) Sea-water, brine Od. 5.53, 322.

forms: To pay no heed or regard Il. 15.162, 178.

defs: To beat: γαῖαν Il. 9.568.
(1) Unguent, oil Od. 7.220, Od. 18.179. Tallow applied to a bow Od. 8.179.
(2) Oil or grease used for dressing a hide Il. 17.390, 392.
(3) Hog's lard or grease: συὸς ῥάχιν τεθαλυῖαν ἀλοιθῇ Il. 9.208. Cf. Il. 9.467, 32: Od. 8.476, Od. 13.410.

etym: [sense unknown. Traditionally explained as 'daughter of the sea' (ἅλς1).]

defs: (1) Salt Il. 9.214. In pl.: ἅλεσσι μεμιγμένον εἶδαρ Od. 11.123 = Od. 23.270.
(2) A piece of salt Od. 17.455.
(2) A sacred grove: ʼογχηστόν, ποσιδήϊον ἀ. (i.e. O. with its grove) Il. 2.506: ʼαθήνης Od. 7.291. Cf. Od. 7.321, Od. 9.200, Od. 10.509, Od. 20.278.
(1) To escape, avoid: ὕβριν Od. 17.581.
(2) Absol., to play the shirker Il. 5.253, Il. 7.443.

(2) To get away from, effect one's escape or release from (something in which one is involved): χρέος καὶ δεσμόν (getting out of the debt and freeing himself from the bonds) Od. 8.353. To get free from the company of: ἑταίρους Od. 12.335.
(3) Absol., to effect one's escape, escape,  save oneself Il. 21.243, Il. 10.348, Il. 22.201: Od. 4.416, Od. 5.345, Od. 11.113 = Od. 12.140, Od. 22.460.
Not to be loosed: πέδας Il. 13.37, πεῖραρ 360: δεσμούς Od. 8.275.
(1) To be beside oneself from pain or grief: ἀλύουσʼ ἀπεβήσετο Il. 5.352. Cf. Il. 24.12. From exultation Od. 18.333 = 393.
(2) To manifest distraction by gestures: χερσὶν ἀλύων Od. 9.398.

forms: 3 sing. opt. ἄλθοι Od. 15.453, Od. 17.250, Od. 20.383.
To bring in, yield (a price) (always of a human chattel): ἑκατόμβοιον Il. 21.79. Cf. Od. 15.453, Od. 17.250, Od. 20.383.
Bringing (her parents many) oxen (as bride-price) Il. 18.593.

defs: Epithet of men, gain-getting, having to labour for their bread Od. 1.349, Od. 7.8, Od. 13.261.

forms: Barley (i.e. the prepared corn): ἀλθίτου ἀκτήν (barley-meal) Il. 11.631. Cf. Od. 2.355, Od. 14.429.

defs: (1) A threshing-floor Il. 5.499, Il. 13.588, Od. 3.496.

(2) A piece of levelled or prepared ground, a garden, orchard, vincyard Il. 5.90, Il. 9.534, 540, Il. 18.57 = 438, Il. 21.36, 77, 346: Od. 7.293. Distinguished as an orchard Od. 24.221, 224, 226, 336. As a vineyard Il. 18.561, 566 (in both cases referring to a represenation in metal): Od. 1.193, Od. 6.122, Od. 11.193.

etym: [σα-. Cf. ἀ-2, ἅπαξ, ἅπας, ἁπλοΐς, L. simul.]
defs: (I) Adv.
(II) Prep. with dat. (freq. following the case).
Loose or sandy soil Il. 5.587.
To level with the dust, destroy: πόλιν Il. 9.593.
Thus, of very great size or height: χίμαιραν Il. 7.179, Il. 16.329: ἱστὸν νηός Od. 14.311.
A binder of sheaves Il. 18.553, 554.
Of young animals, tender, feeble: ἄρνα Il. 22.310: σκυλάκεσσιν Od. 20.14.
A road Il. 22.146.
An irrigation trench Il. 21.259.

forms: 3 sing. impf. ἡμάρτανε Il. 10.372, Il. 24.68: Od. 11.511.
Fut. infin. in mid. form ἁμαρτήσεσθαι Od. 9.512.
defs: (1) To discharge a missile vainly, miss one's aim: ἤμβροτες οὐδ' ἔτυχες Il. 5.287. Cf. Il. 8.311, Il. 11.233 = Il. 13.605, Il. 13.518, Il. 22.279.

(2) To fail to hit, miss. With genit.: θωτός Il. 10.372. Cf. Il. 4.491, Il. 15.430, Il. 16.336, Il. 17.609, Il. 23.857, 865: σκοποῦ Od. 8.425. Cf. Od. 8.421. Sim., to miss (a person) in throwing something to be caught Od. 7.116.
(3) To lose, be deprived of. With genit.: ὀπωπῆς Od. 9.512. Sim., to lose (a person) by death Il. 22.505.

(4) To fall short, be lacking or deficient in. With genit.: δώρων (failed to give in due measure) Il. 24.68: νοήματος ἐσθλοῦ (failed in the matter of) Od. 6.292, μύθων (failed in finding in the matter of) Od. 6.292, μύθων (failed in finding the right) Od. 11.511.
(5) To commit wrong, sin: ὅτε κέν τις ἁμάρτῃ Il. 9.501. Cf. Od. 13.214, Od. 8.155. To neglect one's duty: τόδε γ' ἤμβροτον (in this) Od. 22.154.
(1) Both or all together: δούρατʼ ἤϊξαν Il. 5.656, ῥήσσοντες Il. 18.571.
(2) At the same moment, simultaneously Il. 21.162: Od. 22.81.
Stumbling in speech. In voc. ἁμαρτοεπές Il. 13.824.
A coming of wheels together, a coming of chariots abreast of each other Il. 23.422.
Without a fight Il. 21.437.
(1) To reap, act as reaper Il. 18.551.
(2) To reap (a crop) Od. 9.135. To cut (reeds)  Il. 24.451.
(3) To slice off: ἀπʼ οὔατʼ ἀμήσαντες Od. 8.301.
To collect, bring together. In mid. : ἐν ταλάροισιν ἀμησάμενος Od. 9.247.
Capable of being scaled: πόλις Il. 7.434: οὐρανός Od. 11.316.
Lifting up the voice Il. 22.476. (Cf. ἀνεβάλλετʼ ἀείδειν under ἀναβάλλω 2.)
Spirting up: λέβης ζεῖ ἀ. Il. 21.364.
(1) The food of the gods Od. 5.93, 199, Od. 9.359, Od. 12.63. Introduced into Achilles Il. 19.347, 353. Eaten by divine horses Il. 5.777.

(2) Used as a perfume Od. 4.445. By Here as a cleansing (and doubtless perfuming) cosmetic Il. 14.170. Applied by divine agency as a preservative or for purification to the corpse of Sarpedon Il. 16.670, 680. Introduced by divine agency into the corpse of Patroclus Il. 19.38.

forms: Sweet-smelling, fragrant: χαῖται Il. 1.529, νύκτα Il. 2.57 (prob. referring to the fragrance of a still warm night), ὕπνος Il. 2.19 (prob. a transference of epithet from νύξ). Cf. Il. 5.338, 369, Il. 8.434, Il. 10.41, 142, Il. 13.35, Il. 14.172, 177, 178, Il. 18.268, Il. 21.507, Il. 23.187 (here no doubt with a reference to preservative properties of the divine food; cf. ἀμβροσίη 2), Il. 24.341, 363: =Od. 1.97 = Od. 5.45, Od. 4.429 = 574, Od. 6.283, Od. 9.404, Od. 15.8, Od. 18.193.

etym: -ον. = ἀμβρόσιος.: εἵματα Il. 16.670, 680: Od. 6.260, 265, Od. 24.59, ἐλαίῳ Od. 8.365, νύξ Od. 11.330.

defs: (2) Of or belonging to a god, divine Il. 5.339, 870: Od. 5.347.
(3) Befitting a god Il. 17.194, 202: Od. 10.222.
(4) App., conferring divine qualities: δῶρα Od. 18.191.

forms: Not to be envied or desired.
defs: (1) Of a person in depreciation, miserable, wretched Od. 17.219, Od. 8.362.

forms: The rafters, sloping to each other in pairs, of a pitched roof Il. 23.712 (the wrestlers, with shoulders together but standing wide apart with their feet, being compared with a pair).
3 sing. aor. mid. ἠμείψατο Il. 23.542. ἀμείψατο Il. 4.403.
Infin. ἀμείψασθαι Il. 23.489: Od. 2.83, Od. 4.286, Od. 16.91. (ἀπ-, ἐπ-, παρ-.)
defs: (1) To change: ἔντεα Il. 17.192. To exchange (with another). With genit. of what is taken in exchange: τεύχεα πρὸς διομήδεα χρύσεα χαλκείων Il. 7.235. Sim., to exchange (the support of) one thing for (that of) another: γόνυ γουνός Il. 11.547.
(2) To cause persons to exchange: τεύχεα Il. 14.381.
(3) In mid.

(b) To take turns with one another: ἀμειβόμενοι θυλακὰς ἔχον Il. 9.471. So ἀμειβόμεναι ὀπὶ καλῇ (taking up the strain from each other) Il. 1.604: Od. 24.60.– ἀμειβόμενοι κατὰ οἴκους (each in turn giving the feast in his house) Od. 1.375 = Od. 2.140.– ταρθἔ ἀμειβομένω (with frequent change (from side to side)) Od. 8.379.
(c) To pass from one position or place to another: ἄλλοτ' ἐπ̓ ἄλλον [ἵππον] ἀμείβεται Il. 15.684.
(d) To pass from, leave, quit: ἕρκος ὀδόντων Il. 9.409.
(e) To enter: ἕρκος ὀδόντων Od. 10.328.

(g) To speak in answer, make answer Il. 13.823, Il. 23.489, 492, Il. 24.200, 424: Od. 3.148, Od. 4.382, 484, Od. 7.67, etc. In pres. pple. ἀμειβόμενος, -η, making answer, in answerIl. 3.437, Il. 6.356, Il. 14.270, etc.: Od. 2.84, Od. 4.234, 375, etc.

forms: Inflexible, implacable, relentless: ʼαΐδης Il. 9.158, ἦτορ 572, ἄνακτος Il. 24.734.
Acc. sing. masc. and fem. ἀμείνω Il. 3.11, Il. 4.400, Il. 9.423.
Used as comp. of ἀγαθός or ἐσθλός.
defs: (2) Better, more worthy, serviceable or skilful: ἀγορῇ Il. 4.400. Cf. Il. 7.350, Il. 18.106, Il. 23.315, 479, 605 (your betters): Od. 2.180, Od. 6.51, Od. 22.156. In reference to personal appearance Od. 24.374. Of horses Il. 10.556.

(3) Of things or abstractions, better of their kind, better, more excellent, helpful or in place: ὀμίχλην νυκτὸς ἀμείνω Il. 3.11. Cf. Il. 1.116, Il. 6.358 = Il. 12.232, Il. 9.104, 256, 423, Il. 12.412, Il. 14.107, Il. 15.509: ἀμείνω αἴσιμα πάντα Od. 6.310, Od. 15.71. Cf. Od. 1.376 = Od. 2.141, Od. 5.364, Od. 14.466, Od. 22.374. Impers. with infin.: πείθεσθαι ἄμεινόν [ἐστιν] Il. 1.274. Cf. Il. 11.469: Od. 22.104. Sim.: ὧς γὰρ ἄμεινον Il. 1.217.
(4) Good rather than ill: οὔ οἱ τό γ' ἄμεινον Il. 24.52.
To milk Od. 9.238, 244 = 341, 308. In pass. with the milk in acc.: ἀμελγόμεναι γάλα Il. 4.434.
(1) To disregard the claims of, fail to aid: οὐκ ἀμέλησε κασιγνήτοιο Il. 8.330. Cf. Il. 13.419. In sinister sense of holding back from attempting to despoil Il. 17.9.
(2) To disregard, fail to carry out: ἐθημοσύνης Il. 17.697.
Weak, powerless Il. 5.887. Of ghosts, fleeting, feeble Od. 10.521, 536, Od. 11.29, 49. Of dreams, fleeting, transient Od. 19.562.
To deprive of efficiency or effect: αἰχμήν Il. 13.562.

forms: 2 sing. aor. subj. pass. ἀμερθῇς Il. 22.58.
defs: (1) To deprive of or debar from. With genit.: αἰῶνος Il. 22.58. Cf. Od. 8.64, Od. 8.290.
(2) To despoil, rob Il. 16.53.
(3) To blind (the eyes) Il. 13.340.
(4) To deprive of lustre, tarnish Od. 19.18.
Immeasurable, endless: πένθος Od. 19.512, πόνος Od. 23.249.
Unmeasured in words. Of Thersites Il. 2.212.
(1) Without resources, helpless Od. 19.363.

(2) Unmanageable, difficult to deal with: ἀ. παραρρητοῖσι πιθέσθαι (in that you will not listen to persuasion) Il. 13.726. Of Here Il. 15.14. Of Achilles Il. 16.29. Of Agamemnon Il. 19.273. Playfully of Nestor Il. 10.167. Against which no contrivance a vails Il. 8.130 = Il. 11.310. Impracticable, not to be attempted Il. 14.262. Difficult to deal with or expound: ὄνειροι Od. 19.560.
Wearing no μίτρη with the χιτών, not wearing theμίτρη Il. 16.419.
Thus, misty, steaming. Of Lemnos Il. 24.753. (Lemnos is not volcanic. The reference may be to some jet of natural gas which has now disappeared.)

forms: App., what (of good) fate does not bestow, ill fortune Od. 20.76.

defs: (1) Denied the just dues of mankind, ill - fated Il. 7.408, Il. 24.773.
(2) Having no share in, not entering. With genit.: λοετρῶν ʼωκεανοῖο Il. 18.489: = Od. 5.275.
A vessel for collecting the blood of a sacrificial victim Od. 3.444.
With ease Il. 11.637.

forms: From any point (of a narrative): τῶν ἁ. εἰπέ Od. 1.10.

defs: Of a garment, kept for a change (= ἐπημοιβός 1): χλαῖνα Od. 14.521.
(1) A return or requital: ἄξιον ἔσται ἀμοιβῆς (will bring a (full) return) Od. 1.318, ἑκατόμβης (for . . . ) Od. 3.58.
(2) Compensation: βοῶν (for the loss of . . . ) Od. 12.382.
In turns Il. 18.506: Od. 18.310.
A relieving force: ἦλθον ἀμοιβοί (as a . . . ) Il. 13.793.

forms: gen. rendered, in the depth or gloom of night Il. 11.173, Il. 15.324, Il. 22.28, 317: Od. 4.841. (But Sirius, referred to in Il. 22.27 as shining ὀπώρης, is not then seen in the depth of night; and ἀστὴρ ἕσπερος in Il. 22.317 also causes difficulty.)

etym: -ή, -όν. Our ( =  ἡμέτερος) Il. 7.414, Il. 8.178, Il. 10.448, Il. 13.96, Il. 16.830: Od. 11.166 = 481. (But the sense my (cf. ἡμέτερος 2) is always admissible, and in Il. 7.414, and perh. in Il. 8.178, is preferable.)

forms: In neut. ἄμοτον as adv., insatiably, continually, incessantly, without pause or intermission Il. 4.440, Il. 5.518, Il. 13.40, 80, Il. 19.300, Il. 22.36, Il. 23.567: Od. 7.83, Od. 17.520.
Nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. ἀμπείραντες.
defs: To transfix, spit Il. 2.426.
Rich in vines. Epithet of places Il. 2.561, Il. 3.184, Il. 9.152 = 294.
Passing through. With διά (cf. διαμπερές): διὰ δ' ἀ. ἰὸς κατέπηκτο Il. 11.377. Cf. Il. 17.309: Od. 21.422.

forms: To leap up, start up: ἐκ λόχου ἀμπήδησεν Il. 11.379.

defs: A diadem of metal worn over the forehead Il. 22.469.
(1) Together, all together, in or into a body or mass: θυνόντων ἀ. Il. 10.524. Cf. Il. 9.6, Il. 10.300, Il. 12.385, Il. 13.336, 343, Od. 3.114, 158, 374, Il. 23.217: Od. 4.659, Od. 12.413.
(2) Together, at the same time: ἀ. βρόντησε καὶ ἔμβαλε κεραυνόν Od. 12.415 = Od. 14.305. Cf. Od. 5.467.

(1) An epithet of persons of general commendation, noble, illustrious, goodly, or the like: μάντις Il. 1.92, Αἰθιοπῆας 423. Cf. Il. 2.674, Il. 5.247, Il. 7.155, Il. 11.835, Od. 3.236, etc.: Αἰγίσθοιο (app. as a merely conventional epithet) Od. 1.29, Ὀδυσῆος Od. 2.225. Cf. Od. 4.187, Od. 6.29, Od. 8.117, Od. 19.332, Od. 8.325, etc. Of women: ἄκοιτιν Il. 7.374. Cf. Od. 4.4, Od. 6.303, Od. 13.42, Od. 15.15, etc. Of a nymph Il. 14.444. Of a horse Il. 16.152.

(2) Sim. of things or abstractions, indicating excellence or perfection: πομπῇ Il. 7.171, ἔργα Il. 9.128, τόξῳ Il. 15.463. Cf. Il. 9.270, Il. 10.19, Il. 13.637, Il. 16.119, Il. 19.245, Il. 23.263: οἶκος Od. 1.232, μῆτις Od. 9.414. Cf. Od. 10.50, Od. 12.261, Od. 14.508, Od. 16.237, Od. 22.442 = 459, Od. 23.145, Od. 24.80, 278.
(3) Absol. in neut. pl.: δς ἂν ἀμύμονα εἰδῇ (is of noble heart) (see εἴδω III.12) Od. 19.332.

forms: 3 sing. impf. ἄμυνε Il. 13.678, Il. 14.71, Il. 15.731.
Aor. opt. mid. ἀμυναίμην Od. 2.62, Od. 12.114. (ἀπ-, ἐπ-, προσ-.)
defs: (1) To ward off, keep off, avert: λοιγόν Il. 5.603, 662, Il. 18.450, Od. 3.98. Il. 24.489. Cf. Il. 7.463, Il. 9.599, Il. 13.783, Il. 15.375, Il. 17.615: ἀρήν Od. 2.59 = Od. 17.538, Od. 22.208, μνηστῆρας Od. 24.380. To defend oneself against, fight with: δήϊον ἄνδρα Il. 22.84. With dat. of person or thing protected: ἡμῖν λοιγόν Il. 1.67. Cf. Il. 1.341, 398, 456, Il. 4.129, Il. 9.435, 495, Il. 11.277, 588, Il. 12.334, Il. 13.426, Il. 15.736, Il. 16.32, 512, 835, Il. 17.511, Il. 18.129, Od. 3.124: ἄστεϊ νηλεὲς ἦμαρ Od. 8.525. With genit. : κῆρας παιδός Il. 12.402. Cf. Il. 4.11, Il. 15.731, Il. 16.75, 80.

(2) To defend, protect, succour, fight for, come to the rescue of. With dat.: ὤρεσσιν Il. 5.486, σοῖσιν ἔτῃσιν Il. 7.262. Cf. Il. 9.518, 602, Il. 11.674, Il. 13.464, 481, Il. 14.71, 362, 369, Il. 15.73, 255, 492  (supplying αὐτοῖς), 688, Il. 16.265, Il. 17.273, 563, 703, Il. 21.215, 231, 414: Ἀργείοισιν Od. 11.500, 518. Cf. Od. 16.257, Od. 21.195, 197, Od. 22.214. With genit.: οὗ παιδός Il. 16.522. Cf. Il. 13.109.
(3) Absol. to play the defender, fight, show fight: ἐξελθεῖν καὶ ἀμῦναι Il. 9.576. Cf. Il. 13.312, 678, 814, Il. 17.182: οὐ τοῖοι ἀμυνέμεν Od. 2.60.
(4) In mid.
(b) To defend, protect, fight for. With genit.: καλυδῶνος Il. 9.531. Cf. Il. 12.155, 179, Il. 16.561. With ablative: ναῦθιν Il. 13.700.

(c) Absol., to play the defender, fight: περὶ νηῶν Il. 12.142. Cf. Il. 12.227, 243, Il. 15.496, Il. 16.556, 622, Il. 18.173, Il. 24.500: ἧός μοι ἀμύνεσθαι πάρʼ ὀϊστοί Od. 22.106. Cf. Od. 2.62, Od. 22.116.
To tear, lacerate: χερσὶ στήθεα Il. 19.284. Fig.: θυμόν Il. 1.243.
(1) To welcome (with suppressed notion of embracing) Od. 14.381.
(2) To show love to, treat with affection. In mid. Il. 16.192.
In mid., to come together or gather round. With acc.: θεαί μιν ἀμφαγέροντο Il. 18.37.
Openly, without concealment: μὴ ἀ. ἔργα γένοιτο (disclosure should take place) Od. 19.391.
(1) Open, public: γάμον Od. 7.288.
(2) Adv. of acc. fem. form ἀμφαδίην = ἀμφαδά. Il. 6.196, Il. 13.356: Od. 5.120.

forms: Openly, without concealment or subterfuge: βαλέειν Il. 6.243, ἀγορευέμεν Il. 9.370: ἠὲ δόλῳ ἢ ἀ. Od. 1.296, Od. 11.120, ἢ ἀ. ἦε κρυφηδόν Od. 14.330 = Od. 19.299.
To rattle or ring about one: τεύχεʼ ἀμφαράβησεν Il. 21.408.
Speechlessness: ἀ. μιν λάβεν Il. 17.695: = Od. 4.704.

defs: (1) To put the hands round, handle. In mid.: [ὅρμον] ἀμφαφόωντο Od. 15.462. Cf. Od. 19.475. So μαλακώτερος ἀμφαφάασθαι (easier to deal with) Il. 22.373. To handle and use: τόξον Od. 19.586. In mid. Od. 8.215.
(2) To put the hands on in passing round: κοῖλον λόχον (the wooden horse) Od. 4.277.
(3) Absol., to feel about with the hands Od. 8.196.
To come round, be diffused round. With acc. : ἀϋτή με Od. 7.122, ἀϋτμή με Od. 12.369.
Covering on both sides: θαρέτρην (i.e. enclosing (the arrows)) Il. 1.45.
Disputed on both sides. In neut. qualifying a vague notion the state of things; hence, a dead heat: ἀμφήριστόν κʼ ἔθηκεν Il. 23.382, 527.
(I) Adv.
(II) Prep. (sometimes (without anastrophe) following the case).

forms: Epithet of Ithaca Od. 1.386, 395, 401, Od. 2.293, Od. 8.252.
Acc. fem. pf. pple. without redup. ἀμφιαχυῖαν (ἀμφι-ϝακυῖαν).
defs: Of a bird, to cry (flying) about: τὴν λάβεν ἀμφιαχυῖαν Il. 2.316.

forms: 3 sing. plupf. ἀμφιβεβήκει Il. 8.68, Il. 16.777: Od. 9.198.
defs: (1) To be round, cover completely, a double (organ) (cf. ἀμφί I.1.b). With acc.: πόνος (ἄχος) φρένας ἀμφιβέβηκεν Il. 6.355: Od. 8.541.
(2) To come round, surround. With dat.: Τρώων νέφος νηυσίν Il. 16.66.
(3) To be round, envelop, cover up. With acc. Od. 12.74.

(4) To have the feet on each side of, bestride (cf. βαίνω I.6.a). With acc. Fig.: ἠέλιος μέσον οὐρανόν (thought of as standing with both feet in the midst of heaven) Il. 8.68, Il. 16.777: Od. 4.400. Hence to protect (a place) as a tutelary power Il. 1.37 = 451: Od. 9.198.

forms: Aor. pple. ἀμφιβαλών, -όντος Il. 17.742, Il. 23.97: Od. 17.344, Od. 23.192.
defs: (1) To put round something: [χεῖρας] Od. 17.344. To throw the arms round. With acc.: ἀλλήλους Il. 23.97. To put building materials round. With dat.: θάμνῳ Od. 23.192.
(2) Fig., to throw or put (strength) on both sides of something, apply (strength) vigorously: μένοσἀμφιβαλόντες Il. 17.742.
(3) In mid., to throw (a garment) round oneself Od. 7.178. To put on a piece of armour Od. 22.103.
Defence of a fallen body (cf. ἀμφιβαίνω 4): Τρώων (by the . . .) Il. 5.623.
Protecting on both sides (as well as in front). Epithet of shields Il. 2.389, Il. 11.32, Il. 12.402, Od. 3.281.

etym: [prob. ἀμφι- 2 + γυ-, to bend, as in γύαλον, γυρός.]
defs: Thus, having a crooked limb on each side. Epithet or a name of Hephaestus Il. 1.607, Il. 14.239, Il. 18.383, 393 = 462, 587, 590, 614: Od. 8.300, 349, 357.

forms: Thus, of spears, (having a head) curved on each side, i.e. leafshaped; or perh., bending to either side, elastic Il. 13.147 = Il. 15.278  =  Il. 17.731, Il. 14.26  =  Il. 16.637, Il. 15.386, 712: Od. 16.474, Od. 24.527.

defs: To burn or blaze all round. With acc. Fig.: ἀϋτὴ ἄστυ ἀμφιδέδηε Il. 7.329.
Covered with hair: αἰγίδα Il. 15.309.

To set round in circles, i.e. in strips running round: ᾧ πέρι χεῦμα κασσιτέροιο ἀμφιδεδίνηται Il. 23.562 (the strips on the front plate being app. continued on the back plate and carried round to the front again): κολεὸν ἐλέθαντος ἀμφιδεδίνηται (is surrounded by (a succession of) ivory rings) Od. 8.405.
Having both cheeks torn in mourning: ἄλοχος Il. 2.700.

forms: Both torn in mourning: παρειαί Il. 11.393.

defs: Twofold, double: λιμένες Od. 4.847.
(1) To put (garments) on a person Od. 5.167, 264, Od. 15.369, Od. 18.361.
(2) In mid., to put (garments) on oneself Od. 23.131, 142.

forms: With elision of the ι. (on the loss of the .σ)
3 sing. impf. ἄμθεπε Il. 17.124, Il. 18.348: Od. 8.437.
defs: (1) To handle, attend to, do what is needful to: ἵππους Il. 19.392. Cf. Il. 5.667, Il. 18.559, Il. 23.167, Il. 24.622.
(2) To marshal, draw up in order Il. 2.525.
(3) To manage, conduct: τάθον Il. 24.804.
(4) In sinister sense, to employ oneself about for evil, work for the destruction of, [Τρῶας] Od. 3.118.
(5) Of fire, to bring itself to bear upon, lap round: πρύμνην Il. 16.124. Cf. Il. 18.348: = Od. 8.437.

forms: To settle about, be deposited upon.
Absol., one who has both parents alive Il. 22.496.
3 sing. subj. ἀμφικαλύψῃ Od. 8.511, Od. 13.183, Od. 20.86.
defs: (1) To cover both of one's . . . (cf. ἀμφί I.1
(b) ). Of sleep: βλέθαρʼ ἀμφικαλύψας Od. 5.493. Cf. Od. 20.86, Od. 23.17. To cover completely a double (organ) (cf. ἀμφί I 1.b): ἔρως φρένας ἀμφεκάλυψεν Il. 3.442, Il. 14.294.

(2) To cover up all round, enfold, conceal, contain Il. 2.262, Il. 23.91. Of a city, to receive withing its walls Od. 8.511. Of a house, to receive as a guest  Od. 4.618 = Od. 15.118. Fig. of death or fate Il. 5.68, Il. 12.116, Il. 16.350, Od. 3.417: Od. 4.180.

(3) To put round, cover or protect with. With dat. of what is covered or protected: σἀκος οἱ Il. 8.331 = Il. 13.420. Cf. Il. 14.343: Od. 14.349. Sim., to put round (something) so as to isolate (it): ὄρος πόλει Od. 8.569, Od. 13.152, 158, 177, 183.
To split off all round (something). With acc.: τὸ μέλαν δρυὸς ἀμφικεάσσας (splitting off (the outside wood) all round the dark heart) Od. 14.12.
With foliage all round, thick-leafed: θάμνῳ Il. 17.677.

etym: [ἀμφι- 1 (giving the notion of hesitation between two sides, hence of doubtfulness) + *λύκη = L. lux.]

defs: To carry the hands all round or over (the surface of), wipe all round or over: τραπέζας Od. 20.152.
(1) With acc., in local sense, to fight round or about: ̓́ιλιον Il. 7.461. Cf. Il. 9.412, Il. 16.73, Il. 18.208.
(2) With genit., to fight for the possession of: τείχεος Il. 15.391. Cf. Il. 16.496 = 533, Il. 18.20.
To resound or echo all round Od. 10.227.

forms: In mid., to have one's lot, dwell, round or about.

defs: To smooth all round: κορμόν Od. 23.196.

forms: To busy oneself about, attend to Il. 13.656, Il. 19.278.
To treat surgically Il. 4.220, Il. 16.28: Od. 19.455.
In sinister sense: ʼαστεροπαῖον ἐγχέλυες ἀμφεπένοντο (made a meal of him) Il. 21.203. Cf. Il. 23.184.
With dat. Fig., in pass., to be put round as a crown, adorn: οὔ οἱ χάρις ἀμφιπεριστέθεται ἐπέεσσιν Od. 8.175.
To turn about in all directions: ἵππους Il. 8.348.

defs: To fall (with the arms) round, embrace. With acc.: πόσιν Od. 8.523.

To busy oneself about, take care of, tend: ἐμὸν βίον Od. 18.254 = Od. 19.127, ὄρχατον Od. 24.244, 257. In sinister sense: ἔδοσαν ἐρινύσιν ἀμφιπολεύειν (i.e. handed them over to their tender mercies) Od. 20.78.

A handmaid, a female attendant or servant, hardly to be distinguished from δμῳή. (The words are sometimes used indifferently; cf. Od. 7.52 with 307, and 84 with 99. But in Od. 22.483, 484 ἀμφίπολοι seem to be personal attendants and δμῳαί the other servants.) Il. 3.143, 422, Il. 7.286, 324, 372, 399, 491, 499, Il. 18.417 (i.e. representations), Il. 22.442, 461, Il. 24.304: Od. 1.136, Od. 7.18, Od. 6.232, Od. 18.198, Od. 19.90, Od. 23.227, etc. Of Circe's servants Od. 10.348, 368, Od. 12.18. With γυνή. See γυνή 3. With word indicating the servant's country of origin: σικελή Od. 24.366. Her office: ταμίην Il. 24.302: Od. 16.152.

forms: To busy oneself about, attend to: τάθον Od. 20.307.
To do the offices of a second to: εὐρύαλον Il. 23.681.
To fly round and round Il. 2.315.

defs: Flowed round (by the sea), sea-girt Od. 1.50, 198, Od. 11.325, Od. 12.283.
(I) Adv.
(II) Prep.

forms: In aor. and mid., to stand round or about Il. 18.233, Il. 23.695, Il. 24.712.

defs: To be established round, besiege. With acc.: θρυόεσσαν Il. 11.713.
Thus, twisted about: κεθαλαὶ τρεῖς δράκοντος ἀμφιστρεθέες Il. 11.40 (i.e. two twisted about the third).

forms: Aor. fem. pple. pass. ἀμφιτεθεῖσα Il. 10.271.
defs: (1) To put round or about something Il. 10.271.
(2) In mid., to put on, arm oneself with: ξίθος Od. 8.431 (i.e. the belt rested on both shoulders).
With two θάλοι: κυνέην Il. 5.743 = Il. 11.41.
A two-handled jar Il. 23.92, 170: Od. 2.290, 349, 379, Od. 9.164, 204, Od. 13.105 (of natural formations in a cave), Od. 24.74.
To gape round. With acc.: ἐμὲ κήρ (gaped for me) Il. 23.79.

forms: 3 sing. aor. pass. ἀμφέχυτο Il. 2.41. ἀμφθεχύθη Od. 4.716.
defs: (1) To pour or shed round or about. Of dust: πάρος κόνιν ἀμφιχυθῆναι (had settled down again) Il. 23.764.

(2) Fig., in pass., of sound, to come round. With acc.: ἀμφέχυτό μιν ὀμθή Il. 2.41. Of sleep, to be shed round one, come upon one Il. 14.253 Il. 23.63. Of grief, to come upon. With acc.: τη̣̣ αχος ἀμφεχύθη Od. 4.716. So of a bodily action, to embrace (a person): ἀμφιχυθεὶς πατέρα Od. 16.214. Cf. Od. 22.498.
Poured round or about; hence of heaped-up earth: τεῖχος Od. 3.145.
(1) Both.
(b) In pl. of two groups of persons.

(2) In neut. ἀμφότερον as adv., both. Followed by . . . τε . . . τε Il. 3.179, Il. 4.145. By . . . τε καὶ . . . Il. 4.60 = Il. 18.365, Il. 13.166. By . . . τε . . . δὲ . . . Il. 6.418. By καὶ Od. 14.505. By . . . τε καὶ . . . καὶ . . . Od. 15.78.
(1) From both sides: ὦρτ' ἀϋτὴ ἀ. Il. 15.313. Cf. Il. 12.431. Of plainting strands of a rope, across and across Od. 10.167.

(2) On both sides, on either side: πλῆμναί εἰσιν ἀ. Il. 5.726. Cf. Il. 12.55, Il. 16.563, Il. 17.440, Od. 3.170, Il. 23.628: Od. 22.404. On both edges: ἀ. ἀκαχμένον Od. 5.235, Od. 22.80. At both ends: ἅψας ἀ. Od. 8.408. Of stating alternatives: ἐρέω ἀ. Od. 12.58.
(3) In both directions: θόως γένετ' ἀ. Il. 15.669. With περί, app., in both directions so as to meet: περὶ ἕρκος ἐλήλαται ἀ. Od. 6.113. Cf. Od. 10.88.
In both directions: γεγωνέμεν ἀ. Il. 8.223 = Il. 11.6, ἀ. λίθοι πωτῶντο Il. 12.287.

forms: App., by the middle: ἀ. ἀείρας Od. 17.237.

defs: To remark, notice: οὐλήν Od. 19.391.

forms: Only in nom. and acc. of same form. Both. Constructed with dual or pl.
defs: (1) Of two persons, etc.
(2) Of two groups of persons: ἀριθμηθήμεναι ἀ. Il. 2.124.
Having two ears (for handles) : ἄλεισον Od. 22.10.
Not to be blamed; hence, unerring (in counsel): πουλυδάμαντος Il. 12.109.

forms: Conditional or limiting particle. (Cf. κεν.) For the uses with subj., opt. and fut., aor. and impf. indic. in protasis and apodosis see 6.
defs: (1) With subj.: τάχ' ἂν θυμὸν ὀλέσσῃ Il. 1.205. Cf. Il. 18.192, Il. 22.505: ἐγὼ ἂν ξεῖνος ἔω Od. 9.17. Cf. Od. 4.240, Od. 11.328, 517, Od. 12.81. In Il. 22.50 (ἀπολυσόμεθα) : Od. 4.240, Od. 11.328, 517 (μυθήσομαι), Od. 7.221 (λοέσσομαι) may be aor. subj. or fut. indic.

(2) With opt. in potential or fut. sense: τῶν οὐκ ἄν τι θέροις Il. 1.301. Cf. Il. 2.250 (conveying an order), Il. 3.52 (will you not . . .?), 66, Il. 5.32, 362, Il. 7.141, Il. 9.77, Il. 10.204, Il. 13.741, Il. 14.58, Il. 22.108, Il. 24.437, etc.: πῶς ἂν Ὀδυσῆος λαθοίμην; Od. 1.65. Cf. Od. 3.232, Od. 4.78, Od. 7.57, 300, Od. 10.573, Od. 20.135 (do not . . .), Od. 22.325, etc.
(3) In potential sense in reference to the past in suppositions contrary to fact.
(b) With pres. or aor. opt.: ἦ ἄν ὕστατα λωβήσαιο Il. 1.232 = Il. 2.242. Cf. Il. 1.271, Il. 4.223, Il. 5.85 Il. 13.127: οὐκ ἄν ὀχλίσσειαν Od. 9.241.
(4) With infin. in indirect discourse: καὶ δ' ἂν τοῖς ἄλλοισιν ἔθη παραμυθήσασθαι Il. 9.684.
(5) Joined with κεν. See κεν 5.

(6) For uses in protasis with εἰ and in the corresponding relative sentences see Table at end II.B.a  3 subj., (D) (7) subj., (23) opt., III.B.a  3 subj., (D) (11) fut., (34) (35) (36) (37) (38) (43) (44) subj., (49) (65) opt. For uses in apodosis see II.C.a  3 aor. or impf. indic., (6) opt., c.2 opt., (D) (6) opt., (23) fut., (30) opt., (52) subj., (57) (63) opt. For ὅτʼ ἄν (not in protasis) see ὅτε 1.a.γ, b.α b.δ b.ε, 4. For ὄφρʼ ἅν (not in protasis) see ὄφρα 1.b, ὄφρα 1.c, 5.a
(b) . For ὡς ἄν (not in protasis) see ὡς 7.a, b.β, 8.α 8.γ, b.γ.

forms: Also in form ἄν and in assimilated form ἄμ.
defs: (I) Adv.
(II) Prep.

forms: Up ! get up ! rouse yourself ! to work ! ἀλλʼ ἄνα Il. 7.331, Il. 9.247, Il. 18.178: Od. 18.13.

defs: (A) Contr. 1 pl. subj. ἀμβαίνωμεν Od. 15.219. Contr. infin. ἀμβαίνειν Od. 9.178, Od. 11.637, etc. 3 sing. aor. ἀνέβη Il. 1.497. 3 sing subj. ἀναβῇ Od. 2.358. 3 sing. opt. ἀναβαίη Od. 22.132. Contr. ἀμβαίη Od. 12.77. Pple. ἀναβάς, -άντος Il. 1.312, 611, Il. 14.287, Il. 16.184, etc.: Od. 3.157, Od. 5.470, Od. 14.353, Od. 15.474, etc. Fem. ἀναβᾶσα Od. 1.362, Od. 17.49, Od. 22.428, etc. Infin. ἀναβήμεναι Od. 1.210. 3 sing. aor. mid. ἀνεβήσετο Od. 23.1.
(B) Aor. pple. pl. mid. ἀναβησάμενοι Od. 15.475.
(I) Intrans. in all forms except (B).
(II) Trans. in form (B), to cause to go on board a ship or embark: νὼ ἀναβησάμενοι Od. 15.475.

forms: Contr. 1 pl. subj. mid. ἀμβαλλώμεθα Il. 2.436.
defs: (1) To put off, delay: ἄεθλον Od. 19.584. In mid.: ἔργον Il. 2.436.
(2) In mid., to strike up, begin (to sing) (cf. βάλλω II.4 and ἀμβλήδην̓: ἀνεβάλλετʼ ἀείδειν Od. 1.155, Od. 8.266.
(1) Delay: λύσιος νεκροῖο (in . . .) Il. 24.655.
(2) Respite: κακοῦ (from . . .) Il. 2.380.
To clash or rattle loudly: τεύχεα Il. 19.13. Of a door, to creak or grate loudly Od. 21.48.
To wet or moisten abundantly Il. 17.54.

forms: Neut. aor. pple. pass. ἀναβροχέν Od. 11.586.
defs: To swallow down, swallow Od. 11.586, Od. 12.240.

forms: Genit. sing. masc. pple. ἀναγνόντος Od. 24.346.
Dat. sing. fem. ἀναγνούσῃ Od. 19.250, Od. 23.206.
defs: (1) To know again, recognize Od. 4.250, Od. 11.144, Od. 19.250  =  Od. 23.206, Od. 24.346.
(2) To know well, know certainly: [νόον ἐσθλόν] Il. 13.734 (i.e. best knows its value; cf. Od. 7.185). Cf. Od. 1.216, Od. 21.205.

forms: Instrumental ἀναγκαίηφι Od. 3.143. = ἀνάγκη Il. 7.85: Od. 19.73.
In instrumental, by the application of force or strength: δαμέντας Od. 3.143.

defs: (1) Compelled, acting under compulsion: πολεμισταί Od. 24.499. Sim. of slaves Od. 24.210.
(2) Imposing compulsion: ἦμαρ ἀναγκαῖον (see ἦμαρ 4.b) Il. 16.836, μύθῳ Od. 17.399 = Od. 20.344.–χρειοῖ ἀναγκαίῃ, by compelling necessity, under the compulsion of necessityIl. 8.57.
(1) Necessity, compulsion: ἐπικείσετʼ ἀ. Il. 7.458. Cf. Il. 5.633, Il. 10.418, Od. 3.251, Il. 24.667: Od. 10.273.–ὑπʼ ἀνάγκης, under compulsionOd. 2.110 = Od. 24.146, Od. 19.156.
(2) In dat. ἀνάγκῃ.
(b) Under compulsion of circumstances, of necessity, perforce: φεύγοντας Il. 11.150. Cf. Il. 12.178, Il. 14.128, Il. 15.133, etc.: ἄγρην ἐφέπεσκον Od. 12.330. Cf. Od. 13.307, Od. 15.311.

forms: 3 sing. aor. pass. ἀνεγνάμφθη Il. 3.348, Il. 6.259, Il. 17.44.
defs: (1) To bend back: ἀνεγνάμφθη αἰχμή Il. 3.348 = Il. 6.259 = Il. 17.44.
(2) To unloose Od. 14.348.
(1) To cause to go or take inland Od. 14.272 = Od. 17.441.
(2) Of bringing to Troy Il. 3.48, Il. 7.292, Il. 9.338, Il. 13.627. To Argos Il. 15.29. Of taking from Ithaca to the mainland Od. 18.115.
(3) Of bringing gifts to temples Il. 8.203.
(4) Of conducting to a house: ὅνδε δόμονδε Od. 3.272. Without complementary words Od. 4.534.
(5) To  bring up to the mark in a contest Od. 18.89.
(6) In mid., to put to sea, sail Il. 1.478: Od. 19.202.
To look up Il. 14.436.
A woman's head-dress, app. in the form of a plaited band Il. 22.469.
(1) To receive, catch: σάκος πολλὰ [δούρατα] Il. 5.619.
(2) To receive as one's portion Od. 17.563.
(1) To rise up or emerge from out of. With genit.: ἁλός Il. 1.359. Cf. Od. 5.337. So with acc.: κῦμα Il. 1.496. Absol., to come to the surface Od. 5.322.
(2) To go back, retire Il. 6.217. To withdraw from: πόλεμον Il. 13.225. Absol., to draw back, flinch Od. 9.377.

etym: [app. for ἀνέϝεδνος fr. ἀν- 1 + ἔϝεδνα. See ἕδνα, ἔεδνα.]
defs: Without bride-price Il. 9.146, 288, Il. 13.366.
(1) To lift up, raise Od. 8.298. Of a wrestler hoisting his adversary Il. 23.724, 725, 729.
(2) To take up, pick up Il. 23.614, 778.
An accompaniment or accessory: δαιτός Od. 1.152, Od. 21.430.

forms: To leap or bound up. Of a stone: ἀναθρῴσκων πέτεται Il. 13.140.

defs: (1) Shamelessness, effrontery Il. 1.149, Il. 9.372.
(2) Immodesty, unchastity Od. 22.424.
(1) Careless of the good opinion of others, lost to all sense of decency, shameless, reckless Od. 1.254, Od. 13.376, Od. 17.449, Od. 20.29, 39, 386, Od. 23.37. Absol. Il. 1.158.

(2) Of a stone or rock, reckless, careless of what mischief or trouble may ensue Il. 4.521. Cf. Il. 13.139 (as if the rock lent itself to the discharge of the stone): Od. 11.598. Of κυδοιμός figured as a symbol: ἀναιδέα δηϊοτῆτος (app., shamelessly insatiate of . . .) Il. 5.593.

forms: Infin. ἀνήνασθαι Il. 6.93: Od. 4.651, Od. 14.239, Od. 18.287. (ἀπ-.)
defs: (1) To refuse: δόσιν (i.e. to give it) Od. 4.651, Od. 18.287. To refuse to do something. With infin.: λοιγὸν ἀμῦναι Il. 18.450. Cf. Il. 18.500, Il. 23.204. Absol. Il. 6.93, Il. 9.510, 585, Il. 11.647: Od. 10.18, Od. 14.239.
(2) To reject, spurn Il. 9.679. So in reference to a course proposed: ἔργον ἀεικές Od. 3.265. To refuse to have to do with (a person) Od. 8.212.
(3) To refuse to entertain an idea; hence, to deny: ἀασάμην, οὐδʼ ἀναίνομαι Il. 9.116. To refuse to entertain expectation Od. 14.149.

forms: Aor. pple. ἀνελών, -όντος Il. 1.301, Il. 23.551, 736: Od. 3.453, Od. 18.16.
Mid. Fut. infin. ἀναιρήσεσθαι Od. 21.261, Od. 22.9.
defs: (1) To take or pick up Il. 23.551: Od. 18.16.
(2) To take up into the hands or arms. In mid.: οὐλοχύτας ἀνέλοντο Il. 1.449, Il. 2.410. Cf. Il. 16.8, 10.

(3) To take up and, or in order to, carry off or appropriate: τῶν οὐκ ἄν τι φέροις ἀνελών Il. 1.301. In mid.: [πελέκεας] Od. 21.261. To take up and carry off (prizes) Il. 23.736. In mid. Il. 23.823. To seize and carry off. In mid.: ὅτε κούρας ἀνέλοντο Od. 20.66.
(4) To lift up or raise: ἀπὸ χθονός (i.e. the victim's head) Od. 3.453. In mid.: ἄλεισον ἀναιρήσεσθαι Od. 22.9.

(5) In mid., to take for one's use: ἀνείλετʼ ἔγχος Il. 13.296. To take into service Od. 18.357. To take upon oneself, undertake: πατρὸς ἀέθλια Od. 21.117. To take into one's mind: ἐπιφροσύνας Od. 19.22.

forms: Pple. ἀναΐξας, -αντος Il. 1.584, Il. 15.6, Il. 23.733, etc.: Od. 1.410, Od. 8.186, Od. 21.300, etc.
defs: (1) To start, spring or dart up, rise quickly or suddenly: πάντες ἀνήϊξαν Il. 15.86, Il. 23.203. Cf. Il. 1.584, Il. 4.114, Il. 6.106, Il. 15.6, Il. 23.733, Il. 24.621: ἀναΐξας οἴχεται Od. 1.410. Cf. Od. 8.186, 361, Od. 9.288, Od. 13.197, Od. 18.40, Od. 19.31, Od. 21.119, 300, Od. 22.240, Od. 24.50, 463.
(2) To rush or spring on to. With acc.: ἅρμα Il. 24.440.
(3) Of springs, to gush forth Il. 22.148.
(4) To rise to speak Il. 3.216 (the notion of quickness not here to be pressed).
Not blameworthy, blameless Od. 3.297: Od. 20.135, Od. 22.356. Absol. Il. 11.654, Il. 13.775.

forms: To gush up, ooze forth: αἷμα Il. 6.262, ἱδρώς Il. 13.705, Il. 23.507.

defs: (1) To push back, open (a door) Od. 22.156. To remove (something covering): νέφος Il. 5.751 = Il. 8.395. App. (perh. in imitation of these lines), to suspend or delay the action of (an ambush): ἀνακλῖναι λόχον Od. 11.525.
(2) To cause to lean (against something): ποτὶ ἑρκίον αὐλῆς Od. 18.103. To place or rest in a specified position Il. 4.113.
(3) In aor. pple. pass., leaning or bending back Od. 9.371. Reclining Od. 4.794 = Od. 18.189. Of rowers swinging back to their work Od. 13.78.
To lift up one's voice, speak Od. 14.467.
Of a king or chief Od. 15.397.

etym: [app. ἀνα- 6 + *κυμβαλιάζω in sim. sense fr. κύμβαλον, cymbal.]
forms: Thus, of chariots, to rattle (in upsetting) Il. 16.379.

defs: Lack of spirit, cowardice. In pl. Il. 7.74 = Il. 17.320, Il. 17.337.

forms: Acc. masc. ἄναλκιν Od. 3.375. Incapable of offering defence or resistance, spiritless, cowardly Il. 2.201, Il. 5.331, 349, Il. 8.153, Il. 11.390, Il. 13.104, Il. 16.355, Il. 21.555, etc.: Od. 3.310, 375, Od. 4.334 = Od. 17.125, Od. 9.475.

etym: [prob. for ἄναλδτος fr. ἀν- 1 + ἀλδ-, ἀλδαίνω, ἀλδήσκω.]
defs: Thus, not to be filled out, insatiable, greedy: γαστέρα Od. 17.228, Od. 18.364. Absol. Od. 18.114.
(1) To loose, set free: ἐκ δεσμῶν (from . . .) Od. 12.200.

etym: [ἀνα- 6 + μάσσω, to handle, conn. with μαίομαι.]
defs: To wipe away the stain of (a crime) Od. 19.92.
To wait for, await: Ἠῶ Od. 19.342.

forms: To measure one's way again, retrace one's course.
With acc. of terminus ad quem: χάρυβδιν Od. 12.428.

defs: To remind (a person of a thing). With double acc. Od. 3.211.

forms: To wait for, await: ἀλλήλους Il. 11.171.
Absol., to stand one's ground Il. 16.363.
Contr. aor. pple. ἀμμείξας, ἀμμίξας Il. 24.529.
defs: (1) To mix up ingredients Il. 24.529.
(2) To mix up or mingle: σίτῳ φάρμακα (with . . .) Od. 10.235.
To seethe or boil up Od. 12.238.
(1) To throw up the chin in token of refusal (cf. κατανεύω) Il. 7.311 (app. the statue is supposed to move its head).
(2) With infin. of what is refused: σόον ἀπονέεσθαι Il. 16.252. With acc. ἕτερον Il. 16.250.
(3) To make the motion in prohibition Il. 22.205: Od. 21.129.

etym: [app. a nonce-word formed fr. ἀνά by adding a termination fr. ἔναντα, ἐσάντα.]

forms: Voc. (besides ἄναξ) ἄνα Il. 3.351, Il. 16.233: Od. 17.354.
defs:
(1) A king (the main notion being app. that of a protecting chief rather than that of a ruler; cf. the name Ἀστυάναξ Il. 7.403, and the reason for it there given. But βουληφόρος
              ἀ. occurs Il. 12.414).

(b) ἀ. applied to Priam Il. 2.373, Il. 4.18, Il. 7.451, etc.: Od. 3.107. To Idomeneus Il. 2.405, Il. 10.112, Il. 15.301: Od. 19.181. To Philoctetes Il. 2.725. To Diomedes Il. 4.420, Il. 5.794. To Proetus Il. 7.166. To Achilles Il. 9.164, 276 = Il. 19.177, Il. 23.35, 173, Il. 24.449, 452. To Peleus Il. 9.480. To Asius Il. 12.139. To Sarpedon Il. 12.413, 414, Il. 16.464. To Helenus Il. 13.582, 758, 770, 781. To Nestor Il. 23.302: Od. 3.388. To Menelaus Il. 23.588. To Teucrus Il. 23.859. To Odysseus Od. 3.163, Od. 13.194, etc. To Teiresias Od. 11.144, 151. To Aias Od. 11.561. To Minos Od. 11.570. To minor heroes and personages Il. 2.566 = Il. 23.678, Il. 2.624, 672, 679, 693, Il. 6.8, 137, Il. 11.322, Il. 14.489, Il. 15.639: Od. 16.395 = Od. 18.413, Od. 18.299, Od. 19.523, Od. 24.305. Applied to kings or chiefs generally: ἅρματα ἀνάκτων Il. 2.777: ἀνάκτων παῖδες Od. 13.223. To the leader of a ship's company Od. 11.71. With a local word: πύλοιο Il. 2.77. Cf. Il. 7.173. Sim. τρώεσσιν Od. 3.230. Joined with βασιλεύς Od. 20.194.

(c) ἀ. applied to gods. To Apollo Il. 1.36, 75, 390, etc.: Od. 8.323, 334, 339. To Zeus Il. 1.502, 529, Il. 2.102, Il. 3.351, Il. 6.194, 200, Il. 16.233, Il. 18.118: Od. 17.354. To Hermes Il. 2.104. To Sleep Il. 14.233. To Poseidon Il. 15.8, 57, 158, Od. 3.67, 404: Od. 3.43, 54, Od. 9.412, 526, Od. 11.130, Od. 13.185, Od. 23.277. To Hephaestus Il. 15.214, Il. 18.137: Od. 8.270. To Hades Od. 3.61. To a river Od. 5.445, 450. To the sun Od. 12.176. To the gods generally Od. 12.290.

(2) A lord, master, owner: οὐδʼ ἠγνοίησαν ἄνακτα Il. 13.28, τί δόμεν πηλῆϊ ἄνακτι (to P. as your master) Il. 17.443. Cf. Il. 10.559, Il. 13.38, Il. 15.453, Il. 16.371, 507, Il. 18.417, 421, Il. 23.417 = 446, 517, Il. 24.734: οἴκοιο ἀ. Od. 1.397, οὔτε ἀ. οὔτε ποιμήν Od. 4.87. Cf. Od. 9.440, Od. 10.216, Od. 14.8, 139, 170, Od. 17.186, 320, etc.

forms: 3 sing. impf. ἀνέῳγε Il. 16.221, Il. 24.228. Cont. ἀνῷγε Il. 14.168.
defs: (1) To open (a door) Od. 10.389.
(2) To draw back (a bar in order to open a door) κληῗδα Il. 14.168, Il. 24.455.
(3) To remove (a cover) Il. 16.221, Il. 24.228.

forms: 3 sing. aor. pass. ἀνέπαλτο Il. 8.85, Il. 23.694.
defs: (1) To poise and sway (a spear before throwing) Il. 3.355 = Il. 5.280 = Il. 6.244 = Il. 11.349 = Il. 17.516 = Il. 22.273 = 289, Od. 3.438: Od. 24.519 = 522.
(2) In pass., to leap or spring up: ἀναπάλλεται ἰχθύς Il. 23.692. Cf. Il. 8.85, Il. 23.694.

forms: To cause to cease: ἔργων ἀνθρώπους ἀνέπαυσεν (from . . .) Il. 17.550.
Acc. fem. pf. pple. pass. ἀναπεπταμένας.
defs: To open wide (a gate) Il. 12.122.

forms: To fulfil (one's destiny), have full measure of (misery etc.): πότμον Il. 4.170, Il. 11.263. Cf. Il. 8.34 = 354 = 465, Il. 15.132: κήδεα Od. 5.207. Cf. Od. 5.302.
Fut. infin. in mid. form ἀναπλεύσεσθαι Il. 11.22.
defs: (1) To sail upwards. Of a voyage from Greece to Troy Il. 11.22.
(2) To sail through, traverse. With acc.: στεινωπόν Od. 12.234.

A breathing-space, a respite: ὀλίγη δέ τʼ ἀ. πολέμοιο (a little (space of time) serves as a respite from . . .) Il. 11.801 = Il. 16.43 = Il. 18.201 (ὀλίγη assimilated in gender to the predicate; cf. Il. 13.237 under ἀρετή 1).

forms: To breathe again, recover breath, draw breath, find a breathing-space or respite Il. 11.327, 800 = Il. 16.42 = Il. 18.200, Il. 16.111, 302, Il. 21.534, Il. 22.222.
With genit.: κακότητος (from . . .) Il. 11.382. Cf. Il. 15.235, Il. 19.227.

defs: In neut. ἀνάποινον as adv., without ransom Il. 1.99.
To cause (tears) to well up Il. 9.433: Od. 2.81.
(1) To fasten up (as an offering in a temple) Od. 3.274.
(2) To tie, make fast (a rope): πρυμνήσια Od. 9.137. Cf. Od. 12.51 = 162, 179.
(3) To fasten (blame) upon a person Od. 2.86.
Discovered, revealed. Absol. in neut. pl.: ἀνάπυστα θεοὶ θέσαν (caused discovery to be made) Od. 11.274.
(1) To snatch up and carry off Il. 9.564, Il. 16.437. Of winds Od. 4.515, Od. 5.419, Od. 8.409, Od. 20.63, Od. 23.316.
(2) To carry off as a slave Od. 15.427.
(1) To split, cause to open: γαῖαν Od. 3.63. To tear open, rend: βοείην Il. 18.582.
(2) To tear down, demolish Il. 6.461.

forms: 3 pl. aor. ἀνέρριψαν Od. 10.130. From ἀναρριπτέω
To throw up (the sea with the oar): ἅλα πηδῷ Od. 6.328, Od. 13.78.

etym: [ἀν- 1 + ἀρ-, ἀραρίσκω. Not fitted, ill-fitted, ill-assorted.]
forms: Unfriendly, hostile Il. 24.365: Od. 10.459, Od. 11.401, 408, Od. 24.111.

defs: In mid., to spirt up: αἷμα Il. 11.458.
To draw forth again: ἔγχος Il. 13.574.
Queen, protectress. Applied to Demeter Il. 14.326. In voc. addressed to Athene Od. 3.380. To Nausicaa Od. 7.149, 175.

forms: Aor. infin. mid. -ασθαι Od. 3.245 (in mid. only here).
defs: (1) To protect, be patron of. With genit.: τενέδοιο Il. 1.38 = 452.

(2) To be king, chief or ruler: μετὰ τριτάτοισιν Il. 1.252. Cf. Il. 4.61 = Il. 18.366, Il. 16.172, Il. 23.471: Od. 6.23, 62, Od. 19.110. In mid.: τρὶς ἀνάξασθαι γένεʼ ἀνδρῶν (app., during three generations) Od. 3.245. With local words: ἐν βουδείῳ Il. 16.572. Cf. Od. 11.276, 284, Od. 24.26.
(3) To be king or chief of or ruler over.
(4) In pass., to be ruled by, be under the sway of. With dat.: ἀνάσσονται ἐμοὶ αὐτῷ Od. 4.177.
(5) To be lord or master of, possess, enjoy.
Standing up: δειδέχατʼ ἀ. Il. 9.671, ἴδεσθʼ ἀ. Il. 23.469.

forms: To groan aloud over, lament, bewail Il. 23.211.
Contr. 3 pl. aor. opt. ἀνστρέψειαν Il. 23.436.
defs: (1) To upset: δίφρους Il. 23.436.
(2) In mid., to go about over, find oneself in. With acc.: ἄλλην τινὰ γαῖαν ἀναστρέφομαι Od. 13.326.

forms: To keep turning about: τόξον ἐνώμα ἀναστρωφῶν Od. 21.394.

defs: To cause to spring up or be produced: ἀμβροσίην Il. 5.777.
To lay (reproach) upon. With dat.: ἐλεγχείην μοι Il. 22.100.

forms: To withstand the operation of Od. 10.327.

defs: In mid., to fall supine Il. 7.64, Il. 14.447.
(1) To spirt up Il. 17.297.
(2) To run up, shoot up (like a quickly growing plant) Il. 18.56 = 437. Of weals, to start up Il. 23.717.
(3) To run, stretch, extend up: πέτρη Od. 5.412, Od. 10.4.
(4) To run back, retire Il. 11.354, Il. 16.813.

forms: Absol.: ἷσος ἀναύδῳ (like a dumb man) Od. 10.378.

defs: (1) To reveal, make known Il. 1.87. To betray, denounce Od. 4.254. To display: ἐπεσβολίας Od. 4.159. To make a display of: ἀρετήν Od. 3.411.
(2) To afford light Od. 18.310.
(3) In pass., to appear, be seen: οἷος ἀναφαίνεται ἀστήρ Il. 11.62. Cf. Od. 10.29. Of destruction, to be manifested, come upon one Il. 11.174, Il. 17.244.
Openly, without concealment: ἀ. φιλεῦντας Od. 3.221. Cf. Od. 3.222, Od. 11.455.

forms: = ἀναφανδά.: ἀ. ὄπυιεν (as her avowed husband) Il. 16.178.

defs: (1) To bring or fetch up Od. 11.625.
(2) In mid., to fetch a sigh Il. 19.314.

forms: Aor. pple. ἀναχασσάμενος, -η Il. 6.264, Il. 13.740, Il. 21.403: Od. 6.280, Od. 11.97.

defs: (1) To go back, return Il. 10.210 = 411, Il. 13.457.

(2) To withdraw, retire Od. 17.453, 461. To draw back from danger Il. 3.35. Of hounds retreating from a boar Il. 17.729. To draw back or retire in fight Il. 4.305, Il. 5.107, Il. 11.189, 440, Il. 17.30, Od. 3.196, 335: Od. 22.270.

forms: Fig.: ἐπεὶ ἀνέψυχθεν ἦτορ Il. 10.575. Cf. Il. 13.84.
To cool or soothe (a wound) Il. 5.795.
3 sing. aor. εὔαδε (ἔϝαδε) Il. 14.340, Il. 17.647: Od. 16.28. ἅδε (ϝάδε) Il. 12.80, Il. 13.748: Od. 24.465.
Acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. ἑαδότα (ϝεϝαδότἀ Il. 9.173: Od. 18.422. (ἀφ-, ἐπι-.)
defs: (1) To please, be pleasing or acceptable, find favour or acceptance Od. 5.153, Od. 17.173. With dat.: Ἕκτορι Il. 12.80 = Il. 13.748. Cf. Il. 3.173, Il. 14.340, Il. 18.510: Od. 2.114, Od. 3.150, Od. 8.506, Od. 14.337, 525, Od. 16.398, Od. 20.327, Od. 24.465.

(2) Impers. With dat.: ἐπεί τοι εὔαδεν οὕτως Il. 17.647. Cf. Il. 1.24 = 378, Il. 24.25: Od. 3.143, Od. 10.373. With dat. and infin.: Αἴαντι ἑστάμεν Il. 15.674. Cf. Od. 7.245. So ὥς τοι εὔαδε, . . . ἐσορᾶν . . . Od. 16.28.
(3) In pf. pple., pleasing, agreeable Il. 9.173: = Od. 18.422.
(1) In two, asunder: κεάσθη Il. 16.412 = Od. 3.387, Il. 16.578.
(2) In halves, equally: δάσασθαι Il. 18.511, Il. 22.120.
Spoils of a man, i.e. of a fallen foe Il. 14.509.
Each man, each Od. 13.14.
A slave Il. 6.475.
That is a load for a man, as heavy as a man can carry Od. 10.121.

etym: [prob. rather ἆδριφόντης, fr. ἀδρ-, ἀνδρ-, ἀνήρ + φον-, φένω. Cf. ἀνδροτής.]
defs: Slayer of men. Epithet of Enyalius Il. 2.651, Il. 6.166 = Il. 8.264  =  Il. 17.259.
Made by the hands of man, the work of men's hands Il. 11.371.
(1) Slaughter of men, slaughter in battle. In pl.: παύσασαι ἀνδροκτασιάων Il. 5.909. Cf. Il. 6.237, Il. 24.548: Od. 11.612. In concrete sense: ὕπαγʼ ἐξ ἀνδροκτασίης Il. 11.164.
(2) Homicide Il. 23.86.
Of man, human Il. 11.538 (the throng of men), Il. 17.571, Od. 3.100, Il. 21.70: Od. 9.297 (of man's flesh), 347, 374, Od. 22.19.

etym: [prob. rather ἆδροτής, fr. ἀδρ-, ἀνδρ-, ἀνήρ. Cf. ἀνδρειφόντης.]
defs: (2) Manliness Il. 24.6.
(1) Slayer of men. Epithet of Hector Il. 1.242, Il. 7.498, Il. 9.351, Il. 16.77, 840, Il. 17.428, 616, 638, Il. 18.149, Il. 24.509, 724. Of Ares Il. 4.441. Of Lycurgus Il. 7.134.
(2) Manslaying, fatal: χεῖρας Il. 18.317 = Il. 23.18, Il. 24.479. Of a poisonous application, deadly Od. 1.261.

forms: To wake up, cause to rise, rouse Il. 10.138, 157: Od. 4.730, Od. 10.172, Od. 23.16, 22.
To keep back, restrain: φάλαγγας Il. 3.77 = Il. 6.55, μάχην Τρώων Il. 17.752.
Pl. pple. ἀνέσαντες Il. 13.657. In the forms cited
defs: (1) To set or place upon something: ἐς δίφρον Il. 13.657. Sim.: εἰς εὐνήν Il. 14.209.
(2) To restore to one's place Od. 18.265.
(1) To go up Od. 10.146. Of the sun, to rise: ἠελίου ἀνιόντος Il. 8.538. Cf. Il. 18.136, Il. 22.135: Αἰθίοπες ἀνιόντος Ὑπερίονος (dwelling in the east) Od. 1.24. Cf. Od. 12.429, Od. 23.362.
(2) To go inland Od. 10.274, 446.
(3) To go up (to a person) as a suppliant: ἐς πατρὸς ἑταίρους Il. 22.492.
(1) To ask, inquire, make inquiry Il. 21.508: Od. 6.21, Od. 23.99.
(2) To inquire, about: τήνδε γαῖαν Od. 13.238.
(3) To question (a person): σε Od. 4.420. Cf. Od. 4.461, 631.
(4) With double acc.: ὅ μʼ ἀνείρεαι Il. 3.177: = Od. 6.243 = Od. 15.402, Od. 19.171. Cf. Od. 1.231 = Od. 15.390.
Bearable, endurable, to be endured Il. 1.573, Il. 10.118, Il. 11.610: Od. 20.83. Absol. in neut. pl.: οὐκέτʼ ἀνεκτὰ πέλονται (my case is now unendurable) Od. 20.223.

forms: In such wise as may be endured: μαίνεται οὐκέτʼ ἀ. Il. 8.355. Cf. Od. 9.350.

defs: (1) To draw up Il. 12.434.
(2) To draw back (i.e. away from one): τόξου πῆχυν Il. 11.375, Il. 13.583. To draw back (a spear in order to recover it). In mid. Od. 22.97. To bend a bow Od. 21.128, 150.
(1) A wind: ἐλθὼν ἀ. Il. 17.57. Cf. Il. 5.865: Od. 5.109, 368, Od. 12.313. With pl.: οἱ δʼ ἄνεμοι ἔβαν (they, the winds mentioned) Il. 23.229: τῶν ἄλλων ἀνέμων Od. 5.383.
(3) Joined with βορέης Il. 15.26: Od. 9.67, Od. 14.253, 299, Od. 19.200. With ζέφυρος Il. 16.150.
(4) In pl.
Protecting from the wind: χλαινάων Il. 16.224.
Of a wave, fed (i. e. raised) by the wind Il. 15.625. Of a spear, (made of wood) toughened by (the buffeting of) the wind Il. 11.256.
(1) Like the idle blowing of the wind, idle, vain: ταῦτʼ ἀνεμώλια βάζεις (what you say is idle) Il. 4.355.– Absol.: ἀνεμώλια βάζειν Od. 4.837 = Od. 11.464.
(2) Useless, idle: τόξα Il. 5.216. Cf. Il. 21.474. Useless, effecting nothing Od. 3.123.
(1) To go up Od. 10.97 = 148, 194. To go up (to a city): ἄστυδε Od. 19.190. –Of a plant, to shoot up Od. 7.163, 167.
(2) To come back, return Il. 4.392, Il. 7.187: Od. 1.317.
To question (a person): ἀνηρώτων μιν Od. 4.251.
Unworthy to have a home: ἀφρήτωρ ἀθέμιστος ἀ. Il. 9.63.
(1) Away from, aloof from: δηΐων Il. 13.556.
(2) Lacking: κέντροιο Il. 23.387. Cf. Od. 24.247. Without need of: δεσμοῖο Od. 13.100.
(3) Without the help of: ἕθεν Il. 17.407. Without the good will or permission of: ἐμέθεν Il. 15.213. Cf. Od. 2.372, Od. 15.531.
(1) Adv.
(b) Away, removed: πολλὸν ἀ. Il. 23.378. Cf. Od. 4.356, Od. 19.575.
(c) Apart, aside, aloof: ἀ. ἔθηκεν Il. 22.368. Cf. Il. 23.241, Il. 24.208: Od. 9.26, Od. 11.82.
(2) Prep. with genit.
(b) Away from: νῶϊν Il. 22.88.
(c) Apart or aloof from: ἄλλων Il. 22.39. Cf. Od. 10.554.
(d) Without, free from: πόνου Od. 6.192.
(e) Without the help of: ἐμεῖο Il. 16.89. Cf. Il. 16.239. Without the good will or permission of: θεοῦ Il. 5.185.
(f) App., in the background as regards, ready to take the place of: τοῖο ἀ. λελείμμην Il. 22.333.
To spring up against a person Od. 3.424.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἀνασχέμεν Il. 24.301. ἀνασχεῖν Il. 7.257.
defs: (I) In act.
(II) In mid.

etym: [the former app a nom. pl. masc. fr. an adj. ἄνεως. The latter (only in Od. 23.93 of a woman) app. to be taken as an adv. .]
defs: Silent: ἐγένεσθε Il. 2.323. Cf. Il. 3.84, Il. 9.30 = 695: ἧσθε Od. 2.240. Cf. Od. 6.144, Od. 10.71, Od. 23.93.
Not to be cured or soothed Il. 5.394. Not to be appeased Il. 15.217.
To fail to hearken to, disobey. With genit.: πατρός Il. 15.236 = Il. 16.676.
Not milked Od. 9.439.

etym: [3 sing., in the first passage of a plupf. (with secondary person-ending), in the second of a pf., fr. ἀνεθ- = ἀνθ-, ἄνθος. (Cf. ἐνήνοθε).]
defs: To come to the surface, come forth: αἷμʼ ἀ. Il. 11.266. To rise up, spread upwards: κνίση ἀ. Od. 17.270.
Not accomplished or brought to an end: ἔργῳ Od. 16.111.
Deprived of virility; or perh. merely, unmanly Od. 10.301, 341.

forms: Genit. ἀνέρος Il. 3.61, Il. 5.649, etc.: Od. 1.161, 218, etc.
Dat. ἀνέρι Il. 16.516, 716, etc.: Od. 1.292, Od. 2.223, etc.
Nom. pl. ἀνέρες Il. 2.1, 604, etc. : Od. 1.176, Od. 3.471, etc.
Dat. ἄνδρεσσι Il. 5.546, 874, etc.: Od. 1.358, Od. 10.120, etc.
Acc. ἀνέρας Il. 1.262, Il. 2.554, etc.: Od. 11.630, Od. 13.261, etc.
defs: (2) Specifically.

(c) A man as distigusihed from a god: Διὸς ἄγγελοι ἠδὲ καὶ ἀνδρῶν Il. 1.334. Cf. Il. 1.544, Il. 5.128, Il. 13.632, etc.: Ἀθήνη ἀνδρὶ ἐϊκυῖα Od. 8.194. Cf. Od. 1.28, Od. 13.112, Od. 16.265, etc. Sim. ἡμιθέων ἀνδρῶν Il. 12.22. With words indicative of mortality: βροτός Il. 5.361, Il. 18.85, etc.: Od. 4.397, Od. 5.129, etc.– θνητός Il. 10.403, Il. 16.441, etc.: Od. 10.306, Od. 16.196.– καταθνητός Il. 10.441.
(d) A man as distinguished from a youth: ἤδη ἀ. [ἐστιν] Od. 19.160. Cf. Od. 11.449.
(e) With words indicative of youthfulness, a youth: νέου ἀνδρός Il. 23.589. Cf. Il. 3.108: Od. 2.188, Od. 3.24, Od. 14.524, Od. 21.310, etc.
(f) A man in the full sense of the term: ἀνέρες ἔστε (quit you like men) Il. 5.529, Il. 7.112, Od. 8.174, Il. 15.561, etc.

etym: [No doubt for ἀνηρέψαντο, fr. ἀν-, ἀνα- 1 + ἁρεπ-  =  ἁρπ-, ἁρπάζω. Cf. ἅρπη, Ἅρπυια.]
defs: Thus, to snatch up: γανυμήδεα ἀ. θεοί Od. 3.234. Cf. Od. 1.241 = Od. 14.371, Od. 4.727, Od. 20.77.
(1) Unploughed, untilled Od. 9.123.
(2) Not growing as the result of tillage Od. 9.109.
(1) Flowery: λειμῶνι Il. 2.467. Cf. Il. 2.695: Od. 12.159.
(2) Adorned with flower-like ornaments Il. 23.885: Od. 3.440, Od. 24.275.

etym: [ἀνθέω. The part on which the beard grows.]

forms: App., the stalk of corn: ἐπʼ ἀνθερίκων καρπὸν θέον (the ears of the corn) Od. 3.227.

defs: Of hair on the face, to sprout, grow: πρὶν ἰούλους ἀνθῆσαι Od. 11.320.
The product of flowers, consisting of fruit: εἶδαρ Od. 9.84.

forms: 3 pl. impf. mid. ἀνθίσταντο Il. 16.305. In  aor. and mid., to face in fight.
Absol., to make a stand Il. 16.305.

defs: (2) The characteristic flower of a plant: φάρμακον γάλακτι εἴκελον ἀ. (having a milk-white flower) Od. 10.304.
(3) In collective sense, flowers, blossom: βρύει ἄνθεϊ λευκῷ Il. 17.56. Cf. Od. 6.126.
(4) Fig.: ἔχει ἥβης ἀ. (is in the flower of his youth) Il. 13.484.
Hot embers Il. 9.213.

(2) Specifically, a man as distinguished from a god: οὔτε θεῶν οὔτʼ ἀνθρώπων Il. 1.548. Cf. Il. 2.669, Il. 5.442, Il. 7.180, Il. 8.27, etc.: νέμεσις ἐξ ἀνθρώπων ἔσσεται Od. 2.136. Cf. Od. 13.110, Od. 14.179, Od. 20.112, Od. 22.346, etc. With words indicative of mortality: θνητός Il. 1.339, Il. 14.199, etc.: Od. 1.219, Od. 5.32, etc.– καταθνητός Il. 7.123: Od. 3.114, Od. 9.502, etc.
(1) To molest, annoy Od. 19.323. To weary, tire Il. 23.721.

(2) To be overcome by distress or pain Il. 21.270: Od. 22.87. To weary, become tired Od. 4.460. To become impatient Od. 4.598. To be oppressed, feel hampered (by the possession of something): κτεάτεσσιν Il. 18.300.
(1) To trouble, vex Od. 2.115.
(2) To make oneself a nuisance Od. 19.66, Od. 20.178.

(3) In pass., to become disgusted or disheartened: ἀνιηθέντα νέεσθαι Il. 2.291. To become disgusted or wearied: ὀρυμαγδῷ Od. 1.133. To become wearied or impatient Od. 3.117. To be wearied or annoyed: οὔτις ἀνιᾶται παρεόντι (by your being here) Od. 15.335.
Without sweat, i.e. without conflict: οὔ κεν ἀ. γε τελέσθη Il. 15.228.
(1) Trouble, inconvenience Od. 6.192.
(2) A source of danger Od. 12.223. A bad thing for one Od. 15.394, Od. 20.52. A kill-joy: δαιτὸς ἀνίην Od. 17.446.

forms: Pl. pple. ἀνέντες Il. 5.761. From ἀνιέω
3 sing. impf. ἀνίει Il. 15.24. ἀνί͂ει Od. 8.359.
Fem. pres. pple. mid. ἀνιεμένη Il. 22.80.
defs: (1) To send up, cause to ascend: καπνόν Il. 21.523. To cause to flow up: [ὕδωρ] Od. 12.105.

(2) To stir up, set on, urge, incite, impel: σοὶ ἔπι τοῦτον Il. 5.405. Cf. Il. 5.761, Il. 6.25, Il. 10.389, Il. 16.691, Il. 17.705, Il. 21.395, 545: Od. 2.185. With infin.: νεικείειν βασιλῆας Il. 2.276. Cf. Il. 5.422, 882, Il. 7.256, Il. 6.152, Il. 12.307, Il. 14.362, Il. 21.396, Il. 22.252, 346: ἀειδέμεναι Od. 8.73. Cf. Od. 14.465, Od. 17.425. Absol. Il. 5.880, Od. 3.118. To cause (a wind) to blow Od. 4.568.

(3) To loose (a bond) Od. 8.359.– To loose the fastenings of: πύλας Il. 21.537. To relax hold upon, leave in peace: θυμὸν ὀδύνη Il. 15.24.– Of sleep, to leave, depart from Il. 2.34, 71: Od. 6.289, Od. 18.199, Od. 19.551, Od. 24.440.
(4) In mid., to loose, allow to fall away (a part of one's dress): κόλπον Il. 22.80. App. by development of this sense, to take off the skin of, flay: αἶγας Od. 2.300.
Troublesome, tiresome: πτωχόν Od. 17.220. Cf. Od. 17.377. In comp. in impers. construction: αὐτῷ οἱ ἀνιηρέστερον ἔσται (the worse for him) Od. 2.190.
With unwashen feet: ὑποφῆται Il. 16.235.

(A) 3 sing. impf. ἀνίστη Il. 24.515, 689. 3 pl. fut. ἀναστήσουσι Il. 6.116. Contr. 2 sing. ἀνστήσεις Il. 24.551. 3 pl. -ει Il. 15.64. Contr. pple. ἀνστήσων Il. 10.32. 3 sing. aor. ἀνέστησε Il. 24.756. 3 sing. opt. ἀναστήσειε Il. 1.191. Contr. imp. ἄνστησον Il. 10.176. Pple. ἀναστήσας Il. 10.179: Od. 7.7, Od. 6.163, 170, Od. 14.319. Contr. fem. ἀνστήσασα Il. 18.358.
(I) In impf. act. and the other forms (A)
(II) In mid. and the other forms (B)

forms: To lift up (the hands) in prayer: χεῖρας ἀνίσχοντες Od. 8.347 = Il. 15.369.

etym: [ἀν-, ἀνα- 6 + ἰχνεύω, to trace, fr. ἴχνος.]
defs: To trace or hunt out Il. 22.192.

forms: Of the sun, to rise Od. 10.192.

defs: Lacking understanding Od. 2.270, 278, Od. 17.273.
Senseless, foolish Il. 21.441.

etym: [app. neut. pl. as adv. of an adj. ἀνοπαῖος fr.  ἄνω2; or poss. of such an adj. fr. ἀ-1 + ὀπ-. See ὁράω.]
defs: Thus, upwards, or unseen Od. 1.320. (Others write ἀνόπαια, explained as a kind of eagle.)
(2) Of the sun, to rise Od. 3.1.
Cut off from return home: κεῖνον ἀνόστιμον ἔθηκεν Od. 4.182.
Afflicted by no disease: ἀσκηθέες καὶ ἄνουσοι Od. 14.255.
Not wounded (by thrust): ἄβλητος καὶ ἀνούτατος Il. 4.540.

forms: Without inflicting a wound: οὐδέ οἵ τις ἀνουτητὶ παρέστη Il. 22.371.
contr. 2 sing. and imp. aor. mid. ἀνέχω.

defs: To be endured, sufferable: ἀνσχετὰ ἔργα Od. 2.63.
(I) Adv.
(II) Prep. with genit. (freq. following the case).
(1) Worth, the equal or equivalent of. With genit.: πολλῶν ἀ. ἄλλων Il. 11.514.
(2) Forming a suitable equivalent Il. 1.136. Absol. in neut. ἀντάξιον, an equivalentIl. 9.401.
(1) To meet, encounter. With dat.: οἱ Il. 7.399. Cf. Il. 6.423. To meet a person so as to have knowledge of him Il. 4.375: = Od. 4.201.
(2) With genit., to encounter, come upon: ἔνδον ἐόντων Od. 16.254. To light or come upon: δαίτης Od. 3.44, ὀπωπῆς 97 = Od. 4.327, Od. 17.44. To get one's will in the matter of: μάχης Il. 6.158.
(3) With genit., to encounter in fight: τοῦδʼ ἀνέρος Il. 16.423.

etym: [adv. fr. acc. of *ἄντη, conn. with ἀντίος.]
defs: (1) Face to face: ἐσέδρακον ἀ. Il. 24.223. Cf. Il. 15.247, Il. 24.464: Od. 5.77, Od. 8.213. When set face to face, when brought into comparison: θεῷ ἐναλίγκιος ἀ. Od. 2.5 = Od. 4.310. Cf. Od. 22.240, Od. 24.371.
(2) To one's face: ὁμοιωθήμεναι ἀ. Il. 1.187. Cf. Il. 10.158: Od. 3.120, Od. 8.158.
(3) Facing the foe, man to man: ἀ. ἵστασθε Il. 11.590. Cf. Il. 12.152, Il. 18.307, Il. 22.109.
(4) Straight in front of one: ἀ. εἰσιδέειν Il. 19.15.
(5) Before the eyes of a company: ἀ. οὐκ ἂν λοέσσομαι Od. 7.221.
(6) Into one's view or presence Il. 8.399.

forms: Thus κατʼ ἄντηστιν, opposite: θεμένη δίφρον (i. e. opposite the door of the μέγαρον) Od. 20.387.
Prep. with genit. (sometimes (without anastrophe) following the case).
defs: (1) Instead of, in the place of: Ἕκτορος ἀντί Il. 24.254. Cf. Od. 20.307. For, in exchange for: τρεῖς ἑνὸς ἀντί Il. 13.447. Cf. Il. 14.471.
(2) As good as, the equivalent of: πολλῶν λαῶν Il. 9.116. Entitled to the rights of: ἱκέταο Il. 21.75. Cf. Od. 8.546. No better than: γυναικός Il. 8.163.
(3) In return for: τῶνδʼ ἀντί Il. 23.650. Cf. Od. 22.290.
A match for men. Epithet of the Amazons Il. 3.189, Il. 7.186.

forms: Acc. sing. fem. pple. ἀντιόωσαν Il. 1.31.
defs: (1) To meet or encounter someone: θεὸν ἀντιάσαντα Il. 10.551: ἱκέτην ἀντιάσαντα (who has met one who can help him) Od. 7.193 = Od. 14.511. Cf. Od. 6.293, Od. 12.88, Od. 13.292, 312, Od. 17.442.
(2) To encounter in fight. With genit.: σέθεν Il. 6.231. With dat.: ἐμῷ μένει Il. 7.127 = Il. 21.151, Il. 21.431: ἐκείνῳ Od. 18.147. Absol. Il. 15.297.
(3) Of a missile, to reach, strike. With genit.: στέρνων Il. 13.290.
(4) To find, get. With genit.: ὀνήσιος Od. 21.402.
(5) To join, come to. With genit.: παιδὸς τεθνηότος Od. 24.56.

(6) With genit., to take part in: πόνοιο Il. 12.356. Cf. Il. 12.368 = Il. 13.752, Il. 13.215, Od. 3.125, Il. 23.643: ἀέθλων Od. 22.28. In mid.: ἀντιάασθε γάμου Il. 24.62.–  Of a god, to take part in (a sacrifice): ἑκατομβης Od. 1.25, ἱρῶν Od. 3.436. To accept of (a sacrifice) Il. 1.67.  With acc., to come to share: ἐμὸν λέχος Il. 1.31.
(1) Of words, wrangling, jangling Il. 1.304, Il. 2.378: Od. 18.415  =  Od. 20.323.
(2) In neut. ἀντίβιον as adv., face to face, man to man: ἀ. μαχέσασθαι Il. 3.20 = Il. 6.40 = 51. Cf. Il. 3.435, Il. 11.386.
(3) Adv. of acc. fem. form ἀντιβίην.
(b) To one's face: ἐριζέμεναι βασιλῆϊ ἀ. Il. 1.278.
(1) To meet or encounter someone: θεὸς ἀντιβολήσας Il. 10.546. Cf. Il. 24.375: Od. 7.275, Od. 6.16. With dat.: οἱ Il. 11.809, Il. 13.210, 246: Od. 6.19, μοι Od. 10.277, Od. 13.229.
(2) To encounter in fight. With dat.: τούτῳ Il. 6.114. Cf. Il. 16.847: Od. 22.360. Absol. Il. 11.365 = Od. 3.452, Il. 12.465, Il. 16.790.
(3) To come to, fall to the lot of. With genit.: γάμος ἐμέθεν Od. 18.272.
(4) To find, get. With genit.: ἐπητύος Od. 21.306.
(5) To take part in. With genit.: μάχης Il. 4.342 = Il. 12.316: τάφου Od. 4.547. With dat.: τάφῳ Hom. Od. 24.87. To be present at, witness. With dat.: φόνῳ ἀνδρῶν Od. 11.416.

Like the gods. A vague general epithet of commendation Il. 4.88, Il. 5.663, Il. 9.623, Il. 11.140, Il. 14.322, Il. 23.360, etc.: Od. 1.21, Od. 4.571, Od. 7.241, Od. 11.117, Od. 14.18 (here merely conventional), Od. 15.90, etc.
A space opposit a door: στῆ κατʼ ἀντίθυρον κλισίης Od. 16.159 (app., from 165, in a spot opposite the door of the κλισίη and outside the gate of the αὐλή).
(1) Face to face: μάχεσθαι Il. 5.130, 819.
(3) Right over: τάφρον ὑπέρθορον Il. 16.380.
(4) (Aiming) straight in front Il. 16.285.
(5) With genit., straight against: Ἕκτορος ἀ. Il. 8.301 = 310.
(6) Vehemently: μεμαώς Il. 13.137. Right out, without circumlocution Il. 6.362.
(7) Utterly, completely: ἀπάραξε Il. 16.116. Cf. Il. 23.673, 867.
(1) Opposite, facing: ἔσταν Il. 1.535. In hostile sense Il. 11.94, 216, Il. 13.146, Od. 3.373, Il. 21.144: Od. 19.445. With genit.: ἐμεῖο Il. 17.31 = Od. 3.197.
(2) Straight towards an object: ἀίξας Il. 15.694: Od. 22.90. Straight before one: ἀθρῆσαι Od. 19.478.
(3) To meet persons approaching: ἐξέθορεν Il. 21.539.

(4) In order to meet, join, encounter or intercept a person: ἦλθεν Il. 7.54, Il. 17.257. With genit.: Ἀγαμέμνονος ἀ. ἐλθών Il. 2.185. Cf. Il. 11.594, Il. 22.113: ἀ. ἦλθεν ἄνακτος Od. 16.14. With dat.: τῇ δʼ ἀ. ὄρνυτο Il. 6.20. In hostile sense: ἀ. ἐλθών Od. 3.352. With genit.: ὅς τις τοῦ γʼ ἀ. ἔλθοι Il. 5.301 = Il. 17.8. Cf. Hom. Il. 7.98, Od. 3.371, Il. 21.150. With dat.: ἀ. οἱ ἦλθεν Il. 15.584. Cf. Od. 3.422. In order to clasp or seize. With genit.: ἀ. ἤλυθε γούνων Od. 3.463.
(5) In neut. sing. ἀντίον as adv.
(b) Against, in contradiction. With genit.: ὅς τις σέθεν ἀ. εἴπῃ Il. 1.230.
(c) With straight aim Il. 11.553 = Il. 17.662.– Straight before one: ἴδεν Od. 16.160.

(d) Aiming for, seeking to reach. With genit.: πυλάων Hom. Il. 22.195. In hostile sense, in order to meet or encouter someone: ἐλθέμεναι Il. 17.67, ἐλθών Il. 19.70. With genit.: ἀ. εἶμʼ αὐτῶν Il. 5.256. Cf. Il. 6.160, Il. 11.219, 231, Il. 17.69, Od. 3.175.

(e) In reply: ἀ. ηὔδα Il. 3.203, Il. 4.265, Il. 5.217, etc.: Od. 1.213, 399, Od. 2.242, etc.– Simply in reference to addressing a person: ἔπος μιν ἀ. ηὔδα Il. 5.170. Cf. Il. 8.200, Il. 24.333: Od. 5.28.
(6) In neut. pl. ἀντία as adv. With genit.
(b) In hostile sense, in order to meet or encounter: ἀ. πηλεΐωνος Od. 3.80. Cf. Od. 3.113, 118.
(c) Against the will of. Joined with ἀέκητι. See ἀέκητι 1.
Lying opposite and beyond. Absol.: τὰ ἀντιπέραια (the opposite coast) Il. 2.635.

forms: To hold up as protection against.
With genit.: ἀντίσχεσθε τραπέζας ἰῶν Od. 22.74.
To pierce: χρός Il. 5.337 (the genit. app. partitive).
To break into (a house): δόμον Il. 10.267.

defs: Consisting in paying back or requital: ἄντιτα ἔργα (works of vengeance, revenge) Il. 24.213 (for u.l. see τιτός): Od. 17.51 = 60.
To set oneself against, rival. With dat.: σοί Il. 21.357, ὅτι μοι μένος ἀντιφερίζεις (in the matter of might) 488.
(1) To set oneself against, rival, a person: ἀργαλέος [ἐστὶν] ἀντιφέρεσθαι (hard to set oneself against) Il. 1.589, χαλεπή [εἰμι] μένος ἀντιφέρεσθαι (to rival in the matter of might) Il. 21.482.
(2) To offer (successful) resistance, hold one's own Il. 5.701: Od. 16.238.
The lower part of the interior of a ship, the hold Od. 12.411, Od. 15.479.
A rising: ἀντολαὶ Ἠελίοιο (the pl. app. referring to the different places of rising at different seasons) Od. 12.4.
(1) To meet, encounter. With dat.: ἀλλήλοισιν Il. 15.698. Cf. Il. 16.788, Il. 22.203. Absol. Il. 2.595, Il. 8.412. Of a weapon. With dat.: ἀργύρῳ Il. 11.237.
(2) Of the front and back plates of the θώρηξ, to meet and overlap Il. 4.133 = Od. 3.415.

(1) The breastwork or rail surrounding a chariot in front and at the sides:  ὑπὲρ ἄντυγος Hom. Il. 16.406. Cf. Hom. Il. 5.262, 322. In pl. of a single rail Il. 11.535 = Od. 3.500, Il. 21.38. Cf. δοιαὶ ἄντυγες Il. 5.728 (prob. referring only to a single rail called δοιαί as terminating behind in a handle on each side).
(2) The rim of a shield: ἀ. ἣ πυμάτη θέεν ἀσπίδος Il. 7.118. Cf. Il. 14.412, Il. 15.645, Il. 18.479, 608, Od. 3.275.
To effect, accomplish: θοῶς ἤνυτο ἔργον Od. 5.243.
Accomplishment, effect, result: αὐτῶν (app., on their part) Il. 2.347. Cf. Od. 4.544.
(1) To effect, accomplish: ἀνύσσεσθαι τάδε ἔργα Od. 16.373. To effect one's purpose Il. 4.56.
(2) To consume: ἐπεί σε φλὸξ ἤνυσεν Od. 24.71.
(3) To pass over, traverse: θαλάσσης ὕδωρ Od. 15.294. To perform a voyage Od. 4.357.
To accomplish: ὅπως ἔργον ἄνοιτο Il. 18.473: ἦνον ὁδόν (pursued their way, made (good) speed) Od. 3.496. In pass. of a period of time, to pass away, waste: νύξ ἄνεται Il. 10.251.
(1) Upwards: λᾶαν ἀ. ὤθεσκεν Od. 11.596.
(2) Out to sea: ὅσσον λέσβος ἀ. ἐντὸς ἐέργει Il. 24.544.

forms: 3 sing. ἄνωγε (to be distinguished fr. 3 sing. impf.) Il. 7.444, Il. 9.680, Il. 14.195, Il. 18.426, Il. 24.90: Od. 5.89, Od. 17.582, Od. 18.409, Od. 19.374.
Plupf. (with impf. sense) ἠνώγεα Od. 9.44, Od. 10.263, Od. 17.55.
3 sing. ἠνώγει(ν) Il. 7.170, Il. 6.386, Il. 10.394, Il. 12.355, Il. 24.190: Od. 3.174, Od. 5.99, 112, Od. 12.160, Od. 14.336. ἀνώγε(ιν) (to be distinguished fr. ἀνώγει,
defs: (1) Of persons, to command, order, bid, give orders or injunctions.
(b) With acc. alone, Il. 10.130, etc.: Od. 5.139, Od. 19.374, etc.
(c) With this acc. and acc. of what is enjoined: τίπτε με κεῖνος ἄνωγεν; Il. 24.90.
(d) With dat. and infin.: ἑτάροισι κατακῆαι Od. 10.531. Cf. Od. 16.339, Od. 20.139.
(2) Passing into milder sense, to bid, exhort, charge, desire, urge, recommend, counsel.
(b) With acc. alone Od. 16.404.

(c) With infin. alone: ἐγρήγορθαι Il. 10.67. Cf. Il. 11.139, 646 = 778, Il. 12.355, Il. 16.8, Il. 22.351: ἑδριάασθαι Od. 3.35. Cf. Od. 3.317, Od. 6.221, Od. 12.158, Od. 16.278, 405, Od. 17.398, Od. 23.267. With neg. as above: τύμβον οὐ μάλα πολλὸν πονέεσθαι Il. 23.245.
(d) Absol. Il. 24.670.

(3) In sim. constructions with senses as under (2) of mental faculties and impersonal agencies: θυμός Il. 4.263, Il. 7.439, Il. 6.74, Il. 8.189, 322, Il. 9.101, 703, Il. 14.195 = Il. 18.426, Il. 15.43, Il. 18.176, Il. 19.102, Od. 3.77, 179, Il. 22.142, μένος καὶ θυμός Il. 24.198: ἦτορ Od. 1.316, θυμός Od. 5.89, Od. 8.70, Od. 11.206, Od. 14.246, Od. 16.141, 466, Od. 18.409, Od. 21.194, οἶνος Od. 14.463, κραδίη καὶ θυμός Od. 15.395, ἀχρημοσύνη Od. 17.502. With neg. as under (2): οὐδέ με θυμὸς ἄνωγεν Il. 7.444. Cf. Il. 18.90.
To shove off, put to sea Od. 15.553.
At unawares: ἔπεφνεν Od. 4.92.
Not looked for, unexpected: κακόν Il. 21.39.
Nameless, having no name: οὔ τις ἀ. ἐστιν Od. 8.552.
An axe (referred to only as in warlike use) Il. 13.612, Il. 15.711 (see under πέλεκυς).

(1) Worth, the equal or equivalent of. With genit.: οὐδʼ ἑνός Il. 8.234, πολέος οἱ ἄξιος ἔσται (he will find it a thing of price) Il. 23.562. Cf. Il. 15.719, Il. 23.885: ἄξιον ἔσται ἀμοιβῆς (will bring a (full) return) Od. 1.318. Cf. Od. 8.405.
(2) Forming a suitable equivalent, suitable, sufficient, calculated to satisfy: ἄποινα Il. 7.46 = Il. 11.131. Cf. Il. 9.261: Od. 15.388 = 429. With infin.: προθοήνορος ἀντὶ πεφάσθαι Il. 14.472.
(3) Absol. in neut. ἄξιον.
(b) A suitable return: ἄξιόν κʼ ἄλφοι Od. 20.383.
Thus, thickly timbered: ὕλῃ Il. 11.155.
(1) A song or lay Od. 1.328, 340, 351, Od. 8.499, Od. 12.44, 183, 198, Od. 24.197. A dirge or lament: στονόεσσαν Il. 24.721.
(2) A subject of song: ἐσσομένοισι ἀοιδήν Od. 3.204. Cf. Od. 8.580, Od. 24.200.
(3) Singing: ταῦσαν ἀοιδῆς Il. 2.595: κίθαρις καὶ ἀ. Od. 1.159. Cf. Od. 1.421 = Od. 18.304, Od. 8.429, Od. 17.605.
(4) The art of song: μοῦσαι ἀοιδὴν ἀφέλοντο Il. 2.599. Cf. Il. 13.731: Od. 8.44, 64, 253, 498, Od. 21.406.
To sing Od. 5.61, Od. 10.227.
That is a subject of song Il. 7.358.
A minstrel or bard Il. 18.604: Od. 1.325, Od. 8.43, Od. 13.9, Od. 17.385, Od. 22.376, etc. A singer of a dirge: ἀοιδοὺς θρήνων ἐξάρχους Il. 24.720.
(2) Of inanimate objects, in a body or mass, all together: πάντα φέρωμεν ἀολλέα Od. 8.394. Cf. Od. 3.165, Od. 10.132, Od. 14.432.
(1) To gather together, cause to assemble: γεραιάς Il. 7.270, 287.
(2) In pass., to come together, assemble: ἐπεὶ πάντες ἀολλίσθησαν Il. 19.54. Cf. Il. 15.588.

forms: Acc. pl. in masc. form ἄορας Od. 17.222.

defs: (1) A strap to support a sword, a sword-baldrick: χρυσέοισιν (app. in pl. as referring to the two ends attached to the sheath) Il. 11.31. Joined with, and app. less specific than, τελαμών: περὶ στήθεσσιν ἀ. ἦν τελαμών Od. 11.609.
(2) The shoulder-strap of a wallet Od. 13.438 = Od. 17.198 = Od. 18.109.
(2) An avenger Il. 22.333.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative ἀπαγγέλλεσκε Il. 17.409: Od. 18.7.
3 sing. aor. opt. ἀπαγγείλειε Il. 17.640: Od. 16.153.
To bear a message, make a report or announcement Od. 9.95, Od. 18.7.
With dat. and acc., to announce or report (something) to: μῦθον Δαναοῖσιν Il. 9.626. Cf. Il. 17.409.
3 sing. aor. ἀπήγαγε Il. 15.706: Od. 4.289, Od. 16.370.
defs: (1) To drive or lead off: βόας Od. 18.278. To lead, conduct or bring away Od. 4.289, Od. 13.211.
(2) To bring or conduct back Il. 15.706, Il. 18.326: Od. 15.436, Od. 16.370.

forms: In pass., to take oneself off from.

defs: (1) To spring or dart from. With genit.: κρημνοῦ Il. 21.234.
(2) Of limbs, to dart out from. In mid. With genit.: χεῖρες ὤμων ἀπαΐσσονται Il. 23.628 (v.l. ἐπαΐσσονται).

forms: To ask for, demand: χρήματα Od. 2.78.
To ward or keep off: μνηστῆρας Od. 4.766.
To ward or keep off from.
With genit.: σῆς κύνας κεφαλῆς Il. 22.348.

defs: Handless, shiftless, without resource: ἀνήρ Il. 5.597.
(1) To ward or keep off from. With genit.: ἄλλον σεὺ Il. 24.371.
(2) To keep (a person) protected from. With genit.: κακότητός τινα Od. 17.364.
To be healed or cured: ἕλκεα (of the wounds) Il. 8.405 = 419.

forms: To crush, break, sever: τένοντε καὶ ὀστέα Il. 4.522.

defs: (1) Soft, tender, delicate: δειρήν Il. 3.371. Cf. Il. 13.202, Il. 17.49 = Il. 22.327, Il. 18.123, 177, Il. 19.285: χεῖρας Od. 21.151. Cf. Od. 22.16. Epithet of the life or vital principle: ἦτορ Il. 11.115. Of the feet, stepping delicately Il. 19.92.
(2) In neut. ἁπαλόν as adv.: ἁ. γελάσαι (app., on small provocation, idly) Od. 14.465.
So fed as to be ἁπαλός, well-fed, plump: σιάλοιο Il. 21.363.

forms: To cut, cut through, sever: λαιμόν Il. 18.34 (for v.l. see ἀποτμήγω).
In pres. pple. ἀπαμειβόμενος, making answer, in replyIl. 1.84, Il. 5.814, Il. 11.316, etc.: Od. 1.63, Od. 6.207, Od. 9.409, Od. 17.405, etc.
1 pl. aor. opt. mid. ἀπαμυναίμεσθα Il. 15.738.
defs: (1) To ward off, keep off. With dat. of person protected: αἰτωλοῖσι κακὸν ἦμαρ Il. 9.597.
(2) In mid.
(b) Absol., to defend oneself Il. 15.738: Od. 11.579.
(1) To refuse, reject: θεοῦ εὐνήν Od. 10.297.
(2) To disown: [κλῆρον] Il. 6.185.
(1) Adv.

(b) Apart, aside, aloof: κιών Il. 1.35. Cf. Il. 2.812, Il. 4.227, Il. 10.425, 434, Il. 11.341, Il. 18.558, Il. 24.473: Od. 1.190, Od. 2.260, Od. 7.204, 223, 236, Od. 9.189, Od. 23.86. Apart, separately: τειρεσίῃ ὄϊν ἱερευσέμεν Od. 10.524 = Od. 11.32.
(2) Prep. with genit.
(b) Away from, to a distance from: μάχης Il. 11.283.

(c) Apart or aloof from, at a distance from: νεῶν Il. 1.48, Il. 15.348, Il. 17.403. Cf. Il. 2.391, Il. 11.81, Il. 14.30, 189, Il. 17.192, 426, Il. 18.412, 523, Od. 3.41, Il. 23.77, 83, 141, 194, Il. 24.211: Od. 6.284, Od. 17.447. Apart from, detaching oneself from: θεῶν Il. 8.10. Apart from, without consulting: θεῶν Il. 1.549.
In all directions: φέρων ἀνʼ ὅμιλον ἁ. Il. 6.183, 186: χέε δέσμαθʼ ἁ. Od. 8.278.
To perform a voyage: οἴκαδε Od. 6.326.
(1) Once: θνῄσκουσιν Od. 12.22.
(2) Once for all: ἀπὸ θυμὸν ὀλέσσαι Od. 12.350.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἀπήραξε Il. 14.497. ἀπάραξε Il. 16.116.

defs: In mid., to appease: ἄνδρα Il. 19.183.

forms: In mid. as a word of ritual, to cut off (hairs of the victim) as the first-fruits of the sacrifice (cf. ἄρχω 1..b): ἀπαρχόμενος κεφαλῆς τρίχας Od. 14.422.
Genit. pl. fem. ἁπασέων Od. 8.284. Strengthened form of, but hardly to be distinguished from, πᾶς.
defs: (1) In sing.

(b) All, the whole of : διέχευάν μιν ἅπαντα Il. 6.316, ̓́ιλιος Il. 22.410. Cf. Od. 19.421. A whole: ἐνιαυτόν Od. 14.196, Od. 15.455. All needful: σῖτον Od. 16.83. All possible, perfect: φιλότητος Od. 15.158.
(2) In pl.

(c) Absol., the whole number of specified or indicated persons or things: ἀντίοι ἔσταν ἅπαντες Il. 1.535. Cf. Il. 2.14, Il. 6.153, Il. 12.344, Il. 16.291, Il. 22.241, etc.: τελευτηθῆναι ἅπαντα Od. 2.171. Cf. Od. 2.239, Od. 3.34, Od. 5.262, Od. 13.281, Od. 17.70 (all they had in their minds), etc.
Not partaking of food or drink Il. 19.346. With genit.: ἐδητύος ἀ. Od. 7.250. Cf. Od. 4.788.
(1) To speak untruthfully Od. 4.348 = Od. 17.139.
(2) To trick, cheat, beguile, deal unfairly with Hom. Il. 9.344, 375, Il. 15.33, Hom. Il. 19.97.

etym: [ἀπ-, ἀπο- 7 + ἄτερθε, ἄτερ. Cf. ἄνευθε, ἄνευ.]
defs: (1) Adv., apart from others or from another: θωρήσσοντο Il. 2.587, φθέγξατο Il. 18.217.
(2) Prep. with genit., separated from, at a distance from: ὁμίλου Il. 5.445.
(1) An act of beguiling, a trick Il. 2.114 = Il. 9.21. A piece of unfair dealing Il. 4.168.
(2) In pl., wiles, trickery: ἵνʼ ἀπαλλάξῃς ἀπατάων Il. 15.31. Cf. Od. 13.294.
Cheating, beguiling. Absol. in neut. pl.: ἀπατήλια βάζει (tells lying tales) Od. 14.127, 157, ἀπατήλια εἰδώς (having deceit in his heart) 288 (see εἴδω III.12).

forms: = ἀπατήλιος.: οὐκ ἐμὸν ἀπατηλόν (nothing that comes from me bears deceit) Il. 1.526.
To lay dishonour upon: Πηλεΐωνα Il. 13.113.

etym: [For the impf. ἀπηύρων, -ας, -α should prob. be read aor. ἀπέϝ ραν, -ας, -α (from ἀπο- 1 + ϝρα-, ϝερ- as in ἀπό (ϝ)ερσα)
forms: 3 pl. fut. ἀπουρήσουσι (v.l. ἀπουρίσσουσι; see ἀπουρίζρω) Il. 22.489.
With 3 pl. ἀπέϝ ρασαν (metrically = ἀπηύρων), pple. ἀποϝράς and fut. ἀποϝρήσουσι.]
defs: (2) To take away from (a person), deprive (him) of. With genit. of person: Ἀχιλλῆος γέρας Il. 19.89. Cf. Od. 18.273. With dat.: πολέσσι θυμόν Il. 17.236. Cf. Il. 21.296, Il. 22.489: Od. 3.192, Od. 13.132. With double acc.: κῦδός μιν Il. 8.237. Cf. Il. 7.17, Il. 10.495, Il. 11.115, 334, 432, Il. 15.462, Il. 16.828, 831, Il. 17.125, Od. 3.193, 290, Il. 23.291, 560, 800, 808: νῆά σε Od. 4.646. Cf. Od. 11.203, Od. 13.270.

forms: 3 sing. aor. opt. mid. ἀπάφοιτο Od. 23.216.
defs: To trick, cheat, beguile Od. 11.217. In mid. Od. 23.216. With complementary infin.: οἰοχίτωνʼ ἔμεναι Od. 14.488.
(1) To vow, promise. With fut. infin.: ῥέξειν Il. 23.863, 872.
(2) To boast, vaunt Hom. Il. 8.150. With pres. infin.: βητάρμονας εἶναι ἀρίστους Od. 8.383. With fut. infin.: διελεύσεσθαι Il. 13.143. Cf. Od. 11.313.

(3) To threaten, menace. With dat.: ἀπειλήσω τοι Il. 1.181. Cf. Il. 2.665. With cognate acc.: μῦθον Il. 1.388. With dat. and this acc. Il. 13.220, Il. 16.201. With pres. infin.: ἑλκέμεν Il. 9.682. With fut. infin.: ἀφαιρήσεσθαι Il. 1.161. Cf. Il. 8.415, Il. 15.179, Il. 21.453. To threaten (an injury): ἀπειλήσω τό γε Il. 15.212. Absol. in aor. pple. ἀπειλήσας, with a threatening word or gesture: προσηύδα Il. 6.225. Cf. Od. 3.161, Il. 21.161, 452, Il. 23.184: Od. 21.368. With dat. Od. 20.272.
(1) Boasts, vaunts Il. 9.244, Il. 14.479. With fut. infin.: πολεμίξειν Od. 3.83.
(2) Threats, menaces Il. 13.219, Hom. Il. 16.200: Od. 13.126.
A boaster Il. 6.96.

forms: 3 sing ἀπέσσεται Od. 2.285, Od. 8.150. ἀπεσσεῖται Od. 19.302.
defs: (1) To be away, absent or distant: ἐμεῖο ἀπεόντος Il. 7.362. Cf. Il. 8.522, Il. 10.351, 357, Od. 3.7: ὅτε τόσσον ἀπῆν ὅσσον . . . Od. 5.400 = Od. 9.473 = Od. 12.181. Cf. Od. 9.491, Od. 13.189, Od. 14.330  =  Od. 19.299 (in these three lines pple. of the impf.), Od. 15.515. With genit.: τοῦ (from it) Il. 17.278. Cf. Od. 18.146, Od. 19.169, 302, Od. 20.155.
(2) To be unaccomplished or not brought about: ὁδὸς οὐκέτι δηρὸν ἀπέσσεται Od. 2.285, Od. 8.150.
(1) To go away, go off, depart: γλαύκου ἀπιόντος Il. 12.392. Cf. Il. 13.72, 516, 567, 650, Il. 14.409, 461: ἄπιθʼ ἄλλῃ Od. 17.478. Cf. Od. 9.413.
(2) With fut. sense: ἄπειμι σύας φυλάξων Od. 17.593.
(3) To go back, return Il. 10.289.
(1) Boundless, endless: γαῖαν Od. 3.58: ὀϊζύν Od. 11.621.
(2) Numberless, countless Od. 9.118, Od. 19.174.
(1) Without making an attempt Il. 12.304.
(2) Not put to the issue: πόνος Il. 17.41.
(3) Unskilled: οὐκ ἀ. μαντεύομαι Od. 2.170.
(1) Boundless Il. 1.350, Il. 6.446, Il. 24.342, 545: Od. 1.98 = Od. 5.46, Od. 4.510, Od. 15.79, Od. 17.386, 418, Od. 19.107. Of sleep, from which it might seem that one would never awake Od. 6.286.
(2) App., without an end by which to be unloosed, inextricable: δεσμοί Od. 8.340.
(3) Numberless, countless: δῆμος Il. 24.776.

forms: Redup. pl. aor. imp. mid. ἀπεκλελάθεσθε.
defs: In mid., to put out of one's mind. With genit.: θάμβευς Od. 24.394.
(1) Unmeasured, i.e. very great: ἶνα Il. 5.245, Il. 6.269: = Od. 9.538.
(2) In neut., ἀπέλεθρον as adv., to a very great distance: ἀνέδραμεν Il. 11.354.
To vomit forth, throw up: αἷμα Il. 14.437.
Not to be reckoned, of very great amount or value: ἄποινα Il. 1.13 = 372, Il. 7.49 = Il. 11.134, Il. 7.427, Il. 9.120 = Il. 19.138, Il. 10.380, Il. 24.276, 502, 579, ἕδνα Il. 16.178: Od. 19.529.

forms: To keep off or away Il. 4.542, Il. 17.562: Od. 9.119, Od. 18.105.

defs: (1) To go away, depart Il. 17.703.
(2) To depart from. With genit.: ἐμῆς πάτρης Il. 24.766: Od. 19.223 = Od. 24.310, οἴκου Od. 2.136.

forms: To hold back from, fail to take one's part in.

defs: (1) Without acquiring knowledge, uninformed: ἦλθον ἀ. Od. 3.184.
(2) Unknown, hidden in mystery: ὄλεθρον Od. 3.88.
(1) To hate, detest Il. 3.415.
(2) To make hateful Od. 4.105.

(1) To become hateful, incur hatred or enmity Od. 2.202, Od. 18.165. To become hateful to, incur the hatred, disfavour, dislike or enmity of. With dat.: πᾶσιν Il. 3.454. Cf. Il. 4.53, Il. 7.140, 200, Il. 9.300, 614, Il. 21.83, Il. 24.27: Od. 10.74, 75.
(2) To come into a state of enmity: δῆμος ἀπεχθόμενος Od. 16.114.

forms: 3 pl. aor. subj. ἀπόσχωνται Il. 11.799, Il. 14.78, Il. 16.41, Il. 18.199.
defs: (1) To keep or ward off from. With genit.: τυδέος υἱὸν?̓ιλίου Il. 7.96, 277. With dat.: ἀεικείην χροΐ Il. 24.19. Cf. Od. 20.263. To steer (a ship) so as to keep her away from a region specified: ἑκὰς νήσων Od. 15.33.
(2) To cause to depart from. With genit.: οἴκου με Od. 19.572.
(3) In mid.
(b) To keep one's hands off, do no harm to. With genit.: βοῶν Od. 12.321, 328, σεῦ Od. 19.489.
(c) To hold back from through disinclination, fail to take one's part in. With genit.: δηϊοτῆτος Il. 12.248.
(d) To abstain from intercourse with. With genit.: ἀλλήλων Il. 14.206 = 305.
(e) Absol., to retrain from partaking of something Od. 9.211.
Without respect of persons, without regard for consequences Il. 9.309: Od. 1.373.
(2) Doing no harm; hence
(b) Propitious, favourable: οὖρον Od. 5.268 = Od. 6.266. Cf. Od. 12.167. Profitable: μῦθος Il. 12.80 = Il. 13.748. Bringing safety: νόστος ἀπήμων Od. 4.519.
(c) Of sleep, gentle Il. 14.164.

etym: [ἀπ-, ἀπο- 1 + ἠν-, face. Cf. πρηνής, ὑπηνήτης. With averted face.]
defs: (1) Untoward, harsh, unbending: βασιλῆος Il. 1.340. Cf. Il. 15.94, Il. 16.35, Il. 23.484, 611: Od. 18.381, Od. 19.329, Od. 23.97, 230. Absol. in neut. pl.: δ̀ς ἀπηνέα εἰδῇ (is untoward or harsh in heart) Od. 19.329 (see εἴδω III.12).
(2) Of a reply, unyielding, not conciliatory Il. 15.202.
Raised far, high in air: ὄζοι Od. 12.435.
(1) To refuse compliance with, disobey, disregard. With dat.: οὐδʼ ἀπίθησε μύθῳ Il. 1.220.
(2) To refuse compliance with an order or injunction of. With dat.: Ἀγαμέμνονι Il. 3.120. Cf. Il. 4.198 = Il. 12.351, Il. 7.102, Il. 10.129, Il. 24.300: Od. 23.369.
(1) To lack understandig, be foolish Od. 5.342, Od. 7.258.
(2) To be dazed or stupefied Il. 15.10.
Thus, distant, far off: ἐξ ἀπίης γαίης Il. 1.270, Il. 3.49: Od. 6.25, Od. 16.18.
To disbelieve: τό Od. 13.339.
(1) Not to be trusted, faithless Il. 3.106, Il. 24.63, 207.
(2) Not believing, incredulous Od. 14.150, 391, Od. 23.72.

forms: To hold at a distance: ἄπισχε φάσγανον Od. 11.95.

etym: [(σ)α- as in ἅμα. For the second element cf. δι-πλόος.]
defs: Worn single: χλαίνας Il. 24.230: = Od. 24.276.
Without breath, breathless Od. 5.456.

forms: (Commonly with anastrophe when immediately following the vb. or case-form.)
defs: (I) Adv.
(II) Prep. with genit.
(1) To take away from (a person), deprive (him) of. With genit.: τεύχεʼ Ἀπισάονος Il. 11.582. Cf. Il. 13.262: Od. 17.322.
(2) To take off or away: τεύχεα Il. 17.85. To withdraw, take away: κῦδος Il. 15.595: νόστον Od. 12.419 = Od. 14.309.

forms: Fut. in mid. form ἀποβήσομαι Il. 5.227, Il. 17.480.
3 pl. ἀπέβησαν Il. 11.619. Masc. pl. pple. ἀποβάντες Il. 3.265, Il. 8.492: Od. 13.281, Od. 14.346.
3 sing. aor. mid. ἀπεβήσετο Il. 1.428, Il. 2.35, Il. 5.352, Il. 23.212: Od. 18.197.
defs: (2) To alight (from a chariot): ἐξ ἵππων Il. 3.265, Il. 8.492, Il. 24.459. To alight from (a chariot). With genit.: ἵππων Il. 5.227 = Il. 17.480. Absol. Il. 11.619.
(3) To land or disembark from (a ship). With genit.: νηός Od. 13.281. So to throw oneself from, quit (a raft) Od. 5.357. Absol., to land Od. 14.346.
To be thrown away or despised: ἔπος Il. 2.361, θεῶν δῶρα Il. 3.65.

etym: [ἀπο- 1+ βλύζω, which recurs only in late Greek in sense to gush forth.]
forms: To send or spirt out: οἴνου ἀποβλύζων (partitive genit.) Il. 9.491.

defs: To fall asleep Od. 9.151 = Od. 12.7.

forms: To lame, cripple; fig., to deprive (of vigour): μή μʼ ἀπογυιώσῃς μένεος Il. 7.265.
