To take the clothes off, strip: μή σʼ ἀπογυμνωθέντα κακὸν θήῃ (when stripped) Od. 10.301.

defs: (1) To divide (with a person). With dat.: ʼαχαιοῖς ἄλλα Il. 22.118. Cf. Il. 24.595.
(2) To give as a portion: ἥμισυ ἐνάρων Il. 17.231.

forms: To cut the throat of: Τρώων τέκνα Il. 18.336, Il. 23.22: μῆλα Od. 11.35.

defs: To accept: ἄποινα Il. 1.95.
To effect one's escape Od. 16.65, Od. 17.516.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἀπέδωκε Il. 4.478, Il. 5.651, Il. 17.302.
defs: (1) To give or pay back, restore Il. 1.134, Il. 3.285, Il. 6.84, 362: Od. 8.318.
(2) To give or pay as due or in requital: θρέπτρα Il. 4.478 = Il. 17.302, πάντα (i.e. as blood-price) Il. 18.499. Cf. Od. 22.58, 61. To hand over in terms of a bargain Il. 5.651.
To turn (something) sideways, cause (it) to droop: ἀποδοχμώσας αὐχένα Od. 9.372.

forms: 3 sing. aor. opt. ἀποδρύθοι Il. 23.187, Il. 24.21.
To tear or lacerate the skin of (a person) Il. 23.187, Il. 24.21: Od. 17.480.
In pass., of the skin, to be torn Od. 5.435.

defs: (1) In sigmatic aor., to strip off: τεύχεα Il. 4.532, Il. 18.83.
(2) In impf. and non-sigmatic aor., to divest oneself of Od. 5.343, Od. 22.364.

forms: With genit.: θεῶν ἀπόεικε κελεύθου Il. 3.406 (v.l. ἀπόειπε κελεύθους).

defs: (1) To make refusal, refuse: ὑπόσχεο ἤ ὐπόειπε Il. 1.515, κρατερῶς Il. 9.431 (or perh. this should come under (3)). Cf. Il. 9.510, 675.
(2) To renounce: θεῶν ἀπόειπε κελεύθους Il. 3.406 (u.l.ἀπόεικε κελεύθου), μῆνιν Il. 19.35, 75.
(3) To speak out, declare freely: μῦθον Il. 9.309: Od. 1.373. Absol. to speak one's mind freely Od. 1.91.
(4) To announce publicly, state: ἀγγελίην Il. 6.416. Cf. Il. 23.361. To deliver (a message) Od. 16.340 (the prefix here app. giving the notion  at full length).
(1) To exclude from. With genit.: αἰθούσης Il. 24.238.
(2) To hold apart Il. 8.325. To keep apart from. With genit.: πηλεΐωνα λαοῦ Il. 21.599.
(3) To remove (a covering) from. With genit.: ῥάκεα οὐλῆς Od. 8.221.
(4) To break the course of, shelter from: κῦμα Od. 3.296.

etym: [ἀπο- 1. For the second element cf. ἀπαυράω and L. verro.]
forms: To sweep or carry away Il. 7.348, Il. 21.283, 329.

defs: To marvel much at: ὄνειρον Od. 7.49.

etym: [prob. fr. ἀπο- 6 + θεσ-, θέσσασθαι, to pray for. Thus not prayed for,  not desired.]

forms: Genit. sing. masc. pf. pple. ἀποτεθνηῶτος Il. 22.432.
In pf., to be dead Il. 22.432: Od. 12.393.
With genit., to leap from: νηός Il. 2.702, Il. 16.748.
Of smoke, to rise up from: ἧς γαίης Od. 1.58.

etym: [ἀπο- 2 + θυμός. Away from the heart. Cf. ἀπό II.2.e.]
forms: Absol. in neut. pl.: μὴ νυκτὶ ἀποθύμια ἕρδοι (do her a disfavour, offend her) Il. 14.261.

defs: To send away from home Od. 12.135.

etym: [app. ἀ-2 (not appreciably affecting the sense) + ποινή.]
defs: (1) As the price of freedom Il. 1.13, Il. 2.230, Il. 7.49, Il. 10.380, Il. 11.106 (genit. of price), etc.
(2) As the price of life Il. 7.46 =  Il. 11.131, Il. 21.99.
(4) Applied to gifts offered to effect a reconciliation Il. 9.120 = Il. 19.138.
(1) To be gone or absent: πατρὸς ἀποιχομένοιο Od. 1.135, Od. 3.77, Od. 19.19, δηρὸν ἀποίχεται (has been long away) Od. 4.109. Cf. Od. 1.253, Od. 14.8, 450, Od. 17.296, Od. 8.70, 395.
(2) With genit., to hold aloof from, forsake: ἀνδρὸς ὲῆος Il. 19.342. To hold aloof from, shrink from: πολέμοιο Il. 11.408.

forms: With dat. of that in which one excels: παλαιμοσύνῃ πάντας Od. 8.127. Cf. Od. 8.219.

defs: In mid., to cut off from oneself: χαίτην Il. 23.141.
To be careless, fail to do one's best: αἴ κʼ ἀποκηδήσαντε θερώμεθα χεῖρον ἄεθλον Il. 23.413 (the dual referring to the horses only, but the speaker being included in the subjects of the verb).
(1) To lift from: [δέπας] τραπέζης Il. 11.636.
(2) To force away from: θυράων με Od. 22.107.

forms: Acc. sing. masc. aor. pple. ἀποκλίναντα.
defs: To bend aside: ἄλλῃ Od. 19.556 (see ἄλλῃ 2.b).
(1) To cut off, strike off: κάρη Il. 11.261. Cf. Il. 9.241: Od. 9.325, Od. 23.195.
(2) To cut through, sever: τένοντας Od. 3.449. To cut loose: παρήορον Il. 16.474.

forms: To clear away: ἔντεα δαιτός Od. 6.232.

defs: To let hang down: αὐχένα Il. 23.879.
To separate: ἀποκρινθέντε ἐναντίω ὁρμηθήτην (separating themselves from the throng) Il. 5.12.

forms: To hide away, conceal Il. 11.718, Il. 18.465.
To hide away, make a secret of Od. 17.286.
3 sing. aor. ἀπέκτανε Il. 7.414, Il. 15.440, Il. 22.423.
Mid. 3 sing. aor. (in pass. sense) ἀπέκτατο Il. 15.437, Il. 17.472.
Pple. (in sense of pf. pass.) ἀποκτάμενος, -ου Il. 4.494, Il. 13.660, Il. 23.775.
To shine forth, gleam Il. 19.381, Il. 7.295:  =  Od. 15.108.
Impers. with genit.: αἰχμῆς ἀπέλαμπεν (a gleam came from. . .) Il. 22.319.
In pass., to run down from, trickle off.
With genit.: ὀθονέων ἀπολείβεται ἔλαιον Od. 6.107.

defs: (1) To forsake, abandon: κοῖλον δόμον Il. 12.169.
(2) To leave a remnant, not to consume all: ἤσθιε, οὐδʼ ἀπέλειπεν Od. 9.292.
(3) To fail, be lacking: καρπός Od. 6.117.
To slice off: οὔατα Il. 21.455.
(1) To cease, give over, desist, stop Il. 13.230, Od. 3.99. To fail, die out Il. 7.149.

(2) To cease or desist from. With genit.: μάχης Il. 6.263, Il. 11.255. Cf. Il. 15.31, Il. 21.577, Il. 24.475: Od. 12.224, Od. 13.151. To cease or desist. With complementary pple.: δηϊόων Il. 17.565. Cf. Od. 19.166.

etym: [ἀπο- 1 + λιχμάομαι conn. with λείχω, to lick.]
forms: With double acc.: ὠτειλὴν αἷμʼ ἀπολιχμήσονται Il. 21.123.

defs: (B) 3 sing. pf. ἀπόλωλε Il. 15.129: Od. 1.166, Od. 4.62, 511, Od. 14.137, Od. 19.85. Mid. 3 sing. pa. iterative ἀπολέσκετο Od. 11.586. 2 sing. aor. ἀπώλεο Od. 11.556. 3 sing. -ετο Il. 7.223: Od. 1.413, Od. 3.87, Od. 17.253. 1 pl. -όμεθα Od. 9.303, Od. 10.27, Od. 11.438, Od. 24.186. 3 pl. ἀπόλοντο Hom. Il. 2.162, 178: Od. 3.185, Od. 4.497, Od. 11.384. 3 sing. subj. ἀπόληται Od. 2.333. 3 pl. -ωνται Il. 21.459. Opt. ἀπολοίμην Il. 22.304: Od. 17.426. 3 sing. -οιτο Il. 5.311, 388, Il. 7.170, Il. 14.142, Il. 18.107: Od. 1.47. 3 pl. -οίατο Od. 9.554. 3 sing. imp. ἀπολέσθω Il. 17.227. Infin. ἀπολέσθαι Il. 1.117, Il. 3.40, Il. 6.390, Il. 8.246, etc.: Od. 3.234, Od. 5.347, Od. 8.511, 563.
(I) In aor. act.
(II) In pf. act. and in mid. and pas.

forms: In mid., to wash away from one's. . .
With genit.: ὄθρʼ ἅλμην ὤμοιϊν ἀπολούσομαι Od. 14.219.

defs: To cleanse oneself from pollution Il. 1.313, 314.

etym: [ἀπο- 7 + λυμαίνομαι, to maltreat, fr. λύμη, outrage.]
forms: δαιτῶν ἀ., a spoiler of feasts, a kill joy Od. 17.220, 377.

defs: (1) To loose or untie from. With genit.: ίμάντα κορώνης Od. 8.46. In mid., to undo (something) from one's person, [κρήδεμνον] Od. 5.349.

forms: To be very wroth, take deadly offence: ἀπομνίσας ʼαγαμέμνονι (against. . .) Il. 2.772 = Il. 6.230. Cf. Il. 9.426, Il. 19.62: Od. 16.378.

defs: To remember a favour Il. 24.428.

forms: To swear a negative oath, swear not to do something Od. 10.345, Od. 12.303.
With cognate acc.: ὅρκονν Od. 2.377, Od. 10.381.
3 sing. aor. mid. ἀπομόρξατο Il. 2.269: Od. 17.304, Od. 18.200.
Nom. dual masc. pple. ἀπομορξαμένω Il. 23.739.
defs: (1) To wipe off or away. With double acc.: τελαμῶνα αἱμα Il. 5.798.
(2) In mid., to wipe away from one's face or person: δάκρυ Il. 2.269. Cf. Il. 23.739: Od. 17.304.
(3) To wipe, cleanse Il. 18.414. In mid. Od. 18.200.

forms: To speak in dissuasion, attempt to dissuade a person Il. 9.109.
3 sing. aor. mid. ἀπενάσσατο Il. 2.629: Od. 15.254.
defs: (1) To cause to leave one's residence; hence, to send back: κούρην Il. 16.86.
(2) In mid., to leave one's home, go to . . . in order to settle there: δουλίχιόνδε Il. 2.629. Cf. Od. 15.254.

forms: (Always ending a line and with ἁπ-,)
defs: (1) To go or come back or home, return (the infin. often as fut.; cf. νέομαι 3): Ἴλιον ἐκπέρσαντʼ ἀπονέεσθαι Il. 2.113 = 288 = Il. 5.716 = Il. 9.20, προτὶ Ἴλιον ἀπονέοντο Il. 3.313. Cf. Il. 12.73, Il. 14.46, Il. 15.295, 305, Il. 16.252, Il. 17.415, Od. 3.212, Il. 21.561, Il. 24.330: Od. 2.195, Od. 5.27, Od. 9.451, Od. 16.467, Od. 18.260.
(2) To go away, depart: προτὶ ἄστυ Od. 15.308 (of course in sense (1) to the speaker himself).

forms: Aor. imp. pl. ἀπονίψατε Od. 19.317. Masc. pl. pple. ἀπονίψαντες Od. 24.189.
Fem. pple. mid. ἀπονιψαμένη Od. 18.172. Masc. pl. -οι Od. 22.478.
Pres. infin. mid. in form ἀπονίπτεσθαι Od. 18.179.
defs: (1) To wash off or away Od. 24.189.
(2) To wash (a person) Od. 19.317. Absol. Od. 23.75.
(3) In mid.
(b) To wash (one's person or a part thereof): χρῶτʼ ἀπονιψαμένη Od. 18.172. Cf. Od. 18.179, Od. 22.478.

forms: In mid., to enjoy, have the enjoyment of.
With genit.: τῆς ἀρετῆς Il. 11.763. Cf. Il. 17.25, Il. 24.556: Od. 24.30.
With the object to be supplied from the context Od. 11.324, Od. 16.120, Od. 17.293.
To go or come back, return: ἄψ Il. 1.60, Il. 8.499 = Il. 12.115, Il. 17.406: Od. 13.6, Od. 24.471.

defs: (I) Adv.
(II) Prep. with genit.

etym: [ἀπ-, ἀπο- 7 + ὀξύνω, to sharpen, fr. ὀξύς.]
defs: (1) To make sharp, bring to a point: [ῥόπαλον] Od. 9.326.
(2) To bring (oars (i.e. the blades thereof)) to the proper degree of thinness: ἐρετμά Od. 7.269.

forms: To scrape off. Fig.: γῆρας ἀποξύσας Il. 9.446.

defs: To look about away from something (i.e. away from the fight), look out for a chance of escape Il. 14.101.
(2) In mid., to desist, give over Il. 5.288, Il. 21.372. With genit.: πολέμου Il. 1.422. Cf. Il. 8.473, Il. 16.721: Od. 1.340.
(1) To send away, dismiss Il. 21.452: Od. 2.113, Od. 15.83, Od. 20.133, Od. 23.23. To send away or dismiss from. With genit.: δόμων Od. 10.76.
(2) To dispatch on an errand Il. 10.72.
(3) To send for use: συῶν τὸν ἄριστον Od. 14.108. To send to the proper quarter: δῶρα Od. 17.76.

(4) To dispatch on one's way, speed, arrange for or preside over the departure of Od. 5.112, 146, 161, Od. 10.65, 73, Od. 11.339,  Od. 14.334 = Od. 19.291, Od. 15.53, 65, Od. 19.243, 316, 412, Od. 24.285, 312.

forms: To fall or drop off: ἔερσαι Il. 14.351.
To fall or drop off from.
2 sing. aor. pass. ἀπεπλάγχθης Od. 8.573, Od. 15.382.
defs: (1) To be driven from one's course: Τροίηθεν (i.e. in the course of the voyage from Troy) Od. 9.259.
(2) To wander or rove under stress of circumstances Od. 8.573.
(3) With genit., to be carried away from: πατρίδος Od. 15.382. App. of voluntarily steering a course away from: νήσου Od. 12.285.
(4) Of a missile, to glance off (from something) Il. 13.592. To glance off from. With genit.: σάκεος Il. 22.291.
(5) Of something struck, to be struck off Il. 13.578.
(1) To sail away or off Il. 9.418 = 685: Od. 8.501, Od. 16.331.
(2) To sail away from. With genit.: γαίης Od. 14.339.
Of the sea, to wash away from itself, wash up: λάϊγγας Od. 7.95.

forms: To breathe forth: θυμόν Il. 4.524, Il. 13.654, πυρὸς μένος Il. 7.182: ὀδμήν Od. 4.406.

defs: (1) Adv., to a distance: πολλὸν ἀ. θέρων Il. 16.669, 679.
(2) Prep. with genit., at a distance from: τυτθὸν ἀ. νεῶν Il. 6.334.
To select or pick out: σίτου (partitive genit., a portion of the . . .) Od. 17.457.
(1) Far away: νῆσός τις ἀ. κεῖται Od. 6.244. Cf. Od. 17.408.
(2) At a distance: μένειν Il. 10.209 = 410. Cf. Il. 17.66, 501: Od. 7.218.
(3) Apart from others, aloof: ποιμαίνεσκεν Od. 9.188.
(1) Far away: ἀ. δώματα ναίεις Od. 4.811. Cf. Il. 23.832: Od. 5.80, Od. 9.18, 35.
(2) At a distance Od. 4.757 (app., lying at a distance from the town).

forms: From ἀποπροϊέω3 sing. impf. ἀποπροΐει Od. 22.82.
defs: (1) To shoot forth, discharge (a missile) Od. 22.82.
(2) To send from oneself, let fall from one's grasp: ξίθος χαμᾶζε Od. 22.327.
(3) To dispatch on a mission Od. 14.26.
To cut off a selected protion of something: νώτου (partitive genit., a portion of the . . .) Od. 8.475.

forms: To spit forth or out: ὄνθον Il. 23.781.
Of a wave: ἁλὸς ἄχνην Il. 4.426.

defs: Not sacked Il. 12.11.

forms: In mid., to set forth: ἀπορνύμενον λυκίηθεν Il. 5.105.
With double acc.: κτήματά σε Od. 1.404.

defs: (1) To break off Od. 9.481.
(2) To break asunder: δεσμόν Il. 7.507 = Il. 15.264.
To shrink from doing something. With infin. Od. 2.52.

forms: Acc. sing. masc. aor. pple. ἀπορρίψαντα Il. 9.517.
To cast away. Fig.: μῆνιν Il. 9.517, μηνιθμόν Il. 16.282.

defs: (1) Broken off, abrupt, sheer: ἀκταί Od. 13.98.
(2) As subst., a piece broken off. Hence
(b) A branch stream or tributary Il. 2.755: Od. 10.514.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. ἀπέσσυτο Il. 7.390, Il. 15.572.
Acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. ἀπεσσύμενον Il. 4.527.
defs: (1) To speed away: ἀπεσσύμενον βάλεν Il. 4.527. Cf. Il. 15.572. To speed away from. With genit.: δώματος Il. 7.390.
(2) To start back, retire hastily Od. 9.236, 396.
To cause to disperse, dismiss Il. 19.309: Od. 11.385.

forms: To disperse, go each his own way: οὐκ εἴα ἀποσκίδνασθαι Il. 23.4.
To be angry or wroth with.
To make libation: εὔχετ' ἀποσπένδων Od. 3.394. Cf. Od. 14.331, Od. 19.288.

defs: Standing aloof: ἦ ἀ. λίσσοιτο Od. 7.143. Cf. Od. 7.146.
(1) To go away or off Od. 12.143, 333.
(2) To go back, return Il. 1.522: Od. 11.132 = Od. 23.279.

forms: To shine or glisten: ἀλείθατος (with. . .) Od. 3.408.
3 sing. pa. iterative ἀποστρέψασκε Il. 22.197: Od. 11.597.
Acc. pl. masc. fut. pple. ἀποστρέψοντας Il. 10.355.
3 sing. aor. subj. ἀποστρέψῃσι Il. 15.62. Dual pple. ἀποστρέψαντε Od. 22.173, 190.
defs: (1) To turn back, cause to return Il. 10.355. To turn back from a course desired to be taken Il. 22.197. To cause to roll back: λᾶαν Od. 11.597.
(2) To cause to turn from the fight, put flight into the hearts of Il. 15.62.
(3) To reverse the course of (a ship), turn (her) back Od. 3.162.
(4) To draw back (the feet and hands) in order to bind feet and hands together behind the back Od. 22.173, 190.

forms: To smite so as to drive back Il. 16.703.
So as to drive away from.

defs: (1) To balk of the fruits of. With genit.: πόνοιο Il. 5.567.
(2) To drive from one's course Od. 3.320.
(1) To cut off. In mid. Il. 22.347.
(2) To cut through, sever: παρηορίας Il. 8.87.

forms: genit. sing. masc. pf. pple. ἀποθνῄσκω.

defs: Far away from. With genit.: γαίης κυκλώπων Od. 9.117.
(1) To put away in the appropriate place Il. 16.254. In mid. Il. 18.409.
(2) In mid.
(b) To put away from oneself, avoid incurring: ἐνιπήν Il. 5.492.
(1) To exact (vengeance): πολέων ποινήν (for . . .) Il. 16.398.
(2) To punish: τῶν μʼ ἀποτινύμενοι (on account of . . .) Od. 2.73.

forms: (The fut. and aor. written both -τι- (-τῖ-) and -τει- (-τεῖ-).)
3 sing. subj. ἀποτίσῃ Il. 9.512, Il. 18.93: Od. 22.168.
defs: (1) To pay back Od. 2.132.
(2) To make requital Il. 1.128.
(3) To make requital or return for: κομιδήν Il. 8.186. Cf. Od. 22.235.
(4) To pay the penalty: ἵνα γνώῃς ἀποτίνων Il. 23.487. Cf. Il. 4.161, Il. 9.512: Od. 3.195.
(5) To pay (a penalty) Il. 3.286, 459, Il. 9.634.
(6) To pay the penalty for: Πατρόκλοιο ἕλωρα Il. 18.93. Cf. Il. 21.399, Il. 22.271: Od. 1.43, Od. 13.193 = Od. 22.64, Od. 22.168.
(7) In mid.
(b) To exact (a penalty): ποινὴν ἑτάρων (for their death) Od. 23.312.
(c) To exact the penalty for: βίας Od. 3.216, Od. 11.118, Od. 16.255, Od. 17.540.
(d) To exact a penalty from, chastise, punish Od. 5.24 = Od. 24.480, Od. 13.386.

forms: 3 sing. aor. opt. ἀποτμήξειε (υ.λ. ἀπαμήσειε) Il. 18.34.
Pple. ἀποτμήξας, αντος Il. 10.364, Il. 11.468, Il. 22.456: Od. 10.440.
defs: (1) To cut off Od. 10.440.
(2) To cut off, isolate Il. 11.468. To cut off from, keep away from. With genit.: πόλιος Il. 22.456. Cf. Il. 10.364.
(3) To cut, cut through, sever: λαιμόν Il. 18.34.
(4) To cut up, cut into channels: κλιτῦς Il. 16.390.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. ἀπετράπετο Il. 10.200, Il. 12.329.
defs: (1) To cause to turn away Il. 15.276, Od. 3.109, Il. 21.339. To cause to turn away from, divert from. With genit.: ἀλκῆς Od. 3.256. To dissuade from. With genit.: πολέμοιο Il. 12.249.
(2) To cause to turn back or return Il. 11.758.
(3) In mid.
(b) To turn back, with pple. indicating something from which one desists: ἀπετράπετʼ ὀλλὺς ʼαργείους Il. 10.200.
To wear out: πολλὰ σφέλα (i.e., app., will break them) Od. 17.232.
Living apart as if in banishment: παρʼ ὕεσσιν ἀ. Od. 14.372.
(1) To cause to turn away Od. 3.119. To dissuade from a course proposed Od. 16.405.
(2) In mid., with genit., to turn away from, avoid: λεόντων Il. 18.585. To turn away from, delay undertaking: τόξου τανυστύος Od. 8.112.

etym: [ἀπ-, ἀπο- 7 + οὐρίζω, to bound, fr. οὖρον.]
forms: 3 pl. fut. ἀπουρίσσουσι (v.l. ἀπουρήσουσι; see ἀπαυράω).
defs: To fix the landmarks of, mark off: ἀρούρας Il. 22.489 (the subject ἄλλοι giving an idea of injustice).
(1) To carry away Od. 16.326 = 360.
(2) To cause to be carried away or to go: Κόωνδέ μιν Il. 14.255 = Il. 15.28.
(3) To bring back Il. 5.257. To bring back (word): μῦθον Il. 10.337.
(1) To speak out, declare one's mind plainly Il. 6.362.
(2) To deliver (a message) plainly. In mid. Il. 9.422, 649.

forms: To waste away, perish Il. 5.643, Il. 16.540 (taking θυμόν as acc. of respect).
3 pl. aor. pass. ἀπέφθιθεν Od. 5.110, 133, Od. 6.251.

etym: [app. ἀπ-, ἀπο- 6 + ὀφολ-, ὄφελος. Thus, useless.]
defs: (1) Not fitted for action Od. 14.212. Producing no result, ineffectual Od. 11.249.
(2) Of a man in regard to mental powers, not likely to secure good results, not sagacious Od. 8.177. Absol. in neut. pl.: οὐκ ἀποφώλια εἰδώς (sagacious in mind) Od. 5.182.

etym: [in (1) ἀπο- 6, in(2) ἀπο- 7 (with, in b, admixture of ὰπο- 1) + ψύχω in sense to dry.]
defs: (1) To lack breath, faint Od. 24.348.
(2) To dry. In pass.
(b) Sim., to get (the sweat) dried off (one's garments). With genit.: χιτώνων Il. 11.621.
(1) Not accomplishing one's object Il. 14.221.
(2) Leading or conducing to no result, fruitless: πόλεμον Il. 2.121. Cf. Il. 2.376: Od. 2.79.
(3) Against which nothing can be done: ἀνίην Od. 12.223.

etym: [adv. fr. acc. fem. of *πρίατος fr. ἀ-1 + πρίαμαι.]
defs: Without price or payment Il. 1.99: Od. 14.317.
Untouched, undefiled Il. 19.263.

forms: Hence, that does not take to itself wings: τῇ δʼ ἀ. ἔπλετο μῦθος (she heard in silence) Od. 17.57 = Od. 19.29 = Od. 21.386 = Od. 22.398.

defs: Thus, thrower about of words, reckless in speech: Ἥρη ἀπτοεπές Il. 8.209.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἥψατο Il. 1.512, Il. 5.799, Il. 15.76, 704. ἅψατο Il. 23.666.
Infin. ἅψασθαι Il. 21.65: Od. 7.169, Od. 19.348, Od. 22.339. (ἀν-, ἐξ-, ἐφ-, καθ-, προτι-.)
defs: (1) To fasten Od. 21.408. In mid. Od. 11.278.
(2) In mid.
(b) Of missile weapons (as if personified), to seize their object, work mischief: βέλεʼ ἥπτετο Il. 8.67 = Il. 11.85 = Il. 15.319 = Il. 16.778. Cf. Il. 17.631.
(c) To catch fire Od. 9.379.
Not fortified Od. 11.264.
Not yet put on the fire, new: τρίποδας Il. 9.122 = 264, λέβητα Il. 23.267, 885.

etym: [ἀ-1 + πυρόω, to expose to fire, fr. πῦρ.]

defs: (1) Without knowledge Od. 4.675, Od. 5.127.
(2) Of whom no tidings come Od. 1.242.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἀπέωσε Od. 9.81. ἀπῶσε Il. 17.649, Il. 24.446.
Mid. 3 sing. aor. ἀπώσατο Il. 24.508: Od. 13.276.
defs: (1) To drive or thrust back. In mid.: Τρῶας ἀπώσασθαι Il. 8.206. Cf. Il. 8.533, Il. 15.407. To drive away, expel: ἐκ Τροίης Il. 13.367. In mid. Od. 1.270. To thrust back, ward or keep off. In mid.: νεῖκος Il. 12.276. Cf. Il. 18.13. In reference to driving away or dispersing immaterial or impalpable things: λοιγόν Il. 1.97, ὀμίχλην Il. 17.649.

(2) With genit., to drive away from: γέροντος ἄγριον ἄνδρα Il. 8.96. Cf. Od. 22.76. To expel from: δόμων Od. 2.130. To thrust away or debar from: νηός Od. 15.280. To thrust aside from. In mid.: θυράων λίθον Od. 9.305. To ward or keep off from. In mid.: κακὰ νηῶν Il. 15.503. Cf. Il. 16.251, 301.
(3) In mid., to push away from oneself Il. 24.508.
(4) To drive out of one's course Od. 9.81. In mid. Od. 13.276.
(5) To thrust back, unfasten: ὀχῆας Il. 21.537, Il. 24.446.

forms: Also in lighter (and enclitic) form ῥα.
defs: (1) Expressing consequence or sequence
(b) ῥα: καί ῥα καθέζετο Il. 1.360. Cf. Il. 1.569, Il. 2.1, 48, 211, etc.: βῆ ῥʼ ἴμεν Od. 1.441. Cf. Od. 1.127, 333, Od. 2.148, 321, etc.

(2) Expressing explanation, indicating a reason or cause (generally ἄρα, but sometimes ῥἀ: πάντες ἄρʼ οἵ γʼ ἔθελον πολεμίζειν Il. 6.169, νήπιος, οὐδʼ ἄρʼ ἔμελλε . . . Il. 12.113. Cf. Il. 8.163, 558, Il. 10.46, Il. 13.191, Il. 16.203, Il. 23.670, etc.: φῆ ῥʼ ἀέκητι θεῶν φυγέειν Od. 4.504, ὣς ἄρα πυκνοὶ ἔφυν Od. 5.480. Cf. Od. 6.301, Od. 8.58, Od. 15.468, Od. 19.442, etc. So ἐπεὶ ἄρα Il. 5.686, Il. 9.316, etc.: Od. 1.231, Od. 23.258, etc.– ἐπεί ῥα Il. 11.498, Il. 16.206, etc.: Od. 1.263, etc.– οὕνεκʼ ἄρα Il. 6.140, etc.: Od. 8.480, etc.– τοὔνεκʼ ἄρα Il. 1.96: Od. 13.194.– γάρ ῥα Il. 1.113, 236, Il. 11.74, Il. 17.403, etc.: Od. 3.143, Od. 4.366, Od. 5.321, etc.
(3) Amplifying, adding a circumstance.
(b) ῥα: τόν ῥʼ ἔβαλεν Il. 4.459, etc.: καί ῥʼ οὐχ ὑλαοντο Od. 16.162, etc.
(4) Summing up or resuming. ἄρα: οὗτοι ἄρʼ ἡγεμόνες ἦσαν Il. 2.760, τοὺς ἄρʼ ὅ γʼ ἕλεν Il. 11.304, etc. Sim. in enumerations Il. 2.546, 584, 615, etc.
(5) Calling attention to something: ἀλλʼ ἄρα καὶ τὸν ἀπάτησεν Il. 19.96, Ἀχιλεὺς δʼ ἄρʼ ἐπιρρήσσεσκε καὶ οἶος Il. 24.456.
(6) In relative sentences, sometimes giving a certain emphasis (mark you! note this ! or the like), sometimes not appreciably affecting the sense.

(b) ῥα: ἅ ῥʼ οὐ τελέεσθαι ἔμελλον Il. 2.36, ὅτε δή ῥα . . . Il. 16.386. Cf. Il. 1.430, Il. 2.21, Il. 3.61, Il. 5.70, Il. 11.499, etc.: τόν ῥʼ ἔκτανʼ Ὀρέστης Od. 1.30. Cf. Od. 1.126, Od. 2.9, Od. 4.460, Od. 6.71, Od. 16.50, etc. Sim. in a clause introduced by ὅ, ὅ τε, ὅττι, οὕνεκα or ὡς.
(b) ῥα: οὐδέ τι ᾔδη ὅττι ῥα . . . Il. 13.675, γνῶ ἔργα θεῶν, ὅ ῥα . . . Il. 16.120, etc.: ὅττι ῥά οἱ τέρας ἧκεν Od. 21.415, γνωτὸν ἦν ὅ ῥα  . . . Od. 24.182, etc.
(7) In the first of two related clauses.

(b) ῥα: τοῦ μέν ῥʼ ἀφάμαρτεν, ὁ δἐ . . . Il. 8.119, εἰ δή ῥʼ ἐθέλεις . . . ἔστι . . . Il. 14.337. Cf. Il. 4.15, Il. 8.487, Il. 11.442, Il. 15.53, etc.: οἱ μέν ῥʼ εὔχοντο . . . ὁ δὲ . . . Od. 13.185. Cf. Od. 4.632, Od. 7.120, Od. 21.398, etc. In the second.
(8) In questions, direct or indirect.

(b) ῥα: ἦ ῥά νύ μοί τι πίθοιο; Il. 14.190. Cf. Il. 6.446, etc.: ἦ ῥά κʼ ἅμʼ ἡμῖν ἕποιο; Od. 15.431. Cf. Od. 16.462, etc. So τʼ ἄρα (τε ἄρἀ and τʼ ἄρ (τε ἄρ) (written also ταρ (enclitic)) Il. 1.8, Il. 2.761, Il. 3.226, Il. 11.656, Il. 12.409, Il. 13.307, Il. 18.6, 188, etc.: Od. 1.346, Od. 13.417, Od. 23.264, etc.
A chattering (of the teeth) Il. 10.375.

forms: App., slender, slight, narrow: χεῖρα Il. 5.425, γλώσσῃσιν Il. 16.161, κνῆμαι Il. 18.411 = Od. 3.37: εἴσοδος Od. 10.90.
Non-thematic pres. infin. in act. form αἀρήμεναι Od. 22.322.
defs: (1) To pray. With dat.: μητρὶ ἠρήσατο Il. 1.351. Cf. Il. 1.35, Il. 7.115, Il. 9.172, Il. 17.568, etc.: Od. 4.761, Od. 7.323, Od. 12.337, Od. 13.355. Absol. Il. 3.318, Il. 5.114, etc.: Od. 3.62, 64, Od. 6.1. With complementary infin.: φανήμεναι Ἠῶ Il. 9.240. Cf. Il. 4.143, Il. 13.286, Il. 23.209: Od. 1.164, 366 = Od. 18.213, Od. 4.827, Od. 19.533, Od. 22.322. With dat. and infin. Il. 13.818: Od. 18.176. With dependent clause: ἧος ἵκοιο γῆρας Od. 19.367.
(2) To invoke: ἐρινῦς Od. 2.135.
(3) To vow. With infin.: κόμην σοι κερέειν Il. 23.144. Absol. Il. 23.149.

(A) Trans. 3 sing. impf. ἀράρισκε Od. 14.23. 3 sing. aor. ἄρσε Od. 21.45. Imp. ἄρσον Od. 2.289, 353. Pple. ἄρσας, -αντος Il. 1.136: Od. 1.280. 3 sing. aor. ἤραρε Il. 4.110, Il. 23.712: Od. 5.95, Od. 14.111. 3 pl. ἄραρον Il. 12.105. 3 sing. subj. ἀράρῃ Il. 16.212. Pple. ἀραρών, -όντος Od. 5.252, Od. 16.169. 3 pl. aor. pass. ἄρθεν Il. 16.211.
(I) Trans.
(II) Intrans.

(1) To strike so as to break, shiver or smash: τρυφάλειαν Il. 13.577. Cf. Il. 12.384, Il. 16.324, Il. 23.673: σύν κʼ ὀστέʼ ἀράχθη (would have had his bones smashed) Od. 5.426. Cf. Od. 9.498, Od. 12.412, 422.
(2) To put together or construct by hammering: σχεδίην Od. 5.248.

forms: A spider's web: εὐνὴ ἀράχνιʼ ἔχουσα Od. 16.35. Cf. Od. 8.280.

defs: (2) Grievous or disastrous in results, baleful: χόλου Il. 10.107, χόλος Il. 18.119. In comp.: ἀργαλεώτερος χόλος Il. 15.121. Cf. Od. 4.698. Ill-omened, presaging disaster: ἔπος Od. 21.169. Baneful, destructive, working disaster: ̓́εριδα Il. 11.4. Of Scylla Od. 12.119. Of winds, blowing with violence Il. 13.795, Il. 14.254: Od. 11.400 = 407, Od. 24.110. Difficult to traverse: λαῖτμα θαλάσσης Od. 5.175. Hard to force: στόμα λαύρης Od. 22.137. Of a wave, dashing or breaking with violence Od. 5.367.–  Hard to manage: βόας Od. 11.291.

(3) In neut. ἀργαλέον, with or without copula, it is hard or difficult. With infin.: ῥῦσθαι Il. 15.140. Cf. Od. 3.368, Il. 21.498: Od. 6.241. With dat. and infin.: ἀ. μοί ἐστι θέσθαι κέλευθον Il. 12.410. Cf. Il. 17.252, Od. 3.356, Il. 23.791: Od. 13.312. With acc. and infin.: ἀ. με ταῦτʼ ἀγορεῦσαι Il. 12.176. Cf. Od. 16.88, Od. 19.221. App. rather in sense oppressive, unfair. With infin.: ἀ. ἀνδράσι καὶ πλεόνεσσι μαχήσασθαι (i.e. to have to fight with them) Od. 2.244. Sim. with acc. and infin.: ἀ. ἕνα προικὸς χαρίσασθαι (hard, too much) Od. 13.15.
(4) In personal construction. With infin.: ἀργαλέος Ὀλύμπιος ἀντιφέρεσθαι (is hard to set oneself against) Il. 1.589. Cf. Il. 12.63: Od. 4.397.

forms: White: ὀθόνῃσιν Il. 3.141, οἰῶν 198, Il. 18.529, 588, ὀΐεσσιν Il. 7.424: Od. 17.472.
App., bringing white clouds: νότοιο Il. 11.306, Il. 21.334.

defs: (2) Bright, glancing, vivid: κεραυνόν Il. 8.133. Cf. Od. 5.128, 131, Od. 6.249, Od. 12.387.

forms: (Wielder, the wielder) of the bright thunderbolt.
Epithet or a name of Zeus Il. 19.121, Od. 3.16, Il. 22.178.
Epithet of cities (app. from white cliffs) Il. 2.647, 656.

defs: Having white teeth or tusks: κύνας Il. 11.292. Cf. Il. 9.539, Il. 10.264, Il. 23.32: ὕας Od. 8.60. Cf. Od. 8.476, Od. 11.413, Od. 14.416, 423, 438, 532.
In pl., firstling pieces, portions of food offered to the gods before a meal Od. 14.446.
(1) White, bright. Of oxen, app., glistening, sleek Il. 23.30. So of a goose Od. 15.161.

(2) The notion of brightness or gleam passing into that of rapid movement (cf. αἰόλος 2). Of dogs, swift Il. 1.50, Il. 18.283: Od. 17.62 = Od. 20.145. Sim.: κύνες πόδας ἀργοί (swift-footed) Il. 18.578: Od. 2.11.
(2) Studded or ornamented with silver: τελαμών Il. 11.38. Cf. Il. 5.727, Il. 18.480.

forms: Of the Peneus Il. 2.753 (here app. merely conventionally, as the Peneus is (and presumably always has been) a turbid river).

defs: Studded with silver nails: ξίφος (i.e. having the handle thus ornamented) Il. 2.45 = Il. 3.334 = Il. 16.135 = Il. 19.372, Il. 3.361 = Il. 13.610, Il. 6.303, θρόνου Il. 18.389. Cf. Il. 14.405, Il. 23.807: Od. 6.162, Od. 8.65, 406, 416, Od. 10.261, 314 = 366, Od. 11.97, Od. 22.341.

forms: (Lord, the lord) of the silver bow.

defs: (1) White: φᾶρος Od. 5.230 = Od. 10.543.
(2) Bright: σπέος Il. 18.50.

forms: comp. fr. ἀρε-, ἀρετή. Cf. ἄριστος.]
Acc. sing. masc. ἀρείω Il. 10.237: Od. 3.250.
Nom. pl. masc. ἀρείους Il. 16.557: Od. 2.277, Od. 9.48.
defs: (2) Stronger: τεῖχος Il. 4.407 (i.e. stronger than our fathers found), Il. 15.736 (i.e. stronger than this).
(3) In better condition: χρώς Il. 19.33.
(4) Better, the better course: τόδʼ ἀμφοτέροισιν Il. 19.56. Absol. in neut., anything better or more excellent: οὐ τοῦ γʼ ἀ. [ἐστιν] Od. 7.182.
(5) App., good rather than the reverse: γῆρας Od. 23.286.
(6) In neut. as adv., better: φράσεται καὶ ἀ. (more clearly) Od. 23.114.
Undone, still to do: ἔτι μέγα ἔργον ἄρεκτον Il. 19.150.

forms: 3 pl. aor. imp. ἀρεσάσθω Il. 19.179. ἀρεσσάσθω Od. 8.396.
defs: (1) To make atonement, effect reconciliation Il. 9.120  =  Il. 19.138.
(2) In mid.
(b) To make atonement for, make up for: ταῦτα Il. 4.362, τά Il. 7.526. To make up to a person for a loss by levying a contribution Od. 22.55.
To thrive, prosper: οὐκ ἀρετᾷ κακὰ ἔργα Od. 8.329, ἀρετῶσι λαοί Od. 19.114.

(1) Manliness, valour, prowess: ἣν ἀρετὴν διαείσεται Il. 8.535, συμφερτὴ ἀ. πέλει Il. 13.237 (brought together it becomes prowess, i.e. union makes prowess (συμφερτή assimilated in gender to ἀ. the predicate; cf. Il. 11.801 under ἀνάπνευσις)). Cf. Il. 11.90, 763, Il. 13.275, 277, Il. 14.118, Od. 3.242, Il. 22.268: Od. 12.211, Od. 24.515. In pl., manly or warlike qualities: ἀμείνων παντοίας ἀρετάς (in all . . .) Il. 15.642.
(2) Of horses, excellence in the race Il. 23.276, 374.

(3) Good, creditable, serviceable qualities or character: ἠγαγόμην γυναῖκα  εἵνεκʼ ἐμῆς ἀρετῆς Od. 14.212. Cf. Od. 2.206, Od. 4.629 = Od. 21.187, Od. 17.322, Od. 18.205, Od. 22.244, Od. 24.193, 197. Sim. in pl.: παντοίῃς ἀρετῇσι κεκασμένον Od. 4.725 = 815. Reputation for such qualities or character: ἐϋκλείη τʼ ἀ. τε Od. 14.402.
(4) Skill in manly exercises or pursuits Il. 23.571: Od. 8.237, 239, 244. So ποδῶν ἀρετήν (speed) Od. 3.411.
(5) Majesty, dignity, rank Il. 9.498, Il. 23.578.
(6) Good, welfare, prosperity: θεοὶ ἀρετὴν ὀπάσειαν Od. 13.45. Cf. Od. 18.133, 251, Od. 19.124.
(2) An imprecation Il. 9.566.

forms: Bane, harm: ὅ τις ἀρὴν ἀμύναι Il. 12.334, ἀρῆς ἀλκτῆρα Il. 14.485 (here one who saves the family from the disgrace of a kinsman slain without reparation exacted). Cf. Il. 16.512, Il. 18.100, 213, Il. 24.489: Od. 2.59 = Od. 17.538, Od. 22.208.
Fut. infin. ἀρηξέμεν Il. 13.9, Il. 14.265. -ειν Il. 1.77, Il. 5.833.

defs: A helper, aider Il. 4.7, Il. 5.511.
Swift in the fight: αἰζηῶν Il. 8.298, Il. 15.315, Od. 3.167.
Slain in battle: νέῳ Il. 22.72.
(1) Inspired by Ares, warlike, martial Il. 2.698, Il. 3.339, Il. 4.114, Il. 11.501, Il. 12.102, etc.: Od. 3.109, 167, Od. 23.220.
Slain in battle: φῶτας Il. 19.31, Il. 24.415: ἄνδρες Od. 11.41.
Dear to, favoured by Ares Il. 2.778, Il. 3.21, Il. 4.150, etc.: Od. 15.169.

etym: [a pf. pple. pass. app. formed direct fr. ἀρή2 (the a being retained against analogy). Cf. δεδουπότος, κεκοπώς, πεφυζότες.]
defs: Worn out, impaired, broken down Il. 18.435: Od. 7.2, Od. 11.136 = Od. 23.283, Od. 18.53, 81. App., hurt, harmed Od. 9.403.

forms: dat. fem. pf. pple. pass. ἀρόω.

defs: (2) Applied to wounds inflicted in war: ἔνθα μάλιστα γίγνετʼ Ἀ. ἀλεγεινός Il. 13.569.
A priest Il. 1.11, 94, Il. 5.78.

forms: App., prayed against; hence, accursed: γόον Il. 17.37 = Il. 24.741 (v.l. ἄρρητον).
To form friendship or alliance Il. 6.302.
Joined in friendship or alliance: ἡμῖν (with us) Od. 16.427.

defs: (1) Easy to be known or recognized Il. 13.72, Il. 15.490: Od. 4.207, Od. 7.108, 300, Od. 17.265.
(2) Notorious, infamous Od. 17.375.
Distinguished, renowned Od. 11.540. Conspicuous, exalted: ἀνδρῶν (among . . .) Il. 11.248. Cf. Il. 14.320: Od. 8.382 = 401 = Od. 9.2 = Od. 11.355 = 378 = Od. 13.38.
(1) Very bright, conspicuous Il. 13.244, Il. 22.27. Standing out clearly or distinctly in representation Il. 18.519. Very plain, an evident sign: δράκοντʼ ἀρίζηλον θῆκεν Il. 2.318 (v.l. ἀΐζηλον).
(2) Of sound, very clear or distinct Il. 18.219, 221.
(1) To number, count, reckon up Il. 2.124: Od. 4.411, Od. 13.215, 218, Od. 16.235.
(2) To number off: δίχα πάντας ἑταίρους Od. 10.204.
Number, the number: λέκτο δʼ ἀριθμόν Od. 4.451. Cf. Od. 16.246. In concrete sense: μετʼ ἀνδρῶν ἀριθμῷ Od. 11.449.
(1) Very bright, conspicuous: ἄστρα Il. 8.556. Cf. Il. 15.309: Od. 9.22. Standing out clearly, easy to be distinguished Il. 23.453. Bright, ornamented: χηλόν Od. 8.424.
(2) Striking, distinguished: εἶδος Od. 8.176. Of persons, distinguished, conspicuous, renowned: τρώεσσιν (among the . . .) Il. 7.477. Cf. Il. 9.441: Od. 8.390.
(1) That is on the left side, the left . . .: ὦμον Il. 5.16, Il. 16.106, 478, Cf. Il. 5.660, Il. 11.321. The left hand . . .: ἵππος Il. 23.338.
(2) ἐπʼ ἀριστερά.

(b) On the left: θωρήσσοντο Il. 2.526, λαὸν ἐέργων Il. 12.201 = 219 (the bird having its left to the line and passing along from the line's right to its left): ψυρίην ἔχοντες Od. 3.171. Sim.: ἐπʼ ἀ. χειρός Od. 5.277. On the left of. With genit.: μάχης Il. 5.355, Il. 11.498, Il. 13.765, Il. 17.116 = 682, νηῶν Il. 13.675. With locative: ἐπʼ ἀριστερόφιν [παντὸς στρατοῦ] Il. 13.309.
(3) Of a bird of omen, passing as in Il. 12.240 above, boding ill Od. 20.242.
(1) Pre-eminent, leading, of the first rank Il. 2.404. Cf. Il. 3.44, Il. 15.489, Il. 17.203, Il. 19.193: Od. 14.218, Od. 21.333, Od. 24.460.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative ἀριστεύεσκε Il. 7.460, Il. 11.627, 746, Il. 16.292, 551, Il. 17.351.
defs: (1) To be best, excel, take the lead Il. 7.208 = Il. 11.784, Il. 11.409: Od. 4.652. With complementary infin.: μάχεσθαι Il. 7.460, Il. 11.746, Il. 16.292, 551, Il. 17.351.
(2) To  excel (others in something). With genit. and dat.: βουλῇ ἁπάντων Il. 11.627.
(3) To perform feats, do deeds of valour Il. 6.90, Il. 11.506, Il. 15.460.

etym: [prob. ἀϝερ-ιστον. Cf. ἠ(ϝ)έριος. The early meal.]
forms: The first meal of the day Il. 24.124: Od. 16.2.

defs: (1) The most warlike or soldierly Il. 2.577, 817, Il. 7.188, Il. 8.229: Od. 4.530, Od. 11.500. Absol. Od. 24.507.

(2) The best, the best fitted to take the lead in war or peace, pre-eminent: ἀ. Ἀχαιῶν Il. 1.91. Cf. Il. 2.768, Il. 5.541, Il. 6.50, Il. 11.328 (in their local community), Il. 18.230, Il. 24.255, etc.: Od. 2.51, Od. 3.108, Od. 4.629 = Od. 21.187, Od. 7.257, Od. 15.521, Od. 16.251, Od. 22.29, 244, Od. 23.121, Od. 24.38, 108. Absol. (in pl., pre-eminent or leading men, chiefs): ἄριστον Ἀχαιῶν Il. 1.244, πάντας ἀρίστους Il. 3.19. Cf. Il. 3.250, Il. 4.260, Il. 5.103, Il. 13.836, etc.: Od. 1.211, 245 = Od. 16.122 = Od. 19.130, Od. 4.272, 278, Od. 8.78, 91, 108, 127, 512, Od. 11.524, Od. 17.416, Od. 24.429.
(3) The strongest or most powerful: κάρτεΐ τε σθένεΐ τε ἀ. Il. 15.108. Cf. Il. 12.447, Il. 23.891: Od. 3.370.
(4) The highest in rank, dignity or power. Absol.: θεῶν ὤριστος Il. 13.154. Cf. Il. 14.213, Il. 18.364, Il. 19.258, 413, Od. 3.122, Il. 23.43: Od. 13.142, Od. 19.303.

(5) In reference to mental powers, excelling all Il. 19.95. Excelling in person or accomplishments: κούρας Il. 9.638. In reference to one's person, best, excelling: εἶδος ἀρίστη (in . . .) Il. 2.715. Cf. Il. 3.39 = Il. 13.769, Il. 3.124, Il. 7.252, Il. 13.365, 378, Il. 17.142: Od. 6.57, Od. 8.116, Od. 11.469 = Od. 24.17.
(6) Likely to prove the most suitable husband, the best match Od. 11.179, Od. 16.76, Od. 18.289, Od. 20.335, etc.
(7) The most suitable for some purpose: φῶτας Od. 4.778, χῶρος Od. 5.442, Od. 6.281. Cf. Od. 4.409, Od. 8.36, Od. 9.195, Od. 15.25. Absol. Od. 4.666.

(8) The most skilful, versed or efficient: τέκτονες Il. 7.314, βουλῇ (in . . . .) Il. 9.54. Cf. Il. 9.575, Il. 13.313, Il. 22.254, Il. 23.357, 536, 659 = 802, Il. 23.669: νηυσίν (in the management of . . .) Od. 8.247. Cf. Od. 4.211, Od. 8.250, 383, Od. 13.297, Od. 15.253, Od. 16.419. Absol. Il. 1.69, Il. 7.76, Il. 6.221, Il. 23.483, Il. 24.261. With complementary infin.: μάχεσθαί τε φρονέειν τε Il. 7.78. Cf. Od. 6.327, Od. 8.123.

(9) Of things or abstractions, the best of their kind, the most excellent, useful or helpful: βουλή Il. 2.5 = Il. 10.17 = Il. 14.161, Il. 6.325 = Il. 9.94. Cf. Il. 2.274, Il. 9.74, Il. 12.243, 344 = 357, Il. 14.371, Il. 15.616, Il. 17.634, 712: νηῦς Od. 1.280, Od. 2.294, Od. 16.348. Cf. Od. 6.327, Od. 8.424, Od. 9.318 = 424 = Od. 11.230, Od. 23.124, Od. 24.52.
(11) In neut. ἄριστον as adv., best, the best: δοκέει μοι εἶναι ἀ. Od. 5.360. So in neut. pl. ἄριστα: ὥς μοι δοκεῖ εἶναι ἀ. Il. 9.103 = 314 = Il. 13.735, Il. 12.215: Od. 23.130. Cf. Od. 13.154.
(12) In neut. pl., the best results or consequences: ὅπως ἀ. γένηται Il. 3.110. Cf. Od. 3.129, Od. 9.420, Od. 13.365, Od. 23.117. The most seemly or decent things Il. 7.56.
(1) Easy to be distinguished, clear, manifest: σῆμα Il. 23.326: = Od. 11.126, Od. 21.217, Od. 23.73, 273, Od. 24.329, σήματα Od. 23.225.
(2) Easy to be separated or picked out from others: ὀστέα Il. 23.240.
(1) To ward off, keep off Il. 15.534. With dat. of person protected: ὄλεθρόν οἱ Il. 7.16. Cf. Od. 3.289: Od. 4.292. Sim.: ἀπὸ χροός οἱ ὄλεθρον Il. 13.440.
(2) With dat., to defend, protect: θώρηξ οἱ Il. 15.529. Cf. Il. 21.131. Without case Il. 13.371, 397.
(3) To suffice: ἤ κεν νῶϊν Ἀθήνη ἀρκέσει Od. 16.261.
(1) Sufficient, ample; or perh., on which one may rely, certain, sure: μισθός Il. 10.304: Od. 18.358.

(2) In neut. ἄρκιον with infin., expressing certainty that something must happen: ἀ. ἢ ἀπολέσθαι ἠὲ . . .  (it must now be settled whether we are to . . . or to . . . ) Il. 15.502. So οὔ οἱ ἀ. ἐσσεῖται φυγέειν (he will not be able to rely on escaping, i.e. he certainly will not escape) Il. 2.393.
(2) The constellation the Great Bear ( = ἄμαξα 2) Il. 18.487: = Od. 5.273.
(1) A chariot, whether used in war, for racing or for travel (hardly to be distinguished from δίφρος) Il. 2.384, Il. 5.231, Il. 11.528, Il. 18.244, Il. 21.38, Il. 23.304, etc.: Od. 4.8.
That makes chariots. With ἀνήρ, a chariot-maker Il. 4.485.
The mark or furrow left by a chariot-wheel Il. 23.505.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἥρμοσε Il. 3.333, Il. 17.210: Od. 5.247. (ἐφ-.)
defs: (1) To fit or adjust (to something): [δούρατʼ] ἀλλήλοισιν Od. 5.247.
(2) To put together, construct. In mid.: σχεδίην Od. 5.162.
(3) To fit well, be well adapted (to something). With dat.: θώρηξ αὐτῷ Il. 3.333. Cf. Il. 17.210.

(1) In pl. applied to the means of fastening together the logs composing the σχεδίη of Odysseus: γόμφοισι σχεδίην καὶ ἁρμονίῃσιν ἄρασσεν Od. 5.248 (prob. (cf. πολύδεσμος) flexible bands or cords (not pressing the sense of ἄρασσεν)). Cf. Od. 5.361.
(2) A covenant or agreement Il. 22.255.

etym: [no nom. sing. occurs. Acc. of Ϝρήν. Cf. πολύρρην.]
defs: (1) A lamb: ἀρνῶν πρωτογόνων Il. 4.102 = 120 = Il. 23.864 = 873, ἄρνεσσιν ἢ ἐρίφοισιν Il. 16.352, ἄρνʼ ἀμαλήν Il. 22.310. Cf. Il. 4.435, Il. 24.262: ἄρνες κεραοὶ τελέθουσιν Od. 4.85. Cf. Od. 9.220, 226, Od. 17.242, Od. 19.398.

(1) To refuse, decline: γάμον Od. 1.249  = Od. 16.126, Od. 24.126. To refuse to accede to: τεὸν ἔπος Il. 14.212: = Od. 8.358. Absol., to refuse, decline to accede Il. 14.191, Il. 19.304, Il. 23.42: Od. 8.43.
(2) To refuse to give, withhold: τόξον Od. 21.345.
(2) To be fitted to receive the weight of: [ὀνείδεα] ἄχθος (as lading) Od. 3.247.
Arable land Il. 9.580: Od. 9.134.
A ploughman Il. 18.542, Il. 23.835.
A cornfield Od. 9.122.
(3) Ground, space: ὀλίγη ἦν ἀμφὶς ἀ. Il. 3.115.
(4) In pl., the fields, the land: ὅτε χιὼν ἐπάλυνεν ἀρούρας Il. 10.7. Cf. Il. 6.421: = Od. 19.433.
(6) The land as opposed to the sea Od. 3.226.
(7) A particular country: πατρὶς ἀ. Od. 1.407, Od. 10.29, Od. 20.193. Cf. Od. 2.328, Od. 23.311.

forms: Dat. fem. pf. pple. pass. ἀρηρομένῃ Il. 18.548.
defs: (1) To plough (a field) Il. 18.548.
(2) To use the plough, plough Od. 9.108.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἥρπασε Il. 13.528, Il. 22.276: Od. 15.250. ἥρπαξε Il. 12.305: Od. 15.174.

defs: One who snatches, a seizer or robber Il. 24.262.

forms: Greedy: κερδέων Od. 8.164 (with transference of epithet from gainer to gains).
Voraciously, heartily: πῖνε καὶ ἦσθεν Od. 7.250. Cf. Od. 14.110.

etym: [ἁρπάζω. Prob. for ἁρέπη. Cf. ἀνηρείψαντο and Ἅρπυια.]
forms: An unknown bird of prey Il. 19.350.
A personification of the storm-gust: (α. ποδάργη Il. 16.150 (here represented as a semi-divine being in the form of a mare). Cf. Od. 1.241= Od. 14.371, Od. 20.77.

defs: (1) Not to be broken, broken through or severed Il. 13.37, 360, Il. 14.56 = 68, Il. 15.20: Od. 8.275, Od. 10.4.
(2) Not to be broken into: πόλις Il. 21.447.
(3) Not to be dispersed: νεφέλην Od. 3.150.
(4) Of the voice, tireless (cf. ἀτειρής 2, χαλκεόφωνος) Il. 2.490.
(1) Unspoken: ἔπος Od. 14.466
(2) Unspeakable: γόον Il. 16.37 = Il. 24.741 (v. l. ἀρητόν).

forms: Safe and sound: ζωόν τε καὶ ἀρτεμέα Il. 5.515 = Il. 6.308: φίλοισιν Od. 13.43.

defs: Glib of tongue Il. 22.281.
Fitted, exact, suitable. Absol. in neut. pl.: ἄρτια βάζειν, to speak suitablyIl. 14.92: = Od. 8.240.–ἀ. οἱ ᾔδη, his character suited him, was to his taste(see εἴδω III.12) Il. 5.326: Od. 19.248.
Sound of foot Od. 8.310.– Swift of foot Il. 9.505.
Well balanced in mind, sensible Od. 24.261.
A wheaten cake Od. 17.343, Od. 18.120.

forms: Aor. pple. ἀρτύνας, -αντος Il. 12.43, 86, Il. 13.152: Od. 14.469, Od. 24.153.
3 pl. aor. mid. ἠρτύναντο Od. 4.782, Od. 8.53.
defs: (1) To make ready, prepare: ἔεδνα Od. 1.277 = Od. 2.196.
(2) To set in order, array: σφέας αὐτούς Il. 12.43, 86, Il. 13.152. Cf. Il. 11.216, Il. 15.303. To get together, muster: λόχον Od. 14.469.
(3) To put in position. In mid.: ἐρετμά Od. 4.782 = Od. 8.53.
(4) To plan, contrive: θάνατον Od. 24.153. To devise, invent, frame: ψεύδεα Od. 11.366. To put into words, put forward. In mid.: ἀρτύνετο βουλήν Il. 2.55 = Il. 10.302.
(1) To fashion, form Il. 18.379.
(2) To make ready, prepare: γάμον Od. 4.771.
(3) To plan, contrive: δόλον Od. 11.439. Cf. Od. 3.152, Od. 16.448, Od. 20.242.
Giving rise to mischief Il. 5.63.
To lead, command. With dat.: Ἀργείοισιν Il. 2.345, τρώεσσιν Il. 5.200.
(1) A beginning, a first phase: πήματος Od. 8.81.
(2) A beginning, origin, first cause: κακοῦ Il. 11.604. Cf. Il. 22.116: Od. 21.4, Od. 24.169.– ἐξ ἀρχῆς, from of oldOd. 1.188, Od. 2.254, Od. 11.438, Od. 17.69.
(3) Something to serve as a basis or foundation: ξεινοσύνης Od. 21.35.
(4) An unprovoked aggression Il. 3.100.

forms: Genit. pl. masc. pple. ἀρξάντων Il. 21.437.
Pple. ἀρξάμενος, -ου Il. 19.254: Od. 21.142. (ἀπ-, ἐξ-, ἐπ-, κατ-, ὑπ-,.)
defs: (1) In act. and mid.

(b) As a word of ritual, to cut off (hairs of the victim) as the first-fruits of the sacrifice (cf. ἀπάρχω, κατάρχω): κάπρου ἀπὸ τρίχας ἀρξάμενος Il. 19.254. Sim.: ἀρχόμενος μελέων (cutting off pieces from the limbs as first-fruits) Od. 14.428.
(2) In act.
Help, aid, succour: Ζηνός Il. 4.408, τίμοι ἀρωγῆς; (quasi-partitive genit.; what have I to do with . . . ?) Il. 21.360, ἐπʼ ἀρωγῇ (showing partisanship) Il. 23.574.

forms: A helper, aider Il. 4.235, Il. 8.205, Il. 18.502 (partisans), Il. 21.371, 428: Od. 18.232.

defs: (1) Inextinguishable, unquenchable: γέλως Il. 1.599, φλόξ Il. 16.123. Cf. Il. 11.50, 500, 530, Il. 13.169 = 540, Il. 16.267, Il. 17.89, Il. 22.96: Od. 8.326, Od. 20.346.
(2) Not to be forgotten: κλέος Od. 4.584, Od. 6.333.
Without a leader; hence, without a shepherd: μήλοισιν Il. 10.485.
Difficulty in breathing, panting: ἀργαλὲῳ Il. 15.10, Il. 16.109, ἀ. παύετο Il. 15.241.
Not partaking of food Od. 4.788.

etym: [app. ἀ-2 + σκέλλω. Thus (1) dried up, and so withered,, (2)  rigid (like dried wood).]
defs: (1) worn-out, wearied Od. 10.463.
(2) In neut. ἀσκελές as adv., unrelentingly: κεχόλωται Od. 1.68. Unceasingly: μηκέτʼ ἀ. κλαῖε Od. 4.543.
(1) To work on, work up, prepare or fashion with art: εἴρια Il. 3.388. Cf. Il. 4.110, Il. 10.438, Il. 14.179, 240, Il. 18.592, Il. 23.743: ἑρμῖνα Od. 23.198. Cf. Od. 3.438.
(2) App., to smooth, adjust: χιτῶνα Od. 1.439.
Prepared or fashioned with art: νήματος Od. 4.134, λέχει Od. 23.189.

forms: Acting on impulse without consideration Il. 24.157 = 186.

defs: (1) A leathern bag Od. 10.19, 45, 47.

forms: To welcome, greet: δεξιῇ Il. 10.542: χερσίν Od. 3.35, Od. 19.415, Ὀδυσῆα Od. 22.498.

defs: (1) To gasp or pant in the death-struggle Il. 3.293, Il. 10.521, Il. 12.203, Il. 13.571, 573: Od. 8.526, Od. 12.254, 255, Od. 19.229.
(2) Of convulsive movements of the limbs: πόδεσσιν Od. 19.231, Od. 22.473. Of the heart, to throb Il. 13.443.
(1) Having no seed sown in it, unsown: νῆσος Od. 9.123.
(2) Not growing from (sown) seed Od. 9.109.
(1) Welcomed, welcome, giving gladness: ἀ. γένετʼ ἐλθών Il. 10.35. Cf. Il. 8.488: Od. 5.394, 397, Od. 9.466, Od. 11.431, Od. 23.233.
(2) Glad, well pleased: ἦλθον προτὶ ἄστυ Il. 21.607. Cf. Od. 23.238, 296.
(1) Welcome, giving gladness Od. 13.33.
(1) = ἀσπάσιος 1: ἀ. κε φανείη Od. 23.60. Cf. Od. 23.239. In neut. in impersonal construction: ἀσπαστόν κʼ ἐμοὶ γένοιτο Od. 19.569. Cf. Od. 6.343, Od. 8.295.
(2) In neut. ἀσπαστόν as adv. = ἀσπασίως 1: ὣς Ὀδυσῆʼ ἀ. ἐείσατο γαῖα Od. 5.398. Cf. Od. 13.35.
Without issue Od. 3.303.

etym: [app. for ἀνσπερχής, fr. ἀν- (= ἀνα- 6) + σπέρχω. Thus hastening, pressing on.]
forms: In neut. ἀσπερχές as adv., without intermission or pause Il. 4.32, Il. 16.61, Il. 18.556, Il. 22.10, 188: Od. 1.20.

defs: (2) In neut. ἄσπετον as adv., to a great (and unjustifiable) extent: τρεῖτε Il. 17.332.
(3) In neut. pl. as adv. strengthening πολλά Il. 11.704: Od. 4.75.
Without a struggle: μὴ ἀ. νεῶν ἐπιβαῖεν Il. 8.512. Cf. Il. 15.476, Il. 22.304.

forms: acc. pl. neut. of τις: ὁπποῖʼ ἄσσα εἵματα ἕστο Od. 19.218 (see τις 3.b).
acc. pl. neut. of ὅς τις.
defs: (1) = ὅς τις 1: ἅσσʼ ἔλαχον Il. 9.367. Cf. Od. 3.127: ἅσσʼ ἂν μηδοίμην Od. 5.188. Cf. Od. 6.197, Od. 11.74.–= ὅς τις 4 Il. 10.208 = 409.
(2) With subj. or opt. in relative conditional sentences. See Table at end III.B.a  1, (D) (56).
(1) Near (rather than far off), to within a short distance: φέρον Od. 9.380, πάντʼ ἐφόρει Od. 13.368. Near to, close to. With genit.: ἐμεῖο (into my presence) Il. 24.74: ἔθεν Od. 19.481.

(2) With εἶμι, etc., to approach, draw near: ἀ. ἴτε Il. 1.335. Cf. Il. 7.143 = Od. 3.429, Il. 9.508, Il. 23.8, 667: Od. 9.300, Od. 19.392. To approach, draw near to. With genit.: Ζηνὸς οὐκ ἂν ἀ. ἱκοίμην Il. 14.247. Cf. Il. 22.4: Od. 10.537 = Od. 11.50 = 89, 148, Od. 17.303, Od. 24.221. So of something inanimate, to be brought near to: λοετρὰ καρήατος ἀ. ἱκέσθαι Il. 23.44. With dat.: ἀ. μοι στῆθι Il. 23.97. In hostile sense, to attack, make an attack: μίμνʼ ἀ. ἰόντα Il. 22.92. Cf. Il. 1.567, Il. 15.105.

forms: So as to prevent movement, fast, firmly: ἐχέεν Od. 4.419. Cf. Od. 4.459.

etym: [ἀ-1 + στεμφ- as in στέμφυλον, squeezed olives. Not to be squeezed.]

defs: (2) App., adorned with star-like ornaments (or perh., shining with star-like radiance): θώρηκα Il. 16.134, δόμον Il. 18.370.
Lightning, the lightning flash Il. 11.184, Il. 13.242, Il. 14.386.
The lightener. Epithet of Zeus Il. 1.580, 609, Il. 6.443, Il. 12.275.
(2) A falling star, a fire-ball or meteorite Il. 4.75.

forms: A (fellow-)citizen: ἀστοῖσιν ἀρήγων Il. 11.242: μή μιν πρὶν γνοῖεν ἀστοί Od. 13.192.

defs: (1) One of the vertebrae of the neck Il. 14.466: Od. 10.560 = Od. 11.65.

(2) In pl., a game played with the prepared bones, prob. similar to
              knuckle-bones Il. 23.88.
To send forth lightning, lighten. Of Zeus Il. 2.353, Il. 9.237, Il. 10.5, Il. 17.595.

A town or city (used as = πόλις1 Il. 21.607: Od. 7.177-8, Od. 8.524-5, Od. 14.472-3; but in Il. 17.144 app. the inhabited part of the city as opposed to the citadel; see πόλις (2)) Il. 2.332, Il. 3.116, Il. 7.256, Il. 6.32, etc.: Od. 1.3, Od. 3.107, Od. 4.9, Od. 6.40, etc. With name of a particular town in genit.: ἀ. ζελείης Il. 4.103 = 121. Cf. Il. 14.281, Il. 21.128: Od. 18.1, Od. 22.223.
That makes his voice be heard through the city: κήρυκα Il. 24.701.

forms: Absol. in neut., such a deed: ὥς μʼ ἀσύφηλον ἔρεξεν Il. 9.647.

defs: (1) Straight on, without deviation: ὀλοοίτροχος ἀ. θέει Il. 13.141. Cf. Od. 13.86. Without hesitation, surely on to the point: ἀγορεύει Od. 8.171.
(2) ἀ. μένειν, to remain or stand firm or motionlessIl. 17.436: Od. 17.235. Sim. ἔχει ἀ. (keeps his direction steadily) Il. 23.325.
(1) Fixed, immovable: θεῶν ἕδος Od. 7.42.
(2) In neut. ἀσφαλές as adv., without stumbling or falling Il. 15.683.
The wind-pipe: οὐδʼ ἀπʼ ἀσφάραγον τάμεν Il. 22.328.

forms: Teeming with ἀσφόδελος or king's-spear: λειμῶνα Od. 11.539, 573, Od. 24.13.
To be impatient or unable to contain oneself, chafe Il. 2.293, 297, Il. 22.412, Il. 24.403: Od. 1.304.
With genit. of that which causes the feeling: κτήσιος (i.e. the waste of it) Od. 19.534. Cf. Od. 19.159.
With complementary pple.: θωὴν τίνων Od. 2.193.

defs: Not to be restrained, ungovernable: μένος ἄσχετε (in . . .) Od. 2.85 = Od. 17.406, Od. 2.303. Cf. Od. 3.104, Od. 20.19. Of grief, uncontrollable Il. 16.549.
(2) Like, resembling. With dat.: νυκτί Il. 12.463. Cf. Il. 13.795.
Of a child, with the mind just budding Il. 7.400.

forms: App., in an early stage of life, tender: πώλοισιν Od. 3.222: παρθενικαί Od. 11.39.
Absol. in neut. pl., what is natural to such a stage of life: ἀταλὰ φρονέοντες (in childish glee) Il. 18.567.

defs: Not to be diverted from one's course: νόος Il. 3.63.
A path way or path (cf. ἀταρπιτός.) Il. 17.743: Od. 14.1.

forms: App., baneful, baleful, or the like: ἐπέεσσιν Il. 1.223: μέντορ ἀταρτηρέ Od. 2.243.

defs: (1) Recklessness, criminal folly: σφετέρῃσιν ἀτασθαλίῃσιν ὄλοντο Il. 4.409. Cf. Il. 22.104: Od. 1.7, 34, Od. 10.437, Od. 12.300, Od. 22.317 = 416, Od. 23.67, Od. 24.458.
(2) Such characteristics displayed in deeds: ἀτασθαλίαι οἱ ἐχθραὶ ἔσαν Od. 21.146.
To act recklessly or without regard to consequences Od. 18.57, Od. 19.88.
(1) Reckless, careless of consequences, ungoverned Il. 22.418: Od. 6.60, Od. 8.166, Od. 24.282.
(2) Of character, deeds, etc., displaying such characteristics: μένος Il. 13.634. Cf. Od. 16.86, Od. 22.314, Od. 24.352.

(3) In neut. ἀτάσθαλον, a deed displaying such characteristics: οὔ ποτʼ ἀ. ἄνδρα ἐώργει Od. 4.693. In neut. pl. ἀτάσθαλα, such deeds: ἀ. μηχανόωντο Il. 11.695. Cf. Od. 3.207, Od. 16.93, Od. 17.588, Od. 18.139, 143, Od. 20.170, 370, Od. 22.47.
(1) Not to be worn away, hard: χαλκός Il. 5.292. Cf. Il. 6.247, Il. 14.25, Il. 18.474, Il. 19.233, Od. 3.108: Od. 13.368. Fig., of the heart Il. 3.60.
(2) Not liable to fatigue Il. 15.697. Of the voice (cf. ἄρρηκτος 4) Il. 13.45, Il. 17.555, Il. 22.227. Sim. of character: μένος αἰὶν ἀ. (sturdy, unwearying) Od. 11.270.
(1) Not accomplished or performed: τὰ ἔσσεται οὐκ ἀτέλεστα Il. 4.168. Cf. Od. 2.273, Od. 8.571, Od. 18.345.
(2) To no end, resulting in nothing: πόνον Il. 4.26, 57.
(3) In neut. ἀτέλεστον as adv., endlessly, continually Od. 16.111.

forms: = ἀτέλεστος. (1): οὐκ ἐμὸν ἀτελεύτητον (my word never fails) Il. 1.527. Cf. Il. 4.175.

defs: (1) To wrong, treat improperly or with injustice: θυμὸν Ἀχαιῶν (plays or trifles with . . .) Od. 2.90. Cf. Od. 20.294, Od. 21.312.

(2) With genit., to debar from (one's due): ἴσης Il. 11.705: Od. 9.42 = 549. To deprive of: ἀτέμβονται νεότητος (have been robbed (by age) of their youthful vigour) Il. 23.445.–ἀτεμβόμενος σιδήρου, app., lacking Il. 23.834.
(1) Aloof or apart from: ἀ. ἄλλων Il. 1.498. Cf. Il. 5.753.

(2) Without: ἀ. πολέμου (not on a warlike errand) Il. 4.376, ἀ. λαῶν Il. 5.473, ἀ. Ζηνός (without his goodwill) Il. 15.292. Cf. Il. 9.604, Il. 21.50, Il. 23.441: ἀ. σπείρου Od. 2.102, Od. 19.147 = Od. 24.137. Cf. Od. 6.325, Od. 21.409.
(1) Joyless: χῶρον Od. 11.94.
(2) Causing pain or distress, painful, dangerous, gruesome: λιμός Il. 19.354: χώρῳ Od. 6.279, δαῖτα Od. 10.124.
To act rashly or recklessly Od. 3.332.
(1) Stupor: ἀ. φρένας εἷλεν Il. 16.805.

(2) Blindness of the mind sent by the gods, a divine perversion or deception of the mind leading to evil-doing or mischance: Ζεύς μʼ ἄτῃ ἐνέδησεν Il. 2.111 = Il. 9.18, ὡς ὅτʼ ἂν ἄνδρʼ ἀ. λάβῃ Il. 24.480 (the time of this clause and of κατακτείνας in 481 the same; the homicide has been done under impulse of the ἄτη). Cf. Il. 1.412 = Il. 16.274, Il. 7.356, Il. 8.237, Il. 19.88, Il. 24.28: ἄτην μετέστενον Od. 4.261. Cf. Od. 15.233, Od. 21.302, Od. 23.223. In pl. Il. 9.115, Il. 19.270.– Personified Il. 9.504, 505, 512, Il. 19.91, 126, 129, 136.
(3) Such blindness or deception of human origin. In pl. Il. 10.391.
(4) Hurt, harm: εἴς μʼ ἄτην κοιμήσατε (to my hurt) Od. 12.372.
To pay no heed Od. 3.166.
(2) To dishonour by conjugal unfaithfulness: ἄκοιτιν Il. 9.450.

To treat with dishonour or no regard, hold in contempt, show no respect or regard for, slight: Il. 1.94, 356 = 507  =  Il. 2.240, Il. 7.522, Il. 8.163, Il. 9.62, 111, Il. 14.127: Od. 14.57, Od. 16.274, 307, Od. 20.133, Od. 21.99, Od. 23.28.

forms: Despised; or perh., to whose life no blood-money is attached, whom anyone may slay with impunity: μετανάστην Il. 9.648 = Il. 16.59.
Dishonour: ἀτιμίῃσιν ἰάλλειν (to fling at, assail, with acts of dishonour) Od. 13.142.

defs: (1) Held in no respect, regard or esteem Il. 1.171. In comp.: ἀτιμότερόν με θήσεις Il. 16.90. In superl.: ἀτιμοτάτη θεός Il. 1.516.
(2) In neut. ἄτιμον as adv., without making recompense Od. 16.431.
(2) In reference to animals, to rear. Of horses Il. 5.271, Il. 24.280. Of swine Od. 14.41. Of a goose Od. 15.174.
(1) Unavenged: οὐκ ἄτῖτος κεῖτʼ?̓́ασιος Il. 13.414.
(2) Unpaid: ἵνα μὴ ποινὴ ἄτιτος ἔῃ Il. 14.484.

etym: [ἀτραπός (prob. fr. ἀ-2 + τραπέω) + ἰτ-, εἶμι. Thus a way worn by continual treading.]
forms: A path way or path (cf. ἀταρπός) Od. 13.195.

defs: (1) = ἀτρεκέως.: οὐ δεκὰς ἀ. (not just ten) Od. 16.245.
(2) Surely, certainly Il. 5.208.
Steady, dauntless: μένος Il. 5.126, Il. 17.157, θυμός Il. 16.163.

That yields no fruit, barren: ἁλός Il. 1.316, 327, Il. 24.752, θαλάσσης Il. 14.204, πόντον Il. 15.27, αἰθέρος Il. 17.425: ἁλός Od. 1.72, Od. 5.52, Od. 7.226, Od. 8.49, Od. 10.179, πόντον Od. 2.370, Od. 5.84 = 158, Od. 5.140, Od. 6.79, Od. 13.419, Od. 17.289.
Thus, the unwearied one. Name of Athene Il. 2.157  =  Il. 5.714 = Il. 21.420, Il. 5.115, Il. 10.284: Od. 4.762 = Od. 7.324.

etym: [a widely spread word for father, doubtless derived from childish speech.]
forms: Used in addressing an elder Il. 9.607, Il. 17.561: Od. 16.31, 57, 130, Od. 17.6, 599, Od. 21.369.

defs: (1) To be terrified or distraught, to be panic-stricken, flee scared: ἀτυζόμενοι φοβέοντο Il. 7.41, ἀτυζομένην ἀπολέσθαι (distraught to the point of death) Il. 22.474. Cf. Il. 7.38, Il. 8.183, Il. 15.90, Il. 18.7, Il. 21.4, 554: Od. 11.606, Od. 23.42.
(2) To be scared or put out by: πατρὸς ὄψιν ἀτυχθείς Il. 7.468.

(1) Again, once more: ἔφυγες θάνατον Il. 11.362, νῦν αὖ μʼ ἄνωγας . . .  (to risk myself again) Il. 14.262. Cf. Il. 16.477, Il. 21.82, etc.: νῦν αὖ δεῦρʼ ἱκόμην (have come again to your aid) Od. 13.303. Cf. Od. 12.116, Od. 20.88, etc.
(2) In impatient or remonstrative questions, again, now this time: τίς δὴ αὖ τοι συμφράσσατο βουλάς; Il. 1.540. Cf. Il. 6.24: Od. 23.264.
(3) In return or requital: τοῖσιν αὖ θάνατος ἔσσεται Il. 4.270. Cf. Il. 10.292, Il. 21.399: Od. 3.382, Od. 21.363.
(4) In one's turn: ἔνθʼ αὖ νείκεσεν Il. 5.471. Cf. Il. 11.145, etc.: νέστωρ αὖ τότʼ ἐφῖζεν Od. 3.411. Cf. Od. 8.129, etc.
(5) In reply: τὸν αὖ ἀντίον ηὔδα Il. 5.647. Cf. Il. 13.254, etc.: Od. 1.213, Od. 15.485, etc.

(6) Adversative: ἀρχοὺς αὖ ἐρέω Il. 2.493. Cf. Il. 11.367, etc.: Od. 14.174, etc. On the other hand, again: ὃν δʼ αὖ δήμου ἄνδρα ἴδοι Il. 2.198. Cf. Il. 3.200, 332, Il. 4.17, Il. 11.109, Il. 17.312, etc.: χωρὶς δʼ αὖ . . . Od. 4.130. Cf. Od. 2.48, Od. 3.425, Od. 4.211, Od. 5.221, etc.

(7) Particle of transition or continuation: ἔνθʼ αὖ ἕλεν ἄνδρα Il. 16.603. Cf. Il. 2.618, Il. 9.700, Il. 12.182, Il. 15.138, etc.: αἰδὼς δʼ αὖ . . . Od. 3.24. Cf. Od. 4.727, Od. 5.18, Od. 9.349, Od. 11.6, etc. App. introducing a narrative Od. 3.215.
To dry: ὄφρα φοροίη [ῥόπαλον] αὐανθέν (when dried) Od. 9.321.

etym: [αὐγή, the sense light passing into that of sight.]

defs: (2) Of lightning. In pl. Il. 13.244. So ἵκετο Διὸς αὐγάς (the home of lightning) Il. 13.837.
(3) Of the gleam from polished armour: αὐγὴ χαλκείη Il. 13.341.
(4) Of the sun Il. 17.371, Il. 22.134: Od. 7.98, Od. 12.176. In pl. of his rays Il. 8.480, Il. 16.181, Od. 11.498, 619, Od. 15.349. So of rays from a star Il. 22.27.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative αὐδήσασκε Il. 5.786, Il. 17.420. (ἐξ-, μετ-, παρ-, προσ-.)
defs: (1) To speak: ηὔδα μάντις Il. 1.92, οὐδʼ ἔκλυον αὐδήσασντος (by word of mouth) Il. 10.47. Cf. Il. 16.76, Il. 17.420: Od. 3.337, Od. 4.505, Od. 9.497. Of shouting Il. 5.786.
(2) To say, speak, utter: ἔπος Il. 7.54, Il. 10.377, Il. 11.379, Il. 12.163, etc., αὔδα ὅ τι φρονέεις Il. 14.195 = Il. 18.426: = Od. 5.89, ἔπος Od. 13.199.
(3) To address (a person): τὸν (etc.) ἀντίον ηὔδα Il. 3.203, Il. 4.265, Il. 5.217, Il. 11.822, etc.: Od. 1.213, Od. 2.242, Od. 4.155, Od. 5.28, etc.
(4) With double construction of (2) and (3): ἔπος μιν ἀντίον ηὔδα Il. 5.170.

(1) Voice, speech: Ἕκτορος αὐδήν Il. 13.757, θεῷ ἐναλίγκιος αὐδήν (in . . . ) Il. 19.250. Cf. Il. 1.249, Il. 15.270, Il. 19.418: τοῦ τερπόμεθʼ αὐδῇ Od. 4.160. Cf. Od. 1.371 = Od. 9.4, Od. 2.268 = 401 = Od. 22.206 = Od. 24.503 = 548, Od. 2.297, Od. 4.831, Od. 10.311, 481.
(2) The faculty of speech: ἔχοντʼ ἐν στήθεσιν αὐδήν Il. 4.430. Cf. Il. 18.419.
(3) A rumour or report: θεοῦ αὐδήν (sent abroad by a god) Od. 14.89.
(4) Applied to sound produced by twitching a stretched bowstring Od. 21.411.
(1) Having the power of speech: αὐδήεντα ἔθηκεν Il. 19.407.
(2) Using the speech of mortals (as opposed to that of the gods): θεὸς αὐδήεσσα Od. 10.136 = Od. 11.8 = Od. 12.150, Od. 12.449.
(3) As a general epithet of human (as opposed to divine) beings Od. 5.334, Od. 7.125.
(1) To pull up, pull out of the ground: στήλας Il. 12.261.
(2) To draw back.
(b) Of drawing back the head of a sacrificial victim Il. 1.459 = Il. 2.422.

(1) On the spot, there: αὐ. μένων Il. 1.492, ὲζόμενος δὲ κατʼ αὐ. (κατά adv. with the pple.) Il. 13.653, κατʼ αὐ. λίπον Il. 17.535. Cf. Il. 2.328, Il. 10.62, Il. 11.48, Il. 13.37, Il. 22.137, etc.: αὐ. παρʼ Ἀτρεΐδῃ Od. 3.156. Cf. Od. 4.416, Od. 8.275, Od. 10.567, Od. 17.357, etc. So παρʼ αὐ. = παρʼ αὐτόθι (see αὐτόθι (1)) Il. 23.163.
(2) On the spot, here: μηκέτʼ αὐ. λεγώμεθα Il. 2.435. Cf. Il. 3.291, Il. 7.84, Il. 9.412, Il. 13.233, etc.: μένʼ αὐ. Od. 2.369. Cf. Od. 6.314, Od. 12.24, Od. 13.44, Od. 20.220, etc.
(3) On the spot, at once: αὐ. λύθη ψυχή Il. 5.296. Cf. Il. 7.281, Il. 11.141, Il. 16.331, Il. 17.298, etc.: Od. 18.91, etc.
With united shout: ἄβρομοι αὐΐαχοι Il. 13.41.
Of the αὐλή· οὐδοῦ (the threshold of the gateway leading into the αὐλή) Od. 1.104, θύρῃσιν (= αἰθούσης θύρῃσιν; see under αἴθουσα (2)) Od. 18.239, Od. 23.49.

(2) A courtyard in front of or surrounding a house: ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ αὐλῆς Il. 9.472, ἑρκίον αὐλῆς 476.  Cf. Il. 7.247, 316, Il. 11.774, Il. 24.161, 452, 640: ὅθι οἱ θάλαμος αὐλῆς δέδμητο (in the αὐλή) Od. 1.425, δόμοι καὶ αὐ. Od. 7.303. Cf. Od. 2.300, Od. 4.678, Od. 6.112, 130, Od. 10.10, Od. 15.162, Od. 16.343, Od. 17.266, Od. 18.101, 102, 237, Od. 20.355, Od. 21.191, 240, 389, Od. 22.137, 376, 442 = 459, 449, 474, 494.
(3) App. loosely as = δῶμα 3..b Od. 4.74.
Of cattle, etc., to be driven back to the steading, come home Od. 12.265, Od. 14.412.
(1) A bird's roosting-place Od. 22.470.
(2) A bivouac: αὖλιν ἔθεντο Il. 9.232.

(1) A wind-instrument resembling a flute or clarionet: αὐλῶν συρίγγων τʼ ἐνοπήν (app. (to avoid asyndeton) to be rendered flute-pipes, taking αὐλῶν συρίγγων as virtually a compound word) Il. 10.13, αὐλοὶ φόρμιγγές τε Il. 18.495.
(2) Applied (app. from resemblance to a tube) to a jet or column of blood Od. 22.18.
(3) A hollow or socket in a spear-head to receive the end of the shaft Il. 17.297.
(4) A tube or sheath to receive a pin of a περόνη Od. 19.227 ( = the κληῗδες of Od. 18.294: see κληΐς 5).

forms: App., with tubes for the eyes, i.e. having a vizor furnished with eye-holes Il. 5.182, Il. 11.353, Il. 13.530, Il. 16.795.

defs: (1) Dry, dried up Il. 23.327: Od. 5.240 (sapless), Od. 18.309. Made of well-dried hide Il. 12.137, Il. 17.493.
(2) In neut. αὖον as adv., with a dry, i.e. a harsh or grating sound (cf. καρφαλέος 2): κόρυθες αὖον ἀΰτευν Il. 12.160. Cf. Il. 13.441.
(1) Sleepless, not able to sleep Od. 9.404.
(2) Doing without sleep Od. 10.84, Od. 19.591.
(3) Sleepless, in which one does not sleep: νύκτας Il. 9.325: Od. 19.340.
A breeze: αὐ. ψυχρὴ πνέει Od. 5.469.
(1) To-morrow: ἄφρα μοι ἕπηται αὐ. Il. 9.429. Cf. Il. 8.535, Il. 9.357, 692, Il. 18.269: Od. 1.272, Od. 18.23.
(2) As quasi-sb.: ἠελίου ἀνιόντος ἐς αὔριον Il. 8.538. Cf. Od. 6.318, Od. 11.351.
Chosen by oneself, at one's choice; or perh., taken of itself, to be had for the taking Od. 16.148.
(1) Adversative particle, but.
(2) Particle of transition or continuation.
(b) ἀτάρ: μάψ, ἀ. οὐ κατὰ κόσμον (yea) Il. 2.214. Cf. Il. 1.506, Il. 2.313, Il. 3.268, Il. 4.484, etc.: Od. 1.181, 419, Od. 2.240, Od. 3.138, etc.
(3) ἀτάρ introducing a statement or injunction: Ἕκτορ, ἀ. σὺ πόλινδε μετέρχεο Il. 7.86. Cf. Il. 7.429, Il. 22.331: Od. 4.236.–αὐτάρ introd. an apodosis Il. 3.290, Il. 22.390.
(1) In the reverse direction, back: ὅτʼ ἂν αὐ. νεώμεθα Il. 6.335. Cf. Il. 4.384, Il. 8.139, etc.
(2) Of resumption of a state or condition, again. With ἐξαῦτις: αὐ. ἐξαῦτις ἀνέστη Il. 15.287.

(3) Again, once more: ἀγορῇ νικᾷς Il. 2.370, ὅτε δὴ αὐ.  Ἕκτωρ Ἀργείους ὀλέκεσκεν (i.e. in this second instance) Il. 19.134. Cf. Il. 2.221 (as usual), Il. 3.191, Il. 8.373, Il. 9.702, Il. 14.454 (meaning that his aim is always good), Il. 21.421, etc.: αὐ. δύω μάρψας Od. 9.311. Cf. Od. 5.356, Od. 22.165, 281, etc.

(4) In impatient or remonstrative questions, again, now, this time: τίπτʼ αὐ. εἰλήλουθας; Il. 1.202. Cf. Il. 2.225, Il. 6.448, Il. 14.364, Od. 3.16, Il. 21.394: Od. 7.119 = Od. 13.200, Od. 10.281, Od. 11.93, Od. 20.33.
(5) In one's turn: ὁ αὐ. δῶκʼ Ἀτρέϊ Il. 2.105. Cf. Il. 1.404, Il. 5.541, Il. 10.283, Il. 13.414, Il. 23.278, etc.: ἔνθʼ αὐ. εὐρυδάμαντα βάλεν (i.e. his turn had come) Od. 22.283. Cf. Od. 8.127.
(6) In reply: τὸν αὐ. προσέειπεν Il. 1.206. Cf. Il. 3.58, 203, Il. 4.265, Il. 7.144, etc.: Od. 1.178, 221, 383, 399, etc.

(7) Adversative: νῦν μὲν . . . ὕστερον αὐ. μαχήσονται Il. 6.30. Cf. Il. 3.67, etc.: νῦν αὐ. πανύστατος Od. 9.452, etc. On the other hand, again: Τρώων αὐ. ἀγορὴ γένετο Il. 6.345. Cf. Il. 5.279, Il. 6.248, Il. 8.55, Il. 11.56, etc.: ἄλλοτε δʼ αὐ. παύομαι Od. 4.102. Cf. Od. 1.111, Od. 5.29 (for your part), Od. 12.282 (as we cannot do here), Od. 16.463, etc.

(8) Particle of transition or continuation: Ἕκτωρ δʼ αὐ. χάρη Il. 3.76. Cf. Il. 1.237, Il. 2.407, Il. 7.73, Il. 8.26, etc.: ἡμῖν δʼ αὐ. ἐπεπείθετο θυμός Od. 2.103. Cf. Od. 2.335, 386, Od. 9.256, Od. 11.21, etc.

(9) Hereafter, in the future, yet: εἴ ποτε δὴ αὐ. χρειὼ ἐμεῖο γένηται Il. 1.340. Cf. Il. 1.578, Il. 5.232, Il. 9.135, Il. 15.16, Il. 23.605, etc.: ἡμεῖς δʼ αὐ. τισόμεθα Od. 13.14. Cf. Od. 8.444, Od. 18.48.
(1) To shout, cry, call Od. 3.50, Il. 21.582. Of the sound of struck armour Il. 12.160.
(2) To shout or call to: πάντας ἀρίστους Il. 11.258.
(1) A shout or cry Il. 2.153, Il. 11.466: Od. 7.122, Od. 14.265 = Od. 17.434. Shouting: εἴ ποτʼ ἀϋτῆς σχοίατο Il. 2.97.
(3) Battle: δηΐων ἐν ἀϋτῇ Il. 17.167. Cf. Il. 1.492, Il. 5.732, Il. 7.328, Il. 11.802 = Il. 16.44, Il. 13.621, Il. 14.37, 96, Il. 16.63: Τρώων ὑπεξέφυγον ἀϋτήν Od. 11.383.
(1) On the same day, on that day Il. 18.454: Od. 3.311.
(2) For that day Il. 1.81.

forms: Forthwith, straightway, at once: αὐ. ἆλτο χαμᾶζε Il. 3.29. Cf. Il. 1.118, 199, 539, Il. 2.322, etc.: αὐ. μνηστῆρας ἐπῴχετο Od. 1.324. Cf. Od. 2.367, 379, Od. 3.54, 448, etc.

defs: (1) In the reverse direction, backwards, back, back again: ἴτην Il. 1.347, ἐλεύσεται 425. Cf. Il. 1.522, Il. 2.208, Il. 3.36, Il. 4.19, etc.: ὑποστρέψας Od. 8.301, κυλίνδετο λᾶας Od. 11.598. Cf. Od. 1.317, Od. 3.164, Od. 4.478, Od. 5.430, Od. 9.496, etc. With πάλιν. See πάλιν 1.

(2) Back to a former state or condition, again: αὐ. ἐμπνύνθη Il. 5.697. Cf. Il. 4.222, Il. 6.462, Il. 9.368, Il. 12.31, Il. 15.60, etc.: αὐ. ἄρʼ ἕζετο Od. 17.602. Cf. Od. 4.549, Od. 10.461, etc. With ἄψ. See ἄψ 2.

(3) Again, once more: ἰόντα Il. 1.27. Cf. Il. 1.513, Il. 6.170, Il. 10.463 (as on former occasions), Il. 18.153, Il. 22.449 (giving changed orders), etc.: αὐ. οἱ πόρον οἶνον Od. 9.360. Cf. Od. 3.161, Od. 9.354, Od. 12.453, Od. 15.439, Od. 19.65, etc.
(4) Adversative: ὅς σʼ αὐ. κτείναιμι (in spite of that) Od. 14.405.
(5) Particle of transition: αὐ. δʼ ἐκ κολεοῖο ἐρυσσάμενος ξίφος (and then . . .) Il. 12.190. Cf. Od. 18.60.
(6) At another time,  on some future occasion, another day: μεταφρασόμεσθα καὶ αὐ. Il. 1.140. Cf. Il. 3.440.

(2) Of the wind from bellows Il. 18.471. Of the blowing of the winds Od. 11.400 = 407. Of the breath of fire Il. 21.366: Od. 9.389, Od. 16.290 = Od. 19.9, Od. 19.20 (in these three passages referring to smoke). Of fragrance or odour: κνίσης αὐ. Od. 12.369. Cf. Il. 14.174.
(1) Breath Il. 23.765.
(2) Of the blowing of the winds Od. 3.289.

etym: [αὐτός + ὁδός (with Aeolic smooth breathing). On or by the same way.]
forms: In neut. αὐτόδιον as adv., straightway: αὐ. μιν λούσασθαι ἀνώγει Od. 8.449.

defs: In neut. αὐτόετες as adv., within the same year, in a year's space Od. 3.322.
(1) From the place in which one is. With complementary words: αὐ. ἐξ ἕδρης Il. 19.77. Cf. Od. 13.56, Od. 21.420.
(2) On the spot, at once Od. 3.120.

(1) On the spot, there: αὐ. ὀλέσθαι Il. 3.428, λιπέτην (λεῖπἐ κατʼ αὐ. (κατά adv. with the vb.) Il. 10.273, Il. 21.201. Cf. Il. 5.847, Il. 14.119, Il. 16.294, 848, Il. 19.403, Od. 3.340, Il. 21.496, Il. 24.673, 707: αὐ. μεῖνεν Od. 4.508, κατʼ αὐ. λιπόντε (see above) Od. 21.90. Cf. Od. 4.302, Od. 9.29, 496, Od. 10.132, Od. 11.187, Od. 12.161, Od. 14.285, 525, Od. 15.327, Od. 17.254, Od. 24.464. So παρʼ αὐ. (app. by confusion with αὐτόφι, locative of αὐτός): κτενέειν παρʼ αὐ. πάντας ἀρίστους Il. 13.42. Cf. Od. 3.140, Il. 23.147, 640.
A sister of the whole blood Od. 10.137.
A brother of the whole blood Il. 2.706, Il. 3.238, Il. 11.427, Il. 13.534, Il. 14.156, Il. 16.718.
(1) Without being asked, of one's own accord: ἦλθεν Il. 2.408.
(2) Self-acting, self-moving, self-impelled: αὐτόμαται πύλαι μύκον Il. 5.749 = Il. 8.393. Cf. Il. 18.376.
This very night Il. 8.197.

forms: Locative αὐτόφι Il. 12.302. This form as ablative Il. 11.44.
Crasis with ὁ gives ωὐτός Il. 5.396.
defs: (1) Anaphoric pronoun in emphatic use.

(3) Without change, the same: αὐτὰ κέλευθα Il. 12.225. Cf. Il. 23.480: Od. 8.107, Od. 21.366, etc. With the article: ωὐτὸς ἀνήρ Il. 5.396. Cf. Il. 7.391: ἐκ τοκήων τῶν αὐτῶν Od. 6.55. Cf. Od. 16.334, etc. So with ὅδε: τοῦδʼ αὐτοῦ λυκάβαντος Od. 14.161 = Od. 19.306. The very . . .: ἄκρον ὑπὸ λόφον αὐτόν Il. 13.615. Cf. Od. 10.158.

(4) Idiomatically with sb. in comitative dat. or instrumental, with or without σύν, just as it is(was), . . . and all: αὐτῇ κεν γαίῃ ἐρύσαιμι Il. 8.24, αὐτοῖσιν ὄχεσφιν Il. 8.290, Il. 11.699, αὐτῇ σὺν φόρμιγγι Il. 9.194. Cf. Il. 9.542, Il. 14.498, Od. 3.482, Il. 23.8: αὐτῷ φάρει ἀναΐξας Od. 8.186. Cf. Od. 13.118, Od. 14.77, Od. 20.219, Od. 21.54.
(5) As reflexive pronoun: ἄνευ ἕθεν οὐδὲ σὺν αὐτῷ Il. 17.407. Cf. Il. 9.342, Od. 3.55: κλέος αὐτῇ ποιεῖται Od. 2.125. Cf. Od. 4.247.

(6) In unemphatic use as anaphoric pronoun of the 3rd person (never in nom. or at the beginning of a clause), he, she, it, etc.: βούλομαι αὐτὴν οἴκοι ἔχειν Il. 1.112, μάλα τʼ ἔκλυον αὐτοῦ 218. Cf. Il. 1.47, 360, Il. 3.25, 436, Il. 5.42, 170, etc.: κήρυκες αὐτοῖσι οἶνον ἔμισγον Od. 1.109, ἀπὸ δʼ ἔσχισεν αὐτήν Od. 4.507. Cf. Od. 1.143, Od. 2.128, 154, Od. 3.22, 249, Od. 4.110, 522, 634, etc.

forms: stand-up (of fighting) ἐν αὐτοσταδίῃ [ὑσμίνῃ], in stand-up fighting Il. 13.325.

defs: From close at hand Il. 16.319.
(1) αὐτοσχεδίῃ [ὑσμίνῃ,], in close combat Il. 15.510.
(2) Adv. of acc. fem. form αὐτοσχεδίην = αὐτοσχεδόν. Il. 12.192, Il. 17.294: Od. 11.536.
From close at hand, at close quaters: αὐ. κʼ οὐτάζοντο Il. 6.273. Cf. Il. 13.496, 526, Il. 15.386, 708, 746, Il. 17.530: Od. 22.293.
(1) In the same place, where one is or finds oneself: αὐ. ἔμειναν Il. 15.656. Cf. Il. 9.634, Il. 18.488, etc.: ἔσχετʼ αὐ. νηῦς Od. 12.204. Cf. Od. 5.274, Od. 11.152, etc.
(2) On that spot, there: τὸν δεʼ λίπʼ αὐ. Il. 1.428. Cf. Il. 4.292, Il. 5.886, Il. 7.192, Il. 8.207, etc.: αὐ. ἰχθυάᾳ Od. 12.95. Cf. Od. 3.397, Od. 4.639, Od. 5.68, Od. 9.194, etc.
(3) Here: αὐ. ἐνὶ τροίῃ Il. 2.237. Cf. Il. 2.332, Il. 5.262, Il. 13.751, Il. 18.330, etc.: αὐ. τῷδʼ ἐνὶ δήμῳ Od. 2.317. Cf. Od. 3.427, Od. 5.362, Od. 10.266, Od. 11.332, etc.
(4) On the spot, at once: αὐ. οἱ θάνατον μητίσομαι Il. 15.349. Cf. Il. 16.649,  Il. 17.416, Il. 21.114, etc.: αὐ. κε πότμον ἐπίσποι Od. 2.250. Cf. Od. 4.703, Od. 9.303, Od. 18.212, etc.

etym: [app. for αὐτόχωνος = αὐτοχόανος, fr. αὐτός + χόανος.]
defs: Of a mass of iron, just as it came from the smelting furnace, i.e. in the condition of pig-iron: σόλον Il. 23.826.
(1) Without change, as before, as ever: ἔργον αὐ. ἀκράαντόν [ἐστιν] Il. 2.138. Cf. Od. 13.336.

(2) Just as one or it is (was): αὐ. ἧσθαι δευόμενον Il. 1.133, ὅσσʼ ἔρρεξεν αὐ. (without extraneous aid) Il. 10.50, κτενέει με αὐ. (without effort) Il. 22.125, λευκὸν ἔτʼ αὐ. (fresh from the maker's hand) Il. 23.268, δίδωμί τοι τόδʼ ἄεθλον αὐ. (without a contest) 621. Cf. Il. 5.255, Il. 16.117, Il. 18.198, 338, Il. 24.413: οἴχεται αὐ. (trusting to his own resources) Od. 4.665, αὐ. ἐκείμεθα Od. 13.281, οὐδέ τις ἡμέας αὐ. ἀππέμψει (empty-handed) Od. 15.83, ἦ αὐ. κεῖται ἀκηδής; (without attention) Od. 20.130. Cf. Od. 12.284.–καὶ αὐ., even as it is, without that: καὶ αὐ. νεικεῖ Il. 1.520. Strengthening ὥς Il. 3.339, Il. 6.430, Il. 9.195, Il. 10.25: Od. 3.64, Od. 7.166, Od. 9.31, Od. 20.238, Od. 21.203, 225, Od. 22.114, Od. 24.409.
(4) Just, merely, only, doing no more: αὐ. ἐνδίεσαν κύνας Il. 18.584. Cf. Il. 14.18: φαγέμεν αὐ. (has not so much as barely eaten) Od. 16.143. Cf. Od. 7.143, Od. 14.151, Od. 17.309.

(5) To no end or purpose, idly, uselessly, vainly: αὐ. ἐριδαίνομεν Il. 2.342, κακὸν ἤμυνε καὶ αὐ. Il. 9.599. Cf. Il. 13.104, 810, Il. 15.128, 513, Il. 17.633, Il. 21.474, Il. 23.74: αὐ. ἄχθος ἀρούρης (a useless cumberer of the ground) Od. 20.379. Cf. Od. 16.313. Just for that, idly: εὔχεαι Il. 11.388. Cf. Il. 17.450. Idly, without justification: αὐ. σε κλέος ἐσθλὸν ἔχει Il. 17.143. Cf. Od. 3.348. Idly, thoughtlessly, lightly: σῖτον ἔδοντας μὰψ αὐ. Od. 16.111.
Of the neck Od. 3.450.

forms: To be squalid or dirty Od. 24.250.
To get fire, get a light: ἵνα μή ποθεν ἄλλοθεν αὕῃ (αὔᾐ Od. 5.490.
Pple. ἀΰσας, -αντος (ὐ Il. 2.334, Il. 4.508, Il. 7.66, Il. 11.285, etc.
defs: (1) To shout, cry, call: ἀϋσάντων ὑπʼ Ἀχαιῶν Il. 2.334, ἤϋσεν Ἥρη Il. 5.784. Cf. Il. 7.110, Il. 8.227, Il. 11.10, Il. 14.147, Il. 18.217, Il. 21.307, etc.: Od. 7.117, Od. 24.530. Of the sound of struck armour: ἀσπὶς ἄϋσεν Il. 13.409. Cf. Il. 13.441.
(2) To shout or call to: αὖεν ἑταίρους Il. 11.461, Il. 13.477. Cf. Od. 9.65.

forms: Imp. mid. with hyphaeresis and uncontracted prefix ἀποαίρεο (for ἀποαιρέεὀ Il. 1.275.
Infin. with uncontracted prefix ἀποαιρεῖσθαι Il. 1.230.
defs: (1) To take away or remove: θυρεόν Od. 9.313, σῖτον Il. 14.455.
(2) In mid.
(b) To take away or remove  from. With genit.: τεύχεʼ ὤμοιιν ἀφελέσθαι Il. 5.622 = Il. 13.511. Cf. Il. 16.560: Od. 22.219.

(c) With double acc. of what is taken away and of the person deprived of it: ὡς ἔμʼ ἀφαιρεῖται χρυσηΐδα Il. 1.182. Cf. Il. 1.275, Il. 22.18. With the personal acc. to be supplied: δῶρʼ ἀποαιρεῖσθαι [κεῖνον] ὅς τις . . . Il. 1.230. With this acc. alone: ἐπεί μʼ ἀφέλεσθέ γε δόντες Il. 1.299.
Having no φάλος Il. 10.258.

forms: Dat. sing. fem. pple. ἀφαμαρτούσῃ Il. 7.411.
defs: (1) To discharge a missile vainly, miss one's aim: οὐδʼ ἀφάμαρτε Il. 11.350, Il. 13.160, Il. 14.403, Il. 16.322, Il. 21.591, Il. 22.290, ἀπήμβροτε δουρί Il. 16.477.
(2) To fail to hit, miss. With genit.: τοῦ Il. 8.119, 302, Il. 15.521, Il. 21.171, αὐτοῦ Il. 16.466.
(3) To lose, be deprived of. With genit.: σεῦ Il. 7.411.
Stumbling in speech Il. 3.215.

forms: With dat.: ὑμῖν ὅδε μῦθος Od. 16.387.

defs: Caused to disappear, made away with Il. 7.60, Od. 3.303.

(1) Quickly, speedily, soon, at once, forthwith: ἕζετο Il. 1.349, ἵπποισι τάθη δρόμος (i.e. directly they had turned) Il. 23.375. Cf. Il. 1.594, Il. 2.453  =  Il. 11.13, Il. 10.537, Il. 12.221, Il. 17.392, 750, Il. 19.405, Il. 22.270, Il. 24.446: οἴχεται Od. 1.410. Cf. Od. 2.95 = Od. 24.130, Od. 3.456, Od. 4.85, Od. 5.482, Od. 7.49, Od. 8.270, 409, Od. 9.328, Od. 10.122, Od. 11.274, Od. 17.305, Od. 19.140, Od. 21.307.
(2) Without hesitation: μένουσιν Il. 11.418.
(3) Of a surety, truly: ἀ. κε δοῦναι βουλοίμην Il. 23.593. Cf. Il. 13.814, Il. 17.417: ἀ. σφι τόδε λώϊόν ἐστιν Od. 2.169.
(4) In vague intensifying sense: ἔφθη ὀρεξάμενος . . . ὦμον ἀ. (right into the . . .) Il. 16.323, ἀ. κλονέοντο πεφυζότες (in wild confusion) Il. 21.528.
To snatch from. With genit.: κόρυθα κρατός Il. 13.189.

etym: [app. comp. from, and with sense due to the notion of speed implicit in, ἄφαρ.]

defs: (1) Powerless, feeble: παιδός Il. 6.235. In comp.: σέο ἀφαυρότερος Il. 6.457. In superl.: ἀφαυρότατος Ἀχαιῶν Il. 15.11. Cf. Od. 20.110.
(2) Of a missile, ineffective. In comp.: ἵνα μή οἱ ἀφαυρότερον βέλος εἴη Il. 12.458 (μὴ ἀ. = the more effective, being comp. in dependent form of οὐκ ἀφαυρός, which by litotes  =  effective).

forms: Acc. sing. masc. pres. pple. ἁφόωντα.
defs: To handle, turn over: ἀσπίδα Il. 7.322.
Riches, wealth Il. 1.171, Il. 23.299: Od. 14.99.

etym: [ἀφ-, ἀπο- 1 + ἡ-, ἵημι1. The sender forth.]
forms: The Archer. Name of Apollo Il. 9.404.

defs: Not liable to decay, imperishable Il. 2.46, 186, Il. 5.724, Il. 13.22, Il. 14.238, Il. 18.370. Never failing: ἄμπελοι Od. 9.133. Of immaterial things: κλέος (everlasting) Il. 9.413, μήδεα (that cannot come to nought) Il. 24.88.

forms: Fem. pl. pres. pple. ἀφιεῖσαι Od. 6.126.
3 sing. subj. ἀφήῃ Il. 17.631. ἀφέῃ Il. 16.590.
3 sing. opt. ἀφείη Il. 3.317, Od. 3.464. From ἀφιέω
defs: (1) To throw, hurl, launch (a missile): ἔγχος Il. 3.317. Cf. Il. 8.133, Il. 10.372, Il. 16.590, Il. 17.631, Il. 23.432: Od. 24.539. Absol., to make one's throw Il. 23.841. With genit. of the throwing limb: ἄκοντα χειρὸς ἀφῆκεν Il. 21.590. Cf. Il. 13.410.
(2) To send from one-self, let fall: ἔγχος Il. 21.115. Cf. Il. 12.221.
(3) To send forth, cause to cease: μένος [ἔγχεος] Il. 13.444 = Il. 16.613 = Il. 17.529.
(4) To get rid of, slake (thirst): δίψαν Il. 11.642.
(5) To shed (blossom) Od. 6.126.
(6) In mid., to loose (a part of oneself) from. With genit.: δειρῆς οὐκ ἀφίετο πήχεε Od. 23.240.
(7) To send away, dismiss (a person) Il. 1.25 = Il. 1.379, Il. 2.263, Il. 11.702. To let go, set free: ζωόν Od. 3.464.

forms: To be in the condition of having come to, arrived at, reached, to find oneself at, be at, a specified place: τίπτε δεῦρʼ ἀφικάνεις; Il. 14.43.
2 sing. aor. ἀφίκεο Od. 1.171, Od. 14.188, Od. 15.489.
defs: (1) To come to an indicated place: ὁπποίης ἐπὶνηὸς ἀφίκεο (came here) Od. 1.171 = Od. 14.188.
(2) To go, proceed, take one's way. With preps.: ἐς Ὀλυμπον Od. 20.55, γαῖαν ὕπο Od. 20.81. With acc. of the place: ἄλλων δῆμον Od. 15.228 (fled to . . .), Od. 16.382 (be forced to flee to . . .).
(3) To present oneself before, come into the presence of: μνηστῆρας Od. 1.332 = Od. 18.208 = Od. 21.63, Od. 16.414. Cf. Od. 21.25.
(5) Of a feeling, to come upon, seize, affect: ὅτε μʼ ἄλγος ἀφίκετο Il. 18.395.
(A) 3 pl. aor. subj. mid. ἀποστήσωνται Il. 13.745.

(B) 3 sing. aor. ἀπέστη Il. 3.33. 2 pl. pf. ἀφέστατε Il. 4.340. 3 pl. ἀφεστᾶσι Il. 13.738, Il. 14.132. 3 sing. plupf. ἀφεστήκει Od. 11.544. 3 pl. ἀφέστασαν Il. 15.672, 675, Il. 21.391. 3 sing. opt. ἀφεσταίη Od. 23.101, 169. Pl. pple. ἀφεσταότες Il. 17.375. 3 sing. pres. mid. ἀφίσταται Il. 23.517.
(I) In form (A) To get weighed out to oneself; hence, to exact payment of: χρεῖος Il. 13.745 (i.e. take their revenge for what they suffered).
(II) In pres. mid. and the other forms (B)
A tall ornamental projection in which the stern of a ship ran up (app. = κόρυμβον) Il. 15.717.

Rich, wealthy Il. 2.570, 825, Il. 5.9, Il. 7.47, Il. 9.483, Il. 13.664, Il. 17.576, Il. 24.318, 398, 482: Od. 1.232, 393, Od. 11.414, Od. 14.116, 200, Od. 15.227, 426, 433, Od. 17.420 = Od. 19.76, Od. 17.423 = Od. 19.79, Od. 18.127. Absol. Od. 18.276. In superl. ἀφνειότατος Od. 3.220. With genit.: βιότοιο (in . . .) Il. 5.544, Il. 7.14, Il. 14.122. So in comp.: ἐλαφρότεροι πόδας εἶναι ἢ ἀφνειότεροι χρυσοῖο (light of foot rather than rich in . . .) Od. 1.165.

forms: To put off (one's armour): ἔντεα Il. 23.26.

defs: (1) To set forth, depart: ἀφορμηθέντος ἀκοῦσαι Od. 2.375, Od. 4.748.
(2) To sally forth from. With ablative: ναῦφιν Il. 2.794.

forms: acc. sing. masc. pres. pple. ἁφάω.

defs: To act senselessly, foolishly or thoughtlessly Il. 9.32: Od. 6.294.

forms: Senselessly, foolishly, recklessly Il. 3.436, Il. 12.62, Il. 23.320, 426.

defs: (1) Senseless, foolish, reckless: μνηστήρων Od. 2.282.
(2) Senseless, lacking the perceptive powers proper to the living: νεκροί Od. 11.476.

Senselessness, folly, recklessness, thoughtlessness, heedlessness: πολέμοιο (in war) Il. 2.368. In pl. in sim. sense: παρέδραμεν ἀφραδίῃσιν Il. 10.350. Cf. Il. 5.649, Il. 10.122, Il. 16.354: αὐτῶν ἀπωλόμεθʼ ἀφραδίῃσιν Od. 10.27. Cf. Od. 9.361, Od. 14.481, Od. 17.233, Od. 19.523, Od. 22.288.
(1) To act senselessly, foolishly or recklessly Il. 2.258, Il. 6.109.
(2) To be out of one's mind, be beside oneself Od. 20.360.
To be covered with foam Il. 11.282.
Unworthy to be a member of a clan: ἀ. ἀθέμιστος ἀνέστιος Il. 9.63.

forms: Sexual love: εἰς ὅ κʼ ἐκλελάθωντʼ Ἀφροδίτης Od. 22.444.

defs: To act senselessly or foolishly: Ζηνὶ μενεαίνομεν ἀφρονέοντες Il. 15.104.

forms: Foam formed in a lion's mouth Od. 3.168.

defs: Senselessness, folly, recklessness Il. 6.110. In pl. in sim. sense Od. 16.278, Od. 24.457.
Leafless, stripped of leaves: σχίζῃσιν Il. 2.425.

forms: App., drift-wood; or perh., mud Il. 11.495.
3 sing. aor. ἤφυσε Il. 13.508, Il. 17.315. ἄφυσσε Il. 14.517: Od. 2.379.
1 pl. -άμεθα Od. 9.85, Od. 10.56. Masc. pl. pple. ἀφυσσάμενοι Od. 4.359.
defs: (1) To draw (water). In mid. Od. 4.359, Od. 9.85 = Od. 10.56.

(2) To draw off (wine etc.): νέκταρ ἀπὸ κρητῆρος Il. 1.598. Cf. Od. 2.349, 379, Od. 9.9, 165, 204. In mid.: ἐκ κρητῆρος ἀφυσσόμενοι δεπάεσσιν (in cups) Il. 3.295. Cf. Il. 10.579, Il. 16.230, Il. 23.220. In pass.: πολλὸς ἠφύσσετο οἶνος Od. 23.305.
(3) To get together, heap up (wealth) Il. 1.171. In mid., to bring or gather together (about one): ἀμφὶ φύλλα ἠφυσάμην Od. 6.286.
(4) Of a weapon, to let out (the entrails) like water: διὰ δʼ ἔντερα χαλκὸς ἤφυσεν Il. 13.508 = Il. 17.315. Cf. Il. 14.517.
Ungracious, unpleasing. Of speech Od. 8.236. Unpleasant, unpleasing. In comp. ἀχαρίστερος (ἀ-χαρίτ-τερος) Od. 20.392.

forms: Some kind of prickly shrub Od. 14.10.

etym: [conn. in popular etymology with the river Acheron, from which Heracles was said to have brought the tree.]
forms: A tree, said to be the white poplar Il. 13.389 = Il. 16.482.

defs: To be grieved or troubled, grieve, sorrow. Only in pres. pple.: θυμὸν ἀχεύων (in his heart) Il. 5.869, Il. 18.461, Il. 23.566. Cf. Il. 9.612, Il. 24.128: Od. 2.23, Od. 4.100, Od. 11.88, Od. 21.318. With genit. of person grieved for: ἄνακτος Od. 14.40. Cf. Od. 16.139.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἤκαχε Il. 16.822: Od. 15.357, Od. 16.427.
defs: (1) In aor. act., to cause to grieve, grieve, trouble Il. 16.822: Od. 15.357. To molest, harry: Θεσπρωτούς Od. 16.427.

(2) In pres. pple. act. and aor. mid., to be grieved or troubled, be in grief or trouble, grieve, sorrow: κῆρ ἀχέων (in his heart) Il. 5.399. Cf. Il. 2.724, Il. 8.207, Il. 13.344: μνηστῆρες ἀκάχοντο Od. 16.342. Cf. Od. 11.195, Od. 15.361. With genit. of what is grieved for: βρισηΐδος Il. 2.694. Cf. Il. 9.567, Il. 16.16, Il. 18.446. With dat.: θανόντι Od. 1.236.
(1) Of a ship, to be laden, have her cargo on board Od. 15.457.

(2) To be weighed down, be in pain or grief: ὀδύνῃσιν Il. 5.354, ἕλκος (app. acc. of part affected, in the wound) 361, κῆρ (in his heart) Il. 11.274 = 400. With pple. in acc. expressing the cause of grief: ἤχθετο [̓αργείους] δαμναμένους Il. 13.352.
(1) A weight, burden, load: ἀ. ἀρούρης (cumbering the earth) Il. 18.104. Cf. Il. 12.452: Od. 20.379. A weight or load carried: ἀ. ὕλης Od. 9.233.
(2) The lading or cargo of a ship Od. 3.247: Od. 3.312.

A mist: ἀχλύν οἱ κατέχευεν Od. 6.41. Cf. Od. 20.357. In reference to blinding or to the mist of death: κατʼ ὀφθαλμῶν κέχυτʼ ἀ. Il. 5.696, ἀπʼ ὀφθαλμῶν νέφος ἀχλύος ὦσεν (the cloud of mist) Il. 15.668. Cf. Il. 5.127, Il. 16.344, Od. 3.321, 341, 421: Od. 22.88.
To become shrouded in darkness: ἤχλυσε πόντος Od. 12.406 = Od. 14.304.
(2) In pl., chaff: καρπόν τε καὶ ἄχνας Il. 5.501. Cf. Il. 5.499.

To be grieved or troubled, be in grief or trouble, grieve, sorrow: ἀνέστη ἀχνύμενος Il. 1.103, ἀχνύμενοι κῆρ (in their hearts) Il. 6.428. Cf. Il. 1.241, 588, Il. 2.270, Il. 6.431, Il. 12.178, Il. 13.419, 658, Il. 14.38, Il. 15.133, Il. 18.62 = 443, Il. 18.112 = Il. 19.65, Il. 18.320, Il. 19.8, 57, Il. 22.424, Il. 23.137, 165, 284, 443, Il. 24.523, 526, 584, 773: Od. 4.104, 549, 553, 661, Od. 6.297, Od. 8.478, Od. 10.67, 174, 570, Od. 11.5, 388, 466, 542, Od. 12.12, 153 = 270, 250, Od. 14.170, Od. 16.147, Od. 21.115, 250, Od. 22.188, Od. 24.21, 420. With genit. of person grieved for: ἑταίρου Il. 8.125 = 317. Cf. Il. 13.403, Il. 15.651, Il. 17.459: Od. 11.558, Od. 14.376. With acc. expressing the cause of grief: τὸ δʼ ἐμὸν κῆρ ἄχνυται, ὅτε . . . Il. 7.524.
Allaying wrath Od. 4.221.
To be in trouble Od. 18.256 = Od. 19.129.
