(1) Pain of the mind, grief, sorrow, trouble, distress: πηλεΐωνι ἀ. γένετο Il. 1.188, σέθεν (for thee) Il. 4.169. Cf. Il. 2.171, Il. 7.336, Il. 8.124, Il. 10.145, Il. 13.581, etc.: Od. 4.108, 716, Od. 8.541, Od. 15.358, Od. 18.274, etc. In pl., sorrows, troubles: ἄχεʼ ἄκριτα Il. 3.412, Il. 24.91. Cf. Il. 7.413: Od. 19.167.
(2) A subject of grief: ἀ. μοί ἐστιν Il. 16.55. Cf. Il. 5.759, Il. 9.249: Od. 22.345.–  A subject or cause of resentment: ἕνεκʼ ἀλλοτρίων ἀχέων (in a quarrel not his own) Od. 3.298.

Serving no good purpose. In neut. ἀχρεῖον as adv.: ἀ. ἰδών (looking (about him) like one dazed, with helpless look) Il. 2.269: ἀ. ἐγέλασσεν (a forced laugh (to cover embarrassment in announcing her intention)) Od. 18.163.
Lack of means Od. 17.502.

(1) Adv., utterly, completely: τένοντε ἀ. ἀπηλοίησεν Il. 4.522, ἀπʼ ὀστέον ἀ. ἄραξεν Il. 16.324, γράψεν οἱ ὀστέον ἀ. (app. implying that though the wound was a superficial one (a portion of) the bone was destroyed) Il. 17.599.
(2) Prep. with genit., until, up to: κνέφαος Od. 18.370.
A heap of chaff Il. 5.502.

(1) In the reverse direction, backwards, back, back again: ἀπονοστήσειν Il. 1.60, ἐς κουλεὸν ὦσε ξίφος 220. Cf. Il. 3.32, 35, Il. 4.392, Il. 7.467, Il. 10.211, etc.: ἐς πόντον ἐδύσετο Od. 5.352. Cf. Od. 1.276, Od. 3.307, Od. 4.261, Od. 9.314, Od. 11.18, Od. 17.461, etc. In reference to the direction in which one looks, backwards: ὁρόων Il. 3.325. Of a period of time completing its cycle: ἀ. περιτελλομένου ἔτεος Od. 11.295 = Od. 14.294.

(2) Back to a former state or condition, again: ἀπέλυσεν Il. 7.427, ἐνὶ χώρῃ ἕζετο Il. 23.349. Cf. Il. 16.54, 58, 86, Il. 22.277, etc.: ἄνδρες ἐγένοντο Od. 10.395. Cf. Od. 16.175, Od. 18.152. With αὖτις Il. 8.335, Il. 15.364: Od. 18.157 = Od. 21.139 = 166 = Od. 23.164. In reference to making atonement or effecting reconciliation: ἀρέσαι Il. 9.120 = Il. 19.138.
(3) Again, once more: ἐπόρουσεν Il. 3.379. Cf. Il. 5.505, Il. 17.543, Il. 21.33: ὤσασκεν Od. 11.599. Cf. Od. 8.90, 92.
A mesh of a net Il. 5.487.

forms: Of Ocean, flowing back on himself as encircling the earth Il. 18.399: Od. 20.65.

defs: (1) Going back, returning: ἄψορροι ἀπονέοντο Il. 3.313, Il. 24.330. Cf. Il. 21.456.
(2) In neut. ἄψορρον as adv.
(b) In reply Od. 9.282, 501.
A joint Od. 4.794 = Od. 18.189.

etym: [ἀ-, ἁ-, (σ)α-. Cf. ἄδην, ἅδην and L. satis.]
forms: Also 1 pl. subj. ἕωμεν (disyllable) Il. 19.402, formed by metathesis of quantity fr. ἥομεν fr. ἡ- = (σ)α-.
defs: (1) To sate, satiate: κύνας Il. 11.818, Il. 24.211. To sate with, give a fill of. With genit.: αἵματος Il. 5.289 = Od. 3.78 = Il. 22.267. Cf. Il. 9.489, Il. 18.281. In mid. Il. 19.307.

(2) To sate oneself with, take or have one's fill of. With genit.: χροός (of spears personified) Il. 11.574 = Il. 15.317, Il. 21.70, 168, πολέμοιο Il. 19.402, γόοιο Il. 23.157. In mid.: κλαυθμοῖο Il. 24.717.
Thus, pendulous: πόδες Od. 12.89 (of Scylla).
(1) The wool on an animal, [ἀρνειοῦ] Od. 9.434.
(2) Things made of wool.
(b) οἰὸς ἀ. in sense sling Il. 13.599. Collectively, slings Il. 13.716.
Step by step: ἀπιόντος Il. 13.516.
(2) To say, speak, utter: ταῦτα Il. 4.355, ἄρτια Il. 14.92: ἔπος εἴ τι βέβακται δεινόν Od. 8.408. Cf. Od. 4.32, 206, 837 = Od. 11.464, Od. 8.240, Od. 14.127, 157, Od. 17.461, Od. 18.332 = 392.
(3) With double acc. of thing said and person addressed: ταῦτά μʼ ἐβάζετε Il. 16.207. Cf. Il. 9.58.

forms: = βαθυδινήεις.: ποταμός Od. 3.73, Il. 21.143, 212, 228, 329: Ὠκεανῷ Od. 10.511.
Deep-girded, so girt that the upper part of the robe falls down in a deep fold (κόλπος) over the girdle.

defs: Whose robe falls down in a deep fold over the girdle (cf. βαθύζωνος.). Epithet of women Il. 18.122, 339, Il. 24.215.
Having meadows with deep rich grass: Ἄνθειαν Il. 9.151 = 293.
With a deep rich crop: τέμενος Il. 18.550 (v.l. βασιλήϊον).
To lower the surface of Il. 23.421.
With deep, steady flow Il. 23.195.

(1) Deep: ἅλα Il. 1.532. Cf. Il. 6.341, 440, Il. 8.336, 481, Il. 13.32, Il. 15.356, etc.: Od. 7.116, Od. 12.214. Epithet of φρήν Il. 19.125. In superl. βάθιστος Il. 8.14. Where we should rather say high: αὐλῆς (high-walled) Il. 5.142: Od. 9.239, 338. Sim., app., of a storm, reaching from earth to heaven Il. 11.306.
(2) Deep, extending far inwards: ἠϊόνος Il. 2.92. Deeply indenting the land: κόλπον Il. 2.560.
(3) Growing thickly, affording thick covert: ὕλης Il. 5.555. Cf. Il. 11.415, Il. 15.606, Il. 16.766, Od. 3.491, Il. 21.573: Od. 17.316.
(4) Lying thick: τέφρη Il. 23.251. Forming a thick deposit: ἀμάθοιο Il. 5.587.
(5) With deep soil: νειοῖο Il. 10.353, Il. 18.547.
(6) Forming a deep, rich crop: λήϊον Il. 2.147, Il. 11.560: Od. 9.134.
(7) Thick, obstructing vision: ἠέρα Od. 3.446. Cf. Il. 21.7: Od. 9.144.
With banks thickly set with rushes: Ἀσωπόν Il. 4.383.

(B) 3 sing. aor. βῆσε Il. 1.310, Il. 5.164, Il. 16.810. 1 pl. ἐβήσαμεν Od. 11.4. βήσαμεν Il. 11.756. 3 pl. βῆσαν Il. 1.438. 1 pl. subj. βήσομεν Il. 1.144. (ἀμφι-, ἀνα-, ἀπο-, δια-, εἰσ-, εἰσανα-, ἐκ-, ἐκδια-, ἐμ-, ἐξανα-, ἐξαπο-, ἐπεμ-, ἐπι-, ἐσκατα-, κατα-, μετα-, παρα-, περι-, προ-, προσ-, ὑπερ-, ὑπερκατα-.)
(I) Intrans. in all forms except those under (B).

(II) Trans. in forms (B). To cause to take a specified position: ἄν Χρυσηΐδα βήσομεν (let us put her on board) Il. 1.144, ἐς ἑκατόμβην βῆσεν (put it on board) 310, ἐξ ἑκατόμβην βῆσαν (landed it) 438, τοὺς ἐξ ἵππων βῆσεν (thrust or knocked off) Il. 5.164, βήσαμεν ἵππους (brought to a stand, stopped) Il. 11.756, φῶτας βῆσεν ἀφʼ ἵππων Il. 16.810: ἐν τὰ μῆλα ἐβήσαμεν (put them on board) Od. 11.4.
The fruit of the φηγός Od. 10.242, Od. 13.409.

forms: Dat. sing. masc. pple. βαλέοντι Od. 11.608.
3 sing. plupf. (in intensive impf. or aor. sense) βεβλήκει(ν) Il. 4.108, 492, Il. 5.66, 73, 394, 661, Il. 12.401, Il. 14.412, Il. 17.606: Od. 22.258, 275, 286.
2 sing. pf. βέβληαι Il. 5.284, Il. 11.380, Il. 13.251.

Pple. βεβλημένος, -ου Il. 11.475, 592, 659, Il. 12.2, Il. 13.764, Il. 14.63, etc.: Od. 11.535, Od. 19.69. (ἀμφι-, ἀνα-, ἐκ-, ἐμ-, ἐπι-, κατα-, παρα-, παρακατα-, περι-, προ-, προσ-, συμ-, ὑπερ-, ὑπο-.)
defs: (I) To throw.
(II) To strike.

forms: An imitative formation, to stammer; or perh. redup. fr. βαίνω, to staggerIl. 10.375.
App. referring to harshness of speech = ἀγριόφωνος, Il. 2.867.

defs: In this pple., weighed down, overcome Od. 3.139, Od. 19.122.
To be weighed down: βαρύθει μοι ὦμος (has lost its power) Il. 16.519.

forms: To weigh down, oppress: γυῖα βαρύνεται Il. 19.165. Cf. Il. 5.664, Il. 8.308, Od. 3.480: Od. 5.321.
Sim.: δόναξ ἐβάρυνε μηρόν (app., made it painful to move) Il. 11.584.

defs: (1) Heavy. Of the hand or arm, heavy, powerful Il. 1.89, 219, Il. 5.81, Il. 11.235 = Il. 17.48, Il. 13.410, Il. 21.590, Il. 23.687: Od. 18.56.
(2) Heavy to bear, grievous, dire: ἄτῃ Il. 2.111 = Il. 9.18. Cf. Il. 5.417, Il. 10.71, Od. 3.55: Od. 15.233. Giving misery, stern, dire, grim: κῆρας Il. 21.548. Cf. Od. 6.197.
(3) Of a voice, deep (as proceeding from a giant's throat) Od. 9.257.
(2) The daughter of a βασιλεύς. Of Nausicaa Od. 7.115.
(3) β. γυναικῶν, the peerless one among womenOd. 11.258.

forms: One in authority, a king, chief, noble.
defs: (1) Of men (never of gods), sometimes as a title, sometimes as a descriptive term. Of Agamemnon Il. 1.9, 231, 340, 410, Il. 3.179, Il. 4.402, Il. 6.180, Il. 11.23, 46, 136, 262, 283, Il. 19.256. Of Achilles Il. 1.331, Il. 16.211. Of Nestor Il. 2.54. Of Paris Il. 4.96. Of Priam Il. 5.464, Il. 24.680, 803. Of Proetus Il. 7.163. Of Rhesus Il. 10.435, 494. Of Sarpedon Il. 16.660. Of Menelaus Od. 4.44, 621. Of Alcinous Od. 6.46, 55, 141, Od. 8.157, 257, 469, Od. 13.62. Of Odysseus Od. 16.335, Od. 20.194. Of Antinous and Eurymachus Od. 18.64. Of Antinous Od. 24.179. Of minor heroes and personages Il. 4.338, Il. 13.643, Od. 3.219, Il. 23.631, 849: Od. 4.618 = Od. 15.118, Od. 14.316, 336, Od. 18.85 = 116 = Od. 21.308, Od. 19.287. Joined with ἄναξ Od. 20.194.

(2) In various contexts: κρείς σων β. ὅτε χώσεται ἀνδρὶ χέρηϊ Il. 1.80, διοτρεφέων βασιλήων 176, ὅν τινα βασιλῆα κιχείη Il. 2.188, εἷς β. [ἔστω] 205. Cf. Il. 2.86, 98, 196, 214, 247, 250, 277, 445, etc.: μὴ σέ γε βασιλῆα κρονίων ποιήσειεν Od. 1.386, δίκη βασιλήων Od. 4.691. Cf. Od. 1.394, Od. 2.231 = Od. 5.9, Od. 3.480, Od. 4.63, Od. 7.54, Od. 6.49, Od. 8.41, 390, Od. 10.110, Od. 13.205, Od. 14.278, Od. 17.416, Od. 19.109, Od. 20.196, 222, Od. 24.88, 253.
Most-royal, supreme in rank Il. 9.69.
More royal, higher in rank Il. 9.160, 392, Il. 10.239: Od. 15.533.
(1) To rule, hold sway, be king, chief or ruler Il. 2.203, Il. 9.616: Od. 1.392, Od. 2.47, Od. 19.179, Od. 22.52, Od. 24.483.
(2) To be king or chief of or ruler over.
(b) With dat.: Γιγάντεσσιν Od. 7.59. Cf. Il. 2.206 (v.l. βουλεύῃσι).
(3) Of a woman, to enjoy rank as the wife of a βασιλεύς Il. 7.425. With local genit.: πύλου Od. 11.285.
Of a king or chief: τέμενος Il. 18.550 (v.l. βαθυλήϊον). Royal, princely Od. 16.401.
(1) To raise. Of pushing uphill Od. 11.594.
(2) To take into the hands, handle: τόξον Od. 21.405.
In pl., the prickles of some kind of prickly shrub or plant: βάτων ἕνεκα Od. 24.230.

forms: acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. βαρέω.
acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. pass. βλάπτω.
acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. pass. βύω.
2 sing. βέῃ Il. 16.852, Il. 24.131 (app. for βέεαι (βέεʼ)).
defs: To live: οὔ τι Διὸς βέομαι φρεσίν Il. 15.194 (φ. app. comitative dat., in company with . . ., in accordance with . . .; thus, will not live and move and have my being in his mind), οὐ δηρὸν βέῃ Il. 16.852, Il. 24.131, τί νυ βείομαι; (what have I now to live for?) Il. 22.431.

forms: A spear or dart: πικρά Il. 22.206.

defs: (1) A spear or dart, but in pl. not necessarily excluding arrows or stones: οὐχ ἅλιον β. ἧκεν Il. 4.498, βελέων ἐρωήν 542. Cf. Il. 5.18, 316, 622, Il. 8.67, 159, etc.: Od. 16.277.–ἐκ βελέων, out of range of missiles: ὕπαγεν Il. 11.163. Cf. Il. 16.122, 668, 678, 781, Il. 18.152. So ὑπὲκ βελέων Il. 4.465, Il. 18.232. Motion not implied: ἐκ βελέων (keeping out of their range) Il. 14.130.
(3) A stone Il. 12.159, 458, Il. 14.439, Il. 16.737. Of the rock thrown by the Cyclops Od. 9.495.
(4) Of the θρῆνυς thrown by Antinous Od. 17.464. Of the ox's foot thrown by Ktesippus Od. 20.305.
(5) Applied to a weapon in gen. Il. 13.289.
(6) Metaphorically of the wound inflicted by a missile: ὥς τις β. πέσσῃ Il. 8.513. Of the pains of childbirth Il. 11.269.

forms: In neut. βέλτερον with or without copula, it is (would be) better: β. δς προφύγῃ κακόν Il. 14.81 ([κείνῳ] ὅς = εἴ τις).
With complementary infin.: β. ἀπολέσθαι Il. 15.511. Cf. Il. 15.197, Il. 18.302, Il. 21.485, Il. 22.129.
With dat. and infin.: πτωχῷ β. ἐστι δαῖτα πτωχεύειν Od. 17.18.
With εἰ: β., εἰ καὐτὴ πόσιν εὗρεν ἄλλοθεν Od. 7.282.

defs: (1) The depth or gulf (of the sea): κατὰ β. ἁλός Il. 18.38, 49. In pl. in sim. sense: ἐν βένθεσσιν ἁλός Il. 1.358 = Il. 18.36. Cf. Il. 13.21, 32.
(2) In pl., the deeps or deep recesses (of the sea): θαλάσσης πάσης βένθεα οἶδεν Od. 1.53, Od. 4.386. The recesses or coverts (of a wood): βαθείης βένθεσιν ὕλης Od. 17.316.

forms: To the deep part (of the sea), to the deep (sea): νῆα ἁλὸς β. ἔρυσσαν Od. 4.780, Od. 8.51.

defs: A gulf or deep recess: βάθιστον ὑπὸ χθονὸς β. Il. 8.14. Of Scylla's cave Od. 12.94.
A threshold: ῥῖψεν (ῥίπτασκον) ἀπὸ βηλοῦ (i.e. of Olympus) Il. 1.591, Il. 15.23. Cf. Il. 23.202. (There is a tradition that in the first two passages it is a distinct word = οὐρανός.)

forms: 3 sing. fut. in mid. form βαίνω.

etym: [app. βη-, βαίνω + ἁρμ-,  ἁρμόζω. One who goes in measure.]

defs: (1) To bring one's might to bear upon, bear hard upon, press, use violence against. In mid.: βιάζεταί δε Il. 22.229. Cf. Od. 9.410. In pass., to be pressed or driven: βελέεσσιν Il. 11.576. Cf. Il. 11.589, Il. 15.727 = Il. 16.102.
(2) To push one's advantage against, constrain: βιάζετέ με μοῦνον ἐόντα Od. 12.297.
Forceful, violent: ἔργα Od. 2.236.

forms: Forcefully, by force, with violence: γυναιξὶ παρευνάζεσθε β. Od. 22.37. Cf. Od. 2.237.

defs: (1) To use violence to, lay constraint upon. In mid.: ὃ κεῖνον βιόωνται Od. 11.503. Cf. Od. 23.9. Of something immaterial: τοῖον ἄχος βεβίηκεν Ἀχαιούς Il. 10.145 = Il. 16.22. Cf. Il. 10.172.
(2) To prove too strong for, force, overcome. In mid.: ὄνος ἐβιήσατο παῖδας Il. 11.558. Cf. Il. 11.467, Il. 16.823.
(3) To force to act against one's will. In mid.: οὔ τίς μʼ ἀέκοντα βιήσεται Od. 21.348. To compel in a certain direction, throw upon something: ἐκβαίνοντά κέ με βιήσατο κῦμʼ ἐπὶ χέρσου Od. 6.278.
(4) To push one's advantage against, get the better of. In mid.: ψεύδεσσι βιησάμενος Il. 23.576.
(5) To rob (of one's due). In mid. with double acc.: νῶϊ βιήσατο μισθόν Il. 21.451.
To stride, stride along: μακρὰ βιβάσθων Il. 13.809, Il. 15.676, Il. 16.534.

forms: (προ-.) = βιβάσθω.: μακρὰ βιβῶντα Il. 3.22. Cf. Il. 13.371, Il. 15.307, 686: Od. 11.539. (In all cases with βιβάντα, etc., from βίβημι. as v.l.)
(προ-.) = βιβάω.: μακρὰ βιβάντα (βιβάς) Il. 3.22, Il. 6.213, Il. 15.307, 686, ὕψι βιβάντα Il. 13.371: μακρὰ βιβᾶσα Od. 11.539.
Of a ram 450. (For vv. ll. see βιβάω.)
3 sing. fut. pf. pass. βεβρώσεται Od. 2.203.
defs: (1) In pf. forms in intensive sense: εἰ βεβρώθοις Πρίαμον (eat up, devour) Il. 4.35. Sim. of χρήματα Od. 2.203 (will be consumed).
(2) In strict pf. sense: βεβρωκὼς φάρμακα Il. 22.94. So with partitive genit.: βεβρωκὼς βοός Od. 22.403.

(1) Bodily strength, might, power; the exercise of this: βίην ἀμείνων (in might) Il. 1.404, Il. 15.139, πεποίθασι βίηφιν (in their strength) Il. 4.325, οὔ τίς με βίῃ δίηται Il. 6.197, σὴ β. λέλυται Il. 8.103. Cf. Il. 3.431, Il. 6.288, Il. 12.135, 341, Il. 13.572, Il. 15.106, Il. 17.569, Il. 23.315, etc.: δόλῳ ἠὲ βίηφιν Od. 9.406, βίης ἐπιδευέες Od. 21.185. Cf. Od. 4.415, Od. 7.6, Od. 13.143, Od. 18.4, Od. 20.379, Od. 21.128, etc. In pl.: βίας Τρώων Il. 5.521. Cf. Od. 22.219.
(2) National strength or power: Φαιήκων Od. 7.197.
(3) The act of putting strength into exercise, effort: μεθῆκε βίης Il. 21.177. Cf. Od. 4.422, Od. 21.126.
(4) Courage, spirit: οὐκ ἔστι β. φρεσίν Il. 3.45.

(5) β. τινός, periphrasis for a person(the might of . . . = the mighty . . . ) (cf. ἴς 5, μένος 6, σθένος 2): Πριάμοιο βίην Il. 3.105, β. (ελένοιο Il. 13.770. Cf. Il. 5.781, Il. 13.758, 781, Il. 15.614, Il. 17.24, 187, Il. 18.117, Od. 3.307, Il. 21.367, Il. 22.323, Il. 23.859: Od. 10.200. Sim. with adj.: βίῃ Ἡρακληείῃ Il. 2.658. Cf. Il. 2.666, Il. 4.386, Il. 5.638, Il. 11.690, Il. 15.640, Il. 19.98: Od. 11.290, 296, 601.
(7) Might, power, authority, influence Il. 9.498, Il. 23.578.

forms: One's life, course of life, manner of living: ζώεις ἀγαθὸν βίον Od. 15.491. Cf. Od. 18.254 = Od. 19.127.

defs: (1) Life, existence, one's life: βιότοιο μεγήρας Il. 13.563. Cf. Il. 4.170: Od. 5.394, Od. 12.328, Od. 24.536.
(2) The period of one's life: βιότοιο τελευτή Il. 6.104, Il. 16.787.
(3) The fact of being alive: εἴ κεν πατρὸς βίοτον ἀκούσῃς Od. 1.287. Cf. Od. 2.218.

(4) The means of living, substance, goods, chattels: ἀφνειὸς βιότοιο Il. 5.544. Cf. Il. 7.14, Il. 14.122: ἀλλότριον βίοτον ἔδουσιν Od. 1.160 Od. 18.280. Cf. Od. 1.377, Od. 2.49, 123, 126, Od. 3.301, Od. 4.90, 686, etc.
(1) To live, continue to exist: ἄλλος βιώτω Il. 8.429. Cf. Il. 10.174, Il. 15.511: Od. 14.359.
(2) Trans. in aor. mid., to give life to, rescue from death: σύ μ'  ἐβιώσαο Od. 8.468.
To cause to fail or break down: βλάβεται γούνατα Il. 19.166: Od. 13.34. To cause (a speaker) to break down: βλάβεται λιγύς περἐὼν ἀγορητής Il. 19.82.

forms: 2 sing. aor. ἔβλαψας Il. 22.15. βλάψας Il. 23.571.
3 sing. ἔβλαψε Il. 23.782. βλάψε Il. 6.271, Il. 23.774: Od. 14.178.
3 pl. aor. pass. ἐβλάφθησαν Il. 23.387. Also ἔβλαβεν Il. 23.461. βλάβεν Il. 23.545.
Acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. βεβλαμμένον Il. 16.660.
defs: (1) To cause to fail or break down, make useless: γούνατα Il. 6.271. Cf. Il. 15.484, 489. To stop, cut short the course of: ἵπποι ἔβλαβεν Il. 23.461. Cf. Il. 23.545. Sim.: βεβλαμμένον ἦτορ (app., brought to a stop in his life, slain) Il. 16.660.

(2) To impede the course of: ἵππους Il. 23.571. To impede the motion of, entangle: βλαφθέντα κατὰ κλόνον Il. 16.331. To impede in action, be in the way of: ἑταίρων τίνʼ ἐλαυνόντων Od. 13.22. To entangle, catch: ἵππω ὄζῳ ἔνι βλαφθέντε Il. 7.39. Cf. Il. 15.647.
(3) To trip, cause to stumble Il. 23.774. To trip up (the feet of). With double acc.: ἔβλαψέ με πόδας Il. 23.782.
(4) To put at a disadvantage, [ἵπποι] ἐβλάφθησαν ἄνευ κέντροιο θέοντες Il. 23.387.
(5) To hinder from. With genit.: κελεύθου Od. 1.195.
(6) Of a divine agency.
(b) To deprive of good sense, put out of one's right mind: θεοί σ' ἔβλαψαν Il. 23.14. With φρένας as second acc.: τόν τις ἀθανάτων βλάψε φρένας Od. 14.178.
(c) To foil: ἔβλαψάς μ' , ἑκάεργε Il. 22.15.
(7) Of wine, to drive out of one's right mind Od. 21.294.

forms: App., to exult, bear oneself proudly, or the like: σθένεϊ βλεμεαίνων Il. 8.337. Cf. Il. 9.237, Il. 12.42, Il. 17.22, 135, Od. 3.36.

defs: Always in dual or pl. The eyelids: οὐχ ὕπνος ἐπὶ βλεφάροισιν ἐφίζανε Il. 10.26. Cf. Il. 10.187, Il. 14.165, Il. 17.438, Il. 19.17, Il. 24.637: δάκρυ βάλεν ἐκ βλεφάροιϊν Od. 17.490. Cf. Od. 1.364, Od. 2.398, Od. 4.114, Od. 5.493, Od. 8.522, Od. 9.389, etc.

forms: App., a clamp or clincher for fastening lengths together: ξυστὸν κολλητὸν βλήτροισιν Il. 15.678.

defs: A bleating: οἰῶν Od. 12.266.

forms: App., tall, stately: πίτυς Il. 13.390 = Il. 16.483: ὄγχνην Od. 24.234.

defs: (1) To go: ποτὶ μέγαρα Il. 7.286. Of a period of time, to pass away Od. 17.190.
(2) To come: δεῦρο Il. 15.720. Cf. Il. 11.173.Od. 3.44, Od. 24.335. Of a period of time, to come on Il. 24.781.

etym: [βο-, βοῦς + ἄγρη. Spoils of an ox. Cf. ἀνδράγρια.]
defs: Shields of ox-hide Il. 12.22: Od. 16.296.

forms: Dat. sing. masc. aor. pple. βώσαντι Il. 12.337.
defs: (1) To cry aloud, shout: κήρυκες βοόωντες ἐρήτυον Il. 2.97. Cf. Il. 2.198, 224, Il. 8.92, Il. 9.12, Il. 11.15, Il. 12.337, Il. 15.687 = 732, Il. 17.89, 334, 607 (app. for joy on seeing Hector unharmed), Il. 23.847: στὰς ἐβόησα Od. 10.311. Cf. Od. 4.281, Od. 5.400 = Od. 9.473 = Od. 12.181, Od. 7.294, Od. 8.305, Od. 9.403, Od. 24.537.
(2) Of things, to roar, resound: θαλάσσης κῦμα Il. 14.394, ἠϊόνες Il. 17.265.
(1) Of an ox: δέρμα Od. 14.24.
(2) Made from ox-hide Il. 4.122: Od. 24.228.
(3) In fem. βοείη as sb.
(b) A shield of ox-hide Il. 5.452 = Il. 12.425, Il. 22.159.
(1) Of an ox: ὄνθου Il. 23.777.
(2) Made from ox-hide Il. 22.397, Il. 23.324.
(3) In fem. βοέη as sb.
(b) A shield of ox-hide Il. 17.492.
A strap of ox-leather (used for hoisting a sail): ἕλκον ἱστία βοεῦσιν Od. 2.426 = Od. 15.291.
(1) A crying out, a shouting:  βοῆς ἀΐοντες Od. 9.401, Od. 14.266 = Od. 17.435. A hue-and-cry, a din: διὰ ἄστεος Od. 10.118. Cf. Od. 22.77, 133.

(2) A shouting in battle: Il. 11.50, 500, 530, Il. 13.169 = 540, Il. 14.4, Il. 16.267.–βοὴν ἀγαθός, good at the battle-cry, marshalling or rallying his men with loud shout. Of Menelaus Il. 2.408, 586, Il. 3.96, Il. 4.220, Il. 7.37, etc.: Od. 3.311, Od. 4.307, 609, Od. 15.14, 57, 67, 92, 97, Od. 17.120. Of Diomedes Il. 2.563, Il. 5.114, Il. 7.12, Il. 6.399, Il. 8.91, etc. Of Hector Il. 13.123, Il. 15.671. Of Aias Il. 15.249, Il. 17.102. Of Polites Il. 24.250.
(3) A loud expression of grief Il. 7.465: Od. 24.48.
(4) The sound of musical instruments Il. 18.495.
Running to the battle-cry, coming swiftly to the fight Il. 13.477. The epithet transferred from the warrior to his chariot Il. 17.481.
A driving off of cattle: νεῖκος ἀμφὶ βοηλασίῃ Il. 11.672.
Noise, disturbance Od. 1.369.
(1) A hole or pit dug in the ground: βόθρον ὀρύξαι Od. 10.517, ἀπεδειροτόμησα ἐς βόθρον (so that the blood ran into the pit) Od. 11.36. Cf. Od. 11.25, 42, 95.
(2) A hollow by a river used for washing clothes Od. 7.92.
(3) The trench in which a young tree is planted Il. 17.58.

forms: Pf. pple. pass. βεβολημένος Il. 9.9: Od. 10.247.
defs: Of grief, to smite: πένθεϊ βεβολήατο (were in the state of having been smitten, were tossed about or agitated) Il. 9.3. Cf. Il. 9.9: Od. 10.247.
(1) A blow with a missile Od. 17.283, Od. 24.161.
(2) A turn or glance (of the eyes) Od. 4.150.
(1) βούλομαι 1: ἑτέρως ἐβόλοντο Od. 1.234. With infin.: αὐτὸν ζώειν Od. 16.387.
(2) = βούλομαι 4. With infin. and ἤ: Τρωσὶν δοῦναι ἠέ περ ἡμῖν Il. 11.319.

etym: [imitative] To make a resounding, clanging or clashing noise Il. 13.530, Il. 16.118: Od. 12.204 (the oars knocked against each other in the wash of the sea as they hung by the τροποί), Od. 18.397.
forms: Of the whizzing flight of a quoit Od. 8.190.
Genit. (besides Βορέαο) βορέω Il. 14.395, Il. 23.692: Od. 14.533. βορέης as spondee Il. 9.5. So βορέῃ Il. 23.195.
defs: (2) The north: πρὸς Βορέαο Od. 13.110.

forms: 3 pl. pa. iterative pass. βοσκέσκοντο Od. 12.355.
defs: (1) To feed, tend (cattle, etc.) Il. 15.548: Od. 14.102.
(2) To feed, nourish, support: γαῖα ἀνθρώπους Od. 11.365. Cf. Od. 9.124, Od. 12.97, Od. 14.325= Od. 19.294. To fill or stuff (one's belly) Od. 17.228, 559, Od. 18.364.

(3) In pass., of cattle, etc., to feed, graze: ξύλοχον κάτα βοσκομενάων Il. 5.162. Cf. Il. 16.151, Il. 17.62, Od. 3.223: Od. 4.338 = Od. 17.129, Od. 11.108, Od. 12.128, 355, Od. 14.104, Od. 21.49. Of birds, to feed Il. 15.691.
Grazing beasts, beasts of the herd: ἀρδμὸς πάντεσσι βοτοῖσιν Il. 18.521.
(1) Food, fodder Od. 10.411.
(2) A feeding-place: ὡς εἴ θ' ἕσπετο μῆλα ἐκ βοτάνης Il. 13.493.
A herdsman: ἀγροὺς ἐπιείσομαι ἠδὲ βοτῆρας Od. 15.504.
In clusters Il. 2.89.
A bunch or cluster of grapes: μέλανες Il. 18.562.
Grazed by cattle. Of Ithaca Od. 13.246.
Explained as the insect that attacks cattle, the gadfly. By others connected with βι-βρώσκω and explained as ravenous hunger (taking βου- in an intensive sense. Cf. βουγάϊος) Il. 24.532.
The groin Il. 4.492.

etym: [app. a compound of βοῦς, perh. in intensive sense. The second element perh. γαϝ-, γαίω.]
defs: Thus, perh., braggart Il. 13.824: Od. 18.79.
(1) To feed or tend cattle: Ἀγχίσῃ βουκολέοντι Il. 5.313. Cf. Il. 14.445: Od. 10.85.
(2) To feed, tend (cattle): βοῦς Il. 21.448.
(3) In pass., of cattle, etc., to feed, graze Od. 3.221.

etym: [app. for βουπόλος fr. βοῦς + -πολος, conn. with πολεύω. Cf. αἰπόλος.]

defs: A member of the βουλή, a councillorIl. 7.114.

(1) To deliberate, consider, take counsel with oneself, concert measures, contrive, plan: ἵνα σφίσι βουλεύῃσθα (in their interests) Il. 9.99. Cf. Il. 2.206 (υ.λ. βασιλεύῃ): Od. 12.58, Od. 14.491. With infin.: τὸν βούλευσα κατακτάμεν (οὐτάμεναι) (debated whether to ...) Il. 9.458: Od. 9.299. With dependent clause: ὅπως... (how, in what manner) Od. 9.420, Od. 11.229.

(2) In dual and pl., to take counsel together: ὣς βουλεύσαντε Il. 1.531, εἰ ἐς μίαν βουλεύσομεν (take counsel to one purpose, lay our plans in common) Il. 2.379. Cf. Od. 13.439, Od. 16.234. With infin. Il. 2.347.

(3) With cognate acc.: ὅς κεν ἀρίστην βουλὴν βουλεύσῃ (devise the best counsel) Il. 9.75, βουλὰς βουλεύειν (to take counsel together, hold counsel, concert measures) Il. 10.327. Cf. Il. 10.147, 415, Il. 23.78, Il. 24.652: Od. 7.61.
(4) To turn over in one's mind, ponder: ὁδόν Od. 1.444. To meditate, purpose, propose to oneself: φύξιν Il. 10.311 = 398.

(5) To plan, contrive, scheme to bring about: ὄλεθρον Il. 14.464. Cf. Od. 5.179 = Od. 10.344, Od. 5.187 = Od. 10.300. To plan, contrive, devise, elaborate: ψεύδεα Od. 14.296. Cf. Od. 5.23 = Od. 24.479, Od. 23.217. In mid.: ἀπάτην βουλεύσατο Il. 2.114 = Il. 9.21.
(1) A select council of the most important chiefs (cf. ἀγορή 1) Il. 2.53, 194, 202, Il. 10.195, Il. 12.213: Od. 3.127.
(2) The deliberation or discussion in the council: ὅσοι οὐ βουλῆς ἐπάκουσαν Il. 2.143.
(3) The place of council Il. 2.84: Od. 7.55.

(4) Counsel, concerting of measures, contriving,  planning, scheming: οἳ περί ἐστε βουλὴν Δαναῶν (in . . .) Il. 1.258. Cf. Il. 9.54, Il. 10.43, Il. 11.627, Il. 13.728, 741, Il. 16.630: ἐπίφρονι Od. 3.128. Cf. Od. 4.267, Od. 12.211, Od. 13.298, 305, Od. 16.242, 374, 420, Od. 22.230. In pl.: ὅτι οἱ συμφράσσατο βουλάς Il. 1.537. Cf. Il. 1.540, Il. 2.340, Il. 9.374, Il. 15.71, Od. 3.154: Od. 4.462, 677 = Od. 16.412, Od. 11.437, 510. For βουλὴν (βουλὰς) βουλεύειν see βουλεύω 3.
(5) A conclusion, a resolve, a course to take: βουλήν, ἣ θεοῖσιν ἐφήνδανεν Il. 6.45. Cf. Il. 2.5 = Il. 10.107 = Il. 14.161, Il. 17.469: Od. 9.318 = 424 = Od. 11.230, Od. 14.337.
(6) What one has contrived or planned. In pl.: Θέτιδος ἐξήνυσε βουλάς Il. 8.370. A plan or plot: οὐχ ἡμῖν συνθεύσεται ἥδε γε βουλή Od. 20.245.

(7) Counsel given, advice, what one proposes or puts forward: πυκινήν Il. 2.55 = Il. 10.302. Cf. Il. 2.282, Il. 4.323, Il. 6.325 = Il. 9.94, Il. 8.36 = 467, Il. 12.109, Il. 14.102, Il. 18.313, 510: εἴ τινα βουλὴν εἴποι Od. 11.479. Cf. Od. 3.150, Od. 8.506, Od. 10.46, Od. 12.339, Od. 24.52. In pl.: βουλέων μευ ξύνιεν Il. 1.273 Cf. Il. 2.273.
(9) One's mind, what one has in view or is doing Od. 2.281, Od. 11.177.
(1) A (trusted) adviser, a leader in counsel Il. 5.180  =  Il. 17.485, Il. 5.633, Il. 6.126, Il. 10.518, Il. 13.219, 255, 463, Od. 3.83.
(2) Specifically, a member of the βουλή, a leading chief Il. 10.414, Il. 24.651: Od. 13.12. Joined with ἀνήρ Il. 1.144, Il. 2.24 = 61. With ἄναξ Il. 12.414.
(3) As adj.: ἀγοραὶ βουληφόροι (in which counsel is exchanged) Od. 9.112.
(1) To have a preference for one of two things, to wish, be minded : ἄλλῃ Il. 15.51.

(2) To wish, desire (something): τρώεσσι βούλετο ϝίκην Il. 6.21, Il. 13.347, Il. 16.121. Cf. Il. 8.204, Il. 23.682. With infin.: τρώεσσι κῦδος ὀρέξαι Il. 11.79. Cf. Il. 12.174 = Il. 15.596: Od. 4.275, 353 (βούλοντο here app. an aor.), Od. 15.21, 88.
(3) To be willing or ready. With infin.: ἀπὸ λοιγὸν ἀμῦναι Il. 1.67.

(4) To prefer: τό κε βουλοίμην Il. 3.41: Od. 11.358 = Od. 20.316. With infin.: αὐτὴν οἴκοι ἔχειν Il. 1.112. Cf. Il. 24.39: Od. 3.143, Od. 9.96, Od. 17.187, 228, Od. 18.364. With ἤ: ἡμῖν Ζεὺς βούλεται ἤ Δαναοῖσι νίκην Il. 17.331. With infin. and ἤ: λαὸν σῶν ἔμμεναι ἢ ἀπολέσθαι Il. 1.117. Cf. Il. 23.594: Od. 3.232, Od. 11.489, Od. 12.350, Od. 16.106, Od. 17.81, 404. Absol.: βούλομαι (I prefer it so, I accept the alternative) Il. 24.226.

etym: [βοῦς + λύω + -δε 1. To the time for unyoking oxen.]
forms: To or towards early afternoon: Ἠέλιος μετενίσετο β. Il. 16.779: = Od. 9.58. (The time specified is fixed for Il. 16.779, and is admissible for Od. 9.58.
The reference seems to be to a custom of stopping ploughing at or soon after mid-day.)

defs: An ox-whip or-goad; or perh., a pole-axe: θεινόμεναι βουπλῆγι Il. 7.135.

forms: βοός, ὁ, ἡ (βοϝ-. Cf. L. bouis).
defs: (1) A bull, ox, or cow.

(b) Masculine: ἶφι κταμένοιο Il. 3.375, βόε ἶσον θυμὸν ἔχοντε Il. 13.703, ἐριμύκων Od. 3.497 (for the gender see 495). Cf. Il. 13.571, Il. 18.559, Il. 23.775, etc.: Od. 1.108, Od. 18.371. Joined with ταῦρος Il. 2.480, Il. 17.389. Qualified by ἄρσην Il. 6.314, Od. 3.495: Od. 19.420.

(c) Feminine: ἐμὰς βοῦς Il. 1.154, αὐτῇσι βόεσσιν Il. 6.474. Cf. Il. 7.93, Il. 8.231, Il. 10.292, Il. 11.172, Il. 17.62, Il. 18.574, etc.: στεῖραν βοῦν Od. 10.522, πολλαί Od. 12.128. Cf. Od. 3.382, Od. 10.410, Od. 11.108, Od. 12.262, Od. 20.221, etc. Distinguished from ταῦρος Il. 2.481, Il. 16.488.
(2) A shield of ox-hide. In this sense fem.: τυκτῇσι βόεσσιν Il. 12.105. Cf. Il. 6.238, Il. 12.137, Il. 16.636.
To slay an ox or oxen for sacrifice Il. 6.466.

forms: Of Clymene (one of Helen's handmaidens) Il. 3.144.

defs: The constellation the Waggoner, containing the star Arcturus Od. 5.272.
Slowness, want of speed: βραδυτῆτί τε νωχελίῃ τε Il. 19.411.

Of armour, to rattle, clash, ring Il. 4.420, Il. 12.396, Il. 13.181, Il. 14.420, Il. 16.566. Of an axle, to creak, grate Il. 5.838. So of a door Od. 21.49. Of a river, to resound under the splash of something falling into it Il. 21.9. Of the earth, to give forth a sound, resound Il. 21.387. Of persons, to roar, shriek Il. 5.859, 863, Il. 16.468.
Of the sea or the wind, to roar Il. 4.425. In mid. Il. 2.210, Il. 14.399.
Unborn offspring Il. 23.266.

forms: App., the head: ἔπεσε ἐπὶ βρεχμόν τε καὶ ὤμους Il. 5.586.

defs: To slumber, nod Il. 4.223.
Thus, with powerful or loud voice. Epithet of Ares Il. 13.521.
Weight, load: ἔβραχεν ἄξων βριθοσύνῃ Il. 5.839, πέσε λίθος εἴσω βριθοσύνῃ (by its weight) Il. 12.460.

(1) To be heavy, loaded or weighed down with something. With dat.: σταφυλῇσιν Il. 18.561. Cf. Od. 16.474, Od. 19.112. With genit.: τυρῶν Od. 9.219. Cf. Od. 15.334. So in pass. With dat.: καρπῷ Il. 8.307. To be oppressed: ὑπὸ λαίλαπι χθών Il. 16.384.
(2) To bring one's weight to bear, bear hard: ἰθὺς Δαναῶν βρίσαντες ἔβησαν Il. 17.233. Cf. Il. 12.346 = 359, Il. 17.512. Fig., to be grievous or distressing Il. 21.385.
(3) To prevail, achieve one's end: ἐέδνοισιν Od. 7.159.
Of flies, to buzz Il. 16.642.
The roaring (of fire) Il. 14.396.
Mortal, human Od. 19.545.
Gory, blood-stained: ἔναρα Il. 7.480, Il. 8.534, Il. 10.528, 570, Il. 15.347, Il. 17.13, 540, Il. 22.245, ἀνδράγρια Il. 14.509.
Shed blood, gore: αἱματόεντα Il. 6.425, Il. 14.7, Il. 18.345, Il. 23.41: μέλανα Od. 24.189.

(2) Absol., a mortal man, a man: θεὰ βροτῷ εὐνηθεῖσα Il. 2.821. Cf. Il. 1.272, Il. 8.428, Il. 9.159, Il. 11.2, Il. 13.244, etc.: βροτῶν θελκτήρια Od. 1.337. Cf. Od. 4.197, Od. 5.101, Od. 7.149, Od. 11.287, Od. 12.125, etc. Qualified by θνητός Od. 3.3 = Od. 12.386, Od. 6.210, Od. 16.212. For μέροπες βροτοί see μέροπες.
To make gory, stain with blood: βεβροτωμένα τεύχεα Od. 11.41.

forms: Of a wounded hero Il. 13.393 = Il. 16.486.

defs: (2) The partaking of food: μνησόμεθα βρώμης Od. 10.177.
(2) The partaking of food: ἐς βρωτὺν ὀτρύνετον Il. 19.205.

forms: Made of the fibrous coat of the papyrus Od. 21.391.

etym: [app. fr. βυσσός + δόμος, to construct in the interior of the house, away from public view.]
forms: To plan or ponder secretly Od. 4.676, Od. 8.273, Od. 9.316, Od. 17.66, 465 = 491 = Od. 20.184.

defs: The depth of the sea Il. 24.80.

forms: Acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. pass. βεβυσμένον
defs: To stuff full of. With genit.: τάλαρον νήματος Od. 4.134.

forms: A clod, the clods, of earth Od. 4.374.

etym: [prob. fr. βα-, βαίνω, something to or on which one mounts.]
defs: (2) A stand on which the body of a chariot was placed after removal of the wheels. In pl. of a single stand: ἅρματʼ ἃμ βωμοῖσι τίθει Il. 8.441 (app. assimilated to ἅρματα, which is pl. in form only).
(3) A pedestal Od. 6.100.
To call to for aid: κράταιϊν Od. 12.124.
Feeding men, rich in food: φθιῃ Il. 1.155.

(1) The earth: στεναχιζετο γ. Il. 2.95. Cf. Il. 2.699, 782, Il. 7.19, 282, Il. 17.447, etc.: πείρατα γαίης Od. 4.563. Cf. Od. 2.131, Od. 3.16, Od. 4.417, Od. 7.167, Od. 11.239, etc. Personified Il. 3.278: Od. 11.576.
(2) The earth as distinguished
(b) From the sea or water: γαίης καὶ πόντοιο Il. 8.479. Cf. Il. 8.24, Il. 14.204: ἐφ̓ὑγρὴν ἠδ' ἐπὶ γαῖαν Od. 1.98. Cf. Od. 5.294, 359, Od. 11.587, Od. 12.282, Od. 23.238, etc.

(3) The earth considered with reference to extent: πολλὴ γαῖα, many regions or countriesIl. 15.81: Od. 2.364, Od. 4.268, Od. 14.380. So πολλὴν ἐπʼ ἀπείρονα γαῖαν (far and wide on the . . . ) Od. 15.79. Cf. Od. 19.284.

(5) The surface of the earth, the earth, the ground: ποτὶσκῆπτρον βάλε γαίῃ Il. 1.245. Cf. Il. 3.114, Il. 4.112, Il. 11.161, Il. 13.200, Od. 3.420, Il. 23.420, etc.: κατακλίνας ἐπὶγαίῃ Od. 10.165. Cf. Od. 2.80, Od. 8.190, Od. 9.289, Od. 11.423, Od. 18.92, etc.

(6) Earth as a material, earth, soil: χυτή με κατὰ γαῖα καλύπτοι Il. 7.464. Cf. Il. 6.99, Il. 14.114, Il. 23.256: ἀμφὶ γαῖαν ἔναξεν Od. 21.122. Cf. Od. 3.258. Of a corpse: κωφὴν γαῖαν (the senseless clay) Il. 24.54.
Of the Earth: υἱόν Od. 6.324.

Epithet or a name of Poseidon. Prob., earth-embracing, the earth-embracer (connecting Poseidon with the earth-encircling river Ocean) Il. 13.83, 125, Il. 15.174, 201, Od. 3.34: Od. 1.68, Od. 3.55, Od. 8.322, 350, Od. 9.528. Joined  with ἐννοσίγαιος Il. 9.183, Il. 13.43, 59, 677, Il. 14.355, Il. 15.222, Il. 23.584: Od. 11.241.

forms: Only in phrase κύδεϊ γαίων, of a divinity, glorying in his splendour; or perh., brilliant or glorious with splendour Il. 1.405, Il. 5.906, Il. 8.51 Il. 11.81.
Still sucking the mother's milk: νεβρούς Od. 4.336 = Od. 17.127.

defs: (1) Of the winds Od. 5.391, Od. 12.168.
(2) Of the sea: ἐλόωσι γαλήνην (through a calm sea) Od. 6.319. Cf. Od. 5.452, Od. 10.94.

forms: A sister-in-law, a sister of one's husband Il. 3.122, Il. 7.378, 383, Il. 22.473, Il. 24.769.

defs: (2) A brother-in-law Il. 5.474, Il. 13.464, 466.

forms: 3 sing. aor. opt. γήμαιτο Od. 16.392, Od. 21.162.
defs: (1) In act., of a man, to marry, wed: κούρην Il. 9.388, μιν 391, Ἀδρήστοιο θυγατρῶν(partitive genit., one of his daughters) Il. 14.121. Cf. Il. 9.399, Il. 11.227, Il. 13.433: ἄλοχον μνηστήν Od. 1.36 (here of another's wife), Od. 11.179, 274, 282, Od. 15.241, 522, Od. 16.34, Od. 21.72, 158, Od. 23.149. Absol. Od. 4.208.
(2) In mid.
(b) App., to get (a wife for one's son): πηλεύς μοι γυναῖκα γαμέσσεται Il. 9.394 (υ.λ. γε μάσσεται).

(1) A contracting of marriage, one's marriage: ὄφρα συνώμεθα ἀμφὶ γάμῳ Il. 13.382: γάμον τεύξουσιν Od. 1.277 = Od. 2.196. Cf. Od. 1.249 = Od. 16.126, Od. 2.97 = Od. 19.142 = Od. 24.132, Od. 2.205, Od. 4.7,Od. 7.27, 66, 288, Od. 15.126, 524, Od. 17.476, Od. 18.272, Od. 19.137, 157, Od. 20.341, Od. 21.250, Od. 22.50, Od. 24.126.
(2) A marriage, a wedding, a wedding-feast: γάμοι εἰλαπίναι τε Il. 18.491. Cf. Il. 19.299, Il. 24.62: δαινύντα γάμον Od. 4.3. Cf. Od. 1.226, Od. 4.770, Od. 11.415, Od. 20.307, Od. 23.135.
(3) Marriage, wedlock: ἱμερόεντα ἔργα γάμοιο Il. 5.429: ἐκλελάθοιτό κε γάμοιο Od. 3.224. Cf. Od. 20.74.
The jaws of an animal. Of lions Il. 13.200, Il. 16.489. Of horses Il. 19.394.
With hooked talons: αἰγυπιοί Il. 16.428: = Od. 22.302, Od. 16.217.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. pres. pple. γανόωντες Il. 13.265.
Of polished metal, to shine, gleam Il. 13.265, Il. 19.359.
Of vegetation, to be brightly green: πρασιαί Od. 6.128.
To rejoice or take delight in.
In reference to persons: ἀνδρὶ φίλῳ ἐλθοντι Il. 14.504. Cf. Od. 12.43.

defs: (1) Introducing the ground or reason for something said.

(2) Introducing an explanation, reason, amplification, or analysis of something previously said (often with καί; see  καί 3) Il. 1.9, 12, 80, 262, 295, 355, Il. 2.119, Il. 4.226, 301, Il. 8.148, Il. 10.352, Il. 12.322, etc.: Od. 1.33, 260, Od. 2.89, Od. 3.89, 362, Od. 4.86, Od. 7.164, Od. 9.319, 432 (the clause here introduced parenthetically), Od. 11.69, Od. 20.42, Od. 21.232, etc.

(3) Introducing as a kind of interjection a question or expression with something of an abrupt effect (sometimes translatable, why . . ., well . . .): πῶς γάρ τοι δώσουσι γέρας ; Il. 1.123, ἦ γάρ κεν δειλὸς καλεοίμην Il. 1.293. Cf. Il. 10.61, Il. 15.201, Il. 18.182, etc.: πῶς γάρ με κέλεαι . . .; Od. 10.337, εἰ γάρ κεν σὺ μίμνοις Od. 15.545. Cf. Od. 8.159, Od. 10.383, Od. 14.115, Od. 15.509, Od. 16.222, etc. For αἲ γάρ, εἰ γάρ in wishes see αἴ 1, εἰ 2.b.

(4) Idiomatically following the relative ὅς · ὃ γάρ κʼ ὄχ' ἄριστον εἴη (for that . . .) Il. 12.344 = 357, ὃ γὰρ γέρας ἐστὶ θανόντων Il. 23.9: ὃς γὰρ δεύτατος ἦλθεν Od. 1.286. Cf. Od. 17.172, Od. 24.190. So following ἵνα: ἵνα γάρ σφιν ἐπέφραδον ἠγερέθεσθαι (for there . . .) Il. 10.127. And ὡς: ὡς γὰρ ἀνώγει (for so he bade) Il. 9.690, ὡς γὰρ ἔμοιγε (for so he was to me) Il. 24.68, etc.: ὡς γάρ οἱ μοῖρʼ ἐστὶ . . . (for this is his destiny, to . . .) Od. 5.41. Cf. Od. 8.79, Od. 20.282, etc. (In such cases the demonstrative ὥ (ὧς) is also read.)
(2) The intestine of an animal stuffed with fat and blood and forming some kind of pudding or large sausage Od. 18.44, 118, Od. 20.25.
(3) The womb Il. 7.58.

forms: The lower and rounded part of a vessel: τρίποδος Il. 18.348: = Od. 8.437.

defs: Some kind of vessel for milk Od. 9.223.

forms: Calling attention to a word or fact or distinguishing it from others: εἴ κε θάνατόν γε φύγοιμεν Il. 1.60, ἐπεί μ'  ἀφέλεσθέ γε δόντες 299 (δόντες being here the word emphasized). Cf. Il. 1.81, 216, 286, 352, 393, 506, etc.: κεῖνός γε ἐοικότι κεῖται ὀλέθρῳ Od. 1.46, ὅτις τοιαῦτά γε ῥέζοι 47. Cf. Od. 1.10, 203, 222, 223, 229, 339, etc.–γʼ οὖν in any case: εἴ γʼ οὖν ἕτερός γε φύγῃσιν (if indeed one does escape) Il. 5.258, μὴ ἐμέ γʼ οὖν οὗν οὗτός γε λάβοι χόλος (far be it from me) Il. 16.30.
3 sing. plupf. (in impf. sense) ἐγεγώνει Il. 22.34, Il. 23.425: Od. 21.368.
3 sing. impf. (ἐ γέγωνε Il. 14.469, Il. 24.703: Od. 8.305.
From pres. γεγωνέω impf. (ἐγεγώνευν Od. 12.370, Od. 17.161.
defs: (1) To make one's voice heard: οὔ πώς οἱ ἔην βώσαντι γεγωνεῖν Il. 12.337. Cf. Il. 8.223 = Il. 11.6: Od. 5.400 = Od. 9.473 = Od. 12.181, Od. 7.294.–αὔειν γεγωνώς, to shout making oneself heard, i.e. in a sustained and loud voiceIl. 8.227 = Il. 11.275 = 586 = Il. 17.247, Il. 12.439 = Il. 13.149.
(2) To shout (with implication that one makes oneself heard): ἐγέγωνε πουλυδάμαντι Il. 14.469. Cf. Il. 22.34, Il. 23.425, Il. 24.703: Od. 8.305, Od. 9.47, Od. 12.370, Od. 21.368.
(3) To declare something aloud Od. 17.161.
A neighbour Od. 4.16, Od. 5.489, Od. 9.48.
Tending to, conceived in a spirit of, mockery; or perh., laughable: ἔργα Od. 8.307.

forms: Pple. γελάσας Od. 2.301. γελάσσας Il. 11.378, Il. 21.508.
Infin. γελάσαι Od. 14.465. Also pres. γελόω Od. 21.105.
Pl. pple. γελόωντες Od. 18.40, Od. 20.374. γελώωντες Od. 18.111, Od. 20.390. (ἐκ-.)
defs: (1) To smile: δακρυόεν Il. 7.484, χείλεσιν (i.e. with a forced smile) Il. 15.101. Cf. Od. 17.542, Od. 21.105. Of the earth, to be bright Il. 19.362. Of the heart, to rejoice Il. 21.389: Od. 9.413 (here app. connoting inward derisive laughter. See 2.b).

(1) Race, stock, family = γένος 1, γενέθλη 1: τίη γενεὴν ἐρεείνεις; Il. 7.145, Il. 21.153, πατρόθεν ἐκ γενεῆς ὀνομάζων (by his father's, that is, his family name) Il. 10.68, γενεῇ ὑπέρτερος (in birth) Il. 11.786, γενεὴν Διὸς εἶναι (by race sprung from . . .) Il. 21.187. Cf. Il. 7.151, 211  =  Od. 3.241, Il. 6.128, Il. 10.239, Il. 15.141, Il. 19.105, Od. 3.203, 214, Il. 21.157, Il. 23.471: γενεῇ πατρώϊον (by right of descent) Od. 1.387. Cf. Od. 15.225. Of horses, stock, breed Il. 5.265, 268.

(2) A race or generation = γένος 3: φύλλων Il. 7.146, ἀνδρῶν 149. A race or family: οὔ τοι γενεὴν θεοὶ νώνυμνον θῆκαν Od. 1.222. Cf. Od. 16.117. A body of descendants, offspring: δαρδάνου Od. 3.303. Cf. Od. 3.306, Il. 21.191: Od. 4.27.

(3) The body of persons born at about a certain time and conceived of as living for a certain time and conceived of as living for certain period, a generation: δύο γενεαὶ ἀνθρώπων Il. 1.250. Cf. Il. 23.790: Od. 14.325 = Od. 19.294.
(4) App., family likeness or type: αὐτῷ γενεὴν ἐῴκει (in . . .) Il. 14.474.

(5) In reference to the date of one's birth, age, one's years = γένος 7: ὁπλότερος γενεῇ (in age) Il. 2.707. Cf. Il. 4.60 = Il. 18.365, Il. 7.24, Il. 6.153, Il. 9.161, Il. 15.166, 182: Od. 19.184. So with instrumental: γενεῆφι νεώτατος Il. 14.112. Cf. Il. 9.58, Il. 21.439.
(6) One's birthplace = γένος 8 Od. 3.390: Od. 1.407, Od. 15.175, Od. 20.193.
(1) Race, stock = γενεή 1, γένος 1: σῆς ἐκ γενέθλης Il. 19.111: παιήονός εἰσι γενέθλης (of the race of . . .) Od. 4.232. Cf. Od. 13.130.
(2) Of mares, a brood: τῶν ἓξ ἐγένοντο γ. Il. 5.270 (γ. being predicate).
(3) Source, origin = γένος 2: ὅθεν ἀργύρου ἐστὶ γ. (whence comes . . .) Il. 2.857.
In pl., the hair on the chin, the beard: γενειάδες ἀμφὶ γένειον Od. 16.176.
To get a beard, i.e. attain manhood: παῖδα γενειήσαντα Od. 18.176. Cf. Od. 18.269.
Source, origin: Ὠκεανόν, θεῶν γένεσιν Il. 14.201 = 302. Cf. Il. 14.246.

forms: One's birth: ἐκ γενετῆς Il. 24.535 (from his birth (onwards)): Od. 18.6 (to be his from his birth, i.e. on his birth).

defs: Suited to (noble) birth, seemly, honourable Il. 5.253.

(1) Race, stock, family = γενεή 1, γενέθλη 1: γ. ἦν ἐκ ποταμοῖο (was by race sprung from . . .) Il. 5.544. Cf. Il. 5.896, Il. 7.209, Il. 14.113, 126, Il. 21.186, Il. 23.347: Od. 4.63, Od. 14.199, 204, Od. 15.267, 533, Od. 16.62, 401, Od. 17.373, Od. 19.116, 162, Od. 21.335, Od. 24.269, 508, 512. One's descent: γ. μοι ἔνθεν ὅθεν σοί Il. 4.58. Cf. Il. 13.354.
(2) Source, origin = γενέθλη 3: ὅθεν ἡμιόνων γ. Il. 2.852 (whence come . . .).
(3) A race or generation = γενεή 2: ἡμιθέων ἀνδρῶν Il. 12.23. Cf. Od. 4.62, Od. 17.523, Od. 20.212.
(4) App., a generation considered as a period: τρὶς ἀνάξασθαι γένεʼ ἀνδρῶν (during three generations) Od. 3.245.
(5) The members of one's family: μεθʼ αἶμά τε καὶ γ. αὐτῶν Od. 8.583.
(6) Offspring, a child: δῖον γ. Il. 9.538, σὸν γένος Il. 19.124. So of the Chimaera: θεῖον γ. (as being of divine origin) Il. 7.180.
(7) In reference to the date of one's birth, age, one's years = γενεή 5: γένει ὕστερος ἦεν (was the younger) Il. 3.215.
(8) One's birthplace = γενεή 6 Od. 7.35.

forms: To seize or grasp: ἱμάσθλην Il. 8.43 = Il. 13.25. Cf. Il. 13.241, Il. 18.476, 477.

defs: (1) Absol. in masc., an old man (always of a dignified person): ἠρᾶθʼ ὁ γ. Il. 1.35. Cf. Il. 3.191, 225, Il. 10.77, Il. 11.632, 645, Il. 14.39, Il. 24.162, 252, 279, 302, 322: Od. 3.373. In voc. as a term of respectful address Il. 10.164, 167, 558, Il. 11.648, 653, Il. 24.390, 433, 618. Joined with ἄττα Il. 9.607, Il. 17.561. Without the notion of respect Od. 2.201, Od. 14.131, 185.
(2) Absol. in fem., an old woman (app. referring to those of the higher classes): ξυνάγουσα γεραιάς Il. 7.87. Cf. Il. 7.270, 287, 296.
(3) In comp. γεραίτερος
(b) Old rather than young, elderly: κῆρυξ Il. 24.149, 178. Cf. Od. 3.362.
To honour, show honour to: νώτοισι διηνεκέεσσιν Il. 6.321: Od. 14.437, ἀγαθοῖσιν 441.
Of dignified bearing, majestic Il. 3.170. In comp. γεραρώτερος Il. 3.211.

forms: Acc. pl. with hyphaeresis γέρᾶ (for γέραἀ Il. 2.237, Il. 9.334: Od. 4.66.
defs: (1) A meed of honour, a special prize apart from the general division of spoils (represented as assigned sometimes to the king or a chief by the general consent (as in Il. 1.118, 123, 135, 276, Il. 16.56, Il. 18.444: Od. 6.10), sometimes to chiefs by the king (as in Il. 9.334, 367). (But cf. Il. 9.130, 272, Il. 11.696, where the king is represented as choosing his prize)) Il. 1.118, 120, 123, 133, 135, 138, 161, 163, 167, 185, 276, 356 = 507  =  Il. 2.240, Il. 2.237, Il. 9.111, 334, 344, 367, Il. 16.54, 56, Il. 18.444, Il. 19.89: Od. 6.10, Od. 11.534.
(2) Something given by way of showing honour to a person: νῶτα βοός, τά οἱ γέρα πάρθεσαν Od. 4.66.
(3) An honour paid: τὸ γὰρ λάχομεν γ. ἡμεῖς Il. 4.49 = Il. 24.70. Cf. Il. 16.457 = 675, Il. 23.9: Od. 4.197, Od. 24.190, 296.
(4) A privilege: γερόντων Il. 4.323, Il. 9.422.

(5) The dignity or honours of a king: οὔ τοι Πρίαμος γ. ἐν χερὶ θήσει Od. 3.182. Cf. Od. 11.175, 184, Od. 15.522. App., any hereditary honour or privilege bestowed on a king or a chief by the people: γ. ὅ τι δῆμος ἔδωκεν Od. 6.150.
(6) A gratuity: λοετροχόῳ Od. 20.297.
Of an oath, taken by the elders or councillors (as representing the people) Il. 22.119. Of wine, such as is served at assemblies of councillors Il. 4.259: Od. 13.8.

forms: Dat. pl. γέρουσι Il. 4.344, Il. 7.113, Il. 9.70.
defs: (2) In apposition: παρὰ πατρὶ γέροντι Il. 1.358. Cf. Il. 2.793, Il. 5.149, Il. 6.125, etc.: Od. 1.188, Od. 2.157, Od. 3.436, etc.
(3) As a proper adj., old, stricken by age: γ. ἐὼν πολεμιστής Il. 10.549. Cf. Od. 18.53, 81. Of a thing, old, worn by use: σάκος Od. 22.184.

(4) A member of the βουλή, an elder or councillor: βουλὴν γερόντων Il. 2.53. Cf. Il. 2.21, 404, Il. 4.323, 344, Il. 7.113, Il. 9.70, 89, 422, 574, Il. 15.721, Il. 18.448, Il. 19.303, 338 (here including Agamemnon, the king): γέροντας πλέονας καλέσαντες Od. 6.189. Cf. Od. 2.14, Od. 21.21, Od. 24.255.
(5) An elder acting as one of a body of judges Il. 18.503.

forms: With genit., to taste of, take a taste of. Fig.: δουρὸς ἀκωκῆς Il. 21.61. Cf. Od. 21.98.
Also, fig., to make trial of, try one's fortune with: ἀλλήλων Od. 3.258: Ἀχαιῶν Od. 17.413, χειρῶν Od. 20.181.

defs: (1) A dike or embankment to confine a river: ποταμὸς ἐκέδασσε γεφύρας Il. 5.88. Cf. Il. 5.89.

(2) π(τ)ολέμοιο γέφυραι, app., ranks of men thought of as stemming the tide of warIl. 4.371, Il. 8.378, Il. 11.160, Od. 3.427. In Il. 8.553 (ἐπὶ πτολέμοιο γεφύρας ἥατο) app., preserving (more or less) the stations in which they had fought.
(1) To dam (a river) Il. 21.245.
(2) To make (a way) by forming an embankment: γεφύρωσε κέλευθον Il. 15.357.
(1) The earth = γαῖα 1: ὄφρʼ ἂν ἵκηται γῆν Il. 15.24, φυσίζοος Il. 21.63. Personified Il. 3.104, Il. 19.259.
(2) The earth as distinguished from the sea, the land = γαῖα 2..b: ἢ ἁλὸς ἢ ἐπὶ γῆς Od. 12.27. Cf. Od. 21.233.
(3) A particular land or country = γαῖα 4: τίς γῆ; Od. 13.233. One's native land: ἁμῆς γῆς Od. 11.167, 482.
(4) The surface of the earth, the ground = γαῖα 5: νέρθεν γῆς Od. 11.302, ἦ πρὸς γῆν ἐλάσειε κάρη Od. 17.237.

forms: 3 sing. pf. (in pres. sense) γέγηθε Il. 8.559: Od. 7.106.
3 sing. plupf. (in impf. sense) γεγήθει Il. 11.683, Il. 13.494.
defs: (2) To take pleasure or delight in doing something. With pple.: Ἀργείων ἐρέων γενεήν Il. 6.127.
Joy, delight: ἐγέλασσέ οἱ ἦτορ γηθοσύνῃ Il. 21.390. Of the sea Il. 13.29.

forms: The period of old age: ἐς γῆρας Il. 14.86. Cf. Od. 8.226, Od. 19.368, Od. 23.286.
3 sing. impf. ἐγήρα Il. 6.148, Il. 17.197. γήρα Od. 14.67. Also non-thematic pres. pple. γηράς Il. 17.197.
defs: To grow old: ἤδη γηράσκοντα Il. 2.663. Cf. Il. 6.148, Il. 17.197 (twice), 325, Il. 24.541: Od. 4.210, Od. 14.67, Od. 15.409. Of fruit, to mellow Od. 6.120.

(A) 3 sing. pa. iterative γενέσκετο Od. 11.208. Aor. γενόμην Il. 18.102, Il. 19.219, Il. 21.440: Od. 8.311, Od. 14.141. 2 sing. γένευ Il. 5.897. 3 sing. γένετο Il. 1.49, Il. 7.153, Il. 13.417, Il. 23.526, etc.: Od. 2.26, Od. 4.11, Od. 24.292, etc. 3 dual γενέσθην Il. 5.548: Od. 11.255, 307, 312. 1 pl. γενόμεσθα Il. 21.89. With metrical lengthening of the first syllable γεινόμεθα Il. 22.477 (v.l. γιγνόμεθα). 2 pl. ἐγένεσθε Il. 2.323. 3 pl. (ἐγένοντο Il. 3.84, Il. 4.382, Il. 5.63, Il. 6.313, etc.: Od. 6.144, Od. 8.234, Od. 18.345, Od. 21.24, etc. Subj. γένωμαι Il. 8.180, Il. 16.39, Il. 22.358: Od. 5.473, Od. 11.73, Od. 22.167. 2 sing. -ηαι Il. 8.282, Il. 11.797:  Od. 10.486. 3 sing. -ηται Il. 1.341, Il. 7.489, Il. 19.201, etc.: Od. 2.374, Od. 8.553, Od. 17.23, etc. 1 pl. -ώμεθα Il. 10.193, Il. 13.236, Il. 17.636. 2 pl. -ησθε Il. 5.488. 3 pl. -ωνται Il. 2.397, Od. 3.308. Opt. γενοίμην Il. 17.38: Od. 14.338, Od. 16.103. 2 sing. -οιο Od. 9.456, Od. 14.440, Od. 15.341, Od. 18.79. 3 sing. -οιτο Il. 4.17, Il. 8.26, Il. 13.233, etc.: Od. 3.129, Od. 8.414, Od. 18.161, etc. 1 pl. -οίμεθα Il. 13.485. 2 pl. -οισθε Il. 6.99. 3 pl. -οίατο Il. 2.340: Od. 1.266, Od. 4.346, Od. 17.137. 3 sing. imp. γενέσθω Il. 8.181: Od. 5.224, Od. 17.285, Od. 22.491. Pple. (with metrical lengthening of the first syllable) γεινόμενος, -ου (vv. ll. γιγνόμενος, -οὐ Il. 10.71, Od. 3.128, Il. 23.79, Il. 24.210: Od. 4.208, Od. 6.198. Infin. γενέσθαι Il. 3.323, Il. 6.199, Il. 17.151, etc.: Od. 1.220, Od. 4.173, Od. 15.480, etc. 3 sing. pf. γέγονε Il. 19.122. 3 pl. γεγάασι Il. 4.325: Od. 5.35, Od. 7.62, Od. 9.118, Od. 10.5, Od. 13.160, Od. 19.279, Od. 24.84. 3 sing. plupf. γεγόνει Il. 13.355. Acc. sing. masc. pple. γεγαῶτα Il. 9.456: Od. 4.112, 144, Od. 19.400. Acc. pl. γεγαῶτας Il. 2.866. (For these pf. forms cf. μάω, μέμονα under μάω.)

(B) 2 sing. aor. ἐγείναο Il. 5.880. 3 sing. (ἐ)γείνατο Il. 1.280, Il. 4.476, Il. 5.800, Il. 13.777, Il. 15.526, Il. 21.85, etc.: Od. 1.223, Od. 4.13, Od. 7.25, Od. 6.57, 61, Od. 11.268, 299, Od. 15.242, Od. 21.172. 2 sing. subj. γείνεαι Od. 20.202. Infin. γείνασθαι Il. 21.160: Od. 8.312. (ἐγ-, ἐκ-, ἐπι-, παρα-, περι-, προ-.)
(I) In pres. and impf. and forms (A), to come into being.
(II) In forms (B), to give (a person) being.

forms: 2 sing. fut. in mid. form γνώσεαι Il. 2.367, Il. 10.88: Od. 16.310. γνώσῃ Il. 2.365.
Infin. γνώμεναι Il. 2.349, Il. 21.266, 609: Od. 1.411. γνῶναι Od. 2.159, Od. 13.312, Od. 24.159. (ἀνα-, δια-, ἐπι-.)
defs: (2) To gain knowledge of, get to know, learn: Τρώων νόον Il. 22.382. Cf. Od. 1.3, Od. 16.304. To get to know, make the acquaintance of (a person) Od. 1.411. So with genit.: ἀλλήλων Od. 21.36. To become aware of the presence of, discover (a person) Il. 24.688 (twice), 691. To experience, find: φιλότητα Od. 15.537 = Od. 17.164 = Od. 19.310.
(4) To distinguish, discern: ἠμὲν θεὸν ἠδὲ καὶ ἄνδρα Il. 5.128. Cf. Il. 13.72. With acc. and dependent clause: ἵππους οἳ δεύτεροι οἵ τε πάροιθεν Il. 23.497.

(5) To know (a person or thing) for what he or it is, know the nature of, know: εὖ σε γιγνώσκων Il. 22.356. Cf. Il. 17.32 = Od. 3.198, Il. 18.270: ἔγνω [ποταμόν] (i.e. recognized him for a god) Od. 5.444, καλάμην γιγνώσκειν (i.e. can judge from that what I was) Od. 14.215. Cf. Od. 2.159, Od. 16.310. Sim.: θεὸν ἔγνω (knew that it was a god) Od. 1.420. Absol., to recognize one's claim, hold it good Il. 23.661.
Living on (mare's) milk Il. 13.6.
To have the eyes bright or glaring. Of a lion Od. 3.172.
Bright, shining, gleaming (prob. without any notion of colour). Of the sea Il. 16.34.

forms: (The) bright-eyed (maid) (prob. without any notion of colour).
Epithet or a name of Athene Il. 1.206, Il. 2.166, Il. 5.29, Il. 7.88, Il. 8.373, etc.: Od. 1.44, 156, Od. 2.433, Od. 3.13, 135, etc.

etym: [γλάφω = γλύφω. See γλυφίς, and cf. διαγλάφω.]
defs: Hollow, hollowed (for the most part as a conventional epithet). Of caves Il. 18.402, Il. 24.83: Od. 1.15 = Od. 9.30, Od. 1.73, Od. 2.20, Od. 4.403, Od. 5.68, 155, 194, 226, Od. 9.114, 476, Od. 12.210, Od. 23.335. Of rocks, having a cavity or cavities Il. 2.88: Od. 14.533. Of the lyre Od. 8.257, Od. 17.262, Od. 22.340, Od. 23.144. Of a harbour (referring to the curved outline) Od. 12.305. Else-where epithet of ships Il. 2.454, 516, Il. 3.119, Il. 5.327, Il. 8.180, etc.: Od. 3.287, Od. 4.356, 513, Od. 9.99, Od. 10.23, etc.
(1) The eye, the eyeball Il. 14.494: Od. 9.390.
(2) A plaything, a doll or puppet: ἔρρε, κακὴ γλήνη Il. 8.164.
One of the buttocks: δεξιόν Il. 5.66, Il. 13.651. In pl., the buttocks, the rump Il. 8.340.

(1) Sweet or pleasant to the taste: σίτου Il. 11.89: συκέαι Od. 6.116 = Od. 11.590 (the tree for the fruit). Cf. Od. 4.88, Od. 14.194, Od. 20.69, Od. 24.68. Of water, sweet, fit for drinking Od. 12.306.

(2) Generally, sweet, pleasant, giving delight or joy: ὕπνος Il. 10.4, μολπῆς Il. 13.637. Cf. Il. 24.3, 636: Od. 4.295, Od. 5.472, Od. 16.23 = Od. 17.41, Od. 19.511, Od. 22.323, Od. 23.145, 255. In comp.: ἧς γαίης γλυκερώτερον ἄλλο Od. 9.28.
Of gentle or kindly mind: ἀνήρ Od. 3.467.

etym: -ύ. Comp. γλυκίων, γλύκιον Il. 1.249, Il. 2.453, Il. 11.13, Il. 18.109: Od. 9.34.
defs: (1) Sweet or pleasant to the taste: νέκταρ Il. 1.598.

etym: [γλύφω, to cut out, carve. Cf. γλαφυρός.]
forms: App., the notch in an arrow to receive the string.
In pl. (poss. referring to a double notch (i.e. two notches at right angles)) Il. 4.122: Od. 21.419.

defs: (1) The tongue Il. 1.249, Il. 2.489, Il. 5.74, 292, Il. 16.161, Il. 17.618, Od. 3.248. Of the tongues of sacrificial victims Od. 3.332, 341.
(2) A tongue or language Il. 2.804: Od. 19.175. Language, speech: γ. ἐμέμικτο Il. 4.438.

forms: App., a tongue forming one of the ends of the ζυγόδεσμον or yoke-fastening, the ζ. being wound round the pole criss-cross, keeping the portion with the tongue the longer, and the tongue being tucked in under its portion after that portion had been wound over, and had so secured, the end of the other and shorter portion: ὑπὸ γλωχῖνα δʼ ἔκαμψαν Il. 24.274 (ὑπό advbl.).

defs: (1) Bent, curved: ἕλικας Il. 18.401: ἀγκίστροισιν Od. 4.369 = Od. 12.332.
(2) Fig., that can be bent or influenced: νόημα Il. 24.41.
(3) As epithet of the limbs, flexible, lissom Il. 11.669, Il. 24.359: Od. 11.394, Od. 13.398, 430, Od. 21.283. Sim. of jaws, moving freely in their sockets Il. 11.416.
To bend: ἐν γόνυ γνάμψεν (app., crooked his knee round the other's leg) Il. 23.731.

forms: (Lawfully) begotten, born in wedlock, legitimate Il. 11.102: Od. 14.202.

defs: On the knee or the knees: ἔριπεν Il. 5.68. Cf. Il. 5.309, 357, Il. 8.329, Il. 11.355, Od. 3.417.

forms: Absol., a friend or acquaintance Od. 16.9.

defs: (1) Easy to be known, evident: γνωτόν [ἐστιν] ὡς . . . Il. 6.401 Cf. Od. 24.182.
(2) As sb.
(b) More specifically, a brother (and the word may bear this sense in the passages under a) Il. 14.485, Il. 17.35, Il. 22.234.

forms: 1 pl. opt. γοάοιμεν Il. 24.664. γοάοιεν Od. 24.190.
3 sing. fut. in mid. form γοήσεται Il. 21.124, Il. 22.353.
3 pl. aor. γόον (perh. formed fr. γόος) Il. 7.500.
defs: (1) To weep, wail, show signs of grief: μὴ γοόωσα οἰκῆας ἐγείρῃ Il. 5.413. Cf. Il. 7.373, Il. 18.315, 355, Il. 22.476, Il. 23.106: ἑζόμενοι γόων Od. 10.567. Cf. Od. 4.721, 800, Od. 8.92, Od. 9.467, Od. 10.209, Od. 12.234, Od. 19.119, 210, 513.
(2) To weep for, bewail, lament, mourn for the loss of: Ἕκτορα Il. 7.500, δ̀ν πότμον Il. 16.857 = Il. 22.363: πόσιν Od. 19.264.
(3) To pay mourning rites to: αὐτόν Il. 24.664. Cf. Il. 14.502, Il. 21.124, Il. 22.353: Od. 24.190.
A wooden peg, a treenail Od. 5.248.
(1) Offspring Il. 24.539.
(2) Progeny, descendants: Ἀρκεισιάδαο Od. 4.755.
(1) One sprung or born.
(b) A remoter descendant Il. 7.191, Il. 13.449.
(c) In both these senses: δ̀ν (i.e. λαέρταὀ καὶ Ὀδυσσῆος Od. 4.741.
(2) The race: ἀτρέος Od. 11.436.
(3) Offspring Il. 9.493: Od. 4.12, Od. 12.130. One's children or family: νεώτατος γόνοιο Od. 3.409.
(4) One's parentage: δ̀ν γόνον ἐξαγόρευεν Od. 11.234. Cf. Od. 1.216, Od. 19.166.

forms: Genit. γουνός (for γονϝ-ός) Il. 11.547: Od. 19.450. γούνατος Il. 21.591.
defs: (3) Of clasping the knees in supplication: λαβέ [μιν] γούνων (by the knees) Il. 1.407. Cf. Il. 1.500, 512, 557, Il. 7.45, Il. 15.76, Od. 3.468, Il. 21.65, 68, 71, Il. 22.345, Il. 24.357, 465, 478: μητρὸς ποτὶ γούνασι χεῖρας βάλλειν Od. 7.310. Cf. Od. 7.142, 147, 169, Od. 6.142, Od. 10.264, 323, Od. 22.310, 339, 342, 365. So with a word of seizing to be supplied: λισσέσκετο γούνων Il. 9.451. Cf. Od. 10.481, Od. 22.337. Sim.: περὶ γούνατʼ ἐμὰ στήσεσθαι λισσομένους Il. 11.609. Cf. Il. 18.457, Od. 3.463: σὰ γούναθʼ ἱκάνω Od. 5.449, Od. 6.147, Ἀμφινόμου πρὸς γοῦνα καθέζετο (as putting himself under his protection) Od. 18.395. Cf. Od. 3.92 = Od. 4.322, Od. 9.266, Od. 13.231. Also λίσσομʼ ὑπὲρ γούνων Il. 22.338. Of kissing the knees in supplication: ἥ οἱ γούνατʼ ἔκυσσε Il. 8.371. Cf. Od. 14.279.

(4) By extension, in pl., the knee(s) and thigh(s) of a sitting person: ἐν γούνασι πῖπτε διώνης (on her knee) Il. 5.370, Ἀθηναίης ἐπὶ γούνασιν (on the lap, i.e., app., of a seated statue) Il. 7.92, 273, 303. Cf. Il. 5.408, Il. 9.455, 488, Il. 21.506, Il. 22.500: ἐμὲ γούνασιν οἷσιν ἐφεσσάμενος Od. 16.443. Cf. Od. 19.401, Od. 21.55.–ταῦτα θεῶν ἐν γούνασι κεῖται, the issue lies with the gods(perh. referring to the custom of placing gifts on the lap of a statue (cf. Il. 7.92, 273, 303 cited above), the gifts being irrevocably dedicated, and symbolizing complete submission to divine governance) Il. 17.514 = Od. 3.435: = Od. 1.267 = Od. 16.129, Od. 1.400.

(1) Weeping, wailing, lamentation, mourning Il. 5.156, Il. 7.499, Il. 17.37, Il. 18.51, Il. 23.10, 14, etc.: Od. 4.102, 113, Od. 8.540, Od. 16.144, Od. 19.268, Od. 21.228, etc. In pl.: ὀδύνας τε γόους τε Od. 1.242.
(2) Inclination to weep: πᾶσιν ὑπέδυ γ. Od. 10.398.
(3) Mourning rites, formal mourning or lamentation: ἦρχε γόοιο Il. 24.723. Cf. Il. 24.747, 761.

etym: [γουν-, γόνυ. To clasp the knees, clasp by the knees, in supplication. Cf. γόνυ 3.]
forms: To supplicate, entreat. Retaining the genitival construction of a vb. of taking hold, and with the construction extended to something appealed to: μή με γούνων γουνάζεο μηδὲ τοκήων Il. 22.345.
With this latter construction alone: τῶν ὄπιθέν σε γουνάζομαι Od. 11.66.
With prepositional clauses indicating what is appealed to: τῶν ὕπερ Il. 15.665. Cf. Od. 11.66, Od. 13.324.
With simple acc. of the person entreated: γουνάσομαί μιν Il. 1.427.

etym: [perh. fr. γονϝ-, γόνυ, in sense swell, knoll, and, in reference to a vineyard, etc., the part best catching the sun, and therefore the most fruitful.]
forms: γουνῷ (γουνὸν̓ ἀλωῆς Il. 9.534, Il. 18.57 = 438: Od. 1.193, Od. 11.193, ἐς γουνὸν Ἀθηνάων Od. 11.323 (here perh. the reference is to the citadel).

defs: To supplicate, entreat: υἱόν Il. 9.583. Cf. Il. 15.660, Il. 21.74, Il. 22.240: Od. 4.433, Od. 7.149, Od. 22.312, 344. App., to supplicate (and at the same  time to vow to do something): νεκύων κάρηνα ῥέξειν . . . Od. 10.521, Od. 11.29.

forms: contr. nom. pl. masc. pres. pple. γοάω.

defs: A scratch: γραπτῦς ἀλεείνων Od. 24.229.
(1) To scratch, cut into, incise: δ'στέον Il. 17.599.
(2) To form by scratching or incision: θυμοφθόρα Il. 7.169.

forms: In apposition: γρηΐ ἀμφιπόλῳ Od. 1.191. Cf. Od. 18.27, Od. 24.211.

defs: One of the two curved plates, front and back, of which the θώρηξ was formed. The front plate Il. 5.99, 189, Il. 13.507 = Il. 17.314, Il. 13.587. In pl. of the two plates Il. 15.530.
(1) A joint: γ. ποδῶν Il. 13.512.
(2) The limbs: γ. ἔθηκεν ἐλαφρά Il. 5.122 = Il. 13.61 = Il. 23.772. Cf. Il. 19.385, Il. 22.448, Il. 23.691.

(3) The limbs regarded as the scat of strength, as symbolizing the strength (cf. γόνυ 2): λῦσε γ. Il. 4.469 = Il. 11.260, Il. 11.240, Il. 16.312 = 400, 465, Il. 21.406. Cf. Il. 4.230, Il. 5.811, Il. 7.27, Il. 6.6, 12, 16, Il. 13.85m 435, Il. 15.435, 581, Il. 16.341, 805, Il. 17.524, Il. 18.31, Il. 19.165, 169, Il. 23.63, 627, 726: ἐκ κάματον εἵλετο γυίων Od. 10.363. Cf. Od. 1.192, Od. 8.233, Od. 12.279, Od. 18.238, 242, 341. As that upon which fear takes hold or which it affects: τρόμος ἔλλαβε γ. Il. 3.34, Il. 8.452, Il. 14.506, Il. 24.170. Cf. Il. 6.215 = Od. 3.44, Il. 10.95, 390: Od. 7.140, Od. 11.527, Od. 18.88. App. as the seat of yearning: ἦλθʼ ἵμερος [γόοιο] ἀπὸ γυίων Il. 24.514.
To lame, cripple: γυιώσω σθωῒν ἵππους Il. 8.402. Cf. Il. 8.416.
(1) Without clothes, naked: σὲ εὐλαὶ ἔδονται γυμνόν Il. 22.510. Cf. Od. 7.136.
(2) Without armour, unarmed: κτενέει με γυμνὸν ἐόντα Il. 22.124. Cf. Il. 16.815, Il. 17.122 = 693, 711, Il. 18.21, Il. 21.50.
(3) Of a bow, out of its case Od. 11.607. Of an arrow, out of the quiver Od. 21.417.
(1) To become naked, strip oneself: αἰδέομαι γυμνοῦσθαι Od. 7.222. Cf. Od. 10.341. To strip oneself of. With genit.: γυμνώθη ῥακέων Od. 22.1.
(2) To be left unprotected by armour or shield: οὖτα γυμνωθέντα Il. 16.312 = 400. Cf. Il. 12.389, 428. Of a wall, to be left bare of defence Il. 12.399.
Of a woman: βουλάς Od. 11.437.
Mad for women Il. 3.39 = Il. 13.769.
Of a woman: δώρων (given to a woman) Od. 11.521, Od. 15.247.
(2) The mistress of a house Od. 16.334, Od. 21.86.

(3) In pl., the female servants in a house: τετυγμένα χερσὶ γυναικῶν Il. 22.511. Cf. Il. 18.559: εἰς ὅ κʼ εἴπω γυναιξὶ δεῖπνον τετυκεῖν Od. 15.76. Cf. Od. 2.108, Od. 16.304, Od. 17.75, Od. 18.186, Od. 19.16, Od. 22.437, etc. With ἀμφίπολος Od. 1.362, Od. 7.52, Od. 6.235, Od. 16.413, Od. 21.8, etc. With δμῳή Il. 7.323, Il. 9.477: Od. 6.103, Od. 13.66, Od. 16.108 = Od. 20.318, Od. 17.505, Od. 19.490, Od. 22.37, etc. In sing., one of the servants Od. 15.417, 434, 439, Od. 19.344, etc. With words indicating the servant's country of origin: φοίνισσα Od. 15.417, σικελή Od. 24.211. Her office: ταμίη Il. 7.390: Od. 2.345, Od. 3.479, ἀλετρίς Od. 20.105.
(4) Specifically.

(b) A wife: σὺν γυναιξί τε καὶ τεκέεσσιν Il. 4.162. Cf. Il. 3.48, Il. 7.160, Il. 8.57, Il. 9.394, Il. 17.36, etc.: ἀνὴρ ἠδὲ γ. Od. 7.184. Cf. Od. 1.13, 433, Od. 2.249, Od. 6.347, Od. 14.211, Od. 17.152, Od. 21.72, etc.
(c) A concubine as opposed to a wife Il. 24.497.

(d) A woman as distinguished from a goddess: θεᾶς οὐδὲ γυναικός Il. 14.315. Cf. Il. 16.176, Il. 24.58: ἢ θεὸς ἠὲ γ. Od. 10.228, 255. With words indicative of mortality: θνητάων Od. 3.305: θνητήν Od. 11.244.
(5) In voc. as a term of courteous or respectful address, lady Il. 3.204, 438, Il. 7.441, Il. 24.300: Od. 4.148, Od. 7.168, Od. 8.424, Od. 11.248, etc.
Bent, rounded Od. 19.246.
A vulture (except in Od. 11.578 always preying on carrion. Cf. αἰγυπιός) Il. 4.237, Il. 11.162, Il. 16.836, Il. 18.271, Il. 22.42: Od. 11.578, Od. 22.30.
A case for a bow Od. 21.54.
Skilled, experienced Il. 15.411, Il. 23.671. With genit.: ἄθλων (in . . .) Od. 8.159. Cf. Od. 8.263, Od. 16.253.

forms: Genit. pl. δαέρων as spondee Il. 24.762, 769.
Emphasizing particle used after interrogatives: τίς δ. ὅμιλος; Od. 1.225. Cf. Il. 10.408 (v.l. δʼ αἰ̔· Od. 24.299.

defs: To ornament curiously: σάκος Il. 18.479: χρυσῷ τε καὶ ἀργύρῳ Od. 23.200.

Something curiously wrought, an ornament Od. 19.227. In pl., things curiously wrought, pieces of cunning workmanship, ornaments: χάλκευον δαίδαλα πολλά Il. 18.400. Cf. Il. 5.60, Il. 14.179, Il. 18.482, Il. 19.13, 19.
(1) To rend, tear: (εκτόρεον χιτῶνα Il. 2.416. Cf. Il. 6.247, Il. 16.841. To tear (the hair) Il. 18.27.

(2) To rend the flesh of,  wound, slay: δεδαϊγμένον ἦτορ (app., with the life killed in him) Il. 17.535, δαΐζων χαλκᾠ Il. 24.393. Cf. Il. 11.497, Il. 18.236, Il. 19.203, 211, 283, 292, 319, Il. 21.147, Il. 22.72. Absol., to do execution Il. 21.33.
(3) To divide (meat) into portions Od. 14.434.

(4) Fig., in pass., to be in two minds, be in doubt: δαϊζόμενος
          ἢ . . . ἦε . . . Hom. Il. 14.20 Of the mind, etc., to be troubled or distressed: ἐδαΐζετο θυμός Il. 9.8 = Il. 15.629. Cf. Od. 13.320.

forms: dat. of δάϊς + κτάμενος. See κτείνω.]
defs: Slain in battle: αἰζηῶν Il. 21.146, 301.

forms: Under superhuman influence, possessed, whose actions are unaccountable or ill-omened.
defs: (1) In stern reproof Il. 1.561, Il. 7.326, Il. 9.40. More gently Il. 7.521.
(2) In more or less stern remonstrance Il. 2.190, Il. 3.399, Il. 4.31: Od. 18.15, Od. 19.71. In tender or gentle remonstrance Il. 7.407, 486: Od. 10.472, Od. 23.166, 174, 264.
(3) Conveying an implication of folly or senselessness Il. 2.200, Il. 13.448, 810: Od. 4.774, Od. 18.406.
(4) App. indicating a degree of wonder, the person addressed showing himself superior to what his outward man would indicate: δαιμόνιε ξείνων Od. 14.443.
(5) App., with orig. sense lost sight of, merely in affectionate address Il. 24.194.
(1) A superhuman power, with little notion of personality (sometimes difficult to distinguish from the next sense).
(b) As beneficent: ἄλλα δ. ὑποθήσεται Od. 3.27. Cf. Od. 9.381, Od. 17.243 = Od. 21.201 (cf. θεός τις Od. 21.196), Od. 19.10, 138.
(c) With neither notion prominent Od. 14.386.

(2) In generalized sense, superhuman power, heaven, fate, the gods (sometimes difficult to distinguish from the δαιμόνιος. sense): σὺν δαίμονι (if heaven so wills it) Il. 11.792, Il. 15.403, πρὸς δαίμονα φωτὶ μάχεσθαι (against the will of the gods) Il. 17.98. Cf. Il. 6.291, 377 = 396, Il. 17.104: δαίμονος αἶσα Od. 11.61. Cf. Od. 2.134, Od. 16.64, Od. 18.146, 256 = Od. 19.129, Od. 19.512, Od. 20.87, Od. 24.306.–δαίμονά τοι δώσω (I will deal thee fate, i.e. death) Il. 8.166.
(3) With more marked notion of personality: ἐπέσσυτο δαίμονι ἶσος Il. 5.438 = Il. 16.705 = 786 = Od. 3.447. Cf. Il. 5.459 = 884, Od. 3.493, Il. 21.18, 227.

forms: 2 sing. subj. mid. δαινύῃ Od. 8.243. δαινύ͂ῃ Od. 19.328.
Nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. δαισάμενοι Od. 6.188, Od. 18.408. (μετα-.)
defs: (2) In mid.

(1) A meal (often with the notion of faring well or revelling): δαίνυ δαῖτα Il. 9.70, δαῖτα πένοντο Il. 18.558 (app. a meal for the King and his retainers, that for the ἔριθοι being mentioned below), πειθώμεθα δαιτί (i.e. to hunger) Il. 23.48. Cf. Il. 1.467, 468, 575m 579, Il. 4.259, 343, etc.: ὄφρʼ ἂν δαῖτα πτωχεύῃ (i.e. beg his bread) Od. 17.11, δαιτῶν ἀπολυμαντῆρα 220. Cf. Od. 1.152, 374, Od. 2.322, Od. 3.33, Od. 6.232, Od. 10.124, etc. Of the god's share of a sacrifice: Ζεὺς ἔβη κατὰ δαῖτα Il. 1.424. Cf. Il. 4.48 = Il. 24.69: τέρπετο δαιτὶ παρήμενος Od. 1.26 (of Poseidon). Cf. Od. 3.336, 420, Od. 8.76. Of what a beast devours Il. 24.43.
(2) A wedding-feast Od. 18.279.
(3) A funeral-feast Il. 24.802.
War, battle: ἐν δαΐ λυγρῇ (λευγαλέᾐ Il. 13.286, Il. 14.387, Il. 24.739.

forms: Of a god's share of a sacrifice Od. 3.44.
From, leaving, a meal: δαίτηθεν ἰόντα Od. 10.216.

defs: (1) To carve meat Od. 14.433, Od. 15.323.
(2) To make an apportionment of spoil Il. 11.688, 705.

forms: One who carves meat, a carver Od. 1.141 = Od. 4.57, Od. 17.331.

defs: The art of carving meat. In pl.: θεράποντε δαήμονε δαιτροσυνάων Od. 16.253.

forms: A guest at or partaker of a meal or feast Od. 4.621, Od. 6.102, 148, Od. 8.66 = 473, Od. 9.7, Od. 15.467, Od. 17.605, Od. 22.12 (in the last two passages of the self-invited guests, the suitors).

defs: Skilled, whether in war or in the arts of peace. Epithet of heroes, etc. Il. 2.23, Il. 4.252, Il. 7.162, Il. 9.651, Il. 11.123, Il. 14.459, etc.:  Od. 1.48, Od. 4.687, Od. 7.256, Od. 8.8, Od. 15.519, Od. 21.16, etc. Absol. in voc. Il. 5.277. Applied to Anticleia Od. 15.356.

forms: 3 sing. pf. (in pres. sense) δέδηε Il. 13.736, Il. 17.253, Od. 3.18: Od. 20.353.
3 sing. plupf. (in impf. sense) δεδήει Il. 2.93, Il. 12.35, 466.
3 sing. aor. subj. pass. δάηται Od. 3.316, Il. 21.375. (ἀμφι-.)
defs: (1) To set on fire, kindle: ξύλα Il. 18.347: Od. 8.436. To light (a fire) Il. 9.211: Od. 6.7. To case (fire) to appear or blaze Il. 5.4, 7, Il. 18.206, 227.

(2) In pf. and plupf. and in pass., to burn or blaze: πῦρ δαιετο Il. 21.343. Cf. Il. 8.75, Il. 18.227 Od. 3.316 = Il. 21.375: Od. 5.61. Of the eyes, to blaze Il. 12.466. So of a lion's eyes Od. 7.132. Fig.: ̓́οσσα δεδήει (spread like wild-fire) Il. 2.93, νῦν ἄγχιστα μάχη δέδηε (app., now most nearly blazes up, i.e. is on the point of blazing up) Od. 3.18. Cf. Il. 12.35, Il. 13.736, Il. 17.253: οἰμωγὴ δέδηε (is bursting forth) Od. 20.353.
(1) In mid.: κρέα δαίετο Od. 15.140. Cf. Od. 17.332.
(2) In pass.: αἰθίοπας, τοὶ διχθὰ δεδαίαται (are divided) Od. 1.23, μήλων δαιομένων (in the division of the . . .) Od. 9.551. Fig., to be troubled or distressed: δαίεταί μοι ἦτορ Od. 1.48.

forms: Fig.: δάκε φρένας μῦθος Il. 5.493 (cf. θυμοδακής).

defs: (1) A tear: δεύοντο δάκρυσι κόλποι Il. 9.570. Cf. Il. 23.16, Il. 24.162: Od. 6.260, Od. 17.103 = Od. 19.596.–(κατἂ δ. χέειν, to shed a tear, to weepIl. 1.357, 413, Il. 3.142, Il. 7.405, Il. 9.14, etc.: Od. 2.24, Od. 4.556, Od. 11.5, Od. 12.12, Od. 14.280, etc. Sim. in various expressions: βαλέειν ἀπὸ δ. παρειῶν Od. 4.198. Cf. Od. 4.114, 223, Od. 17.490.– ἔκπεσέ οἱ δ. Il. 2.266: Od. 16.16.– κατείβετο δ. Il. 24.794: τί δ. κατείβετον; Od. 21.86.–δ. ἀπομόρξασθαι, to wipe away one's tears Il. 2.269: Od. 17.304.– δ. ἔδευε παρειάς (his tears) Od. 8.522.
(2) As the visible feature of weeping; hence, in pl., tears, weeping: δάκρυσι θυμὸν ἐρέχθων Od. 5.83 = 157.
(1) Shedding tears, weeping Il. 7.455, Il. 16.10, Il. 18.66, Il. 21.493, 496, 506, Il. 22.499: Od. 10.415. In neut. δακρυόεν as adv.: γελάσας (smiling through her tears) Il. 7.484.
(2) Accompanied by tears: γόοιο Od. 4.801, Od. 17.8, Od. 24.323.
(3) Causing tears, bringing misery: πόλεμον Il. 5.737 = Il. 8.388, Il. 17.512. Cf. Il. 11.601, Il. 13.765, Il. 16.436.

forms: Instrumental δακρυόφι Il. 17.696, Il. 23.397: Od. 4.705, Od. 10.248, Od. 19.472, Od. 20.349.
defs: (1) A tear: ὄσσε δακρυόφι πλῆσθεν (with tears) Il. 17.696 = Il. 23.397: = Od. 4.705 = Od. 19.472, οὐδέ ποτʼ ὄσσε δακρυόφιν τέρσοντο (were free of tears) Od. 5.152, δάκρυα κεῦθεν Od. 19.212. Cf. Od. 10.248 = Od. 20.349, Od. 18.173.–δάκρυα χέειν, to shed tears, to weepIl. 6.426, Il. 16.3, Il. 18.17, 235: Od. 24.46.– χύτο δάκρυα Il. 23.385: δάκρυα χέοντο Od. 4.523. Sim. in varous expressions: δάκρυʼ ἀναπρήσας Il. 9.433: Od. 2.81.–(κατὰ) δάκρυον εἴβειν, to shed a tear, to weepIl. 16.11, Il. 19.323', Il. 24.9: Od. 4.153, Od. 8.531, Od. 11.391, Od. 16.219, 332, Od. 24.234, 280.– δάκρυα λείβειν Il. 13.88, 658, Il. 18.32: Od. 5.84 = 158, Od. 8.86, 93 = 532, Od. 16.214.– δάκρυʼ ἔκβαλεν Od. 19.362.– δάκρυον ἧκεν Od. 16.191, Od. 23.33.– δάκρυα πίπτει Od. 14.129.– δάκρυα ῥέεν Il. 17.437: Od. 19.204.– δάκρυʼ ὀμόργνυσθαι (ὀμόρξασθαἰ Il. 18.124: Od. 8.88, Od. 11.527, 530.
(2) As the visible feature of weeping: τείσειαν Δαναοὶ ἐμὰ δάκρυα (my weeping, i.e. the cause thereof, my wrongs) Il. 1.42.

etym: [δάκρυ + πλώω in sense to flow. Cf. L. pluo.]
forms: To flow with tears, be maudlin Od. 19.122.

defs: (1) To shed tears, weep: δακρύσας ἕζετο (with a burst of tears) Il. 1.349. Cf. Il. 10.377. Il. 19.229: δάκρυσα ἰδών Od. 11.55 = 395, 87. Cf. Od. 1.336, Od. 17.33, 38, Od. 21.82, Od. 23.207.
(2) In pf. pass., to be in tears: τίπτε δεδάκρυσαι; Il. 16.7. To be covered or filled with tears: δεδάκρυνται παρειαί Il. 22.491. Cf. Od. 20.204, 353.
(1) A piece of ignited material for communicating fire, a fire-brand Il. 13.320, Il. 15.421: Od. 5.488.
(2) A brand snatched from the fire or from a brazier Od. 19.69.

forms: 3 sing. fut. δαμάᾳ Il. 22.271. δαμᾷ Il. 1.61.
Imp. δάμασον Il. 9.496: Od. 11.562. δάμασσον Il. 3.352.
Nom. pl. δαμάσαντες Il. 18.113, Il. 19.66: Od. 9.59.
Acc. sing. masc. pple. δμηθέντα Il. 4.99, Il. 5.646.
defs: (1) To break in, tame. In mid.: ἡμίονον, ἥ τʼ ἀλγίστη δαμάσασθαι Il. 23.655. Cf. Od. 4.637. To control (horses) Il. 10.403 = Il. 17.77. Fig.: Διὸς μάστιγι δαμέντες Il. 12.37. Cf. Il. 13.812.

(2) To bring into subjection: σοὶ δεδμήμεσθα Il. 5.878. Cf. Od. 11.622. Of political subjection Il. 3.183, Il. 7.159: Od. 3.305. To subject (to a man) in marriage: ἀνδρί με  δάμασσεν Il. 18.432. To subject (a woman to the discretion of a victor): ἄλοχοι δʼ ἄλλοισι δαμεῖεν Il. 3.301.

(3) Of feelings, sleep, etc., to overcome: ἔρος μʼ ἐδάμασσεν Il. 14.316. Cf. Il. 10.2 = Il. 24.678, Il. 14.353: δεδμημένος ὕπνῳ Od. 6.318. Cf. Od. 13.119, Od. 15.6. Of natural agencies, to have an overpowering effect upon, wear out, exhaust: ἁλὶ δέδμητο Od. 5.454. Cf. Od. 8.231, Od. 14.318.
(4) To curb or restrain (one's spirit): δάμασον θυμὸν μέγαν Il. 9.496. Cf. Il. 18.113 = Il. 19.66: Od. 11.562. In pass., to be appeased or placated: δμηθήτω Il. 9.158.

(5) To overpower, get the better of, master: ἐπεὶ ξάνθοιο δάμη μένος Il. 21.383. Cf. Il. 16.816: Od. 4.397. In mid.: δαμασσάμενος οἴνῳ Od. 9.454. Cf. Od. 9.516. To defeat, rout, put to flight: κλῖναν δαμάσαντες Ἀχαιούς Od. 9.59. Cf. Il. 7.74 = Il. 17.320, Il. 10.310 = 397, Il. 13.98, Il. 16.420, Il. 17.337, Od. 3.143: Od. 23.310. In mid. Il. 10.210 = 411, Il. 15.476.

(6) To put an end to, destroy, kill, slay: εἰ πόλεμος δαμᾷ Ἀχαιούς Il. 1.61, μὴ ὑπʼ αὐτοῦ δουρὶ δαμήῃς (by him with his spear) Il. 3.436, σοὶ δαμῆναι (by thee) Il. 13.603. Cf. Il. 2.860, Il. 4.479, Il. 5.106, Il. 11.98, Il. 14.482, Il. 19.203, etc.: μοῖρʼ ἐπέδησε δαμῆναι Od. 3.269 (app. referring to Aegisthus as fate-bound to (ultimate) ruin; or perh. to Clytaemnestra as yielding to passion (sense (3))), μή με στίβη δαμάσῃ Od. 5.468. Cf. Od. 1.237, Od. 3.90, 410, Od. 4.495, Od. 11.171, Od. 18.54, etc. In mid. Il. 5.278, Il. 11.478, Il. 16.561, Il. 21.226, Il. 22.379: Od. 16.105. Of a shield, in pass., to be unable to resist a blow, be pierced Od. 3.266. To do violence to, disfigure (oneself): αὐτόν μιν πληγῇσι δαμάσσας Od. 4.244.
(7) To subject to a foe, cause to be defeated Il. 9.118.

(8) To cause to be slain by a foe: ἐμῇς ὑπὸ χερσὶ δάμασσον [Ἀλέξανδρον] Il. 3.352. Cf. Il. 7.368, Il. 13.434, Il. 16.543, 845, Il. 18.119, Il. 22.446, etc.: τούσδε μοῖρʼ ἐδάμασσεν Od. 22.413. Cf. Od. 14.367, Od. 18.57, Od. 19.488 = Od. 21.213, Od. 19.496.
(1) To control, keep in order: Ἥρην ἐπέεσσιν Il. 5.893.
(2) To overcome by troubling the senses. In mid.: φιλότητα καὶ ἵμερον, ᾧ τε σὺ πάντας δαμνᾷ Il. 14.199.
(3) To have an overpowering effect upon, wear out, exhaust: δεσμός ἑ ἐδάμνα Il. 5.391. Cf. Il. 14.439, Il. 21.52, 270. In mid. Od. 14.488.
(4) To overpower, master Il. 16.103.
(5) To defeat, rout, put to flight: Ἀχαιοὺς Τρωσὶν δαμναμένους (by the Trojans) Il. 13.16 = 353. Cf. Il. 5.746 = Il. 8.390: = Od. 1.100.
(6) To kill, slay: τρώεσσιν δάμνασθαι (by the Trojans) Il. 8.244 = Il. 15.376. Cf. Il. 11.309. To destroy, consume: σάρκας πυρὸς μένος δαμνᾷ Od. 11.221. To pierce, rend (a shield) Il. 21.401.
A torch: δ. μετὰ χερσὶν ἔχουσα Od. 23.294. Collectively, torches: δ. μετὰ χερσὶν ἔχουσαι Il. 24.647: = Od. 4.300 = Od. 6.339 = Od. 22.497.

etym: [δα- (app. referring to the work of levelling, stamping, etc.) + πέδον, the ground.]
defs: (1) A levelled and prepared surface: ἐν τυκτῷ δαπέδῳ Od. 4.627 = Od. 17.169.
(2) A floor of a house Il. 4.2: Od. 10.227, Od. 11.420, Od. 22.188, 309 = Od. 24.185, Od. 22.455. Of the under surface of the realm of Hades Od. 11.577.
(1) To devour. Of wild beasts Il. 11.481, Il. 16.159. Fig. of fire Il. 23.183.
(2) Of rending flesh Il. 5.831, Il. 13.831, Il. 21.398.

forms: To devour. Of wild beasts Il. 11.479.

defs: To sleep, go to sleep, take one's rest Od. 20.143.
Thickly shaded, with thick shades: ὕλη Il. 15.273: ὕλην Od. 5.470.
A division or apportionment: ἤν ποτε δασμὸς ἵκηται Il. 1.166.

etym: [prob. fr. δασ-  = δεσ-, house, as in δέσποινἀ + πλη-, πελάζω. Cf. τειχεσιπλήτης.]
defs: Thus, that approaches houses (with hostile intent), smiter of houses: Ἐρινύς Od. 15.234.

forms: With thick fleece: ἄρσενες ὄϊες Od. 9.425.

defs: Thick with hair, hairy Od. 14.51. App., spread so as to lie thickly: ῥῶπας Od. 14.49.

forms: 3 pl. ἐδάσαντο Od. 14.208. δάσσαντο Il. 1.368: Od. 19.423.
Pl. pple. δασσάμενοι Od. 3.66, 316, Od. 15.13, Od. 16.385, Od. 20.280.
Infin. δάσασθαι Il. 18.511, Il. 22.120, Il. 23.21: Od. 18.87, Od. 22.476. δάσσασθαι Od. 20.216.
3 sing. pf. pass. δέδασται Il. 1.125, Il. 15.189: Od. 15.412. (ἀπο-.)
defs: (1) To divide among themselves, make mutual apportionment of: χηρωσταὶ διὰ κτῆσιν δατέοντο Il. 5.158. Cf. Il. 1.368, Il. 9.138 = 280: τάδε δʼ αὐτοὶ δάσονται Od. 2.368. Cf. Od. 2.335, Od. 3.316 = Od. 15.13, Od. 9.42, 549, Od. 14.208, Od. 16.385, Od. 17.80, Od. 20.216. Fig.: μένος Ἄρηος δατέονται (app., share between them, are alike filled with) Il. 18.264.

(2) To divide, apportion: διὰ παῦρα δασάσκετο Il. 9.333. Cf. Il. 1.125, Il. 15.189, Il. 18.511, Il. 22.120: Od. 3.66 = Od. 20.280, Od. 7.10, Od. 15.412, Od. 19.423. To divide into portions: κρέα Od. 1.112.
(3) To divide among themselves as prey, to tear (and devour). Of dogs, etc. Il. 22.354, Il. 23.21: Od. 18.87, Od. 22.476.
(4) To cut in pieces Od. 3.394–To cut up (the ground) Il. 23.121.
The laurel Od. 9.183.
Red or tawny: δράκων Il. 2.308, δέρμα λέοντος Il. 10.23, θῶες Il. 11.474.

forms: 2 sing. fut. in mid. form δαήσεαι Od. 3.187, Od. 19.325.
Infin. δαήμεναι Il. 7.150, Od. 3.213, Il. 21.487: Od. 13.335, Od. 23.262. δαῆναι Od. 4.493.
2 sing. pf. δεδάηκας Od. 8.146, 3  δεδάηκε Od. 8.134.
3 sing. redup. aor. δέδαε Od. 7.233, Od. 8.448, Od. 20.72, Od. 23.160.
From this tense is formed infin. mid. δεδάασθαι (for δεδαέσθαἰ Od. 16.316.
defs: (1) To get to know, know, learn: ἀμφοτέρων φυήν Il. 3.208, πολέμοιο δαήμεναι (about war) Il. 21.487. Cf. Il. 7.150 = Od. 3.213: Od. 3.187, Od. 4.267, 493. With dependent clause: ἢ . . . ἦε . . . Il. 2.299. Cf. Il. 16.423, Il. 21.61: πῶς ἐμεῦ δαήσεαι εἰ . . . ; (about me) Od. 19.325. Absol.: ὄφρα δαείω Il. 10.425: Od. 9.280. Cf. Od. 13.335, Od. 23.262.
(2) To acquire practical knowledge of or skill in. In pf., to have such knowledge of or skill in: εἴ τινʼ ἄεθλον δεδάηκεν Od. 8.134. Cf. Od. 2.61, Od. 8.146, Od. 17.519.

(3) In redup. aor., to teach (something): ἔργα δʼ Ἀθηναίη δέδαεν Od. 20.72. With double acc. of person and thing: δ̀ν Ἥφαιστος δέδαεν τέχνην παντοίην Od. 7.233 = Od. 23.160. Cf. Od. 8.448. In mid., to have oneself taught; hence, to get to know, acquire knowledge of: γυναῖκας δεδάασθαι, αἵ τε . . . καὶ αἳ . . . Od. 16.316.
(1) Adversative particle, but, yet, on the other hand, while Il. 1.29, 83, 108, 137, 167, etc.: Od. 1.13, 19, 33, 75, 212, etc.

(2) Particle of continuation, often introducing a subordinate statement or a parenthesis: πολλὰς δὲ ψυχὰς Ἄϊδι προΐαψεν Il. 1.3, νοῦσον ὦρσεν, ὀλέκοντο δὲ λαοί 10, μύδωνα βάλεν–ὁ δʼ ὑπέστρεφε ἵππους–χερμαδίῳ Il. 5.581. Cf. Il. 1.19, 25, 33, 34, 35, etc.: Od. 1.3, 51, 53, 71, 93, etc.

(3) Giving a reason or explanation, for: πίθεσθʼ. ἄμφω δὲ νεωτέρω ἐστὸν ἐμεῖο Il. 1.259, ἐμέθεν ξύνες. Διὸς δέ τοι ἄγγελός εἰμι Il. 2.26, μή τι ῥέξῃ κακόν. θυμὸς δὲ μέγας ἐστὶ βασιλήων 196. Cf. Il. 1.271, Il. 3.410, Il. 4.438, 478, Il. 6.259, etc.: Od. 1.168, 433, Od. 2.36, 41, Od. 3.48, etc.

(4) Introducing a principal clause after a relative, temporal or conditional protasis: οἱ δʼ ἐπεὶ οὖν ἤγερθεν . . . τοῖσι δὲ μετέφη Il. 1.58, εἰ δέ κε μὴ δώωσιν, ἐγὼ δέ κεν αὐτ̀ς ἕλωμαι 137, ὅν τινα βασιλῆα κιχείη, τὸν ἀγανοῖς ἐπέεσσιν ἐρητύσασκεν Il. 2.189. Cf. Il. 2.322, Il. 4.262, Il. 5.261, 439, Il. 6.314, Il. 9.167, etc.: Od. 5.425, Od. 6.109, Od. 8.25, Od. 10.366, Od. 11.148, Od. 16.274, etc. Introducing without antecedent clause Il. 2.802, Il. 3.229, etc.: Od. 4.400, Od. 5.428, Il. 3.229, etc.: Od. 4.400, Od. 5.428, etc.

(5) Introducing a question: τίς δὲ σύ ἐσσι; Il. 7.123, τίς δʼ οἶδʼ εἰ . . . ; Il. 15.403. Cf. Il. 7.55, Il. 10.82, Il. 11.792, Il. 14.264, Il. 15.244, etc.: Od. 2.332, 363, Od. 4.312, 681, Od. 7.276, etc.
(6) Before an imp. or a subj. as imp.: σὺ δὲ παῦε τεὸν μένος Il. 1.282. Cf. Il. 2.344, etc.: τῶν δὲ βοῶν ἀπεχώμεθα Od. 12.321. Cf. Od. 3.247, Od. 5.346, Od. 16.130, Od. 22.312, etc.

forms: 1 and 3 sing. and 3 pl. plupf. pass. δαμάζω.
genit. sing. masc. pf. pple. δουπέω.

defs: Thus, conspicuous, easy to be distinguished: σῆμα Il. 10.466.
It is binding on (one), behoves (one). With acc. and infin.: τί δεῖ πολεμιζέμεναι Τρώεσσιν Ἀργείους; Il. 9.337.
Fearful, timid Il. 3.56.

etym: [app. redup. fr. δικ-, δείκνυμι. Cf. δεικανάομαι.]
defs: (1) To pledge in drinking = δείκνυμι 5: δέπαϊ Od. 18.121.
(2) To welcome, greet Od. 3.41, Od. 20.197.
(1) To frighten, alarm, scare Il. 4.184, Il. 12.52, Il. 13.810 (try to . . .), Od. 3.201 = 432. To scare (away from something): Ἕκτορʼ ἀπὸ νεκροῦ Il. 18.164.
(2) To use threats to, threaten Il. 2.190, Il. 15.196.

forms: Also 1 sing. δείδια (δέδϝια) Il. 13.49, 481, Il. 21.536: Od. 4.820, Od. 7.168, Od. 17.188.
3 sing. plupf. (with impf. sense) δείδιε (with secondary person-ending) Il. 18.34, Il. 24.358.
Infin. δειδίμεν Od. 9.274, Od. 10.381. Also δείδω (app. for δείδοα (δέδϝοἀ Il. 10.39, Il. 11.470, Il. 13.745, Il. 14.44, Il. 19.24, Od. 3.30, Il. 22.455: Od. 5.300, 419, 473, Od. 12.122.
3 sing. fut. in mid. form δείσεται Od. 3.130.
3 pl. ἔδεισαν Od. 10.219,  Od. 13.184. δεῖσαν Il. 6.93.
defs: (2) With dependent clause.

(b) In reference to the past with μή and indic.: μὴ πάντα νημερτέα εἷπεν Od. 5.300. In virtual reference to the past with μή and subj.: μή σε παρείπῃ (that she may prove to have...,
              i.e. that she has . . .) Il. 1.555. Cf. Il. 10.538.
(c) With infin., to be afraid to do something, shrink from doing it: ὑποδέχθαι Il. 6.93. Cf. Il. 15.299: Od. 7.168.

(3) To be afraid of, fear, be in fear of, dread, to anticipate with fear, shrink from: αἴσχεα Il. 3.242, μήτε σύ γʼ?̓́ αρηα τό γε δείδιθι Il. 5.827 (τό γε, for that matter), Ζηνὸς μῆνιν Il. 13.624. Cf. Il. 5.790, Il. 7.99, Il. 12.39, Il. 13.49, Il. 18.261, Il. 22.19, etc. : οὔτινα Od. 2.199, ἐμὴν ἐνιπήν Od. 10.448. Cf. Od. 9.72, 257, Od. 10.130, Od. 12.244, Od. 17.577, Od. 18.63, 80, 396. With complementary infin.: οὐ δείσαντες ϝέμεσιν ἔσεσθαι Od. 22.39. Cf. Il. 18.342 (τό γε as in Il. 5.827 above). In double construction with acc. and υή with subj.: ταῦτα δείδοικα, μή οἱ ἀπειλὰς ἐκτελέσωσι θεοί, ἡμῖν δ' αἴσιμον εἴη . . . Il. 9.244 (here also with opt. of remoter consequence). Cf. Od. 17.188.
(4) To stand in awe of, reverence, hold in awe or due respect: σημάντορας Il. 4.431. Cf. Il. 24.116, 435: Od. 9.274, Od. 14.389, Od. 16.306, Od. 22.39.

forms: Hence, app., to sup: ἔρχεο δειελιήσας Od. 17.599.

defs: (1) The setting sun, the evening: δ. ὀψὲ δύων Il. 21.232.
(2) As adj.: δείελον ἦμαρ (evening) Od. 17.606.
(1) To pledge in drinking = δείκνυμι 5 Il. 15.86.
(2) To welcome, greet Od. 18.111, Od. 24.410.

forms: Mid. Pres. pple. δεικνύμενος Il. 9.196, Il. 23.701: Od. 4.59.
3 pl. pf. (with pres. sense) δειδέχαται Od. 6.72.
3 sing. plupf. (with impf. sense) δείδεκτο Il. 9.224.
defs: (1) To manifest, exhibit, display: σῆμα βροτοῖσιν Il. 13.244. Cf. Od. 3.174.
(2) To show, bring forward or exhibit to be looked at: αἷμα καταρρέον Il. 5.870. Cf. Il. 7.170, Il. 6.184, Il. 19.332: Od. 14.323 = Od. 19.293, Od. 21.217, Od. 24.147. In mid. Il. 23.701.
