(3) To show, point out: Ἀλέξανδρον Il. 3.452. Cf. Il. 10.476: πόλιν Od. 7.144. Cf. Od. 7.178, 194, Od. 6.29, Od. 13.344. With dependent clause: ὅθι δένδρεα πεφύκει Od. 5.241.
(4) To point out in words, tell, explain Od. 10.303, Od. 12.25.
(5) In mid., to pledge in drinking (app. from a custom of pointing to the person whose health was to be drunk): δείδεκτʼ Ἀχιλῆα Il. 9.224. Cf. Il. 4.4, Il. 9.671.
(6) In mid., to welcome, greet: τὼ δεικνύενος Il. 9.196. Cf. Il. 22.435: Od. 4.59, Od. 6.72.
Of the sun, to decline towards evening: δείλετʼ ἠέλιος Od. 6.289.
(1) Cowardly, craven Il. 1.293, Il. 13.278.
(2) Sorry, worthless: δειλαὶ δειλῶν ὲγγύαι (given by worthless fellows) Od. 8.351.
Fear, terror Il. 5.682.
Fear personified Il. 4.440, Il. 11.37, Il. 15.119.

(1) Causing, or such as to cause, fear, fearful, terrible, aweinspiring, dread, dire Il. 1.200, Il. 2.321, Il. 5.739, Il. 8.135, Il. 11.418, etc.: Od. 3.145, Od. 5.52, Od. 11.157, Od. 12.94, Od. 22.405, etc. With complementary infin.: δεινὸν γένος βασιλήϊόν ἐστι κτείνειν Od. 16.401. Of noises, troubling the hearers, terrible, dreadful: καναχήν Il. 16.104. Cf. Il. 1.49, Il. 23.688. Of something said, calculated to trouble the hearer, out of place, unseemly: ἔπος Od. 8.409, Od. 21.169.

(2) In neut. δεινόν as adv., so as to cause fear, fearfully, terribly, dreadfully: δ. δερκόμενοι Il. 3.342. Cf. Il. 3.337, Il. 4.420, Il. 7.182, Il. 8.133, Il. 11.10, etc.: κῦμα δ. ἐπεσσύμενον Od. 5.314. Cf. Od. 5.403, Od. 11.608, Od. 12.85, 106, 236, Od. 22.124, etc. So in pl. δεινά Il. 5.439, Il. 15.13, Il. 16.706 = Od. 3.448.
(3) Troubling with excessive wonder, marvellous, strange: θαῦμα Il. 13.100. Exciting wonder, wonderful: πελώρου Od. 10.168.

(4) To be regarded or treated with awe, reverence or respect: ὅρκου Il. 2.755, θεός Il. 4.514. Cf. Il. 3.172, Il. 5.839, Il. 7.380 = 385, Il. 18.394, Il. 21.25: Od. 6.41, 246, 255, Od. 8.22, Od. 10.136 = Od. 11.8  =  Od. 12.150, Od. 12.322, 449, Od. 14.234. In superl. δεινότατος Il. 15.38: = Od. 5.186.
(5) Of armour, with notion of great power of resistance, proof against blows, stout: σάκος Il. 6.245, 266. Cf. Il. 10.254, 272, Od. 3.259.
(6) Feeling fear: ἀγορὴ δεινὴ τετρηχυῖα (in fear and disorder) Il. 6.346.

forms: 3 sing. plupf. δεδειπνήκετ Od. 17.359. to take δεῖπνον
defs: (2) Of the meal taken by Hermes on arriving at Calypso's island Od. 5.95. Of  that taken by the disguised Odysseus on arriving at Eumaeus's hut Od. 14.111.
The time for δεῖπνον: ὅτε δ. ἔην Od. 17.170 (here in sense 1.f).
To entertain at δεῖπνον: κατέπεφνε δειπνίσσας Od. 4.535 = Od. 11.411 (app. in sense 1.f, but the time is not determined).
(1) The principal meal of the day.
(b) Taken by travellers before setting out Od. 15.77 = 94.
(c) Taken in an interval of occupation Il. 11.86, Il. 18.560: Od. 7.97.
(d) Taken after work Il. 23.158.
(e) Taken on returning from a nocturnal expedition Il. 10.578.
(f) The regular principal meal, taken in the late morning or about mid-day Od. 1.124, 134, Od. 17.176, Od. 19.321, 419, Od. 20.390, Od. 24.215, 360, 386, 394, 412.–
(g) A meal taken on shore by a ship's company Od. 9.86 = Od. 10.57, Od. 10.155, Od. 15.500.–
(h) A meal taken in the evening (Od. 3.497) by travellers arriving at a house and finding a marriage-feast in progress Od. 4.61 (the same meal called δόρπον 213; and cf. μεταδόρπιος 194).–
(i) Of an ἔρανος on the day after a marriage-feast Od. 4.624.
(2) Simply, a meal Od. 10.116, Od. 15.316.
(3) The material for a meal: αἷγας Od. 17.214 = Od. 20.175.
(4) A feed for horses Il. 2.383.

forms: acc. pl. masc. aor. pple. δέρω.

defs: (1) The neck or throat Il. 3.371, 396, Il. 13.202, Il. 14.412, Il. 18.177, Il. 19.285: Od. 22.472, Od. 23.208, 240. Of the necks of Scylla Od. 12.90. Of an eagle's neck Il. 12.204: Od. 2.153.
(2) The neck-opening of a θώρηξ Il. 11.26.
To cut the throat of, to slay thus; or simply, to slay Il. 21.89, 555, Il. 23.174: Od. 22.349.

forms: With another numeral: ἑπτὰ καὶ δ. Od. 5.278, Od. 6.267, Od. 24.63.

defs: (1) Ten times Il. 9.379.
(2) Ten times the normal, tenfold: ἄποινα Il. 22.349.
A body or company of ten: εἴ κʼ ἐς δεκάδας διακοσμηθεῖμεν Il. 2.126. Cf. Il. 2.128: Od. 16.245.

(1) The tenth: Ἠώς Il. 7.175, ὲς δεκάτους ἐνιαυτούς (app. for ἐς δέκα ἐνιαυτούς by confusion with ἐς δέκατον ἐνιαυτόν) Od. 8.404 = 418. Cf. Il. 2.329, Il. 9.474, Il. 12.15, Il. 24.785: Od. 5.107, Od. 6.253 = Od. 14.314, Od. 12.447, Od. 14.241, 325 = Od. 19.294, Od. 16.18, Od. 19.192.
(2) δεκάτη (sc. ἡμέρη), the tenth day: δεκάτῃ (on the tenth day) Od. 9.83. So τῇ δεκάτῃ Il. 1.54, Il. 24.612, 665: Od. 10.29.
Ten thousand Il. 5.860 = Il. 14.148.
A beggar Od. 4.248.
A dolphin Il. 21.22: Od. 12.96.

(1) One's bodily frame or build: οὐ δέμας οὐδὲ φυήν (the two words difficult to distinguish) Il. 1.115, μικρὸς δέμας Il. 5.801 (here app. stature), δέμας ἐϊκυῖα θεῇσιν Il. 8.305. Cf. Il. 13.45, Il. 17.323, 555, Il. 21.285, Il. 22.227, Il. 24.376: δέμας ἀθανάτοισιν ὁμοῖος Od. 3.468. Cf. Od. 2.268 = 401 = Od. 22.206 = Od. 24.503 = 548, Od. 4.796, Od. 5.212, 213, Od. 6.210, Od. 8.14, 116, 194, Od. 11.469 = Od. 24.17, Od. 13.222, 288, Od. 14.177, Od. 16.157, 174, Od. 18.251, Od. 19.124, 381, Od. 20.31, 194, Od. 23.163. Of animals: συῶν δέμας Od. 10.240. Cf. Od. 17.307, 313.
(2) In advbl. acc. with genit., in the build of, after the similitude of, like (as our like has developed fr. orig. Teutonic *liko-, body, form): πυρός Il. 11.596 = Il. 13.673 = Il. 18.1, Il. 17.366.

A bedstead, a bed. (In Il. 24.644 two beds are referred to. See 648. So perh. also in Od. 4.297, 301; but from Od. 15.45 it would rather appear that Telemachus and Peisistratus were then sleeping together): δέμνιʼ ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ θέμεναι Il. 24.644: = Od. 4.297 = Od. 6.336, δέμνια κούρης Od. 7.20. Cf. Od. 4.301, Od. 8.277, 282, 296, 314, Od. 11.189, Od. 19.318, 599, Od. 20.139.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. (ἐ δείματο Od. 7.9, Od. 14.8.
3 sing. plupf. pass. (ἐ δέδμητο Il. 13.683: Od. 1.426, Od. 9.185, Od. 14.6.

to construct, build, form: πύργους Il. 6.337. Cf. Il. 7.245, 249, Il. 6.436, Il. 9.349, Il. 13.683, Il. 14.32, Il. 21.446; ὅθι οἱ θάλαμος δέδμητο (was in the state of having been built, i.e., simply, stood) Od. 1.426, θάλαμον Od. 23.192. Cf. Od. 9.185, Od. 14.6.
App., to turn the eyes, give meaning looks: ἐς ἕκαστον Il. 9.180.

defs: Abounding in trees: νῆσος Od. 1.51, ἄλσεϊ Od. 9.200.

(2) ἐπὶ δεξιά, to the right : νωμῆσαι βῶν Il. 6.238, εἴτʼ ὲπὶ δ. ἴωσιν (from left to right of a spectator, i.e. in the lucky direction) Il. 12.239.–ἐπὶ δεξιόφιν on the right of. With genit.: παντὸς στρατοῦ Il. 13.308.
(3) Of a bird of omen, passing as in Il. 12.239 above, boding well: δεξιὸν ἧκεν ἐρωδιόν Il. 10.274. Cf. Il. 13.821, Il. 24.294 = 312, 320: Od. 2.154, Od. 15.160 = 525, 531, Od. 15.164, Od. 24.312.
(4) In fem. δεξιή (sc. χείρ), the right hand: δεξιῇ ἠσπάζοντο Il. 10.542. A grasp or clasp of the right hand as the sign of a pledge Il. 2.341 = Il. 4.159.

etym: [in form comp. of δεξιός. with changed accent.]
forms: Fem. instrumental δεξιτερῆφι Od. 19.480. This form as locative Il. 24.284: Od. 15.148.
defs: (1) That is on the right side, the right . . . : κνήμην Il. 4.519. Cf. Il. 5.393, Il. 6.108, Il. 10.373, Il. 11.377, Il. 14.137, Il. 21.167, Il. 24.284, 672: Od. 1.121, Od. 15.148, Od. 18.258, 397, Od. 19.480, Od. 20.197,  Od. 21.410. The right-hand part of, the part of on the right: γναθμὸν δεξιτερόν Il. 16.405.
(2) In fem. δεξιτερή (sc. χείρ), the right hand: δεξιτερῇ ὲλοῦσα Il. 1.501. Cf. Il. 21.490, Il. 22.320.
(2) Reason or cause for fear or apprehension: οὔ τοι ἔπι δ. Il. 1.515. With complementary infin.: σοὶ οὐ δ. ἔστʼ ἀπολέσθαι Il. 12.246. Cf. Od. 5.347, Od. 8.563.

forms: Pl. δέπα (for δέπαα) Od. 15.466, Od. 19.62, Od. 20.153.
Dat. δεπάεσσι Il. 1.471, Il. 3.295, Il. 8.162, etc.: Od. 3.340, Od. 6.137, Od. 18.418, etc. δέπασσι Il. 15.86.

A drinking-cup: ἐπαρξάμενοι δεπάεσσιν (locative dat., into the . . .) Il. 1.471 = Il. 9.176, ἀμφικύπελλον Il. 1.584. Cf. Il. 3.295, Il. 4.3, 262, Il. 6.480, Il. 9.203, etc.: Od. 3.41, Od. 6.137, Od. 9.10, Od. 18.152, Od. 19.62, etc.
3 sing. pf. (in press. sense) δέδορκε Il. 22.95.
defs: (1) To see, behold, look upon: Τρῶας Il. 13.86. Cf. Il. 14.141.
(2) To have the power of sight as being alive: ἐμεῦ (ἐμέθεν̓ ἐπὶ χθονὶ δερκομένοιο Il. 1.88: Od. 16.439.
(3) To descry, make out: καπνόν Od. 10.197. Absol.: ὀξύτατον δέρκεσθαι Il. 17.675.
(4) To direct the sight, look: ἐπὶ πόντον Od. 5.84 = 158.
(5) To look, glance: δεινόν Il. 3.342, Il. 11.37, Il. 23.815. Cf. Il. 22.95, Il. 23.477. Fig., with cognate acc.: πῦρ ὀφθαλμοῖσι δεδορκώς Od. 19.446.
(1) A hide or skin stripped from a beast: συός Il. 9.548. Cf. Od. 4.436, 440, Od. 22.362.
(2) The prepared skin of a beast: λέοντος Il. 10.23, 177. Cf. Od. 13.436, Od. 14.50, 519.
(3) A piece of leather: βόειον Od. 14.24. Used as = ἄντυξ 2 Il. 7.117. A leathern bag: πυκινοῖσιν Od. 2.291.
(4) The human skin: ἔσχεθε δ' οἷον δέρμα (the strip of skin not severed) Il. 16.341. Cf. Od. 13.431.
The membrane enclosing the intestines: γῦπε δ. ἔσω δύνοντες Od. 11.579.

forms: 3 pl. aor. ἔδειραν Il. 1.459, Il. 2.422: Od. 12.359.
Acc. pl. masc. pple. δείραντας Od. 10.533, Od. 11.46. (ἐκ-,)

defs: (1) Any means of securing a person, a bond, bonds: δῆσαν κρατερῷ ἐνὶ δεσμῷ Il. 5.386. Cf. Il. 5.391, Il. 10.443, Il. 15.19: δεσμὸν ἀνέγναμψαν Od. 14.348. Cf. Od. 8.317, 353, 359, 360, Od. 12.160, Od. 15.232, 444, Od. 22.189, 200. In pl. (app., except where the idea of number is involved, used indifferently with the sing.): ὑπελύσαο δεσμῶν Il. 1.401: ἐνὶ πλεόνεσσι δεσμοῖσι διδέντων Od. 12.54. Cf. Od. 1.204, Od. 8.274, 278, 296, 336, 340, Od. 11.293, Od. 12.164, 196, 200.
(2) A halter for a horse Il. 7.507 = Il. 15.264.
(3) A ship's mooring-cable Od. 13.100.
(4) A knot (in a cord put round a chest to secure the lid) Od. 8.443, 447.
(5) A means of securing a gate: ἐπὶ δεσμὸν ἰῆλαι [θύραις] Od. 21.241 (app. not referring to a regular fastening. The gate is in fact secured with a ὅπλον ϝεός. See 390).
(6) A rivet Il. 18.379.
(7) In pl., articles of head-dress in gen.: δέσματα σιγαλόεντα Il. 22.468 (the particular articles being specified in the next line).

etym: [δεσ-, house + a second element conn. with πόσις1 Cf. δεσπότης, master, πότνια; also δασπλῆτις.]
defs: The lady of a house, a mistress Od. 6.53, Od. 14.9 = 451, Od. 14.127, Od. 15.374, 377, Od. 19.83, Od. 23.2. Joined with ἄλοχος Od. 3.403. With γυνή Od. 6.347.
A faggot Il. 11.554 = Il. 17.663.

forms: In form δεύρω Il. 3.240 (u.l. δεῦρο). Hither.
defs: (1) With vbs. of motion: ἤλυθον Il. 1.153. Cf. Il. 2.138, Il. 3.240, Il. 7.426, Il. 10.406, Il. 22.12, Il. 23.21, etc.: μολόντες Od. 3.44. Cf. Od. 8.424, Od. 15.213, Od. 16.132, Od. 17.53, Od. 24.299, etc. With imp. : δ. ἴθι Il. 3.130. Cf. Il. 3.390, Il. 6.75, Il. 13.235. In pregnant sense: δ. παρέστης Il. 3.405. Elliptically (withἄγε): ἄγε δ., ὄφρα. . . Il. 17.685. Cf. Od. 9.517, Od. 11.561.
(2) With other vbs.: κάλεσσον Il. 4.193, ὁρόωντες Il. 17.637. Cf. Il. 24.106: Od. 17.529.
(3) With imp. (with or without ἄγε), come ! ἄγε δ. παρʼ ἔμʼ ἵστασο Il. 11.314, Il. 17.179. Cf. Il. 23.581: δ. ὄρσο Od. 22.395. Cf. Od. 8.145, 205, Od. 12.184, Od. 22.233.
(4) With 1 pl. subj. (with or without ἄγε), come ! let us ...: δ. ἐς τοὺς φύλακας καταβήομεν Il. 10.97. Cf. Il. 17.120, Il. 22.254, Il. 23.485: Od. 8.292.
Last, the last: ἦλθεν Il. 19.51: Od. 1.286, τοῦτο δεύτατον εἶπεν ἔπος Od. 23.342.

forms: = δεῦρο. Used in dual and pl. contexts.
defs: (1) = δεῦρο 1 elliptically: δ. καί μʼ ἀμύνετε Il. 13.481. Cf. Od. 8.307.
(2) = δεῦρο 3: δ. δύω μοι ἕπεσθον Il. 22.450. With ἄγε Od. 8.11.
(3) = δεῦρο 4 (with or without ἄγετε): δ. ἴομεν Il. 14.128. Cf. Il. 6.350: Od. 2.410, Od. 8.133.

(1) Coming second in a contest: γνώσεσθʼ ἵππους οἶ δεύτεροι οἵ τε πάροιθεν Il. 23.498. With ellipse of sb.: τῷ δευτέρῳ ἵππον ἔθηκεν Il. 23.265. Cf. Il. 23.750. In neut. pl. δεύτερα, the prize for the secondIl. 23.538.
(2) Coming second in gaining estimation, taking a second place: ἵνα υὴ δ. ἔλθοι Il. 10.368. Cf. Il. 22.207.
(3) (except in Il. 17.45, Il. 21.596 strengthened by αὖτε)
(4) With genit.: ἐμεῖο δεύτεροι (left behind or surviving me) Il. 23.248.
(5) In neut. δεύτερον as adv.

(b) A second time, again: ὁρμηθείς Il. 16.402. With αὖτε Il. 3.191. With αὖτις Il. 1.513: Od. 3.161, Od. 19.65 (cf. Od. 18.321), Od. 22.69. Sim.: ᾔτεέ με δ. αὖτις (asked for a second supply) Od. 9.354.
(c) Another time, for the future. With αὖτε: δ. αὖτʼ ἀλέασθαι ἀμείνονας ἠπεροπεύειν Il. 23.605. Again, in the future: οὔ μʼ ἔτι δ. ὦδε ἵξετʼ ἄχος Il. 23.46. Cf. Od. 18.24.
(d) So as to come in as in 3.b: ὁρμηθείς Il. 16.467. Cf. Il. 3.349.

forms: Also in form δῆσε Il. 18.100. Except in these forms as deponent δεύομαι.
defs: (1) To lack, be without, want, not to have. With genit.: ἡγεμόνος Il. 2.709. Cf. Il. 2.128, Il. 4.48 = Il. 24.69, Il. 5.202, Il. 8.127, Il. 13.786, Il. 18.100: ἐσθῆτος Od. 7.192, Od. 14.510. Cf. Od. 6.73, Od. 8.137, Od. 23.128. Absol.: ἧσθαι δευόμενον (with empty hands) Il. 1.134, μηδέ τι θυμῷ δευέσθω (fail) Od. 3.122, δευόμενος (in his need) Il. 22.492. To be in the state of having (something) fail one, be deprived of, lose. With genit.: θυμοῦ Il. 3.294, Od. 3.472.
(2) To fall short of (a person). With genit.: Ἀργείων Il. 23.484. Cf. Od. 1.254, Od. 4.264. To be unequal to, unfitted for. With genit.: πολέμοιο Il. 13.310. Cf. Il. 17.142.
(3) To suffer want or be stinted in the matter of. With genit.: δαιτός Il. 1.468 = 602 = Il. 2.431 = Il. 6.320 = Il. 23.56: = Od. 16.479 = Od. 19.425.
(4) To fail to do something. With infin.: ἐδεύησεν οἰήϊον ἄκρον ἱκέσθαι Od. 9.483 = 540.

forms: 3 sing. aor. δέκτο Il. 2.420, Il. 15.88: Od. 9.353.
Plupf. ἐδέγμην Od. 9.513, Od. 12.230. (ἀνα-, ἀπο-, ἐκ-, παρα-, ποτι-, ὑπο-.)
defs: (1) To receive or take something offered, given, handed over, etc., to accept: ἄποινα Il. 1.20, παιδὸς κύπελλον (φρομ ηιμ'  596, σκῆπτρόν οἱ (from him) Il. 2.186, χαλκὸν δέδεξο (app., be minded to accept) Il. 22.340. Cf. Il. 1.446, Il. 5.227, Il. 7.483, Il. 9.633, Il. 17.391, etc.: κρήδεμνον Od. 5.462, δῶρα (for custody) Od. 8.419, χρυσὸν ἀνδρός (as the price of the betrayal of . . .) Od. 11.327, ἔγχος οἱ (relieved him of . . .) Od. 15.282 = Od. 16.40. Cf. Od. 1.121, Od. 8.483, Od. 9.353, Od. 17.356, Od. 19.355, etc. Of a god, to accept (a sacrifice) Il. 2.420.

(2) To receive (a child) for nurture Il. 14.203. To receive and undertake the charge of (a person) Il. 23.89. To receive, welcome Il. 5.158, Il. 18.238, 331. To receive hospitably, entertain Od. 14.128, Od. 17.110, Od. 19.316.
(3) To accept, resign oneself to: κῆρα Il. 18.115, Il. 22.365. To accept, put up with, make the best of: μῦθον Od. 20.271.
(4) In pf. and plupf.

(b) To wait. With dependent clause: ὁππότʼ ἀφορμηθεῖεν (watching for the time when...) Il. 2.794, εἰς ὅ κεν ἔλθῃς Il. 10.62. Cf. Il. 18.524: Od. 20.385. To await. With dependent clause: αἰακίδην όπότε λήξειεν Il. 9.191. Of things: ίππῆας ἄεθλα δεδεγμένα Il. 23.273. Absol.: δεδεγμένος (on the watch) Il. 4.107.
(c) To await the attack of, stand up to, be ready for: Ἀχιλλῆα Od. 3.377. Cf. Il. 5.228, 238, Il. 12.147, Il. 15.745. Absol. Il. 8.296, Il. 15.730.
(5) App., to succeed, come next: δέχεταί μοι κακὸν ἐκ κακοῦ Il. 19.290.
To work or knead with the hands in order to soften: κηρόν Od. 12.48.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative mid. δησάσκετο Il. 24.15.
3 sing. plupf. pass. δέδεντο Il. 5.387, Il. 23.866: Od. 15.232, Od. 24.229.
3 pl. δέδεντο Il. 10.475: Od. 9.443, Od. 10.92. (ἐκ-, ἐν-, ἐπι-, κατα-, συν-.)
defs: (1) To tie or secure in its place, fasten: δῆσε ζυγόν Il. 5.730. Cf. Il. 24.190, 267: Od. 2.425 = Od. 15.290. In mid. Od. 8.37.
(2) To tie into a bundle, bind together. In mid.: δράγματα δέοντο Il. 18.553.

(3) To tie or attach by a cord, a strap, etc.: ἐκ δίφροιο ἔδησεν [̔́εκτορα] Il. 22.398, ποδός (by the foot) Il. 23.854. Cf. Il. 23.866: Od. 9.443. In mid. Il. 24.15. To tie round (with a fastening). In mid., [πόδα] δησάμενος τελαμῶνι Il. 17.290.
(4) To moor (a ship) Od. 10.92.
(5) To tie or secure (a rope): πρυμνήσια Il. 1.436. Cf. Il. 24.273: Od. 10.96, Od. 15.498. In mid. Od. 8.26: Od. 2.430.
(6) To tie or secure (a person's feet, etc.): πόδας καὶ χεῖρας Od. 21.454. Cf. Od. 21.30: Od. 22.189.

(7) To bind or secure (a person), put (him) in bonds: δῆσαν κρατερῷ ἐνὶ δεσμῷ Il. 5.386. Cf. Il. 1.406, Il. 2.231, Il. 5.387, Il. 10.443: Od. 8.352, Od. 9.99, Od. 12.50, 161, 178, 196, Od. 15.232. Fig.: ἡμέτερον μένος Il. 14.73: κελεύθου με (hinders from . . . ) Od. 4.380 = 469. Cf. Od. 14.61. To halter or secure (a horse or an ox) Od. 8.544, Il. 10.475, Il. 13.572.
(8) To bind up (a wound) Od. 19.457.

(9) In mid., to tie on to one's person: ἐδήσατο πέδιλα Il. 24.340, Il. 2.44 = Il. 10.22 = 132 = Il. 14.186: = Od. 2.4 = Od. 4.309 = Od. 20.126, Od. 1.96, Od. 5.44, Od. 15.550, Od. 16.155, Od. 17.2. Sim. in pass.: περὶ κνήμῃσι κνημῖδας δέδετο (had them bound about his legs) Od. 24.229.
(1) Temporal particle.

(2) As affirmative or emphasizing particle: μὴ δὴ οὕτως κλέπτε νόῳ Il. 1.131. Cf. Il. 1.286, 295, Il. 2.158, 301, Il. 7.476, Il. 8.491, Il. 11.314, Il. 13.260, Il. 18.364, etc.: εἰ δὴ ἐξ αὐτοῖο τόσος πάϊς εἰς Ὀδυσῆος Od. 1.207. Cf. Od. 1.253, 384, Od. 3.352, 357, Od. 4.819, Od. 5.23, Od. 11.348, Od. 14.282, etc. Giving a touch of scorn, forsooth, to be sure: ὡς δὴ τοῦδʼ ἕνεκά σφιν ἑκηβόλος ἄλγεα τεύχει Il. 1.110. Cf. Il. 3.403, Il. 8.177, Il. 14.88, etc.: Od. 21.170. Emphasizing superlatives: κάρτιστοι δὴ κεῖνοι τράφεν Il. 1.266. Cf. Il. 7.98, Il. 6.155, Il. 10.436, Il. 22.76, etc.: οἴκτιστον δὴ κεῖνο ἴδον Od. 12.258. Cf. Od. 8.519, Od. 11.309, etc.

etym: [Subjunctives with strong stem answering to δᾶ- in ἐδάην, etc. See δάω. The -εις of 2 sing. app. a trace of an older inflexion, -ω, -εις, -ει, answering to -ομεν, -ετε.]
defs: To find, to light or come upon: δούρατα δήεις (will find) Il. 13.260. Cf. Od. 7.291, Od. 6.49, Od. 13.407. Of immaterial things: ἐν πήματα οἴκῳ Od. 11.115. To find, get: ἄλλοθι ἕδρην Od. 16.44. To find out by experience: τέκμωρ?̓ιλίου Il. 9.418 = 685. To attain to, bring about: ἄνυσιν Od. 4.544.

For a long time, for long, long: μηκέτι δ. λεγώμεθα Il. 2.435, ποταμῷ δ ἱερεύετε ταύρους . . . καθίετε ἵππους (the vbs. to be taken as presents, have long been sacrificing . . . ) Il. 21.131. Cf. Il. 5.104, 587, Il. 10.52, Il. 14.110, Il. 15.512: δ. πήματα πάσχει (has been suffering) Od. 1.49, δ θύρῃσιν ἐφεστάμεν 120. Cf. Od. 2.255, 404, Od. 3.313, 336, Od. 4.373, 466, Od. 6.152, Od. 8.411, Od. 12.351, Od. 16.313, Od. 22.177.
To tarry, delay, loiter Il. 1.27, Il. 7.503, 519: Od. 12.121, Od. 17.278.

etym: [conn. with δαίω1. Perh. orig. δά͂ϝιος. Cf. θεσπιδαής.]
defs: Epithet of fire, blazing, consuming Il. 2.415, Il. 7.331, Il. 8.181, Il. 9.347, 674, Il. 11.667, Il. 16.127, 301, Il. 18.13.

forms: (The first syllable scanned ͂ when followed by ͂-.)
defs: (1) Hostile, enemy: ἄνδρα Il. 7.481. Cf. Il. 9.317 = Il. 17.148, Il. 10.358, Il. 12.57, Il. 15.533, Il. 22.84, Il. 24.684. Epithet of πόλεμος, destructive, deadlyIl. 4.281, Il. 5.117, Il. 6.119 = 174, Il. 17.189, Il. 19.73, Il. 21.422. Of Ares Il. 6.241.
(2) In concrete sense, the fighters, the fighting throng: θέων ἀνὰ δηϊοτῆτα Il. 15.584, Il. 17.257.

forms: Contr. forms. Pres. pple. δῃῶν Il. 17.65.
Aor. pple. pass. δῃωθείς, -έντος Il. 4.417: Od. 9.66.
defs: (1) To treat as a foe, to wound, kill, slay Il. 8.534, Il. 11.71 = Il. 16.771, Il. 11.153, Il. 12.227, Il. 15.708, Il. 16.650, Il. 17.566, Il. 18.83, 195, Il. 22.218, Il. 23.176: Od. 4.226, Od. 9.66. To inflict slaughter upon (a hostile force): Τρῶας Il. 4.416. Cf. Il. 4.417, Il. 9.243, Il. 13.675.
(2) To rend or tear: βοείας Il. 5.452 = Il. 12.425. Cf. Il. 14.518. Of beasts tearing their prey Il. 16.158, Il. 17.65.

(1) To do harm or mischief to, hurt, injure: μή πως ἀμφοτέρους δηλήσεαι Il. 23.428. Absol. Od. 8.444, Od. 13.124. Of warlike action Il. 4.67 = 72: Od. 10.459, Od. 11.401, 408, Od. 22.368, Od. 24.111. Absol. Il. 4.236, 271. –Of a weapon: ῥινὸν δηλήσατο χαλκός Od. 22.278. Also, absol., to do harm, lead to mischief: σή κε βουλἡ δηλήσεται Il. 14.102.
(2) To ravage, destroy: καρπόν Il. 1.156.
(3) To violate (a treaty) Il. 3.107.
Something that brings harm, a bane: δηλήματα νηῶν Od. 12.286.
Working mischief, baneful Il. 24.33. As sb., a bane Od. 18.85 = 116 = Od. 21.308.
One who works for the common weal, not for himself or for a private employer Od. 17.383, Od. 19.135.
(1) Belonging to the community, public: οἳ͂κος Od. 20.264.
(2) Relating to the public interests, public: πρῆξις Od. 3.82. Absol.: ἦέ τι δήμιον πιφαύσκεται; Od. 2.32. Cf. Od. 2.44, Od. 4.314.
(3) Discharging public functions: αἰσυμνῆται Od. 8.259.
(4) In neut. pl. δήμια as adv., at the public cost (cf. δημόθεν): πίνουσιν Il. 17.250.
That devours the common stock: βασιλεύς Il. 1.231.

forms: From the common stock: δ. ἄλφιτα δῶκα Od. 19.197.

defs: (1) The common stock or store: ἐς δῆμον ἔδωκεν Il. 11.704.

(3) A community or people: παντὶ δήμῳ Il. 3.50, Il. 24.706, θεὸς ὣς τίετο δήμῳ (in the . . . , among the . . . ) Il. 5.78, Il. 10.33, Il. 11.58, Il. 13.218, Il. 16.605. Cf. Il. 9.460, Il. 11.328, Il. 12.447, Il. 17.577, Il. 18.295, 500, Od. 3.166: κατὰ δῆμον Od. 2.101, δήμου ἡγήτορες Od. 13.186. Cf. Od. 2.239, 291, Od. 4.691, Od. 6.11, 150, Od. 14.205, 239, Od. 16.114, 425, etc.
(4) A body or force of men: ἑτεραλκέα δῆμον Il. 15.738. Cf. Il. 17.330. App., a multitude: ἐπὶ δ' ἔστενε δ. ἀπείρων Il. 24.776.
(5) The common people: δήμου ἄνδρα Il. 2.198. App., one of the common people: δῆμον ἐόντα Il. 12.213.

For a long time, for long, long: ἀκέων δ. ἧστο Il. 1.512. Cf. Il. 1.416, Il. 5.412, Il. 7.131, 139, Il. 8.126, Il. 9.30 = 695, Il. 13.573, Il. 16.736, Il. 17.695, Od. 3.426, Il. 23.690: δ. ἀπεών (having been long . . .) Od. 13.189, ὀϊζὺν δ. ἔχομεν (have long been suffering . . .) Od. 14.416. Cf. Od. 1.281, Od. 2.36, Od. 4.494, Od. 5.127, Od. 7.33, Od. 20.155, Od. 22.473, etc.
(1) Arts, wiles: ὀλοφώϊα Od. 10.289.
(2) What one has in one's mind, thougts, counsels: ἤπια δήνεα οἶδεν Il. 4.361 (see ἤπιος 1): θεῶν Od. 23.82.

forms: To strive, contend, struggle, in passages cited.

defs: Strife, contention Il. 17.158: Od. 24.515.
(1) Of time, long Il. 14.206 = 305. Absol.: ἐπὶ δηρόν Il. 9.415.

(2) In neut. sing. δηρόν as adv., for a long time, for long, long: μένειν Il. 2.298. Cf. Il. 5.120, Il. 10.371, Il. 13.151, Il. 16.852, Il. 19.64, etc.: ἐσκοπίαζον Od. 10.260. Cf. Od. 1.203, Od. 2.285, Od. 5.396, Od. 16.171, Od. 21.112, etc.
(I) Adv.
(II) Prep. (sometimes, without anastrophe, following the case).

forms: Absol., to cross over: ἐς?̓́ηλιδα Od. 4.635.–εὖ διαβάς, with the legs set well apartIl. 12.458.
To distinguish, discern: ἄνδρα ἕκαστον Il. 6.424. Cf. Il. 23.240.

etym: [δια- 10 + γλάφω = γλύφω, to cut out, carve. Cf. γλυφίς, γλαφυρός.]
defs: To hollow out, form: εὐνὰς ἐν ψαμάθοισιν Od. 4.438.
To convey across a strait: πορθμῆες Od. 20.187.
To catch sight of, see Il. 14.344.

forms: To do sore hurt to Od. 14.37.
3 sing. fut. in mid. form διαείσεται Il. 8.535.
defs: (1) To distinguish, discern. In pass.: ἀρετὴ διαείδεται ἀνδρῶν Il. 13.277.
(2) To learn the value of, know. With acc. and dependent clause: ἣν ἀρετήν, εἰ . . . (whether . . .) Il. 8.535.
(1) To go through in talk: μῦθοι ἔσονται διαειπέμεν ἀλλήλοισιν Od. 4.215.
(2) To tell fully, declare. Absol. Il. 10.425.
To blow through. With acc.: θάμνους Od. 5.478, λόχμην Od. 19.440.
To fumigate thoroughly with sulphur: μέγαρον Od. 22.494.

forms: Nom. sing. neut. aor. pple. pass. διατρυφέν.
defs: To break in pieces, shiver: ξίφος διατρυφὲν ἔκπεσε χειρός Il. 3.363.

forms: To wet, moisten Il. 13.30, Il. 21.202, Il. 22.495.

defs: To thwart, frustrate: ἐμὸν ἔπος Il. 8.8.
To break in two: τόξα Il. 5.216.
(1) To separate out and form into suitable bodies, marshal Il. 2.476. To divide up and form (into bodies): ἐς δεκάδας Il. 2.126.
(2) To put in due order. In mid.: ἐπεὶ μέγαρον διεκοσμήσαντο Od. 22.457.
Clearly, without doubt: δ. εἶναι ἄριστοι (ἄριστος) Il. 12.103, Il. 15.108.

forms: Pass. Fut. infin. διακρινέεσθαι Od. 18.149, Od. 20.180.
Nom. pl. fem. pf. pple. διακεκριμέναι Od. 9.220.
defs: (1) To separate out and form into suitable bodies, marshal Il. 2.815. To separate out, sort out: αἰπόλια αἰγῶν Il. 2.475. Cf. Od. 9.220.
(2) To separate, part: ἡμέας Od. 4.179. Of combatants Il. 3.98, 102, Il. 6.292 = 378 = 397, Il. 6.306, Il. 17.531, Od. 3.141, 212: Od. 18.149, Od. 20.180, Od. 24.532. Sim.: μένος ἀνδρῶν Il. 2.387.
(3) To distinguish, make out: τὸ σῆμα Od. 8.195.

etym: [perh. fr. διακ-, lengthened fr. δι-α-, δι-, to run, as in δίεμαι.]

defs: To go through, debate: ταῦτα Il. 11.407 = Il. 17.97 = Il. 21.562 = Il. 22.122 = 385.

forms: To cut through: διάμησε χιτῶνα Il. 3.359 = Il. 6.253.

defs: Measured off Il. 3.344.
To divide, apportion: ἕπταχα πάντα Od. 14.434.

(1) Right through: βέλος ἐξέρυσε Il. 5.112 (i.e. in the direction of the arrow so as not to pull against the barbs), αἰχμὴ ἦλθεν 658. Cf. Il. 5.284, Il. 13.547. With genit.: ἀσπίδος Il. 12.429. Cf. Od. 3.362. Right through so as to make itself felt: οὐκ ὄμβρος περάασκεν Od. 5.480, Od. 19.442.

(2) Continuously, without break or interval: πέτρη τετύχηκεν Od. 10.88. Cf. Il. 16.640: Od. 5.256–Continuously, all the way: θρόνοι ἐρηρέδατο Od. 6.96–Right round: σταυροὺς ἔλασσεν Od. 14.11. Cf. Il. 18.563. Right on: ἡγεμόνευε Od. 17.194. Cf. Il. 10.325. All together, in a mass Il. 12.398. Right through a company, in turn Il. 6.171. So as to meet, thoroughly: πόδας χεῖράς τε ἀποστρέψαντε Od. 22.190.

(3) Of time, continuously, without intermission, break or interval Il. 10.89, 331, Il. 15.70, Il. 16.499, Il. 19.272, Il. 22.264: Od. 4.209, Od. 8.245, Od. 11.558, Od. 13.59, Od. 15.196, Od. 20.47, Od. 23.151. In intensive sense: ἔγχος κέ σε κατέπαυσε δ. (for good) Il. 16.618.
(1) By halves Il. 9.37.
(2) With divided mind: μερμήριξεν (was in two minds) Il. 1.189, Il. 13.455, (had half a mind) Il. 8.167.
To make an end. With pple.: κακότητʼ ἀγορεύων Od. 17.517.
(1) To traverse a space by flight Il. 15.83, 172.
(2) To fly away through some opening Od. 1.320.
(1) To traverse a space, pass, advance, make one's way: πεδίοιο (local genit., along the . . .) Il. 2.785 = Il. 3.14, Il. 23.364. To accomplish (a journey) Il. 1.483: = Od. 2.429, Od. 2.213.
(2) To pass or spend (time) Il. 9.326.
(3) To make an end. With pple.: λέγων ἐμὰ κήδεα Od. 14.197.

(1) Right through: ἤλυθʼ ἀκωκή Il. 5.66. Cf. Il. 5.538, Il. 6.260, Il. 12.184, Il. 13.388, Od. 3.276, Il. 21.164, etc.: Od. 22.295, Od. 24.524. With genit.: μίτρης Il. 4.138. Cf. Il. 5.281, Il. 14.494.
(2) Through the whole extent: τάνυται Il. 17.393.
(2) Without a break: πεδίοιο τετυχηκώς (on the . . .) Il. 17.748.

forms: To dash in pieces, destroy, make an end of, bring to nought Il. 2.473, Il. 9.78, Il. 11.713, 733, Il. 17.727, Il. 24.355: Od. 1.251 = Od. 16.128, Od. 2.49, Od. 12.290.

defs: To shoot (an arrow) through something Od. 19.575.
To speed or pass quickly through or across. With genit.: τάφροιο Il. 10.194: μεγάροιο Il. 22.460: Od. 4.37. Of a piercing weapon Il. 15.542. With acc.: λαόν Il. 2.450. Absol., of a weapon Il. 5.661.

forms: To break up into its component parts and disperse these: σχεδίην Od. 6.275.
To scatter to the winds, make an end of: ἀγλαΐας Od. 17.244.

defs: (1) To spy out Il. 10.388.
(2) To distinguish, discern Il. 17.252.
(1) To sever, rend: νεῦρα διεσχίσθη Il. 16.316.
(2) To tear in pieces: ἱστία Od. 9.71.

forms: Aor. pple. διατμήξας Il. 21.3: Od. 3.291, Od. 5.409, Od. 12.174.
3 pl. aor. pass. διέτμαγεν Il. 1.531, Il. 6.302, Il. 12.461, Il. 16.354: Od. 13.439.
defs: (1) To divide into two, sever Il. 21.3 (i.e. severing the fugitives into two bodies). So of ships sailing together and severed into two bodies by a storm Od. 3.291.
(2) To cleave (the sea),  traverse (it) Od. 5.409, Od. 6.276.
(3) In pass., of two persons, to leave one another, part: ἐν φιλότητι διέτμαγεν Il. 6.302. Cf. Il. 1.531: = Od. 13.439.
(4) To cut in pieces Od. 12.173. In pass., of the boards of a gate coming apart Il. 12.461. Of a scattered flock Il. 16.354.

forms: With acc.: κέλευθα Od. 3.177. Cf. Od. 5.100.

defs: To flee in all directions: θῶες Il. 11.481, ἄλλυδις ἄλλος 486.
(1) To rub down into small fragments, crumble Il. 11.847.
(2) To throw obstacles in the way of, put off, delay Od. 2.265, Od. 20.341. To thwart, oppose: τὸν ἐμὸν χόλον Il. 4.42.
(3) To put off (a person). With double acc. of the person and of what is delayed: Ἀχαιοὺς δ̀ν γάμον Od. 2.204.
(4) To put off time, loiter, delay Il. 19.150. With genit., to hold back from, delay in undertaking: ὁδοῖο Od. 2.404.
Bearing fruit through the seasons, never failing Od. 24.342.

forms: nom. sing. neut. aor. pple. pass. διαθρύπτω.

defs: (1) To appear or be seen through. With genit.: ὅθι νεκύων διεφαίνετο χῶρος Il. 8.491 = Il. 10.199.
(2) To glow Od. 9.379.
(1) To destroy utterly: πόλιν Il. 13.625.
(2) In pf., to have lost one's wits, be beside oneself Il. 15.128.
To go through, say, tell Od. 3.340: Od. 17.590. Absol. Il. 18.9: Od. 7.47.
(1) To draw off (wine) in large quantities or constantly Od. 16.110.
(2) To lay open or rend (flesh) (as if to draw off the life) Od. 19.450.
To dismember or divide into joints (a sacrificial victim) Il. 6.316: = Od. 19.421, Od. 3.456, Od. 14.427.
(1) To teach, instruct (a person) Il. 11.832, Il. 23.308: Od. 8.488.
(2) To teach, impart knowledge of (something) Il. 9.442, Il. 23.307: Od. 22.422 (ἐργάζεσθαι complementary).
(3) With double acc. of person and thing: σφέας οἴμας Od. 8.481. With infin. of what is taught: βάλλειν ἄγρια πάντα Il. 5.51. With acc. of person and this infin.: ὑψαγόρην σʼ ἔμεναι Od. 1.384.
(4) In pass., to gain knowledge of, learn: φάρμακα δεδιδάχθαι (i.e. their properties) Il. 11.831. With genit.: διδασκόμενος πολέμοιο (concerning war, i.e. the art of war) Il. 16.811.

forms: Only in dual and pl. Twin: διδυμάονε παῖδε Il. 5.548, Il. 7.26.– (The) twins: (́γπνῳ καὶ θανάτῳ διδυμάοσιν Il. 16.672 = 682.

defs: (1) Two, two (to one) Il. 23.641.
(2) Double; αὐλοῖσιν Od. 19.227.

forms: 1 sing. pres. δίδωμι Il. 23.620: Od. 15.125, Od. 20.342.
Pple. διδούς, -όντος Il. 9.699: Od. 1.390, Od. 11.117, Od. 13.378.
Pa. iterative δόσκον Il. 9.331: Od. 17.420, Od. 19.76.
1 pl. aor. ἔδομεν Od. 24.65. δόμεν Il. 17.443.
Nom. pl. masc. δόντες Il. 1.299: Od. 5.38, Od. 23.341.
3 sing. aor. opt. pass. δοθείη Od. 2.78.
defs: (1) To make another the owner of, give, present: τόξον ἔδωκεν Il. 2.827, δῶρα δίδωσι (offers) Il. 9.261. Cf. Il. 2.102, Il. 5.272, Il. 7.219, Il. 6.299, etc.: τάλαρον ἔδωκεν Od. 4.125, ἕδνα διδόντες (offering) Od. 11.117. Cf. Od. 1.313, 316, Od. 2.336, etc. In reference to something immaterial: τιμῆς ἥμισυ Il. 7.193. To assign (a share of spoil) Il. 1.162, Il. 2.228, Il. 9.334, etc. To make over one's rights in: ἑπτὰ πτολίεθρα Il. 9.149, 291.
(2) To give as a reward or prize: δύω χρυσοῖο τάλαντα Il. 18.508. Cf. Il. 10.305, Il. 23.537, 551, 560, 616, 620, 807, etc.
(3) To offer (a sacrifice): θεοῖς ἑκατόμβας Il. 6.450 = Il. 12.6. Cf. Od. 1.67, Od. 16.184, Od. 19.367. Sim. δῶρα  θεοῖσιν Od. 3.299. Cf. Il. 24.425: Od. 13.358.

(4) To give (food or drink), put (food or drink) before a person: δέπας οἴνου Il. 18.546: ξεινήϊα Od. 3.490. Cf. Od. 7.209, Od. 6.166, Od. 9.93, etc. To see to the due providing of (a meal): δεῖπνον ἑταίροισιν Od. 10.155. Of feeding horses Il. 2.383. Of an eagle feeding its young Il. 12.222.

(5) To pay (a price) Od. 1.431, Od. 15.388 = 429, 449. To pay (ransom) Il. 21.41, 42, Il. 22.341, Il. 23.746, Il. 24.594, 685, 686. To make over (as compensation): ἵππους υἶος ποινήν Il. 5.266. To pay as bride-price Il. 11.243, 244. To give (μείλιἀ Il. 9.147, 289.

(7) To give or confer (something immaterial): μέγʼ εὖχος Il. 5.285: γέρας Od. 6.150. Cf. Il. 5.654 = Il. 11.445, Il. 16.625, Il. 21.473. Sim.: δαίμονά τοι δώσω (will deal thee . . .) Il. 8.166: γαστὴρ πολλὰ κακὰ δίδωσιν Od. 17.287, 474. To give or utter (an oath) Od. 19.302.
(8) To resign one's claims to: ἵππον Il. 23.553, 592, 610.

(9) To give the use of, lend: φάσγανον Il. 10.255. Cf. Il. 5.359, 363, Il. 10.260, Il. 11.798, etc.: νῆα Od. 2.212 = Od. 4.669. Cf. Od. 3.369, Od. 4.647, 649, Od. 5.234, 237, Od. 7.144, 178, etc. To give the services of: ἐπικούρους Il. 4.379, 380: Od. 2.212  =  Od. 4.669. To give as a servant or slave Od. 17.223, 442.

(10) To give, commit, hand over, for some purpose: σάκος χείρονι φωτί Il. 14.377. Cf. Il. 1.324, Il. 2.205, Il. 9.331, Il. 15.455, Il. 17.127, Il. 21.84, etc.: ἄλεισον Od. 3.50. Cf. Od. 3.40, 437, Od. 5.351, Od. 10.33, Od. 14.112, Od. 21.233, etc. Sim.: ὀδύνῃσί μιν (μʼ̓ ἔδωκεν Il. 5.397: Od. 17.567, ἀχέεσσί με δώσεις Od. 19.167. With infin. expressing the purpose: δός σφωϊν [κούρην] ἄγειν Il. 1.338. Cf. Il. 5.26, Il. 7.53, Il. 6.471, Il. 11.704, Il. 16.40, etc.: δὸς τούτῳ δέπας σπεῖσαι Od. 3.46. Cf. Od. 18.87, Od. 20.78. To give (the hand) Il. 23.75. To commit (to the flames) Od. 24.65.
(11) Of a divine power
(b) To send or afflict with (something evil): ἄλγεα Il. 1.96. Cf. Il. 2.375, Il. 9.571, Il. 19.264, 270, Il. 24.241, etc.: ἄτην Od. 4.262. Cf. Od. 2.135, Od. 4.237, Od. 6.242, Od. 14.39, etc.

(c) With infin., to empower or permit to do something, grant a person's doing it or its being done: ἐκπέρσαι πόλιν Il. 1.18, τὸν δῦναι δόμον Ἄϊδος Il. 3.322. Cf. Il. 1.129, Il. 5.118, Il. 7.307, Il. 6.203, Il. 17.646, etc.: παλίντιτα ἔργα γενέσθαι Od. 1.379, ἄλοχον ἰδέειν Od. 8.411. Cf. Od. 3.60, Od. 7.327, Od. 6.110, Od. 12.216, Od. 22.253, etc. To appoint as one's lot: τολυπεύειν πολέμους Il. 14.86.
(d) Absol.: διάνδιχα δῶκε κρόνου πάϊς Il. 9.37. Cf. Il. 22.285, Il. 24.529: Διός γε διδόντος Od. 1.390. Cf. Od. 1.348, Od. 6.35, Od. 19.396.
(12) Absol., to accede to one's wishes: σοὶ δῶκα ἑκὼν ἀέκοντί γε θυμῷ Il. 4.43.
(14) Uses with adverbs.
(b) With πάλιν, to restore(cf. (13)) Il. 1.116, Il. 6.79 = Il. 22.342, Il. 22.259.

forms: To ask about at length; or simply, to ask about Il. 1.550.
With double acc. (cf. εἴρομαι 4): ταῦτά με Il. 15.93: Od. 4.492, Od. 11.463, Od. 24.478.

defs: Right through; or simply, through. With genit.: προθύρου Il. 15.124. Cf. Od. 10.388, Od. 17.61, 460, Od. 18.101, 185 = Od. 19.503 = Od. 22.433, Od. 18.386, Od. 19.47 = Od. 20.144, Od. 21.299.
(1) To drive (horses, etc.) across something Il. 12.120 (across the ditch). To drive them across. With genit.: τάφροιο Il. 10.564.
(2) To drive or thrust (a weapon) through. With genit.: λαπάρης ἔγχος Il. 16.318. To drive or thrust a weapon through. With genit.: ἀσπίδος Il. 13.161.
(1) To chase, pursue Il. 22.189: Od. 17.317
(2) To chase away, drive off or away: λῖν Il. 17.110. Cf. Il. 12.276, Il. 18.162, Il. 22.456: Od. 21.370. Sim.: ἀπὸ ναῦφι μάχην Il. 16.246. To cause to retire, put to flight Il. 6.197.
(3) To send or chase away, dismiss: ξεῖνον ἀπὸ μεγάροιο Od. 17.398. Cf. Od. 20.343.
(4) To drive (horses) Il. 15.681.
(5) As pass.
(b) Of horses, to be driven, race Il. 23.475.
To pass through and emerge from something: πύλας, τῇ ἔμελλε διεξίμεναι πεδίονδε Il. 7.393.

forms: With double acc.: ἐμὲ ταῦτα Il. 10.432.

defs: (1) To bring into order or under control: στρατόν Il. 2.207. Cf. Il. 24.247.
(2) To carry on, manage Il. 1.166. To attend to, carry through: τὰ ἕκαστα Od. 12.16. To attend to, arrange, settle Il. 11.706.
To row or propel oneself in the water through a space Od. 12.444 (through the strait), Od. 14.351 (through the water between the ship and the shore).
(1) App., living: βροτός Od. 7.201.
(2) App., nimble: ποδί Od. 9.43.
(1) Of a weapon, to  pierce its way Od. 3.263, Il. 23.876: Od. 19.453. To pierce or pass through. With genit.: χροός Od. 3.100.

(2) To pass through or traverse a space: ὅπως ἵπποι ῥεῖα διέλθοιεν Il. 10.492. Cf. Il. 24.716. To pass through or traverse. With genit.: μεγάροιο Od. 7.304. With acc.: ἄστυ Il. 7.392. Cf. Il. 3.198, Il. 13.144.
To pass through, hold its way: [ὀϊστός] Il. 5.100. Cf. Il. 11.253, Od. 3.416.

(1) To seek for, try to find (a person or a strayed animal): πάνδαρον Il. 4.88. Cf. Il. 5.168, Il. 10.84, Il. 13.760: ἵππους Od. 21.22. Cf. Od. 15.90. To seek out, try to get the help of: ἄλλους Od. 16.239.
(2) To seek after, try to acquire or have: φάρμακον Od. 1.261. Cf. Il. 17.221. To strive after, seek to achieve: νόστον Od. 11.100, Od. 23.253.
(3) To seek in marriage, woo Od. 16.391 = Od. 21.161.
Yoked, or meant to be yoked, in pairs: ἵπποι Il. 5.195, Il. 10.473.
To be in doubt, hesitate: ἠὲ . . . ἦ . . . Il. 16.713.
Two hundred Il. 9.383. Absol. Il. 8.233.

forms: Right through, at length: ἀγορεῦσαι Od. 6.241.
Fully, plainly, in detail Od. 4.836, Od. 12.56.

defs: Carried straight through, straight: ὦλκα Od. 18.375. Without break or obstruction: ἀτραπιτοί Od. 13.195. Continuous: νώτοισιν (slices cut the whole length of the back) Il. 6.321: Od. 14.437–Thrown out far, far-stretching: ῥίζῃσιν Il. 12.134. Carried right round: ῥάψε ῥάβδοισι διηνεκέσιν περὶ κύκλον Il. 12.297.

forms: To go through in speaking: πάντα Il. 9.61, Il. 19.186.

defs: Thus, falling in the sky, i.e. rain-fed; or poss., falling by the power or ordinance of Zeus. Epithet of rivers Il. 16.174, Il. 17.263, Il. 21.268, 326: Od. 4.477, 581, Od. 6.284.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. pple. διαστάντες Il. 12.86, Il. 17.391.
defs: (1) In aor. and mid.
(2) In pf., to have one's stand, stand, apart: τίη διέσταμεν; (why do we not come to close quarters ?) Il. 21.436.

forms: dat. of Ζεύς + φίλος. Prob. better written thus than Διὶ φίλος. Cf. διιπετής, which is clearly a compound.]

defs: (1) To pronounce judgment, give a decision Il. 18.506, Il. 23.574, 579: Od. 11.547.
(2) To form a decision, come to a resolve Il. 1.542, Il. 8.431 (lay down the law for . . .).
(3) In mid., to seek a judgment or decision, plead one's cause Od. 11.545, Od. 12.440.
(1) Conforming to the traditional order of society, observing the usages common to civilized men, civilized Od. 7.120 = Od. 9.175 = Od. 13.201, Od. 8.575. In superl. δικαιότατος Il. 11.832, Il. 13.6.
(2) Mindful of the usages of courtesy, well-bred Od. 3.52.
(3) Acting with due regard to what is right, upright, honourable Od. 2.282, Od. 3.133, Od. 13.209. In comp. δικαιότερος Il. 19.181.

(4) Absol. in neut. δίκαιον, something right or proper: ἐπὶ ῥηθέντι δικαίῳ (when the right word has been spoken) Od. 18.414 = Od. 20.322.–οὐ δ. with infin., (it is) not right or proper to: ἀτέμβειν Od. 20.294, Od. 21.312.

forms: In due or proper wise Od. 14.90.
acc. pl. of δίκη + -πολος, conn. with πολεύω.]
defs: Busied about judgments, administering justice Il. 1.238: Od. 11.186.

(1) Custom, usage, way: βασιλήων Od. 4.691. Cf. Od. 18.275, Od. 19.43. With notion of privilege: γερόντων Od. 24.255. Applied to a mode of existence or action imposed from without: δμώων Od. 14.59. Cf. Od. 11.218. Something that always happens in specified circumstances Od. 19.168.

(2) Right, justice Il. 16.388, Il. 19.180: Od. 14.84. In pl., rules of right, principles of justice: οὐ δίκας εἰδότα οὐδὲ θέμιστας (having no regard for justice or the usages of (civilized) men; see εἴδω III.12) Od. 9.215. Cf. Od. 3.244.
(3) A judgement or doom: δ̀ς λυκίην εἴρυτο δίκῃσιν (by his (impartial) administration of justice) Il. 16.542. Cf. Il. 18.508.
(4) A plea of right, a claim: δίκας εἴροντο (were asking questions about their . . ., seeking decisions in regard to them) Od. 11.570. Cf. Il. 23.542.
Of gates or  doors, double: πύλας δικλίδας Il. 12.455. Cf. Od. 2.345, Od. 17.268.
A fishing-net Od. 22.386.
(1) To turn (one's team) this way and that Il. 18.543.
(2) To whirl oneself about, spin round. Of acrobats Il. 18.606: = Od. 4.19. Of a bird, to circle or wheel in flight Il. 23.875.
(3) To wander, rove, roam. Il. 4.541, Il. 24.12: Od. 19.67.
(1) To whirl round (before throwing): δόλον Il. 23.840. To cause to revolve: μοχλόν Od. 9.384, 388.
(2) To whirl oneself about, spin round. Of dancers Il. 18.494.
(3) In pass.
(b) To wander, rove, roam Od. 9.153, Od. 16.63.
(c) Of the eyes, to be turned in various directions, wander Il. 17.680.
An eddy or whirlpool (in a river) Il. 21.11, 132, 213, 239, 246, 353: Od. 7.116.

Eddying, whirling. Epithet of rivers. Of the Lycian Xanthus Il. 2.877, Il. 5.479. Of the Trojan Xanthus (Scamander) Il. 8.490, Il. 14.434 = Il. 21.2  =  Il. 24.693, Il. 21.125, 206, 332, Il. 22.148. Of other rivers Od. 3.392: Od. 7.89, Od. 11.242.
(1) App., adorned with inlaid circles or spirals of a precious material Il. 3.391: Od. 19.56.
(2) App., ornamented with rings or round pieces of specified materials Il. 13.407.

etym: [δι-ο-, fr. δι- of oblique cases of Ζεύς + γεν-, γίγνομαι.]
defs: Sprung from Zeus. Epithet of heroes Il. 1.337, 489, Il. 2.173, Il. 4.489, Il. 9.106, Il. 11.810, Il. 23.294, etc. In Od. always of Odysseus Od. 2.352, Od. 5.203, Od. 8.3, Od. 10.443, etc.
(1) From, sent by, Zeus Il. 24.194, 561.
(2) By his power or will Il. 15.489.
(1) To shoot an arrow through. With genit.: πελέκεων Od. 19.578 = Od. 21.76. Cf. Od. 19.587, Od. 21.97 = 127, Od. 21.114.
(2) To shoot an arrow over an indicated space Od. 12.102.
To go to ruin: οἶκος ἐμὸς διόλωλε Od. 2.64.
To be afraid Il. 5.566, Il. 9.433, Il. 11.557. With μή and opt. Il. 17.666: Od. 22.96.
To flee, run Il. 22.251.

etym: [δι-, δια- 10 + ὀπτεύω fr. ὀπ-. See ὁράω.]
defs: To act the spy Il. 10.451.
(1) Of Zeus: δῖον γένος Il. 9.538 (= Διὸς κούρη 536).
(3) An epithet of general commendation.

Nourished or cherished by Zeus. Epithet of kings, chiefs, etc. Il. 1.176, Il. 2.660, Il. 5.463, Il. 6.109, Il. 11.648, etc.: Od. 3.480, Od. 4.26, Od. 5.378, Od. 6.49, Od. 22.136, etc. Absol. in voc. Il. 9.229, Il. 17.685, Il. 21.75, etc.: Od. 4.391, Od. 10.266, 419, Od. 15.155, 199, Od. 24.122.

etym: [δι-, δισ-. For the second element cf. διπλόος.]
defs: (1) Double, applied in two layers: δημῷ Il. 23.243. Cf. Il. 23.253.
(2) As fem. sb., a χλαῖνα intended to be worn double Il. 3.126, Il. 22.441: Od. 19.241.

etym: [δι-, δισ-. For the second element cf. ἁ-πλοΐς and δίπλαξ.]
forms: Contr. acc. sing. fem. διπλῆν Il. 10.134: Od. 19.226.
defs: (1) Worn double: χλαῖναν Il. 10.134: Od. 19.226.

(2) Of the θώρηξ, consisting of two plates: ὅθι ζωστῆρος ὀχῆες σύνεχον καὶ δ. ἤντετο θώρηξ Il. 4.133 = Od. 3.415 (i.e. where the two plates met (and overlapped) at the sides. But there is great confusion in these passages. The belt would naturally be fastened in front, not at the side; and in Od. 3. the wound is behind).

forms: From δίπτυξ acc. sing. fem. δίπτυχα (cf. ὑπόβρυξ).
defs: (1) Worn double: δίπυχον λώπην Od. 13.224.
(2) In a double fold: δίπτυχα [κνίσην] ποιήσαντες (i.e. folding it with a double fold so as to enclose the sacrificial joints) Il. 1.461 = Il. 2.424: = Od. 3.458 = Od. 12.361.
Dying twice Od. 12.22 (i.e. with a second death to face).
To engage in a contest of throwing the δίσκος: ἀλλήλοισιν (with . . . ) Od. 8.188.
A mass of stone for distance-throwing as a trial of strength or skill Il. 23.431, Il. 2.774:  =  Od. 4.626 = Od. 17.168, Od. 8.129, 186.

forms: τά Il. 23.523 = δίσκου οὖρα. See οὖρον 3.
To seek for, search for Il. 16.747.

etym: [contr. fr. διφόρος fr. δι-, δισ- + -φορος, φέρω. Something that carries two,  i. e. (in war) the ἡνίοχος and the παραιβάτης.]
defs: (2) A seat (the notion of two app. lost) Il. 3.424, Il. 7.354, Il. 24.578: Od. 4.717, Od. 17.330, Od. 19.97, Od. 20.259, etc.
(1) In two: δ. ἑταίρους ἠρίθμεον (into two bodies) Od. 10.203, δ. δφισὶ πάντα δέδασται (between them) Od. 15.412.

(2) In two ways: δ. σφισὶν ἥνδανε βουλή (they were divided in opinion) Il. 18.510: Od. 3.150, βάζομεν (in disagreement, at variance) Od. 3.127. So of favouring different sides, taking different parts: δ. θυμὸν ἔχοντες Od. 3.32. Cf. Il. 21.386. Of doubt or hesitation: δ. μερμήριζεν (was in two minds) Od. 22.333. Cf. Od. 16.73, Od. 19.524.
(1) = δίχα. (1) Od. 1.23 (into two tribes).
(2) = δίχα. (2). Of doubt, etc. Il. 16.435.
(1) Two (and different): κῆρας Il. 9.411.
(2) In neut. pl. διχθάδια as adv. = δίχα 2. Of doubt, etc. Il. 14.21.
To be athirst: διψάων (in (his) thirst) Od. 11.584.
To tear asunder, rend: κρημνὸν [πτελέη] διῶσεν Il. 21.244.
(2) To send away, chase away Od. 18.409. In mid. Od. 18.8.
(3) To pursue, seek to win: ἀκίχητα Il. 17.75.
(4) To drive (a chariot) Il. 8.439. Absol. Il. 23.344, 424, 499, 547.
(5) Of a wind, to drive (a vessel) Od. 5.332.
(6) Of rowers, to propel (a vessel). Absol.: ῥίμφα διώκοντες Od. 12.182. In pass., of a vessel, to be propelled by any agency, course along: ῥίμφα διωκομένη Od. 13.162.

forms: The subduer (cf. πανδαμάτωρ): νὺξ δ. θεῶν καὶ ἀνδρῶν Il. 14.259.

defs: A bondwoman, a female servant (cf. ἀμφίπολος) Il. 7.375, 376, Il. 9.658, Il. 18.28, Il. 22.449, Il. 23.550, Il. 24.582, 587, 643: Od. 1.147, Od. 2.412, Od. 4.49, Od. 7.307, Od. 15.461, Od. 17.34, etc. Of Calypso's servants Od. 5.199. With γυνή. See γυνή 3.

forms: Genit. pl. δμώων Od. 1.398, Od. 9.206, Od. 14.59, Od. 17.402, etc.
Dat. δμώεσσι Od. 7.71, Od. 11.431, Od. 15.379, Od. 24.213, etc. δμωσί Od. 17.389.
App., to knock aside or about, or, to shake: ἀνὴρ ἄνδρ ἐδνοπάλιζεν Il. 4.472.
Of clothes, app., metaphorically, to knock them about; or perh., to flutter or flaunt them: τὰ σὰ ῥάκεα δνοπαλίξεις Od. 14.512.

defs: (1) Dark, devoid of light Od. 13.269, Od. 15.50.
(2) Dark in hue Il. 9.15 = Il. 16.4.
(2) In neut. pl. δοιά as adv., in two ways, in double wise: κακὸν ἔμπεσεν οἴκῳ Od. 2.46.
To watch, keep an eye upon: μεταστρεφθέντα (for his turning away) Il. 13.545, Ὠρίωνα Il. 18.488: = Od. 5.274. Cf. Il. 8.340, Il. 16.313, Il. 23.325.

(1) To seem, appear. With infin.: ὃς δοκέει χαριέστατος εἶναι Il. 7.90. Cf. Il. 23.459, 470: Od. 1.227, Od. 2.33, Od. 5.342, Od. 7.258, Od. 8.388, Od. 17.415, Od. 18.18, 125, Od. 20.93. Impers.: ὥς μοι δοκεῖ εἶναι ἄριστα Il. 9.103 = 314 = Il. 13.735. Cf. Il. 7.338, Il. 12.215: Od. 1.376 = Od. 2.141, Od. 5.360, Od. 13.154, Od. 18.354, Od. 23.130.
(2) To seem likely to . . . With fut. infin.: οὔ μοι δοκέει μύθοιο τελευτὴ κρανέεσθαι Il. 9.625.
(3) To seem or appear to oneself, think oneself. With infin.: δοκέεις τις μέγας ἔμμεναι Od. 18.382.
(4) To think, suppose, fancy, imagine. With pres. infin.: δόκησε σφίσι θυμὸς ὣς ἔμεν ὡς εἰ . . . Od. 10.415. With fut. infin.: νικησέμεν Il. 6.192.
A beam supporting a roof Od. 19.38, Od. 22.176, 193. A piece of timber intended to be used as such a beam Il. 17.744.
(1) Characterized by or showing craft or guile Od. 4.455, 529, Od. 9.282.
(2) Craftily and skilfully arranged: κύκλον Od. 4.792.

forms: With long αὐλός: αἰγανέας Od. 9.156 (meaning simply long ; the second element not to be pressed).

defs: With long spears Il. 21.155.
With long oars. Epithet of the Phaeacias Od. 8.191 = 369 = Od. 13.166. Of ships Od. 4.499, Od. 19.339, Od. 23.176.

(1) Long Il. 4.533, Il. 6.255, Il. 9.86, Il. 13.162, Il. 15.474, Il. 17.607: Od. 3.169, Od. 4.393, 483, Od. 17.426, Od. 19.448. Of time: νύκτα δολιχὴν σχέθεν (so as to be . . . ) Od. 23.243. Of a disease, long drawn-out, protracted Od. 11.172.
(2) In neut. sing. δολιχόν as adv., for a long time, for long, long Il. 10.52.

etym: [doubtfully explained as fr. δολιχός + σκιή, casting a long shadow, long.]

defs: (1) Crafty, wily Od. 6.245, Od. 9.32.
(2) Craftily or cunningly made Od. 8.281.
Crafty of counsel, wily. Absol. in voc. δολομῆτα Il. 1.540.
(1) Bait for catching fish Od. 12.252.
(2) Any cunningly made contrivance for ensnaring or bringing into one's power. Of the bonds forged by Hephaestus Od. 8.276, 282, 317. Of the Trojan horse Od. 8.494.

(4) Guile, craft, cunning, trickery: ἔπεφνε δόλῳ Il. 6.142. Cf. Il. 21.599, 604, Il. 23.585: ἠὲ δόλῳ ἢ ἀμφαδόν Od. 1.296, Od. 11.120. Cf. Od. 2.106 = Od. 24.141, Od. 2.368, Od. 9.406, 408, Od. 19.212.– (The) contrivance or plotting: ὑπʼ αἰγίσθοιο δόλῳ Od. 3.235. Cf. Od. 4.92. Craftiness, cunning: δόλου οὐ λήθετο Il. 23.725. Cf. Od. 23.321.
To have guile in one's heart, plan trickery Il. 3.405, Il. 14.197, 300 = 329  =  Il. 19.106: Od. 10.339, Od. 18.51 = Od. 21.274.
Trickery, deceit Il. 19.112. In pl.: δολοφροσύνῃς ἀπάτησεν Il. 19.97.
(1) To the house Od. 22.479, Od. 24.220.
(3) A temple: Ἐρεχθῆος Od. 6.81. Cf. Il. 7.89.
(4) Of a nest of wasps or bees Il. 12.169. Of a sheepfold Il. 12.301 = Od. 7.134.
(5) With a distinguishing word: χαλκήϊον Od. 18.328 (see χαλκήϊος).
(6) Applied to particular parts of a house.

(b) To the μέγαρον (sometime difficult to say whether the word should be taken in this restricted sense): δόμον κάτα δαινυμένοισιν Od. 17.332. Cf. Od. 2.322, Od. 6.144, Od. 22.199, 291, 381, 440, 455.
A thicket of reeds Il. 18.576.
(2) The shaft of an arrow: ἐκλάσθη δ. Il. 11.584.
(1) To shake, cause to quiver Il. 17.55.
(2) To drive about, put in commotion: βόας οἶστρος Od. 22.300. Of the wind driving clouds Il. 12.157.

forms: nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. δίδωμι.

defs: What one expects: ἀπὸ δόξης (away from, i. e. such or so as to fall short of or disappoint, expectation) Il. 10.324: Od. 11.344.
A leathern bag Od. 2.354, 380.
To take δόρπον Il. 23.11: Od. 6.215, Od. 8.539, Od. 15.302 (twice).

forms: Genit. δουρός (for δορϝός) Il. 3.61, Il. 17.295, Il. 23.529, etc.: Od. 19.453. δούρατος Il. 11.357.
Dat. δούρεσσι Il. 12.303: Od. 8.528. δούρασι Il. 21.162.
defs: (1) A shoot or stem of a tree Od. 7.167.
(2) A treetrunk, a piece of timber in the rough: δοῦρα κέρσαντες Il. 24.450. Cf. Il. 3.61: Od. 5.162, 243.

(3) A beam, plank, or log: δοῦρα νεῶν Il. 2.135. Cf. Il. 12.36, Il. 15.410, Il. 17.744: τέκτονα δούρων Od. 17.384. Cf. Od. 5.361, 370, 371, Od. 9.384, 498, Od. 12.441, 443. Something made of beams or planks. Applied to the Trojan horse Od. 8.507.
(4) The shaft of a spear: πῆλε κόλον δ. Il. 16.117 (perh. δ. in 114 should be taken in the same sense).

(5) A spear Il. 2.382, Il. 4.490, Il. 8.258, Il. 13.130, Il. 17.355, Il. 21.145, etc.: Od. 1.256, Od. 8.229, Od. 11.532, Od. 14.277, Od. 16.295, Od. 22.101, etc. Used in hunting Il. 21.577: Od. 10.162, 164, Od. 19.448, 453. In guarding a sheepfold Il. 12.303. Personified: εἰ καὶ ἐμὸν δ. μαίνεται Il. 8.111. Fig.: δουρὶ δʼ ἐμῷ κτεάτισσα Il. 16.57. Cf. Il. 16.708, Il. 18.341.
(1) A gift: δ. ὀλίγη τε φίλη τε (i.e. even a small gift is welcome) Od. 7.208. Cf. Il. 10.213: Od. 14.58, Od. 18.287.
(2) A giving for use, a loan Od. 4.651.
One who gives out or distributes: ταμίαι, σίτοιο δοτῆρες Il. 19.44.

forms: Of a slave: δούλειον ἐπιπρέπει (show like a slave's) Od. 24.252.
A female slave: γέετʼ ἐκ δούλης (i.e. a captive) Od. 4.12. Cf. Il. 3.409.
Genit. sing. masc. pf. pple. δεδουπότος Il. 23.679 (app. formed direct fr. δοῦπος. Cf. ἀρημένος, κεκοπώς, πεφυζότες.) (ἐν-.)
defs: (2) To fall in fight, be slain Il. 13.426. App., simply, to die: δεδουπότος οἰδιπόδαο Il. 23.679.

A sound or noise. Of the roaring of the sea Od. 5.401, Od. 12.202. Of the roar of rushing and meeting waters Il. 4.455. Of noise or din in battle: ἐς δοῦπον ἀκόντων (to where the sound is, ι. ε. to battle) Il. 11.364 = Od. 3.451, δοῦπον ἀκόντων (the whiz) Il. 16.361, τεῖχος ὕπερ δ. ὀρώρει Il. 12.289. Cf. Il. 9.573, Il. 16.635.– Of the sound of persons approaching or moving: ἐπερχομένων δ. Il. 23.234. Cf. Il. 10.354: Od. 10.556, Od. 16.10.
Made of beams or planks. Of the Trojan horse Od. 8.493, 512.
In neut. sing. δουρηνεκές as adv., as far as a spear carries, a spear-throw: ἄπεσαν Il. 10.357.
Famous with, i.e.,  for, the spear, renowned in fight. Epithet of Menelaus Il. 5.55, 578, Il. 10.230, Il. 23.355: Od. 15.52, Od. 17.116, 147. Of Diomedes Il. 11.333.

forms: Epithet of Idomeneus Il. 2.645, 650, Il. 5.45, Il. 13.210, 467, 476.– Of Tlepolemus Il. 2.657.
Of Agastrophus Il. 11.368.– Of Odysseus Il. 11.396, 401, 661 = Il. 16.26.

defs: Won by the spear, a captive. Of Briseis Il. 9.343.
A rack or stand for holding spears Od. 1.128.

forms: In neut. pl. δόχμια as adv., across-hill: ἄναντα κάταντα πάραντά τε δ. τε Il. 23.116 (hardly to be distinguished from πάραντα).

defs: Taking a slanting direction: ἀΐσσοντε (slantwise) Il. 12.148.
An armful; in reaping, the corn cut by a sweep of the sickle, a swath Il. 11.69, Il. 18.552.

forms: In reaping, to pick up the cut corn in armfuls Il. 18.555.

defs: To be for doing, be minded to do: εἴ τι δραίνεις Il. 10.96.
To clutch at, grasp. With genit.: κόνιος δεδραγμένος Il. 13.393 = Il. 16.486.
Skinned, flayed: σώματα Il. 23.169.
To do, accomplish: ἅσσʼ ἐθέλοιεν Od. 15.317.
A sickle Il. 18.551.

forms: A female servant: αἳ δῶμα κάτα δρήστειραι ἔασιν Od. 19.345. Cf. Od. 10.349.

defs: A manservant Od. 16.248, Od. 18.76, Od. 20.160.
Domestic service, household work Od. 15.321.

Of the pains of child birth, sharp, piercing Il. 11.270. Of wrath, bitter, piercing Il. 18.322. Of fighting, bitter, keenly contested Il. 15.696. Applied to passion manifesting itself outwardly (and app. likened to smarting tears) Od. 24.319.
A coppice Od. 14.353.

(1) Running Il. 18.281. A running: δρόμου ἰσχανόωσαν (for the race) Il. 23.300, ὡς μεμνέῳτο δρόμους 361 (app., the running of the various chariots. Not laps, as the course seems to be only out and home. V. l. δρόμου, the running simply), πύματον τέλεον δρόμον (the last part of the race, i.e. that from the turn home) 373, 768. Cf. Il. 23.375, 526. 758: Od. 8.121.
(2) A race-course Il. 23.321.
(3) A piece of ground suited to horses Od. 4.605.
Oaken, or perh., wooden Od. 21.43.
(1) Thickets, coppices (prob. not nec. of oak) Il. 11.118: Od. 10.251.
(2) The pl. app. expressing vague mass or quantity rather than plurality: ἐείσατο καπνὸς διὰ δ. Od. 10.150. Cf. Od. 10.197.
Stays or trestles supporting the keel of a ship under construction Od. 19.574.
To tear away or strip off: ἀπό κε ῥινοὺς δρύφθη (would have had his skin stripped off) Od. 5.426. Cf. Il. 16.324. In mid. of reciprocal action Od. 2.153 (tearing each other's . . .).

etym: [cognate with Eng. tree, doubtless the orig. sense. Cf. δρίος, δρύϊνος, δρυμά, δρύοχοι, δρυτόμος.]
defs: (2) A felled oak or a piece thereof: ξύλον δρυός Il. 23.328. Cf. Od. 9.186, Od. 14.12, 425.

(3) In phrase οὐκ ἀπὸ δρυὸς οὐδʼ ἀπὸ πέτρης Il. 22.126: Od. 19.163, an obscure proverbial expression. In Il. 22. the sense seems to be giving utterance to thoughts from any source as they arise, with unconsidered or idle words. In Od. 19. the sense seems to be for you are sprung (from men) not from . . .
A wood-cutter Il. 11.86, Il. 16.633, Il. 23.315.
To afflict Od. 20.195.
Suffering, misery: δ. μʼ ἔχει Od. 14.215, δύης πῆμα (sorrow of suffering, sorrow and suffering) 338. Cf. Od. 18.53, 81.

forms: Genit. sing. masc. pple. δυναμένοιο Od. 1.276, Od. 11.414.
defs: (1) To be able, have the power, ability or strength, be in a position, to do something. With infin.: τεύχεʼ ὤμοιιν ἀφελέσθαι Il. 5.621. Cf. Il. 1.241, Il. 2.343, Il. 3.236, Il. 7.101, Il. 13.634, etc.: ἐριδαινέμεν οἶος Od. 1.78. Cf. Od. 2.191, Od. 3.89, Od. 4.374, Od. 18.230, Od. 21.171, etc. Of things: οὐδέ μοι αἷμα τερσῆναι δύναται (as if it was striving) Il. 16.519. Cf. Il. 14.33. With ellipse of infin.: δύναται ἅπαντα Od. 4.237. Cf. Il. 7.229: Od. 10.306, Od. 14.445. Absol.: εἰ δύνασαί γε Il. 1.393. Cf. Od. 3.360: μέγα δυναμένοιο (possessed of great power or influence) Od. 1.274, Od. 11.414, δύναμαι γάρ Od. 4.612, δύνασαι γάρ (thou well knowest how to do it) Od. 5.25. Cf. Od. 4.827, Od. 16.208.
(2) Of moral possibility: τελευτὴν ποιῆσαι (cannot make up her mind to . . .) Od. 1.250 = Od. 16.127, προλιπεῖν δε (have not the heart to . . .) Od. 13.331.
(2) Power to do something: ἀκέσασθε: δ. γὰρ ἐν ὑμῖν Od. 10.69.

forms: acc. sing. masc. aor. pple. δύω.

indeclinable. (The forms about equally common. Used with both dual and pl.) Two Il. 1.16, 250, Il. 2.731, Il. 3.18, Il. 5.159, Il. 10.253, etc.: Od. 1.256, Od. 4.27, 496, Od. 5.388, Od. 8.312, Od. 10.515, etc.
Absol.: δύω μοι ἕπεσθον Il. 22.450. Cf. Il. 2.346, Il. 10.224, Od. 3.271, Il. 23.174, etc.: Od. 2.22, Od. 7.63, Od. 14.74, etc.
With other numerals: δύω καὶ εἴκοσι Il. 2.748: Od. 9.241, Od. 10.208.– δύω καὶ πεντήκοντα Od. 8.35, 48, Od. 16.247.
Absol.: δ. πάντες ἄριστοι Od. 16.251. Cf. Od. 9.195.
Of winds, blowing with violence, stormy, blustering Il. 5.865, Il. 23.200: Od. 5.295, Od. 12.289, Od. 13.99.

defs: Dogged by persistent evil fate, most miserable Il. 19.315, Il. 22.428, 485, Il. 24.727.
That bare the noblest of sons to an evil fate Il. 18.54.

forms: Apt to put a bad construction on things, suspicious Od. 6.307.

defs: Bringing much woe. Epithet of war Od. 3.154. Of death Od. 22.325.
Bringing much woe. Epithet of war Il. 2.686, Il. 6.376 = 395, Il. 11.524, 590, Il. 13.535, Il. 18.307. Of death Il. 16.442 = Il. 22.180, Il. 18.464.
Evil in the matter of heat, cold: χειμῶνος Il. 17.549.

forms: III-sounding, evil to the ears: φόβοιο Il. 16.357.

defs: Bringing pain or discomfort: νύκτα Od. 5.466.
With smirched fame Il. 2.115 = Il. 9.22.
Bearing ill-will, in enemy wise: εἰ δ. κάκʼ ἔρεξεν Od. 2.72. Cf. Od. 2.73, Od. 20.314.

forms: Dat. pl. δυσμενέεσσι Il. 5.488, Il. 10.193, Il. 22.403, etc.: Od. 3.90, Od. 14.218, Od. 17.289, etc. δυσμενέσι Il. 3.51.
defs: (2) Absol. in pl., enemies, foes, the foe: μάχεσθαι δυσμενέεσσιν Il. 16.521. Cf. Il. 3.51, Il. 10.193, Il. 19.62, Il. 22.403: δυσμενέες καὶ ἀνάρσιοι (i.e. pirates) Od. 14.85. Cf. Od. 4.822, Od. 7.184, Od. 14.218, Od. 16.121, 234, Od. 17.289.
In voc. δύσμητερ, mother of an ill sortOd. 23.97.
Doomed to an evil fate, ill-starred, unlucky Il. 22.60, 481: Od. 1.49, Od. 6.270, Od. 16.139, Od. 20.194, Od. 24.290, 311.

forms: genit. sing. masc. aor. pple. mid. δύω.

defs: In voc. δύσπαρι, Paris, thou wretchIl. 3.39 = Il. 13.769.
Stormy: [πόντος] Il. 16.748.
Vexed by bitter weather, inclement. Of Dodona Il. 2.750, Il. 16.234.
Of ill name, accursed Il. 7.255, Il. 12.116: Od. 19.571.

forms: 3 pl. aor. subj. δυσωρήσωνται (most MSS. -ονται, prob. the orig. form).
3 pl. ἔδυσαν Il. 18.145. ἔδυν Il. 4.222, Il. 11.263.
3 sing. opt. δύη (for δυίἠ Od. 18.348, Od. 20.286.
Acc. sing. masc. pple. δύντα Il. 19.308.
3 sing. pf. δέδυκε Il. 5.811, Il. 9.239: Od. 12.93.
Genit. sing. masc. pple. δυσομένου Od. 1.24.
(ἀνα-, ἀπο-, ἐκ-, ἐνδύνω, ἐξανα-, ἐξαποδύνω, ἐσ-, κατα-, περι-, ὑπεξανα-, ὑπο-.)
defs: (I) In fut. and sigmatic aor. act., with adverbs indicating deprivation, to strip off (clothes, etc.): εἰ μὴ ἀφʼ εἵματα δύσω Il. 2.261. Cf. Il. 5.435, Il. 13.182: Od. 14.341. Sim. in pres. subj., to put off (one's armour): ἐπεί κʼ ἀπὸ τεύχεα δύω Il. 22.125.
(II) In the tenses other than the fut. and sigmatic aor. act.
Of the value of twelve oxen: δυωδεκάβοιον τῖον (at . . .) Il. 23.703.
(2) δυωδεκάτη (sc. ἡμέρη), the twelfth day: δυωδεκάτῃ (on the twelfth day) Il. 21.46: ἑνδεκάτη τε δυωδεκάτη τε Od. 2.374, Od. 4.588. So τῇ δυωδεκάτῃ Il. 24.667.
Holding twenty-two measures: τρίποδα Il. 23.264.
(2) Of the house or realm of Hades: Ἄϊδος δῶ Il. 23.74: Od. 11.571.

forms: Absol.: δ. οὖτα Il. 15.746. Cf. Od. 2.353, Od. 22.424.

defs: (1) The twelfth: ἠώς Il. 24.781.
(2) δωδεκάτη (sc. ἡμέρη), the twelfth day: δωδεκάτῃ (on the twelfth day) Il. 1.425: πρὶν δωδεκάτην γενέσθαι Od. 4.747.

(1) A house or abode: ὑψερεφὲς μέγα δ. Il. 5.213, θάλαμον καὶ δ. καὶ αὐλήν Il. 7.316 (app. the house in gen., a particular part, the θ., being specially mentioned; cf. Od. 22.494). Cf. Il. 1.18, Il. 2.854, Il. 14.121, Il. 15.143, Il. 21.44, etc.: πρὸς δ. (home) Od. 2.298, Ἀλκινόοιο δ. Od. 8.13. Cf. Od. 3.368, Od. 5.208, Od. 16.276, Od. 20.192, Od. 23.50, etc. In pl. in the same sense: ἐν δώμασʼ ἐμοῖσιν Il. 7.221. Cf. Il. 1.222, Il. 11.77, Il. 16.190, Il. 23.89, etc.: Od. 1.116, Od. 3.355, Od. 17.479, Od. 19.194, etc.
(2) Of the house or realm of Hades: δ. Ἀΐδαο Il. 15.251: Od. 12.21.
(3) Applied to particular parts of a house.

(b) To the μέγαρον (sometimes difficult to say whether the word should be taken in this restricted sense. In Od. 22.494 μέγαρον and δ. are app. distinguished): βῆ διὰ δ. Od. 6.139. Cf. Il. 4.386, Il. 15.101: Od. 1.228, Od. 2.247, Od. 4.15, 44, 46, Od. 6.85, Od. 17.329, 501, 541, 566, Od. 18.153, 341, Od. 20.149, 178, Od. 21.378, Od. 22.23,  307, 360, Od. 23.146. So in pl.: φαίνοντες κατὰ δώματα δαιτυμόνεσσιν Od. 6.102. Cf. Il. 1.600: Od. 4.72, Od. 9.7, Od. 17.531, Od. 20.159, Od. 21.234, Od. 22.22, Od. 24.183.
To give Il. 10.557.
Open to gifts, that may be appeased by gifts Il. 9.526.

(2) Something given as a return or reward: δώρῳ ἔπι μεγάλῳ Il. 10.304. Cf. Il. 9.576, 598, Il. 11.124, Il. 14.238, etc.: πόρε μοι δῶρα Od. 9.201. Cf. Od. 2.186, Od. 11.521, Od. 15.247. Of a share of spoil Il. 1.230. Of ransom for a corpse Il. 22.341, Il. 24.76, 119 = 147 = 176 = 196, 447, 458.
(3) Something given or devoted to a god: δ. Ἀθήνῃ Il. 7.293. Cf. Il. 1.390, Il. 8.203, Od. 3.299, Il. 24.68, 425: Od. 13.358, Od. 16.185.

(4) Of what is bestowed by the gods on mortals. Of one's lot or fortune: δώρων οἶα δίδωσι [Ζεύς] Il. 24.528. Cf. Il. 24.534: Od. 18.142. Of personal qualities: δῶρʼ Ἀφροδίτης Il. 3.54, 64. Cf. Il. 3.65: Od. 18.191. Of sleep: ὕπνου δ. ἕλοντο Il. 6.482, Il. 9.713: Od. 16.481, Od. 19.427.
(5) Gifts more or less voluntary, benevolences (cf. δωτίνη 2): δώροισι κατατρύχω λαούς Il. 17.225.
A bestower Od. 8.325.
(1) A gift or present Od. 9.268. Gifts collectively: εἰς ὅ κε πᾶσαν δωτίνην τελέσω Od. 11.352.
In voc. δῶτορ Od. 8.335.

forms: acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. ἁνδάνω.
With ἐ- lengthened to εἰ- in the first arsis Il. 16.9.
A robe or garment Il. 3.385, 419, Il. 14.178, Il. 16.9, Il. 21.507.

defs: Yielding, flexible, pliant: πέπλον Il. 5.734 = Il. 8.385. Cf. Il. 18.352, 613, Il. 23.254.

forms: The spring: ἔαρος νέον ἱσταμένοιο Od. 19.519. Cf. Il. 7.148.

etym: [prob. fr. (ϝ)ι(ϝ)άπτω. See προϊάπτω. For the aspirate cf. ἕηκε, ἕεστο, etc..]
defs: Thus, to be hurled or thrust Il. 13.543, Il. 14.419.
(2) With infin.

(b) To leave to do or suffer something: Τρῶας καὶ Ἀχαιοὺς μάρνασθαι Il. 5.32, τοὺς πόνον ἐχέμεν Il. 13.2. Cf. Il. 2.236, 346, Il. 5.465, Il. 8.244  =  Il. 15.376, Il. 15.522, Il. 16.96, 451, Od. 3.311, Il. 21.556, Il. 22.398: Od. 18.222. To leave to do something, wait for one's doing it: αὐτόν μιν πατρὸς μνησθῆναι Od. 4.118. To turn (animals) loose to feed: σιάλους νέμεσθαι Od. 20.164.
(c) To leave or commit to be cared for: τὸν ξεῖνον τηλεμάχῳ μελέμεν Od. 18.420.
(d) To give up the idea of doing something: κλέψαι  Ἕκτορα Il. 24.71.

(3) To suffer, let, allow, permit. With infin.: νῆας ἑλκέμεν Il. 2.165, εἴ περ οὐκ εἰῶ διαπέρσαι (seek to hinder) Il. 4.55, εἴσω δʼ οὔ μιν θυμὸς ἐφορμηθῆναι ἐάσει (will not suffice for that) Il. 18.282, Cf. Il. 2.132, Il. 5.717, Il. 8.243, 399, Il. 11.437, Il. 22.416, etc.: δορπῆσαι Od. 6.215, ζώειν Od. 13.359. Cf. Od. 2.70, Od. 6.274, Od. 10.443, 536, Od. 11.453, Od. 12.282, Od. 22.427, etc. Absol.: ἀλλά μʼ ἐᾶσαι (let me have my will) Il. 4.42, οὐ γὰρ ἐάσω Il. 17.449, Il. 18.296. Cf. Il. 5.517: Od. 6.41, Od. 10.291, Od. 20.273.
(4) With neg. and infin.
(b) Not to approve of doing something, give one's voice against doing it: οὐκ εἴασχʼ (ελένην δόμεναι Il. 11.125. Cf. Il. 8.428.
(c) To be an obstacle or hindrance to the doing of something: παῖς ἐμὸς ἧος ἔην ἔτι νήπιος γήμασθʼ οὔ μʼ εἴα Od. 19.531.
Good things, blessings Il. 24.528: Od. 8.325, 335.
(1) The seventh Il. 6.248.
(2) ἑβδομάτη (sc. ἡμέρη), the seventh day: ἑβδομάτῃ (on the seventh day) Od. 10.81, Od. 14.252.

forms: 3 pl. trans. aor. subj. ἐγγείνωνται Il. 19.26.
defs: (1) In pf., to exist, live, be in. With dat.: τοὶ?̓ιλίῳ ἐγγεγάασιν Il. 7.493, Il. 17.145. To exist, live, be, in a place: τίνες ἀνέρες ἐγγεγάασιν; Od. 13.233. Cf. Il. 4.41.
(2) In trans. aor., to give being to, breed, in an indicated place: μὴ μυῖαι εὐλὰς ἐγγείνωνται Il. 19.26.

etym: [ἐγ-, ἐν- 2 + γυ- (as in γύαλον), the hollow of the hand.]
forms: To put into the hand; hence
defs: (1) To hand over, pay: ἔεδνα Od. 8.319.
(2) To put (a person) into one's hands to be cared for: [ξεῖνόν] τοι ἐγγυαλίξω Od. 16.66.

(3) Generally, to give, grant, commit, bestow: τιμήν Il. 1.353. Cf. Il. 2.436, Il. 9.98, Il. 11.192, 207, 753, Il. 15.491, 644, Il. 17.206, 613, Il. 23.278: ὅττι κε κέρδος ἐγγυαλίξῃ (put into our minds) Od. 23.140.
To accept (an undertaking) Od. 8.351.
The giving of a pledge, an undertaking Od. 8.351.
(1) From close at hand: σάκος οὔτασεν Il. 13.647. Cf. Il. 13.562, Il. 15.529: Od. 12.354.
(c) Following closely: ἔχʼ ἐ. ἵππους Il. 23.516. Cf. Il. 22.141, Il. 23.763.
(d) Taking a course close to something, shaving it: τέρμʼ ὁρόων στρέφει ἐ. Il. 23.323.
(3) Near, near to, close to. With genit.: Ἀρήνης Il. 11.723. With dat.: αὐτῷ Il. 18.133. Cf. Il. 17.554, Il. 19.409, Il. 22.295: Od. 24.446.

(4) With ἐλθεῖν of drawing near or approaching: ἐ. ἐλθών Il. 5.72. Cf. Il. 5.275, Il. 6.219 = Il. 11.485 = Il. 17.128, Il. 11.396, Il. 13.574, Il. 14.446, Il. 24.360: Od. 3.36, Od. 8.62 = 471, Od. 8.261. So ἐ. ἱσταμένη Il. 10.508. Cf. Il. 15.710, Il. 17.582. With ἐλθεῖν and dat.: ἐ. οἱ ἦλθεν Il. 18.16, 381. Cf. Od. 3.330: Od. 4.630, Od. 15.163, Od. 17.71. So ἤντετό οἱ ἐ. Il. 22.204.
(1) Near, at hand: ὀρύξομεν ἐ. τάφρον Il. 6.341. Cf. Il. 16.71. Of a period of time: ἐ. δʼ ἠώς Il. 10.251.
(2) Near, near to, close to. With genit.: νηῶν Il. 9.76, Il. 10.561. Cf. Il. 7.317: Od. 6.29, Od. 13.156, Od. 24.358. With dat.: μοι Il. 22.300.
(3) Like ἐγγύθεν. (4): ἐ. στάς (drawing near, approaching) Od. 1.120.

(2) Near, near to, close to. With genit.: ἁλός Il. 9.153 = 295, Il. 15.619. Cf. Il. 9.232, Il. 10.274, Il. 13.247, Il. 15.650: Od. 13.268, Od. 14.518, Od. 17.205, Od. 21.215. With dat.: τοι Il. 24.365. Cf. Il. 22.453. With prep.: ἐπʼ αὐτάων ἐ. Il. 22.153.

(3) With ἰέναι of drawing near or approaching: ἐ. ἰών Il. 4.496 = Il. 5.611 = Il. 17.347, Il. 11.429, Il. 12.457. So ἱστάμενοι ἐ. Il. 18.586. So also of persons coming up to each other: ἐ. στήτην Il. 3.344. With genit.: στῆ  Ἕκτορος ἐ. Il. 6.225. With dat.: τῷ ἐ. ἰόντε Il. 21.285.

forms: 3 pl. pf. ἐγρηγόρθασι (app. fr. the mid. forms ἐγρήγορθε, ἐγρήγορθαι cited below) Il. 10.419.
Imp. pl. pf. ἐγρήγορθε Il. 6.371, Il. 18.299.
defs: (1) To rouse from sleep, waken: καὶ ὑπνώοντας ἐγείρει Il. 24.344: = Od. 5.48 = Od. 24.4. Cf. Il. 5.413, Il. 10.108, 146, 166, 511, Il. 23.234: Od. 7.48, Od. 15.44. To keep awake: μελεδήματά [μιν] ἔγειρεν Od. 15.8.
(2) To rouse, stimulate, stir to action: ἔγειρέ μιν Διὸς νόος Il. 15.242. Cf. Il. 5.208, 510, Il. 13.58, Il. 15.232, 567, 594, 603, Il. 17.552: Od. 24.164. Absol.: ἔγειρε κατὰ στρατόν Il. 13.357.

(3) To stir up, bring about, cause to break forth (battle, strife, etc.): ὀξὺν Ἄρηα Il. 2.440, Il. 4.352 = Il. 19.237, Il. 8.531 = Il. 18.304. Cf. Il. 5.496 = Il. 7.105 = Il. 11.213, Il. 5.517, Il. 13.778, Il. 17.261, 544, Od. 3.31.
(4) In mid.
(b) To rouse oneself to action, bestir oneself: ἔγρετο λαός Il. 6.434, Il. 24.789 (perh. rather ἤγρετο fr. ἀγείρω; cf. ἀγείρω 2).
(c) In pf., to keep oneself awake, be on the alert: ἐγρήγορθε ἕκαστος Il. 6.371 = Il. 18.299. So in act. form ἐγρηγόρθασι Il. 10.419. App., merely = a: ἐγρήγορθαι ἄνωχθι Il. 10.67.
To thrust down into. With dat.: ξίφος κουλεῷ Od. 11.98.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. ἐγκάτθετο Il. 14.223: Od. 11.614, Od. 23.223.
To lay down in; to put in, place within.
With dat.: τοῦτον ἱμάντα τεῷ κόλπῳ Il. 14.219. Cf. Il. 14.223.

Fig.: δ̀ς κεῖνον τελαμῶνα ἑῇ ἐγκάτθετο τέχνῃ Od. 11.614 (put it into his invention, i.e. conceived the idea of it), τὴν ἄτην ἑῷ ἐγκάτθετο θυμῷ Od. 23.223 (took or admitted the illusion into her heart).

defs: To lie (wrapped) in. With dat.: εἵμασιν Il. 22.513.
To mix or dilute in a vessel: οἶνον Il. 8.189.
In pass., to rest upon; fig., to be laid or imposed upon. With dat.: πόνος ὔμμι Il. 7.78.
To show activity, make haste: στόρεσαν λέχεʼ ἐγκονέουσαι Il. 24.648. Cf. Od. 6.340 = Od. 23.291.

forms: With dat.: τὰ τεύχεα νηΐ Od. 15.218.

defs: To put away in. With dat.: δαλὸν σποδιῇ Od. 5.488.
To run into, encounter. With dat.: φάλαγξιν Il. 13.145.

etym: [cf. the pf. forms under ἐγείρω and also ἐγρηγορτί.]
defs: To be in a state of wakefulness, be awake: κεῖτʼ ἐγρηγορόων Od. 20.6.

etym: [cf. the pf. forms under ἐγείρω and also ἐγρηγοράω.]
defs: In a state of wakefulness, awake, on the alert: ἥατο Il. 10.182.
To be in a state of wakefulness, be on the alert: πάννυχοι ἐγρήσσοντες Il. 11.551 = Il. 17.660. To lie awake Od. 20.33, 53.
(2) Spearmanship, the spear: κέκαστο πάντας ἐγχείῃ Il. 14.125. Cf. Il. 2.530.

forms: dat. pl. of ἔγχος. Second element obscure. Cf. ἰόμωρος, ὑλακόμωρος.]
defs: App., eager or active with the spear Il. 2.692, 840, Il. 6.134: Od. 3.188.
Wielding, fighting with, the spear Il. 2.131, Il. 14.449, Il. 15.605.
(2) Spearmanship, the spear: ἔγχεϊ φέρτερος εἶναι Il. 3.431. Cf. Il. 6.289, Il. 16.809, 834, Il. 18.252, Il. 19.218, Il. 21.159.

forms: 3 sing. imp. aor. pass. ἐγχριμφθήτω Il. 23.338.
Pple. ἐγχριμφθείς Il. 6.272 (v.l. ἐνιχριμφθείς (ἐνι-, ἐν.), Il. 13.146.
defs: (1) To bring near to. With dat.: τέρματι ἐγχρίμψας ἅρμα (shaving it) Il. 23.334.

(2) In pass., to come near to. With dat.: αἰχμὴ ὀστέῳ ἐγχριμφθεῖσα (grazing it) Il. 5.662, ἀσπίδι ἐγχριμφθείς (app., having it driven on him by the force of the blow) Il. 6.272. Cf. Il. 17.405. So ἐν νύσσῃ ἵππος ἐγχριμφθήτω (let him shave it) Il. 23.338. Absol.: νωλεμὲς ἐγχρίμπτοντο (fought at close quarters, pressed each other hard) Il. 17.413. Cf. Il. 13.146.

forms: Strengthened by γε: ἐγώ γε, ἔγωγε Il. 1.173, 282, 296, 298, etc.: Od. 1.215, 217, Od. 3.182, 232, etc.

etym: [orig. and sense unknown. Connexion with ἡδύς doubtful. Also written (doubtfully) ἐδανός, eatable, fr. ἔδω.]
defs: Epithet of ἔλαιον Il. 14.172.
The hull (of a ship) Od. 5.249.

forms: Also, with prothetic ἐ, ἔεδνα (ἔϝ εδνἀ.
defs: (1) A bride-price: πορὼν ἀπερείσια ἕδνα Il. 16.178. Cf. Il. 16.190, Il. 22.472: ἐέδνοισι βρίσας Od. 7.159. Cf. Od. 8.318, Od. 11.117 = Od. 13.378, Od. 11.282, Od. 15.18, Od. 16.391 = Od. 21.161,  Od. 19.529.
(2) App., a dowry given by her parents to the bride Od. 1.277 = Od. 2.196.
(1) One's seat: λιπὼν ἑ. Il. 9.194. Cf. Il. 1.534, 581.
(2) The seat of a people, etc., an abode: Θήβης ἑ. (consisting in . . .) Il. 4.406, ἀθανάτων ἑ. Il. 5.360, Il. 8.456. Cf. Il. 5.367, 868, Il. 24.144, 544: Od. 7.42, Od. 11.263, Od. 13.344.
(3) Sitting: οὐχ ἑ. ἐστίν (it is no time for sitting) Il. 11.648. Cf. Il. 23.205.
(2) A seat of honour: τίον σε ἕδρῃ Il. 8.162. Cf. Il. 12.311.
(3) A company sitting together: ἐννέα ἕδραι ἔσαν Od. 3.7, 31.

forms: 3 pl. impf. ἑδριόωντο Il. 10.198: Od. 6.98, Od. 16.344.
defs: (1) To sit down Il. 10.198: Od. 3.35, Od. 16.344. With κατά Il. 11.646 = 778.
(2) To sit, be seated: ἔνθʼ ἑδριόωντο πίνοντες Od. 6.98.

forms: Subj. mid. (in fut. sense) ἔδομαι Od. 9.369.
3 sing. pf. pass. ἐδήδοται Od. 22.56 (written also ἐδήδεται (for which cf. ὀρώρεται under ὄρνυμι) and ἐδήδαται (3 pl.)). (κατα-.)
defs: (1) Of men and beasts, to eat (food): κρέα Il. 4.345. Cf. Il. 5.341, Il. 7.142, Il. 10.569, Il. 12.319, Il. 13.322, Il. 21.465, Il. 22.501: οἷα σύες ἔδουσιν Od. 10.243. Cf. Od. 3.480, Od. 5.197, Od. 8.222, Od. 9.89 = Od. 10.101, Od. 9.84, Od. 11.123 = Od. 23.270, Od. 14.17, 81, Od. 16.110, Od. 17.533, Od. 19.536. Absol., to take food, eat: εἰωθότες ἔδμεναι ἅδην Il. 5.203. Cf. Il. 13.36: πίνοντες καὶ ἔδοντες Od. 6.99. Cf. Od. 10.243, 427, Od. 14.42, Od. 16.50, 84, Od. 17.260, Od. 20.214.
(2) Fig., to eat (one's heart): θυμὸν ἔδοντες Od. 9.75 = Od. 10.143. Cf. Il. 24.129: Od. 10.379.

(3) Of beasts, etc., to eat up, devour: χρόα γῦπες ἔδονται Il. 4.237, λέων κατὰ ταῦρον ἐδηδώς Il. 17.542. Cf. Il. 15.636, Il. 16.836, Il. 18.271, 283, Il. 22.42: Od. 22.30. Of the cannibal Cyclops Od. 9.297, 369, 476. Of a man fiercely desiring vengeance: ὠμὰ κρέα ἔδμεναι Il. 22.347. Of worms, to eat, gnaw: σὲ εὐλαὶ ἔδονται Il. 22.509: μὴ κέρα ἶπες ἔδοτεν (should be found eating or to have eaten . . .) Od. 21.395.

(4) To eat up, devour, consume, make away with: ἀλλότριον βίοτον Od. 1.160. Cf. Od. 1.250 = Od. 16.127, Od. 1.375 = Od. 2.140, Od. 2.123, Od. 13.419, Od. 14.377, 417, Od. 16.389, 431, Od. 18.280, Od. 21.332, Od. 22.56, Od. 23.9.
(1) Food, meat: κατατρύχω ἐδωδῇ λαούς (i.e. with requisitions for it) Il. 17.225, κορεσσάμενος ἐδωδῆς Il. 19.167. Cf. Od. 4.105, Od. 5.95 = Od. 14.111, Od. 5.196, Od. 7.76, Od. 14.42, 193.
(2) Fodder for horses Il. 8.504.
(3) Eating: νέον ἀπέληγεν ἐδωδῆς Il. 24.475. Cf. Od. 3.70.

(1) In the encl. forms pron. of the 3rd person sing., him, her, it: μαντοσύνην, τήν οἱ πόρεν Il. 1.72, περὶ γάρ ῥά ἑ χαλκὸς ἔλεψε φύλλα 236. Cf. Il. 2.217, Il. 3.408, Il. 4.534, Il. 5.103, etc.: Od. 1.335, Od. 2.21, Od. 7.133, Od. 8.405, etc.

(2) Reflexive in the accented forms: ἀμφὶ ἓ παπτήνας Il. 4.497. Cf. Il. 2.239, Il. 3.128, Il. 4.400, Il. 5.56, 800, Il. 8.327, Il. 13.163, Il. 15.241, Il. 17.407, Il. 19.385, etc.: κρήδεμνον ἀπὸ ἕο λῦσεν Od. 5.459. Cf. Od. 6.217, Od. 9.398, Od. 11.433, Od. 22.19, etc.
To give in marriage Od. 2.53.
A match-maker, marriage-broker: οὐκ ἐεδνωταὶ κακοί εἰμεν Il. 13.382.

etym: [ἐεικοσ-, ἐείκοσι + -α- (on analogy of numerals in -ἀ) + βοῦς.]
defs: (1) Of the value of twenty oxen: τιμήν Od. 22.57.
(2) In neut. pl. ἐεικοσάβοια, the value of twenty oxen: ἔδωκεν Od. 1.431.
Of twenty oars: νηός Od. 9.322.

forms: nom. pl. fem. pf. pple. pass. ἔργω1.
nom. pl. fem. pf. pple. pass. ζεύγνυμι.
redup. fr. (σ)εδ-, the rough breathing representing the first ς. Cf. ἵζω, L. sedeo.]
The pres. indic. only in 2 sing. ἕζεαι Od. 10.378.
The forms form ἑζόμην (with imp. ἕζευ Il. 24.522) may be regarded as aorists, with the infin. accented ἑζέσθαι.
Also 3 sing. aor. in mid. form ἐέσσατο Od. 14.295.
defs: (I) In pres. and in impf. (or aor. (see above)).
(II) In sigmatic aor. act. and mid.
(1) The mane of a horse Il. 8.42 = Il. 13.24.
(2) Horse-hairs forming a crest on a helmet: μιάνθησαν ἐ. αἵματι Il. 16.795. Cf. Il. 19.382, Il. 22.315.

forms: App., to tend, till: ἀλωήν Il. 21.347.
2 sing. pres. subj. in shorter form θέλῃσθα Il. 1.554.
defs: (3) With οὐ, to decline, refuse. With infin.: εἰ ἂν τιμὴν οὐκ ἐθέλωσι τίνειν Il. 3.289. Cf. Il. 15.492.
(4) To have the heart, venture. With infin.: ἀντίον ἐλθέμεναι Il. 17.66. Cf. Il. 9.353, Il. 13.106.
(5) Passes into the sense to be able, have the power: οὐδʼ ἔθελε [ποταμὸς] προρέειν Il. 21.366.
(2) A swarm (of bees) Il. 2.87. (Of flies) Il. 2.469. A flight (of birds) Il. 2.459, Il. 15.691. A herd (of swine) Od. 14.73.

etym: [conn. with ἦθος and orig. σϝέθω. Cf. L. suesco.]
forms: 3 sing. pf. εἴωθε Il. 5.766: Od. 17.394. ἔωθε Il. 8.408, 422.
defs: (1) In pres. pple., after one's wont: οὓς παῖδες ἐριδμαίνωσιν ἔθοντες Il. 16.260. Of a beast, after the manner of its kind Il. 9.540.

(2) In pf., to be wont or accustomed. With infin.: εἰωθότες ἔδμεναι ἅδην Il. 5.203. Cf. Il. 5.766, Il. 7.508 = Il. 15.265, Il. 8.408, 422: Od. 17.394. Adjectivally in pple., to which one is accustomed: ἡνιόχῳ εἰωθότι Il. 5.231.
(1) Interjectionally with imp., come ! εἰ φευγόντων Il. 9.46, εἰ ἄκουσον 262. For εἰ δʼ ἄγε ἄγε (ἄγετἐ see ἄγε.
(2) With opt. introducing a wish.
(b) So εἰ γάρ· εἰ γὰρ Ἀθήνη δοίη κάρτος Il. 17.561. Cf. Od. 1.255, Od. 3.218, Od. 17.496, 513, Od. 18.366. Of the present: εἰ γὰρ εἴην ἀθάνατος Il. 8.538. Cf. Il. 13.825.
(3) Citing a fact in corroboration or as the ground of an appeal or exhortation made or to be made, if it is certain or true that . . ., as surely as . . . For the examples see I of Table at end.

(4) Introducing in protasis one of two opposed clauses, even if, even though, though, granted that (such words as yet, still, nevertheless, introducing or suppliable before the apodosis). For the examples and constructions see (II) of Table.

(5) Introducing the protasis of conditional sentences, if, on condition that, supposing that (such words as then, consequently, therefore, introducing or suppliable before the apodosis). For the examples and constructions see (III) of Table.
(6) With ὡς (or ὡς. . . τε) expressing supposition for comparison.
(b) With subj.: ὡς εἴ τε φιλήσῃ Il. 9.481.
(c) With opt.: ἴσαν ὡς εἴ τε πυρὶ χθὼν νέμοιτο Il. 2.780, οὐκ ἀλέγω, ὡς εἴ με γυνὴ βάλοι Il. 11.389. Cf. Il. 11.467, Il. 22.410: Od. 9.314, Od. 10.416, 420, Od. 17.366.
(8) εἰ μή without expressed vb., unless it be (were), unless, except: εἰ μὴ πάτροκλος Il. 17.477. Cf. Il. 18.193, Il. 23.792: Od. 12.326, Od. 17.383.
(9) In final clauses, if haply, in the hope that.
(b) With subj.
(10) In object clauses, whether.
(b) With subj.
(c) With opt.
A piece of low or flat-lying land: ἐν εἱαμενῇ ἕλεος (consisting of . . ., forming . . .) Il. 4.483, Il. 15.631.

forms: Of the spring, spring . . .: ἄνθεσιν Il. 2.89. Cf. Il. 2.471 = Il. 16.643, Il. 8.307: Od. 18.367 = Od. 22.301.

defs: Fair to see, comely Od. 24.279.

(1) Food, meat Od. 9.84, Od. 11.123 = Od. 23.270. In pl. of food of various kinds: εἴδατα πόλλʼ ἐπιθεῖσα Od. 1.140 = Od. 4.56 = Od. 6.176 = Od. 10.372 = Od. 15.139 = Od. 17.95. Of food disposed on a table: ἀπὸ δʼ εἴδατα χεῦεν ἔραζε Od. 22.20, 85. Of food used as bait: ἰχθύσι δόλον κατὰ εἴδατα βάλλων Od. 12.252.
(2) Fodder for horses Il. 5.369, Il. 13.35.

(Pple. ) εἰσάμενος Il. 13.45, Il. 16.716, Il. 17.73, Il. 21.213, etc.: Od. 11.241. With prothetic ἐ ἐεισάμενος Il. 2.22, Il. 16.720, Il. 17.326, 585, Od. 3.82. Fem. εἰσαμένη Il. 5.785, Il. 17.555. ἐεισαμένη Il. 2.795, Il. 3.389: Od. 7.24.
(I) In forms (A) in act. and mid.
(II) In forms (B)
(III) In forms (C)

An unreal image, a phantom Il. 5.449, 451. Appearing in a dream Od. 4.796, 824, 835. Of the shades of the dead Il. 23.104: Od. 11.83, 213, 602. So εἴδωλα καμόντων Il. 23.72: Od. 11.476, Od. 24.14. Of the shades of slain men passing below Od. 20.355.
(1) Right on, right through Il. 5.337, Od. 3.473.
Expressing a wish. With opt.: εἰ. ἀγαθὸν τελέσειεν Od. 2.33. Of the present: εἰ. ὣς ἡβώοιμι Il. 6.157 = Il. 11.670, Il. 23.629: = Od. 14.468. Cf. Il. 4.313.
(2) In neut. sing. εἴκελον as adv., in the manner of, like. With dat.: σκιῇ εἰ. ἔπτατο Od. 11.207.
Twenty times Il. 9.379.

forms: Twenty times the normal, twenty-fold: ἄποινα Il. 22.349.
3 sing. in mid. form ἤϊκτο Od. 4.796, Od. 13.288, Od. 16.157, Od. 20.31. ἔϊκτο Il. 23.107.
defs: (I) To seem likely. Impers.: ὅθι σφίσιν εἶκε λοχῆσαι (where there was opportunity) Il. 18.520, ὅπῃ εἴξειε μάλιστα (where he might find an opening) Il. 22.321.
(II) Otherwise only in pf. and plupf. (with pres. and impf. sense).

forms: 3 sing. opt. εἴξειε Il. 13.321: Od. 14.221, Od. 22.91.
defs: (1) In fighting, to retire, give way, give ground: εἰ εἴξωσιν Ἀχαιοί Il. 12.224. Cf. Il. 5.606, Il. 8.164, Il. 12.48, Il. 13.321, 807, Il. 17.230: ὅ τέ μοι εἴξειε πόδεσσιν Od. 14.221 (app., whoever fled before me with his feet; or perh. in sense (4) with πόδεσσιν in sense πούς 2). With genit., to shrink or withdraw from (battle): πολέμου Il. 5.348. Cf. Il. 4.509.
(2) To retire or withdraw from, leave, quit. With genit.: προθύρου Od. 18.10. Cf. Od. 22.91.
(3) To make way or room for someone or something: εἶξε δʼ Ἄθήνη Il. 24.100. Cf. Od. 2.14. With dat.: οὐρεῦσιν Il. 24.716, ἀπήνῃ 718.

(4) To yield, confess oneself second: τὸ δ̀ν μένος οὐδενὶ εἴκων (to none in . . .) Il. 22.459: = Od. 11.515. Of something inanimate, to yield, give way: εἴκοι ὑπὸ βῶλος ἀρότρῳ (give the plough free passage) Od. 18.374.

(5) To yield, give way, allow play to (a feeling, a defect of character, a personal quality, a circumstance). With dat.: σῷ θυμῷ Il. 9.110. Cf. Il. 9.598, Il. 10.122, 238, Il. 13.225, Il. 24.43: πενίῃ Od. 14.157. Cf. Od. 5.126, Od. 13.143, Od. 14.262 = Od. 17.431, Od. 18.139, Od. 22.288.
(6) Trans., to yield, give: ἵππῳ ἡνία (give him the rein) Il. 23.337. To give up, surrender, hand over Od. 5.332.
To feast, revel: τῷ κεν ἐπισχοίης πόδας εἰλαπινάζων Il. 14.241. Cf. Od. 2.57 = Od. 17.536, Od. 17.410.
A boon-companion Il. 17.577.
A feast or banquet, properly one given by a single host (cf. ἔρανος: ἢ γάμῳ ἢ ἐράνῳ ἢ εἰλαπίνῃ Od. 11.415. Cf. Il. 10.217, Il. 18.491, Il. 23.201: Od. 1.226.
A means of defence or protection: νηῶν τε καὶ αὐτῶν (for . . .) Il. 6.338, 437, Il. 14.56 = 68: κύματος (against . . .) Od. 5.257.

etym: [ἐλάτη. ἐλάτινος could not stand in the hexameter.]
forms: Of fir-wood: ἐπιβλής Il. 24.454. Cf. Od. 2.424 = Od. 15.289, Od. 19.38.

etym: [explained as fr. ἐλυθ- (see ἔρχομαι). The comer, she who comes in the woman's hour of need; or, she who makes the child come forth.]
forms: The goddess presiding over child-birth Il. 16.187, Il. 19.103: Od. 19.188.
