3 pl. impf. pass. εἰλέω. See εἴλω.

etym: [εἰλ-, εἰλύω + πούς. Thus, rolling the feet, the feet being but slightly lifted, and each as set forward describing a segment of a circle. Contrast with ἀερσίπους.]

defs: A wrapper Od. 7.179.
To roll along: ἄνεμος φλόγα εἰλυφάζει Od. 3.492.

forms: Pres. pple. εἰλυφόων. = εἰλυφάζω.: εἰλυφόων ἄνεμος φέρει [πῦρ] Il. 11.156.
Also 3 sing. aor. pass. ἐλύσθη Il. 23.393.
defs: (1) In aor. pple. pass., bent upon oneself, crouching: προπάροιθε ποδῶν Ἀχιλῆος ἐλυσθείς Il. 24.510. Curled up: ὑπὸ γαστέρʼ [ἀρνειοῦ] ἐλυσθείς Od. 9.433. In Il. 23.393 (ῥυμὸς  ἐπὶ γαῖαν ἐλύσθη) app., swung to the ground.

(2) To wrap something round (something), wrap up; hence, to cover up, cover: νεφέλῃ εἰλυμένος Il. 5.186. Cf. Il. 12.286, Il. 16.640, Il. 17.492, Il. 18.522, Il. 21.319; εἴλυτο ἁλὸς ἄχνῃ Od. 5.403. Cf. Od. 14.136, 479, Od. 20.352.

etym: [ϝελ-, ϝελϝ-. Cf. εἰλύω, ἑλίσσω, λ. volvo. Conn. with ἅλις, ἁλίσκομαι, ἀολλής.]
forms: Acc. sing. masc. pres. pple. εἰλεῦντα Od. 11.573.
Infin ἀλήμεναι Il. 5.823, Il. 18.76, 286. ἀλῆναι Il. 16.714.
defs: (1) To hem in, pen in, coop up (a body of foes): κατὰ πρύμνας ἔλσαι Ἀχαιούς Il. 1.409. Cf. Il. 8.215 (twice), Il. 12.38, Il. 18.76, 294, 447, Il. 21.225, 295. Sim. of the Cyclops: εἴλει ἐνὶ σπῆϊ Od. 12.210. Of herding together the unfaithful handmaids Od. 22.460. In reference to a single person: ἔλσαν [̓οδυσσῆα] ἐν μέσσοισιν Il. 11.413. To force in a crowd (into something): ἡμίσεες ἐς ποταμὸν εἰλεῦντο Il. 21.8. Of a hunter, to drive (the quarry) together Od. 11.573. In reference to confined water: χειμέριον ἀλὲν ὕδωρ Il. 23.420.
(2) In pass.

(b) To get oneself into small compass, crouch down: πᾶς ἐάλη Il. 13.408, ἐνὶ δίφρῳ ἧστο ἀλείς (cowering) Il. 16.403, Ἀχιλῆα ἀλεὶς μένεν (crouching for a spring) Il. 21.571, οἴμησεν ἀλείς (drawing himself together) Il. 22.308: = Od. 24.538. Cf. Od. 3.168, 278.

(3) To impede or thwart the progress of: δ́ν περ ἄελλαι εἰλέωσιν Il. 2.294. To restrain from freedom of movement, confine: Διὸς βουλῇσιν ἐελμένος Il. 13.524. Sim. of the wind making navigation impossible Od. 19.200. App., to stop, hold from motion, pin down: νῆα Ζεὺς ἔλσας ἐκέασσεν Od. 5.132 = Od. 6.250.
(1) A garment: εἶμα δʼ ἔχʼ ἀμφʼ ὤμοισιν Il. 18.538. Cf. Od. 14.501.

(2) In pl., clothes, clothing, raiment: εἰ μὴ ἀφʼ εἵματα δύσω Il. 2.261. Cf. Il. 3.392, Il. 5.905, Il. 16.670, 680, Il. 18.517, Il. 22.154, 510, Il. 23.67, Il. 24.162: εἵματα ἑσσάμενος Od. 2.3, ὑφαντά Od. 13.218. Cf. Od. 4.750, Od. 5.167, Od. 7.26, Od. 8.249, etc. In apposition: φᾶρός τε χιτῶνά τε εἵματα Od. 7.214 (for raiment), Od. 6.234 (that he had on). Cf. Od. 10.542 = Od. 14.320, Od. 14.132, 154, 341, 396, 516, Od. 15.338, 368, Od. 16.79 = Od. 17.550 = Od. 21.339, Od. 22.487.

forms: (The whole of the pres. indic. except εἶς (εἴς), ἔασι may be enclitic.)
3 pl. εἶεν Il. 2.372, etc.: Od. 9.89, etc.
3 sing. ἔοι Il. 9.142, etc.: Od. 17.421, etc.
Imp. in mid. form ἔσσο Od. 1.302, etc.
3 sing. ἐσσεῖται Il. 2.393, Il. 13.317. ἔσομαι, ἔσεαι, ἔσεται, ἔσται, etc. Il. 1.136, 211, 546, 563, Il. 4.305, etc.: Od. 1.312, 397, Od. 2.61, Od. 3.325, Od. 16.267, etc.
Pple. ἐσσόμενος, -η, -ον Il. 1.70, Il. 2.119, Il. 3.287, etc.: Od. 3.204, Od. 8.580, Od. 11.433, etc.

Infin. ἔσσεσθαι Il. 7.339, Il. 11.444, Il. 12.324, etc.: Od. 14.176, Od. 16.311. ἔσεσθαι Il. 5.644, Il. 14.56, Il. 21.533, etc.: Od. 4.108, 494, Od. 7.165, etc. (ἀπ-, ἐν-, ἐπ-, μετ-, παρ-, περι-, συν-, ὑπ-.)
defs: (1) To be, exist: ὅμαδος ἦν Il. 2.96, ἡμῖν εἴνατός ἐστιν ἐνιαυτός (has been completed, has passed) 295, οὐκ ἔσθʼ δ̀ς . . . (the man does not live who . . .) Il. 22.348. Cf. Il. 2.204, 641, 642, Il. 6.340, Il. 9.249, etc.: θεοὺς αἰὲν  ἐόντας Od. 1.263. Cf. Od. 2.89, Od. 4.195, Od. 5.239, Od. 7.82, 210, etc. Impers.: ἔσται ὅτʼ ἂν . . . (the day will come when . . .) Il. 8.373. Absol. in fut. pple. pl., the men to come, posterity: αἰσχρὸν καὶ ἐσσομένοισι πυθέσθαι Il. 2.119, etc.: ἐλεγχείη καὶ ἐσσομένοισι πυθέσθαι Od. 21.255, etc. Sim. in neut. pres. pple. pl., the present: τὰ ἐόντα Il. 1.70 (τὰ ἐσσόμενα in the same line being the future, and πρὸ ἐόντα the past (pple. of the impf.)).

(2) Impers., to be possible: ἅς οὐκ ἔστι φυγεῖν Il. 12.327, οὐδʼ ἄρα πως ἦν ἀσπερχὲς κεχολῶσθαι Il. 16.60. Cf. Il. 7.267, Il. 6.239, Il. 12.65, Il. 13.114, Il. 14.63, etc.: οὔ πως ἔστι δαίνυσθαι ἀκέοντα Od. 2.310, εἴ τί που ἔστιν (if it may be) Od. 4.193. Cf. Od. 2.130, Od. 5.103, Od. 9.411, Od. 11.158, Od. 15.49, etc.

(3) As copula, to be: ἔχθιστός μοί ἐσσι Il. 1.176, καὶ σὲ τὸ πρὶν ἀκούομεν ὄλβιον εἶναι Il. 24.543 (infin. of the impf.). Cf. Il. 1.63, 107, 114, 153, 186, etc.: οἴκοι ἔσαν Od. 1.12. Cf. Od. 1.18, 27, 66, 70, 170, etc. Impers.: ἐμοί κε κέρδιον εἴη . . . Il. 7.410. Cf. Il. 1.169, 211, 229, etc.: Od. 2.74, 190, Od. 17.191, etc.

forms: 1 pl. ἴμεν Il. 17.155 (or this may be taken as infin.): Od. 2.127, Od. 10.431, Od. 18.288.
3 sing. ἴῃ Od. 8.395, Od. 18.194. ἴῃσι Il. 9.701.
3 sing. opt. ἴοι Il. 14.21. ἰείη Il. 19.209.
(ἀν-, ἀπ-, διεξ-, εἰσι, εἰσαν-, ἐξ-, ἐπ-, κατ-, μετ-, παρ-, προσ-, συν-.)
defs: (2) Of the motion of a ship Il. 1.482: = Od. 2.428. Of birds Il. 12.239, Il. 17.756, Il. 22.309. Of bees Il. 2.87. Of wind Il. 13.796. Of a storm-cloud Il. 4.278. Of smoke Il. 18.207, Il. 21.522. Of an axe Il. 3.61. Of a heavenly body Il. 22.317: Od. 10.191, Od. 12.380. Of time passing: τάχα δʼ εἶσι τέταρτον [ἔτος] (is fast passing away) Od. 2.89. Of a rumour or report going abroad Od. 23.362. Of food passing into the body Il. 19.209.
(4) To adopt a course of action: τῇ ἴμεν ᾗ κε σὺ ἡγεμονεύῃς Il. 15.46.

(5) To move oneself into a specified position, to get (on to something): ἐπʼ οὐδόν Il. 7.375: Od. 17.466, Od. 18.110, Od. 20.128, Od. 21.124 = 149, Od. 24.178, 493. Of going (on board a ship): ἐπὶ νηὸς ἰόντι (ἰών) Od. 19.238, 339, Od. 23.176.
(7) Of hostile approach: ὑπὸ τεῖχος ἰόντας Il. 12.264. Cf. Il. 4.480, Il. 10.189, etc.
(8) Of the coming on of a period of time: ἥδε δὴ ἠὼς εἶσιν (is approaching) Od. 19.571. So of death Il. 17.202.

(9) In imp. with imp., come, . . .: ἀλλʼ ἴθι προκάλεσσαι Μενέλαον Il. 3.432. Cf. Il. 10.53, 175, Il. 11.611, Il. 19.347: Od. 22.157. Sim.: ἀλλʼ ἴθι καὶ σὸν ἑταῖρον κτερέϊζε Il. 23.646. Cf. Od. 18.171. So with fut.: ἀλλʼ ἴθι, ταῦτα δʼ ἀρεσσόμεθα Il. 4.362. Absol.: ἀλλʼ ἴθι Il. 14.267.
(10) In pres. with fut. sense.
(b) To come: οὐδέ μιν οἴω νῦν ἰέναι Il. 17.710. With fut. pple.: ἡμέας εἶσι κυδοιμήσων Il. 15.136. Cf. Il. 10.450.
Nine times Od. 14.230.

forms: Inhabiting the sea: κήτεϊ Od. 4.443. Cf. Od. 5.67, Od. 15.479.
App. an adv., for nine nights: εἰ. ἴαυον Il. 9.470 (or perh. nom. pl. in a personal construction).

defs: The wives of one's husband's brothers Il. 7.378, 383, Il. 22.473, Il. 24.769.
The ninth: ἐνιαυτός Il. 2.295, εἰ. ἦλθεν (was the ninth to . . .) Il. 8.266.

forms: (Having their nest) by the way-side: σφήκεσσιν Il. 16.260.

etym: [ἐνϝοσι- (ἐν- 3 + ϝοθ-, ὠθέω) + φύλλον. Cf. ἐννοσίγαιος. Making its leaves to shake.]
forms: Covered with trembling leafage: νήριτον Il. 2.632. Cf. Il. 2.757: Od. 9.22, Od. 11.316.
3 sing. aor. opt. εἴκω1 and εἴκω2.
2 sing. subj. εἴπῃσθα Od. 3.250: Od. 11.224, Od. 22.373.
Also 2 sing. indic. εἶπας Il. 1.106, 108: Od. 22.46. ἔειπας (v.l. ἔειπες) Il. 1.286, Il. 24.379, etc.
3 sing. pa. iterative εἴπεσκε Il. 2.271, Il. 3.297, Il. 17.423, Il. 22.375, etc.: Od. 2.324, Od. 4.772, Od. 8.328, Od. 23.148, etc. (ἀπο-, δια-, ἐξ-, μετέειπον, παρ-, προσέειπον.)
defs: (1) To utter speech, speak, say: ὣς εἰπών Il. 1.68, ἐπεὶ κατὰ μοῖραν ἔειπες Il. 9.59. Cf. Il. 1.230, Il. 2.139, Il. 7.75, Il. 15.185, Il. 19.82, etc.: Od. 1.96, Od. 2.251, Od. 4.772, Od. 8.166, Od. 22.288, etc. Followed by what is said directly reported Il. 5.600, Il. 7.375, Il. 6.46, Il. 16.513, Il. 19.286, etc.: Od. 2.324, Od. 5.298, Od. 8.328, Od. 9.171, etc.

(2) To utter, speak, say, tell: ὅττι κεν εἴπῃς Il. 1.294, ποῖον ἔειπες Il. 13.824. Cf. Il. 1.286, Il. 2.59. Il. 4.22, Il. 6.68, Il. 17.716, etc.: κενὰ εὔγματα χ́γ> 249. ξφ. Od. 3.227, Od. 4.204, Od. 5.300, Od. 15.314, Od. 18.422, etc. To give (judgment): δίκην Il. 18.508.

(3) To tell, tell of or about, give information about, describe, explain: κακὸν τόσον ὅσσον ἐτύχθη Il. 17.410. Cf. Il. 9.688, Il. 10.384, Il. 23.350, etc.: γαῖαν τεήν Od. 8.555, τεὸν γένος Od. 19.162. Cf. Od. 1.169, Od. 2.31, Od. 11.177, Od. 17.106, Od. 23.273, etc. With genit.: εἰπέ μοι πατρός Od. 11.174. Cf. Od. 1.10. Absol.: Ἀχιλῆϊ εἰπεῖν Il. 17.692: τίπτʼ οὔ οἱ εἶπες; Od. 13.417. Cf. Od. 1.282, Od. 2.216, Od. 15.158, Od. 22.429, etc. Followed by a direct question: εἰπέ μοι, τί . . .; Od. 24.474. Cf. Od. 11.144.

(4) With infin. or clause in indirect discourse, to say, state, assert, tell. With infin.: νούσῳ ὑπʼ ἀργαλέῃ φθίσθαι (that he would . . .) Il. 13.666. Cf. Il. 18.9, Il. 24.113. With ὅτ̔τ'ι, thatIl. 17.655: Od. 16.131. With ὡς, howOd. 22.373. With question: ὅ τι . . . Il. 1.64, ἢ . . . ἦ . . . Il. 9.673, ὅππως . . . Il. 10.544: ὁππόθι . . . Od. 3.89, ἠὲ (ἢ . . . ἦ . . . Od. 3.214 = Od. 16.95, Od. 4.28, Od. 11.494, ὅς τις . . . Od. 4.379 = 468, ὅττι . . . Od. 4.391, ὅ τι . . . Od. 8.577, ὅπ̔π̓ῃ . . . Od. 9.279, 457, εἰ . . . Od. 11.494, Od. 13.328, ὅσσα . . . Od. 13.306, ὁππόθεν . . . Od. 14.47, ὁπποῖα . . . Od. 19.218, ὅπως . . . Od. 21.198. With acc. and dependent clause: εἰπὲ τόνδε, ὅς τις ὅδʼ ἐστίν Il. 3.192: εἰπὲ νόστον, ὡς . . . Od. 4.379 = 468. Cf. Od. 4.389 = Od. 10.539. Sim.: τόδε εἰπέ, ἢ (ἠἒ . . . ἦ . . . Il. 11.819, Il. 24.380, τόδε εἰπέ, ποσσῆμαρ . . . Il. 24.656: τόδε εἰπέ, εἰ . . . Od. 1.206, Od. 11.370, 457, ἢ (ἠἒ . . . ἦε (ἦ Od. 4.486, Od. 15.383, ὅππῃ . . . Od. 8.572, ἦ . . . Od. 16.137, τάδε κʼ εἴποι, ὡς . . . Od. 22.350, ἕκαστα εἰπεῖν, ὡς . . . Od. 24.237. So περὶ μητρός, ἢ . . . ἦ . . . Od. 15.347.

(5) To bid, direct, order, recommend. With dat. and infin.: ποσειδάωνι τὰ ἃ πρὸς δώμαθʼ ἱκέσθαι Il. 15.57. Cf. Il. 7.114, Il. 14.501: δμῳῇσι δαῖτα πένεσθαι Od. 3.427. Cf. Od. 1.37, Od. 4.682, Od. 15.76, Od. 21.235, Od. 22.262, 431. Sim.: νέστορι εἰπεῖν [χαίρειν] Od. 15.152. So μετὰ δμῳῇσιν ἔειπεν στῆσαι τρίποδα Od. 8.433. Cf. Od. 16.151. With dat. and clause: εἰπεῖν Ἀγαμέμνονι εἰ ἐποτρύνειε . . . Od. 14.497, εἰπὲ πατρὶ μή με δηλήσεται Od. 22.367. With dat. only: εἰπὲ μητέρι Il. 7.86. With acc. of what is enjoined: ἕκαστα Od. 3.361.

(6) To speak of, allude to: Ἀγαμέμνονα Il. 1.90. To speak (well) of: ἵνα τίς δʼ ἐῢ εἴπῃ Od. 1.302 = Od. 3.200. To call (so and so): πολλοί μιν ἐσθλὸν ἔειπον Od. 19.334. Cf. Il. 8.373. With acc. of the person of whom something is said and what is said directly reported: εἴποι τις "πατρὸς . . . ἀμείνων" ἐκ πολέμου ἀνιόντα Il. 7.479.

(7) To address (a person): Ἕκτορα Il. 12.60 = 210, Il. 13.725, Il. 17.334, Od. 3.375. Cf. Il. 17.237 = 651. With double acc. of person and of what is said: ἐξαίσιόν τι εἰπών τινα Od. 4.690. Cf. Od. 22.314, Od. 23.91. With prep. and cognate acc.: τὸν πρὸς μῦθον ἔειπεν Il. 5.632. Cf. Il. 2.59, 156, etc.: Od. 4.803, Od. 14.492, Od. 16.460, etc.

forms: Thus, a speaking-place: εἰράων προπάροιθε Il. 18.531.
In pl.: ἤσκειν εἴρια καλά Il. 3.388. Cf. Od. 18.316, Od. 22.423.

defs: A wool-dresser Il. 3.387.

forms: Infin. ἐρέσθαι Od. 1.405, Od. 3.69, 243, Od. 14.378, Od. 15.362, Od. 16.465. From ἐρέω pres. opt. ἐρέοιμι Od. 11.229.
Infin. ἐρέεσθαι Od. 7.298, Od. 23.106. From ἔρημι
defs: (1) To ask, inquire, make inquiry, ask questions: εἴρετο δεύτερον αὖτις Il. 1.513. Cf. Il. 9.671: Od. 10.63, Od. 14.378, Od. 15.263, 362, Od. 23.106, Od. 24.114, 474. With indirect question: ὁππόθεν εἰμέν Od. 3.80. Cf. Od. 4.423, Od. 9.402, Od. 10.109, Od. 17.120.

(2) To  ask or inquire about: εἰρόμεναι παῖδας Il. 7.239. Cf. Il. 6.128, Il. 10.416, Il. 24.390: δώματα πατρὸς ἐμοῦ Od. 7.298. Cf. Od. 9.13, 503, Od. 11.542, Od. 16.402, 465. With indirect question: νόστον, ὡς . . . Od. 4.423.

(3) To question (a person): μάντιν τινά Il. 1.62. Cf. Il. 1.332, 553, Il. 6.127, Il. 8.445, Il. 15.247: Od. 1.135, 188, 284, Od. 3.77, Od. 4.192, Od. 9.251, Od. 11.229, Od. 19.46, 95, Od. 20.137. With indirect question: Νέστορʼ ἔρειο ὅν τινα . . . Il. 11.611. Cf. Od. 3.69, Od. 4.61, Od. 8.133, Od. 17.368, 509. So ἐθέλω σε περὶ ξείνοιο ἐρέσθαι, ὁππόθεν . . . Od. 1.405. With cognate acc.: ἔπος ἄλλο ἐρέσθαι νέστορα Od. 3.243.
(4) With double acc. of person questioned and of what is inquired about: τό σε πρῶτον εἰρήσομαι Od. 6.237 = Od. 19.104. Cf. Od. 8.549, Od. 11.570 (see under δίκη 4), Od. 17.571, Od. 19.509.
(5) To ask about, look for, seek: ἵππους Od. 21.31.

forms: Acc. sing. masc. pple. ἐερμένον Od. 18.296.
To connect together by a string: [ὅρμος] ἠλέκτροισιν ἔερτο (was strung with . . .) Od. 15.460. Cf. Od. 18.296.
In pres. only Od. 2.162, Od. 11.137, Od. 13.7.
Pass. Dat. sing. neut. aor. pple. ῥηθέντι Od. 18.414, Od. 20.322.
defs: (1) To utter speech, speak, say: ἔκ τοι ἐρέω Il. 1.204. Cf. Il. 4.182, Il. 9.56, 103, Il. 10.534, etc.: Od. 4.140, Od. 7.285, Od. 12.38, Od. 19.224, etc. Followed by what is said directly reported Il. 1.204, Il. 2.257, Il. 4.176, Il. 9.314, etc.: Od. 2.187, Od. 15.318, Od. 17.229, Od. 23.130, etc.

(2) To utter, speak, say, tell: ἄλλο Il. 1.297, ἀγγελίην Il. 14.355. Cf. Il. 1.419, Il. 3.83, Il. 4.363, Il. 23.795, etc.: ψεῦδος Od. 3.20, οὔνομα Od. 7.194. Cf. Od. 2.162, Od. 12.453, Od. 16.11, Od. 18.414, etc.

(3) To tell, tell of or about, give information about, describe, explain: ἀρχοὺς νηῶν Il. 2.493. Cf. Il. 3.177, Il. 23.326: ὀλοφώϊα γέροντος Od. 4.410. Cf. Od. 6.243 = Od. 15.402, Od. 10.289, 292, Od. 11.126, Od. 19.171. With ppl. clause: δεσποινῃ έρέουσα πόσιν ἔνδον ἐόντα Od. 23.2. Absol.: τοιγὰρ ἐγὼν ἐρέω Il. 1.76. Cf. Il. 7.334, Il. 9.528: μὴ πρὶν σοὶ ἐρέειν Od. 4.747. Cf. Od. 12.58, 156, Od. 16.259, 334, Od. 18.129, 338, Od. 20.48, 229, Od. 24.481.
(4) With clause in indirect discourse, to say, state, assert, tell. With ὡς, thatIl. 23.787: Od. 4.376. With οὕνεκα Od. 16.378. With question: τοῦ εἵνεκα . . . Il. 24.106.
(5) Of the dawn or the morning-star, to herald or be the harbinger of (the daylight): φόως ἐρέουσα Il. 2.49. Cf. Il. 23.226.
(1) To ask, inquire. With question: εἰρώτα τίς εἴη Od. 15.423.
(2) To question (a person): εἰρωτᾷς με Od. 5.97. With double acc. of person questioned and of what is inquired about: ταῦθʼ ἅ μʼ εἰρωτᾷς Od. 4.347 = Od. 17.138. Cf. Od. 9.364.
(I) Adv.
(II) Prep. (commonly accented when immediately following the case-form)

(1) One, one only, a single . . .: κοίρανος Il. 2.204. Cf. Il. 2.205, 292, Il. 6.336, 435, Il. 8.355, Il. 10.48, Il. 11.40, Il. 12.456, Il. 13.260, Il. 15.416, 511, Il. 21.569, Il. 24.540: πόλιν Od. 4.176. Cf. Od. 1.377 = Od. 2.142, Od. 5.371, Od. 9.209, Od. 14.94, Od. 21.121, Od. 22.138, Od. 23.118. One and no other: εἷς οἰωνὸς ἄριστος Il. 12.243. By oneself, left alone: μή με περιστήωσʼ ἕνα πολλοί Il. 17.95. Absol. Il. 2.346, Il. 8.234, Il. 13.447, Il. 22.425: Od. 4.105, 498, Od. 10.116, Od. 12.154, Od. 13.15, Od. 20.313. Absol. in acc. fem.: ἐς μίαν βουλεύειν. See βουλεύω 2.
(2) With the article
(b) The first: τῆς ἰῆς στιχὸς ἦρχε . . . τῆς δʼ ἑτέρης . . . Il. 16.173.

(3) Strengthened by οἶος: ἕνα οἶον ἵει Il. 4.397. Cf. Il. 18.565: μίαν οἴην παῖδα Od. 6.65. Cf. Od. 2.412, Od. 14.514, Od. 22.130. Strengthening οἶος: ταμίη τε μίʼ οἴη (she and none other) Od. 9.207. Strengthened by μοῦνος: ἀμφίπολος μία μούνη Od. 23.227.

(4) Not pressing the notion of unity or singleness, one, someone: εἷς τις ἀνὴρ βουληφόρος (one of the βουλἤ Il. 1.144. Absol.: εἷς θεῶν (one of the gods) Il. 5.603, Od. 3.98. Cf. Il. 7.293, Il. 14.267, 275, 411: ὁ μὲν . . . εἷς δὲ . . . εἷς δʼ αὖ . . . (one . . . another . . . another . . .) Od. 3.421, δώσει τι ἕν (something) Od. 15.83. Cf. Od. 1.339, Od. 15.106, Od. 22.117.

(5) One, the same, one and the same: εἰν ἑνὶ δίφρῳ Il. 5.160, 609, Il. 11.103, 127. Cf. Il. 4.437, 446 = Il. 8.60, Il. 7.422, Il. 9.319, Il. 13.354, 487, Il. 15.710, Il. 16.219, Il. 17.267, Il. 18.251, Il. 22.477, Il. 24.66, 396, 496: Od. 3.128. The same as. With dat.: τώ μοι μία γείνατο μήτηρ (the same as in my case, the same as my own) Il. 3.238. Cf. Il. 19.293.
(1) To bring or conduct in: λαοδίκην ἐσάγουσα Il. 7.252. Cf. Od. 10.233, 314 = 366, Od. 14.49, 419, Od. 19.420. To bring in to one's aid: ποταμῶν μένος Il. 12.18.
(2) To bring or conduct into. With acc.: [παῖδα]?̓́ιλιον εἰσαγαγών Il. 24.620. Cf. Il. 24.719: Od. 4.43. To bring or lead home to. With acc.: κρήτην ἑταίρους Od. 3.191.

forms: 3 sing aor. opt. mid. εἴδω B.
To go up to or on to.
Of a voyage to Troy: ὅτε?̓́ιλιον εἰσανέβαινον Od. 2.172, Od. 18.252 = Od. 19.125.
App., to carry off inland, or simply, to carry off, into (a condition) (cf. ἀνάγω 1).

defs: To look up to. With acc.: οὐρανόν Il. 16.232, Il. 24.307.
To ascend or climb to. With acc.: οὐρανόν Il. 6.423.
In the face, face to face: ἰδών Il. 17.334. Cf. Od. 5.217, Od. 10.453, Od. 11.143, Od. 15.532, Od. 16.458, Od. 17.239.

forms: To come to, arrive at, reach: λῆμνον Il. 14.230. Cf. Od. 22.99, 112.
3 sing. opt. εἰσαφίκοιτο Od. 12.84, Od. 22.415, Od. 23.66.
To come or go to, arrive at, reach: ̓́ιλιον Il. 22.17. Cf. Od. 3.336: Od. 12.40, Od. 13.404 = Od. 15.38, Od. 16.228 = Od. 20.188, Od. 22.415 = Od. 23.66.
Of reaching with an arrow Od. 12.84.
Nom. pl. masc. pple. ἐσβάντες Il. 10.573.
defs: (1) To effect an entrance Il. 12.59.
(2) To plunge into something Il. 10.573.
(3) To go on board ship, embark: αἶψʼ εἴσβαινον Od. 9.103 = 179 = 471 = 563 = Od. 11.638 = Od. 12.146 = Od. 15.549, Od. 15.221.

forms: Aor. ἐσεῖδον (ἐσϝ-) (v.l. εἰσεῖδον) Od. 11.582, 593. ἔσιδον (v.l. εἴσιδον) Od. 11.306.
Infin. εἰσιδέειν Il. 16.256, Il. 19.15: Od. 7.230. ἐσιδέειν (v.l. εἰσιδέειν) Od. 12.446, Od. 23.157.
defs: (1) To look towards, look at Od. 23.94.
(3) To witness, see, look on at: φύλοπιν Il. 16.256.
(4) With pple. expressing something observed in connexion with a person or thing: ἑταῖρον κείμενον ἐν φέρτρῳ Il. 18.235. Cf. Od. 16.356. Sim.: τοὺς σχεδὸν ἔσιδεν Od. 24.493.
(5) To direct one's eyes, look, glance: Ἥρη εἰσεῖδεν Il. 14.153. Cf. Il. 19.15.
(6) The infin. used epexegetically: μείζονα εἰσιδέειν Od. 7.230 = Od. 23.157.
(1) To go in: μετʼ ἀνέρας Od. 18.184.
(2) To go into; hence, to come within the range of. With acc.: Ἀχιλῆος ὀφθαλμούς Il. 24.463.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. pple. εἰσελάσαντες Il. 15.385.
defs: (1) To drive in: ἵππους Il. 15.385. To drive a flock or herd in or home Od. 10.83.
(2) To bring a ship to land Od. 13.113.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. εὶσερύσαντες.
defs: To draw into. With acc.: νῆα σπέος εἰσερύσαντες Od. 12.317.

forms: Imp. εἴσελθε Il. 7.354: Od. 16.25. ἔσελθε Hom. Od. 17.275.
defs: (1) To go or proceed to. With acc.: Ἰθάκην Od. 1.88. Cf. Od. 17.52.
(2) To go in, get in, enter: ἔνθʼ εἰσῆλθε Il. 7.318. Cf. M 341, Il. 14.169, Il. 24.465, 477: Od. 13.112, Od. 21.230, Od. 23.88. With prep.: ἐς θάλαμον Od. 4.802.
(3) With acc.
(b) To go within or behind: πύλας καὶ τείχεα Il. 4.34.
(c) To enter into, play a part in: μάχας Il. 2.798.
(4) To come in, enter: εἴσελθε καὶ ἕζεο Il. 7.354. Cf. Od. 16.25.
(5) With acc.
(b) To come in among, mingle with: θεῶν ἑκατόμβας Il. 2.321.
(6) To come in or present oneself to take part in proceeding: νῆα χρυσοῦ νηησάσθω (νηήσασθαἰ εἰσελθών Il. 9.138, 280.
An entrance Od. 7.264.

etym: [app. for ϝεϝίκσκω, fr. ϝικ-, εἴκω1 Cf. ἴσκω, εἴκελος.]
forms: For εἴσκοντες, v.l. for ἴσκοντες, see ἴσκω 2.
defs: (1) To cause to take the likeness of, make like. With dat.: ἄλλῳ αὐτὸν φωτὶ ἤϊσκεν Od. 4.247. Cf. Od. 13.313.
(2) To liken to, deem like, compare with. With dat.: ἀρνειῷ μιν Il. 3.197. Cf. Il. 5.181, Il. 24.371: Ἀρτέμιδί σε Od. 7.152. Cf. Od. 8.159, Od. 16.187, Od. 20.362.
(3) To think, fancy, suppose, conjecture: ὡς σὺ ἐΐσκεις Od. 4.148. With infin.: ἄντα σέθεν ξάνθον ἠΐσκομεν εἶναι Il. 21.332. Cf. Il. 13.446: Od. 9.321 (infin. to be supplied), Od. 11.363.

forms: To note, descry, see: πατέρα Il. 24.700: Ὠρίωνα Od. 11.572, βίην Ἡρακληείην 601.

defs: An entrance Od. 10.90.

forms: Acc. sing. fem. pple. εἰσοιχνεῦσαν Od. 7.157.
With acc., to go to, land upon: νῆσον Od. 9.120.
To approach in order to take part in: χορόν Od. 7.157.
Infin. εἰσοράασθαι Il. 14.345: Od. 3.246, Od. 9.324, Od. 10.396, Od. 24.252.
3 pl. impf. εἰσορόωντο Il. 23.448. From ὀπ- fut. in mid. form ἐσόψομαι Il. 5.212.
defs: (1) To look at or upon, see, view, behold: Τρώων πόλιν Il. 4.4. Cf. Il. 5.183, Il. 6.214, Il. 8.52 = Il. 11.82, Il. 9.229, Il. 11.601, Il. 13.88, Il. 23.448, 495, Il. 24.632: πατέρα Od. 24.319. Cf. Od. 8.327, Od. 16.26, Od. 20.311. To set eyes upon, see: πατρίδʼ ἐμήν Il. 5.212. Cf. Il. 24.206. To look upon, be a spectator of the doings of: μνηστήρων ὅμιλον Od. 16.29, Od. 23.303. To observe, survey: χρόα Il. 22.321. To keep one's eyes upon, watch: πληϊάδας Od. 5.272.

(2) Absol., to see, behold: θάμβος ἔχεν εἰσορόωντας Il. 3.342. Cf. Il. 4.9, 79. Il. 5.418, Il. 11.73, Il. 14.345, Il. 17.687, Il. 24.23, 482: Od. 3.123, Od. 4.75, 142, Od. 7.161, Od. 8.384, Od. 9.321, Od. 11.363, Od. 14.214, Od. 16.277, Od. 19.537, Od. 23.239. To look on, be a spectator Od. 8.341. To direct one's sight, look Il. 23.464. To look out, watch: σχεδὸν ἴσχειν εἰσορόωντα ἵππους (keeping his eyes open) Il. 15.456.
(3) To look to for guidance or counsel Il. 10.123. To look towards for aid Il. 13.478, 490. To watch (a person) looking for a signal for action from him Od. 21.393.
(4) To look up to, respect, regard:  θεοὺς ὥς Il. 12.312. Cf. Od. 6.71, Od. 8.173, Od. 15.520, Od. 20.166.
(5) The infin. mid. used epexegetically: καλλίονες εἰσοράασθαι Od. 10.396. Cf. Od. 3.246, Od. 9.324, Od. 24.252.
To fly into. With acc.: κοίλην πέτρην Il. 21.494.

(1) Into the interior of something, inwards, in: δῦναι δόμον Ἄϊδος εἴσω Il. 3.322, εἵσω ἀσπίδʼ ἔαξεν (broke it in) Il. 6.270, εἴσω ἐπιγράψαι χρόα (app., getting within his guard) Il. 13.553. Cf. Il. 4.460, Il. 12.459, Il. 16.340, Il. 18.282, etc.: εἴπατʼ εἴσω (go in and tell) Od. 3.427, ἔσω κίε Od. 6.50. Cf. Od. 4.775, Od. 6.6, Od. 10.91, Od. 11.579, etc.
(2) In the interior, within: εἴσω δόρπον ἐκόσμει Od. 6.13. Cf. Od. 18.96, Od. 19.4.

(3) With acc. of something reached and entered: ̓́ιλιον εἴσω Il. 17.159. Cf. Il. 11.44, Il. 14.457, Il. 21.125, Il. 24.155, etc.: πέμψαι δόμον Ἄϊδος εἴσω Od. 9.524. Cf. Od. 11.150, Od. 15.40, Od. 23.24, etc. So with ellipse of δόμον (or perh. on the analogy of εἰς Ἄϊδος (see εἰς II.2)): κατελθόντʼ Ἄϊδος εἴσω Il. 7.284. Cf. Il. 7.422, Il. 22.425.– In reference to a point reached, but not implying entrance: νήεσσʼ ἡγήσατο?̓́ιλιον εἴσω Il. 1.71. Cf. Il. 18.58, 439, etc.: Od. 19.182, 193.
(4) With genit. as in (3): εἴσω δώματος ᾔει Od. 8.290. Cf. Od. 6.135.

forms: Hence, within or inside of the line of.

defs: (I) Adv.
(II) Prep. with genit. (commonly accented when immediately following the case - form).
(1) From afar: ἑ. φαίνεται αὐγή (i.e., as we say, to a great distance) Il. 2.456. Cf. Il. 13.179, Il. 16.634.
(2) Far off: ἑ. ἄστυ φάτʼ εἶναι Od. 17.25.
(1) Far, far off or away, at a great distance: δτρωφᾶσθαι Od. 3.422. Cf. Od. 2.40, Od. 5.358. Comp. ἑκαστέρω Od. 6.321. Superl. ἑκαστάτω Il. 10.113.
(2) Far, to a great distance: ἔπτατʼ ὀϊστός Il. 13.592. Cf. Od. 12.435.

(3) Far from. With genit.: ἑ. πόλιος Il. 5.791 = Il. 13.107. Cf. Il. 9.246, Il. 13.263, Il. 15.740, Od. 3.354: νηῶν ἑ, Od. 14.496. Cf. Od. 3.260, Od. 4.99, Od. 7.8, Od. 15.33, Od. 17.73, Od. 24.37. With prep.: ἑ. ἀπὸ τείχεος Il. 18.256.
In each place, at each of the spots mentioned Od. 3.8.
(2) Absol.
(b) In pl., the whole number of specified or indicated persons or things.

(1) On either side: τρεῖς ἑ. Il. 11.27, ἑ. καθήατο (in two parties) Od. 3.153, τρὶς ἑ. ἔδησαν [ζυγόδεσμον] Il. 24.273 (i.e. with three turns each way round the ὀμφαλός): ἀμφίπολος ἑ. παρέστη Od. 1.335 = Od. 18.211 = Od. 21.66, ἁψάμενοι ἑ. Od. 9.386 (i.e. taking hold of the two ends of the strap, which made a turn round the shaft, and pulling the ends alternately). Cf. Od. 6.91, Od. 9.430, Od. 11.578, Od. 22.181.

(2) On either side of. With genit.: ὁμίλου Il. 3.340 = Il. 23.813 (i.e. each retired behind his friends). Cf. Il. 23.329, Il. 24.319: σταθμοῖϊν
              ἑ. (one by each σταθμός) Od. 7.19. Cf. Od. 7.263.

etym: [ἑκατη-, conn. with ἑκάς + βολ-, βάλλω. Cf. ἑκηβόλος.]
defs: The far-shooter. Epithet or a name of Aollo Il. 1.370, Il. 5.444 = Il. 16.711, Il. 15.231, Il. 17.333: Od. 8.339, Od. 20.278.
The hundred-handed. Of Briareus Il. 1.402.
With a hundred rowing-benches: νηῦς Od. 3.247.

etym: [ἑκατόν + βοῦς. Lit., a sacrifice of a hundred oxen.]
defs: (1) A great or costly sacrifice Il. 1.65, Il. 2.306, Il. 7.115, Il. 6.450, Il. 9.535, etc.: Od. 1.25, Od. 3.59, Od. 4.352, Od. 5.102, Od. 6.202, etc.
(2) The material for such a sacrifice: ἄγειν ἑκατόμβην ἐς χρύσην Il. 1.99. Cf. Il. 1.142, 309, 431, 438, 447: Od. 20.276.
(1) Of the value of a hundred oxen Il. 2.449.
(2) Absol.: ἄμειβεν ἑκατόμβοιʼ ἐννεαβοίων Il. 7.236. In neut. sing., the value of a hundred oxen: ἑκατόμβοιόν τοι ἦλφον Il. 21.79.

etym: [ἑκατόν + πεδ- (as in πεζός), πούς, in sense, a measure of length.]
forms: Measuring a hundred feet: πυρήν Il. 23.164.

defs: Containing a hundred cities. Epithet of Crete Il. 2.649.
The hundred-gated. Epithet of the Egyptian Thebes Il. 9.383.

forms: indeclinable. A hundred Il. 2.448, 576, Il. 5.744, Il. 9.85, Il. 11.244, Il. 14.181.
Absol.: ἑ. τε διηκοσίων τε Il. 8.233.
With another numeral: ἑ. καὶ εἴκοσι Il. 2.510, ἑ. καὶ πεντήκοντα Il. 11.680.

etym: [a short or pet from of ἑκατηβόλος.]

defs: (A) Aor. imp. pl. ἔκβητε Od. 8.38. Pple. ἐκβάς Od. 6.285. Pl. ἐκβάντες Od. 10.103, 142.
(B) Aor. pple. pl. ἐκβήσαντες Od. 24.301.
(I) Intrans.  in all forms except (B).
(II) Trans. in form (B), to set on shore Od. 24.301.
(1) To throw out Il. 21.237.– To throw overboard Od. 15.481. Of the sea, to cast up (on to the shore) Od. 19.278. To shed (tears) Od. 19.362. To utter: ἔπος Il. 18.324: Od. 4.503.
(2) To fell (trees) (cf. ἐκτάμνω 4) Od. 5.244.
(3) To send forth, let fall: δόρυ ἔκτοσε χειπός Od. 14.277.
(4) With genit., to strike out of (the hand): βιὸν ἔκβαλε χειρός Il. 15.468. Cf. Od. 2.396. To hurl or cause to fall from: ἔκβαλε δίφρου Il. 5.39.
(5) To send forth, let fall from (the hand). With genit.: χειρὸς ἔκβαλεν ἔγχος Il. 14.419.
A means of escape from something: ἁλός Od. 5.410.
To come out: κλισίηθεν Il. 11.604.

forms: nom. sing. fem. pf. pple. ἐκγίγνομαι.

defs: To laugh out, laugh aloud: ἡδύ Od. 16.354, Od. 18.35.

forms: 3 pl. aor. ἐξεγένοντο Il. 5.637, Il. 14.115, Od. 3.231, 305.
Dat. sing. masc. pf. pple. ἐκγεγαῶτι Il. 21.185.
defs: (1) To be born: πορθεῖ τρεῖς παῖδες ἐξεγένοντο (were born to . . .) Il. 14.115.

(2) With genit., to be born of: οἳ Διὸς ἐξεγένοντο Il. 5.637. Cf. Il. 3.199, 418, Od. 3.106, 231, 305, Il. 21.185: Od. 4.184, 219, Od. 10.138, Od. 7.229, Od. 23.218. To be by birth (the son) of: υἱὸς Ἀγχίσαο εὔχεται (εὔχομαἰ ἐκγεγάμεν Il. 5.248, Od. 3.209.
(1) The offspring, a child (= γόνος 1.a): τυδέος Il. 5.813. Cf. Od. 3.206: Od. 3.123, Od. 11.236.
(2) A remoter descendant ( = γόνος 1..b): μελάμποδος Od. 15.225 (he was his great-grandson).
To strip off: δῶκέ μʼ ἐκδείρας ἀσκὸν βοός Od. 10.19 (i.e. a bag made from the stripped off skin).

forms: To receive from one, relieve one of: οἵ οἱ σάκος ἐξεδέχοντο Il. 13.710.

defs: (1) To attach, bind on Od. 22.174.
(2) To attach so as to hang from, bind on to. With genit.: δρῦς ἔκδεον ἡμιόνων Il. 23.121.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. ἐκσιαβάντες.
defs: To go forth and across (a space). With acc.: τάφρον Il. 10.198.
To give up, surrender: (ελένην Il. 3.459.
(1) To put off (a garment) Od. 1.437, Od. 14.460. So in mid., to put off (one's armour): τεύχεʼ ἐξεδύοντο Il. 3.114.
(2) To go out of, quit. With genit.: μεγάροιο Od. 22.334. To escape, avoid: ὄλεθρον Il. 16.99.

(1) That person or thing, the person or thing referred to, he, she, it (with backward reference): οἶος ἐ. δεινὸς ἀνήρ Il. 11.653. Cf. Od. 2.183, Od. 3.113, Od. 14.163, 352, Od. 15.330, 368, Od. 16.151, Od. 18.147, Od. 19.322, Od. 24.288, 312, 437.
(2) As antecedent to a relative: ἐ. ὃς . . . Il. 9.63.
(3) Contrasted with ὁ Od. 4.819.
(4) With sb., that: ἐν ἐκείνῳ δήμῳ Od. 3.103.
Skill in the use of the bow. In pl. Il. 5.54.

(1) At ease, at one's ease, taking one's ease, untroubled, undisturbed, without undue exertion: τέρπονται Il. 5.759, ἐρρέτω (without hindrance on my part, for all Il. 9. care) Il. 9.376. Cf. Il. 7.70, Il. 8.512, Il. 11.75, Il. 17.340: Od. 2.311, Od. 11.184, Od. 13.423, Od. 14.91, 167, Od. 16.314, Od. 21.289.

(2) Implying forbearance from action, keeping the peace, holding one's peace, restraining oneself: δαίνυσθαι Il. 5.805. Cf. Il. 15.194: Od. 12.301, Od. 17.478, Od. 21.259 (giving over for the time being), 309.
By the grace or aid of. With genit. (always following the case): (ερμείαο ἑ. Od. 15.319. Cf. Od. 19.86, Od. 20.42.

forms: nom. pl. fem. aor. pple. ἐκτίθημι.

defs: To die: γέλῳ ἔκθανον Od. 4.100 (app. (nearly) killed themselves with laughter).

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἐξέθορε Il. 21.539. ἔκθορε Il. 16.427.
defs: (1) To leap or spring forth Il. 21.539.
(2) To jump out of. With genit.: δίφρου Il. 16.427. So of the heart beating in agitation and apparently striving to burst (out of the breast): κραδίη μοι ἔξω στηθέων ἐκθρῴσκει Il. 10.95.

forms: To clear out, free from obstructions: οὐρούς Il. 2.153.

etym: [ἑκ-, ἕξ + καί + δέκα + δῶρον, a palm, four fingers' breadth, i.e. about three inches.]
forms: Sixteen palms in length, i.e. about four feet: κέρα Il. 4.109.
Aor. pple. ἐκκαλέσας Il. 24.582.  Pl. ἐκκαλέσαντες Od. 10.471.
To call forth for conference: με Od. 10.471.– Of Hermes summoning souls for their passage to the nether world.

defs: To see or descry something from (a height). With genit.: περγάμου Il. 4.508, Il. 6.21.
To leap forth down from for an indicated purpose: οὐρανοῦ Il. 19.351 (v.l. οὐρανοῦ ἒκ κατεπᾶλτο).
To rescue by stealth out of something: Ἄρηα Il. 5.390.
In pass., to be rolled, roll (headlong) from a position: ἐκ δίφροιο Il. 7.42 = Il. 23.394.

forms: 3 pl. redup. aor. subj. ἐκλελάθωνται Od. 22.444.
defs: (1) To cause a person to forget, deprive him of (a faculty): ἐκλέλαθον κιθαριστύν Il. 2.600.
(2) In mid.

(b) With genit., to forget, fail to bethink oneself of: οὐδʼ ἀλκῆς ἐξελάθοντο Il. 16.602. To forget, be freed from: ὀϊζύος Il. 7.285. To (die and) forget, cease to think of (in death): γάμοιο Od. 3.224. Cf. Od. 22.444.

forms: 2 sing. impf. pass. κλέω. See κλείω.

defs: A forgetting: παίδων φόνοιο Od. 24.485 (an amnesty in regard to . . .).
(1) To set free or rescue from. In mid. With genit.: κακῶν σʼ ἐκλύσομαι Od. 10.286.
(2) αἰχμὴ ἐξελύθη Il. 5.293, app., was disengaged from the flesh.

etym: [ἐκ- 1 + μυζάω, in late Greek, to suck.]
forms: To suck, or perh. rather, to press or squeeze out: αἷμʼ ἐκμυζήσας Il. 4.218.

etym: [perh. for ἔκ-πλαγ-λος, fr. ἐκ- 9 + πλαγ-, πλήσσω.]
forms: In some way striking or remarkable.
defs: (1) Of persons Il. 21.452 (extraordinarily violent or unreasonable), 589 (wonderful, great). In superl. Il. 1.146 and Od. 3.389 (most wonderful (derisively)), Il. 18.170 (app., incredibly remiss).
(2) Of words, etc., violent, vehement: ἐπέεσσιν Il. 15.198: Od. 8.77, ἐνιπήν Od. 10.448. Of a storm, unusually violent Od. 14.522.

(3) In neut. sing. ἔκπαγλον as adv., in striking wise, vehemently, loudly, excessively: ἐπεύξατο Il. 13.413, 445, Il. 14.453, 478, ἀεικιῶ Il. 22.256. Cf. Od. 17.216. So in pl. ἔκπαγλα, exceedingly, strongly, deeply: φίλησα Il. 3.415. Cf. Il. 5.423.

forms: In striking wise, vehemently, exceedingly, strongly, deeply Il. 1.268, Il. 2.223, 357, Il. 9.238: Od. 5.340, Od. 11.437, 560, Od. 15.355.
To make oneself prominent, attract attention to oneself Il. 5.803.

defs: In pass., app., to throb forth from. With genit.: μυελὸς σφονδυλίων ἔκπαλτο Od. 3.483.

forms: App., to afflict (in mind): φρένας ἐκπεπαταγμένος ἐσσί (out of your wits, stirred to madness) Od. 18.327.
Aor. imp. pl. mid. ἐκπέμψασθε Od. 20.361.
defs: (1) To send forth or away Il. 24.381: Od. 16.3.
(2) With genit., to send forth from, cause to depart from: πολέμου Il. 21.598. To turn out of: δώματος Od. 18.336. In mid. Od. 20.361.
(3) To conduct or escort from. With genit.: νηῶν Il. 24.681.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἐξεπέρησε Il. 13.652, Il. 16.346: Od. 10.162.
defs: (1) To pass over, traverse: λαῖτμα Od. 6.35, Od. 8.561, Od. 9.323.
(2) Of an arrow or a spear, to make its way, pass Il. 13.652, Il. 16.346: Od. 10.162.
(2) To plunder or carry off from. With genit.: πολίων Il. 1.125.

forms: nom. pl. fem. pf. pple. ἐκφύω.

defs: (1) To take a draught, quaff a cup Od. 9.353, 361, Od. 10.237, 318.
(2) In pass., to be drunk up, be consumed: ὅσσα τοι ἐκπέποται Od. 22.56.
(1) To fall out Il. 21.492, Il. 23.467. To fall out of one's hand: χαμαί οἱ ἔκπεσε κερκίς Il. 22.448. Of tears, to fall, be shed Il. 2.266: Od. 16.16.

(2) With genit., to fall out of or from: δίφρου Il. 5.585, Il. 13.399, ἵππων Il. 11.179. To fall out of (one's hand or arms): χειρός Il. 3.363, Il. 4.493, Il. 8.329, Il. 15.421, 465: Od. 14.31, 34, Od. 22.17.
In pass., to be driven out of one's wits, become panic-struck (cf. πλήσσω 2) Il. 18.225.

forms: Of snow-flakes, to fly forth, be shed abroad: νιφάδες ἐκποτέονται Il. 19.357.

defs: To summon and cause to come forward out of. In mid. With genit.: μεγάρων Od. 2.400.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. ἐκπρολιπόντες.
defs: To quit...and go forward, to issue from: λόχον Od. 8.515.
To spit out of. With genit.: στόματος ἅλμην Od. 5.322.
To break, cause to snap asunder Il. 15.469. To carry away, cause to give way: ὁδοῖο (partitive genit., a part of the ...) Il. 23.421.
To save or preserve from impending danger Il. 4.12. To save or preserve from  the power of. With genit.: θαλάσσης Od. 4.501.
(1) To speed forth Od. 9.438.
(2) With genit., to speed forth from: πυλέων Il. 6.1. Of sleep, to flee away from, forsake: βλεφάρων μοι ἐξέσσυτο ὕπνος Od. 12.366. To issue or gush forth from: φάρυγος οἶνος Od. 9.373.

forms: Nom. dual masc. aor. pple. mid. ἐκσπασσαμένω Il. 6.255.
To draw out, recover (a spear) Il. 7.65.
So in mid.: ἔγχεα (i.e. from the shields in which they were stuck) Il. 6.255.

defs: To overturn (a plant) and uproot (it) from. With genit.: ἔρνος βόθρου Il. 17.58.
Thus, capable of being spread out, ample, flowing: χλαῖναν Il. 10.134.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἐξέταμε Il. 4.486. ἔκταμε Od. 9.320.
defs: (1) To cut out (a sacrificial limb), sever (it) by the joint: μηρούς Il. 1.460 = Il. 2.423: = Od. 12.360. Of a surgeon, to cut out, extract: ἰούς Il. 11.515. To cut out or extract from. With genit.: μηροῦ ὀϊστόν Il. 11.829.
(2) To cut from a tree for one's use: ῥόπαλον Od. 9.320.
(3) To cut pieces out of, make incision in: ὕλην Il. 12.149.
(4) To fell (trees) (cf. ἐκβάλλω 2) Il. 4.486, Il. 13.391  =  Il. 16.484.
(5) To cut out, shape: νήϊον Il. 3.62.
(1) To stretch out, cause to lie stretched out Il. 11.844, Il. 24.18.
(2) To stretch out, lay low Il. 17.58. In pass., to be laid low: ὕπτιος ἐξετανύσθη Il. 6.271.

forms: 3 pl. impf. pass. ἐξετελεῦντο Od. 11.294, Od. 14.293.
defs: (1) To bring to completion, carry through, carry out, bring about, accomplish, perform: ἔργον Od. 3.99 = Od. 4.329. Cf. Il. 6.353, Il. 18.79, Il. 23.96: Od. 3.275, Od. 4.7, Od. 8.22, Od. 10.41, Od. 11.280, Od. 21.135, 180 = 268, Od. 22.5. Absol. Od. 10.27 (his aid was vain), Od. 11.317 (would have succeeded). In pass., to come to pass, happen. Impers.: ὧδʼ ἐκτελέεσθαι ὀΐομαι (thus it will be) Il. 12.217.
(2) To accomplish, fulfil, carry out, bring to fruition or consummation (a promise, purpose, wish, boasts): ὑπόσχεσιν Il. 2.286. Cf. Il. 9.245, Il. 10.105: Od. 3.99 = Od. 4.329, Od. 23.54.
(3) To finish the making of, complete: φᾶρος Od. 2.98 = Od. 19.143 = Od. 24.133, Od. 2.110 = Od. 24.146, Od. 19.156.
(4) To bring into being, cause to be born: γόνον Il. 9.493.
(5) In pass., of periods of time, to be accomplished or completed: ὅτε μῆνές τε καὶ ἡμέραι ἐξετελεῦντο Od. 11.294 = Od. 14.293.

forms: Nom. pl. fem. aor. pple. ἐκθεῖσαι.
defs: To place outside on a spot indicated: λέχος Od. 23.179.
(1) Outside, without: ἐ. αὐλῆς (outside in the αὐλή, taking αὐλῆς as local genit.) Od. 9.239, 338. Cf. Od. 13.100.
(2) Outside the circle of. With genit.: ἐ. ἄλλων μνηστήρων Od. 1.132.
Outside of, beyond the line or shelter of. With genit.: νηῶν Il. 15.391, πυλάων Il. 22.439.
The sixth Il. 2.407: Od. 3.415.
(1) Outside: ὡς ἴδε νεῦρόν τε καὶ ὄγκους ἐ. ἐόντας Il. 4.151 (i.e. they had not entered the wound), ἐ. λέξο Il. 24.650 (i.e. in the αἴθουσα). Cf. Il. 10.151: Od. 7.72, Od. 14.11, 16, Od. 23.135.
(2) With genit.
(b) To outside of: καλέσσατο δώματος ἐ. Il. 15.143.
(c) Out of the region of danger from: καπνοῦ καὶ κύματος ἐ. Od. 12.219.
(d) Apart from, at a distance from the line of: ὁδοῦ Od. 13.123. Aside or away from the line of: ὁδοῦ Il. 23.424. Cf. Od. 17.234.
Out of, from. With genit.: χειρός Od. 14.277.
A mother-in-law Il. 22.451, Il. 24.770.
A father-in-law Il. 3.172, Il. 24.770.

forms: 3 sing. aor. pass. ἐξεφαάνθη Il. 4.468, Il. 13.278: Od. 12.441.
3 sing. aor. ἐξεφάνη Il. 18.248, Il. 19.46, Od. 3.43: Od. 10.260.
defs: (1) To bring to light Il. 19.104 (to the birth).
(2) In pass.
(b) To be exposed to view, be visible Il. 4.468. To be seen in one's true colours, be known for what one is Il. 13.278.
(c) To shine, gleam: ὡς εἰ σέλας Il. 19.17.
(1) To bear or carry forth or away Il. 10.505: Od. 15.470. To carry off (a prize) Il. 23.785.
(2) To bear, carry, bring, forth or away from. With genit.: πολέμοιο Il. 5.234, 664, 669. Cf. Il. 23.259: Od. 8.439.
(3) To carry forth (a corpse) for funeral rites Il. 23.675, Il. 24.786.
(4) To bear from the field, carry out of danger Il. 16.368, 383 = 866.
(5) To bring round or on (a point of time): ὅτε μισθοῖο τέλος ὧραι ἐξέφερον Il. 21.451.
(6) Intrans. for reflexive, to draw away from competitors in a race, shoot ahead (cf. ὑπεκφέρω 3) Il. 23.376, 377, 759.
(1) To escape, evade, avoid (impending danger or trouble): θάνατον Il. 21.66. Cf. Il. 9.355: Od. 4.502, 512, Od. 15.235, Od. 19.157.

(2) To escape from, get clear or free of (danger, etc., in which one is involved): μέγα πεῖραρ ὀϊζύος Od. 5.289. Cf. Od. 5.414. Absol.: ἔνθεν ἐκφύγομεν Od. 12.212. Cf. Od. 19.231. To escape from or out of. With genit.: ἁλός Od. 23.236.
(3) Of a missile weapon, to fly from (the hand). With genit.: βέλος ἔκφυγε χειρός Il. 5.18, Il. 11.376, Il. 14.407 = Il. 22.292, Il. 16.480. Absol.: οὐδʼ ἅλιον βέλος ἔκφυγεν Il. 11.380.
(1) To announce or declare openly. With dependent clause: οὕνεκα...ν 308.
(2) To utter: ἔπος Od. 10.246.
Of something stored in a place, to be consumed or perish from or out of  (the place). With genit. : οὔ πω νηῶν ἐξέφθιτο οἶνος Od. 9.163. Cf. Od. 12.329.
(1) To bear or carry out Od. 22.451.
(2) In pass., to be borne or advance from. With genit.: κόρυθες νηῶν ἐκφορέοντο Il. 19.360.

forms: Nom. pl. fem. pf. pple. ἐκπεφυυῖαι.
defs: To spring from. With genit.: κεφαλαὶ τρεῖς ἑνὸς αὐχένος Il. 11.40.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. ἐκχεύατο Od. 22.3, Od. 24.178.
3 sing. aor. pass. ἐξέχυτο Od. 19.470. ἔκχυτο Od. 19.504.
defs: (1) To pour out (liquid) Il. 3.296. Of solid objects. In mid.: ὀϊστούς Od. 22.3, Od. 24.178.

(2) In pass., of a liquid, to pour out, be spread: ὕδατος ἐκχυμένοιο Il. 21.300. To be spilt: ἐξέχυθʼ ὕδωρ Od. 19.470. Cf. Od. 19.504. Fig., to hang suspended from. With ablative, [δέσματα] μελαθρόφιν ἐξεκέχυντο Od. 8.279. Of persons, to pour out, stream forth Il. 16.259: Od. 8.515.
(1) Willingly, of free will, not under compulsion: ἑ. δῶκα Od. 4.649. Cf. Od. 4.647, Od. 5.100-1 Od. 22.351.
(2) Yielding too readily to one's feelings or fears or to circumstances, giving in too easily: ἑ. μεθιεῖς Il. 7.523. Cf. Il. 13.234: Od. 3.214 = Od. 16.95, Od. 4.372, 377.
(3) On purpose, of set purpose, intentionally, advisedly: ἑ. ἡμάρτανεν Il. 10.372. Cf. Il. 8.81, Il. 23.434, 585.
(4) As a matter of choice, by one's own will: ἑ. οὐκ ἄν τις ἕλοιτο [θεῶν δῶρα] Il. 3.66.

(5) Preceding ἀέκων and serving to emphasize it by contrast: ἑ. ἀέκοντί γε θυμῷ Il. 4.43. Cf. Il. 6.197. Sim. in Od. 2.133 ἑ. is used rather with reference to ἀέκουσαν in 130 than as in itself giving any distinct sense.
Of olive-wood Od. 9.320, 394.

forms: In neut. ἔλασσον as adv., less: δουρηνεκὲς ἤ καὶ ἐ. Il. 10.357.

defs: To drive (one's team) Il. 18.543.
(1) The fir-tree Il. 5.560, Il. 14.287: Od. 5.239. Fir-wood Il. 24.450.
One who drives, a charioteer Il. 4.145, Il. 11.702, Il. 23.369.

forms: 3 sing.  subj. ἐλάσσῃ Il. 5.236. ἐλάσῃ Od. 3.422, Od. 10.293, Od. 17.279.
3 sing. opt. ἐλάσειε Od. 11.290, Od. 17.237, Od. 22.97, etc.
Infin. ἐλάσαι Il. 5.264, Il. 19.423: Od. 18.94. ἐλάσσαι Il. 13.607, 647.
Pass. 3 sing. pf. ἐλήλαται Il. 16.518: Od. 6.113.
3 sing. plupf. ἐλήλατο Il. 4.135, Il. 10.153, Il. 13.595. ἠλήλατο Il. 5.400.
3 pl. ἐληλέατο Od. 6.86 (vv.ll. ἐληλάδατο, ἐληλέδατο). (δι-, εἰσ-, ἐξ-, ἐπ-, παρ-, παρεξ-, συν-.)
defs: (1) To drive (cattle, etc.) Il. 4.279, Il. 19.281: Od. 9.237, 337, Od. 10.390. To drive in or fetch (them) for some purpose Od. 12.343, 353, 398. In mid. Od. 4.637. Absol.: ὄφρʼ ἐλάσῃ ἐπιβουκόλος ἀνήρ Od. 3.422.

(2) In reference to persons, to drive: κακοὺς ἐς μέσσον Il. 4.299. Cf. Il. 24.532. To drive or chase, to drive or chase away: ἐκ τροίησʼ αχαιούς Il. 7.529. Cf. Il. 16.87, 293, Il. 21.217, Il. 24.392. To banish Il. 7.158. For ἅδην ἐλάαν see ἅδην: Fig. οἴ ἐκ δίκην ἐλάσωσιν Il. 16.388.

(3) To drive off (cattle, etc., as spoil) Il. 1.154: Od. 9.405, 465, Od. 11.290, Od. 15.235. In mid.: ῥύσιʼ ὲλαυνόμενος Il. 11.674. Cf. Il. 11.682: Od. 20.51. To drive off (captured horses) Il. 5.165, 236, 264, 327, 589, Il. 17.496. In mid. Il. 10.537.

(4) To drive (horses, a chariot, a team of oxen, etc.): ἅρματα καὶ ἵππω Il. 5.237. Cf. Il. 2.764, Il. 11.289, Il. 23.334, Il. 24.325, etc.: Od. 15.215. Absol.: μάστιξεν ἐλάαν (to start the horses) Il. 5.366. Cf. Il. 11.274, Il. 13.27, Il. 16.713, Il. 23.356, etc.: εἰ βόες εἶεν ἐλαυνέμεν Od. 18.371. Cf. Od. 3.484, 493, Od. 4.2, etc. To drive up to the rescue: ἵππους Il. 17.614. To ride (a horse) Od. 5.371. Fig., to carry on, keep going: κολῳόν Il. 1.575.

(5) To propel (a ship) with oars, row (her) Od. 6.109, Od. 12.109, 276, Od. 13.155, 169, Od. 15.503. Absol.: ἀναβάντες ἐλαύνομεν Od. 3.157, ἐλόωσι γαλήνην (through...) Od. 6.319. Cf. Od. 12.47, 55, 124, Od. 13.22.

(6) Of operations conducted in line, to drive or form (a ditch, a wall, etc.): τάφρον Il. 6.450 = Il. 12.6, Il. 9.349, ὄγμον Il. 11.68. Cf. Il. 18.564: τεῖχος Od. 7.9, σταυρούς (a line of ...) Od. 14.11. Cf. Od. 6.86, 113.

(7) To drive or thrust (a weapon): διαπρὸ χαλκὸν ἔλασσεν Il. 15.342. Cf. Il. 5.41, 539, Od. 3.259, Il. 24.421, etc.: Od. 22.93, 295. To drive (a weapon) into the ground Il. 10.153. To drive or thrust (something into a specified position): μοχλὸν ὑπὸ σποδοῦ Od. 9.375. In pass. of an arrow or a spear, to pass, take its way: διὰ ζωστῆρος ἐλήλατʼ [ὀϊστός] Il. 4.135. Cf. Il. 5.400, Il. 13.

(8) To strike or wound (never with a missile): (γψήνορα ὦμον (in the . . .) Il. 5.80, κόρυθος φάλον Il. 13.614. Cf. Il. 2.199, Il. 5.584, Il. 10.455, Il. 11.109, Il. 13.576, Il. 14.497, Il. 15.352, Il. 16.338, Od. 3.475, Il. 22.326: πέτρην Od. 4.507, δεξιὸν ὦμον Od. 18.95. Cf. Od. 10.293, Od. 17.279, Od. 18.92, 96, Od. 22.94, 97, 296, 328. Absol.: Il. 21.425, Il. 22.284: Od. 3.449, Od. 13.164, Od. 18.91, 94. To dash (against the ground): πρὸς γῆν κάρη Od. 17.237. Of a wave striking Od. 5.313, 367. Of a boar wounding with its tusk Od. 19.449, 465. With cognate acc. of the wound inflicted by it Od. 19.393 = Od. 23.74, Od. 21.219, Od. 24.332. With σύν, to dash(one's teeth) together Od. 18.98. To beat (the sea with oars) (cf. τύπτω 3) Il. 6.6. Fig., of pain, to pierce: χεὶρ ὀδύνῃσιν ἐλήλαται Il. 16.518.
(9) To beat or hammer out (metal) Il. 6.223. To form by beating or hammering out Il. 12.296, Od. 3.270.
One who smites deer, a hunter Il. 18.319.
(1) Light, of small weight: λᾶαν Il. 12.450.

(2) Moving easily, nimble: γυῖα Il. 5.122 = Il. 13.61 = Il. 23.772, χεῖρες Il. 23.628. Active in movement, nimble: ἀνήρ Il. 16.745. Swift. In comp. ἐλαφρότερος Od. 1.164 (see ἀφνειός)–In superl. ἐλαφρότατος Il. 23.749: Od. 3.370. Of birds Il. 22.139: Od. 13.87. Of the wind Il. 19.416.
(3) Light to bear, not burdensome. In comp.: ἐλαφρότερός κε πόλεμος γένοιτο Il. 22.287.
(1) To wish, desire. With infin.: ἰδέσθαι σε Od. 4.162. Cf. Il. 13.638: Od. 5.219, Od. 15.66, Od. 18.164, Od. 20.35.
(2) To wish for, desire, covet: κτήματα Il. 5.481. To long for, look eagerly forward to Od. 23.6. To seek the accomplishment of, prosecute (business) Od. 1.409.
(3) With genit., to long for, sigh after: πασιθέης Il. 14.276: σῆς ἀλόχου Od. 5.210. To be eager for: ἐλδόμεναι πεδίοιο (eager to reach the...) Il. 23.122. To lack: ἐδωδῆς Od. 14.42.
(4) Absol. in pple., longing, desiring, eagerly expectant Il. 6.4, 7: Od. 12.438, Od. 21.209, Od. 24.400.
(5) As pass.: ἐελδέσθω τοι πόλεμος (let it be thy desire) Il. 16.494.
Always, with prothetic ἐ, ἐέλδωρ. A wish or desire Il. 1.41, 455 = Il. 16.238, Il. 1.504, Il. 8.242, Il. 15.74: Od. 3.418, Od. 17.242, Od. 21.200, Od. 23.54.

forms: To pity, take pity upon, feel pity for, feel for Il. 2.27 = 64 Il. 24.174, Il. 7.407, Il. 10.176, Il. 11.665, Il. 24.19, 23: Od. 3.96 = Od. 4.326, Od. 14.389, Od. 23.313.
With pple. expressing the plight of the pitied: Τρῶας ἀπολλυμένους Il. 6.27. Cf. Il. 9.302, Il. 13.15: Od. 4.828, Od. 19.210.
With infin.: μισγέμεναι κακότητι (in regard to..., so as not to ...) Od. 20.202.

defs: (1) Disgrace, reproach, blame, shame Il. 22.100, Il. 23.408: Od. 14.38.
(2) An occasion or cause thereof: ἐ. σοὶ αὐτῷ ἔσσεται Il. 23.342. Cf. Od. 21.255.
Deserving of reproach: Ἀργεῖοι; ἐλεγχέες Il. 4.242. Cf. Il. 24.239.
The most open of all men to reproach, the most deserving of blame or contempt Il. 2.285, Il. 4.171, Il. 17.26: Od. 10.72.

forms: An occasion or cause of disgrace, reproach, blame, shame: ἐ. ἔσσεται εἴ κεν ... Il. 11.314.
In pl. ἡμῖν ἂν ἐλέγχεα ταῦτα  γένοιτο Od. 21.329. Cf. Od. 21.333.
So of persons regarded as disgraces to their kind, things of shame: κάκʼ ἐλέγχεα Il. 2.235, Il. 5.787 = Il. 8.228. Cf. τὰ δ' ἐλέγχεα πάντα λέλειπται Il. 24.260.

defs: (1) To dishonour, bring to nought, make futile: μῦθον Il. 9.522.
(2) To bring shame on, do no credit to: σε Od. 21.424.

(1) That is a fitting object of pity, pitiable, piteous: νέκυν Il. 23.110. Cf. Il. 21.273: δάκρυον (caused by feelings worthy of pity) Od. 8.531, Od. 16.219. Cf. Od. 19.253. In comp. ἐλεεινότερος Il. 24.504. In superl. ἐλεεινότατος Od. 8.530.
(2) Moving or finding pity: φίλον ἐλθεῖν ἠδʼ ἐλεεινόν Il. 24.309: Od. 7.327.
(3) In neut. pl. ἐλεεινά as adv., in piteous wise Il. 2.314, Il. 22.37, 408.
Pitiful, compassionate Od. 5.191.
Compunction in using, sparing: οὔ τις ἐ. ἀλλοτρίων χαρίσασθαι Od. 17.451. Cf. Od. 14.82.

forms: To shake, cause to tremble Il. 1.530, Il. 8.199.
In pass., to shake, quiver, tremble: ἔγχος ἐλέλικτο Il. 13.558. Cf. Il. 22.448.
For ἐλέλιξε Il. 17.278: Od. 5.314; ἐλελιξάμενος Il. 2.316; ἐλελίχθη Od. 12.416, Od. 14.306; ἐλελίχθησαν Il. 5.497, Il. 7.106, Il. 11.214, Il. 17.343; ἐλέλικτο Il. 11.39, see ἑλίσσω.

defs: Marshbred, growing in marshy ground Il. 2.776.
Pity, compassion Il. 24.44.
A charger, platter Il. 9.215: Od. 14.432.
That can be seized or grasped: ἀνδρὸς ψυχή Il. 9.409.

forms: Free, not in bondage: ἐλεύθερον ἦμαρ (see ἦμαρ 4.d), κρητῆρα ἐλεύθερον (a bowl to celebrate deliverance) Il. 7.528.
To play a trick upon Il. 23.388.
Absol., to deceive. Of dreams Od. 19.565.
App., of Helike in Achaca, a seat of the worship of Poseidon Od. 3.404.

etym: [prob. (.) ελικ-, ἑλίσσω + ὦπα. Throwing the eyes round.]
forms: Thus, quick-glancing (as indicating liveliness or vivacity of disposition).
Epithet of the Achaeans Il. 1.389, Il. 3.190, 234, Il. 16.569 = Il. 17.274, Il. 24.402.

defs: An ornament of some kind in spiral form Il. 18.401.

etym: [prob. as ἕλιξ., with twisted or crumpled horns. Or poss. fr. (σ)ελ- as in σέλας, shining, sleek.]

forms: 3 sing. aor. subj. mid. ἑλίξεται Il. 17.728.
Genit. pl. masc. aor. pple. pass. ἑλιχθέντων Il. 12.74.

To these should no doubt be added (cf. under ἐλελίζω) 3 sing. aor. ἐ (ϝ)έλιξε (appearing in the MSS. as ἐλέλιξε) Il. 17.278: Od. 5.314; aor. pple. mid. (.)ελιξάμενος (ἐλελιξάμενος) Il. 2.316; 3 sing. aor. pass. ἐ̔ϝ̓ελίχθη (ἐλελίχθἠ Od. 12.416, Od. 14.306; 3 pl. ἐ̔ϝ̓ελίχθησαν (ἐλελίχθησαν) Il. 5.497, Il. 7.106, Il. 11.214, Il. 17.343, ἐ̔ϝ̓έλιχθεν (ἐλελιχθεν) Il. 7.109; pple. pl. (ϝ)ελιχθέντες (ἐλελιχθέντες) Il. 11.588.
defs: (1) To form in a spiral shape, twine: ἐλέλικτο δράκων Il. 11.39.
(2) To impart a circular motion to, cause to whirl Od. 5.314, Od. 12.416 = Od. 14.306.
(3) To bring (troops) to face the foe, rally (them) Il. 17.278. In pass., of troops, to rally: οἱ δ' ἐλελίχθησαν Il. 5.497 = Il. 7.106 = Il. 11.214 = Il. 17.343. Cf. Il. 7.109, Il. 11.588, Il. 12.74.
(4) Absol., to turn one's horses (round a mark): περὶ τέρμαθʼ ἑλισσέμεν Il. 23.309. Cf. Il. 23.466. In mid., to take the turn round a mark: ἐπὶ πολλὸν ἑλίσσεται (wheels wide) Il. 23.320.
(5) In mid., to turn oneself, turn to bay Il. 17.283, 728.
(6) In mid., to turn this way and that, go or betake oneself hither and thither: ἀνʼ ὅμιλον ἰὼν εἱλίσσετο Il. 12.49 (v.l. ἐλίσσετο (λίσσομαι)). Cf. Il. 12.408, 467, Il. 21.11.

(7) In mid. in various senses. To busy oneself Il. 18.372. Of a recumbent person, to turn (from side to side) Od. 20.24, 28. To swing one's body in preparation for a throw: ἧκε ἑλιξάμενος Il. 13.204 (or perh., whirling the thrown object in a circle). To twist oneself about in an effort to free oneself Il. 8.340. Of a snake, to coil itself Il. 22.95. To do this for a spring  Il. 2.316. Of the steam of sacrifice, to curl Il. 1.317. Of a thrown object, to spin Il. 23.846.
Trailing the πέπλος, with long flowing πέπλος. Epithet of Trojan women Il. 7.442 = Il. 22.105, Il. 6.297.
Trailing the χιτών, with long flowingχιτών·?̓ιάονες Il. 13.685.
(1) To drag away by force, carry off: ἑλκηθείσας θύγατρας Il. 22.62 (with at least a suggestion of ravishment).
(2) To pull at: νέκυν εἵλκεον Il. 17.395. To pull about, tear (a corpse) Il. 17.558, Il. 22.336.
(3) To lay violent hands upon: λητὼ ἕλκησε Od. 11.580 (cf. (1)).
A being dragged or carried away by force (cf. ἑλκέω 1) Il. 7.465.
To expose to dragging or pulling about Il. 23.187, Il. 24.21.

(1) To drag, haul or pull along or away: ἑλκομένας νυούς Il. 22.65 (with at least a suggestion of ravishment), ὥς θʼ ἡμίονοι ἕλκωσι δοκόν Il. 17.743. Cf. Il. 3.370, Il. 18.581, Od. 3.404, 405, Il. 22.465, Il. 24.52, 417: Od. 16.276, Od. 18.10, 12, 101, Od. 21.300. Of dragging the body of a foe from the fight Il. 4.465, Il. 13.383, Il. 17.126, 289, Il. 18.156, 176. Of so dragging the body of a friend Il. 11.258, 259. Of κήρ dragging off a body Il. 18.537. In pass., to drag or trail along: κάρη ἕλκεσθαι ἔασεν Il. 22.398. Cf. Il. 5.665, Il. 22.401, 464, Il. 24.15.
(2) To draw, pull, pluck, in a specified direction: ἐκζωστῆρος ὀϊστόν Il. 4.213. Cf. Il. 11.239, 398, 457, Il. 16.406, 409, 504. To pull at Il. 12.398, Il. 17.393.
(3) To draw down (a ship) in order to launch her Il. 2.152, 165 = 181, Il. 9.683, Il. 14.76, 97, 100, 106: Od. 3.153.
(4) Of mules, to draw (a waggon) Il. 24.324. Of horses, to draw (a charioteer) Il. 23.518. Of a charioteer, to draw (his chariot) Il. 23.533.
(5) To draw (a plough): νειοῖο ἄροτρον Il. 10.353 (genit. of space within which). Cf. Od. 13.32.
(6) To draw (a bow): ἕλκεν νευρὴν γλυφίδας τε Od. 21.419. Cf. Il. 4.122. In mid.: τόξον ἕλκετο Il. 11.583.
(7) To hoist (sails) Od. 2.426 = Od. 15.291.
(8) To draw up and poise (a balance) Il. 8.72, Il. 22.212.
(9) To apply force to: νῶτα ἑλκόμενα Il. 23.715.
(10) Fig., to bring on (a period of time): φάος ἠελίοιο ἕλκον νύκτα Il. 8.486.

(11) In mid., to draw (one's sword) Il. 1.194, 210. To pull out (one's hair) Il. 10.15, Il. 22.77. To draw (down the skin of the brows), [λέων] ἐπισκύνιον κάτω ἕλκεται Il. 17.136. To draw in (a seat) Od. 19.506.
A band for binding a corn-sheaf Il. 18.553.
The young of the deer, a fawn Od. 19.228.
A marsh-meadow Il. 4.483, Il. 15.631, Od. 3.221. Marshy ground Od. 14.474.

forms: 3 sing. plupf. ἐὠλπει Il. 19.328: Od. 20.328, Od. 21.96, Od. 24.313.
3 sing. impf. mid. ἐέλπετο Il. 12.407, Il. 13.609: Od. 23.345.
3 sing. pres. mid. ἐέλπεται Il. 10.105, Il. 13.813.
defs: (I) In pres. act., to rouse hopes in, cause to hope: πάντας ἔλπει Od. 2.91 = Od. 13.380.
In pf. and plupf. and in mid.

forms: With fut. infin.: ὑπάλυξιν ἔσεσθαι Od. 23.287.
With aor. infin.: φίλους ἰδέειν Od. 7.314 = Od. 6.76. Cf. Od. 2.280.

defs: An object of prey or of spoiling: ἀνδράσι δυσμενέεσσιν ἑ. καὶ κύρμα Il. 5.488. Cf. Il. 5.684, Il. 17.151, 667: οἰωνοῖσιν Od. 3.271. Cf. Od. 5.473, Od. 13.208, Od. 24.292. In pl.: Πατρόκλοιο ἕλωρα ἀποτείσῃ Il. 18.93 (pay the penalty for the spoiling of ...).
By stepping, i.e. by land: ἐ. ἵξεσθαι πατρίδα γαῖαν Il. 15.505.

forms: Acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. ἐμβεβαῶτα Il. 5.199.
defs: (1) With dat., to  step upon, put one's foot upon: ἐλάφῳ Od. 10.164. To step upon, put the feet upon in passing over: νεκροῖς Il. 10.493. To go on board of, embark upon (a ship): νηΐ πύλονδε (embarked for . . .) Od. 4.656. Absol.: πολέες ἔμβαινον (app., sailed therein) Il. 2.619.
(2) To enter the fray, intervene Il. 16.94.
(3) App., to push on, make a spurt Il. 23.403.

(4) In pf. and plupf. of the state or condition of having gone upon something: ἐρέται πεντήκοντα ἐμβέβασαν (were on board, formed the complement) Il. 2.720, ἵπποισιν καὶ ἅρμασιν ἐμβεβαῶτα (mounted upon, driving) Il. 5.199. So μολυβδαίνη κατὰ βοὸς κέρας ἐμβεβαυῖα (mounted upon it) Il. 24.81.
(1) To throw into something Il. 6.188. To throw into. With dat.: πόντῳ με Il. 14.258. Cf. Il. 13.320, Il. 15.598, Il. 16.122: Od. 5.431, Od. 7.116, Od. 12.415 = Od. 14.305.
(2) To throw upon something or someone: ῥήγεα ἐμβαλέειν Il. 24.645: = Od. 4.298 = Od. 6.337. Cf. Il. 12.383: Od. 23.179. To throw upon. With dat.: ἵππους πυρῇ Il. 23.172. Cf. Il. 23.174.
(3) With dat., to put or place in: ἱμάντα χερσίν Il. 14.218. Cf. Od. 1.438, Od. 2.37, Od. 18.103. To cause to be in or to fall into: βροτοῦ σʼ ἀνέρος εὐνῇ Il. 18.85, χερσίν μιν Ἀχιλλῆος Il. 21.47.

(4) In reference to mental or physical states, to inspire, induce, bring about, suggest in. With dat.: φόβον σφιν Il. 17.118. Cf. Il. 3.139, Il. 4.444, Il. 10.366, Il. 11.11, Il. 13.82, Il. 14.151, Il. 16.529, Il. 19.88: ὀδύνας θυμῷ Od. 2.79. Cf. Od. 19.485 = Od. 23.260. Sim.: τόδʼ ἐνὶ φρεσίν Od. 19.10. Without case Il. 21.304.
(5) App., to throw oneself upon, ply. With dat.: ἐμβαλέειν κώπῃς Od. 9.489 = Od. 10.129.

(6) In mid., with dat., to take into (one's mind), flatter oneself with the idea of: μὴ φύξιν ἐμβάλλεο θυμῷ Il. 10.447. To lay to (one's heart), bear in mind the need for: μῆτιν ἐμβάλλεο θυμῷ Il. 23.313.

forms: To rule or hold sway in a place Il. 2.572.
To rule or hold sway in.
acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. ἐμβαίνω.
In mid., of the wind, to roar in.

defs: The young of an animal Od. 9.245 = 309 = 342.

forms: Pron. of the 1st person sing., me: ἐμοὶ γέρας ἑτοιμάσατε Il. 1.118, νεωτέρω ἐμεῖο 259, ἐμεῦ ἀπονόσφιν 541, καμέτην μοι ἵπποι Il. 4.27, μή με κάθιζε Il. 7.360, ἔμʼ ἄμμορον 408, etc.
Strengthened by γε: ἐμέ γε, ἔμεγε Il. 9.315, etc.: Od. 5.99, etc.– ἐμοί γε, ἔμοιγε Il. 1.174, 295, etc.: Od. 3.227, Od. 4.538, etc.

defs: To vomit, throw up Il. 15.11.
(1) With eager haste, speed, alacrity, zeal: ἐμμεμαὼς ἐπόρουσεν Od. 3.284, 442. Cf. Il. 5.142, 240, 330, 838, Il. 13.785, Il. 17.735, 746, Il. 22.143: Od. 23.127.
(2) Adjectivally, of fiery disposition, fierce Od. 3.468.
Only in neut. ἐμμενές as adv., without intermission, continuously, strengthening αἰεί: Il. 10.361, 364, Il. 13.517: Od. 9.386, Od. 21.69.
Having a share of, endued with: τιμῆς Od. 8.480.

forms: With the article: τὸν ἐμὸν χόλον Il. 4.42. Cf. Il. 7.523, etc.: Od. 2.97, Od. 11.452, etc.
Absol.: οὐκ ἐμὸν παλινάγρετον (nothing of mine) Il. 1.526.
As predicative adj., mine: ἵππον δώσω ἐμήν περ ἐοῦσαν Il. 23.610: εἰ ἐμός ἐσσι Od. 16.300. Cf. Il. 6.191.

defs: (1) To care about, regard, concern oneself with, pay attention to. With genit.: θεοπροπίης Il. 16.50: ξείνων Od. 19.134. Cf. Od. 1.271, 305, 415, Od. 2.201, Od. 17.488, Od. 20.275, 384.
(2) To receive (a sacrifice). With genit.: ἱρῶν Od. 9.553.
(3) To hold in due honour, respect: ἱκέτας Od. 16.422.

forms: App., expert in, possessed of: οὐδʼ ἔργων ἔμπαιον?̓̔ οὐδὲ βίης Od. 20.379, κακῶν Od. 21.400.
In weaving, to insert representations of in a web: ἐνέπασσεν ἀέθλους (sc. ἱστᾦ Il. 3.126.

etym: [ἐμ-, ἐν- 3 + πεδ-, ποδ-, πούς. Firm on the feet. Cf. ἠπεδανός.]
defs: (1) Standing firmly in place, not overthrown, intact: τεῖχος Il. 12.9, 12.
(2) Maintained in place, steady: ἔμπεδον ἔχων σάκος Il. 16.107. Cf. Il. 16.520. In place, not displaced Il. 10.94: Od. 23.203.

(3) Safe, intact Od. 2.227, Od. 11.178, Od. 19.525. Not decayed, fresh: χρώς Il. 19.33, 39. Unimpaired, retaining vigour: βίη Il. 4.314, Il. 6.157 = Il. 11.670, Il. 23.629. Cf. Il. 5.254, Il. 11.813, Il. 13.512, Il. 23.627:  Od. 10.240, 493, Od. 11.393, Od. 14.468, 503, Od. 19.493, Od. 21.426, Od. 22.226. Unimpaired in mind Od. 3.183. Well-balanced: φρένες Il. 7.352: Od. 18.215.
(4) Maintained with ceaseless vigilance: φυλακή Il. 8.521.
(5) Secured, not liable to confiscation: γέρα Il. 9.335.
(6) Assured, certain, never failing: κομιδή Od. 8.453. Assured, to be looked forward to with certainty: πομπήν Od. 8.30. In unfailing succession Od. 19.113.
(7) Affording sure testimony, unmistakable: σήματα Od. 19.250 = Od. 23.206, Od. 24.346.
(8) In neut. ἔμπεδον as adv.

(b) Without intermission or break, continuously Il. 12.281: Od. 6.259. Continually: ἐπαΐξασκεν Il. 18.158. With steady course, without break or stop Il. 22.192. With steady or undeviating course Il. 13.141, Il. 23.641, 642: Od. 13.86.
(c) App., without hesitation or uncertainty: ἄλλοτʼ ἐπʼ ἄλλον ἀμείβεται Il. 15.683.
(1) In any case: νῦν δʼ ἐ. γὰρ κῆρες ἐφεστᾶσιν (but as it is, since in any case . . .) Il. 12.326, τλήσομαι ἐ. (on that I am resolved) Il. 19.308. Cf. Il. 24.522 (in spite of our hearts).

(2) For certain, for sure: οὔ τινα δείδιμεν ἐ. Il. 6.196: Od. 2.199. Cf. Od. 15.214, Od. 24.324. Introducing a statement of something remarkable, of a surety Od. 19.37. Derisively, really now Od. 18.354. Nay even: ἐ. δέ τοι ὅρκια δώσω (I will not hesitate to . . .) Od. 19.302.

(3) Adversatively, nevertheless, notwithstanding, all the same, still: πρῆξαι δʼ ἐ. οὔ τι δυνήσεαι Il. 1.562. Cf. Il. 5.191, Il. 8.33 = 464, Il. 14.174 (though it was in the palace of Zeus that it was stirred), Il. 17.632: Od. 2.191, Od. 3.209, Od. 4.100, Od. 7.190, Od. 11.351, Od. 14.214, 481 (even without the χλαῖνἀ, Od. 16.147, Od. 18.12, Od. 20.311, Od. 23.83. Strengthened by καί Il. 2.297, Il. 19.422: Od. 5.205.

(4) In ppl. construction with περ, though, even though: χατέουσί περ ἐ. (in need though they be) Il. 9.518, ἐπικρατέουσί περ ἐ. (though as it is they are the victors) Il. 14.98. Cf. Il. 14.1, Il. 15.399, Il. 17.229: Od. 15.361, Od. 18.165, Od. 19.356.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. ἐμπλήσατο Il. 22.312: Od. 9.296.
defs: (1) To fill (a receptacle or the like) by pouring or putting something into it: ἓν δέπας Od. 9.209. Cf. Od. 2.353, Od. 17.503, Od. 23.358. With a liquid as subject: αἷμα κόλπον ἐνέπλησεν Od. 3.471. With genit. of material: ἐμπίπληθι ῥέεθρα ὕδατος Il. 21.311. Cf. Od. 8.495, Od. 9.212, Od. 18.45. Sim.: πυρὴν ἐμπλησέμεν ἐσθλῶν (to heap it with . . .) Od. 10.523 = Od. 11.31. Fig.: μή μοι θυμὸν ἐνιπλήσῃς ὀδυνάων Od. 19.117.
(2) In mid., to fill one's . . .: ἐπεὶ ἐμπλήσατο νηδύν Od. 9.296. Fig., with genit.: μένεος ἐμπλήσατο θυμόν Il. 22.312. Cf. Il. 22.504.

(3) In pass., to be filled, be full, be stuffed: γαστὴρ ἐνιπλησθῆναι ἀνώγει Od. 6.221. With genit.: ἐνέπλησθεν αἵματος ὀφθαλμοί Il. 16.348, πόλις ἔμπλητο ἀλέντων Il. 21.607. Cf. Od. 8.16. Fig.: υἶος ἐνιπλησθῆναι (to have my fill of looking upon him) Od. 11.452.

(1) To fall into. With dat.: πέτρῃ (i.e. into a cleft) Il. 4.108: πόντῳ Od. 4.508, Od. 5.318. Of an arrow, to fall into, enter, strike. With dat.: αὐχένι Il. 15.451. Sim.: ὅθʼ ἔμπεσʼ ὀϊστός Il. 4.217. Of fire, to be flung into. With dat.: νηυσίν Il. 16.113. Of a feeling, to enter into, come upon. With dat.: χόλος θυμῷ Il. 9.436, Il. 14.207 = 306, Il. 16.206. Cf. Il. 17.625. To come into (the mind), recur to one. With dat.: ἔπος θυμῷ Od. 12.266.
(2) To fall on to. With dat.: πόντῳ (lighted on it) Od. 5.50.
(3) To attack, make an attack Il. 16.81. Of fire, to fall upon. With dat.: ὅτε πῦρ ἐμπέσῃ ὕλῃ Il. 11.155–Sim.: κακὸν οἴκῳ Od. 2.45, Od. 15.375.

forms: Also ἐνίπλειος Od. 14.113, Od. 17.300, Od. 19.580, Od. 21.78.
With genit., filled with, full of: οἴνου Od. 14.113. Cf. Od. 18.119, Od. 19.580 = Od. 21.78, Od. 20.26, Od. 22.3.

defs: In striking wise, mightily: ἐ. ἕτερόν γε τίει Od. 20.132.
Near or close to. With genit.: βοιωτῶν ἐ. Il. 2.526.

forms: Dual pple. in form ἐμπνείοντε Il. 17.502.
3 sing. aor. ἐνέπνευσε Il. 17.456: Od. 9.381, Od. 19.138. ἔμπνευσε Il. 10.482, Il. 15.262, Od. 3.110: Od. 24.520.
defs: (1) To breathe upon. With dat.: μεταφρένῳ Il. 17.502.

(2) To breathe into one, inspire him with: μένος Il. 15.60. Cf. Od. 9.381, Od. 24.520. To breathe into. With dat.: τῷ μένος Il. 10.482. Cf. Il. 15.262 = Od. 3.110, Il. 17.456. To put into (one's mind), suggest. With dat. and infin.: φᾶρός μοι ἐνέπνευσε φρεσὶν ὑφαίνειν Od. 19.138.

etym: [Prob. ἐμ-, ἐν- 6 + πνυ-. See πέπνυμαι. In the MSS. ἀμπνὕν̓θη, ἄμπνυτο (ἀμ-, ἀνα- 4).]
forms: 3 sing. sing. aor. pass. Il. 5.697, Il. 14.436. Also ἔμπνυτο Il. 11.359, Il. 22.475: Od. 5.458, Od. 24.349.
defs: To come to after a faint: ἐμπνύνθη καὶ ἀνέδρακεν ὀφθαλμοῖσιν Il. 14.436. Cf. Il. 5.697, Il. 11.359, Il. 22.475: Od. 5.458, Od. 24.349.

forms: To make or construct (in something): ἐν πύργοισι πύλας ἐνεποίεον Il. 6.438.

defs: To get by trafficking: βίοτον πολύν Od. 15.456.

forms: One who travels in a ship belonging to another, a passenger Od. 2.319, Od. 24.300.
Infin. ἐμπρήσειν Il. 9.242. ἐνιπρήσειν Il. 12.198, Il. 15.702.

To destroy by fire, burn: πυρὶ νῆας Il. 8.182, νῆας πυρός (genit. of material) Il. 9.242. Cf. Il. 8.217, 235, Il. 9.589, Il. 12.198, Il. 13.319, Il. 14.47, Il. 15.417, 507, 702, Il. 16.82, Il. 22.374.

defs: Made to go or stand upon the fire: τρίποδα Il. 23.702.

forms: In pass., to be borne or carried about in.
With dat.: κύμασιν ἐμφορέοντο Od. 12.419 = Od. 14.309.

defs: Of one's own tribe: ἄνδρα Od. 15.273.
(1) In aor., to implant or inspire knowledge of Od. 22.348.
(2) In pf., to grow or be upon. With dat.: ὅθι τρίχες κρανίῳ ἐμπεφύασιν Il. 8.84. To cling closely Il. 1.513.
(I) Adv.
(II) Prep. with dat. (ἐνί with anastrophe when immediately following the case-form).

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. ἐνήρατο Il. 5.43, 59, Il. 7.32, Il. 14.515: Od. 24.424. (κατ-.)
defs: (2) To kill in the chase: θῆρας Il. 21.485.
(3) In weakened sense, to mar, impair. In mid.: μηκέτι χρόα ἐναίρεο Od. 19.263.
(2) Bringing omens, charged with fate: ὄρνιθες Od. 2.182. Boding well: σήματα Il. 2.353. Absol. in neut. pl., omens Od. 2.159.

Like, resembling, in the likeness of. With dat.: ὄρνιθι Il. 14.290, θεῷ αὐδήν (in . . .) Il. 19.250. Cf. Il. 5.5, Il. 13.242, Il. 17.583: ἀθανάτοις Od. 6.5, θεοῖς ἐναλίγκια μήδεα (like those of the gods) Od. 13.89. Cf. Od. 1.371 = Od. 9.4, Od. 2.5 = Od. 4.310, Od. 16.209, 273 = Od. 17.202 = Od. 24.157, Od. 17.337, Od. 19.267, Od. 24.148, 371. In neut. in impers. construction: τῷ ἔην ἐναλίγκιον, ὡς εἰ . . ., it was like the case or state of things as [it would be] if . . ., it was as if . . . Il. 22.410.

forms: With dat.: γαυλοί, τοῖς ἐνάμελγεν Od. 9.223.

defs: In neut. sing. ἐναντίβιον as adv., face to face, man to man: ἐ. μαχέσασθαι Il. 8.168, 255, Il. 22.223, ὅτε κέν τις ἐ. θεὸς ἔλθῃ (in open hostility) Od. 3.130, στῆναι ἐ. (to face the danger) Il. 21.266. Cf. Il. 10.451, Il. 15.179, Il. 17.490, Il. 21.477: Od. 14.270, Od. 17.439. With genit.: Ἀχιλῆος Od. 3.85.

(1) Opposite, facing: ἔστησαν Od. 10.391. Cf. Il. 7.247. With genit.: ἕζετʼ Ὀδυσῆος ἐναντίη Od. 23.89. With dat.: οἱ Il. 9.190, ἀλλήλοισιν (i.e. beginning at either end of the line and meeting in the middle) Il. 11.67. Cf. Od. 10.89. Face to face Od. 7.329. In hostile sense, opposite, facing. With genit.: Ἀχαιῶν Il. 5.497 = Il. 7.106 = Il. 11.214 = Il. 17.343.

(2) Meeting, in order to meet, join, encounter or intercept a person, etc.: ἐναντίη ἦλθε Il. 7.394, Il. 15.88. Cf. Od. 13.226. With genit.: ἐ. ἤλυθεν ἵππων Il. 15.454. With dat.: ἐναντίη οἱ ἤλυθεν Il. 7.251. Sim.: πόριες σκαίρουσιν ἐναντίαι (come frisking to meet their mothers) Od. 10.412. In hostile sense. With dat.: ἐναντίω οἱ ὁρμηθήτην Il. 5.12.
(3) In neut. sing. ἐναντίον as adv.
(b) In order to meet or join. With genit.: ἐ. ἤλυθον ἵππων Od. 14.278. Sim.: τὸν ξεῖνον ἐ. κάλεσσον Od. 17.544. In hostile sense. With genit.: θηρητῆρος Il. 21.574.
(2) Booty or spoil in general: φόρμιγγα ἄρετʼ ἐξ ἐνάρων Il. 9.188.

forms: Nom. sing. neut. pf. pple. ἐναρηρός.
defs: To be fitted into its place Od. 5.236.
(1) In visible presence: χαλεποὶ θεοὶ φαίνεσθαι ἐναργεῖς (in respect of their appearing . . ., when they appear . . .) Od. 3.131: Ἀθήνην, ἥ μοι ἐ. ἦλθεν Od. 3.420. Cf. Od. 6.201, Od. 16.161.
(2) Clear or plain to the mind's eye: ὄνειρον Od. 4.841.

forms: nom. sing. neut. pf. pple. ἐναραρίσκω.

defs: (1) To strip (a slain foe) of his armour and trappings Il. 5.844.
(2) With double acc. of the spoil and of the person despoiled: τοὺς ἐνάριζον ἀπʼ ἔντεα Il. 12.195, Il. 15.343. Cf. Il. 17.187, Il. 22.323.
(4) To kill or slay in gen. Il. 1.191.
(1) Reckoned in the number, counted Il. 2.202.
(2) Making up the number, completing the tale Od. 12.65.
The ninth: μήτηρ ἐνάτη ἦν Il. 2.313 = 327.

etym: [app. ἐν- 1 + αὐλός. Cf. sense (3) thereof. A hollow in . . ..]
defs: (1) A torrentbed, a gully Il. 16.71.
(2) A torrent Il. 21.283, 312.
In mid., to open one's mind, declare oneself Il. 19.83.

forms: Eleven cubits long: ἔγχος Il. 7.319 = Il. 8.494.

defs: (2) ἑνδεκάτη (sc. ἡμέρη), the eleventh day: ἑνδεκάτῃ (on the eleventh day) Il. 24.666: ἑνδεκάτη τε δυωδεκάτη τε Od. 2.374, Od. 4.588.
(1) App., on the right hand of a spectator (i.e. in the lucky quarter): ἐνδέξια σήματα φαίνων Il. 9.236.
(2) In neut. pl. ἐνδέξια as adv., (passing round) from left to right (i.e. in the sun's, or the lucky, direction): ἐ. οἰνοχόει Il. 1.597. Cf. Il. 6.184: Od. 17.365.
(1) To bend or tie on to something: νευρήν, ἣν ἐνέδησα Il. 15.469. To secure or tie in something: ὑπέρας ἐν αὐτῇ (sc. ἐν νηἴ Od. 5.260.
(2) Fig., to entangle or involve in. With dat.: ἄτῃ με Il. 2.111 = Il. 9.18.
To tar on, set on (dogs) Il. 18.584.

forms: App., the inward parts of the body Il. 23.806.
At mid-day: ἐ. ἦλθεν Od. 4.450. Cf. Il. 11.726.

defs: (1) From within: ὑπακοῦσαι Od. 4.283. Cf. Od. 20.101.
(2) Within: Ζηνὸς τοιήδε ἐ. αὐλή Od. 4.74. With genit.: αὐλῆς Il. 7.247, Il. 24.161.
(3) Within one, in one's breast: εἴ οἱ κραδίη σιδηρέη ἐ. ἦεν Od. 4.293. Cf. Od. 4.467.
(1) Within Od. 3.271, Il. 23.819: Od. 4.678. With genit.: πύργων Il. 18.287.
(2) Within, in the house, in one's house, at home: τὴν ἐ. τέτμεν ἐοῦσαν Od. 5.58. Cf. Il. 7.498: Od. 22.220.
(3) Within one, in one's breast: ἐ. θυμὸν ἀμύξεις Il. 1.243. Cf. Il. 22.242: Od. 2.315, Od. 8.577, Od. 19.377, Od. 24.474.

(1) Within: ἐγκέφαλος ἐ. πεπάλακτο Il. 11.98 = Il. 12.186 = Od. 3.400. Cf. Il. 12.142, Il. 21.362: ἐ. τις ἀοιδιάει Od. 10.226. Cf. Od. 21.237 = 383 (in the μέγαρον̓, Od. 22.179 (in the θάλαμος). With genit.: Διὸς [δώματος] ἐ. Od. 3.13. Cf. Il. 23.200.

(2) Within, in the house, in one's house, at home: οὐκ ἐ. τέτμεν ἄκοιτιν Il. 7.374, δεινή μοι θεὸς ἐ. [ἐστίν] Il. 18.394. Cf. Il. 10.378, Il. 11.767, 771, Il. 19.320, Il. 22.50: Od. 5.61, 81, Od. 7.51, Od. 6.166, Od. 9.216, 232, Od. 10.221, Od. 14.407, Od. 15.77 = 94, Od. 16.254, Od. 19.40, 321, Od. 20.40, Od. 21.178 = 183, Od. 23.38. Sim., app.: καβησόθεν ἐ. ἐόντα (who had come to the city from . . .) Il. 13.363. Cf. Il. 15.438.
(3) Returned from a journey or from travels: ἄλλοθεν ἐ. ἐόντα Od. 16.26. Cf. Od. 16.202, 301, 355, 462, Od. 19.477, Od. 21.207, Od. 23.2, 29, 71.
(4) Within one, in one's breast: κραδίη ἐ. ὑλάκτει Od. 20.13, 16. Cf. Od. 11.337  =  Od. 18.249, Od. 14.178, Od. 24.382.
(5) In the usual place, where one would expect to find a thing: ἐ., ὀΐομαι, [τεύχεά ἐστιν] Od. 22.140.

forms: To make a splash or thud in falling into.
With dat.: μέσσῳ ἐνδούπησα Od. 12.443, ἄντλῳ ἐνδούπησε πεσοῦσα Od. 15.479.

defs: (1) Kindly, in gentle wise, with care for one's well-being: ἔτραφέ με Il. 23.90, ἱκέτεω πεφιδήσεται Il. 24.158 = 187. Cf. Il. 24.438: Od. 6.256, Od. 10.65, 450, Od. 14.62, 337, Od. 15.305, 491, 543 = Od. 17.56, Od. 17.111, 113, Od. 19.195 = Od. 24.272,  Od. 24.212, 390.
(2) App., with kindly or grateful feelings: κρέʼ ἤσθιεν Od. 14.109.

forms: Fem. aor. pple. ἐνδῦσα Il. 5.736, Il. 8.387.
To get into, put on (clothes): χιτῶνα Il. 2.42, Il. 5.736 = Il. 8.387, Il. 10.21, 131.
3 sing. impf. ἐνῆεν Il. 1.593. ἐνέην Od. 9.164, Od. 19.443.
defs: (1) To be or exist in a specified or indicated place, to be or exist in some person or thing: ὀλίγος ἔτι θυμὸς ἐνῆεν Il. 1.593, οὐκ οἴκοι ἔνεστι γόος; Il. 24.240. Cf. Il. 5.477, Il. 7.244: Od. 19.443, Od. 21.12, 60.
(2) To be or exist in. With dat.: εἰ Τρώεσσι μένος ἐνείη Il. 17.156. Cf. Il. 2.490: Od. 10.45.
(3) To be available in an indicated place: ἐνέην [οἶνος] Od. 9.164.
(1) On account of, because of, for.

(b) Of objects: εἵνεκα κούρης (to fetch . . .) Il. 1.336, σεῦ ἕνεκα Il. 3.206, ἕνεχʼ ἵππων Il. 5.640. Cf. Il. 2.138, Il. 3.290, Il. 9.327, 560, Il. 17.92, Il. 18.171, etc.: σῆς μητέρος εἵνεκα (in the course of their suit) Od. 3.212, εἵνεκα πατρός (in quest of . . .) Od. 4.672, εἵνεκα πομπῆς (seeking . . .) Od. 8.33, εἵνεκα κούρης (as her bride-price) 319. Cf. Od. 13.263, Od. 14.70, Od. 16.334, Od. 19.413, Od. 21.155, etc.

(2) For the sake of, to do pleasure or service to: ἕνεκα θνητῶν Il. 1.574. Cf. Il. 1.174, Il. 8.428, Il. 10.27, Il. 16.539, Il. 21.380, 463, Il. 22.236, Il. 23.608, Il. 24.501: ὑῶν ἕνεκα (in care of them) Od. 14.416, ἕνεκα γαστρός (to satisfy it) Od. 15.344. Cf. Od. 4.170, Od. 8.544, Od. 17.288, Od. 19.377.
To press or thrust into. With dat.: μοχλὸν ὀφθαλμῷ Od. 9.383.

forms: App. on the analogy of ὕπερθε.]
defs: (1) Beneath, below: νέρθε ποσσὶν ἤϊεν Il. 6.212 (the feet being contrasted with the face), θώρηκος ἔνερθε (app., below on the . . . , taking the genit. as partitive) Il. 11.234. Cf. Il. 11.282, 535 = Od. 3.500, Il. 13.75, 78, Il. 16.347, Od. 3.57, Il. 22.452: Od. 9.385, Od. 13.163, Od. 20.352. With genit.: ἀγκῶνος ἔνερθε Il. 11.252. Cf. Il. 8.16, Il. 14.204: Od. 11.302.
(2) Adjectivally: οἱ ἔνερθε θεοί Il. 14.274.
Those beneath the earth, the dwellers below Il. 15.188, Od. 3.61.

forms: App. on the analogy of ὑπέρ-τερος.]
defs: (1) Lower than, beneath, below. With genit.: ἐ. οὐρανιώνων Il. 5.898.
(2) That is beneath or below: θεοί Il. 15.225.

etym: [ἐνετός, verbal adj. of ἐνίημι. What is sent or thrust in.]

defs: (1) To sleep in or upon something Od. 3.350.
(2) To sleep in or upon. With dat.: χλαῖναν καὶ κώεα τοῖσιν ἐνεῦδεν Od. 20.95.
In or on the bed: αὐτοῦ ἐνεύναιον (sc. δέρμα) (his own bedcovering) Od. 14.51. Absol., app., a sleeper: χήτει ἐνευναίων Od. 16.35.
The quality of being ἐνηής: ἐνηείης τις πατροκλῆος μνησάσθω Il. 17.670.

forms: App., gentle, amiable, kindly disposed or the like: ἑταῖρον Il. 17.204, Il. 21.96, μέμνησαί μευ ἐνηέος (as being kindly disposed to you) Il. 23.648. Cf. Il. 23.252: Od. 8.200.
To be seated in a specified place: ἵνʼ ἐνήμεθα Od. 4.272.
A form difficult to explain. Most MSS. read ἀνήνοθε (q.v.).

defs: (2) Thither, there: ἢν ἐ. ἀφίκηαι Il. 8.482. Cf. Il. 7.318, Il. 13.23, Il. 14.169, etc.: Od. 1.427, Od. 3.297, Od. 4.8, 407, etc.–ἐ. . . . ἐ., hither . . . thither, in this direction . . . in that Il. 2.90, 397, 462, Il. 5.223, Il. 10.264 (in rows), Il. 18.543 (up and down the field), Il. 23.164 (a hundred feet square), 320 (to right and left), etc.: Od. 2.213 (thither and back again), Od. 5.327, Od. 6.86 (lengthwise and breadth-wise), Od. 10.517 (a cubit square), Od. 14.11, Od. 19.524, Od. 20.24, etc.
(4) Whither: ἐς τροίην, ἐ. περ ἔβαν Od. 1.210. To where: βὰν δʼ ἴμεν ἐ. . . . Il. 13.789. Cf. Il. 4.247, Il. 24.733.

(1) Thence: τὸν ἐ. ῥυσάμην Il. 15.29. Cf. Il. 6.472, Il. 10.179, Il. 11.725, Od. 3.191, etc.: Od. 2.329, Od. 7.7, Od. 9.62, Od. 12.211, 447, etc. In reference to seeing: ἐ. ἐφαίνετʼ?̓́ιδη Il. 13.13. Cf. Od. 12.230. To birth: γένος μοι ἐ. ὅθεν σοί Il. 4.58. To taking up a lay from a specified point: ἐ. ἑλὼν ὡς . . . (from the point where . . .) Od. 8.500.
(2) ἐ . . . ἑτέρωθι . . ., on one side . . . on the other . . . Od. 12.235.
(4) Then, thereupon: ἐ. ἂν ἐπιφρασσαίμεθα βουλήν Il. 13.741. Sim.: ἐ. πέτραι ἐπηρεφέες (then come . . .) Od. 12.59.

forms: From here, hence: ἐ. χρυσὸν ἄξομαι Il. 9.365. Cf. Il. 8.527: Od. 11.69.

defs: (1) To leap into: μέσσῳ Il. 21.233, πόντῳ Il. 24.79.
(2) To leap in among: ὁμίλῳ Il. 15.623.
(3) To leap against: λὰξ ἔνθορεν ἰσχίῳ (i.e. kicked it) Od. 17.233.
Taken to heart Od. 13.421 (a subject of anxiety).

There is (are) therein (thereon). With or without dat.: φρένες οὐκ ἔνι Il. 23.104. Cf. Il. 14.141, 216, Il. 18.53, Od. 3.248: ᾧ ἔνι λωτός Od. 4.603, οὔ οἱ ἔνι τρίχες Od. 18.355. Cf. Od. 4.846, Od. 9.126, Od. 11.367, Od. 21.288.
A year old: σῦν Od. 16.454.

etym: [prob. the time when the heavens are again ἐνὶ αὐτῷ, in the same position, and thus properly rather an epoch than a period.]
defs: (1) Considered as a point or unit of time or as one of a series: ἐννέα βεβάασιν Il. 2.134, δεκάτῳ Il. 12.15 (at the tenth turn of the year, at the end of the tenth year). Cf. Il. 2.295, 551: ὅτʼ ἐ. ἔην (when the turn of the year had come) Od. 10.469. Cf. Od. 1.16, Od. 2.175, Od. 3.391, Od. 11.248, Od. 16.18, Od. 17.327.

(2) Considered as a space of time: ἐς δεκάτους ἐνιαυτούς Il. 8.404 = 418 (see δέκατος 1), πέντε ὲνιαυτούς Il. 23.833. Cf. Il. 19.32, Il. 21.444: τλαίης (τλαίην̓ ἂν ἐνιαυτόν (for a year) Od. 1.288, Od. 2.219. Cf. Od. 4.86, 526, 595, Od. 10.467, Od. 11.356, Od. 14.196, 292, Od. 15.230, 455.
(1) To pass the night in a specified place: ἔνθʼ ἀνὴρ ὲνίαυεν Od. 9.187.
(2) To pass the night among. With dat.: ὕεσσιν Od. 15.557.

(1) To put or throw into a vessel: [φάρμακον] Od. 4.233. To send or throw into. With dat.: νηυσὶ πῦρ Il. 12.441. To send forward into the fight Il. 14.131. To send (in order to make up a number): ἄλλην ἐνίησιν ἐναρίθμιον εἶναι Od. 12.65.
(2) To launch one's ship into (the sea) put to (sea). With dat.: ἐνήσομεν πόντῳ Od. 2.295. Cf. Od. 12.293, 401.
(3) With dat., to set (a person) upon, incline (him) to: ἀγηνορίῃσιν Il. 9.700. To involve in, bring within the compass of: πόνοισιν Il. 10.89: ὁμοφροσύνῃσιν (will incline us to . . .) Od. 15.198.
(4) To inspire: μένος Il. 19.37. Cf. Il. 17.570: Od. 13.387. To inspire or cause in. With dat.: τοῖσιν κότον Il. 16.449. Cf. Il. 16.656, Od. 3.80, Il. 23.390.
To thwart, frustrate Il. 8.408, 422.

(1) Rebuke or reproach as felt by the person rebuked or reproached: ἀποθέσθαι ἐνιπήν Il. 5.492. An instance of this, a rebuke or reproach so considered: αἰδεσθεὶς βασιλῆος ἐνιπήν Il. 4.402. Cf. Il. 14.104: Od. 10.448.
(2) Abuse, contumely Od. 20.266.
(3) App., a threat: φεύγων ποσειδάωνος ἐνιπάς Od. 5.446.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. pple. ἐνιπλήξαντες Il. 15.344.
To fall into, get into, get caught or entangled in.
With dat.: τάφρῳ Il. 12.72, Il. 15.344: ἕρκει Od. 22.469.

etym: [ἐνι-, ἐν- 1, ἐν- 3 + σκίμπτω = σκήπτω. See σκήπτομαι.]
forms: 3 sing. aor. pass. ἐνισκίμφθη Il. 16.612, Il. 17.528.
defs: (1) To fix or stick in. With dat.: δόρυ οὔδει ἐνισκίμφθη Il. 16.612 = Il. 17.528.
(2) To cause or allow to rest upon. With dat.: οὔδει ἐνισκίμψαντε καρήατε Il. 17.437.
(1) [= ἐνίπτω]. θυγατέρεσσίν τε καὶ υἱάσι βέλτερον εἴη ἐνισσέμεν [αὐτούς] (it is better for them that he should scold them, i.e. it is better that he should scold them) Il. 15.198.
Of the value of nine oxen. Absol. Il. 7.236.

forms: Nine cubits long or in extent: ζυγόδεσμον Il. 24.270: ἐννεαπήχεες εὖρος (in . . .) Od. 11.311.

defs: Nine thousand Il. 5.860 = Il. 14.148.
Nine fathoms in extent: μῆκος ἐννεόργυιοι (in . . .) Od. 11.312.

forms: Fut. ἐνισπήσω (ἐνι-, ἐν?) Od. 5.98. ἐνίψω Od. 2.137.
Imp. pl. ἔσπετε (prob. for ἔνσπετἐ Il. 2.484, Il. 11.218, Il. 14.508, Il. 16.112.
defs: (1) To say, tell, tell of or about, communicate, make known: τὸν ὄνειρον Il. 2.80. Cf. Il. 6.447, Il. 8.412, Il. 11.186, 839, Il. 14.107, Il. 24.388: κείνου ὄλεθρον Od. 3.93 = Od. 4.323. Cf. Od. 2.137, Od. 4.314, 317, Od. 5.98, Od. 9.37, Od. 11.492, Od. 12.112, Od. 14.185, Od. 17.549, 556, 561, Od. 24.414. To tell about, tell the tale of (a person) Od. 1.1.
(2) With dependent clause, to say, tell: οἵ τινες . . . Il. 2.484, ὅππως . . . Il. 16.112. Cf. Il. 2.761, Il. 11.218, Il. 14.508: Od. 8.101, 251, Od. 22.166, Od. 23.35.
(3) Absol.
(b) To talk, hold converse: πρὸς ἀλλήλους Il. 11.643: Od. 23.301 (exchanging tales).

etym: [ἐνίημι. For ἐνεσίη, which could not stand in the hexameter.]

defs: (1) Nine years old, at nine years old Od. 11.311.
(2) App. (the number being taken as a round one) conveying the notion of full maturity, well matured, full-grown: ἀλείφατος Il. 18.351: βοός Od. 10.19, σιάλοισιν 390.

(3) In Od. 19.179 (μίνως ἐ. βασίλευε Διὸς ὀαριστής) the reference seems to be to an eightyearly tenure of kingship. See Frazer, Golden Bough, 3 rd ed., Part iii. Od. 17.58 foll., esp. Od. 17.70. On the analogy of διὰ τρίτης ἡμέρας, every second day, and similar expressions, ἐ. is to be translated by terms of eight years, fresh kingly power being supposed to be imparted in converse with Zeus at the end of each term.

forms: Also ἐνενήκοντα Il. 2.602 (a form difficult to explain).

etym: [ἐνϝοσι- (ἐν- 1 or (3) + ϝοθ-, + ὠθέω + γαῖα. Cf. εἰνοσίφυλλος, ἐνοσίχθων.]
defs: Epithet or a name of Poseidon. Lord of earthquakes; or perh., who is ever beating the earth with his waves Il. 6.455, Il. 8.201, 440, Il. 9.362, Il. 12.27, Il. 14.135, 510, Il. 15.173, 184, 218, Od. 3.20, 310, Il. 21.462: Od. 5.423, Od. 7.326, Od. 9.518, Od. 11.102, Od. 13.140. Joined with γαιήοχος Il. 9.183, Il. 13.43, 59, 677, Il. 14.355, Il. 15.222, Il. 23.584: Od. 11.241.

forms: Mid. Pres. infin. ἕννυσθαι Od. 7.28, Od. 14.514, 522.
3 sing. aor. ἑέσσατο (ἐϝεσσατὀ Il. 10.23, 177: Od. 14.529. ἕσατο Il. 14.178. ἕσσατο Il. 6.207, Il. 10.334: Od. 7.228.
defs: (I) In act.
(II) In mid.
Doing somthing by night, by night, in the night-time: ἐ. προμολών Il. 21.37. Cf. Il. 11.683: Od. 3.178.
(1) Voice or sound Od. 10.147.
(2) Shouting: ἐνοπῇ ἴσαν Il. 3.2. The shouting of fighters, the din of battle: μάχη ἐ. τε Il. 12.35, Τρώων ἐξ ἐνοπῆς (from the shouting throng) Il. 16.782, Il. 17.714. Cf. Il. 16.246.
(3) The sound of mourning, weeping, wailing: ἐνοπήν τε γόον τε Il. 24.160.
(4) The sound of musical instruments: αὐλῶν συρίγγων τʼ ἐνοπήν Il. 10.13.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. ἐνῶρτο Il. 1.599: Od. 8.326.
defs: (1) To awaken or induce in a person an inclination for (something), to turn him to (something): φύζαν Il. 15.62.
(2) To awaken or induce an inclination for (something) in a person, to turn him to (something). With dat.: τῇσι γόον ἐνῶρσεν Il. 7.499. Cf. Il. 15.366.
(3) In mid., to be caused or brought about among, to break out among. With dat.: ἐνῶρτο γέλως θεοῖσιν Il. 1.599: = Od. 8.326.
(1) To leap or spring upon the foe: τῇ ἐνόρουσεν Il. 11.149. Cf. Il. 11.747.
(2) To leap or spring upon. With dat.: Τρωσίν Il. 16.783. Cf. Il. 10.486.

etym: [for ἐνϝοσίχθων, fr. ἐνϝοσι- as in ἐννοσίγαιος + χθών.]

defs: To drop into; hence, to instil in. With dat.: εἴ τοι σοῦ πατρὸς ἐνέστακται μένος ἠΰ Od. 2.271.
To fix in, stick into. With dat.: γαίῃ ἐνεστήρικτο Il. 21.168.

forms: In mid., to turn or have movement in (a socket).
With dat.: ἔνθα μηρὸς ἰσχίῳ ἐνστρέφεται Il. 5.306.

defs: (1) To bend (a bow) into the position required for stringing it, to string (it) (cf. τανύω 2): οὐδὲ τόξον ἐντάνυσεν Od. 21.150. Cf. Od. 19.577 = Od. 21.75, Od. 21.92, 247, 286, 306, 315, 326, 338, 403. Absol. Od. 21.114, 185.
