(2) To lead the way, act as leader, take the lead: ὣς φωνήσας ἡγήσατο Od. 3.144. Cf. Il. 9.168, 192, Il. 12.28, Il. 24.96: Od. 1.125, Od. 2.405  =  Od. 3.29 = Od. 6.37, Od. 2.413 = Od. 8.46 = 104, Od. 5.192, Od. 14.48.

(3) To lead the way, give a lead, in a course of action. With dat.: τοῖσιν εὐπείθης ἡγήσατο νηπιέῃσιν (in their . . .) Od. 24.469. To give a lead, cause a start to be made. With dat. and genit. of that in which a start is made: ἀοιδὸς ἡμῖν ἡγείσθω ὀρχηθμοῖο Od. 23.134.
(4) To be the leader, commander or chief of.
(b) With dat.: Μῄοσιν Il. 2.864, νῆες, ᾗσιν Ἀχιλλεὺς ἐς τροίην ἡγεῖτο (brought to Troy under his command) Il. 16.169. Cf. Il. 2.687, Il. 5.211: Od. 14.238.
(5) Absol., to act as chief or leader, lead one's men Il. 12.251 = Il. 13.833, Il. 13.802, Il. 14.374: Od. 14.470. To lead a person on, induce him to follow: κερδοσύνῃ ἡγήσατο Il. 22.247.
(6) To lead or lead on (one's men). With genit.: ἡγήσατο λαῶν Il. 15.311. With dat.: Τρωσὶ ποτὶ πτόλιν ἡγήσασθαι Il. 22.101.
(7) To take the lead, be the leading person, among. With dat.: ἡγεῖτο μνηστῆρσιν Od. 16.397.

(1) To come or gather together, assemble: ἀμφʼ Ἀτρεΐωνα ἠγερέθοντο Il. 23.233. Cf. Il. 2.304, Il. 10.127, Il. 19.303, Il. 24.783: περὶ ἑταῖροι ἠγερέθοντο Od. 2.392. Cf. Od. 3.412, Od. 11.228, Od. 17.34, 65, Od. 18.41, Od. 19.542, Od. 24.468.
(2) To be or remain gathered together or in a body: ἀμφί μιν κρητῶν ἀγοὶ ἠγερέθονται Il. 3.231. Cf. Il. 12.82.
(1) To play the leader or fugleman to: κακὸς κακὸν ἡγηλάζει Od. 17.217.
(2) To lead (a specified kind of existence), endure (a specified fate): κακὸν μόρον ἡγηλάζεις Od. 11.618.

A leader, commander or chief: δύω ἡγήτορες ἦσαν Il. 4.393. Cf. Il. 2.79, Il. 3.153, Il. 10.181, Il. 15.330, Od. 3.383, etc.: ταφίων Od. 1.105. Cf. Od. 6.98, 136, 186 = Od. 8.26 = 97 = 387 = 536, Od. 8.11, Od. 11.526, Od. 13.186, 210. With ἀνήρ: πυλίων. ἡγήτορες ἄνδρες Il. 11.687. Cf. Il. 16.495, 532.

forms: So ἠδὲ καί· Διὸς ἄγγελοι ἠδὲ καὶ ἀνδρῶν Il. 1.334, etc. Cf. Od. 2.209, etc.

defs: (1) Previously to some specified or indicated time, by or before this (or that) time, by now, now, already, ere this: ἤδη οἱ ἐφῆκα βέλος Il. 5.188. Cf. Il. 1.250, 260, 590, Il. 2.699, Il. 3.56, 184, etc.: ἤδη Ἄϊδόσδε βεβήκει Od. 3.410. Cf. Od. 2.164, 211, 402, 410, Od. 3.241, 335, etc. Reinforcing νῦν Il. 15.110, etc.: Od. 14.213, etc.

(2) In reference to the future, now: ἧ ἤδη με δαμόωσιν Il. 7.368. Cf. Il. 11.821, Il. 16.438, Il. 23.20, Il. 24.635, etc.: ἤδη σχεθέτω φόρμιγγα Od. 8.537. Cf. Od. 1.303, Od. 4.294, Od. 13.151, Od. 19.300, Od. 22.101, Od. 24.506, etc. Reinforcing νῦν Il. 1.456, etc.: Od. 10.472, etc.
(1) In aor., to conceive delight or pleasure. With pple., expressing the occasion: ἥσατο πίνων Od. 9.353.

(2) In aor. pple., having conceived or conceiving pleasure, well-pleased, glad: ἐμοί κεν ἀσμένῳ εἴη (I should be glad . . .) Il. 14.108, φύγεν ἄσμενος ἐκ θανάτοιο (was glad to flee . . .) Od. 3.350: προτέρω πλέομεν ἄσμενοι ἐκ θανάτοιο (glad to have escaped . . .) Od. 9.63 = 566 = Od. 10.134.

Pleasure, profit, satisfaction: μίνυνθα ἡμέων ἔσσεται ἠ. (we shall profit our friends little) Il. 11.318, τί μοι τῶν ἠ.; (what satisfaction have I in that ?) Il. 18.80. Cf. Il. 1.576: = Od. 18.404, Od. 24.95.
Sweet to drink. Of wine Od. 2.340, Od. 3.391, Od. 15.507.

forms: ἡδεῖα, ἡδύ. Also fem. ἡδύς Od. 12.369
defs: (1) Sweet or pleasant.
(b) To the sense of smell: ὀδμή Od. 9.210. Cf. Od. 12.369.
(c) To the ear: ἀοιδήν Od. 8.64.
(2) Of sleep or rest, sweet, grateful, balmy, refreshing Il. 4.131: Od. 1.364 = Od. 16.451 = Od. 19.604 = Od. 21.358, Od. 15.44, Od. 19.510, Od. 23.17. Superl. ἥδιστος: ὕπνος Od. 13.80.
(3) Pleasing, agreeable, such as commends itself to one: εἴ πως τόδε πᾶσι φίλον καὶ ἡδὺ γένοιτο Il. 4.17. Cf. Il. 6.387: Od. 24.435.
(4) In neut. ἡδύ as adv.
(b) Of sleeping, sweetly: ἡδὺ κνώσσουσα Od. 4.809.
(c) Of laughing, merrily, heartily: ἡδὺ γελάσσας Il. 11.378. Cf. Il. 2.270, Il. 21.508, Il. 23.784: = Od. 20.358 = Od. 21.376, Od. 16.354, Od. 18.35, 111.
(1) Disjunctive particle.

(b) ἠὲ (ἢ . . . ἠὲ (ἢ . . ., either . . . or . . .: ἢ νῦν δηθύνοντʼ ἢ ὕστερον αὖτις ἰόντα Il. 1.27. Cf. Il. 1.138, 395, Il. 5.484, Il. 9.78, 537, Il. 10.370, etc.: ἠὲ δόλῳ ἢ ἀμφαδόν Od. 1.296. Cf. Od. 3.99, 217, Od. 4.546, Od. 5.484, Od. 7.103, Od. 10.228, etc. Thrice or four times Il. 1.145, Il. 6.179, Il. 10.6, etc.: Od. 10.433, Od. 15.84, etc. So ἤ τε (ἤτἐ . . . ἤ τε (ἤτἐ . . . Il. 9.276 = Il. 19.177, Il. 11.410, Il. 17.42.– ἢ . . . τε Il. 2.289.
(2) In questions in disjunctive form (the second particle written ἦε, ἦ.

(b) Indirect, whether . . . or . . .: μερμήριξεν, ἢ . . . ἦε . . . Il. 1.190. Cf. Il. 2.238, Il. 4.15, Il. 5.86, Il. 8.377, Il. 13.327, Il. 18.308 (and see whether . . .), etc.: ὄφρʼ ἐῢ εἰδῶ, ἠὲ . . . ἦ . . . Od. 1.175. Cf. Od. 1.268, Od. 3.170, Od. 4.28, Od. 7.142, Od. 11.175, Od. 16.260, Od. 19.525, etc. Without the particle in the first clause Il. 10.546, etc.: Od. 4.837, etc. With εἰ or αἴ in the first clause Il. 2.368, Il. 7.368, Il. 8.533, Il. 22.246: Od. 24.218. With change of construction Od. 17.275.

(3) After comparatives, than: ἀρείοσιν ἠέ περ ὑμῖν Il. 1.260. Cf. Il. 5.531, Il. 8.190, Il. 16.688, etc.: νεώτεροι ἢ πάρος ἦσαν Od. 10.395. Cf. Od. 1.322, Od. 8.154, etc. So ἤ τε (ἤτἐ Od. 16.216. After ἄλλος Il. 10.404, etc. After ἀλλοῖος Od. 16.181, Od. 19.267. After verbs implying comparison: βούλομαι . . . ἢ . . . Il. 1.117, etc.: ἔφθης . . . ἢ . . . Od. 11.58, etc.

etym: -ου, ὁ. Also Ἥλιος Od. 8.271. Ἠέλιος as voc. Il. 3.277.
defs: (1) The sun.

(b) ὑπʼ αὐγὰς ἠελίοιο, in the upper world, among the livingOd. 11.498, 619, Od. 15.349. Of seeing the sun, i.e. of living: δηρὸν ἔτʼ ὄψεσθαι φάος ἠελίοιο Il. 5.120. Cf. Il. 18.61 = 442, Il. 24.558: Od. 4.540 = Od. 10.498, Od. 4.833, Od. 14.44 = Od. 20.207. Sim. of being born: ἠελίου ἴδεν αὐγάς Il. 16.188. Of leaving the sun, i.e. of dying: λείψειν (λιπὼν̓ φάος ἠελίοιο Il. 18.11: Od. 11.93.
(2) The quarter of the rising sun, the east: πρὸς ἠῶ τʼ ἠέλιόν τε Il. 12.239: Od. 9.26, Od. 13.240.

(3) The sun-god: Ἠ. δς πάντʼ ἐφορᾷς Il. 3.277. Cf. Il. 3.104, Il. 8.480, Il. 14.344, Il. 19.197, etc.: βοῦς (γπερίονος Ἠελίοιο Od. 1.8. Cf. Od. 3.1, Od. 8.271, Od. 10.138, Od. 11.16, 109, Od. 12.133, Od. 19.276, Od. 24.12, etc.
(1) To take wing: ὡς ἀκρίδες ἠερέθονται Il. 21.12.
(2) To wave about, flutter: θύσανοι ἠερέθονται Il. 2.448. Fig., of the mind, to be blown about by passion or caprice, to be unsteady or untrustworthy Il. 3.108.

etym: [ἀϝερ-. Cf. ἠώς, ἄριστον, αὔριον, ἦρι, λ. aurora.]
forms: With the early morning: ἠερίη ἀνέβη οὐρανόν Il. 1.497. Cf. Il. 1.557, Il. 3.7: Od. 9.52.

defs: (1) Epithet of the sea, misty, melting into the haze of distance Il. 23.744: Od. 2.263, Od. 3.105, 294, Od. 4.482, Od. 5.164, 281, Od. 8.568 = Od. 13.150 = 176, Od. 12.285. In neut. ἠεροειδές as adv., through the haze, in the haze of distance: ὅσσον ἠ. ἀνὴρ ἴδεν Il. 5.770.
(2) Of a rock, shrouded in mist Od. 12.233 (cf. 74).
(3) Epithet of caves, dim, dusky, shadowy Od. 12.80, Od. 13.103 = 347, 366.
(1) Hazy, gloomy, dark: τάρταρον Il. 8.13, ζόφον Il. 12.240, Il. 15.191, Il. 21.56, Il. 23.51: Od. 11.57, 155, Od. 13.241.
(2) Hazy, misty: κατʼ ἠερόεντα κέλευθα (through the paths of the clouds) Od. 20.64.
Walking in darkness. Epithet of Erinys Il. 9.571, Il. 19.87.

etym: [perh. fr. ἀείρω + φωνή. Cf. ἠερέθομαι, μετ-ήορος. Lifting up the voice.]

defs: In voc. ἠθεῖε as a form of address to an elder or a master Il. 7.518 (Paris to Hector), Il. 10.37 (Menelaus to Agamemnon), Il. 22.229, 239 (the supposed Deïphobus to Hector). Sim. in the periphrasis ἠθείη κεφαλή Il. 23.94 (Achilles to the shade of Patroclus. Patroclus was the senior Il. 11.787). In Od. 14.147 (ἠθεῖόν μιν καλέω) Eumaeus means that he mentally addresses his absent master as ἠθεῖε.
In pl., the accustomed haunts of animals: ἤθεα ἵππων Il. 7.511 = Il. 15.268. The sties of swine Od. 14.411.
(1) Provisions for a voyage: ὅπλισσον ἤϊα Od. 2.289, ἤϊα φερώμεθα 410, ἤῗά κε πάντα κατέφθιτο Od. 4.363, ἐν καὶ ᾖα κωρύκῳ Od. 5.266, Od. 9.212, νηὸς ἐξέφθιτο ἤῗα πάντα Od. 12.329.
(2) Prey: θώων ἤϊα πέλονται Il. 13.103.

(3) Chaff (in this sense perh. a different word): ὡς ἄνεμος ζαὴς
              ἠΐων (disyllable) θημῶνα τινάξῃ Od. 5.368.
Epithet of a river, of unknown meaning: ἐπʼ ἠϊόεντι σκαμάνδρῳ Il. 5.36.

forms: Epithet of Apollo, of unknown meaning: ἤϊε φοῖβε Il. 15.365, Od. 3.152.

defs: (1) A beach or shore of the sea: ἠϊόνος προπάροιθε βαθείης Il. 2.92. Cf. Il. 6.462, Il. 12.31, Il. 14.36, Od. 3.148, Il. 23.61.
(2) In pl.
(b) Beaches or spits projecting into the sea: ἠϊόνας παραπλῆγας Od. 5.418 = 440. Cf. Od. 7.138.
(1) Of action, gently, without effort:  ψύξασα Od. 3.440. Cf. Il. 23.336: Od. 18.92, 94, Od. 20.301. Gently, without violence: ἀπώσατο γέροντα Il. 24.508.
(2) Of journeying, softly, at a foot-pace Od. 17.254.
(3) Of speaking, softly, in an undertone Il. 3.155.
(4) Of the soft play of light on a glossy surface: χιτῶνας ἦκα στίλβοντας ἐλαίῳ Il. 18.596.

etym: [doubtfully explained as fr. ἠ- = ἀ-1 + -κεστος. See κεστός.]
defs: Thus, untouched by the goad: βοῦς ἠκέστας Il. 7.94 = 275, 309.
The slowest or weakest: ἠ. ἐλαυνέμεν (in driving) Il. 23.531.
The yarn spun off from the distaff Od. 7.53, 306, Od. 6.105, Od. 17.97, Od. 18.315.
(1) To wander aimlessly about Il. 18.281.
(2) To go about or skulk in order to avoid (danger): ὅππῃ ἐμὸν μένος ἠλασκάζει Od. 9.457.
To rove or flit about: ἔλαφοι καθʼ ὕλην αὔτως ἠλάσκουσαι Il. 13.104. Cf. Il. 2.470.
(1) Amber Od. 4.73.
(2) In pl., beads of amber: ὅρμον ἠλέκτροισιν ἐερμένον Od. 18.296. Cf. Od. 15.460.
(1) Crazed, distraught: φρένας ἠλέ (in your . . .) Il. 15.128. Cf. Od. 2.243.
(2) That takes away one's wits or discretion: οἶνος Od. 14.464.
Of unknown meaning. Epithet of πέτρη Il. 15.273, 619, Il. 16.35: Od. 9.243, Od. 10.88, Od. 13.196.

forms: Strengthening πολλός: ἤλιθα πολλήν Il. 11.677. Cf. Od. 5.483, Od. 9.330, Od. 14.215, Od. 19.443.

defs: (1) Time of life: ἤν πως ἡλικίην αἰδέσσεται (may respect my age) Il. 22.419.
(2) Those of the same age as oneself, one's fellows in years, one's contemporaries: ἡλικίην ἐκέκαστο Il. 16.808.
Of the same age: βόες Od. 18.373.

etym: [ἀλιτ-, ἀλιταίνω + μήν. Failing in (the due number of) months.]

forms: A nail or stud used for ornament Il. 1.246, Il. 11.29, 633.

etym: [said to be for ἠλύθ-τιος, fr. ἠλυθ- (see ἔρχομαι.  To which . . . go.]
forms: Ἠλύσιον πεδίον, an abode of everlasting bliss assigned to mortals favoured by the godsOd. 4.563.
In pl.: ὅσσον ἥμασιν ἔπλευ ἄριστος (in throwing the spear) Il. 23.891.

defs: Abounding in sand, sandy, by the sandy shore. Epithet of Pylus Il. 2.77, Il. 9.153 = 295, Il. 11.712: Od. 1.93, Od. 2.214 = 359, Od. 2.326, Od. 4.633, Od. 11.257, 459, Od. 24.152.

forms: 3 pl. ἥαται (ἥς-αταἰ, also writtenεἵαται Il. 2.137, Il. 10.100, 161, 422: Od. 2.403, Od. 7.307. ἕαται Il. 3.134, Il. 9.628.
1 sing. impf. ἥμην Il. 7.336: Od. 10.374, Od. 11.49.

3 pl. ἥατο (ἥς-ατὀ, also writtenεἵατο Il. 3.149, Il. 6.61, Il. 8.554, Il. 15.10, Il. 18.504, Il. 24.99, etc.: Od. 1.326, Od. 2.398, Od. 3.8, Od. 9.545, Od. 20.106, etc. ἕατο Il. 6.414. ἧντο Il. 3.153.
defs: (1) To sit, be seated: παρὰ κλισίῃ ἥμενον Il. 1.330, ἕαται σιγῇ Il. 3.134. Cf. Il. 2.200, Il. 4.21, Il. 7.324, Il. 8.445, Il. 9.190, Il. 13.11, etc.: ἥμενοι ἐν ῥινοῖσιν Od. 1.108. Cf. Od. 1.114, Od. 2.36, Od. 3.8, 32, Od. 7.52, Od. 8.157, Od. 10.374, etc.

(2) To sit idle, doing nothing: ἥμενοι αὖθι ἕκαστοι ἀκήριοι Il. 6.100. Cf. Il. 1.134, Il. 13.253: οἶον ἧσθʼ ἄνεθͅ Od. 2.240. Cf. Od. 10.375, Od. 16.145. Requiring to do nothing: ἱστία ἐρύσαντες ἥμεθα Od. 9.78 = Od. 14.256. Cf. Od. 10.507, Od. 11.10 = Od. 12.152.

(3) To sit, abide, be, remain, doing something specified or in a specified condition or place: ἀδάκρυτος ἧσθαι Il. 1.416, ἥαται ποτιδέγμεναι Il. 2.137, τηλόθι πάτρης ἧμαι ἐνὶ τροίῃ Il. 24.542. Cf. Il. 2.255, Il. 4.412, Il. 8.480, Il. 9.628, Il. 10.100, 161, 422, Il. 15.740, Il. 18.104: Od. 3.263, Od. 13.337, 424, Od. 14.41, Od. 19.120, Od. 21.425.
(4) Of an army, to be set down or encamped: τὴν πόλιν ἀμφὶ δύω στρατοὶ ἥατο Il. 18.509. Of a sentinel or scout, to be at his post Il. 10.182. To be posted: δύω σκοποὶ ἥατο Il. 18.523. Cf. Il. 24.799.
(5) Of a thing, to be set, fixed, placed: ἔνθα μύλαι ἥατο Od. 20.106.

(1) Day, the day, the period of daylight: μέσον ἠ. Il. 21.111, ὄφρʼ ἀέξετο ἠ. Il. 8.66 = Il. 11.84: = Od. 9.56. Cf. Od. 6.288, Od. 10.86, 470, Od. 17.191, Od. 18.367 = Od. 22.301. For δείελον ἠ. see δείελος 2.
(2) A day considered as a space of time.
(4) With an adj., expressing periphrastically the substantival notion implicit in the adj.
(b) ἠ. ἀναγκαῖον (the day that brings compulsion, slavery) Il. 16.836.
(c) δούλιον ἠ. (the day that brings slavery, slavery) Il. 7.463: Od. 14.340, Od. 17.323.
(d) ἐλεύθερον ἠ. (the day or time of freedom, freedom) Il. 7.455, Il. 16.831, Od. 3.193.
(e) κακὸν ἠ. (the day that brings bane, bane) Il. 9.251, 597, Od. 3.315  =  Il. 21.374: Od. 10.269, 288, Od. 15.524.
(f) μόρσιμον ἠ. (the fatal day, one's fate) Il. 15.613: Od. 10.175.–
(g) νηλεὲς ἠ. (the day of pitiless fate, fate, bane) Il. 11.484, 588, Il. 13.514, Il. 15.375, Il. 17.511, 615, Il. 21.57: Od. 8.525, Od. 9.17.
(h) νόστιμον ἠ. (the day that brings one's home-coming, one's home-coming) Od. 1.9, 168, 354, Od. 3.233 = Od. 5.220  =  Od. 8.466, Od. 7.311, Od. 16.149, Od. 17.253, 571, Od. 19.369.
(i) ὀλέθριον ἠ. (the day that brings bane, bane) Il. 19.294, 409.
(j) ἠ. ὀρφανικόν (the day that brings orphanhood, orphanhood) Il. 22.490.
(1) By day, in the day-time: ἠματίη ὑφαίνεσκεν Od. 2.104 = Od. 24.139. Cf. Od. 19.149.
(2) Day by day, daily Il. 9.72.

Correlative with ἠδέ. ἠμὲν . . . ἠδὲ . . ., both . . . and . . .: ἠμὲν νέοι ἠδὲ γέροντες Il. 2.789. Cf. Il. 5.751, Il. 9.36, Il. 11.7, Il. 12.159, Il. 15.226, etc.: ἠμὲν ἀπείλησας . . . ἠδὲ . . . (you boasted that . . . and lo . . .) Od. 8.383. Cf. Od. 1.97, Od. 2.68, Od. 3.105, Od. 10.22, Od. 14.193, etc. So ἠμὲν . . . ἠδὲ . . . ἠδὲ . . . Il. 4.258, etc.– ἠμὲν . . . δὲ . . . Il. 12.428.– ἠμὲν . . . τε . . . Od. 8.575. Retaining something of the original emphasis (surely . . . and even so . . .) Il. 1.453, etc.
The cultivated vine, the vine Od. 5.69.
Tame, domestic: χῆνα Od. 15.162.

forms: To our (my) house: ἡ. ἐλθόντες Od. 8.39. Cf. Od. 15.513, Od. 24.267.

defs: (1) Our Il. 2.374, Il. 3.233, Il. 7.58, Il. 10.342, Il. 11.720, etc.: Od. 1.45, Od. 2.26, Od. 7.191, Od. 11.33, Od. 13.181, etc. With the article: αἱ ἡμέτεραι ἄλοχοι Il. 2.136. Absol.: εἰς ἡμέτερον (sc. δῶμἀ Od. 2.55 = Od. 17.534.–ἐφʼ ἡμέτερα (sc. δώματα) (to our homes, home) Il. 9.619.

(2) My Il. 1.30, Il. 7.151 = Od. 3.214, Il. 6.363, Il. 9.108, Il. 15.224, Il. 16.244, Il. 19.73, Il. 21.60, Il. 24.567: Od. 1.397, Od. 3.186, Od. 4.101, Od. 8.255, Od. 10.334, Od. 11.562, Od. 16.45, 117, 300, 442, Od. 19.344, Od. 21.375, Od. 22.464, Od. 24.216. Absol.: ἐς ἡμέτερον (sc. δῶμἀ Od. 6.301.–ἐφʼ ἡμέτερα (sc. δώματα) (home) Od. 15.88. (Sometimes, esp. in uses with οἶκος and the like, it is difficult to say which sense should be preferred.)
To utter speech, speak, say: ἦ καὶ . . . Il. 1.219. Cf. Il. 1.528, Il. 3.292, 310, 355, etc.: Od. 2.321, Od. 3.337, Od. 7.198, Od. 9.371, etc.

forms: Half-divine, of divine parentage on one side: ἀνδρῶν Il. 12.23.

defs: (1) Drawn by mules Il. 24.189, 266: Od. 7.72.
(2) For, worn by, mules Il. 24.268.

(1) A mule (doubtless including the hinny) Il. 6.333, Il. 10.352, Il. 17.742, Il. 23.121, Il. 24.150, etc.: Od. 4.636, Od. 7.37, Od. 6.2, Od. 8.124, Od. 15.85, Od. 17.298, etc. In Il. 2.852 (ἡμιόνων ἀγροτεράων) app. not strictly mules but some species intermediate between the horse and the ass.
(2) Like ἵππος 3: ἐφʼ ἡμιόνων κείμενον (i.e. on the waggon) Il. 24.702.

forms: A half-axe, an axe with a single cutting edge Il. 23.851, 858, 883.

defs: (1) Half, half of: ἡμίσεες λαοί Od. 3.155.
(2) Absol., half of what is specified or indicated.

(b) In neut. ἥμισυ: τιμῆς ἡ. Il. 7.193. Cf. Il. 9.580 (following τὸ ἡ. 579 (see below)), Il. 17.231 (twice): Od. 9.246 (twice), Od. 13.114, Od. 17.322. With the article: τὸ δʼ ἡ. κεῖτʼ ἐπὶ γαίης Il. 13.565. Cf. Il. 9.579
(3) In neut. as adv., to the extent of a half: ἡ. μείρεο τιμῆς Il. 9.616.
A halftalent: χρυσοῦ Il. 23.751, 796.
(1) With indic.: ἦμος δʼ ἠέλιος κατέδυ Il. 1.475. Cf. Il. 1.477, Il. 16.779, etc.: Od. 2.1, Od. 9.58, 168, etc. Introducing a simile Od. 12.439. Correlative with τῆμος. See τῆμος 2.
(2) With subj. in a conditional relative sentence. See Table at end III.B.a  1.
(1) To cause to bend, bow, droop: κάρη Il. 8.308.
(2) To bend, bow, droop: λήϊον ἠμύει ἀσταχύεσσιν (with its ears) Il. 2.148, ἤμυσε καρήατι Il. 19.405. Of a city nodding or tottering to its fall Il. 2.373  =  Il. 4.290.

forms: One skilled in throwing (the spear): ἥμονες ἄνδρες Il. 23.886.

defs: (1) Introducing in protasis one of two opposed clauses, even if, even though, though, granted that = εἰ 4. For the examples see (II) of Table at end.
(2) Introducing the protasis of conditional sentences, if, on condition that, supposing that = εἰ 5. For the examples see (III) of Table.

(3) In final clauses, if haply, in the hope that = εἰ 9..b: ἐμὲ πρόες, ἤν πού τι φόως Δαναοῖσι γένωμαι Il. 16.39. Cf. Il. 6.39, Il. 14.78, Il. 17.245, Od. 3.172, Il. 22.419: ἤν που ἀκούσῃ (ἀκούσω) Od. 1.94, Od. 2.360, Od. 3.83. Cf. Od. 1.282, Od. 2.216, Od. 5.417.
(4) In an object clause, whether = εἰ 10
(b) : ὄφρα ἴδῃ ἤν τοι χραίσμῃ φιλότης Il. 15.32.

Blown upon or vexed by the winds: ἄκριας Od. 9.400, Od. 16.365. Cf. Il. 22.145: Od. 19.432. Epithet of places. Of Troy Il. 3.305, Il. 8.499 = Il. 12.115, Il. 13.724, Il. 18.174, Il. 23.64, 297. Of Enispe Il. 2.606. Of Mimas Od. 3.172.
The reins used in driving a chariot Il. 3.261, Il. 5.226, 262, 365, Il. 8.121, Il. 16.404, Il. 17.619, Il. 23.337, etc.: Od. 3.483, Od. 7.81.
(2) Used loosely of the παραιβάτης (cf. ἡνίοχος 2) Il. 19.401.
(1) To act as ἡνίοχος of a war-chariot, drive it Il. 11.103, Il. 23.641, 642.
(2) To drive a waggon Od. 7.319.

etym: [ἡνία + ὀχ-, ἔχω. He that holds the reins.]
defs: (1) The driver of a war-chariot as distinguished from the παραιβάτης or fighting man: παραιβάται ἡνίοχοί τε Il. 23.132. Cf. Il. 5.231, 580, Il. 8.119, 124 = 316, Il. 8.126, Il. 11.47 = Il. 12.84, Il. 11.161, 273 = 399, Il. 11.280, Il. 12.111, Il. 13.386, 394, 537  =  Il. 14.431, Il. 17.427, 439, 610, Il. 18.225, Il. 23.280.

(2) Used loosely of the παραιβάτης (cf. ἡνιοχεύς 2): θρασὺν ἡνίοχον φορέοντες  Ἕκτορα Il. 8.89 (Eniopeus was driving, see 119, where he also is called ἡ.). In pl. including both the ἡ. proper and the παραιβάτης: σὺν ἡνιόχοισι κακοῖσιν Il. 17.487.
(3) One who drives his chariot in a race: μήτι ἡ. περιγίγνεται ἡνιόχοιο Il. 23.318. Cf. Il. 23.460, 465, 502.

etym: [doubtfully explained as fr. ἔνος, cited in sense year.]
forms: Thus, one year old, that is a yearling: δυοκαίδεκα βοῦς ἤνις Il. 7.94 = 275, 309, βοῦν ἦνιν Il. 10.292: = Od. 3.382.
Manliness, valour, mettle, prowess: ἠνορέηφι πεποιθώς Il. 4.303. Cf. Il. 7.156, Il. 8.226 = Il. 11.9, Il. 17.329: Od. 24.509.

defs: Of unknown meaning. Perh. glittering, gleaming, or the like: ἤνοπι χαλκῷ Il. 16.408, Il. 18.349: = Od. 10.360.
(1) Of the east, dwelling in the east, eastern Od. 8.29.
(2) In fem. as sb., the morning: πᾶσαν ἠοίην μένομεν Od. 4.447.

forms: Also ἕως Od. 2.78. This form scanned as a monosyllable Il. 17.727.
defs: (1) While, so long as: ἧος ζώει Od. 17.390. Cf. Od. 19.530. Correlative with τόφρα. See τόφρα 3.

(2) While, during the time that: ἧος ὁ ταῦθʼ ὥρμαινεν Il. 1.193: = Od. 4.120 = Od. 5.365, ἧός μοι πάρʼ ὀϊστοί (while I still have them) Od. 22.106. Cf. Od. 13.315 = Od. 15.153, Od. 17.358. Correlative with τόφρα. See τόφρα 3. With τῆος. See τῆος 2.
(3) For a time, up to a certain point of time: ἕως μὲν θέουσιν Il. 17.727. Cf. Il. 12.141, Il. 13.143, Il. 15.277, Il. 17.730: Od. 2.148, Od. 3.126 (all that time).
(4) Until.
(5) In order that. With opt.: ἦος χυτλώσαιτο Od. 7.80. Cf. Od. 4.800, Od. 5.386. After a vb. of praying, that. With opt.: ἀρώμενος ἧος ἵκοιο γῆρας Od. 19.367.

etym: [prob. for ἀ-πεδ-ανός fr. ἀ-1 + πεδ-, ποδ-, πούς. Not firm on the feet. Cf. ἔμπεδος.]
defs: Thus, weakly, feeble Il. 8.104: Od. 8.311.
(1) To or on to the land as opposed to the sea: ἐκ πόντου βὰς ἠ. Od. 5.56. Cf. Od. 5.438, Od. 9.73, 485, Od. 10.403, 423, Od. 13.116, Od. 23.236.
(2) To the mainland as opposed to an island: πέμψω σʼ ἠ. Od. 18.84, ἀνάξομέν μιν ἠ. 115 (in both cases said in Ithaca).

(1) The land as opposed to  the sea: νῆʼ ἐπʼ ἠπείροιο ἔρυσσαν Il. 1.485: εἴτʼ ἐπʼ ἠπείρου . . . εἴτʼ ἐν πελάγει Od. 3.90. Cf. Od. 1.162, Od. 5.348, 350, 399, 402, Od. 9.85 = Od. 10.56, Od. 9.496, Od. 13.114, Od. 14.136, Od. 16.325, 359, 367.
(2) Inland parts as opposed to the coast Od. 9.49.

(3) The mainland, as opposed to an island or islands: οἳ ἤπειρον ἕχον Il. 2.635 (the coast of the mainland opposite the islands): οὔτʼ ἠπείροιο οὔτʼ αὐτῆς?̓ιθάκης Od. 14.97. Cf. Od. 13.235, Od. 14.100, Od. 21.109, Od. 24.378.
A cheat, deceiver, cozener, beguiler: ἠπεροπῆά τε καὶ ἐπίκλοπον Od. 11.364.
(1) To deceive, cozen: ἵνʼ ἐμὰς φρένας ἠπεροπεύσῃς Od. 13.327. Absol. Od. 14.400. To trick, take unfair advantage of Il. 23.605.

(2) To beguile the heart of, lead astray (a woman) Il. 5.349: Od. 15.419. So τάτε φρένας ἠπεροπεύει γυναιξίν Od. 15.421. With direct and cognate acc.: τί με ταῦτα λιλαίεαι ἠπεροπεύειν; (to beguile me thus) Il. 3.399.

forms: App., generous in giving, bountiful in supplying her children's needs, grudging them nothing: μήτηρ Il. 7.251.

defs: (1) Well or kindly disposed, kindly, gentle, mild, not harsh or rigorous: ἤπια δήνεα οἶδεν (is well disposed towards me) Il. 4.361 (see εἴδω III.12), ἐθέλω τοι ἠ. εἶναι Il. 8.40 = Il. 22.184. Cf. Il. 24.770, 775: Od. 2.47, 230 = Od. 5.8, Od. 2.234 = Od. 5.12, Od. 10.337, Od. 11.441, Od. 13.314, Od. 14.139, Od. 15.152, 490. Absol. in neut. pl.: εἴ μοι ἤπια εἰδείη (were well disposed towards me) Il. 16.73: ὁμῶς τοι ἤπια οἶδεν (is at one with you in loyalty of heart) Od. 13.405 = Od. 15.39, ἀνάκτεσιν ἤπια εἰδώς (loyal to them) Od. 15.557. See in reference to these εἴδω III.12.
(2) Giving kindly tendance, solicitous for the well-being of what is committed to one Il. 23.281.
(3) Of speech, tending to effect reconcilement or bring peace Od. 20.327.
(4) Of medicinal applications, soothing, allaying pain Il. 4.218, Il. 11.515, 830.

etym: [ἠπύω. Prob. orig. a voc. turned into a nom..]

defs: (1) To call to (a person): κύκλωπας Od. 9.399. Cf. Od. 10.83.
(2) Of the wind, to roar Il. 14.399. Of the lyre, to sound Od. 17.271.

forms: What is pleasing or agreeable. Only in acc. sing. ἧρα in phrase ἦρα φέρειν, to do acceptable service, make oneself agreeable, show oneself well disposed: μητρὶ φίλῃ ἐπὶ ἦρα φέρων Il. 1.572. Cf. Il. 1.578: Od. 3.164, Od. 16.375, Od. 18.56.
Sim.: θυμῷ ἦρα φέροντες (yielding to it, giving in to it) Il. 14.132.

defs: Early in the morning Il. 9.360: Od. 19.320, Od. 20.156.

forms: Without Ἠώς, the dawn: οὐδὲ σέ γʼ ἠ. λήσει Od. 22.197. Cf. Od. 23.347.

defs: A grave-mound, a barrow Il. 23.126.

(2) Prefixed to an ethnic name, of a body of the same race in arms together: ὦ φίλοι ἥρωες Δαναοί Il. 2.110 = Il. 7.67 = Il. 15.733 = Il. 19.78. Cf. Il. 2.256, Il. 12.165, Il. 13.629, Il. 15.219, 230, 261, 702, Il. 19.34, 41: Od. 24.68.
(4) In voc. as a form of address to a warrior Il. 10.416, Od. 3.104. With a proper name: Εὐρύπυλʼ ἥρως Il. 11.819, 838.

(5) Applied to warriors, but signifying little more than the man, the wight: ἔτρεψεν ἀδελφειοῦ φρένας ἡ. Il. 7.61. Cf. Il. 3.377, Il. 6.120 = Il. 13.788, Il. 10.179, Il. 23.824. In apposition: ὅ γʼ ἡ. ἔστη Il. 5.308. Cf. Il. 5.327, Il. 8.268, Il. 10.154, Il. 11.483, Il. 13.164, Il. 23.896.
(6) As an honourable appellation of others than warriors: ἐπὶ φᾶρος βάλετʼ ὤμοις ἡ. Od. 15.62. Cf. Od. 6.44, Od. 8.242. With ἄνδρες Od. 14.97. With an ethnic name: ἥρωας Ἀχαιούς Od. 1.272.

(7) Prefixed or added as a sort of title to the name or patronymic of another than a warrior: Λαέρτην ἥρωα Od. 1.189. Cf. Od. 2.15, 99  =  Od. 19.144 = Od. 24.134, Od. 2.157 = Od. 24.451, Od. 3.415, Od. 4.21 = 303, 617 = Od. 15.117, Od. 7.303, Od. 6.155, Od. 8.483, Od. 11.342, Od. 14.317, Od. 15.52, 121, 131, Od. 18.423, Od. 22.185.
(8) In voc. as a form of address to another than a warrior Od. 4.423, Od. 6.303, Od. 10.516. With a proper name: Τηλέμαχʼ ἥρως Od. 4.312.

etym: [for ἡκιων. Comp. fr. ἦκα. Cf.   ἤκιστος.]
defs: (1) Of less worth or merit, inferior Il. 16.722, Il. 23.322, 858.
(2) In neut. ἧσσον as adv., less: ὀλίγον τί μʼ ἡ. ἐτίμα Od. 15.365.
Peace, freedom from disturbance: ἡ. ἂν ἐμοὶ καὶ μᾶλλον ἔτʼ εἴη Od. 18.22.

forms: τό. Only in nom. and acc. sing.
defs: (1) The heart: πάλλεται ἠ. ἀνὰ στόμα Il. 22.452. Cf. Il. 10.93.
(2) The heart, breast, soul, mind. As the seat or a seat

forms: Epithet of lions Il. 15.275, Il. 17.109, Il. 18.318: Od. 4.456.

defs: With beautiful hair, fair-tressed. Epithet of goddesses and women. Of Leto Il. 1.36, Il. 19.413: Od. 11.318. Of Thetis Il. 4.512, Il. 16.860. Of Athene Il. 7.92, 273, 303. Of Here Il. 10.5. Of Calypso Od. 8.452, Od. 12.389. Of Briseïs Il. 2.689. Of Helen Il. 3.329 = Il. 6.355 = Il. 8.82, Il. 9.339, Il. 11.369, 505, Il. 13.766. Of Niobe Il. 24.602.– μητέρος Il. 24.466.

(1) As when, introducing similes. With indic. Il. 2.87, 455, 480, Il. 3.3, Il. 16.487, Il. 21.573, Il. 22.139. With subj. Il. 17.547. Without expressed vb. Il. 2.469, Il. 15.618, Il. 17.737: Od. 21.48.
(3) After a comp., than: μελάντερον ἠΰτε πίσσα Il. 4.277.

forms: A fire: σπλάγχνʼ ὑπείρεχον Ἡφαίστοιο Il. 2.426.
Where: ἡ. ἑκάστῳ δῶμα Ἥφαιστος ποίησεν Il. 1.607. Cf. Il. 3.326, Il. 5.774, Il. 8.14, Il. 11.76: Od. 3.292, Od. 7.94, Od. 19.553.
In an object clause: ἄλλους πευθόμεθʼ, ἡ. ἕκαστος ἀπώλετο Od. 3.87.

From the dawn; hence, at dawn, in the morning. Referring to the next morning: ἠ. ἴτω ἐπὶ νῆας Il. 6.372. Cf. Il. 6.381, Il. 11.555 = Il. 17.664, Il. 18.136, Il. 23.49, Il. 24.401: ἠ. ἀγορήνδε καθεζώμεσθα κιὁντες Od. 1.372. Cf. Od. 3.153, 366, Od. 4.214, Od. 6.189, Od. 12.293, Od. 14.512, Od. 15.308, 506, Od. 17.600, Od. 18.248, Od. 19.320, Od. 21.265, 280, Od. 24.72.

defs: (2) A dawning or morning considered as a space of time: ὄφρʼ ἠ. ἦν Il. 8.66 = Il. 11.84, ἠοῦς ὄψεαι (in the morning) Il. 8.470, τὸν [μῦθον] ἠοῦς (the morrow's) 525. Cf. Il. 21.111: νηῦς ἠῶ πεῖρε κέλευθον (through the morning) Od. 2.434. Cf. Od. 6.288, Od. 9.56.
(3) A morning considered as a point or unit of time or as one of a series: δυωδεκάτη Il. 1.493 = Il. 24.31, Il. 21.80, Il. 24.413. Cf. Il. 13.794, Il. 21.156, Il. 24.781, 785: Od. 19.192, 571.
(4) The quarter of the dawn, the east: πρὸς ἠῶ τʼ ἠέλιόν τε Il. 12.239: Od. 9.26, Od. 13.240. Cf. Od. 10.190.
To sit, be seated: ἕδος ἔνθα θάασσεν Il. 9.194. Cf. Il. 15.124: δηθὰ θεῶν ἐν δαιτὶ θαασσέμεν Od. 3.336.

forms: App. vertical (presumably metal) pegs at the top and bottom of a side of a gate working in stone sockets and governing the opening and shutting Il. 12.459.

defs: A den or hole Od. 5.432.
A female servant in charge of the sleeping-rooms, a chamber-maid Od. 6.8, Od. 23.293.

forms: To the θάλαμος (in sense (4)) Od. 2.348, Od. 21.8, Od. 22.109, 161.

defs: (2) A chamber appropriated to the lady of a house and her maidens: ὡρμᾶτʼ ἐκ θαλάμοιο Il. 3.142 (the same as the μέγαρον of 125). Cf. Il. 7.316, 321, 336: ἐξ (ελένη θαλάμοιο ἤλυθεν Od. 4.121. Cf. Od. 4.718, 802, Od. 17.36 = Od. 19.53, Od. 17.506. In pl. of the women's apartments generally: νύμφας ἐκ θαλάμων ἠγίνεον Il. 18.492 (cf. Od. 22.143 cited under (4); or this may be the pl. of indefiniteness like νύμφας in this line and γάμοι and εἰλαπίναι in the θάλαμόνδε. line) (u.l. ἐς θαλάμους, which would go under 1.b): μυχῷ θαλάμων ἥμεθα Od. 23.41.
(3) A work-room Il. 4.143.

(4) A room for storage or safe custody, a store-room, a treasure-chamber: θύρη θαλάμοιο ἀνέρος ἀφνειοῖο Il. 24.317: χηλὸν ἐξέφερεν θαλάμοιο Od. 8.439, ἀνέβαινε ἐς θαλάμους Od. 22.143 (app. meaning a single room; cf. Il. 18.492 cited under (3)). Cf. Il. 7.288, Il. 22.63, Il. 24.191, 275: Od. 2.337, Od. 3.441, Od. 7.74, Od. 15.99, Od. 16.285, Od. 19.17, 256, Od. 21.42, Od. 22.140, 155, 157, 166, 174, 179, 180, Od. 24.166.
(2) Distinguished in terms from the land: γαίης νέρθε καὶ θαλάσσης Il. 14.204. Cf. Il. 8.24. From the land and the heavens Il. 18.483: Od. 12.404 = Od. 14.302. From other waters Il. 21.196.
(3) Personified: γλαυκή σε τίκτε θ. Il. 16.34.
(4) Sea-water: θ. κήκιε πολλή Od. 5.455. Cf. Il. 10.572.
Of or pertaining to the sea: ἔργα Il. 2.614: Od. 5.67.
In pres. pple., flourishing, luxuriant: θάμνος ἐλαίης Od. 23.191. Of youths, lusty, in prime of vigour Od. 7.63. Of swine: θαλέθοντες ἀλοιφῇ (swelling with fat) Il. 9.467, Il. 23.32.
(1) Lusty, in prime of vigour: αἰζηοί Il. 3.26. Cf. Il. 4.474, Il. 7.430, Il. 8.156, 190, Il. 10.259, Il. 14.4, etc.
(2) Of a woman, blooming, in pride of beauty: παράκοιτιν Il. 3.53.
(3) Of marriage, app. giving the notion of the union of a pair in prime of youth Od. 7.66, Od. 20.74.
(4) Of parts of the body, well-developed, stout: μηρώ Il. 15.113. Of a horse's mane, long, flowing Il. 17.439.
(5) Of the voice, full, rich Il. 17.696 = Il. 23.397: = Od. 4.705  =  Od. 19.472.
(7) Of lamentation, loud, vehement Od. 10.457.
(8) Of fat, thick, abundant Od. 8.476.
Abundance, plenty Il. 9.143, 285. In pl.: τέρπεται ἐν θαλίῃς Od. 11.603.
Green stuff, fodder: θαλλὸν ἐρίφοισι φορῆναι Od. 17.224.
(1) Of vegetation, to grow profusely, flourish, be luxuriant: ἡμερὶς τεθήλει σταφυλῇσιν (flourished with its. . .) Od. 5.69.
(2) In pf. pple.
(b) Of the fat or lard of swine, rich Od. 13.410. Sim.: συὸς ῥάχιν τεθαλυῖαν ἀλοιφῇ (rich with . . .) Il. 9.208.
(c) Of dew, copious Od. 13.245.
(d) Of a feast, sumptuous, affording good cheer Od. 11.415.
A young shoot or branch. Fig. of a youthful person Il. 22.87: Od. 7.157.
To be warm: εὖ θαλπιόων Od. 19.319.

forms: To warm, to make flexible by the application of heat Od. 21.179, 184, 246.

defs: (1) Comfort, consolation, cheering: οὐκ ἄλλη ἔσται θ. Il. 7.412. Cf. Od. 1.167.
(2) Heartening, confidence: μᾶλλον θ. ἔσται Il. 10.223.
(1) Of a feast, sumptuous, affording good cheer Il. 6.475: Od. 3.420, Od. 8.76, 99.
(2) Absol. in neut. pl., good cheer: θαλέων ἐμπλησάμενος κῆρ Il. 22.504.
A sacrifice of first fruits: χωσαμένη ὅ οἱ οὔ τι θ. ῥέξεν Il. 9.534.

(1) To wonder, be struck with wonder or astonishment: θάμβησεν Ἀχιλεύς Il. 1.199. Cf. Il. 3.398, Il. 8.77, Il. 23.728 = 881, Il. 24.483, 484: θαμβήσασα βεβήκει Od. 1.360 = Od. 21.354. Cf. Od. 1.323, Od. 4.638,  Od. 10.63, Od. 24.101.
(2) To wonder or marvel at: ὄρνιθας Od. 2.155. Cf. Od. 16.178, Od. 17.367.

forms: Wonder, astonishment, amazement: θ. ἔχεν εἰσορόωντας Il. 3.342. Cf. Il. 4.79, Il. 23.815, Il. 24.482: Od. 3.372, Od. 24.394.

defs: (1) Set or standing closely together: ἔνθα θαμειαὶ εἴρυντο νέες Il. 18.68. Cf. Il. 10.264, Il. 12.296, Il. 19.383 = Il. 22.316: ἀραρὼν θαμέσι σταμίνεσσιν Od. 5.252. Cf. Od. 12.92, Od. 14.12.
(2) coming, flying, falling, thick and fast: θαμέες ἄκοντες ἀΐσσουσιν Il. 11.552 = Il. 17.661, ὥς τε νιφάδες πίπτωσι θαμειαί Il. 12.278. Cf. Il. 12.44, 287, Il. 14.422.
(3) Occurring at short intervals over a space, numerous: πυραὶ καίοντο θαμειαί Il. 1.52.
(1) To come often to, frequent, an indicated place: πάρος γε μὲν οὔ τι θαμίζεις Il. 18.386 = 425: Od. 5.88.
(2) To go about, ply one's vocation: ἅμα νηῒ θαμίζων Od. 8.161.
(3) With pass. pple., to be accustomed to treatment of an indicated kind: οὔ τι κουιζόμενος θάμιζεν (was not wont to be (so) cared for) Od. 8.451.
(1) A bush, shrub, small tree: θάμνῳ ὑπ̓ ἀμφικόμῳ Il. 17.677. Cf. Il. 11.156, Il. 22.191: δοιοὺς ὑπήλυθε θάμνους Od. 5.476, θάμνος ἐλαίης (consisting of . . .) Od. 23.190. Cf. Od. 22.469
(2) In pl., a thicket: θάμνων ὑπεδύσετο Od. 7.127. Cf. Od. 5.471, Od. 6.285.

forms: To one's death: ὡς εἰ θ. κιόντα Il. 24.328. Cf. Il. 16.693, Il. 22.297.

defs: (2) Personified: Ὕπνῳ κασιγνήτῳ Θανάτοιο Il. 14.231. Cf. Il. 16.454, 672 = 682.
(3) A kind or mode of death: λευγαλέῳ θανάτῳ ἁλῶναι Il. 21.281: = Od. 5.312, πάντες στυγεροὶ θάνατοί [εἰσιν] Od. 12.341. Cf. Od. 11.412, Od. 15.359, Od. 18.202, Od. 22.462, Od. 24.34.
To admire, look at with admiration Od. 18.191.
(1) To suck (the breast): γυναῖκα θήσατο μαζόν (double acc. of whole and part, a woman's breast) Il. 24.58.
(2) To suck (milk): παρέχουσι γάλα θῆσθαι (for their young to suck) Od. 4.89.
To pay funeral rites to (a corpse): ὁπότʼ Ἀμαρυγκέα θάπτον Ἐπειοί Il. 23.630. Cf. Il. 21.323, Il. 23.71, Il. 24.612, 665: οὔ πω ἐτέθαπτο Od. 11.52. Cf. Od. 3.285, Od. 12.12, Od. 24.417.

(1) Bold, stout, courageous, spirited, confident: πολεμιστήν Il. 5.602 = Il. 16.493 = Il. 22.269. Cf. Il. 19.169, Il. 21.430, 589: Od. 6.51. Neut. comp. θαρσαλεώτερον in impers. construction: θ. ἔσται (one would feel more confidence, have better heart) Il. 10.223.
(2) Over-bold, audacious, presuming: θαρσαλέος τις προΐκτης Od. 17.449. Cf. Od. 19.91.
(1) Boldly, confidently: ἀγόρευεν Od. 1.382 = Od. 18.411 = Od. 20.269. Cf. Od. 1.385.
(2) Too boldly or confidently: ἀγορεύεις Od. 18.330 = 390.

(1) To be of good heart or courage, of good cheer: θαρσῶν μάχεσθαι Il. 5.124, τεθαρσήκασι λαοί (are (now) of good heart) Il. 9.420 = 687. In imp. θάρσει Il. 4.184, Il. 8.39 = Il. 22.183, Il. 10.383, Il. 15.254, Il. 18.463, Il. 24.171: Od. 2.372, Od. 4.825, Od. 8.197 (τόνδε γʼ ἄεθλον, as touching this . . .), Od. 13.362 = Od. 16.436  =  Od. 24.357, Od. 19.546, Od. 22.372.
(2) In aor., to take heart, pluck up courage: θαρσήσας εἰπέ Il. 1.85. Cf. Il. 1.92, Od. 3.338: Od. 3.76, 252.
(1) Boldness, courage, spirit, confidence: σῷ θάρσει Il. 7.126. Cf. Il. 5.2, Il. 6.153, Il. 17.570, 573, Il. 21.547: Od. 1.321, Od. 3.76, Od. 7.140, Od. 9.381, Od. 14.216.
(2) Excessive boldness or confidence: θ. ἄητον ἔχουσα Il. 21.395.
Having plucked up courage: Τρώων πόλις ἐπὶ πᾶσα βέβηκεν θ. Il. 16.70. Taking courage: θ. οἰωνῷ (from the . . .) Il. 13.823.

To encourage, hearten, cheer, put spirit into: τοὺς θάρσυνε μύθῳ Il. 10.190. Cf. Il. 4.233, Il. 13.767 = Il. 17.117 = 683, Il. 16.242, Il. 18.325, Il. 23.682: Od. 3.361, Od. 9.377, Od. 13.323, Od. 16.448, Od. 24.448.

etym: [for θακίων. Comp. of ταχύς with transference of aspirate.]
defs: (1) Swifter: ποσὶν θ. (with the feet, in running) Il. 15.570. Cf. Il. 13.819.
(2) In neut. θᾶσσον as adv.

(b) Quickly rather than slowly, quickly, with speed: θ. Ἀθηναίῃ ἐπιτεῖλαι Il. 4.64. Cf. Il. 13.115, Il. 16.129, Il. 17.654, Il. 19.68, Od. 3.257: ἔρρʼ ἐκ νήσου θ. Od. 10.72. Cf. Od. 6.152, Od. 10.44, 192, 228, 268, Od. 15.201, Od. 16.130, Od. 20.154, Od. 24.495.
(1) Wonder, amazement: θ. μʼ ἔχει Od. 10.326.

(2) A wonder or marvel: θ. ἰδέσθαι (to behold) Il. 5.725, Il. 10.439, Il. 18.83, 377, μέγα θ. τόδʼ ὁρῶμαι (this is a great wonder that I see) Il. 13.99 = Il. 15.286 = Od. 3.344 = Il. 21.54. Cf. Il. 18.549: Od. 7.306, Od. 6.45, Od. 8.366, Od. 9.190, Od. 11.287, Od. 13.108, Od. 17.306, Od. 19.36.

forms: 3 sing. fut. in mid. form θαυμάσσεται Il. 18.467.
defs: (1) To wonder, marvel, to feel or be struck with wonder, astonishment or admiration: γυναῖκες ἱστάμεναι θαύμαζον Il. 18.496. Cf. Il. 24.394: θαύμαζεν ὁ γεραιός Od. 3.373. Cf. Od. 4.44, Od. 6.145, Od. 8.265, Od. 13.157, Od. 16.203. With dependent clause: θαυμάζομεν οἷον ἐτύχθη Il. 2.320.

(2) To wonder or marvel at, look upon with wonder or eager curiousity: πτόλεμόν τε μάχην τε Il. 13.11. Cf. Il. 10.12, Il. 18.467: λιμένας καὶ νῆας Od. 6.43. Cf. Od. 1.382 = Od. 18.411 = Od. 20.269, Od. 4.655, Od. 9.153, Od. 19.229, Od. 24.370. With infin.: οἷον θαυμάζομεν (impf.) Ἕκτορα αἰχμητὴν ἔμεναι (thinking that he was . . .) Il. 5.601. To look upon or behold (a person) with respectful wonder and admiration: Πρίαμος θαύμαζʼ Ἀχιλῆα Il. 24.629. Cf. Il. 24.631: Od. 8.459.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. fut. pple.  θαυμανέοντες.
defs: To witness or watch with eager interest: ἀέθλια θαυμανέοντες Od. 8.108.

forms: Dat. pl. θεῇσι Il. 8.305. Il. 11.638, Il. 19.286: Od. 6.291. θεῇς Il. 3.158. θεαῖς Od. 5.119.
defs: (1) A female divine (or semi-divine) being, a goddess: εἰ θεά σε γείνατο μήτηρ Il. 1.280 (Thetis). Cf. Il. 1.1, Il. 2.182, Il. 3.396, Il. 8.305, Il. 18.429, etc.: καλυψώ, δῖα θεάων Od. 1.14, θεά οἱ ἔκλυεν ἀρῆς Od. 4.767 (Athene). Cf. Od. 2.392, Od. 5.215, Od. 10.222, Od. 12.131, Od. 20.393, etc.
(2) A goddess as distinguished in terms from a god: εἰρωτᾷς με θεὰ θεόν Od. 5.97. Cf. Il. 10.50. From a woman: θεᾶς οὐδὲ γυναικός Il. 14.315.

(3) With the name of a particular goddess. With Ἥρη Il. 1.55, Il. 5.711, Il. 8.350, etc. With Ἀθήνη Il. 1.206, Il. 2.166, Il. 5.405, etc.: Od. 1.44, Od. 2.382, Od. 3.13, etc. With Ἠώς Il. 2.48. With θέτις Il. 9.410, Il. 15.76, Il. 18.127, etc. With θέμις Il. 15.93. With ̓͂ιρις Il. 15.206, Il. 18.182. With Ἐρινύς Od. 15.234.

forms: A goddess as distinguished from a god: πάντες τε θεοὶ πᾶσαί τε θέαιναι Il. 8.5 = Il. 19.101, Il. 8.20. Cf. Od. 8.341.

defs: (1) In reference to the sulphurous smell associated with a thunderbolt: δεινὴ θεείου γίγνεται ὀδμή Il. 14.415. Cf. Il. 8.135: Od. 12.417, Od. 14.307.
(2) Used for cleansing by fumigation: ἐκάθηρε θεείῳ Il. 16.228. Cf. Od. 22.481, 493.
To cleanse with the fumes of sulphur Od. 22.482. In mid. Od. 23.50.

etym: [app. θείλη  =  εἵλη, the sun's warmth + πέδον, the ground.]
forms: A warm spot in a vineyard in which the grapes were left to be dried by the sun, a sun-trap Od. 6.123.
3 sing. aor. ἔθεινε Il. 21.491. θεῖνε Il. 16.339.
To strike, smite: μή σε ἴδωμαι θεινομένην Il. 1.588. Cf. Il. 7.135, Il. 10.484, Il. 16.339, Il. 17.430, Od. 3.481, Il. 21.21, 491: ὅς κέ σε θείνῃ Od. 18.63. Cf. Od. 9.459, Od. 22.443.

defs: (1) Partaking of the nature of the gods, divine, immortal: θείοιο γέροντος (Proteus) Od. 4.395.
(2) Consisting of gods: ἀγῶνα (see ἀγών 1.a) Il. 6.298, Il. 18.376.
(3) Connected with the gods, sacred: ἁλός Il. 9.214 (perh. as used for purifying sacrifices): χορόν Od. 8.264 (app. from the dance being regarded as a matter of ritual).

(4) Of divine origin, from a divine source, divine: ̓́ονειρος Il. 2.22, 56, ὀμφή Il. 2.41, γένος Il. 7.180, πύργου Il. 21.526 (app. as god-built; see 446 and cf. Il. 6.452, Il. 8.519): ὄνειρος Od. 14.495. Applied to persons of divine descent: ̓́ιλου Il. 10.415 (he was descended from Zeus; see Od. 3.215-232), (ηρακλῆος Il. 15.25, Od. 3.145, ἀνδρὸς θείοιο Ἀχιλλῆος Il. 16.798, πηλεΐδαο Il. 17.199, Ἀχιλλῆος Il. 19.279, 297: Ἐνιπῆος Od. 11.238 (since all rivers spring from Zeus).

(5) Applied to kings as holding their office from Zeus Od. 4.621, 691, Od. 16.335. To heralds as under his special protection Il. 4.192, Il. 10.315. To bards as singing by divine inspiration Il. 18.604: = Od. 4.17, Od. 1.336, Od. 8.43, 47, 87, 539, Od. 13.27, Od. 16.252, Od. 17.359, Od. 23.133, 143, Od. 24.439.

(6) Applied as a mere epithet of honour to Odysseus Il. 2.335, Il. 9.218, Il. 10.243, Il. 11.806: Od. 1.65, Od. 2.233, 259, Od. 3.398, Od. 4.682, etc. To Oïleus Il. 13.694 = Il. 15.333. To Thoas Il. 14.230. To Munes Il. 19.296.
(7) Denoting a superlative degree of excellence or beauty: ποτόν Od. 2.341, Od. 9.205, δόμον Od. 4.43.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative θέλγεσκε Od. 3.264. 3 fut. θέλξει Od. 16.298.
defs: (1) To work upon by spells or enchantment, bewithch, charm Il. 24.343: = Od. 5.47, Od. 10.291, 318, 326, Od. 24.3. Sim. of the operation of passion: ἔρῳ θυμὸν ἔθελχθεν Od. 18.212.
(2) Of divine interference, to lay a spell upon, bind up from activity: Ἀχαιῶν νόον Il. 12.255. Cf. Il. 13.435, Il. 15.322, 594: Od. 16.298.
(3) To work upon by wiles, cajole, lead on to one's hurt, prejudice, or dishonour: Ἀγαμεμνονέην ἄλοχον Od. 3.264. Cf. Od. 1.57, Od. 12.40, 44, Od. 18.282.
(4) To beguile, deceive, cheat: δόλῳ [μιν] ἔθελγεν Il. 21.604. Cf. Il. 21.276: Od. 14.387, Od. 16.195.
(5) To charm, delight, ravish Od. 17.521. In mid.: οἶα μυθεῖται, θέλγοιτό κέ τοι ἦτορ Od. 17.514.
(1) A means of enchantment, a spell Il. 14.215.
(2) A means of propitiating or placating: θεῶν θελκτήριον Od. 8.509.
(3) Something that charms or delights Od. 1.337.
(1) The root or bed (of the eye) Il. 14.493.
(2) The lower part (of the throat) Il. 17.47.

forms: Supports, consisting of stakes or stones, set to contain the face of an earthwork or mound (cf. στήλη 1) Il. 12.28, Il. 23.255.

defs: (1) In pl., a body of traditionary rules or precedents: βασιλεύς, ᾧ δῶκε κρόνου πάϊς θέμιστας Il. 2.206. Cf. Il. 1.238, Il. 9.99: Od. 9.112, 215 (see δίκη 2). In sing.: ὃς οὔ τινα οἶδε θέμιστα Il. 5.761 (has no regard for any usage of decency; see εἴδω III.12).

(2) What is established or sanctioned by custom or usage: ἣ θ. ἐστίν Il. 2.73 (as is my right), Il. 9.33 (do.), Il. 23.581 (as usage requires), Il. 24.652 (as the custom is), ἣ θ. ἀνθρώπων πέλει (as is the way of . . .) Il. 9.134, ἣ θ. ἐστὶν ἤ τʼ ἀνδρῶν ἤ τε γυναικῶν (as is the way of . . .) 276 = Il. 19.177, ξείνια παρέθηκεν, ἅ τε ξείνοις θ. ἐστίν (which by the customs of hospitality one . . .) Il. 11.779, ἄορ ἔχων· τῷ δʼ οὐ θ. ἐστὶ μιγῆναι (mortal must not encounter it) Il. 14.386, πάρος γʼ οὐ θ. ἦεν . . . (it was not permitted . . .) Il. 16.796, οὐ θ. ἐστὶ . . . (it must not be that . . .) Il. 23.44: ἣ θ. ἐστίν Od. 3.45 (as the custom is), 187 (as is your due), Od. 11.451 (as it is his privilege to do), ἥ τε ξείνων θ. ἐστίν (as . . . use to do) Od. 9.268, οὔ μοι θ. ἐστὶ . . . (I may not . . .) Od. 10.73, Od. 14.56, ἣ θ. ἐστὶ γυναικός (as a woman's way ever is) 130, ἐπεί μοι   . . . θ. ἐστίν (since it is my right to . . .) Od. 16.91, ἡ γὰρ θ. ὅς τις . . . (for that is due to him who . . .) Od. 24.286.
(3) A judgment or doom Il. 16.387.
(4) An ordinance or decree Il. 9.156, 298.
(5) An oracular reply (in answer to an inquiry as to what is right to be done) Od. 16.403.
(6) A place of judgment Il. 11.807.
(7) As proper name, a goddess with such funtions as may be gathered from the name and the context Il. 15.87, 93, Od. 3.4: Od. 2.68.
(1) To pronounce judgments, act as judge Od. 11.569.
(2) With genit. (like ἀνάσσω 3.a), to rule over, be master of: παίδων Od. 9.114.
To drive or carry in a specified direction: νῆα χέρσον ἱκέσθαι Od. 9.486, 542.

forms: App., the palm of the hand Il. 5.339.
nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. τίθημι.
God - built: πύργων Il. 8.519 (cf. Il. 21.526 cited under θεῖος 4).

defs: Like the gods, godlike. Epithet of persons Il. 1.131  =  Il. 19.155: Od. 3.416, Od. 4.276, Od. 8.256.

forms: From, at the hands of, the gods: θ. οὐκ ἔστʼ ἀλέασθαι [θάνατον] Od. 16.447.

defs: To reveal the divine will Il. 1.109, Il. 2.322: Od. 2.184.
A disclosure of the divine will, the divine will as disclosed to a seer: οὐ θεοπροπίης ἐμπάζομαι Il. 16.50. Cf. Il. 11.794, Il. 16.36: Od. 1.415, Od. 2.201. In pl. Il. 1.87, 385.

forms: = θεοπροπίη.: εἰπὲ θεοπρόπιον ὅ τι οἶσθα Il. 1.85.

etym: [app., one who prays to a god, fr. θεός + προπ-, perh. conn. with L. precor.]
forms: One who reveals the divine will, a seer Il. 12.228: Od. 1.416.
With a word expressing likeness Il. 6.366, Il. 14.318, Il. 17.477: Od. 3.110, 409.
This form as ablative Il. 17.101, Il. 23.347.
defs: (2) A god as distinguished in terms from a goddess: εἰρωτᾷς με θεὰ θεόν Od. 5.97. Cf. Il. 10.50. From a mortal: ἠμὲν θεὸν ἠδὲ καὶ ἄνδρα Il. 5.128. Cf. Il. 19.417, Il. 22.9, Il. 24.259, etc.: Od. 4.397, 654, etc.

(3) Without reference to any particular god, the divine power, heaven: θεός που σοὶ τό γʼ ἔδωκεν Il. 1.178. Cf. Il. 2.436, Il. 7.228, Il. 6.4, Il. 9.49, Il. 17.327, Il. 21.47, etc.: οὐκ ἄνευ θεοῦ Od. 2.372. Cf. Od. 3.131, Od. 8.170, Od. 9.158. Od. 11.292, Od. 17.399, Od. 18.265, etc.
(5) A goddess as distinguished in terms from a woman: ἢ θεὸς ἠὲ γυνή Od. 10.228, 255.

(7) In pl., the gods as distinguished in terms from the goddesses: πάντες τε θεοὶ πᾶσαί τε θέαιναι Il. 8.5 = Il. 19.101, Il. 8.20. Cf. Od. 8.341. From mortals: πρός τε θεῶν πρός τʼ ἀνθρώπων Il. 1.339. Cf. Il. 1.403, Il. 9.239, Il. 14.233, Il. 21.264, etc.: Od. 1.338, Od. 2.211, Od. 16.265, Od. 24.64, etc.

forms: God-fearing, reverencing the gods Od. 7.121 = Od. 9.176 = Od. 13.202, Od. 8.576, Od. 19.109, 364.

defs: To do service to, serve. With dat.: ᾧ πατρί Od. 13.265.

(1) A follower, retainer or henchman: θεράποντες ἀπʼ ὤμων τεύχεʼ ἕλοντο Il. 6.122. Cf. Il. 1.321, Il. 5.48, Il. 7.53, Il. 11.843, Il. 13.600, Il. 15.401, Il. 16.272 = Il. 17.165, Il. 19.143, 281, Il. 24.396, 406, 573: ἴσθμιον ἤνεικεν θ. Od. 18.300. Cf. Od. 1.109, Od. 4.23 = 217, Od. 4.38, 784, Od. 16.253, 326 = 360, Od. 18.297, 424. Fig. of warriors: θεράποντες Ἄρηος Il. 2.110 = Il. 7.67 = Il. 15.733 = Il. 19.78. Cf. Il. 6.382, Il. 8.79, Il. 10.228, Il. 19.47. Of kings θεράποντε διός Od. 11.255.

(2) A warrior in honourable personal attendance on another, the relation of the two resembling generally that of squire and knight: ἠῢς θ. Ἀχιλῆος (Patroclus) Il. 16.653. Cf. Il. 6.149, Il. 11.322, 620, Il. 13.246, 331, Il. 15.431, Il. 16.165 = Il. 17.388, Il. 16.244, 279, 464, 865, Il. 17.164, 271, Il. 18.152, Il. 23.90, 113 = 124, 528, 860 = 888.
(3) Applied to a warrior's ἡνίοχος: ἵππους θ. ἀπάνευθʼ ἔχεν Il. 4.227, ἡνίοχον θεράποντα Il. 5.580. Cf. Il. 7.18, Il. 8.104, 109, 113, 119, Il. 11.341, 488, Il. 12.76, 111, Il. 13.386, Od. 3.487.
To heat Il. 14.7: Od. 9.376.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. θέρμετο Il. 18.348, Il. 23.381: Od. 8.437.
defs: (1) To warm, heat: ὕδωρ Od. 8.426.
(2) In mid., to become warm or hot: θέρμετο δʼ ὕδωρ Il. 18.348: = Od. 8.437. Cf. Il. 23.381.

forms: Genit. θέρευς Od. 6.118. Summer: θέρεϊ (in summer) Il. 22.151: χείματος οὐδὲ θέρευς (in winter or summer) Od. 6.118.
As distinguished from ὀπώρη, early summerOd. 11.192, Od. 12.76, Od. 14.384.

defs: (1) In mid., to warm oneself: φόως ἔμεν ἠδὲ θέρεσθαι Od. 19.64. Cf. Od. 19.507.
(2) In pass., to be warmed: ἐπεί κε πυρὸς θερέω (genit. of material) Od. 17.23. To be burnt: μὴ ἄστυ πυρὸς θέρηται Il. 7.331. Cf. Il. 11.667.

etym: [the first element seems to be the same as in θέσ-φατος.]
defs: (1) App., marvellous, wondrous, or the like: ἔργα Il. 3.130: Od. 11.374, 610.–
(2) So in neut. θέσκελον as adv., marvellously, in wondrous wise: ἔϊκτο θέσκελον αὐτῷ Il. 23.107.
Place, Site Od. 23.296.
(1) Absol. in fem., sentence pronounced by a god, the will of heaven: εἰ καὶ θεσπεσίῃ πόλιν οὐκ ἀλαπάξεις Il. 2.367.
(2) Of song, befitting a god, divinely sweet Il. 2.600. Of singers, heavenly sweet of voice: σειρήνων Od. 12.158.
(4) The force of the second element lost

(b) Indicating a high degree of some quality such as abundance, greatness, greatness of extent, completeness, swiftness, beauty, sweetness or the like: πλοῦτον Il. 2.670. Cf. Il. 2.457, Il. 9.2, Il. 15.669, Il. 17.118, Od. 3.342: ὀδμή Od. 9.211. Cf. Od. 2.12 = Od. 17.63, Od. 6.42, Od. 8.19, Od. 9.68 = Od. 12.314, Od. 9.434, Od. 13.363, Od. 20.289, Od. 24.6.

forms: = θεσπέσιος. 4.b: θ. ἐφόβηθεν (in panic rout) Il. 15.637.

etym: [θε-σπ- as in θεσπέσιον (with the force of the second element lost) + δα(ϝ)-, δαίω1.]
forms: Epithet of fire, defying human efforts, devouring, consuming Il. 12.177, 441, Il. 15.597, Od. 3.490, Il. 21.342, 381, Il. 23.216: Od. 4.418.

etym: [the second element φα-, φημί. The first explained as θεσ-, θεός.]
defs: (1) Pronounced or ordained by a god or by the divine will. Neut. in impers. construction: ὡς γὰρ θέσφατόν ἐστιν Il. 8.477. With infin.: θανέειν Od. 4.561. Cf. Od. 10.473.
(2) Absol. in neut. pl. θέσφατα, divine ordinances or decrees: οὔ τι θεῶν ἐκ θ. ᾔδη Il. 5.64. Cf. Od. 9.507 = Od. 13.172, Od. 11.151, 297, Od. 12.155.
(3) = θεσπέσιος 4..b: ἀήρ Od. 6.143.

etym: [prob. for θἥϝ̓ω, fr. θηϝ-, long form of θεϝ-.]
forms: 2 sing. fut. in mid. form θεύσεαι Il. 23.623.
defs: (1) Of men, horses, etc., to run, speed: θέεις ἀκίχητα διώκων Il. 17.75, ἵπποι βάρδιστοι θείειν Il. 23.310. Cf. Il. 2.183, Il. 4.244, Il. 7.54, Il. 15.442, Il. 19.415, Il. 23.387, etc.: Od. 3.112, 370, Od. 4.202, Od. 8.123, 247, Od. 14.501, Od. 17.308, Od. 22.99, 106. To run a race, contend in a race Il. 11.701, Il. 23.623.

(2) Of the motion of a ship: νηῦς ἔθεεν κατὰ κῦμα Il. 1.483: = Od. 2.429. Cf. Od. 3.281, Od. 12.407, Od. 13.86, 88, Od. 14.299, Od. 15.294. Of a person in a ship: ὅτε κεῖνος ἐν νηυσὶ μαλειάων ὄρος ἷξε θέων Od. 3.288. Of a rolling stone Il. 13.141. Of a δίσκος Od. 8.193. Of a potter's wheel Il. 18.601.
(3) Of things, to run or extend: ἄντυξ ἣ πυμάτη θέεν ἀσπίδος Il. 7.118. Cf. Il. 7.320 = Il. 8.495, Il. 13.547, Od. 3.275: περὶ κλίσιον θέε πάντῃ Od. 24.208.
Holy as distinguished from common: [θύραι] Od. 13.111.

forms: 3 sing. aor. imp. mid. θηξάσθω Il. 2.382.
defs: (1) To sharpen, whet. In mid.: δόρυ Il. 2.382.
(2) Of a boar whetting his tusks Il. 11.416, Il. 13.475.

forms: 3 sing. impf. θηεῖτο Od. 5.75, Od. 7.237, Od. 6.133, Od. 8.265.
3 pl. ἐθηήσαντο Od. 19.235. θηήσαντο Il. 15.682, Il. 22.370: Od. 8.17, Od. 10.180.
defs: (1) To look or gaze upon, view, behold, with interest, curiosity, wonder, admiration: πολέες ἑ θηήσαντο Il. 15.682. Cf. Il. 6.444, Il. 10.524, Il. 22.370: μαρμαρυγὰς ποδῶν Od. 8.265. Cf. Od. 2.13 = Od. 17.64, Od. 5.76 = Od. 6.134, Od. 9.218, Od. 10.180, Od. 15.132, Od. 19.235.

(2) To look about one with wonder or admiration: στὰς θηεῖτο Od. 5.75, Od. 6.133. To look upon something with wonder, to wonder, marvel, be astonished: λαοὶ θηεῦντο Il. 23.728 = 881: θηεῖτο κούρη Od. 7.237. Cf. Od. 5.74, Od. 8.17, Od. 17.315, Od. 24.90. With dependent clause: θηοῖό κεν οἷον . . . Il. 24.418.
An admirer, fancier Od. 21.397.
To teem with, abound in. With genit.: ἴου Od. 5.73.

forms: Also in regular fem. form θήλεια Il. 2.767, Il. 8.7, Il. 11.681, Od. 3.222: Od. 4.636, Od. 9.439, Od. 14.16, Od. 21.23.
defs: (1) Female: θήλεια θεός Il. 8.7, ὄϊν θῆλυν Il. 10.216. Cf. Il. 2.767, Il. 5.269, Il. 11.681, Il. 19.97, Od. 3.222, Il. 23.409: Od. 4.636  =  Od. 21.23, Od. 9.439, Od. 10.527, 572, Od. 14.16. Comp. θηλυτέρη, female as opposed to male: θεαί Od. 8.324, γυναικῶν Od. 11.386. Cf. Il. 8.520: Od. 11.434 = Od. 15.422 = Od. 24.202, Od. 23.166.
(2) Characteristic of women, feminine: θῆλυς ἀϋτή Od. 7.122.
(3) Of dew, copious: θῆλυς ἐέρση Od. 5.467.
A heap Od. 5.368.

forms: Enclitic affirmative particle: οὔ θην δηρὸν βέῃ Il. 16.852. Cf. Il. 9.394, Il. 11.365 = Od. 3.452, Il. 15.288, Il. 17.29, Il. 21.568: Od. 3.352, Od. 16.91.
With mocking or ironical force: οὔ θήν μιν ἀνήσει θυμὸς νεικείειν Il. 2.276. Cf. Il. 8.448, Il. 10.104, Il. 13.620, 813, Il. 14.480: οὐ μέν θην κείνης γε χερείων εὔχομαι εἶναι Od. 5.211.
Dat. pl. θήρεσσι Od. 5.473, Od. 14.21. θηρσί Od. 24.292.

defs: A hunter Il. 12.41. With κύων, a hunting dog: ἐν κυσὶ θηρευτῇσιν Il. 11.325.
To hunt, engage in hunting: ὥς μιν θηρεύοντʼ ἔλασεν σῦς Od. 19.465.
(1) Hunting, the chase: αἵμονα θήρης Il. 5.49. Cf. Il. 10.360: Od. 19.429.
(2) The quarry: ἔδωκε θεὸς μενοεικέα θήρην Od. 9.158.
A hunter Il. 5.51, Il. 11.292, Il. 15.581, Il. 17.726, Il. 21.574. Of a bird of  prey: αἰετοῦ, τοῦ θηρητῆρος Il. 21.252. Cf. Il. 24.316. Of despoilers of a wasps' nest Il. 12.170.

etym: [prob. θήρ + suffix distinguishing an individual from a class.]
forms: A wild beast: μάλα μέγα θηρίον ἦεν Od. 10.171, 180.

defs: A labourer for hire Od. 4.644.
To serve as a hired labourer: θητεύσαμεν μισθῷ ἔπι ῥητῷ Il. 21.444. Cf. Od. 11.489, Od. 18.357.

(1) The beach or shore of the sea: ἐπὶ θινί Od. 2.408. Cf. Od. 6.290, Od. 9.46, 551. The beach or shore (of the sea): παρὰ θῖνα θαλάσσης Il. 1.34. Cf. Il. 1.316, 327, 350, Il. 4.248, Il. 9.182, Il. 11.622, Il. 13.682, Il. 14.31, Il. 19.40, Il. 23.59, Il. 24.12: Od. 2.260, Od. 3.5, Od. 4.432, 779, Od. 7.94, 236, Od. 8.49, Od. 10.154, 179, 402, 407 = Od. 12.367, Od. 10.569, Od. 11.75, Od. 13.65, 220, Od. 14.347, Od. 15.205, Od. 16.358. App., a piece of the shore covered by shallow water: ὡς ὅτʼ ἀναπάλλεται ἰχθὺς θίνʼ ἐν φυκιόεντι Il. 23.693.
(2) A heap: ὀστεόφιν θίς Od. 12.45.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἔθλασε Od. 18.97. θλάσσε Il. 5.307, Il. 12.384.
To smash, crush: κοτύλην Il. 5.307, κυνέην Il. 12.384, ὀστέα Od. 18.97.

defs: To press or rub: πολλῇς φλιῇσι θλίψεται ὤμους Od. 17.221.

forms: Fut. infin. in mid. form θανέεσθαι Il. 4.12, Il. 15.728: Od. 20.21.
Infin. τεθνάμεναι Il. 24.225. τεθνάμεν Il. 15.497, Il. 17.405, Il. 19.335: Od. 16.107, Od. 20.317, Od. 21.155. (ἀπο-, ἐκ-, κατα-.)
defs: (2) In a quasi- passive sense of being slain in battle: χερσὶν ὑπʼ Αἴαντος θανέειν Il. 15.289. Cf. Il. 1.243, Il. 22.426.
(3) In aor. indic.

(b) To have died, be dead: θάνε Μελέαγρος Il. 2.642. Cf. Il. 12.13, Il. 21.610, Il. 22.486: ἐπεὶ θάνʼ Ὀδυσσεύς Od. 1.396, Od. 2.96 = Od. 19.141 = Od. 24.131. Cf. Od. 15.253. In pple.: ὄφρα πυρός με λελάχωσι θανόντα (in death) Il. 6.80 = Il. 22.343, περὶ πατρόκλοιο θανόντος (the dead . . .) Il. 8.476, Il. 17.120, 182, Il. 18.195, μενοιτιάδαο θανόντος ἄχεος (for the death of . . .) Il. 17.538, οὔ μευ ζώοντος . . ., ἀλλὰ θανόντος (now that I am dead) Il. 23.70. Cf. Il. 11.453, Il. 15.350, Il. 17.379, 564, Il. 21.28, Il. 22.73, Il. 23.223, Il. 24.16, 575: οὔ κε θανόντι περ ὧδʼ ἀκαχοίμην (if he were dead) Od. 1.236, ζωὸς ἠὲ θανών (alive or dead) Od. 4.553, μή τι θανὼν ἀκαχίζευ (let not thy death grieve thee) Od. 11.486. Cf. Od. 3.258, Od. 5.310, Od. 11.554, Od. 17.115, Od. 24.77, 79, 93. Absol. in pl. pple., the dead: γέρας θανόντων Il. 16.457 = 675, Il. 23.9: Od. 24.190, 296. Cf. Il. 22.389.
(4) In pf.

(2) Absol., a mortal man, a man: ἕνεκα θνητῶν Il. 1.574, τί δόμεν πηλῆϊ θνητῷ; (to Peleus, to a mortal) Il. 17.444. Cf. Il. 12.242, Il. 17.547, Od. 3.64: Od. 19.593. Fem.: θνητὰς ἀθανάτῃσιν ἐρίζειν Od. 5.213.

forms: To entertain at table: ἐς αὐτοὺς προτέρω ἄγε θοινηθῆναι Od. 4.36.

defs: A building, app. of no great size, within the αὐλή, of unknown nature and useOd. 22.442 = 459, 466.
(1) Quick in movement, nimble, swift, fleet: θοός περ ἐὼν πολεμιστής Il. 5.571. Cf. Il. 5.536, Il. 12.306, Il. 15.585, Il. 16.422, 494.
(3) νήσοισιν ἐπιπροέηκε θοῇσιν Od. 15.299.  Doubtfully explained (cf. θοόω) as the sharp or pointed islands, supposed to form part of the group called the Echinades.

etym: [poss. conn. with θοός and meaning orig. to make quick or active, acquiring the sense of sharpening when applied to weapons, etc..]
forms: To sharpen, put a point upon: ἐθόωσα
and in fem. form θοῦρις, -ιδος, with acc. -ιν
Rushing, impetuous, eager for the fray.
defs: (3) Of a shield, app. by transference of epithet from the bearer to the shield: ἀσπίδα θοῦριν Il. 11.32, Od. 3.162. Sim. of the aegis Il. 15.308.
Boldness, courage: οὐκ ἔχει θράσος ὅς κεν ἴδηται Il. 14.416.
Stout of heart Il. 10.41, Il. 13.343.
Of bold spirit, stout of heart Il. 5.639: Od. 11.267.
(1) Bold, stout: ἡνίοχον Il. 8.89, 126, ἡνιοχῆα 312. Epithet of Hector Il. 12.60 = 210, Il. 13.725, Il. 22.455, Il. 24.72, 786. Of other heroes Il. 8.128, Il. 16.604: Od. 10.436.
(3) Epithet of war, carried on with spirit, strenous Il. 7.254, Il. 10.28: Od. 4.146.
Recompense for rearing due by a child to his parents: οὐδὲ τοκεῦσι θ. ἀπέδωκεν Il. 4.478 = Il. 17.302.
To sing a dirge, wail Il. 24.722: Od. 24.61.
A funeral-song, a dirge: θρήνων ἐξάρχους Il. 24.721.
(2) Prob. a plank or gangway connecting the forward and after ἴκρια of a ship: ἀνεχάζετο θρῆνυν ἐφʼ ἑπταπόδην, λίπε δʼ ἴκρια Il. 15.729.
(1) An uppermost course in a wall, a coping Od. 17.267.
(2) A frieze running along the upper part of the inner walls of a house Od. 6.87.
To finish off the upper part of the wall of (an enclosure) with something intended to give protection or to prevent exit: ἐθρίγκωσεν [αὐλὴν] ἀχέρδῳ Od. 14.10.
(1) The hair of the head: πολιὰς τρίχας Il. 22.77. Cf. Il. 23.135 (locks of hair): Od. 13.399, 431, Od. 18.355. The hair on the limbs: ὀρθαὶ τρίχες ἔσταν ἐνὶ μέλεσσιν Il. 24.359.

(2) The hairs of the mane of a horse Il. 8.83. The hairs of a horse's tail Il. 23.519. The hair on the head of an ox Od. 3.446. Of the wool of sheep Il. 3.273. Of the bristles of swine Il. 19.254: Od. 10.239, 393, Od. 14.422.
Figures or designs in woven work: ἐν θρόνα ἔπασσεν (i.e. in the web) Il. 22.441.

A seat or chair: καθέζετʼ ἐπὶ θρόνου Il. 1.536. Cf. Il. 8.199, 442, Il. 11.645, Il. 14.238, Il. 15.124, 142, 150, Il. 18.389, 422, Od. 3.62, Il. 24.515, 522, 553: κατὰ κλισμούς τε θρόνους τε (the two words hardly to be distinguished) Od. 1.145. Cf. Od. 1.130, Od. 4.51, Od. 5.86, Od. 7.308, Od. 8.65, Od. 17.32, Od. 20.96, Od. 22.23, etc.
Sound, noise; hence, speech Il. 4.437.
To crush, bruise: θρυλίχθη μέτωπον Il. 23.396.
Collectively, rushes Il. 21.351.

forms: (ἀνα-, ἀπο-, ἐκ-, ἐν-, ἐπι-, ἐσ-, προ-, ὑπερ-.)
defs: To leap, spring, bound, dart: κὰδ δʼ ἔθορʼ ἐς μέσσον Il. 4.79. Cf. Il. 5.161, Il. 8.252 = Il. 14.441, Il. 8.320 = Il. 23.509, Il. 10.528, Il. 11.70  =  Il. 17.770, Il. 15.380, 573, 580, 582, 684, Od. 3.381, Il. 21.126: ἀπὸ λέκτροιο θοροῦσα Od. 23.32. Cf. Od. 22.303. Of inanimate objects: ἐκ δʼ ἔθορε κλῆρος κυνέης Il. 6.182. Cf. Il. 13.589, Il. 15.314, 470, Il. 16.773, Il. 23.353: Od. 10.207.
Only in phrase ἐπὶ θρωσμῷ πεδίοιο, a piece of ground rising from, and somewhat above the general level of, the plainIl. 10.160, Il. 11.56  =  Od. 3.3.

forms: Genit. θυγατέρος Il. 21.504: Od. 19.400. θυγατρός Od. 4.4, Od. 6.290, Od. 11.421.
Dat. θυγατέρι Od. 10.106, Od. 15.364. θυγατρί Il. 9.148, 290.
Acc. θυγατέρας Od. 10.7. θύγατρας Il. 22.62: Od. 11.329, Od. 22.222.

defs: (1) A rushing or violent wind or storm: φλογὶ ἶσοι ἠὲ θυέλλῃ Il. 13.39. Cf. Il. 7.346, Il. 12.253, Il. 15.26, Il. 21.335: ἀναρπάξασά μιν θ. θέρεν Od. 4.515, Od. 23.316. Cf. Od. 4.727, Od. 5.317, 419, Od. 7.171, Od. 6.275, Od. 10.48, 54, Od. 12.288, 409, Od. 20.63, 66.
(2) Of a dust-storm: κονίη ἵσταθʼ ὥς τε νέφος ἠὲ θ. Il. 23.366. App. of volcanic fire: πυρὸς ὀλοοῖο θύελλαι Od. 12.68.
Fragrant with the savour of sacrifice: βωμός Il. 8.48, Il. 23.148: Od. 8.363.

forms: App., firstlings of meat given to the gods: ἐν πυρὶ βάλλε θυηλάς Il. 9.220.

defs: Paining or burdening the heart, painful, distressing, grievous Il. 4.513, Il. 9.260, 387, 565: Od. 8.272, Od. 16.69, Od. 18.347 = Od. 20.285, Od. 20.118, Od. 22.189, Od. 23.64, 183, Od. 24.326.

etym: [θυμός + ἀρ-, ἀραρίσκω. Fitted to the heart.]
defs: (1) Such as to inspire affection, lovely, beauteous: ἄλοχον Il. 9.336: Od. 23.232.
(2) Suited to one's taste, grateful to the senses: [ὕδωρ] θυμῆρες κεράσασα (till it became. . .) Od. 10.362.
(3) Suited to one's needs, serviceable: σκῆπρον Od. 17.199.
Endeavouring to rally one's spirit, making a fight for life: ἐκ δʼ ἔπεσον θυμηγερέων Od. 6.283.
Pleasing to the heart, desirable, choice: χρήματα Od. 16.389.
Eating the heart, that will not leave the heart in peace. Epithet of ἔρις Il. 6.210, 301, Il. 16.476, Il. 19.58, Od. 3.253.
Biting the heart, stinging to action: μῦθος Od. 8.185. (Cf. δάκε φρένας μῦθος Il. 5.493.)

forms: Life-destroying: θάνατος Il. 13.544, Il. 16.414 = 580. Cf. Il. 16.591, Il. 18.220.

etym: -οῦ, ὁ. The heart, breast, soul, mind (cf. ἦτορ, καρδίη, κραδίη, κῆρ, φρήν).
defs: (I) As the seat or a seat (when coupled with φρήν, φρένες, κραδίη hardly to be distinguished therefrom)
(II) Vaguely as the seat of κῆρ 2.g: ἐμὸν κῆρ ἄχνυται ἐν θυμῷ Il. 7.524.

(III) One's inward self as a region in which something takes place without outward manifestation: εὔχεθʼ δ̀ν κατὰ θυμόν (in to himself) Il. 23.769: θυμῷ ἐλέαιρε γυναῖκα (without letting any outward sign appear) Od. 19.210. Cf. Od. 5.444, Od. 20.301, Od. 22.411.
(IV) In a more or less physical sense: δ̀ν θυμὸν κατέδων Il. 7.202. Cf. Il. 6.216, Il. 13.280, Il. 15.280, Il. 23.370: οὐκέτι κεύθετε θυμῷ βρωτύν Od. 18.406. Cf. Od. 9.75 = Od. 10.143, Od. 10.379.

forms: Life-destroying: φάρμακα (poisons) Od. 2.329, ἄχος (heart-breaking, crushing) Od. 4.716, κάματον (that crushes the spirit) Od. 10.363, ὅς κε τοῦτον ἀνίαζῃ θ. (molesting or annoying beyond endurance) Od. 19.323.
Absol.: γράψας ἐν πίνακι θυμοφθόρα πολλά (much matter that was to be his death-warrant) Il. 7.169.

defs: A tree not identified, the wood of which emits (sweet) odour when burnt Od. 5.60.
(1) A making of sacrifice, a sacrifice or offering Il. 9.499. In pl. of a single offering: λίσσομʼ ὑπὲρ θυέων Od. 15.261.
(2) What is sacrificed or offered: πρὸς νηὸν ἔρχεο σὺν θυέεσσιν Il. 7.270.

forms: App. a religious adviser skilled in divination from sacrifices, perh. from observation of the smoke thereof Od. 21.145, Od. 22.318, 321.

defs: To impart fragrance to: ἐλαίῳ, τό ῥά οἱ τεθυωμένον ἦεν (which she had by her in (full) fragrance) Il. 14.172.

(1) Out through a door, out of a room or house: βῆ θ. (from his smithy) Il. 18.416. Cf. Il. 24.572: ἢν ἕλκωσι θ. Od. 16.276. Cf. Od. 7.53, Od. 15.62, 451, Od. 19.69, Od. 21.238 = 384. Of leaving a cave Od. 9.418, 444, 461. Of passing the gates of dreams Od. 19.566. With ἐκ: ἐκ θ. ἔδραμον (out of doors) Il. 18.29: δόμων ἐξῆγε θ. Od. 15.465. Cf. Od. 18.386, Od. 19.68, Od. 20.179, 361, 367, Od. 21.89, 299, 388. In pregnant sense: ἐξελθόντες μεγάρων ἕζεσθε θ. (out of doors) Od. 22.375. Cf. Od. 20.97, Od. 22.456.

(2) Forth from a specified or indicated space or region: [ἰχθὺν] ἔρριψε θ. (out of the sea) Od. 12.254, διὰ δʼ ἀμπερὲς ἦλθε θ. ἰός (through and out from the axe-heads) Od. 21.422. With ἐκ: οὐδὲ θ. εἴων ἐξιέναι (from the line of the ships) Il. 18.447. Cf. Il. 5.694, Il. 16.408, Il. 21.29, 237: Od. 5.410.
Watching the door, watch(-dogs): κύνας θυραωρούς Il. 22.69.

forms: Something (in the passages cited a huge stone) placed to block up a door Od. 9.240 = 340, Od. 9.313.

defs: A door (cf. θύρη 1..b) Il. 2.415: αὐλῆς θ. (app., a door leading to the αὐλή from the λαύρἠ Od. 22.137. Cf. Od. 18.385, Od. 21.49.
(3) In locative at the door. Hence, outside Od. 9.238. Out of doors, abroad: κτήματα, τά τʼ ἔνδοθι καὶ τὰ θύρηφιν (i.e. cattle, sheep, etc.) Od. 22.220.

forms: Like θύραζε 2: ὦκα θύρηθʼ ἔα (out of the water) Od. 14.352.

defs: A tassel or pendant. Attached to the aegis: παγχρύσεοι ἐϋπλεκέες Il. 2.448 (app. of twisted wire). To Here's girdle Il. 14.181.

forms: App., mystic implements borne in the rites of Dionysus: θ. χαμαὶ κατέχευαν Il. 7.134.

defs: Furnished with tassels or pendants. Epithet of the aegis Il. 5.738, Il. 15.229, Il. 17.593, Il. 18.204, Il. 21.400.

(1) To run, rush: ἔγχεϊ (spear in hand) Il. 11.180, Il. 16.699, Il. 22.272. Of a river Il. 21.234, 324. Of the sea Il. 23.230: Od. 13.85. Of the wind Od. 12.400, 408, 426 Fig.: ὀλοιῇσι φρεσὶ θύει Il. 1.342.
(2) To run or flow (with a liquid): δάπεδον ἅπαν αἵματι θῦεν Od. 11.420, Od. 22.309 = Od. 24.185.
(1) To offer in sacrifice portions of a  meal before partaking: θεοῖσι θῦσαι ἀνώγει Il. 9.219. Cf. Od. 9.231, Od. 15.222, 260.
(2) To offer (such portions to the gods): ἄργματα θῦσε θεοῖς Od. 14.446.
Sweet-smelling, fragrant Od. 4.121, Od. 5.264, Od. 21.52.
(1) A fine or penalty: σοὶ θωὴν ἐπιθήσομεν Od. 2.192.
(2) Specifically, a fine in place of personal service in war: ἀργαλέην θωὴν ἀλέεινεν Ἀχαιῶν Il. 13.669 (cf. Il. 23.296).

forms: For or with a view to a sitting or assembly: θ. καθίζανον Od. 5.3.

defs: (2) A sitting, session, assembly: οὔθʼ ἡμετέρη ἀγορὴ γένετʼ οὔτε θόωκος Od. 2.26 (the two words hardly to be distinguished). Cf. Od. 15.468. Sim. in pl.: θεῶν ἐξίκετο θώκους (the assembled gods) Il. 8.439.
A breastplate or corslet, consisting of two γύαλα (see γύαλον) Il. 2.544, Il. 3.332, Il. 4.133, Il. 5.99, Il. 11.234, Il. 13.265, Il. 15.529, Il. 19.361, etc.

forms: 3 pl. aor. pass. θωρήχθησαν Il. 3.340, Il. 23.813.
defs: (1) In act., to cause to arm for the fray, get under arms: Ἀχαιούς Il. 2.11, 28 = 65. Cf. Il. 2.72 = 83, Il. 16.155.
(2) In mid. and pass.

(b) App. meaning little more than to have one's station, post oneself, stand, be: ἐπʼ ἀριστερὰ θωρήσσοντο Il. 2.526, πρὸ φθίων θωρηχθέντες (acting as their leaders) Il. 13.699, ἅμα πατρόκλῳ θωρηχθέντες (following him) Il. 16.257. Cf. Il. 2.587, 818, Il. 4.252, Il. 11.709, Il. 16.218.

forms: A beast of prey, perh. the jackal Il. 11.474, 479, 481, Il. 13.103.
3 sing. aor. subj. ἰήνῃ Il. 24.119, 147, 176, 196. Impl. pl. ἰήνατε Od. 8.426.
defs: (1) To warm, heat: χαλκὸν ἰήνατε Od. 8.426. Cf. Od. 10.359, Od. 12.175.

(2) To gladden, rejoice, cheer, comfort, placate: ἵνα φρεσὶ σῇσιν ἰανθῇς Il. 19.174, τοῖο θυμὸς ἰάνθη ὡς εἴ τε περὶ σταχύεσσιν ἐέρση ληΐου Il. 23.598 (app., was gladdened as the dew upon the ears is warmed (sense (1)). V.l. ἐέρσῃ, as (the heart) of the corn is gladdened with the dew upon the ears). Cf. Il. 23.600, Il. 24.119 = 147 = 176 = 196, 321: εἰς ὅ κε σὸν κῆρ ἰανθῇ Od. 22.59. Cf. Od. 4.549, 840, Od. 7.156, Od. 15.165, 379, Od. 19.537, Od. 23.47. To unbend (the brow): οὐδὲ μέτωπον ἰάνθη Il. 15.103.
(1) To shoot, discharge, let fly (a missile): ὀϊστόν Il. 8.300, 309.

(2) Hence, to send, let loose (bane): ὥς κʼ ὔμμι ἐπὶ κῆρας ἰήλω Od. 2.316. To send (a wind) Od. 15.475. To throw on, put on (a bond or manacle): περὶ χερσὶ δεσμὸν ἴηλα Il. 15.19. Sim. of a means of fastening a gate Od. 21.241. To apply or tie (a knot): ἐπὶ δεσμὸν ἴηλον Od. 8.443. Cf. Od. 8.447. To put forth (the hands) Il. 9.91 = 221 = Il. 24.627: = Od. 1.149  =  Od. 4.67 = 218 = Od. 5.200 = Od. 8.71 = 484 = Od. 14.453 = Od. 15.142  =  Od. 16.54 = Od. 17.98 = Od. 20.256, Od. 10.376. In hostile sense Od. 9.288.
(3) To fling at, assail: ἀτιμίῃσιν (with . . .) Od. 13.142.

forms: To heal, cure, make whole, tend: παιήονά [μιν] ἀνώγειν ἰήσασθαι Il. 5.899. Cf. Il. 5.904, Il. 12.2: Od. 9.520, Od. 19.460.
With the injured part as object: ὀθφθαλμόν Od. 9.525.

defs: To hurt, mar Od. 2.376, Od. 4.749.
(1) To lie, rest, pass the night (not necessarily implying sleeping): Ζηνὸς ἐν ἀγκοίνῃσιν ἰαύεις Il. 14.213. Cf. Od. 11.261, Od. 22.464, Od. 24.209. Of sheep, goats or swine Od. 9.184, Od. 14.16.
(2) To pass (the night): ἀΰπνους νύκτας ἴαυον Il. 9.325. Cf. Il. 9.470: Od. 3.151, 490, Od. 5.154, Od. 15.40, 188, Od. 16.367, Od. 19.340, 342.
(3) To bivouac Il. 18.259, Il. 19.71. To keep night-watch. Of dogs Od. 14.21.

etym: [For the impf. forms, 3 sing. ἴαχε and 3 pl. ἴαχον (with ἴαχον Il. 23.766 ), should prob. be read ϝάχε, ἔϝαχε, εὔαχε (cf. εὔαδε) and ϝάκον, ἔϝακον, εὔαχον, as aorists. But ἴαχον in Il. 4.506  =  Il. 17.317 seems to be for ϝίϝαχον,
defs: (1) To shout, cry, call. In battle or for the fight Il. 4.506 = Il. 17.317, Il. 5.302 = Il. 8.321 = Od. 3.285, Il. 11.463, Il. 13.834, Il. 14.421, Il. 16.785, Il. 17.213, 723, Il. 18.160, 228, Il. 19.41, 424, Od. 3.382, 443: Od. 22.81. In rushing from an ambush Od. 4.454. In assent or approval: Ἀργεῖοι μέγʼ ἴαχον Il. 2.333, 394. In encouragement Il. 23.766. On seeing an encouraging omen Il. 13.822. In pain or grief Il. 5.343, Il. 18.29. In terror or affright Od. 3.62: Od. 10.323. In giving a signal Il. 21.341. Of the cry of a frightened infant Il. 7.468.

(2) Of inanimate objects. Of water, to plash: κῦμα μεγάλʼ ἴαχεν Il. 1.482: = Od. 2.428. Of fire, to roar Il. 23.216. Of a bow-string, to twang Il. 4.125. Of a trumpet, to sound Il. 18.219. Of heated metal plunged in water, to hiss Od. 9.392. Of something reechoing sound: περὶ δʼ ἴαχε πέτρη Od. 9.395. Cf. Il. 21.10.
The hollow of the knee, the ham: κατʼ ἰγνύην βεβλημένος Il. 13.212.

forms: And: ὤμοισιν ἰδὲ στέρνοισιν Il. 3.194, κνῆμαί τε ἰδ̀ σφυρά Il. 4.147. Cf. Il. 2.511, 697, Il. 4.382, Il. 5.3, 171, etc.: Od. 4.604, Od. 9.186, Od. 11.337, 431, 626, etc.
App. as genit.: Ἴδηθεν μεδέων Il. 3.276 = 320 = Il. 6.202 = Il. 24.308.

defs: Private, personal: πρῆξις ἥδʼ ἰδίη, οὐ δήμιος Od. 3.82. Absol.: δήμιον ἦ ἴδιον Od. 4.314.
(1) To bend or double up one's body, curl oneself up: ὁ δʼ ἰδνώθη (in pain) Il. 2.266, ἰδνώθη πεσών (in the death-struggle) Il. 13.618. Cf. Od. 22.85.
(2) To bend the body for an upward throw: ἰδνωθεὶς ὀπίσω Od. 8.375. Sim., of an eagle bending back his head in order to use his beak Il. 12.205.

forms: Skill: ἰδρείῃ πολέμοιο (skill in war) Il. 16.359. Cf. Il. 6.198.
With infin.: ἴδριες νῆα ἐλαυνέμεν (in propelling . . .) Od. 6.108.
Acc. sing. pres. pple. ἱδρώοντα Il. 18.372.
defs: (1) To sweat Il. 2.390, Il. 11.119, 598, Il. 18.372, Il. 8.543: = Od. 4.39. With cognate acc.: ἱδρῶ δ̀ν ἵδρωσα Il. 4.27.
(2) To be covered with sweat: ἱδρώσει τευ τελαμών Il. 2.388

forms: 3 pl. aor. pass. ἱδρύνθησαν Il. 3.78, Il. 6.56. (καθ-.)
defs: (1) To cause to be seated: ἵδρυε λαούς Il. 2.191. Cf. Il. 15.142: Od. 3.37, Od. 5.86.
(2) In pass., to be seated. In aor., to sit down: τοὶ δʼ ἱδρύνθησαν ἅπαντες Il. 3.78 = Il. 6.56.

forms: A priestess attached to the service of a particular goddess: Ἀθηναίης ἱέρειαν Il. 7.300.
ὁ. Also ἱρεύς Il. 5.10, Il. 16.604: Od. 9.198.
defs: A priest attached to the service of a particular god: ἱερεὺς Ἀπόλλωνος Il. 1.370. Cf. Il. 1.23 = 377, Il. 1.62, Il. 5.10, Il. 9.575, Il. 16.604, Il. 24.221: Od. 9.198.

forms: 3 pl. pa. iterative ἱρεύεσκον Od. 20.3. ἱέρευτο Il. 24.125 is prob. to be taken as impf. pass. assimilated to forms like στεῦτο.
defs: (1) To sacrifice (an animal to a god): Ἀθηναίῃ βοῦς Il. 7.94 = 275, 309. Cf. Il. 21.131, Il. 23.147: Od. 13.182. To the spirit of a deceased man: τειρεσίῃ ὄϊν Od. 10.524 = Od. 11.32.

(2) To kill (an animal) for a meal, parts being offered as firstlings to a god or the gods: τοῖσι βοῦν ἱέρευσε κρονίωνι Il. 6.314. Cf. Il. 2.402, Il. 7.174, Il. 18.559, Il. 24.125: δεῖπνον συῶν ἱερεύσατε ὅς τις ἄριστος (for the meal) Od. 24.215. Cf. Od. 2.56 = Od. 17.535, Od. 8.59, Od. 13.24, Od. 14.28, 74, 94, 414, Od. 16.454, Od. 17.180  =  Od. 20.250, Od. 17.181 = Od. 20.251, Od. 20.3, 391. In mid.: δῶκα βοῦς ἱερεύσασθαι Od. 19.198.
(1) An animal for sacrifice Od. 11.23.

(2) An animal to be killed as under ἱερεύω. (2): ἑταῖροι δαίνυντʼ αὐτὰρ ἐγὼν ἱερήϊα πολλὰ παρεῖχον Od. 14.250. Cf. Od. 17.600. So doubtless οὐχ ἱ. ἀρνύσθην Il. 22.159 (i.e. as a prize). As object to ἱερεύω. (2): οὔ ποθʼ ἓν ἱρεύσʼ ἱ. Od. 14.94.

etym: -ή, -όν. Also ὶρός -ή, -όν Il. 2.420, Il. 4.46, Il. 7.96, Il. 17.193, Il. 21.128, etc.: Od. 1.66, Od. 3.278, Od. 9.553, Od. 17.293, etc. Sacred, holy, set apart.
defs: (1) Of sacrifices Il. 1.99, 431, 443, 447, Il. 23.146: Od. 3.144, Od. 4.478, Od. 11.132 = Od. 23.279, Od. 20.276. Of altars Il. 2.305: Od. 3.273. Of a temple: θύρας ἱεροῖο δόμοιο Il. 7.89. Of the site of a sacred grove: Ὀγχηστὸν ἱερόν, ποσιδήϊον ἄλσος Il. 2.506.

(2) Epithet of places: ̓́ιλιος ἱρή Il. 4.46. Cf. Il. 1.366, Il. 2.535, 625, Il. 4.103, Il. 5.446, etc.: πύλου ἱερῆς Od. 21.108. Cf. Od. 1.2, Od. 3.278, Od. 9.165, Od. 11.86, 323, Od. 17.293. Sim.: ἱερὰ ρείχεα Θήβης Il. 4.378. Cf. Il. 16.100. Of rivers (as sprung from Zeus): ἱερὸν ῥόον Ἀλφειοῖο Il. 11.726. Cf. Od. 10.351.
(3) Epithet of natural periods of time half-personified as divine controlling powers: κνέφας Il. 11.194 = 209 = Il. 17.455, ἦμαρ Il. 8.66 = Il. 11.84: = Od. 9.56.

(4) Of things regarded as divine by connexion or relation: ἀλωάς (as being consecrated to Demeter) Il. 5.499, ἀλφίτου (as being the gift of Demeter) Il. 11.631, κύκλῳ (justice, the care of Zeus, being there dispensed) Il. 18.504. Cf. Il. 15.39, Il. 16.658: βήσσας (as being about the dwelling of Circe) Od. 10.275, ἐλαίης (as being near the nymphhaunted cave) Od. 13.372. Cf. Od. 10.426, 445, 554. Sim.: ἰχθύν (perh. referring to a religious scruple against eating fish) Il. 16.407, δίφρῳ (app. as drawn by divine steeds) Il. 17.464.

(5) Of persons regarded as divine by connexion or relation. Epithet of King Alcinous (as holding office from Zeus) Od. 6.167, Od. 8.2, 4 = 421, Od. 8.385, Od. 13.20, 24. Applied also to Antinous Od. 18.34. Of Telemachus (as being under the special protection of Athene) Od. 2.409 = Od. 18.405  =  Od. 21.101, Od. 16.476, Od. 18.60 = Od. 21.130, Od. 22.354. Applied to persons dignified by being charged with a special function: πυλαωρούς Il. 24.681. Sim. applied to the post occupied by such persons: φυλάκων τέλος Il. 10.56. Extended to a whole host (perh. as being engaged in a  pious work): Ἀργείων στρατός Od. 24.81.
(6) Absol. in neut.
(b) App., a sacrifice = c: ὄφρʼ ἱρὸν ἑτοιμασσαίατʼ Ἀθήνῃ (a sacrifice at which the arms were to be dedicated) Il. 10.571.

(c) In pl., offerings, a sacrifice, sacrifices: ὑπίσχετο ἱερά Il. 23.195. Cf. Il. 1.147, Il. 2.420, Il. 5.178, Il. 9.357, Il. 10.46, Il. 11.707, 727, Il. 23.207, 209: ἱερὰ ῥέζον Od. 3.5. Cf. Od. 1.61, 66, Od. 3.159, 436, Od. 4.473, Od. 5.102, Od. 6.191, Od. 9.553, Od. 11.130, Od. 16.184, Od. 23.277. The actual burnt-offering: σπένδων οἶνον ἐπʼ αἰθομένοις ἱεροῖσιν Il. 11.775. Cf. Od. 12.362.
(1) To cause to be seated: ἀγῶνα Il. 23.258.
(2) To sit: ἐν τῷ ἵζανον Od. 24.209 (i.e. used it as a sitting-room). Fig. of sleep: οὔ μοι ἐπʼ ὄμμασιν ὕπνος ἱζάνει Il. 10.92.

forms: redup. fr. σ(ε)δ-, the rough breathing representing the first σ. Cf. ἕζομαι, ἱδρύω.]
3 sing. pa. iterative ἵζεσκε Il. 24.472: Od. 3.409.
Imp. mid. ἵζευ Il. 3.162, Il. 6.115. (ἐσ-, ἐφ-, καθ-, μετα-, παρ-, προκαθ-.)
defs: (1) To cause to seat oneself, bid be seated: μή μʼ ἐς θρόνον ἵζε Il. 24.553. To cause (an assembly) to sit for business: βουλήν Il. 2.53.

(2) To seat oneself, sit down: ἀντίον ἷζεν Ὀδυσσῆος Il. 9.218. Cf. Il. 2.96, Il. 9.13, 87, Il. 13.281, Il. 18.422, Od. 3.15, Il. 21.520, Il. 23.28: ἐπʼ οὐδοῦ ἶζεν Od. 4.718, Od. 17.339, ἵζʼ ἐπὶ δεῖπνον (sit down to . . .) Od. 24.394. Cf. Od. 5.198, 338, Od. 8.469, Od. 14.79, Od. 16.53, Od. 17.96, Od. 19.389. In mid.: πάροιθʼ ἵζευ ἐμεῖο Il. 3.162. Cf. Il. 3.326, Il. 6.115, Il. 18.522, Il. 19.50: Od. 22.335.
(3) To have one's seat, be seated, sit: ὅς οἱ πλησίον ἷζεν Od. 6.171. Cf. Il. 24.472: Od. 3.409, Od. 11.449, Od. 21.146. Of a scout, to be posted: σκοποὶ ἷζον ἐπʼ ἄκριας Od. 16.365. Cf. Il. 2.792.

forms: Pl. pple. ἱέντες Il. 2.774: Od. 4.626, Od. 17.168.
3 sing. ἕηκε (ἔσηκἐ Il. 1.48. ἧκε Il. 1.195, Il. 4.75, Il. 5.513, etc.: Od. 7.231, Od. 9.481, Od. 16.191, etc.
Mid. 3 pl. aor. ἕντο Il. 1.469, Il. 6.323, Il. 9.92, Il. 23.57, etc.: Od. 1.150, Od. 4.68, Od. 14.454, Od. 17.99, etc. Pass 3. pl. pres. ἵενται Il. 4.77.
(ἀν-, ἀποπρο-, ἀφ-, ἐν-, ἐξ-, ἐξαν-, ἐπιπρο-, ἐφ-, καθ-, μεθ-, παρ-, προ-, συν-, ὑπερ-, ὑφ-.)
defs: (1) To send forth, throw, hurl, launch, let fly (a missile): ὀϊστόν Il. 13.650, δόρυ Il. 16.608. Cf. Il. 1.48, 382, Il. 2.774, Il. 3.12, Il. 4.498 = Il. 15.575, Il. 6.269, Il. 8.134, Il. 16.736, Il. 22.206, Il. 23.840, 863: δίσκον Od. 8.189. Cf. Od. 4.626 = Od. 17.168, Od. 8.203, Od. 9.481, 538, Od. 21.420. Absol., to throw, make a throw, make one's throw: ἥσω καὶ ἐγώ Il. 17.515. Cf. Il. 15.359: Od. 9.499. To shoot one's arrow: διὰ δʼ ἧκε σιδήρου Od. 21.328, Od. 24.177.
(2) In gen., to throw, send, cause to fall: ἐέρσας ἐξ αἰθέρος Il. 11.53. Cf. Il. 13.204, Il. 21.120.
(3) To send from oneself, let fall from one's grasp: φάσγανον ἧκε χαμᾶζε Od. 22.84. Cf. Il. 12.205, Il. 17.299. To let (oneself) fall: ἧκα καθύπερθε πόδας καὶ χεῖρε Od. 12.442.
(4) To shed (tears) Od. 16.191, Od. 23.33.
(5) To send forth (the voice): ἱεῖσαι ὄπα κάλλιμον Od. 12.192. Cf. Il. 3.152, 221, Il. 14.151.

(6) To cause (waters) to flow: ἐς τεῖχος ἵει ῥόον Il. 12.25. Of a river, to send or roll (its waters): ᾗ πρόσθεν ἵεν [ποταμοὶ] ὕδωρ Il. 12.33. Cf. Il. 21.158. Absol.: Ἐνιπῆος, δς κάλλιστος ποταμῶν ἐπὶ γαῖαν ἵησιν Od. 11.239. So of a fountain: δύω κρῆναι ἡ μὲν . . . ἡ δ ὑπʼ αὐλῆς οὐδὸν ἵησδιν Od. 6.130.

(7) To send or dispatch as a messenger, on a specified or indicated mission, for some purpose, to a specified destination: πρὸ γὰρ ἧκέ μιν Ἥρη Il. 18.168. Cf. Il. 1.195, 208, Il. 4.397, Il. 18.182, Il. 24.375: ἄγγελον ἧκαν Od. 15.458. Cf. Od. 10.159, Od. 21.21. To cause (a person) to come forth, bring (him) forth: αἰνείαν ἐξ ἀδύτοιο Il. 5.513. To send (a wind): ἴκμενον οὖρον ἵει Il. 1.479: Od. 2.420 = Od. 15.292, Od. 11.7 = Od. 12.149. To send (evil): κακότητα Il. 10.71.
(8) In gen., to send forth, cause to appear: δράκοντα φόωσδε Il. 2.309, τοῦ πολλοὶ ἀπὸ σπινθῆρες ἵενται Il. 4.77. Cf. Il. 4.75, Il. 8.76, 247 = Il. 24.315, Il. 10.274: Od. 21.415.

(9) To expel by satiety, put thus away (desire, inclination or appetite, thought of as something physical): ἐπὴν γόου ἐξ ἔρον εἵην Il. 24.227. Cf. Il. 13.638. In mid.: ἐπεὶ πόσιος καὶ ἐδητύος ἐξ ἔρον ἕντο Il. 1.469 = Il. 2.432 = Il. 6.323 = Il. 9.92 = 222 = Il. 23.57 = Il. 24.628:  =  Od. 1.150 = Od. 3.67 = 473 = Od. 4.68 = Od. 8.72 = 485 = Od. 12.308 = Od. 14.454 = Od. 15.143 = 303 = 501 = Od. 16.55 = 480 = Od. 17.99, ἐπεὶ σίτοιο ἐξ ἔρον ἕντο Od. 24.489.

(10) To cause to be in a specified place or position, set, place, put, hang, throw: ἐν ἕρματα ἧκε λοβοῖσιν Il. 14.182, ὑπὸ θρῆνυν ἥσει 240, ἐκ ποδοῖιν ἄκμονας ἧκα Il. 15.19, ἐν αὐτὸν ἵει πυρί (set him on fire) Il. 21.338. Cf. Il. 18.612, Il. 19.383 = Il. 22.316: κατὰ κάρητος οὔλας ἧκε κόμας Od. 7.231 = Od. 23.158, ὑπʼ ἔμβρυον ἧκεν ἑκάστῃ Od. 9.245 = 309 = 342. Cf. Od. 10.317, Od. 19.57, Od. 21.47. Of harnessing a horse: ἐν παρηορίῃσι πήδασον ἵει Il. 16.152. Of applying fire: ἐν πυρὸς μένος ἧκεν Il. 23.177.
(11) To inspire or infuse (spirit, panic): ἔν τοι στήθεσσι μένος ἧκα Il. 5.125, ἐν κυδοιμὸν ἧκεν Il. 11.539. Cf. Il. 15.327, Il. 16.291, 730, Il. 23.400.

forms: (ϝίημι). Only in mid. Fut. εἴσομαι (ϝίσομαἰ Il. 14.8, Il. 21.335, Il. 24.462: Od. 22.7.
defs: (1) To aim at, take one's aim at. With genit.: Ὀδυσῆος ἐείσατο Od. 22.89. With acc.: σκοπὸν ἄλλον εἴσομαι Od. 22.7 (or the word may be referred to εἴδω III.10).

(2) To desire, be eager or anxious, long, to do something specified or indicated, be set on doing it: τό οἱ οὔ τις ἐρύκακεν ἱεμένων περ Il. 15.450 = Il. 17.292. Cf. Il. 16.396, Il. 17.276: ἕεται αἰνῶς Od. 2.327. Cf. Od. 1.6, Od. 4.284, Od. 10.246, Od. 16.430, Od. 21.129, Od. 22.256, 273, 409, Od. 23.353. With complementary infin.: ἵετʼ αἰνείαν κτεῖναι Il. 5.434, ἱέμενος τροίην ἐξαλαπάξαι (in my eagerness to . . .) Il. 8.241. Cf. Il. 2.589, Il. 8.301 = 310, Il. 11.537, Il. 12.68, Il. 13.386, 424, 501 = Il. 16.761, Il. 13.585, Il. 16.359, 383 = 866, Il. 16.507, Il. 18.501, 547, Od. 3.469, 502: ἱέσθην ἐπὶ νῆα ϝέεσθαι Od. 3.344, ἐμὲ ἱέμενοι  γῆμαι Od. 21.72. Cf. Od. 1.58, Od. 4.823 = Od. 13.426 = Od. 15.30, Od. 14.142, 282, Od. 15.201. To be eager to go or make one's way in a specified direction: οἴκαδε ἱεμένων Il. 2.154. Cf. Od. 3.160, Od. 9.261, Od. 17.5, Od. 19.187. Of a missile weapon checked in its eager course: ἐγχείη ἐνὶ γαίῃ ἔστη ἱεμένη Od. 3.280. So with complementary infin.: ἐγχείη ἐνὶ γαίῃ ἔστη ἱεμένη χροὸς ἄμεναι Il. 21.70.
(3) To be eager for, strive for, be set upon. With genit.: νίκης ἱεμένων Il. 23.371. Cf. Il. 23.718, 767: ἱέμενον νόστοιο Od. 15.69.

(4) To hasten, speed, rush, press, make one's way: πρόσω ἵεσθε Il. 12.274, τάχα εἴσομαι Il. 14.8 (or the word may be referred to εἴδω III.1), πάλιν εἴσομαι Il. 24.462. Cf. Il. 8.313, Il. 12.118, Il. 13.291, 707, Il. 15.415, Il. 16.382: ἱεμένων?̓́ερεβόσδε Od. 20.356. Cf. Od. 22.304. With genit. of the point aimed at: ἱέμενοι πόλιος Il. 11.168: ἱέμενος ποταμοῖο ῥοάων (moving towards the river) Od. 10.529. With fut. pple. indicating purpose: ζεφύροιο εἴσομαι ὄρσουσα θύελλαν Il. 21.335. Cf. Od. 15.213. So with fut. infin.: ἐεισάσθην τεύχεα δυλήσειν Il. 15.544. With aor. infin.: ἄλλος κʼ ἀνὴρ ἵετο ἰδέειν παῖδας Od. 13.334. Of a weapon, to take its way: διαπρὸ εἴσατο χαλκός Il. 5.538 = Il. 17.518: = Od. 24.524. Cf. Il. 4.138, Il. 15.543, Od. 3.399.
(5) App., to reach. With genit.: οὔ πῃ χροὸς εἴσατο Il. 13.191 (for the sense with v.l. χρώς see εἴδω II.1).
A healer, a surgeon and physician: ἕλκος ἰ. ἐπιμάσσεται Il. 4.190. Cf. Il. 2.732, Il. 4.194, Il. 11.518, 835: Od. 17.384.
Born in wedlock, legitimate. Absol.: ἶσόν μʼ ἰθαγενέεσσιν ἐτίμα Od. 14.203.

forms: Gait: πελειάσιν ἴθμαθʼ ὁμοῖαι (app., with short, quick steps) Il. 5.778.

defs: (1) Straight, straight on, without turning aside: μένος χειρῶν ἰθὺς φέρον Il. 5.506, ἰθὺς πρὸς τεῖχος ἔκιον Il. 12.137. Cf. Il. 8.118, Il. 11.95, Il. 12.124, 330, Il. 13.135, Il. 16.168, 492, Od. 3.79, 99, 108, 172, 386, Il. 22.143, 243, 284: Od. 3.10, Od. 17.33, Od. 23.207, Od. 24.101, 397.
(2) Of position, straight, direct: τέτραπτο πρὸς ἰθύ οἱ Il. 14.403 (straight towards him, i.e. he had him right in the line of his throw): ἰθὺς τετραμμένος (facing the foe) Il. 17.227.

(3) Straight towards, to, at. With genit.: ἰθὺς μενελάου ἤϊεν Il. 13.601. Cf. Il. 5.849, Il. 11.289, Il. 12.254, 453, Il. 16.584, Il. 21.540, etc.: βῆ δʼ ἰθὺς προθύροιο Od. 1.119. Cf. Od. 2.301, Od. 3.17, Od. 15.511, Od. 17.325, Od. 24.241.
