A spade or shovel Od. 22.455.
(1) To make entreaty or petition to, entreat, supplicate : μιν Il. 9.581. Cf. Il. 22.414, Il. 24.357 : Od. 6.145, Od. 10.481.
(2) To pray to (a divine power). With infin. : πολλὰ λιτάνευεν [ἀνέμους] ἐλθέμεν Il. 23.196.

A prayer : εὐχωλῇσι λιτῇσί τε ἐλλισάμην (the two words hardly to be distinguished) Od. 11.34. Personified : λιταί εἰσι (there are such beings as...) Διὸς κοῦραι Il. 9.502 (i.e. prayers of repentance, for forgiveness, addressed by an offender to the person injured).
The lobe of the ear Il. 14.182.

forms: In pl., talk, discourse : τὸν ἔτερπε λόγοις Il. 15.393. Cf. Od. 1.56.

defs: In pl., water for washing or bathing Il. 14.6, Il. 22.444, 445, Il. 23.44 : Od. 8.249, 451. Fig. : λοετρῶν Ὠκεανοῖο (the baths of ocean) Il. 18.489 : =Od. 5.275.
An attendant who poured out water for the bath Od. 20.297.– λ. τρίπος, a caldron in which to heat water for the bathIl. 18.346 : Od. 8.435.

forms: Libation : λοιβῆς τε κνίσης τε Il. 4.49 = Il. 24.70. Cf. Il. 9.500.
Applied ironically to the wine brought for the Cyclops Od. 9.349.
Baneful : λοίγια ἔργα, sad work, a bad businessIl. 1.518, 573.
Absol. in neut. pl. λοίγια in same sense : οἴω λοίγιʼ ἔσεσθαι Il. 21.533, Il. 23.310.

defs: Bane, evil, death, destruction : λοιγὸν ἀμῦναι Il. 1.67. Cf. Il. 1.456, Il. 5.662, Il. 8.130, Il. 13.426, Il. 16.32, Il. 21.134, etc.
Plague, pestilence Il. 1.61.
Of a prize, for the last, the last Il. 23.785. Absol. in neut. pl. λοισθήϊα, the last prizeIl. 23.751.
A husk or skin : σιγαλόεντα, οἷόν τε κρομύοιο λοπὸν κάτα ἰσχαλέοιο Od. 19.233 (glistening as (there is glistening) over the skin of ..., i.e. glistening like the skin of ...).

forms: Nom. sing. fem. pple. λούσασα Od. 5.264.
Infin. mid. λούεσθαι Il. 7.508, Il. 15.265. λοῦσθαι Od. 7.216.
Pf. pple. λελουμένος Il. 5.6. From λοέω (λοϝέω) impf. λόεον Od. 4.252.
Fut. mid. (or aor. subj.) λοέσσομαι Od. 7.221.
Pple. λοεσσάμενος, -η Il. 10.577, Il. 21.560 : Od. 1.310, Od. 7.96, Od. 8.427. (ἀπο-)
defs: (1) To wash the body of, cause to bathe : τηλέμαχον λοῦσε πολυκάστη Od. 3.464. Cf. Il. 5.905 : Od. 4.49, Od. 5.264, Od. 7.210, Od. 8.364, Od. 19.320, Od. 23.154, etc. In reference to cleansing a corpse Il. 16.669, 679, Il. 18.350, Il. 24.582, 587. In reference to horses : λοέσσας [ἵππους] ὕδατι Il. 23.282.
(2) With ἀπό, to wash away or off : εἰς ὅ κε λούσῃ ἄπο βρότον Il. 14.7. With double acc.  of what is cleansed and of what is washed away : ὄφρα Πάτροκλον λούσειαν ἄπο βρότον Il. 18.345.

(3) In mid., to wash one's body, bathe oneself : ἐς ἀσαμίνθους βάντες λούσαντο Il. 10.576, λοεσσάμενος ποταμοῖο (genit. of space or material, in the ...) Il. 21.560. Cf. Il. 10.577: Od. 1.310, Od. 4.48, Od. 7.96, Od. 8.427, Od. 23.131, Od. 24.254, etc. Of a horse : εἰωθὼς λούεσθαι ποταμοῖο Il. 7.508=Il. 15.265. Fig. of a star : λελουμένος Ὠκεανοῖο Il. 5.6.
(4) In mid., with ἀπό, to wash away or off from one's body : λούσασθαι ἄπο βρότον Il. 23.41.
The bristly back of a wild boar: φρίξας εὖ λοφιήν Od. 19.446.
(1) The neck Il. 10.573. Of horses Il. 23.508.

(2) A crest or plume on a helmet: δεινὸν λόφος καθύπερθεν ἔνευεν Il. 3.337=Il. 11.42=Il. 15.481=Il. 16.138, κόρυθος φάλον ἤλασεν ὑπὸ λόφον αὐτόν (just at the base of it) Il. 13.615. Cf. Il. 7.469, Il. 15.537, Il. 18.612, Il. 19.383=Il. 22.316 : Od. 22.124.
(3) The crest or summit of a hill Od. 11.596. An eminence or ridge : ὅθι (́ερμαιος λ. ἐστίν Od. 16.471.

forms: 3 pl. λοχόωσι Od. 13.425, Od. 15.28. λοχῶσι Od. 14.181.
Nom. pl. masc. ppl.e λοχόωντες Od. 4.847, Od. 16.369.
To lie in wait for, lie in ambush for: λοχόωσί μιν νέοι Od. 13.425. Cf. Od. 4.847, Od. 14.181, Od. 15.28, Od. 16.369, Od. 22.53.
Absol. : ὅθι σφίσιν εἶκε λοχῆσαι Il. 18.520.

defs: The lair of a wild beast : ἐν λόχμῃ κατέκειτο σῦς Od. 19.439.

forms: For, to take part in, with a view to, an ambush : λόχονδʼ ἰέναι Il. 1.227. Cf. Od. 14.217.

defs: (1) A body of men lying in wait or in ambush or detailed for such a purpose : εἷσε λόχον Il. 7.189, μὴ λόχος εἰσέλθῃσι πόλιν (a body detailed to effect a surprise) Il. 8.522. Cf. Il. 4.392, Il. 13.285 : Od. 4.531, Od. 14.469.

(2) A lying in wait, an ambush : λόχῳ ὑπεθωρήσσοντο (for ...) Il. 18.513, μὴ δείσητʼ Ἀργείων λόχον (any attempt at surprise on their part) Il. 24.779. Cf. Il. 13.277 : Od. 4.395, 441, Od. 11.525, Od. 16.463.
(3) A place of concealment with a view to hostile action, a lurking-place : ἐκ λόχου ἀμπήδησεν Il. 11.379. Applied to the Trojan horse Od. 4.277, Od. 8.515.
(4) App. a band or troop : εἴ περ πεντήκοντα λόχοι ἀνθρώπων νῶϊ περισταῖεν Od. 20.49.

forms: A pliant twig, a withy Il. 11.105 : Od. 9.427, Od. 10.166.

defs: (1) As a term of contempt, sorry, pitiful, good for nothing, of no account : ὅς τις πολέμοιο μεθείη λ, ἐών Il. 13.119. Cf. Il. 13.237 : Od. 9.454, Od. 18.107.

(2) Bringing or inferring wretchedness or woe, wretched, woeful, miserable, painful, distressing, baleful, disastrous: ὄλεθρον Il. 2.873, γήραϊ Il. 5.153, ἀγγελίης Il. 17.642. Cf. Il. 7.16, Il. 13.346, Il. 22.242, etc. : νόστον Od. 1.327, πένθεϊ Od. 2.70, κήδεα Od. 11.369. Cf. Od. 1.341, Od. 3.87, Od. 23.224, Od. 24.250, etc. As epithet of war : δαϊ Il. 13.286, Il. 24.739. Of the belly Od. 17.473. Bringing evil consequences, ill-wrought : ἀνδροκτασίης Il. 23.86. Carring bale, deadly, fatal : σήματα Il. 7.168. Of drugs, working evil effects, bringing to ill Od. 4.230, Od. 10.236. Of a wound, deep-struck, sore Il. 15.393, Il. 19.49. Of garments, foul, sorry, evil Od. 16.457, Od. 17.203=Od. 24.158, Od. 17.338, 573.

(3) Absol. in neut. pl., things of ill, evils : πόλεμοις καὶ ἄκοντες καὶ ὀϊστοί, λυγρά Od. 14.226. Evil fortune, ill : ᾧ κε τῶν λυγρῶν δώῃ Il. 24.531. Cf. Od. 18.134. Bane, evil : ταῦτʼ ἐμεήσατο λυγρά Od. 3.303.– In ethical sense, evil, mischief : λυγρὰ ἰδυῖα (cherishing evil in her heart) Od. 11.432 (see εἴδω III.12).

forms: So as to inflict pain, sorely : πεπληγυῖα Il. 5.763.
Gore: λύθρῳ παλάσσετο χεῖρας Il. 11.169. Cf. Il. 7.268, Il. 3.503 : Od. 22.402=Od. 23.48.

etym: [λυκ-, light, as in λύχνος + βα-, βαίνω. The going of light.]
forms: Thus, prob., the period of time in which daylight goes and comes again : τοῦδʼ αὐτοῦ λυκάβαντος (within a day's space, ere the sun shall set again) Od. 19.306.
(This interpretation involves bracketing Od. 14.161-162 (=Od. 19.306-307); but is obviously superior to the interpretation a year.)

defs: A wolf-skin Il. 10.459.
Thus, wolf-born. Epithet of Apollo Il. 4.101, 119.
In pl., defilement, impurities : ἀπὸ χροὸς λύματα πάντα κάντα κάθηρεν Il. 14.171. Cf. Il. 1.314.
That relaxes the limbs. Epithet of sleep Od. 20.57, Od. 23.343.
A releasing or ransoming : ἀνάβλησις λύσιος Il. 24.655. A means of release from the toils of something, a means of escape : θανάτου λύσιν Od. 9.421.
Rage, fury, lust of battle : λύσσαν ἔχων ὀλοήν Il. 9.305. Cf. Il. 9.239, Il. 21.542.

forms: One who is raging mad : τοῦτον κύνα λυσσητῆρα (that mad dog) Il. 8.299.

defs: Raging, consumed with lust of battle. Absol. : ὁ λυσσώδης,  Ἕκτωρ Il. 13.53.

forms: 3 sing. aor. pass. λύθη Il. 5.296, Il. 8.123, 315, Il. 17.298.
3 pl. plupf. ἐλέλυντο Od. 22.186. λέλυντο Il. 13.85.
(ἀνα-, ἀπο-, ἐκ-, ἐξανα-, κατα-, ὑπεκπρο-, ὑπο-.)
defs: (1) To loosen, undo, unfasten, untie : ζωστῆρα Il. 4.215. Cf. Il. 16.804 : πρυμνήσια Od. 2.418. Cf. Od. 3.392, Od. 5.459, Od. 13.77, etc. In mid.:  λύοντο τεύχεʼ ἀπʼ ὤμων Il. 17.318. In proper mid. sense of unfastening something from oneself : ἀπὸ στήθεσφιν ἐλύσαθʼ ἱμάντα Il. 14.214. Of loosening the maiden girdle Od. 11.245. To undo the fastening of : ἀσκόν Od. 10.47. To strike (sail) : λύον ἱστία Od. 15.496.

(2) To set free from bonds or confinement, to release, relax one's hold upon : λῦσαι γέροντα Od. 4.422, ἐπεὶ ἐκ δεσμοῖο λύθεν Od. 8.360. Cf. Od. 8.345, 347, Od. 10.298, 387, Od. 11.296, Od. 12.53, 163, 193. In mid., to set oneself free Od. 9.463. To rescue from bonds, effect the release of Il. 15.22. In mid. : ἦ τοὺς λυσόμενος δεῦρʼ ἔρχεαι; Od. 10.284. Cf. Od. 10.385. To release (from trouble or sickness) : θεοὶ κακότητος ἔλυσαν Od. 5.397. Cf. Od. 13.321. To save (from imminent danger) Od. 16.364.

(3) To set free (a captive) for ransom: παῖδʼ ἐμοὶ λύσαιτε Il. 1.20. Cf. Il. 1.29, Il. 21.80. With genit. of price : ἔλυσεν ἀποίνων Il. 11.106. Of restoring a corpse Il. 24.76, 116, 137, 555, 561, 593, 599. Of restoring the armour of a slain foe Il. 17.163. In mid., to effect the ransoming of : ξεῖνός μιν ἐλύσατο Il. 21.42. Cf. Il. 1.13 = 372, Il. 10.378. So of effecting the restoration of a corpse Il. 24.118 = 146 = 195, 175, 237, 502, 685.

(4) To unyoke (horses, etc.) : λῦσαν ἵππους Il. 8.433. Cf. Il. 5.369, Il. 11.620, Il. 18.244, Il. 23.27, Il. 24.576, etc.: Od. 4.35, 39, Od. 6.6. In mid. Il. 23.7, 11. To untether (horses) Il. 10.480, 498.
(5) To settle or compose (a dispute, quarrel or difference) : καὶ ἀνδράσι νείκεα λύει Od. 6.74. Cf. Il. 14.205 = 304.
(6) To dissolve or dismiss (an assembly), allow or cause (it) to disperse : λῦσαν ἀγορήν Il. 1.305. Cf. Il. 2.808, Il. 19.276, Il. 24.1 : Od. 2.69, 257.
(7) To disperse (cares) : λύων μελεδήματα θυμοῦ Il. 23.62 : =Od. 20.56, Od. 23.343.

(8) With notion of destruction, to resolve into the component parts, disintegrate, cause to part : σπάρτα λέλυνται (lie in decay) Il. 2.135 : ὄφρʼ ἀπὸ τοίχους λῦσε κλύδων τρόπιος Od. 12.421. To cause (stitches) to give way or come undone : ῥαφαὶ ἐλέλυντο ἱμάντων Od. 22.186. To bring to ruin, destroy : ὄφρα τροίης κρήδεμνα λύωμεν Il. 16.100. Cf. Il. 2.118=Il. 9.25 : Od. 13.388.

(9) To break up or dissipate (the vital forces), to break up, dissipate or suspend the vital forces or the strength in (the limbs, the heart, etc.), to cause (the limbs, etc.) to give way or collapse.
To treat without regard to right or decency, commit outrage upon. With direct and cognate acc. : λώβης, ἣν ἐμὲ λωβήσασθε Il. 13.623. Absol. Il. 1.232=Il. 2.242.
To play a trick upon, mock, make game of: τίπτε με λωβεύεις; Od. 23.15. Cf. Od. 23.26.

(1) Treatment without regard to right or decency, despiteful usage, outrage : πρίν γʼ ἀπὸ πᾶσαν ἐμοὶ δόμεναι λώβην Il. 9.387. Cf. Il. 11.142, Il. 13.622, Il. 19.208 : Od. 18.347=Od. 20.285, Od. 19.373, Od. 20.169, Od. 24.326.
(2) A cause or occasion of reproach or opprobrium : λώβη τάδε γʼ ἔσσεται, εἰ... Il. 6.97. Cf. Il. 18.180 : Od. 18.225, Od. 24.433.
(3) A mark for mockery, an object of ridicule Il. 3.42.
One who utters despiteful or scurrilous words, an insulter, a foulmouthed fellow Il. 2.275, Il. 11.385. A good-for-nothing person, a worthless fellow Il. 24.239.

forms: App., despitefully used by fortune, wretched, miserable Il. 24.531.
Better, more profitable or advisable : τόδε λωΐτερον ἔμμεναι Od. 1.376=Od. 2.141.
Absol. : χρή σε δόμεναι καὶ λώϊον ἠέ περ ἄλλοι σίτον (a larger portion) Od. 17.417.
Better, more profitable or advisable : τόδε σφιν λ. ἐστιν Od. 2.169.
Absol. with infin. : λ. ἔστι δῶρʼ ἀποαιρεῖσθαι Il. 1.229.
So with ὦδε · δοκέει μοι ὧδε λ. ἔσσεσθαι Il. 7.339.
As adv., better, more fully : γνωσόμεθʼ ἀλλήλων καὶ λ. Od. 23.109.

defs: A garment Od. 13.224.
Overgrown with λωτός · πεδία λωτοῦντα Il. 12.283. (V.l. λωτεῦντα (λωτέοντἀ fr. λωτέω, to teem with λωτός).
(1) A plant, perh. some kind of trefoil or clover. Collectively : ἵπποι λωτὸν ἐρεπτόμενοι Il. 2.776. Cf. Il. 14.348, Il. 21.351 : Od. 4.603.
(2) A fruit of some kind, described as having an irresistibly seductive taste Od. 9.93, 97, 102.– The tree producing the fruit Od. 9.94.
The lotuseaters Od. 9.84, 91, 92, 96, Od. 23.311.

forms: To make pause, cease, give over : ὅδε τάχα λωφήσει Il. 21.292.
To find respite or relief from.
A particle used in affirmations or strong protestations, followed by acc. of a deity or thing invoked. Affirmatively with ναί · ναὶ μὰ τόδε σκῆπτρον (by this...) Il. 1.234.
With οὐ in negation : οὐ μὰ ζῆνα Il. 23.43. Cf. Il. 1.86 : Od. 20.339.

defs: (1) In women : γυναῖκα θήσατο μαζόν Il. 24.58. Cf. Il. 5.393, Il. 22.80, 83 : πάϊς οἱ ἦν έπὶ μαζῷ Od. 11.448. Cf. Od. 19.483.
(2) In men, the mammilla : βάλε στῆθος παρὰ μαζὸν δεξιόν Il. 4.480. Cf. Il. 4.123, 528, Il. 5.145, Il. 8.121, 313, Il. 11.108, 321, Il. 15.577, Il. 17.606 : Od. 22.82.
A word of address to a woman older than the speaker, good mother, dame, gossip Od. 2.349, 372, Od. 17.499, Od. 19.16, 482, 500, Od. 20.129, Od. 23.11, 35, 59, 81, 171.

forms: Pple. μαιμώων Il. 15.742.  Fem. μαιμώωσα Il. 5.661, Il. 15.542. (ἀνα-, περι-.)
defs: To be eager or quiver for action, show eager alacrity in action : μαίμησέ οἱ ἦτορ Il. 5.670, μαιμώων ἔφεπʼ ἔγχεϊ Il. 15.742. Cf. Il. 13.75, 78. Of the eager course of a weapon Il. 5.661, Il. 15.542.
A madwoman : μεγάροιο διέσσυτο μαινάσι ἴση Il. 22.460.

(1) To rage, act like a madman, be in unreasoning rage or fury : σὺ δὲ μαίνεαι οὐκέτʼ ἀνεκτῶς Od. 9.350. Cf. Il. 8.360 : Od. 18.406, Od. 21.298. Of the Bacchic frenzy Il. 7.132. Of the raging of fire : ὡς ὅτε πῦρ οὔρεσι μαίνηται Il. 15.606.

(2) Of martial frenzy : εἰ οὕτω μαίνεσθαι ἐάσομεν Ἄρηα Il. 5.717. Cf. Il. 7.101, Il. 8.355, Il. 9.238, Il. 15.605, Il. 16.245, Il. 21.5 : Od. 11.537. With cognate acc. : οὐχ ὅ γʼ ἄνευθε θεοῦ τάδε μαίνεται (makes this wild work) Il. 5.185. In pple., a madman : τοῦτον μαινόμενον Il. 5.831. Of a weapon : εἰ καὶ ἐμὸν δόρυ μαίνεται Il. 8.111. Cf. Il. 16.75.

(3) To be distracted or out of one's wits. In pple., a madman : μαινόμενε, φρένας ἠλέ Il. 15.128. In fem., a madwoman : μαινομένῃ ἐϊκυῖα Il. 7.389. Of the wits, etc. : τί σφῶϊν μαίνεται ἦτορ; Il. 8.413. Cf. Il. 24.114 = 135.
(1) To make search, search, seek : μαίεσθαι προτέρω Od. 14.356. To search through, examine : κευθμῶνας Od. 13.367.
(2) To seek out, get : πηλεύς μοι γυναῖκά γε μάσσεται αὐτός Il. 9.394 (v.l. γαμέσσεται (γαμέω)).
(3) To seize, grasp Od. 11.591.
(1) Having great resources, great, powerful, influential, wealthy : ἀνδρὸς μάκαρος κατʼ ἄρουραν Il. 11.68. Cf. Od. 1.217.
(2) Happy, fortunate : ὦ μάκαρ Ἀτρεΐδη Il. 3.182. Cf. Il. 24.377. Superl. μακάρτατος · σεῖο μακάρτατος (beyond thee, in reference to thee) Od. 11.483. Cf. Od. 7.158.
(3) As epithet of the gods, happy, blessed, living at ease, dwelling serene Il. 1.339, 406, 599, etc. : Od. 1.82, Od. 5.7, Od. 8.281, etc. Absol. in pl., the blessed gods, the gods Od. 10.299.
To pronounce blessed, esteem fortunate Od. 15.538=Od. 17.165=Od. 19.311.
Tall, high : αἰγείροιο Od. 6.106.
A mattock Il. 21.259.

(1) Long (as applied to weapons commonly a mere epithet) : ἔγχεα Il. 3.135. Cf. Il. 3.137, Il. 5.297, Il. 13.497, etc. : οὐρῇσιν Od. 10.215. Cf. Od. 12.229, Od. 21.121, Od. 22.149, 251, 279, 293. In superl. : τὰ μακρότατʼ ἔγχεα Il. 14.373.

(2) High, tall, lofty (sometimes, doubtless, with connotation of sense (3)) : τείχεα Il. 4.34, Il. 22.507, δένδρεα Il. 9.541, Il. 11.88, οὔρεα Il. 13.18 : κίονας Od. 1.54, δένδρεα Od. 5.238, τείχεα Od. 6.44, πίτυσσιν Od. 9.186, κλίμακα Od. 10.558, ἐρινεόν Od. 12.432, ὄζοι 436, etc. Epithet of Olympus Il. 1.402, Il. 2.48, Il. 5.398, Il. 8.199, Il. 15.21, Il. 18.142, Il. 24.468, etc. : Od. 10.307, Od. 15.43, Od. 20.73, Od. 24.351. In superl. : ἐλάτην, ἣ μακροτάτη πεφυυῖα αἰθέρʼ ἵκανεν Il. 14.288. Tall in person. In comp. : μακρότερόν μιν θῆκεν Od. 8.20. Cf. Od. 18.195.

(3) Great, thick, stout : ἕρματα Il. 1.486, ὀχῆα Il. 12.121, 291, Il. 13.124, σανίδες Il. 18.276 : δούρατα Od. 5.162, 370, ἐπηγκενίδεσσιν Od. 5.253. Of waves, great, big, swollen B 144 : Od. 5.109, Od. 9.147, Od. 24.110.
(4) Wide, broad, spacious : ἠϊόνος στόμα Il. 14.36. Cf. Il. 15.358.
(5) Of great content, great, capacious : φρείατα Il. 21.197.
(6) In reference to periods of time, long : ἤματα Od. 10.470, Od. 18.367=Od. 22.301. Cf. Od. 11.373.
(7) Of a desire, great, of one's heart : τόδε μακρὸν ἐέλδωρ Od. 23.54.

(8) In neut. sing. μακρόν as adv. In reference to the utterance of sound, loudly, with full voice, at the top of one's voice : μ. ἄϋσεν Il. 3.81. Cf. Il. 5.101, Il. 7.66, Il. 11.285, Od. 3.50, etc. : Od. 7.117.

(9) So in neut. pl. μακρά · βοῶν Il. 2.224. Of a bull : μ. μεμυκώς Il. 18.580. In reference to one's gait or movement, with long strides or steps, striding along or about, strutting along : μ. βιβάντα Il. 3.22. Cf. Il. 6.213, Il. 13.809, Il. 15.307,676, 686, Il. 16.534 : Od. 11.539. Of a ram Od. 9.450.

(1) Intensively with adjectives and adverbs, very, exceedingly, quite, just, altogether, or the like : μ. ὦκα Il. 2.52, μ. νήπιος Il. 6.401. Cf. Il. 1.156, Il. 3.204, Il. 5.710, Il. 9.360, Il. 12.382, Il. 13.152, Il. 18.254, etc. : μ. ἀτρεκέως α  179, μ. καλόν 301. Cf. Od. 2.200, Od. 3.20, Od. 4.169, 439, Od. 5.26, 161, 342, Od. 10.111, Od. 18.370, etc. Strengthening πᾶς Il. 2.10, Il. 13.741, Il. 15.546, etc. : Od. 2.306, Od. 5.216, etc. Strengthening ἀμφότερος Il. 8.67, etc. With comp., by far : πρότερος μ. Il. 10.124.

(2) Intensively with verbs and participles, much, greatly, in large measure, deeply, heartily, with good will, earnestly, eagerly, strongly, or the like : θαρσήσας μ. Il. 1.85, φεῦγε μ. (by all means) 173, μ. ἔκλυον 218. Cf. Il. 1.217, Il. 3.25 (greedily), Il. 4.225, 379, Il. 5.471 (bitterly), Il. 6.286, Il. 9.75 (they sorely need...), 318, 419, Il. 10.229, 251 (quickly), Il. 11.710 (well), Il. 12.51 (loudly), Il. 13.146 (to close quarters), 463 (the need is dire), 708 (keeping closely together), Il. 14.58 (closely), Il. 17.502 (from close at hand), 571 (carefully), Il. 23.63, Il. 24.663, etc. : μ. ἀσχαλόωσιν Od. 1.304, μ. χατέουσα Od. 2.249. Cf. Od. 4.472 (clearly), Od. 5.341, Od. 7.44, 319 (skilfully), Od. 6.32 (willingly), Od. 8.316, 413 (with all my heart), Od. 12.108 (very close), Od. 14.361, Od. 18.381, Od. 24.400, etc.

(3) Emphasizing an expression generally rather than attaching itself to particular words, of a surety, surely, verily : ἦ μ. δή σε κιχάνεται ὄλεθρος Il. 11.441. Cf. Il. 2.241, Il. 5.278, Il. 7.255, Il. 9.40, Il. 17.34, Il. 18.12, etc. : ἀλλὰ μ. οὔ πως ἔστι Διὸς νόον παρεξελθεῖν Od. 5.103. Cf. Od. 1.384, Od. 2.325, Od. 5.286, Od. 14.391, Od. 16.8, Od. 19.40, etc.

(1) Yielding to the touch, soft, into or upon which one sinks or settles down comfortably: εὐνῇ Il. 9.618, Il. 10.75, Il. 22.504. Cf. Il. 14.349 : κώεσιν Od. 3.38. Cf. Od. 4.124, Od. 20.58, Od. 22.196 (in sarcasm), Od. 23.290, 349. Soft or yielding in texture, readily adapting itself to one's form or to what it covers : χιτῶνα Il. 2.42, πέπλοισιν Il. 24.796. Cf. Od. 1.437, Od. 19.234. Of meadows, yielding to the tread, covered with rich grass, grassy : λειμῶνες Od. 5.72, Od. 9.133. Of cultivated land, yielding readily to the plough, easily cultivable : νειόν Il. 18.541.

(2) Of speech, gentle, winning, conciliatory : ἐπέεσσιν Il. 1.582, Il. 7.337. Cf. Od. 1.56, Od. 10.70, 422, Od. 16.286=Od. 19.5. Of sleep, stealing gently upon one, sweet Il. 10.2=Il. 24.678, Il. 14.359 : Od. 15.6, Od. 18.201. So of a gentle or  painless death : θάνατον Od. 18.202. Easy to deal with. In comp. : μαλακώτερος ἀμφαφάασθαι Il. 22.373.

forms: In reference to sleeping, softly, at ease : ἐνεύδειν Od. 3.350. Cf. Od. 24.255.

defs: (1) With adjectives and adverbs, in the highest degree, most : μ. λαμπρόν Il. 5.5, ἄγχι Il. 14.460. Cf. Il. 7.433, Il. 8.84, 326, Il. 13.568, 683, Il. 14.399, Il. 22.410. With a vb., in a very high degree, greatly, much : ὅπως πετάσειε μ. θυμόν Od. 18.160.

(2) In general intensive use, most, especially, principally, chiefly : Ἀτρεΐδα μ. [λίσσετο] Il. 1.16, τὸν μ. τῖεν Il. 2.21. Cf. Il. 2.589, Il. 3.97, Il. 4.96, Il. 8.500, etc. : ὄσσαν, ἥ τε μάλιστα φέρει κλέος Od. 1.283. Cf. Od. 1.342, 359, Od. 4.434, Od. 8.582, etc. In reference to something on the point of happening, nearly : μέμβλωκε μ. ἦμαρ Od. 17.190.
(1) With adjectives, in a higher degree, more : τιμήεσσα Od. 18.162. More, rather : μ. ἐπήρατος ἱπποβότοιο (rather... than...) Od. 4.606. Strengthening a comp. : ῥηΐτεροι Il. 24.243.
(2) In general intensive use

(b) The more, all the more, the better, all the better : ἀπὸ θυμοῦ μ. ἐμοὶ ἔσεαι Il. 1.563, ὄφρʼ ἔτι μ. μαχώμεθα Il. 19.231. Cf. Il. 2.81, Il. 5.208, Il. 9.257, 700, Il. 19.16, Il. 21.305, etc. : μ. πιέζειν Od. 4.419. Cf. Od. 2.202, Od. 9.13, Od. 18.22, Od. 19.117, 249, etc.
(3) Much (rather than little). See κηρόθι.

forms: Affirmative particle : οὐ μὰν οὐδʼ Ἀχιλεὺς μάρναται Il. 4.512, ἄγρει μάν (nay come!) Il. 5.765, ἔσται μὰν ὅτʼ ἄν...(the time will yet come when...) Il. 8.373. Cf. Il. 8.512, Il. 13.414, etc. : οὐ μὰν ἡμῖν ἀπὸ σκοποῦ μυθεῖται Od. 11.344. Cf. Od. 17.470.
In aor., to have learned, know : ἔργα κακά Od. 17.226, Od. 18.362.
With infin., to have been brought up or trained to be : ἐπεὶ μάθον ἔμμεναι ἐσθλός Il. 7.444.

defs: (1) To utter prophecy or divination, prophesy, divine : ἤ ἐτεὸν μαντεύεται Il. 2.300 : νῦν τοι ἐγὼ μαντεύσομαι Od. 1.200. Cf. Od. 2.170, 178, Od. 15.172, Od. 17.154, Od. 20.380, Od. 23.251. To be seer, act as seer : μαντευόμενος κατεγήρα κυκλώπεσσιν Od. 9.510. Cf. Od. 15.255.
(2) To prophesy in regard to : ταῦτα μαντεύεσθαι Od. 2.180. To foretell, prophesy, presage : ὄλεθρον Il. 16.859. Cf. Il. 1.107, Il. 19.420.
A prophetic warning : μαντήϊα τειρεσίαο κίρκης τε Od. 12.272.
The art of divination : δς μαντοσύνῃ ἐκέκαστο Od. 9.509. Cf. Il. 1.72. In pl., app. referring to the various means of divination : δς περὶ πάντων ᾔδεε μαντοσύνας Il. 2.832=Il. 11.330.

forms: To quench (fire) : ἐπεὶ φλὸξ ἐμαράνθη (had died down) Il. 9.212, πυρκαϊὴ ἐμαραίνετο Il. 23.228.

defs: To behave like a madman, rage : μαργαίνειν ἐπὶ θεοῖσιν Il. 5.882.
Out of one's wits, beside oneself Od. 23.11. Absol. in voc., madman ! Od. 16.421. Applied to the belly, raging, unappeasable Od. 18.2.

forms: To be bright, to glitter, flash, gleam, sparkle : ἔντεα μαρμαίροντα Il. 12.195. Cf. Il. 13.22, 801, Il. 16.279, 664, Il. 18.131, 617, Il. 23.27.
Of the eyes : ὄμματα μαρμαίροντα Il. 3.397.
Bright, glittering, gleaming Il. 14.273, Il. 17.594, Il. 18.480.
A stone of some such substance as quartz Il. 12.380 : Od. 9.499.
A twinkling or flickering : μαρμαρυγὰς ποδῶν Od. 8.265.

defs: (1) To fight, do battle, take part in the fight : οὐδʼ Ἀχιλεὺς μάρναται Il. 4.513. Cf. Il. 5.33, Il. 6.301, Il. 11.74, Il. 16.195, Il. 18.453, etc. : πρόπαν ἦμαρ ἐμαρνάμεθα Od. 24.41. Cf. Od. 3.85, Od. 11.513, Od. 16.98 = 116, Od. 24.39, 507. With cognate acc. : ὅσα μαρνάμεθα Od. 3.108. To fight, do battle, with. With dat. : μαρνάμενον μενελάῳ Il. 3.307, μάρναντο Τρωσίν τε καὶ  Ἕκτορι Il. 13.720. Cf. Il. 7.204, Il. 9.327, Il. 11.190 = 205, Il. 15.475, 557 : Od. 9.50, Od. 22.228. With ἐπί: μάρνα-σθαι δηΐοισιν ἐπʼ ἀνδράσιν Il. 9.317=Il. 17.148.
(2) Of fighting otherwise than with arms, to box Od. 18.31.
(3) To fight with words, quarrel, wrangle, dispute : εἰ σφῶϊν πυθοίατο μαρναμένιϊν Il. 1.257.

(1) To lay hold of, seize, clasp Il. 14.346, Il. 15.137, Il. 21.489 : Od. 9.289, 311, 344, Od. 10.116. With cognate acc. ἕλκεα, ἅ κεν μάρπτῃσι κεραυνός (which the thunderbolt shall make by fastening upon...) Il. 8.405=419.
(2) To catch up, over-take Il. 21.564, Il. 22.201.
(3) To bring oneself in contact with, touch : οὐδὲ χθόνα μάρπτε ποδοῖιν Il. 14.228.
(4) Of sleep, to come upon : οὐχ (ερμείαν ὕπνος ἔμαρπτεν Il. 24.679. Cf. Il. 23.62 : =Od. 20.56. So of old age : ἐπεὶ κατὰ γῆρας ἔμαρψεν Od. 24.390.
A giving of information, a denouncing. In pl. Od. 11.325.
(1) One who is to bear or can bear testimony, a witness : τὼ αὐτὼ μάρτυροι ἔστων Il. 1.338. Cf. Il. 2.302.
(2) A witness invoked in sanction of something (cf. ἐπιμάρτυρος) : ὑμεῖς μάρτυροι ἔστε Il. 3.280. Cf. Il. 6.76, Il. 14.274, Il. 22.255 : μάρτυροι ἀμφοτέροισι θεοὶ [ἔστων] Od. 14.394. Cf. Od. 1.273.
(3) An ever-present witness, a protector or guardian : ἱκέτας, οἶσι Ζεὺς μ. [ἐστιν] Od. 16.423.
In neut. μᾶσσον as adv., further : ἥσειν Od. 8.203.
(1) The mouth : μάστακα χερσὶ πίεζεν Od. 4.287. Cf. Od. 23.76.
(2) A mouthful, a morsel Il. 9.324.
To apply the μάστιξ to, touch up (horses or mules): μάστιξεν ἵππους Il. 5.768= Il. 10.530= Il. 11.519. Cf. Il. 8.117, Il. 5.366= Il. 8.45= Il. 22.400 := Od. 3.484 = 494= Od. 15.192, Od. 7.82.

A whip (following the indications of Il. 11.532, Il. 15.352, Il. 23.362 : Od. 7.316 ; see also Il. 23.500 under μάστις and Od. 3.171 under μαστίω); but μάστιξ in Il. 23.384 and κέντρον in 387 are evidently represented as identical, and seem to be the same as the ἱμάσθλη of 582, and there are grounds for explaining all as a pliant rod with a metal point serving both as whip and goad (which involves taking ἱμάντες in Il. 23.363 in sense reins) : μάστιγι θοῶς ἐπεμαίεθʼ ἵππους Il. 5.748= Il. 8.392. Cf. (besides as above) Il. 5.226, 840, Il. 10.500, Il. 16.430, 479, 482= Il. 24.441, Il. 19.395, Il. 23.390, 510, 642, Il. 24.326 : Od. 7.81, 316. Fig. of the lash of Zeus : Διὸς μάστιγι δαμέντες (ἐδάμημεν) Il. 12.37, Il. 13.812.

forms: Dat. μάστι Il. 23.500. =μάστιξ. : μάστι ἔλαυνε κατωμαδόν Il. 23.500. Cf. Od. 15.182.

defs: To apply the μάστιξ to, touch up, one's horses : μάστιε νῦν Il. 17.622. In mid. of a lion lashing himself with his tail Od. 3.171.

forms: To do ineffective work, show oneself clumsy or unskilful : ἀπέκοψε παρήορον οὐδὲ μάτησεν Il. 16.474.
Of horses, to shirk their work, grow restive Il. 5.233.
To be at a loss or at fault : οὐ δηθὰ ματεύσομεν Il. 14.110.

defs: Ill directed or ill judged action, folly Od. 10.79.
A knife Il. 3.271= Il. 19.252, Il. 11.844. App. a dagger : μαχαίρας χρυσείας ἐξ ἀργυρέων τελαμ́νων Il. 18.597.

forms: acc. sing. masc. pple. See μάχομαι.

defs: (1) War, battle, armed conflict, fighting : μάχῃ Τρώεσσιν ἀρήγειν Il. 1.521, ἔσχοντο μάχης Il. 3.84. Cf. Il. 4.225, Il. 5.157, Il. 6.290, Il. 11.409, Il. 13.483, Il. 15.15, Il. 17.142, Il. 22.218, Il. 24.385, etc. : Od. 4.497.

(2) A battle, armed conflict, fight : μάχην ἐμάχοντο Il. 12.175, ἀντιόωντες τῆσδε μάχης Od. 3.126. Cf. Il. 1.177, Il. 5.456, 763, Il. 11.336, Il. 12.436, Il. 13.789, Il. 17.261, Od. 3.18, etc. : Od. 9.54, Od. 11.612.– μάχη τινός, a fighting with a person : αἴαντος ἀλέεινε μάχην (did not care to engage him) Il. 11.542.

(3) In concrete sense, a force engaged in fighting, an embattled host, a battle array, a fighting throng : ἀρτύνθη μάχη (the lines were re-formed) Il. 11.216, μάχη ἐπὶ πᾶσα φαάνθη Il. 17.650. Cf. Il. 5.167, 824, Il. 13.337, Il. 14.155, Il. 24.402, etc.
(4) In local sense, a field of battle : μάχης ἐπʼ ἀριστερά Il. 5.355. Cf. Il. 17.368, etc.
(5) The art of war, war, fighting : μάχης εὖ εἰδότε πάσης Il. 2.823= Il. 12.100, Il. 5.11, 549. Cf. Il. 5.634, Il. 13.811.
A warrior : νέοι σε τείρουσι μαχηταί Il. 8.102. With implied notion of stoutness or skill : μικρὸς δέμας, ἀλλὰ μ. Il. 5.801. Cf. Il. 16.186 : Od. 3.112, Od. 4.202, Od. 18.261.
With whom one may fight, to be fought with Od. 12.119.

forms: Lust; app., satisfaction or scope for the satisfaction thereof: ἥ οἱ πόρε μαχλοσύνην ἀλεγεινήν Il. 24.30.
Fut. μαχήσομαι Il. 1.298, Il. 3.290, Il. 9.32, Il. 21.498.
Acc. sing. masc. pple. μαχεσσάμενον Il. 3.393.
Infin. μαχέσασθαι Il. 3.20, Il. 5.496, Il. 6.74, Il. 8.168, Od. 3.171, Il. 22.223, etc. μαχέσσασθαι Il. 15.633 : Od. 18.39. μαχήσασθαι Il. 5.483 : Od. 2.245. (ἀμφι-, προ-)
defs: (1) To fight, do battle, take part in the fight, engage in fight : μαχόμην κατʼ ἔμʼ αὐτόν Il. 1.271, μετὰ πρώτοισι μάχεσθαι Il. 5.536. Cf. Il. 1.153, Il. 3.290, Il. 6.140, Il. 12.2, Il. 15.698, Od. 3.408, Il. 22.243, etc. : οἳ ἄστυ πέρι Πριάμοιο μάχοντο Od. 5.106. Cf. Od. 11.403, Od. 14.491, Od. 16.171, Od. 17.471, Od. 22.65, 245, Od. 24.113. Of single combat : Ἀλέξανδρος καὶ Μενέλαος μαχήσονται περὶ σεῖο Il. 3.137. Cf. Il. 3.20, Il. 6.40, Od. 3.88, Il. 21.160, etc. To box : ὁ ξεῖνος καὶ?̓͂ιρος ἐρίζετον ἀλλήλοιϊν χερσὶ μαχέσσασθαι Od. 18.39. Cf. Il. 23.621.

(2) To fight, engage in fight, do battle, with. With dat. : Τρωσίν Il. 4.156. Cf. Il. 1.151, Il. 5.130, Il. 13.238, Il. 16.520, Il. 21.429, Il. 24.439 (will attack thee), etc. : Od. 2.245, 251, Od. 11.169, Od. 13.390, Od. 14.71, Od. 16.244, Od. 18.63, Od. 22.214. With ἐπί: ἐπὶ Τρώεσσιν Il. 5.124, Il. 11.442, Od. 3.26. Cf. Il. 5.244. With πρός: πρὸς Τρῶας Il. 17.471. Of single combat. With dat. : μενοινώω καὶ οἶυς  Ἕκτορι μάχεσθαι Il. 13.80. Cf. Il. 1.298, Il. 3.435, Il. 6.74, Od. 3.179, etc. Of boxing Il. 23.554 : Od. 18.31, 52.
(3) With cognate acc. : μάχην ἐμάχοντο Il. 12.175. Cf. Il. 2.121, Il. 3.435, Il. 18.533, etc. : Od. 9.54.
(4) To contend with in manly sports. With dat. : τίς ἂν φιλέοντι μάχοιτο · Od. 8.208.

(5) Of fighting with a beast : θηρὶ μαχέσσασθαι Il. 15.633. Of a beast attacking  or fighting with men : ὡς κὑων ὑλάει μέμονέν τε μάχεσθαι Od. 20.15. Cf. Od. 3.171. Of beasts or birds fighting : ὥς τʼ αἰγυπιοὶ μεγάλα κλάζοντε μάχωνται Il. 16.429. Cf. Il. 16.758, 824.
(6) To fight with words, quarrel, wrangle, dispute, contend : ἀντιβίοισι μαχεσσαμένω ἐπέεσσιν Il. 1.304. Cf. Il. 1.8, Il. 2.377.
(7) To oppose, set oneself against, thwart. With dat. : οὐκ ἐθέλησα ποσειδάωνι μάχεσθαι Od. 13.341.

(8) To be up in arms against (a person), assume an attitude of protest in regard to (him), find fault with or upbraid (him). With dat. : σοὶ πάντες μαχόμεσθα· σὺ γὰρ ... Il. 5.875. Cf. Il. 7.329, Il. 9.32, Il. 13.118.
(1) In vain, to no purpose, fruitlessly : μ. ἄπρηκτον πόλεμον πολεμίζειν Il. 2.120. For no good reason, without aim or object so far as one is concerned : μ. ἕνεκʼ ἀλλοτρίων ἀχέων Od. 3.298.
(2) In unseemly wise, without regard for right, decency or established usage : μ., ἀτὰρ οὐ κατὰ κόσμον Il. 2.214, Il. 5.759. Cf. Il. 13.627 : Od. 3.138.
(3) Without justification or good reason, idly, thoughtlessly, frivolously, lightly : μ. αὔτως εὐχετάασθαι Od. 3.348. Cf. Il. 15.40 : Od. 16.111.
(2) Without determined course, idly : ἦ μ. ἀλάλησθε; Od. 3.72 = Od. 9.253.

forms: Nom. dual μεμᾶῶτε Il. 5.569, Il. 7.120, Od. 3.159, Il. 22.243, Il. 23.814. μεμαότε Il. 13.197.
3 sing. μέμονε Il. 12.304, Il. 16.435, Il. 18.176, Il. 21.315 : Od. 15.521, Od. 20.15. (For the forms cf. γέγαα, γέγονα under γίγνομαι A.) (ἐμ-.)
defs: (1) To be eager, anxious or ready : ἐπεὶ μεμάασί γε πολλοί (are ready to volunteer) Il. 10.236, μέμονεν ἶσα θεοῖσιν (his heart swells like that of a god) Il. 21.315.

(2) To be eager, anxious or ready, show eagerness, anxiety or readiness. strive or struggle, to do something, to be bent or set on doing something. With pres. or aor. infin. : μέμασαν μάχεσθαι Il. 2.863, διαπραθέειν μεμαῶτες Il. 9.532. Cf. Il. 1.590, Il. 4.40, 304 (be carried away by his eagerness), Il. 5.852, Il. 13.182, Il. 18.156, Il. 22.413, etc. : Od. 4.351, Od. 5.18, Od. 11.210, Od. 17.520, Od. 20.15, etc. With fut. infin. : μέμασαν τεῖχος ῥήξειν Il. 12.197. Cf. Il. 2.543, Il. 12.200, 218 : Od. 15.521, Od. 24.395.
(3) To be eager for. With genit. : μεμαῶτα μάχης Il. 9.655, μεμαότε ἀλκῆς (eager to display ...) Il. 13.197. Cf. Il. 5.732, Il. 17.181, Od. 3.256.
(4) In pple. without construction

(b) Eagerly, with eager haste, speed, alacrity or zeal : βῆ ῥρʼ ἀνʼ ὁδὸν μεμαώς Il. 10.339. Cf. Il. 5.143, Il. 11.239, 258, Il. 13.40, Il. 15.83, Il. 16.754, Il. 21.174, etc. : ἤϊξαν πεδίονδε μεμαῶτες Od. 15.183.
(5) To hasten, speed : πῇ μέματον; (whither away so fast?) Il. 8.413. Cf. Il. 11.615, Il. 14.298.

(6) To be minded or inclined, to purpose, design : διχθά μοι κραδίη μέμονεν (I am in two minds) Il. 16.435. With pres. or aor. infin. : πῇ μέμονας καταδῦναι ὅμιλον; Il. 13.307, ἦε μένειν μεμάασιν Il. 22.384. Cf. Il. 6.160, Il. 10.208 = 409, Il. 10.433, Il. 12.304, Il. 24.657 : Od. 11.315. With fut. infin. : πῶς μέμονας πόλεμον καταπαυσέμεν; Il. 6.36. Cf. Il. 9.247, Il. 14.88, Il. 15.105, Il. 21.481 (presume to . . .).

forms: Of the royal councillors : βουλὴν μεγαθύμων γερόντων Il. 2.53.– Of peoples Il. 1.123, Il. 2.541, Il. 5.27, Il. 9.549, Il. 13.699, etc. : Od. 3.366, Od. 6.16, Od. 24.57.
To be unwilling to give or allow, to grudge.
With acc. and dat. : μέγηρέ οἱ τό γʼ Ἀπόλλων Il. 23.865.
With dat. alone : Δαναοῖσι μεγήρας Il. 15.473.
With genit. indicating that in respect of which grudging takes place and dat. : τάων οὔ τοι ἐγὼ πρόσθʼ ἵσταμαι οὐδὲ μεγαίρω Il. 4.54.
With this genit. alone : βιότοιο μεγήρας (grudging him the taking of his foe's life) Il. 13.563.
With dat. and infin. indicating what is grudged : μηδὲ μεγήρῃς ἡμῖν τελευτῆσαι τάδε ἔργα Od. 3.55.
With prepositional clause and infin. : ἀμφὶ νεκροῖσι κατακαιέμεν οὔ τι μεγαίρω Il. 6.408.
With infin. and acc. of person concerned as subject of it : μνηστῆρας οὔ τι μεγαίρω ἔρδειν ἔργα βίαια (I say nothing against their doing so) Od. 2.235.

defs: Epithet of the sea, with mighty deeps Od. 3.158. Epithet of ships, with mighty hollow, capacious Il. 8.222= Il. 11.5, Il. 11.600. Epithet of the dolphin, with mighty maw Il. 21.22.

forms: Applied to θυμός (my,  thy, his, great heart) Il. 9.109, Il. 11.403, etc. : Od. 5.298, Od. 9.299, etc.

defs: To bear oneself proudly, be haughty Od. 23.174. To be too proud to do something Il. 10.69.
Greatly, in a high degree, to a great extent : ἐμὲ μ. ἀκαχίζεις Od. 16.432. Cf. Il. 17.723.

forms: =μεγάλως. Strengthening μέγας by reduplication (cf. αἰνόθεν αἰνῶς, οἰόθεν οἶος) Il. 16.776, Il. 18.26 : Od. 24.40.

defs: (1) The chief room of a house, the general living-room, the hall : ἐνὶ μεγάροισιν ἑκάστη πῦρ καιόντων Il. 8.520 : μέθυ νεῖμον πᾶσιν ἀνὰ μ. Od. 6.180. Cf. Od. 4.37, 300, Od. 6.230, Od. 11.420, Od. 16.343, Od. 21.229, etc. In pl. in the same sense : ὁμάδησαν ἀνὰ μέγαρα Od. 1.365. Cf. Od. 4.238, Od. 8.242, Od. 11.334, Od. 15.77, Od. 18.183, Od. 22.172, etc. Such a room in the abode of a god Il. 18.374. In the hut of Achilles Il. 24.647. Of the chief room in the hut of Eumaeus Od. 16.165. So in pl. : παρήμενος ἐν μεγάροισιν Od. 17.521. In pl. of such a room in the modest dwelling of Laertes Od. 24.392, 396, 412.

(2) The house itself, one's house or home : τρεῖς μοί (οἰ̔́ εἰσι θύγατρες ἐνὶ μεγάρῳ Il. 9.144, 286. Cf. Il. 2.661, Il. 7.91, 272, 377, Il. 13.431, Il. 24.209 (at home) : ἴτω ἐς μ. πατρός Od. 1.276. Cf. Od. 1.270, Od. 4.744, Od. 6.65, Od. 13.377, Od. 16.341, Od. 22.370, etc. In pl. in the same sense : πατρὸς ἐν μεγάροισιν Il. 7.428. Cf. Il. 1.418, Il. 2.137, Il. 7.421, Il. 13.667, Il. 15.439, Il. 24.219, etc. : τρέφε ναυσικάαν ἐν μεγάροισιν Od. 6.12. Cf. Od. 1.269, Od. 3.213, Od. 7.62, Od. 11.68, Od. 15.231, Od. 21.30, etc. In pl. app. including the αὐλή: χῆνες ἐκέχυντο ἀθρόοι ἐν μεγάροις Od. 19.540. Cf. Od. 19.552. In pl. of the abodes of the gods Il. 11.76, Il. 21.475 : Od. 1.27.

(3) A chamber or set of chambers appropriated to the lady of a house and her maidens, the women's quarters (cf. ὑπερώϊον 2) : τὴν εὗρʼ ἐν μεγάρῳ Il. 3.125 (the same as the θάλαμος of 142), μεγάροιο διέσσυτο Il. 22.460 (the same as the μυχὸς δόμου of 440) : ἐς μ. καλέασα Od. 1.416, ἦλθον ἀμφίπολοι ἐκ μεγάροιο (i.e. from the part of it from which they had been summoned) Od. 18.198. Cf. Od. 18.185, 316, Od. 19.60, Od. 20.6, Od. 21.236 = 382, Od. 22.497, Od. 23.43. In pl. in the same sense : πηνελόπειαν ἐνὶ μεγάροισιν ἄνωχθι μεῖναι Od. 17.569. Cf. Il. 7.286 : Od. 2.94= Od. 24.129, Od. 19.16, 30= Od. 21.387, Od. 19.139, Od. 22.399.

forms: To the μέγαρον (in sense 1): βῆ δʼ ἰέναι μ. Od. 16.413. Cf. Od. 21.58, Od. 23.20.
μεγάλη, μέγα. Comp. μείζων, -ονος. Neut. μεῖζον. Superl. μέγιστος, -η, -ον.
defs: (1) Of great longitudinal extent, long (as applied to weapons commonly a mere epithet) : ξίφος Il. 1.194, τάφρον Il. 6.441, Il. 9.350. Cf. Il. 3.272, Il. 4.124, Il. 15.677, Il. 22.307, etc. : ἔγχος Od. 1.100. Cf. Od. 10.262, Od. 21.74, Od. 24.172, etc.

(2) Of great upward extent, high, tall, lofty : πύργον Il. 7.386. Cf. Il. 15.619, Il. 16.297, Il. 21.243 : ἐρινεός Od. 12.103. Cf. Od. 4.501, Od. 8.569, Od. 12.71, Od. 22.466, etc. Epithet of Olympus Il. 1.530, Il. 8.443.

(3) Of persons, tall, of large build, goodly : ἠΰς τε μέγας τε Il. 2.653. Cf. Il. 4.534, Il. 5.628, Il. 18.518, Il. 21.108, etc. : καλόν τε μέγαν τε Od. 1.301. Cf. Od. 9.508, Od. 13.289, Od. 18.4, 382, Od. 21.334, etc. In comp. : κεφαλῇ μείζονες ἄλλοι ἔασιν Il. 3.168. Cf. Od. 7.230= Od. 23.157, Od. 10.396, Od. 24.369. Of parts of the body, well developed, stout, strong : μηρούς Od. 18.68. Cf. Il. 15.695 : Od. 17.225. Of the voice, great, full : ὄπα Il. 3.221. Of horses or oxen, stout, goodly Il. 2.839= Il. 12.97, Il. 23.750. Cf. Od. 18.372. In superl. Il. 10.436. Grown-up, come to man's estate Od. 2.314, Od. 18.217, Od. 19.532.

(4) Wide, broad, spacious, extensive : τέμενος Il. 12.313. Cf. Il. 2.210, 332, Il. 4.483, Il. 5.448, Il. 6.462, Il. 13.588, Il. 18.588, Il. 21.239, Il. 24.452, etc. : ὄρχατος Od. 6.112. Cf. Od. 3.107, Od. 5.461, Od. 14.7, Od. 17.299, Od. 19.178, etc. Of flocks : οἰῶν μέγα πῶϋ Il. 3.198, Il. 11.696, Il. 15.323 : Od. 12.299. Of garments, wide, flowing : φᾶρος Il. 2.43, Il. 8.221 : Od. 5.230, Od. 8.84. Cf. Od. 14.521, Od. 18.292, etc. In superl. Il. 7.90, 271, 294 := Od. 15.107. Covering a wide space : ὀμίχλην Il. 13.336. Sim. : κεῖτο μέγας μεγαλωστί Il. 16.776. Cf. Il. 18.26 : Od. 24.40. Epithet of οὐρανός Il. 1.497, Il. 5.750= Il. 8.394, Il. 21.388. Of the sea (no doubt sometimes with notion of depth also) Il. 14.16, Il. 19.267 : Od. 3.179, Od. 4.504, etc.

(5) Of great size, great, large : λίθον Il. 6.265. Cf. Il. 3.23, Il. 5.213, Il. 11.265, Il. 16.158, Il. 18.344, 476, etc. : ἀσκόν Od. 5.266. Cf. Od. 2.94, Od. 5.234, Od. 9.240, Od. 12.173, Od. 14.530, Od. 18.118, Od. 21.177, Od. 24.80, etc. Sim. : λυκίων μέγα ἔθνος Il. 12.330. In comp. : μείζονα κρητῆρα Il. 9.202. Cf. Il. 6.268 : Od. 8.187, Od. 9.537, Od. 12.96. Of waves, big, swollen Il. 15.381, Il. 17.264, Il. 21.268, 313 : Od. 3.295, Od. 5.320, Od. 10.94, Od. 12.60, etc. Of springs, great, welling forth in abundance : κρουνῶν Il. 4.454. Of a meal, abundant, sumptuous : δόρπον Il. 19.208.

(6) Of sound, mighty, loud, resounding, far-sounding : ἀλαλητῷ Il. 12.138, Il. 14.393. Cf. Il. 15.384, Il. 21.9, 256, 387 : Od. 24.463. In comp. Il. 14.4. In reference to a report or rumour or to fame, wide-spread, known far and wide : κλέος Il. 7.446, κῦδος Il. 8.176, etc. Cf. Od. 3.79, etc. In comp. : μεῖζον κλέος Od. 8.147. Cf. Od. 18.255= Od. 19.128. In superl. Od. 9.264.

(7) Great, thick, stout, strong : σάκος ( ηις πονδερους σηιελδ) Il. 3.335, κληῗδα Il. 24.455. Cf. Il. 12.57, 134, 257, etc. : τειχίον Od. 16.165. Cf. Od. 12.436, etc. In comp. Il. 14.377. In superl. Il. 14.371. Of fire, etc., with powerful blaze, blazing strongly or fiercely : πῦρ Il. 8.521, Il. 9.211, σέλαϊ Il. 17.739. Cf. Od. 5.59, Od. 23.51. Of wind, blustering Od. 12.408, Od. 14.458, Od. 19.200.
(8) Of the heart, great, distended with pride, full of spirit or daring, swollen, swelling: δάμασον θυμὸν μέγαν Il. 9.496. Cf. Il. 2.196, Il. 6.25, Il. 9.184, Il. 21.395. In superl. Il. 17.21.

(9) Of great power or influence, of might, of power, mighty, powerful : θεός (θεόν) Il. 5.434, Il. 8.200, Il. 16.531, Il. 19.410, Il. 24.90. Sim. of the Seamander Od. 3.73, Il. 21.192, 248, 282, 329. Epithet of gods and heroes, mighty, the mighty Il. 2.134, 816, Il. 4.295, Il. 5.39, 610, 721, Il. 6.427, Il. 11.501, Il. 12.136, etc. : Od. 4.27, Od. 8.226, etc. Distinguishing the Salaminian from the lesser Aias : αἴας ὁ μέγας Il. 16.358. In superl. Il. 2.412, Il. 3.276 = 320= Il. 6.202= Il. 24.308, Il. 3.298.
(11) In neut. sing. μέγα as adv.

(b) Strengthening an adj. or adv., in a high degree, exceedingly, very : μ. νήπιος Il. 16.46, ἄνευθε μ. νῶϊν Il. 22.88. Cf. Il. 1.158, etc. : Od. 9.44, etc. Strengthening a comp. or superl., by much, by far, much : μ. ἄριστος Il. 2.82, μ. ἀμείνονες Il. 4.405. Cf. Il. 2.239, Il. 19.216, Il. 22.158, etc. : Od. 11.478, Od. 22.374, Od. 23.121, etc. Sim. : μ. ἔξοχος Il. 2.480. Cf. Od. 15.227, Od. 21.266.

(c) In reference to sound, loudly, with a loud voice or sound : μ. ἴαχον Il. 2.333. Cf. Il. 2.784, Il. 14.147, 399, Il. 16.334, Od. 3.260, Il. 22.407, etc. : μ. ἔπταρεν Od. 17.541. Cf. Od. 9.395, Od. 10.323, Od. 17.239, etc.
(12) In neut. pl. μεγάλα as adv.

(b) In reference to sound, loudly, with a loud voice or sound : μεγάλʼ εὔχετο Il. 1.450. Cf. Il. 1.482, Il. 8.75, 347, Il. 16.391, 429, Il. 23.119, etc. : μεγάλʼ αὐδήσαντος (app. connoting boastfulness) Od. 4.505. Cf. Od. 2.428, Od. 9.392, 399, Od. 14.354, Od. 20.113, Od. 21.413. Sim. in reference to the loud beating of the heart in agitation : κραδίη μ. πατάσσει Il. 13.282.
Tall stature, goodly build (cf. μέγας 3): εἶδός τε μ. τε φυήν τε Il. 2.58. Cf. Il. 6.288, Il. 23.66 : Od. 5.217, Od. 7.152, Od. 11.337= Od. 18.219, Od. 24.253, 374.
(1) To devise, plan, contrive, meditate : κακά Il. 4.21= Il. 8.458.

(2) To bethink oneself of, think of, take thought for, remember, make arrangements for. With genit. : πολέμοιο Il. 2.384, ἀλκῆς Il. 4.418= Il. 5.718. Cf. Il. 9.622, 650, Il. 18.245, Il. 24.2, 618 : δείπνοιο Od. 19.321. Cf. Od. 2.358, Od. 3.334, Od. 11.110= Od. 12.137.
(1) A ruler or lord : ἁλὸς μέδοντος Od. 1.72.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative (formed fr. the stem ἑλ- of the aor. (see αἱρέω)) μεθέλεσκε.
defs: To catch in one's turn : [σφαῖραν] Od. 8.376.
To spring or rush in pursuit of a foe or of a competitor, to spring or rush upon him : οὔτασε μετάλμενος Il. 5.336. Cf. Il. 11.538, Il. 12.305, Il. 13.362, Il. 14.443, Il. 23.345.

forms: To direct or drive (one's horses in quest of or to join a person).
With acc. of the person : τυδεΐδην μέθεπεν ἵππους Il. 5.329.
So without the direct object : ἡνίοχον μέθεπεν (drove in quest or search of . . .) Il. 8.126.
To direct one's course towards, make for, an indicated object : [ἑταίρους] Il. 17.190. Cf. Od. 14.33.
To come to pay a visit : ἠὲ νέον μεθέπεις, ἦ . . . Od. 1.175.
Only in mid. Aor. pple. μετασπόμενος.
defs: To follow up a foe : ἀπιόντα μετασπόμενος βάλεν Il. 13.567.

forms: Slow to take action, remiss, careless Il. 2.241 : Od. 7.25.

etym: [μεθ-, μετα- 1 (the senses app. developed through the notion of sending forth from oneself) + ἵημι1.]
forms: Acc. sing. masc. pple. μεθιέντα Il. 4.516, Il. 7.330, Il. 12.268, Il. 13.229.
3 sing. μεθέηκε Il. 23.434, Il. 24.48. μεθῆκε Il. 21.177 : Od. 5.460, Od. 21.126.
3 sing. μεθήῃ Od. 5.471 (v.l. μεθείη, see below).
3 sing. opt. μεθείη Il. 13.118 : Od. 5.471 (v.l. here μεθήῃ, see above).
Infin. μεθέμεν Il. 1.283, Il. 15.138. From μεθιέω
3 sing. impf. μεθίει Il. 15.716, Il. 16.762, Il. 21.72.
defs: (1) To relax one's hold of something, let it go : ἐπεὶ λάβεν οὐχὶ μεθίει Il. 15.716, Il. 16.762. Cf. Il. 21.72 : ἐς ποταμὸν μεθῆκεν (let it fall into the . . .) Od. 5.460.
(2) To let go or release (a captive) Il. 10.449. Sim. in reference to a guest : οὔ σε μεθήσει (will not hear of thy going) Od. 15.212.

(3) App., to relax, relieve, free (from a burden) : κῆρ ἄχεος μεθέηκα (have lightened it of my grief) Il. 17.539. Of a state or condition, to relieve (a person) of its  presence, quit (him) : εἴ με μεθήῃ ῥῖγος Od. 5.471.

(4) To let go or dismiss from one's mind : Ἀχιλλῆϊ μεθέμεν χόλον Il. 1.283. Cf. Il. 15.138 : Od. 1.77. So, to let go, depart from. With genit. : χόλοιο Od. 21.377. To dismiss from one's thoughts, cease to care for, no longer interest oneself in : μὴ χωσαμένη σε μεθείω Il. 3.414.
(5) To yield, give : νίκην Il. 14.364. With infin., to yield the doing of something, to suffer, allow, permit : εἰ τοῦτον Τρώεσσι μεθήσομεν ἄστυ πότι ἐρύσαι Il. 17.418.

(6) To relax one's efforts, lose resolution, grow slack or faint-hearted, in the matter of, relax, cease, refrain, hold back, from. With genit. : ἀλκῆς Il. 4.234, Il. 12.409, Il. 13.116, πολέμοιο Il. 4.240, 351, Il. 7.330, Il. 13.97, 114, 118, μάχης Il. 12.268, βίης (relaxed from his effort) (v.l. βίῃ, in his effort) Il. 21.177 : Od. 21.126. Sim. with infin. : μάχεσθαι Il. 13.234. Cf. Il. 23.434. So κλαύσας καὶ ὀδυράμενος μεθέηκε [κλαίειν καὶ ὀδύρεσθαι] (ceases to weep) Il. 24.48. To refrain from rendering friendly offices to, neglect. With genit. : σεῖο τειρομένοιο (in thy trouble) Il. 11.841.

(7) Absol., to relax one's efforts, become slack, cease to exert oneself, lose heart : ὅθι μεθιέντα ἴδοιτο Il. 4.516. Cf. Il. 7.523, Il. 10.121, Il. 13.229, Il. 15.553, Od. 3.361 : Od. 4.372, Od. 16.377 (will not be idle).

forms: Only in mid. Aor. pple. μετεισάμενος (μετα(ϝ)ισάμενος).
defs: To speed or make in an indicated direction for some purpose : μετεισάμενος ὄτρυνε φάλαλλας Il. 13.90. Cf. Il. 17.285.
(1) In act., to set in a different manner, to change : ταῦτα μεταστήσω (will give another gift instead) Od. 4.612.
(2) In mid., to take one's stand, come and stand, among. With dat. : ἑτάροισι μεθίστατο Il. 5.514.

forms: In pass., to set out with an indicated object, start on an expedition : λυρνησσὸν πέρσα μεθορμηθείς Od. 3.192.
To make a dart or effort towards an indicated object : μεθορμηθεὶς ἐλλάβετο σχεδίης Od. 5.325.

defs: To be drunken : μεθύοντι ἐοικώς Od. 18.240. To drip, be soaked : βοείην μεθύουσαν ἀλοιφῇ (with . . . ) Il. 17.390.

forms: =μειδάω. Only in pres. pple. μειδιόων, -ωσα · μειδιόων βλοσυροῖσι προσώπασιν (a grim smile of anticipated triumph) Il. 6.212. Cf. Il. 21.491, Il. 23.786.
Presents given with a bride by her father Il. 9.147, 289.

defs: A sweet morsel, a titbit : μειλίγματα θυμοῦ (such as delight their hearts) Od. 10.217.

forms: To soften, to soothe : πυρὸς μειλισσέμεν [νέκυας] (as to giving them the consolation of fire (genit. of material)) Il. 6.410.
In mid., to speak comfortably, mince one's words : μή μʼ αἰδόμενος μειλίσσεο Od. 3.96=Od. 4.326.

defs: Slackness or backwardness in action Il. 15.741.
(1) Winning, pleasing : αἰδοῖ Od. 8.172.

(2) Of speech, winning, pleasing, mild, gentle, kindly, conciliatory : μύθοισιν Il. 7.343. Cf. Il. 9.113, Il. 10.288, 542, Il. 11.137, Il. 12.267, Il. 21.339 : Od. 7.143, 148, Od. 10.173, Od. 11.552, Od. 18.283, etc. Absol. in pl., such speech : προσηύδα μειλιχίοισιν Il. 4.256, Il. 7.214, Il. 17.431 : Od. 20.165.
(1) Of persons, winning, mild, gentle, kindly Il. 17.671, Il. 19.300, Il. 24.739.
(2) =μειλίχιος. (2) Od. 15.374.

forms: 3 sing. plupf. pass. εἵμαρτο Il. 21.281 : Od. 5.312, Od. 24.34.
defs: (1) To receive a share of, take one's part of. With genit. : ἥμισυ μείρεο τιμῆς Il. 9.616.
(2) In pf., to have one's share of, to have, hold, be entitled to. With genit. : τιμῆς Il. 1.278, Il. 15.189 : Od. 5.335, Od. 11.338.
(3) In pass. in impers. construction, to be allotted as one's portion, be fated : λευγαλέῳ με θανάτῳ εἵμαρτο ἁλῶναι (it was the fate assigned me) Il. 21.281 :=Od. 5.312. Cf. Od. 24.34.
Of dark or swarthy complexion, tanned Od. 16.175.
(1) A roof-beam or rafter Od. 8.279, Od. 11.278, Od. 22.239. App., a free end of such a beam projecting outside : κατʼ ἄρʼ ἕζετʼ ἐπὶ προὔχοντι μελάθρῳ Od. 19.544.
(2) Such a beam as typifying the house, one's roof : κατὰ πρηνὲς βαλέειν Πριάμοιο μέλαθρον Il. 2.414. Cf. Il. 9.204, 640 (the obligations of hospitality) : Od. 18.150.
To make dark ; in pass., to grow dark : μελαίνετο χρόα καλόν (her flesh grew livid) Il. 5.354, νειὸς μελαίνετʼ ὄπισθεν (was represented as darkened in hue by some process of shading) Il. 18.548.

forms: App., having the hilts bound round with dark bands.

defs: In which the water wells up from dark depths. Epithet of springs Il. 9.14, Il. 16.3, 160, Il. 21.257 : Od. 20.158.
To grow dark Il. 6.64.

(1) Dark in hue, dark (not necessarily implying the absence of colour,  but sometimes to be translated black) , [ἄρνα] μέλαιναν Il. 3.103, κυάνοιο Il. 11.24, 35, τέφρη Il. 18.25, αἰετοῦ Il. 21.252. Cf. Il. 6.265= Il. 21.404, Il. 10.215, Il. 18.562 : οἴνοιο Od. 5.265, Od. 9.196, 346, ὄϊν Od. 10.527, 572. Cf. Od. 5.488, Od. 10.304. In comp. : μελάντερον ἠΰτε πίσσα Il. 4.277. Cf. Il. 24.94. Applied to the φρένες thought of as darkened by deep emotion : μένεος φρένες ἀμφὶ μέλαιναι πίμπλαντο Il. 1.103 := Od. 4.661 (i.e. the double organ (see ἀμφί I.1.b) was filled with fury (so as to be) black in both parts). Cf. Il. 16.83, 499, 573. (In all these cases also written, with sim. sense, ἀμφιμέλαιναι.)–Absol.: τὸ μέλαν δρυός (the dark heart) Od. 14.12.
(2) Epithet
(b) Of the earth : γαῖα μέλαινα Il. 2.699, Il. 15.715, Il. 16.416, Od. 3.494 : Od. 11.365, 587, Od. 19.111. So ἠπείροιο μελαίνης Od. 14.97, Od. 21.109.

(d) Of water (app. referring to the dark hue of water as seen by transmitted light with little or no reflection from the surface) : μέλαν ὕδωρ Il. 2.825, Il. 16.161, Il. 21.202 : Od. 4.359, Od. 7.91, Od. 12.104, Od. 13.409. So of the sea : μείλανι πόντῳ Il. 24.79. And of waves Il. 23.693 : Od. 5.353. Of the surface of the sea rippled by a breeze : μέλαιναν φρῖκα Il. 21.126. Cf. Od. 4.402.

(e) Of night Il. 8.486, 502, Il. 14.439, etc. : Od. 6.253= Od. 14.314, Od. 12.291. Of evening : μέλας ἕσπερος Od. 1.423= Od. 18.306. Sim. : θανάτου μέλαν νέφος Il. 16.350. Cf. Il. 16.591= Il. 18.22 := Od. 24.315, Od. 4.180.
(g) Applied also to pain : μελαινέων ὀδυνάων Il. 4.117. Cf. Il. 4.191, Il. 15.394.

forms: To cause to melt, melt Il. 21.363.

defs: In pl., cares, anxieties, grief : μελεδήματα θυμοῦ Il. 23.62 := Od. 20.56, Od. 23.343, μελεδήματα πατρός (for his ..) Od. 15.8. Cf. Od. 4.650.

forms: Limb-meal, limb by limb : ταμών Il. 24.409 : Od. 9.291. Cf. Od. 18.339.

defs: (1) Vain, useless, idle, empty : εὖχος (because got without fighting) Il. 21.473, οὔ τοι μέλεος εἰρήσεται αἶνος (in vain) Il. 23.795. Cf. Od. 5.416.
(2) In neut. sing. μέλεον as adv., in vain, idly : ἑστάμεναι μ. σὺν τεύχεσιν (doing nothing) Il. 10.480, μ. ἠκόντισαν (without result, each making a miss) Il. 16.336.
(1) The ash: φηγόν τε μελίην τε Il. 16.767. Cf. Il. 13.178.

forms: Applied to one's life or soul : θυμόν Il. 10.495, Il. 16.17 : Od. 11.203.

defs: A mixture of honey and (prob.) milk Od. 10.519= Od. 11.27.
(1) Epithet of spears, with shaft of ash Il. 5.655, 666, Il. 13.715, etc.
(2) μέλινος οὐδός, app., a threshold of wood set upon the λάϊνος οὐδός at the entrance to the μέγαρον Od. 17.339 (see λάϊνος).
A bee : σφῆκες ἠὲ μέλισσαι Il. 12.167. Cf. Il. 2.87 : Od. 13.106.

(1) To be about, be going, to do something, to be on the point of doing it (sometimes tending to pass into (2)). With fut. infin. : θήσειν ἔτʼ ἔμελλεν ἄλγεα Il. 2.39, ἔμελλέ μιν δώσειν Il. 7.52. Cf. Il. 7.393, Il. 11.22, Il. 15.601, Il. 19.98, Il. 23.544, etc. : ὅτʼ ἔμελλε πάλιν οἶκόνδε νέεσθαι Od. 7.110, Ἀγαμέμνονος φθίσεσθαι κακὸν οἶτον ἔμελλον (I have just escaped his fate) Od. 13.384. Cf. Od. 4.514, Od. 6.18, Od. 9.378, Od. 11.596, Od. 17.364, Od. 20.393, Od. 22.9, etc. With pres. infin. : ἔμελλε λίσσεσθαι Il. 10.454. Cf. Od. 19.94. With aor. infin. : ὅτʼ ἔμελλον ἐπαΐξασθαι ἄεθλον Il. 23.773.

(2) To be destined or fated to be or to do. With fut. infin. : ἅ ῥʼ οὐ τελέεσθαι ἔμελλον Il. 2.36, ὣς ἄρʼ ἐμέλλετʼ ἄσειν κύνας (fate destined you to ...) Il. 11.817. Cf. Il. 2.694, Il. 5.205, Il. 10.336, Il. 12.3, Il. 15.612, Od. 3.466, Il. 21.47, Il. 24.85, etc. : μέλλον ἔτι ξυνέσεσθαι ὀϊζυῖ Od. 6.270, οὐκ ἄρʼ ἔμελλες λήξειν ἀπατάων (it could not be that you should ...) Od. 13.293. Cf. Od. 2.156, Od. 7.165, Od. 9.230, 477, Od. 11.553, Od. 21.98, Od. 23.221, Od. 24.28, etc. Impers. : τῇ τελευτήσεσθαι ἔμελλεν (it was fated) Od. 8.510. With pres. infin. : οὐκ ἄρʼ ἔμελλες ἀνάλκιδος ἀνδρὸς ἑταίρους ἔδμεναι Od. 9.475. With aor. infin. : ἔμελλεν οἶ αὐτῷ θάνατον λιτέσθαι (he was fated to find that his prayer had been to his own death) Il. 16.46. Cf. Il. 18.98.

(3) To be likely to be or to be doing or to do, to be presumably so and so or doing so and so. With pres. infin. : ὅθι που μέλλουσι βουλὰς βουλεύειν (where it is likely they are conferring) Il. 10.326, ᾦ μέλλεις εὔχεσθαι (to whom you must pray) Il. 11.364= Od. 3.451, τὰ μέλλετʼ ἀκουέμεν (no doubt you know) Il. 14.125 : μέλλε ποτὲ οἶκος ὅδʼ ἀφνειὸς ἔμμεναι (all know how flourishing it was) Od. 1.232, ὄλβον θεοὶ μέλλουσιν ὀπάζειν (surely you know that it is the gods who ...) Od. 18.19, καὶ ἐγώ ποτʼ ἔμελλον ὄλβιος εἶναι (I too in my day was ...) 138, πολλάκι που μέλλεις ἀρήμεναι (no doubt you prayed) Od. 22.322. Cf. Od. 4.94, 200. Impers. : ἐμοὶ μέλλει φίλον εἷναι (you may be sure that it is) Il. 1.564. Cf. Il. 2.116= Il. 9.23= Il. 14.69, Il. 13.226. With aor. infin. of something likely to have taken place or that presumably has taken place : ἄλλοτε δή ποτε μᾶλλον ἐρωῆσαι πολέμοιο μέλλω (may have done so (but cannot be accused of doing so now)) Il. 13.777, μέλλει τις τελέσσαι (is likely to have done so, i.e. may be expected to do so) Il. 18.362. Cf. Il. 21.83, Il. 24.46 : Od. 4.274, 377, Od. 14.133. With fut. infin. : τά που μέλλεν  ἀγάσσεσθαι θεὸς αὐτός (app., it must have been that he was to do so) Od. 4.181.

forms: In pl., one's limbs, one's bodily frame : θυμὸν ἀπὸ μελέων δῦνα δόμον?̓́αϊδος Il. 6.131, γναμπτοῖσι μέλεσσιν Il. 11.669, Il. 24.359. Cf. Il. 13.672= Il. 16.607, Il. 16.110, Il. 17.211, Il. 23.191, 689 : Od. 8.298, Od. 10.393, Od. 11.201, 394, 600, Od. 13.398, 430, 432, Od. 15.354, Od. 18.70= Od. 24.368, Od. 18.77, Od. 21.283.
In reference to a bird Il. 23.880.
To a sacrifice : πάντων ἀρχόμενος μελέων Od. 14.428.

defs: That which affords sport. In pl. : κυνῶν μέλπηθρα γένοιτο (a sport for ...) Il. 13.233. Cf. Il. 16.255= Il. 18.179.

(1) With special reference to dancing. In mid. : ἰδὼν μετὰ μελπομένῃσιν ἐν χορῷ Ἀρτέμιδος Il. 16.182. App., to dance the war-dance. Fig. : οἷδα δʼ ἐνὶ σταδίῃ δηΐῳ μέλπεσθαι?̓́αρηϊ (in honour of Ares) Il. 6.241.
(2) With special reference to singing. In mid. : μετά σφιν ἐμέλπετʼ ἀοιδός Il. 18.604 := Od. 4.17= Od. 13.27. To honour or celebrate in song : μέλποντες ἑκάεργον Il. 1.474.

forms: 3 sing. plupf. (in impf. sense) μεμήλει Il. 2.614 : Od. 1.151.
3 sing. thematic pf. (in pres. sense) μέμβλεται Il. 19.343.
3 sing. plupf. (in impf. sense) μέμβλετο Il. 21.516 : Od. 22.12.
defs: (1) In act. and mid., to be an object of care, concern, solicitude, anxiety or interest, to, to concern, be the concern of, to make anxious, interest, trouble : ἐμοί κε ταῦτα μελήσεται (I will make it my care) Il. 1.523, ᾧ τόσσα μέμηλεν (who has so many responsibilities) Il. 2.25= 62, οὔ σφι θαλάσσια ἔργα μεμήλει 614, τά κεν διὶ μελήσει (the issue is in his hands) Il. 17.515. Cf. Il. 4.353, Il. 5.228, 490, 876, Il. 7.441, 492, Il. 9.228, Il. 10.51, Il. 15.231, Il. 19.213, Il. 21.516, Il. 24.152, etc. : τοῖσιν ἄλλα μεμήλει (they turned to ...) Od. 1.151, μέλε οἱ ἐὼν ἐν δώμασι νύμφης Od. 5.6, μή τί τοι ἡγεμόνος γε ποθὴ μελέσθω Od. 10.505, Ἀργὼ πᾶσι μέλουσα (at whose name all hearts stir, the storied ...) Od. 12.70 (u.l. πασιμέλουσα). Cf. Od. 1.358, Od. 2.304, Od. 4.415 (bethink you of your ...), Od. 7.65, 270, Od. 6.208, Od. 9.20, Od. 13.362, Od. 17.594, Od. 18.421, Od. 22.12, etc. Impers. : οὐκ ἔμελέν μοι ταῦτα μεταλλῆσαι (I cared not to ...) Od. 16.465. Cf. Od. 1.305.
(2) To be concerned with, busied about. With genit. : πλούτοιο μεμηλώς Il. 5.708, πτολέμοιο μεμηλώς (his mind set on it) Il. 13.297= 469.

forms: acc. pl. neut. pf. pple. pass. μορύσσω.

defs: (1) Affirmative particle : οὐ μὲν σοί ποτε ἶσον ἔχω γέρας Il. 1.163. Cf. Il. 1.211, 216, 234, 269, 273, 514, Il. 2.145, 203, etc. : οὐ μὲν γάρ τι κακὸν βασιλευέμεν Od. 1.392. Cf. Od. 1.78, 173, 208, 222, 411, Od. 2.318, Od. 3.14, 236, etc. In less emphatic use, serving to bring out a new point Il. 2.101, Il. 18.84, Il. 23.328, etc. : Od. 9.159, 320, etc.– μέν τοι Il. 4.318, etc. : Od. 4.157, etc.– μέν τε Il. 13.47, etc. : Od. 5.447, etc. With ἦ. See ἦ2 1.b.β.

(2) In adversative use : οὐδέ τι θυμὸς ἐδεύετο δαιτὸς ἐΐσης, οὐ μὲν φόρμιγγος (nor yet) Il. 1.603, πόθεόν γε μὲν ἀρχόν (but they ...) Il. 2.703. Cf. Il. 9.57 (under ἦ2 1.b.β), Il. 11.813, etc. : οὐ μέν σʼ οὐδὲ ἐῶσι θεοὶ κλαίειν Od. 4.805. Cf. Od. 10.65 (under ἦ2 1.b.β), etc.
(3) Marking an alternative : οὐ ... οὐδὲ μὲν ... Il. 1.154, οὐδὲ ... οὐδὲ μὲν ... Il. 9.374, etc. Cf. Od. 8.553, Od. 22.415, etc.
(1) To be eager, show eagerness or ardour, strive : μάλα περ μενεαίνων Il. 15.617. Cf. Il. 22.10 : Od. 5.341. Of mental struggling : κτεινόμενος μενέαινεν (faced his fate) Il. 16.491.

(2) To desire, be eager or anxious, long, strive, be minded, to do something, be set on doing it. With infin. : κατακτάμεναι Il. 3.379, μηδὲ θεοῖς μενεαινέμεν ἶφι μάχεσθαι (let not your spirit carry you away so as to ...) Il. 5.606. Cf. Il. 4.32, Il. 13.628, Il. 15.507, Il. 21.33, 543, etc. : Od. 4.282, Od. 10.295, 322, Od. 11.392, 585, Od. 13.30, Od. 17.17, 185, Od. 20.315, Od. 21.125. In reference to the eager course of a missile : ἆλτʼ ὀϊστός, καθʼ ὅμιλον ἐπιπτέσθαι μενεαίνων Il. 4.126.

(3) To be enraged, to show or be filled with rage or bitterness, to rage : νήπιοι, οἳ Ζηνὶ μενεαίνομεν (against Zeus) Il. 15.104, Ἕκτορʼ ἀείκιζεν μενεαίνων (in his rage) Il. 24.22. Cf. Il. 19.58, 68, Il. 24.54 : Od. 1.20, Od. 7.330. Of martial rage : Τρωσὶν μενεαίνων Il. 19.367.
Stout in the fight, staunch. Epithet of heroes, etc. Il. 2.740, 749, Il. 4.395, Il. 7.29, Il. 10.255, Il. 13.693, Il. 19.48, Il. 23.836, 844 : Od. 3.442.

etym: [μένος + εἴκω1. Fitted to, satisfying, the spirit.]
forms: Abundant, plentiful, satisfying, contenting, in abundance or plenty : δαῖτα Il. 9.90. Cf. Il. 23.29, 139, 650 : λἥΐδα Od. 13.273. Cf. Od. 5.166, 267, Od. 7.76, Od. 9.158, Od. 13.409, Od. 16.429, Od. 20.391.
Absol. : πάρα μενοεικέα πολλὰ δαίνυσθαι (abundance, to feast thereon to our heart's desire) Il. 9.227. Cf. Il. 19.144 : Od. 14.232.
3 sing. subj. μενοινάᾳ Il. 19.164. μενοινήῃσι Il. 15.82. From μενοινέω
defs: (1) To wish, desire, be bent upon : ὅ τι φρεσὶ σῇσι μενοινᾷς Il. 14.221, ὡς δʼ ὅτʼ ἂν ἀΐξῃ νόος ἀνέρος ... μενοινήῃσί τε πολλά (forms many wishes, i.e. wishes himself in this place or that) Il. 15.82. Cf. Od. 2.34, 275, 285, Od. 4.480, Od. 7.180, Od. 15.111, Od. 17.355. To turn over in one's mind, to design, purpose : νόος οἱ ἄλλα μενοινᾷ Od. 2.92= Od. 13.381. Cf. Od. 11.532, Od. 18.283. To turn over (in one's mind) with anxiety : τίη δὲ σὺ ταῦτα μετὰ φρεσὶ σῇσι μενοινᾷς; (why let that troubl thee?) Il. 14.264. To show eagerness or ardour. With dependent clause : μενοίνεον εἰ τελέουσιν Il. 12.59. Absol. : ὧδε μενοινῶν Il. 15.293.
(2) To desire, be eager or anxious, long, be minded, to do something. With infin. : μάχεσθαι Il. 10.101. Cf. Il. 13.79, 214, Il. 19.164 : Od. 2.36, 248, Od. 21.157, Od. 22.217.

(1) Passion, vehement or commanding feeling or emotion in general : μ. ἄσχετε (whose passion defies restraint) Od. 2.85= Od. 17.406, Od. 2.303, ὄτρυνε μ. ἕκαστου (desire to see the marvel) Od. 8.15. Cf. Od. 14.262= Od. 17.431. In pl. : ἐμῶν μενέων ἀπερωεύς (of my desires, of what I have set my heart upon) Il. 8.361. In a more or less concrete sense : ἀνὰ ῥῖνας δριμὺ μ. προὔτυψεν Od. 24.319.
(2) One's spirit, the spirit within one : αὐτόν με μ. ἄνωγε κεῖσʼ ἰέναι Il. 24.198. Cf. Il. 5.892, Il. 13.634.

(3) Specifically, fury, rage : μένεος φρένες πίμπλαντο Il. 1.103, μ.?̓́αρηος (the fury of battle) Il. 18.264. Cf. Il. 1.207, 282, Il. 6.210, Il. 9.679, Il. 19.202, Il. 21.305, Il. 22.346 : Od. 4.661, Od. 9.457, Od. 11.562, Od. 24.183. In a more or less concrete sense : εἰ μὴ νὺξ διακρινέει μ. ἀνδρῶν (the eager fighters) Il. 2.387 : μ.?̓́αρηος (the combat) Od. 16.269. Distraction, frenzy. In reference to horses Il. 23.468.

(4) Spirit, courage, stoutness : ἔν τοι στήθεσσι μ. πατρώϊον ἧκα Il. 5.125. Cf. Il. 5.2, 470, Il. 8.335, Il. 13.424, Il. 15.594, Il. 16.529, Il. 19.159, Il. 22.96, 459, Il. 24.6, etc. : ὄφρα οἱ μ. ἐν φρεσὶ θείω Od. 1.89. Cf. Od. 1.321, Od. 2.271, Od. 3.104, Od. 11.270, 515, Od. 12.279, Od. 13.387, Od. 19.493. In reference to beasts Il. 17.20, Od. 3.172.

(5) Might, vigour, power, strength : ἔτι μοι μ. ἔμπεδόν ἐστιν Il. 5.254. Cf. Il. 7.101, Il. 6.407, Il. 9.706, Il. 15.60, Il. 16.621, Il. 21.482, etc. : μ. καὶ χεῖρας Od. 11.502. Cf. Od. 20.19, Od. 21.426, Od. 22.226, Od. 24.520. In reference to horses, etc. : σφῶϊν ἐν γούνεσσι βαλῶ μ. ἠδʼ ἐνὶ θυμῷ Il. 17.451 (the word as connected with θυμῷ coming under (4)). Cf. Il. 17.456, 742, Il. 23.390, 400, 524, Il. 24.442. In reference to inanimate objects : πυρὸς μ. Il. 17.565. Cf. Il. 13.444= Il. 16.613= Il. 17.529, Od. 3.372. In a more or less concrete sense : μ. χειρῶν ἰθὺς φέρον Il. 5.506. Cf. Il. 7.127, 502, Il. 8.178, Il. 12.166, Il. 15.510, Od. 3.374, etc. : μ. πνείοντες Od. 22.203. In pl.: μένεα πνείοντες (πνείοντας) Il. 2.536, Il. 3.8, Il. 11.508, Il. 24.364. Cf. Il. 4.447= Il. 8.61. Might or strength in exercise : μένεος σχήσεσθαι Il. 17.503. Cf. Il. 17.638, Il. 21.340. In reference to horses Il. 17.476.

(6) μ. τινός, periphrasis for a person(cf. βίη 5) : λεοντῆος μ. Il. 23.837. Cf. Il. 6.38, Il. 11.268, 272, Il. 14.418, Il. 16.189, Od. 21.383 : μ. Ἀλκινόοιο Od. 6.167, 178= Od. 13.49, Od. 8.2, 4 = 421, Od. 8.385, 423, Od. 13.20, 24, 64. Cf. Od. 8.359, Od. 18.34. With sim. periphrasis : κούρην φέρεν μ. ἡμιόνοιϊν Od. 6.2. Also μένος Βορέαο Il. 5.524, ἀναπνείουσα πυρὸς μένος (breathing fire) Il. 7.182. Cf. Il. 12.18, Il. 23.177, 190, 238= Il. 24.792 : Od. 5.478, Od. 10.160, Od. 11.220, Od. 19.440.

(7) The animating principle, the vital spirit, the soul, the life, life, one's life (cf. θυμός (ἰ 1.b) : τοῦ λύθη ψυχή-τε μ. τε Il. 5.296= Il. 8.123 = 315. Cf. Il. 3.294, Il. 7.27, Il. 8.358, Il. 16.332, Il. 17.29, 298 : ἤϊά κε κατέφθιτο καὶ μένεʼ ἀνδρῶν Od. 4.363. In reference to an animal Od. 3.450.

forms: Aor. ἔμεινα Od. 10.53, Od. 14.244. μεῖνα Od. 14.292.
1 pl. ἐμείναμεν Od. 9.151, 306, 436, Od. 12.7. μείναμεν Il. 11.723.
defs: (1) To remain where one is, to remain, stay, tarry, abide, continue to be, in a specified or indicated place : οὐδέ σε λίσσομαι μένειν Il. 1.174, ἴση μοῖρα μένοντι (for him who stays behind) Il. 9.318, ἔνθʼ ἔμεινε (stayed his course, stopped) Il. 14.286, ὄφρα μένω (remain quiescent, take no action) Il. 24.658. Cf. Il. 1.492, Il. 2.298, Il. 7.258, Il. 10.370, Il. 16.239, Il. 17.721 (sticking together), Il. 18.64, Il. 19.42, Od. 3.22, Il. 22.5, etc. : μένʼ αὖθι Od. 2.369. Cf. Od. 3.427, Od. 4.447, Od. 7.295, Od. 6.259, Od. 9.97, Od. 12.373 (the comrades whom I left behind me), Od. 14.244, Od. 15.51, Od. 17.20, Od. 19.199, Od. 20.330, etc.– Of something inanimate : [ἔγχος] αὐτοῦ μεῖνεν Il. 13.564. Cf. Il. 9.610= Il. 10.90 : Od. 4.508. To remain as one is, refrain, wait : δύντα δʼ ἐς ἠέλιον μενέω Il. 19.308. Cf. Od. 17.582.

(2) To remain, continue, be, in a specified condition : ἕνα μῆνα μένων ἀπὸ ἧς ἀλόχοιο Il. 2.292. Cf. Il. 19.263 : Od. 20.23. To stand firm, stand without motion, stand still : ὥς τε στήλη μένει ἔμπεδον Il. 16.434. Cf. Il. 17.436 : Od. 17.235. Sim. of ships lying without motion Od. 13.100.

(3) To await the coming, approach or return of (a person) : ὄφρα μένοιεν νοστήσαντα ἄνακτα Il. 13.37. Cf. Od. 3.480, Od. 21.609 : Od. 1.304, Od. 4.439, 847, Od. 9.232, Od. 15.346, Od. 22.181. To await in an indicated posture the approach of : οὐδέ τις ἔτλη μεῖναι ἐπερχόμενον (to remain seated on his approach) Il. 1.535. To await (an occurrence) or the coming or coming on of (a period of time) : Ἠῶ Il. 11.723. Cf. Il. 15.599 : Od. 9.151= Od. 12.7, Od. 9.306 = 436. Absol. : ἔνθʼ ἔμενεν (bided his time) Od. 13.161. With infin. : Τρῶας σχεδ̀ν ἐλθέμεν Il. 4.247. Cf. Od. 1.422= Od. 18.305, Od. 4.786, Od. 7.98. With dependent clause : ὁππότε πύργος Ἀχαιῶν ἄλλος Τρώων ὁρμήσειεν (waiting till ...) Il. 4.333. Cf. Il. 11.666.

(4) To  await the attack of, stand up to : Μενέλαον Il. 3.52, Τρῶας Il. 5.527= Il. 15.622. Cf. Il. 13.476, 836, Il. 15.165, 406, Od. 21.571, Il. 22.252 : Od. 9.57. Sim. : Τρώων μένει?̓́αρηα Il. 11.836. Also ἐμὸν ἔγχος Il. 7.126. Cf. Il. 8.536, Il. 13.830, Il. 15.709, Il. 16.147. Of a beast : σῦς, ὅς τε μένει κολοσυρτὸν ἀνδρῶν Il. 13.472. Cf. Il. 22.93. Of something inanimate : πέτρη, ἥ τε μένει ἀνέμων κέλευθα Il. 15.620. Of facing the attack of a beast : μένουσι [κάπριον] Il. 11.418. Absol., to await the foe, stand firm, stand one's ground : μενέμεν καὶ ἀμυνέμεναι ὤρεσσιν Il. 5.486, αἰνείας οὐ μεῖνεν 571. Cf. Il. 5.522, Il. 11.317, Il. 12.79, Il. 14.375, Il. 15.539, Il. 16.659, Od. 21.310, etc. : οἴη Ἀλκινόου θυγάτηρ μένεν Od. 7.139. Cf. Od. 14.270. Of wasps Il. 12.169.

forms: Such as to cause anxiety, baneful, evil : ἔργα Il. 8.453, Il. 10.289, 524.
Absol. in neut. pl., baneful deeds : μέρμερα ῥέζων (ῥέζεν) Il. 11.502, Od. 21.217. Cf. Il. 10.48.

defs: (1) To turn (a thing) anxiously over in one's mind, to ponder or consider (it), meditate (it), have (it) in view : πολλά Od. 1.427, φόνον ἡμῖν Od. 2.325. Cf. Od. 3.17 : Od. 4.533, Od. 19.2 = 52, Od. 20.38, 41. Of a lion Od. 4.791. To think out or contrive : δόλον τόνδε Od. 2.93, Od. 24.128. To think of, find : ἀμύντορά τινα Od. 16.256, 261.

(2) Absol., to ponder, consider, deliberate, meditate : τρὶς μερμήριξεν Il. 8.169, ἔτι μερμήριζον (were hesitating) Il. 12.199. Cf. Od. 5.354, Od. 11.204, Od. 16.237, Od. 20.93. With dependent clause.
(b) With clause introduced by ὡς (how) Il. 2.3.

(d) With alternatives introduced by ἢ... ἦ... Il. 1.189, Il. 5.671, Il. 13.455, Il. 16.647 : Od. 4.117, Od. 7.141, Od. 10.50, Od. 16.73, Od. 17.235, Od. 18.90, Od. 20.10, Od. 22.333. With the first alternative expressed by an infin. and the second introduced by ἦ: μερμήριξε κύσσαι... ἦ... Od. 24.235. With infin. expressing only one of the alternatives : διάνδιχα μερμήριξεν ἵππους στρέψαι (had half a mind to...) Il. 8.167. Cf. Od. 10.151, 438.
A cord or string : κατέδει μέρμιθι Od. 10.23.

forms: Epithet of ἄνθρωποι and βροτοί of unknown meaning: μερόπων ἀνθρώπων Il. 1.250, μερόπεσσι βροτοῖσιν Il. 2.285. Cf. Il. 3.402, Il. 9.340, Il. 11.28, Il. 18.288, 342, 490, Od. 3.217 : Od. 20.49, 132.
Half-grey, grizzled : μ. περ ἐών Il. 13.361.

defs: (1) Adv., in the space separating two objects, between, midway : πολλὰ [δοῦρα] μεσσηγὺ ἐν γαίῃ ἵσταντο (in mid career) Il. 11.573= Il. 15.316. Cf. Il. 23.521 : μηδέ τι μεσσηγύς γε κακὸν πάθῃσιν (by the way) Od. 6.195. In such a space in reference to abstractions : τὸ μὲν τελέει, τὸ δὲ καὶ μεσσηγὺ κολούει (short of fulfilment) Od. 3.370.
(2) Prep. with genit.
(b) Of reciprocal relation or action, between : κέλαδον καὶ ἀϋτὴν κουρήτων τε μεσηγὺ καὶ αἰτωλῶν Il. 9.549.
Holding an intermediate position in a scale of excellence, neither good nor bad Il. 12.269.
(1) In a ship, a sort of box in which the mast was set (prob.= ἱστοπέδη) : ἱστὸν κοίλης ἔντοσθε μεσόδμης στῆσαν Od. 2.424= Od. 15.289.
(2) In a house, prob., a base or pedestal supporting a column Od. 19.37, Od. 20.354.

(1) The middle or midmost part of the ..., the middle or midst of the ...: μέσον ἱστίον Il. 1.481, Ἄργεϊ μέσσῳ (in the heart of ...) Il. 7.224. Cf. Il. 3.78, Il. 5.582, Il. 6.258, 267, Il. 8.68, Il. 11.167, Il. 16.231, Od. 3.254, Il. 23.241, etc. : πέλαγος μέσον Od. 3.174. Cf. Od. 1.344, Od. 2.37, Od. 4.400, Od. 12.80 (halfway up), 93 (waist-deep), etc. In reference to a period of time : μέσον ἦμαρ (noon) Il. 21.111 : Od. 6.288. In pl., the midst of the ... : μέσῃσι μετὰ δμῳῇσιν Od. 16.336. Cf. Il. 13.312, Il. 18.569.

(2) Absol. : δουρὶ μέσον περόνησεν (in his middle) Il. 6.145, Il. 13.397, μέσσῃ δʼ ἐνὶ πῖλος ἀρήρει (app. so as to form a lining to protect the head from chafing) Il. 10.265, σφῆκες μέσον αἰόλοι (about the middle) Il. 12.167. Cf. Il. 13.534, Il. 16.623, Od. 3.413, 486, Il. 23.875 : ἐν μέσσῃ καθῖζεν Od. 5.326. Cf. Od. 5.487, Od. 10.196, Od. 20.306. In pl. : στὰς ἐν μέσσοισιν Il. 6.384, ἕλκε μέσσα λαβών (grasping the middle of it) Il. 8.72, Il. 22.212, ἐνὶ μέσσῃς κλαῖεν Il. 24.84. Cf. Il. 4.212, Il. 11.35, 413, Il. 12.457, Il. 13.308, Il. 15.635, Il. 18.606, Il. 19.77, Il. 23.134, etc.: Od. 4.19, 281, 413, Od. 24.441.
(5) In neut. sing. : μέσ̔σ̓ον as adv., in the middle : νηῦς ἔθεεν μέσσον ὑπὲρ κρήτης (app., taking the mid-sea course) Od. 14.300.– = μεσηγύ 2..a : κὰδ δὲ μέσον τάφρου καὶ τείχεος ἶζον Il. 9.87.

forms: Like μέσος 4.a: ἐν μεσσάτῳ ἔσκεν (just in the middle) Il. 8.223= Il. 11.6.
Etymologically, the middle part of the αὐλή, but used simply as= αὐλή.
defs: (1) In sense 1.a : ἀέκων ἔβη [λὶς] ἀπὸ μεσσαύλοιο Il. 17.112. Cf. Il. 11.548, Il. 17.657 : ὅτε οἱ  μέο σαυλον ἵκοντο ἡμέτεροι ἕταροι Od. 10.435 (app.= the αὐλή of Od. 9.184, etc.).
(2) In sense (2) Il. 24.29.
Planted or driven in up to the middle : ἔγχος Il. 21.172.
(I) Adv.
(II) Prep. (commonly with anastrophe when immediately following the case-form).
There is among specified persons : οὐ γάρ τις μέτα τοῖος ἀνὴρ ἐν τοίσδεσιν Od. 21.93.

forms: Fig., to choose a fresh theme Od. 8.492.
To adopt changed or different counsels : μετεβούλευσαν ἄλλως Od. 5.286.

etym: [μετ-, μετα- 1. Pleonastically, a messenger who goes in quest. Cf. ἐπιβουκόλος.]
defs: A messenger : θεοῖσι μ. Il. 15.144. Cf. Il. 23.199.

forms: To take a meal, take one's meals, with.
With dat. : αἰεὶ ἡμῖν μεταδαίσεται Od. 18.48. Cf. Il. 22.498.
To partake of with others : ἵνα δὴ καὶ ἐγὼ μεταδαίσομαι ἱρῶν (partitive genit.) Il. 23.207.

defs: Among the (i.e. one's own) people, at home : οὐ γὰρ ἔθʼ Ἥφαιστος μ. Od. 8.293. Among, afflicting, the people : κακὸν μεταδήμιον Od. 13.46.

etym: [app. μετα- 3 + δόρπον (the apparatus of the meal, rather than the meal, being thought of).]
forms: Thus, in the middle of, at, δόρπον : οὐ γὰρ ἐγώ γε τέρπομʼ ὀδυρόμενος μ. (in the midst of good cheer) Od. 4.194.

defs: Running in pursuit Il. 5.80.
To take one's seat among a company Od. 16.362.

forms: Aor. pple. μεταΐξας Il. 21.564 : Od. 17.236, Od. 20.11.
To rush at or upon a person : κτεῖνε μεταΐσσων Il. 16.398. Cf. Il. 21.564 : Od. 17.236, Od. 20.11.

defs: To make lament afterwards (i.e. when the opportunity for action has gone) Il. 11.764.

forms: Genit. sing. masc. aor. pple. pass. μετακλινθέντος.
defs: To turn the fortune of (war) : πολέμοιο μετακλινθέντος (if the tide of battle should turn and set against them) Il. 11.509.
(1) To ask, inquire, make inquiry, ask questions : μετάλλησάν γε μὲν οὔ τι Il. 5.516 : παίδων οὐκέτι μέμνηται οὐδὲ μεταλλᾷ (asks anything about them) Od. 15.23. Cf. Od. 14.378, Od. 15.362, Od. 23.99.
(2) To ask or inquire about : οὓς σὺ μεταλλᾷς Il. 10.125, Il. 13.780. Cf. Il. 1.550 : Od. 14.128, Od. 16.465, Od. 17.554, Od. 19.190 (inquired him out), Od. 24.321.
(3) To question (a person) : σε Il. 1.553 : Od. 16.287 =Od. 19.6. With indirect question : ξείνους οἵ τινές εἰσιν Od. 3.69. With cognate acc. : ἔπος ἄλλο μεταλλῆσαι νέστορα Od. 3.243.
(4) With double acc. of person questioned and of what is asked about : ὅ με μεταλλᾷς Il. 3.177 := Od. 6.243 = Od. 15.402, Od. 19.171. Cf. Od. 1.231 = Od. 15.390, Od. 19.115, Od. 24.478.

forms: Dat. sing. masc. aor. pple. μελαλλήξαντι.
defs: To cease, desist, from. With genit. : χόλοιο Il. 9.157, 261, 299.
In neut. sing. μεταμάζιον as adv., between the breasts Il. 5.19.

forms: To throw into one mass or sum with, lump with.
With dat. : κτήματα τοῖσιν Ὀδυσσῆος Od. 22.221.
To set or place among other objects : δαΐδας μετέμισγον Od. 18.310.
App., of none effect, coming to nothing, vain, idle, or the like : τὰ πάντα θεοὶ μεταμώνια θεῖεν Il. 4.363. Cf. Od. 2.98 = Od. 19.143 = Od. 24.133.–
One who has changed his home, an exile, an outcast : ὡς εἴ τινα μετανάστην Il. 9.648 = Il. 16.59.

defs: Of a heavenly body in its path, to change its position, pass : ἦμος δʼ ἠέλιος μετενίσ̔σ̓ετο βουλυτόνδε Il. 16.779 := Od. 9.58.

forms: Between (= μεσηγύ 1) : μάλα πολλὰ μεταξύ [ἐστιν] Il. 1.156.
To give oneself intervals of rest : μεταπαυόμενοι μάχοντο Il. 17.373.

defs: A turn of rest, an interval (cf. παυσωλή) Il. 19.201.
Conspicuous or eminent among. With dat. : δόμον μεταπρεπέʼ ἀθανάτοισιν (admired even where gods gather together) Il. 18.370.

forms: To be conspicuous, eminent, distinguished, distinguish oneself, be the best or finest, among.
With infin. expressing that in which one is distinguished : πᾶσι μετέπρεπε ἔγχεϊ μάρνασθαι Il. 16.194.
The later (lambs) Od. 9.221 (i.e. those born after the πρόγονοι and before the ἕρσαι).
To set off, take one's way, after or in the train of another Il. 7.296.
To start off in pursuit of, make for, a person Il. 21.423.
To make for, make up to (a person) : ποιμένα λαῶν Il. 23.389.
To lament afterwards, look back upon with grief : ἄτην Od. 4.261.

etym: [μετα- 1 + στοῖχος, row, line, fr. στείχω (app. with the notion of following the line with the eye). Cf. τριστοιχί.]
defs: In line, side by side : στὰν μ. Il. 23.358=757.

forms: Aor. pple. pass. μεταστρεφθείς,έντος Il. 8.258, Il. 11.447, 595, Il. 13.545, Il. 15.591, Il. 17.114, 732.
defs: (1) In pass., to turn oneself about, wheel round, for flight : θόωνα μεταστρεφθέντα οὔτασεν Il. 13.545. Cf. Il. 8.258 = Il. 11.447. So as to face the foe : στῆ μεταστρεφθείς Il. 11.595 = Il. 15.591 = Il. 17.114. Cf. Il. 17.732.
(2) To change (one's temper or mood) : εἴ κε μεταστρέψῃ ἦτορ Il. 10.107. Cf. Il. 15.52. Absol., to change one's mind Il. 15.203.
(3) To work a change : μή τι μεταστρέψωσι [θεοί] (bring some evil to pass) Od. 2.67.
To set or cause among a company : οὔ κέ τι τόσον κέλαδον μετέθηκεν (among us) Od. 18.402.

forms: To turn oneself so as to follow with one's view.]
To have regard for, care for, trouble oneself about.
With genit. : τῶν οὔ τι μετατρέπῃ Il. 1.160. Cf. Il. 9.630, Il. 12.238.

defs: To keep turning round : τότʼ οὔ τι μετατροπαλίζεο φεύγων (turned to face me in thy flight) Od. 3.190.

(1) To speak among, address. With dat. : πᾶσι μετηύδα Il. 15.103. Cf. Il. 18.139, Il. 19.269, Il. 22.449, Il. 23.5, Il. 24.32, 715 : Od. 4.721, Od. 7.217, Od. 8.96, Od. 12.153, 376, Od. 20.291, etc. Absol. : ἐν μέσσῳ στᾶσα μετηύδα Od. 12.20. To speak among a company in address to one of them : μετηύδα: Ἀντίλοχε . . . Il. 23.569.
(2) To say, speak, utter (words) among, address in words. With dat. : ἔπεʼ Ἀργείοισι μετηύδα Il. 2.109. Cf. Il. 8.496, Il. 9.16 : Od. 1.31.

To speak among, address. With dat. : τοῖσιν Il. 1.58 = Il. 19.55. Cf. Il. 19.100 : τοῖσιν Od. 4.660. Cf. Od. 8.132, Od. 18.51, 312, etc. To speak among a company in address to one of them. With dat. : τοῖς μετέφη . . . "φίλε κασίγνητε . . ." Il. 4.153. To speak among, be spokesman of (in prayer to a god). With dat. : τοῖσιν εὐχόμενος μετέφη Il. 2.411.

forms: To consider afterwards : ταῦτα μεταφρασόμεσθα καὶ αὖτις (will go into this later) Il. 1.140.

etym: [μετα- 4 + φρήν. The part behind the midriff.]
forms: So in pl. : ὅτεῳ στρεφθέντι μετάφρενα γυμνωθείη Il. 12.428.
With dat. : μυρμιδόνεσσιν Il. 18.323. Cf. Il. 6.384 : Od. 8.201, Od. 16.354, Od. 18.35, Od. 22.69.
To speak among a company in address to one of them.
Absol. : ἀνίστατο καὶ μετέειπεν Il. 6.94. Cf. Il. 6.399, etc. : Od. 2.24, Od. 20.321, etc.
To speak among a company in address to one of them.
With dat. : τοῖσι μετέειπε . . . Νέστορ . . . Il. 10.219. Cf. Il. 23.889, etc. : Od. 3.330, Od. 17.151, etc.
To speak among a company in address to one of them : ὀψὲ μετέειπε διομήδης· Ἀτρεΐδη . . . Il. 9.31. Cf. Il. 8.30, etc. : Od. 6.155.
1 sing. subj. μετέω Il. 22.388. μετείω Il. 23.47.
To be among or with, to have one's being or station, abide, dwell, among or with, consort with.

With dat. : οἷς ὁ γέρων μετέῃσιν Il. 3.109. Cf. Il. 4.316, 322, Il. 5.85, Il. 6.227, Il. 18.91, Od. 3.235, Il. 22.388, Il. 23.47 : ἦ ἔτι ζωοῖσι μετείην Od. 10.52. Cf. Od. 14.487, Od. 15.251, Od. 24.436.
Of something coming in in an interval : οὐ παυσωλὴ μετέσσεται Il. 2.386.

defs: (1) To go, take one's way, on an indicated errand : πόλεμόνδε Il. 13.298.
(2) With fut. sense, to follow after a person : ἴθʼ, ἐγὼ δὲ μέτειμι Il. 7.341.

To go in quest or pursuit of, make for : Τρῶας καὶ λυκίους Il. 16.685. Cf. Il. 18.581. So app. : ὅτε πᾶν πεδίον μετεκίαθον Il. 11.714 (had chased or swept the plain (cf. ἔφεπε πεδίον Il. 11.496 cited under ἐφέπω1 4)). Without expressed object : ἐφʼ ἵππων βάντες μετεκίαθον (went off to see what the matter was) Il. 18.532. To follow after : ἱππῆες ὀλίγον μετεκίαθον (app., came up close) Il. 11.52. To go to visit : αἰθίοπας Od. 1.22.
(1) Afterwards, in after time : ἅμα τʼ αὐτίκα καὶ μ. Od. 14.403. Cf. Il. 14.310.
(1) To go in quest of : πάριν Il. 7.280. To seek for (tidings) Od. 3.83. To go to see, visit : ἔργα Od. 16.314. To go and attend to (one's affairs) : μετέρχεο ἔργα γάμοιο Il. 5.429.

(2) To go, take one's way, on a specified or indicated errand or for a specified or indicated purpose : οὐκ ἂν τόνδʼ ἄνδρʼ ἐρύσαιο μετελθών ; (go and . . .) Il. 5.456. Cf. Il. 5.461, Il. 7.86, Il. 13.351, Il. 21.422 (go after her).

(3) To go or come, make one's way, present oneself, find oneself, among. With dat. or locative : θεοῖσι πᾶσιμετελθών Il. 14.334, λέων ἀγέληφι μετελθών Il. 16.487. Cf. Od. 1.134, Od. 7.132, 222. Without construction, to come upon the scene, present oneself : ὅς τις πινυτός γε μετέλθοι Od. 1.229. Cf. Il. 4.539, Il. 13.127.
In mid-air, in air, into the air, off the ground : τά κε μετήορα πάντα γένοιτο Il. 8.26. Cf. Il. 23.369.
(1) To go in quest or pursuit of : ἀοιδόν Od. 8.47. Cf. Il. 5.148.
(2) = μετέρχομαι 2 : ἀνὰ ἄστυ μετῴχετο Od. 8.7. Cf. Il. 10.111 (go and summon) : Od. 19.24.

forms: To squat now on one ham now on the other Il. 13.281.

defs: (1) In or from a position behind or in the rear : ὅσοι μ. ἀφέστασαν Il. 15.672, μ. μιν ποδῶν λάβεν Il. 18.155. Cf. Il. 10.490, Il. 17.261, Il. 23.346. In a geographical sense : ὅσσοι μ. [ναίουσιν] (in the quarter in which the day ends) Od. 13.241. With genit., behind : μ. νεός Od. 9.539. Cf. Il. 9.504. With a vb. of remaining or leaving, behind : μή τις μ. μιμνέτω Il. 7.68. Cf. Il. 22.334, Il. 24.687.
(2) In the back or rearward part of something, behind : ἴχνια μ. ποδῶν Il. 13.71. Cf. Il. 22.396.
(3) Changing one's position to a position facing rearwards : στρεφθεὶς μ. (turning his back) Il. 15.645.
(4) Afterwards, in after time, later : μ. τοι ἄχος ἔσσεται Il. 9.249. Cf. Il. 1.82, Od. 3.308, Il. 24.111, 436 : Od. 4.695, Od. 5.147, Od. 8.414, Od. 11.224, 382, Od. 22.319, 345, Od. 24.84.
(5) Then, next Il. 22.119.
To remove, change the position of : [λέχος] Od. 23.188. To thrust back (the fastening of a gate) : ὀχῆα Il. 24.567.
To measure, traverse : πέλαγος μέγα μετρήσαντες Od. 3.179.
(1) Something wherewith to measure, a graduated rule or cord Il. 12.422.

(2) A unit of capacity determined by context or usage; a quantity of anything indieated by such a unit : δῶκε μέθυ, χίλια μέτρα Il. 6.471, τέσσαρα μέτρα κεχανδότα Il. 23.268. Cf. Il. 23.741 : Od. 2.355, Od. 9.209.

(3) A stage of development or growth : ἥβης μ. Il. 11.225 : Od. 4.668, Od. 11.317, Od. 18.217, Od. 19.532. A point at the end of and measuring a course to be traversed : ὅρμου μ. (the anchorage) Od. 13.101.
(4) The  measurement or length of anything. In pl. : μέτρα κελεύθου Od. 4.389 = Od. 10.539.
In neut. sing. μετώπιον as adv., on the forehead : βάλε μ. Il. 16.739. Cf. Il. 11.95.

etym: [μετα-, μετα- 2 + ὦπα. The part between the eyes.]
forms: In pl. : πασάων δʼ ὑπὲρ κάρη ἔχει ἠδὲ μέτωπα Od. 7.107.
Of a horse : ἐν μετώπῳ λευκὸν σῆμα τέτυκτο Il. 23.454.

defs: (1) As far as, to : μέχρι θαλάσσης Il. 13.143.
(2) Until : τέο μέχρις; (how long?) Il. 24.128.

forms: Negative particle, commonly used with the moods expressive of command or wish, i. e. the imperative, the subjunctive and the optative (cf. οὐ).
defs: (1) In prohibitions or dehortations.
(2) In wishes. With opt. : μὴ ἐμέ γʼ οὖν οὗτος λάβοι χόλος Il. 16.30. Cf. Il. 13.232, etc. : Od. 1.386, Od. 4.699, Od. 6.316, Od. 12.106, Od. 13.46, etc.
(3) In deprecations and expressions of apprehension. With subj.
(4) After vbs. of fearing, lest.
(5) In subordinate clauses expressing apprehension not preceded by such a vb., lest.
(6) In protasis with εἰ (αἴ, ἤν.
(7) In final clauses.
(8) In conditional relative sentences (cf. οὐ 4).
(9) With indic.

(10) With pple. : μὴ μνηστεύσαντες μηδʼ ἄλλοθʼ ὁμιλήσαντες ὕστατα νῦν δειπνήσειν Od. 4.684 (μή with ὁμιλήσαντες and μνηστεύσαντες with ὁμιλήσαντες and μνηστεύσαντες parenthetical, may they after their wooing and having no meeting elsewhere eat now for the last time. See μηδέ 5, and for the parenthetical pple. and re-echoing neg. cf. μὴ τεχνησάμενος μηδʼ ἄλλο τι τεχνήσαιτο Od. 11.613).
(11) With infin. (see also 1.b).

forms: Negative particle, in general use corresponding to μή as οὐδέ to οὐ.
defs: (1) Adversatively, but not (cf. δέ 1) : τὰ μὲν ἄλλα μετάλλα, μηδʼ ἐμὸν ἐξερέεινε γένος Od. 19.116.
(2) In continuation, and not, nor (cf. δέ 2) : λῆγʼ ἔριδος, μηδὲ ξίφος ἕλκεο Il. 1.210. Cf. Il. 3.407, 434, Il. 14.85, etc. : Od. 1.289, 369, Od. 3.96, Od. 4.754, etc.

(3) Preceded by a negative, nor (sometimes rather to be translated or) : μή τι σὺ ταῦτα διείρεο μηδὲ μετάλλα Il. 1.550, μηκέτι λεγώμεθα, μηδʼ ἔτι δηρὸν ἀμβαλλώμεθα ἔργον Il. 2.435. Cf. Il. 9.523, etc. : Od. 2.231, Od. 5.160, etc.
