(4) Not even : μηδʼ ὅν τινα γαστέρι μήτηρ φέροι Il. 7.58. Cf. Il. 10.239, etc. : Od. 4.710, etc. To be translated neither : μηδὲ σὺ κεῦθε ὅττι κέ σʼ εἴρωμαι Od. 8.548.
(5) Reechoing a negative for emphasis. See under μή 10 and cf. οὐδέ 5.
(6) Introducing a prohibition : μηδέ τις οἶος μεμάτω μάχεσθαι Il. 4.303.

Counsels, arts, plans, devices, schemes : εἰδὼς μ. πυκνά Il. 3.202, ὅτε μ. ὕφαινον Il. 3.212. Cf. Il. 2.340, Il. 3.208, Il. 6.278, Il. 15.467, Il. 16.120, Il. 17.325 (see φίλος 5.c), Il. 18.363, Il. 24.88, 282 = 674 : Od. 2.38, Od. 7.12, Od. 11.202, 445, Od. 13.89, Od. 19.353, Od. 20.46.
The genitals, the testicles, the private parts Od. 7.129, Od. 18.67, 87, Od. 22.476.

forms: Absol. in neut., nothing : ἀναίνετο μηδὲν ἑλέσθαι (double neg., refused to accept anything) Il. 18.500 (the μή implying that the will was concerned).

defs: (1) To take counsel, devise measures Il. 2.360.

(2) To devise, plan, contrive, meditate, intend, have in view : ἔργα Il. 2.38. Cf. Il. 7.157, Il. 6.478, Il. 10.289, Il. 14.253, Il. 21.19, 413, Il. 23.176 : Ζεὺς οὔ πω μήδετο νόστον Od. 3.160, ἄλλο τι τόδε μήδεαι οὐδέ τι πομπήν (it is not of a safe journey for me that you are here thinking but of something else) Od. 5.173. Cf. Od. 3.132, 166, 194, Od. 5.189, Od. 11.429, Od. 22.169, Od. 24.199, etc. With double acc. of what is devised, etc., and of the person aimed at : Ἕκτορα ἀεικέα μήδετο ἔργα Il. 22.395 = Il. 23.24. Cf. Il. 10.52 : Od. 24.426.

forms: 3 pl. thematic plupf. (in impf. sense) ἐμέμηκον Od. 9.439. Of sheep or goats, to bleat : ὄϊες ἀζηχὲς μεμακυῖαι (bleating) Il. 4.435. Cf. Od. 9.439.
In reference to the cry of a hunted creature Il. 10.362.
Of a wounded and dying horse or other animal : κὰδ δὲ πέσε μακών (with a cry) Il. 16.469 := Od. 10.163 = Od. 19.454.
Of Irus when knocked down by Odysseus Od. 18.98.
Epithet of goats Il. 11.383, Il. 23.31 : Od. 9.124, 244 = 341.

etym: [μὴ ἔτι, app. on the analogy of οὐκέτι.]
forms: In general use corresponding to μή as οὐκέτι to οὐ.
defs: (1) In reference to the present, no more, no longer. In a conditional relative sentence : εὖτʼ ἂν μ. ἐπικρατέωσιν ἄνακτες Od. 17.320.

forms: The tallest : τὸν μήκιστον κτάνον ἄνδρα Il. 6.155 : οὓς μηκίστους θρέψεν Od. 11.309.
In neut. pl. μήκιστα as adv., at long last, in the issue : τί νύ μοι μ. γένηται; Od. 5.299, 465.

defs: (1) Length Od. 9.324.
(2) In reference to stature, height Od. 11.312. Tallness of stature as an element of womanly beauty : μ. ἔπορʼ?̓́αρτεμις Od. 20.71.
A poppy Il. 8.306.

forms: An apple-tree : ὄγχναι καὶ ῥοιαὶ καὶ μηλέαι Od. 6.115 = Od. 11.589. Cf. Od. 24.340.

defs: A shepherd : κτεῖνον μηλοβοτῆρας Il. 18.529.
(2) Referring specifically
(b) To goats : ὑπὸ σπέος [αἰπόλος] ἤλασε μῆλα Il. 4.279. Cf. Od. 17.246. In sing., a goat : μ. αἰγῶν ὅς τις φαίνηται ἄριστος Od. 14.105.
(1) A fruit : ἄνθεσι μήλων (fruit-blossom) Il. 9.542.
(2) Specifically, an apple Od. 7.120.
Applehued, yellow. Epithet of grain Od. 6.104.
(1) Considered as a space of time : ἕνα μῆνα μένων Il. 2.292. Cf. Il. 5.387 : Od. 10.14, Od. 12.325, Od. 14.244, Od. 17.408, Od. 24.118.
(2) Considered as a point or unit of time or as one of a series : ὅτε μῆνες ἐξετελεῦντο Od. 11.294 = Od. 14.293, τοῦ φθίνοντος μηνός Od. 14.162 = Od. 19.307. Cf. Od. 10.470, Od. 19.153 = Od. 24.143.

Affirmative particle : εἰ δʼ ἄ γε μὴν πείρησαι (do but . . .) Il. 1.302, καὶ μὴν οἱ τότε . . . (even they Il. 19.45. Cf. Il. 24.52, Il. 23.410 := Od. 16.440 = Od. 19.487, καὶ μὴν . . . εἰσεῖδον (and . . . too I saw) Od. 11.582, 593. With ἦ. See ἦ2 1.b

forms: The moon : τοῦ σέλας γένετʼ ἠΰτε μήνης Il. 19.374. Cf. Il. 23.455.

defs: Wrath, ire : μηνιθμὸν καταπαυσέμεν Il. 16.62. Cf. Il. 16.202, 282.
A cause or occasion of wrath : μή μ. γένωμαι Il. 22.358 : Od. 11.73.
(1) Wrath, ire : μῆνιν ἄειδε Ἀχιλῆος Il. 1.1. Cf. Il. 1.75, Il. 5.178, Il. 9.517, Il. 15.122, Il. 19.35, 75, Il. 21.523 : Od. 3.135.
(2) The operation or effect of wrath : Διὸς ἀλεώμεθα μῆνιν Il. 5.34. Cf. Il. 5.444 = Il. 16.711, Il. 13.624 : Od. 2.66, Od. 5.146, Od. 14.283.

(1) To be wrathful or angry, feel or harbour wrath or anger : μήνιʼ Ἀχαιοῖσιν (against the . . .) Il. 1.422, ἱρῶν μηνίσας (having conceived wrath in the matter of . . .) Il. 5.178. Cf. Il. 1.488, Il. 2.769, Il. 12.10, Il. 18.257 : Od. 17.14.
(2) To show wrath or anger outwardly, rage : Ἀτρεΐδης ἑτέρωθεν ἐμήνιεν Il. 1.247.

As a word of ritual, the thigh bones of a victim with the flesh adhering Il. 1.40, Il. 8.240, Il. 11.773, Il. 15.373, Il. 22.170, Il. 24.34: Od. 3.9, 273, 456, Od. 4.764, Od. 9.553, Od. 17.241, Od. 19.366, 397, Od. 21.267, Od. 22.336.
(1) The thigh : φάσγανον ἐρυσσάμενος παρὰ μηροῦ Il. 1.190. Cf. Il. 4.146, Il. 5.305, Il. 10.573, Il. 11.583, Il. 12.162, etc. : Od. 8.135, Od. 9.300, Od. 10.439, Od. 13.198, Od. 18.67, etc.
To lower (a sail) : ἱστία μηρύσαντο Od. 12.170.
(1) A counsellor or advices Il. 6.366, Il. 14.318, Il. 17.477 : Od. 3.110, 409. Of Zeus Il. 8.22, Il. 17.339.

(2) One who devises or brings about something. In reference to warriors : μήστωρες (μήστωρας) ἀϋτῆς (raisers of the battle-shout) Il. 4.328, Il. 13.93 = 479, Il. 16.759. Cf. Il. 7.97 = 278, Il. 12.39, Il. 23.16. Of horses Il. 5.272, Il. 8.108.

forms: In general use corresponding to μή as οὔτε to οὐ · μήτε . . . μήτε . . ., neither . . . nor . . . (after a negative, either . . . or . . .) Il. 1.275, Il. 5.827, Il. 6.400, Il. 8.7, Il. 10.249, Il. 14.342, Il. 16.98, Il. 21.288, Il. 24.337 : Od. 1.39, Od. 13.308, Od. 14.387, Od. 16.302, Od. 17.401, Od. 18.79, 416 = Od. 20.324.– μήτε . . . τε . . . Il. 13.230.

etym: [cognate with L. mater, Eng. mother, German mutter.]
defs: (1) A mother, one's mother Il. 1.280, 357, Il. 3.238, Il. 4.130, Il. 5.248, etc. : Od. 1.215, Od. 2.135, Od. 3.95, Od. 4.224, Od. 8.550, etc. In reference to birds or animals Il. 2.313 = 327, Il. 2.315, Il. 5.555, Il. 17.4 : Od. 10.414.
(2) Applied to districts, etc., in reference to what they produce : ̓́ιτωνα μητέρα μήλων Il. 2.696. Cf. Il. 8.47, Il. 9.479, Il. 11.222, Il. 14.283, Il. 15.151 : Od. 15.226.

forms: Dat. sing. masc. pple. μητιόωντι Il. 18.312.
Nom. sing. fem. μητιόωσα Il. 15.27 : Od. 7.14, Od. 8.9.
defs: (1) To deliberate, take counsel, concert measures Il. 6.45. To take (counsel) : μητιόωντες βουλάς Od. 3.153. With dependent clause. In mid. : μητιάασθε ἠὲ . . . ἦε . . . (consider whether . . .) Il. 22.175.

(2) To meditate, purpose, propose to oneself, have in mind : ἅσσα τε μητιόωσι μετὰ σφίσιν Il. 10.208=409. Cf. Il. 18.312. To devise, plan, contrive, scheme to bring about : κακά Il. 15.27. Cf. Od. 1.234, Od. 7.14 = Od. 8.9. With infin. expressing what is planned or contrived : τεῖχος ἀμαλδῦναι Il. 12.17.

As voc. Il. 1.508. Elsewhere as nom. (prob. orig. the voc. turned into a nom.) The counsellor or deviser. Epithet of Zeus Il. 1.175, Il. 2.197, Il. 7.198, Il. 6.478, Il. 8.170, etc. : Od. 14.243, Od. 16.298, Od. 20.102.
Skilful in attaining one's ends. Applied to drugs : φάρμακα μητιόεντα (helpful, bringing relief) Od. 4.227.
(1) To exhibit skill or address : οὐδὲ πλείονα ἴσασι μητίσασθαι (know better how to . . ., are more skilful) Il. 23.312.

(2) To devise, plan, contrive, scheme to bring about Il. 3.416, Il. 10.48, Il. 15.349 : Od. 12.373. With double acc. of what is devised, etc., and of the person aimed at : δν ἂν κακὰ μητισαίμην Od. 18.27. Absol. Od. 9.262.

(2) Skill in counsel or device, astuteness, shrewdness : ὄφρα σε μ. ἐξάγαγʼ ἐξ ἄντροιο Od. 20.20. Cf. Il. 2.169, 407, 636, Il. 6.47 = Il. 11.200, Il. 10.137 : Od. 2.279, Od. 3.120, Od. 13.299, Od. 23.125.
(3) Contrivance, scheming : διὰ μῆτιν Ἀθήνης Il. 10.497.
(4) Counsel, concerting of measures : ὑφαίνειν μῆτιν Il. 6.324 = Il. 9.93. Cf. Od. 4.678, Od. 9.422, Od. 13.303, 386, Od. 19.326.
(5) A course of action, scheme, plan : ὄφρʼ ἄλλην φράζωνται μῆτιν ἀμείνω Il. 9.423. Cf. Il. 10.19, Il. 14.107, Il. 15.509, Il. 17.634, 712 : Od. 4.739, Od. 9.414, Od. 10.193, Od. 19.158.
(6) What one proposes to effect, one's intention or purpose, what one has in one's mind : ἥν τινα μῆτιν κέκευθεν Od. 3.18. Cf. Il. 6.447.
(7) The faculty of deliberation or weighing in the mind : λεπτὴ μῆτίς [ἐστιν] Il. 10.226, Il. 23.590.
The father of one's mother, one's maternal grand-father Il. 11.224.
A stepmother Il. 5.389 (i. e., app., of the sons of Aloeus), Il. 13.697 = Il. 15.336.
Of one's mother : μητρώϊον ἐς δῶμα (i.e. her old home) Od. 19.410.
A maternal uncle Il. 2.662, Il. 16.717.

forms: 3 pl. μηχανὁωνται Od. 3.207, Od. 4.822, Od. 16.134, Od. 21.375, etc.
Acc. pl. masc. pple. μηχανόωντας Od. 18.143.
3 pl. impf. μηχανόωντο Il. 8.177, Il. 11.695 : Od. 20.394, Od. 22.432. (περι-)
defs: (1) To construct, put together Il. 8.177.

(2) To devise, contrive, put in practice : ἀτάσθαλα Il. 11.695 : Od. 3.207, Od. 16.93, Od. 17.588, Od. 18.143, Od. 20.170, 370. Cf. Od. 3.213, Od. 16.134, 196, Od. 17.499, Od. 20.394, Od. 21.375, Od. 22.432. Absol., to lay plans, form devices, plot : πολλοὶ ἐπʼ αὐτῷ μηχανόωνται Od. 4.822.

A means, device or expedient for carrying out one's wishes or remedying a state of matters : οὐδέ τι μ. εὑρέμεναι δυνάμεσθα Il. 2.342. Cf. Od. 12.392. With infin. : ἄκος εὑρεῖν Il. 9.249. Cf. Od. 14.238.

forms: 3 pl. aor. pass. μιάνθησαν Il. 16.795, Il. 23.732.
A form μιάνθην Il. 4.146 explained as 3 pl. aor. pass. or as a 3 dual (for μιάν-σθην).
defs: (1) To stain, colour : ἐλέφαντα φοίνικι Il. 4.141.
(2) To stain, defile, sully, soil Il. 4.146, Il. 16.795, 797, Il. 17.439, Il. 23.732.
Stained, sullied Il. 24.420.
To have sexual intercourse : μιγαζομένους φιλότητι Od. 8.271.
Mingled, in one mass, with something Od. 24.77. With dat., among : μ. ἄλλοισι θεοῖσιν Il. 8.437.
(1) Of small size : λίθος Od. 3.296.
(2) In reference to stature, short : μικρὸς δέμας (in . . .) Il. 5.801. Comp. μείων Il. 2.528, 529, Il. 3.193.
To tarry, loiter : παρὰ νηυσίν Il. 2.392, Il. 10.549.

forms: Mid. 3 sing. pa. iterative μνησάσκετο Il. 11.566.
2 pl. μνήσασθε Il. 7.112, Il. 16.371, Il. 15.662, etc.
2 sing. μέμνηαι Il. 21.442. μέμνῃ Il. 15.18, Od. 3.188, Il. 21.396 : Od. 24.115. μέμνησαι Il. 23.648.
3 sing. μέμνηται Il. 8.362 : Od. 2.233, Od. 5.11, Od. 15.23.
3 sing. μεμνέῳτο (app., with metathesis of quantity, for μεμνήοιτο) Il. 23.361.
defs: (1) To remind (a person) : μνήσει σε καὶ θεὸς αὐτός Od. 12.38. To remind (a person) of (something). With genit. : τῶν νῦν μιν μνήσασα Il. 1.407. Cf. Il. 15.31 : Od. 3.103, Od. 14.169, 170.
(2) In mid. and (in c) in pass. (the pf. in pres. and the plupf. in impf. sense).

forms: Dat. pl. masc. pple. μιμνόντεσσι Il. 2.296.
defs: (1) To remain where one is, to remain, stay, tarry, abide, continue to be, in a specified or indicated place : μή τις μετόπισθε μιμνέτω Il. 7.69. Cf. Il. 2.296, 331, Il. 7.431, Il. 9.552, 617, Il. 13.747, Il. 15.689, Il. 18.263, Il. 19.189, 190, Il. 22.439, Il. 24.470 : αὐτόθι μίμνει ἀγρῷ (has his abode at the farm) Od. 11.187. Cf. Od. 7.245, Od. 9.172, Od. 10.489, Od. 11.356, Od. 12.161, Od. 15.545, Od. 23.38, Od. 24.396, 464.
(2) To remain or be in a specified condition : ἵνα περ τάδε τοι σόα μίμνῃ Il. 24.382 : Od. 13.364.

(3) To await the coming or approach of (a person) : ἄλλους Il. 4.340 : τί μ'  οὐ μίμνεις ἑλέειν μεμαῶτα; (stay for my embrace) Od. 11.210. To await the coming or coming on of (a period of time) : Ἠῶ Il. 8.565, Il. 9.662, Il. 18.255 : Od. 16.368, Od. 18.318, Od. 19.50. To await an occurrence. With dependent clause : μίμνετʼ εἰς ὅ κε . . . (wait till . . .) Od. 2.97= Od. 19.142 = Od. 24.132.

(4) To await the attack of, stand up to : οὐδέ μιν μίμνον Il. 5.94. Cf. Il. 9.355, Il. 12.136, Il. 13.129, Il. 22.38, 92. Sim. : μίμνομεν?̓́αρηα Il. 17.721. Cf. Il. 13.106. Of something inanimate : δρύες, αἵ τʼ ἄνεμον μίμνουσιν Il. 12.133. Absol., to await the foe, stand firm, stand one's ground : οὐκ?̓ιδομενεὺς τλῆμίμνειν Il. 8.78, νέστωρ οἶος ἔμιμνεν (here hardly more than sense (1)) 80. Cf. Il. 13.713, Il. 15.727 = Il. 16.102.

forms: enclitic. Acc. pron. of the 3rd person.
defs: (3) Referring to things, it Il. 1.237, Il. 4.143, etc.. Od. 9.120, Od. 10.305, etc. The antecedent a neut. pl. : Od. 10.212, Od. 17.268.
(4) With αὐτός in reflexive sense : αὐτόν μιν πληγῇσι δαμάσσας Od. 4.244.

(1) To diminish, make smaller, take from. In reference to abstractions : Ἀργείων μένος Il. 15.493. Cf. Od. 3.242. To deprive (a person) of power or spirit, take the heart out of (him) : ὅτινας μινύθῃ [Ζεύς] Il. 15.492.
(2) To diminish in number, make fewer : ἄρσενας σύας μινύθεσκον ἔδοντες Od. 14.17.

(3) To waste or decay away : περὶ ῥινοὶ μινύθουσιν Od. 12.46. To suffer destruction, be destroyed or ruined Il. 16.392, Il. 17.738. Of the heart or spirit, to waste or pine away : μινύθει ἦτορ ἑταίρων Od. 4.374. Cf. Od. 4.467.

forms: For a short time, for a little while : ἐπεί τοι αἶσα μ. περ Il. 1.416. Cf. Il. 4.466, Il. 11.317, 539, Il. 12.356, Il. 13.573, Il. 14.358, Il. 17.277, Od. 3.27, Il. 23.97 : Od. 8.315, Od. 11.501, Od. 15.494, Od. 22.473.

defs: Lasting but a short time, short : αἰών Il. 4.478= Il. 17.302. In comp. : μινυνθαδιώτερον ἄλγος ἔσσεται Il. 22.54. Of persons, short-lived Il. 1.352, Il. 15.612, Il. 21.84 : Od. 11.307, Od. 19.328.

forms: To make lament in a low tone,  weep softly Od. 4.719.
To whimper, make whimpering complaint, whine Il. 5.889.

defs: A place where two glens join their streams Il. 4.453.

forms: Fut. infin. μιγήσεσθαι Il. 10.365. μίξεσθαι, μείξεσθαι Od. 7.136, Od. 24.314.
Acc. sing. masc. pple. μιγέντα Il. 4.354 : Od. 18.379.
Nom. sing. fem. μιγεῖσα Od. 1.73, Od. 11.268, Od. 19.266.
3 sing. aor. ἔμικτο Od. 1.433. μίκτο Il. 11.354, Il. 16.813.
defs: (1) To mix together : οἶνον καὶ ὕδωρ Od. 1.110.

(2) To mix with something : ἀνὰ κρῖ ἔμιξαν Od. 4.41. Cf. Od. 4.222. To mix (wine) with water Il. 3.270. With that with which a thing is mixed in dat. : ἅλεσσι μεμιγμένον εἶδαρ Od. 11.123= Od. 23.270. Sim. : τρώεσσι μεμιγμένοι (sharing quarters with them) Il. 10.424. Also Od. 8.196, Od. 20.203 (to bring into trouble).
(3) To mix together in confusion or without distinction : ἐπεί κε νομῷ μιγέωσιν [αἶγες] Il. 2.475. Cf. Od. 4.230. Sim. : γλῶσσʼ ἐμέμικτο Il. 4.438. Cf. Od. 19.175.

(4) To bring together (in fight) : αὐτοσχεδίῃ μεῖξαι χεῖρας Il. 15.510. In pass., to come together in fight : μιγήμεναι ἐν δαΐ Il. 13.286. Cf. Il. 4.456, Od. 3.374, Il. 21.469. So χεῖρες ἔμιχθεν Il. 23.687. Sim. : μισγομένων ἀνέμων θύελλα Od. 5.317.

(5) In pass., to mingle with, to set oneself, take one's place or stand, find or get oneself, among, visit, join, reach. With dat. : προμάχοισιν ἐμίχθη Il. 5.134, Il. 8.99, Il. 13.642, Il. 15.457. Cf. Il. 3.48, Il. 4.354, Il. 5.143, Il. 10.365, Il. 11.354, Il. 16.813, Il. 24.91 : κούρῃσιν ἔμελλε μίξεσθαι Od. 7.136. Cf. Od. 5.378, 386, Od. 9.91, Od. 15.315. Sim. : μιχθήμεναι [ἔγχος] ἔγκασιν (to penetrate) Il. 11.438, ἁλὶ μίσγεται [ἀέλλη] (comes upon and ruffles) Il. 13.797. Cf. Il. 14.386 (to encounter), Il. 15.409 (to get among), Il. 10.457 := Od. 22.329 (rolled in the dust). With ἐν or ἐνὶ · ἐνὶ προμάχοισι μιγέντα Od. 18.379. Cf. Il. 3.209, Il. 10.180. Sim. Il. 3.55. With ἐς Il. 18.216. Absol. : οὐ μίσγεσθαι ἐῶσιν Il. 23.73. Cf. Od. 18.49.
(6) In pass., to associate or be intimate with. With dat. : ἐμισγόμεθ'ʼ ἀλλήλοισιν Od. 1.209. Cf. Od. 7.288, Od. 6.247. Absol. Od. 4.178, Od. 24.314.

(7) In pass., to have sexual intercourse : τῆς εὐνῆς ἐπιβήμεναι ἠδὲ μιγῆναι Il. 9.133=275= Il. 19.176. Cf. Il. 2.232, Il. 3.445, Il. 7.25, 161, Il. 14.295 : Od. 1.433, Od. 8.268, Od. 10.334, Od. 11.268, Od. 15.430, Od. 19.266, Od. 22.445, Od. 23.219. With dat. of person : γυναικί περ ἐν φιλότητι μίσγεσθαι Il. 24.131. Cf. Il. 7.165, Il. 21.143 : Od. 1.73, Od. 5.126, Od. 6.61, Od. 11.306, Od. 15.420, Od. 18.325, Od. 20.7, 12. With cognate acc. : φιλότης τε καὶ εὐνή, ἣν ἐμίγης Il. 15.33.

forms: With infin., to dislike or shrink from the idea of something happening: μίσησέ μιν δηΐων κυσὶ κύρμα γενέσθαι Il. 17.272.

defs: (1) An inducement held out to one, a reward : μισθός οἱ ἄρκιος ἔσται Il. 10.304. Cf. Od. 4.525.
(2) A return for one's work or labour, hire, wages Il. 12.435, Il. 21.445, 450, 451, 457 : Od. 10.84 (double wages), Od. 18.358.
The warp in weaving Il. 23.762.

forms: App. some kind of metal guard worn round the waist under the ζωστήρ, ζῶμα and θώρηξ Il. 4.137, 187, 216, Il. 5.857.
Dat. sing. masc. pple. μνωομένῳ Od. 4.106.
3 pl. impf. ἐμνώοντο Il. 2.686. μνώοντο Il. 11.71, Il. 16.697, 771; Od. 11.288.
defs: (1) = μιμνήσκω 2..a. Absol. : κήδεσιν ἀλλήλων τερπώμεθα μνωομένω Od. 15.400. Cf. Od. 4.106.
(2) = μιμνήσκω 2..b : οὐ πολέμοιο ἐμνώοντο Il. 2.686. Cf. Il. 11.71= Il. 16.771. Sim. : φύγαδε μνώοντο (turned their minds to flight, turned to flight) Il. 16.697.

(3) To seek or woo for one's bride, court : ἤδη σε μνῶνται ἀριστῆες Od. 7.34. Cf. Od. 1.248= Od. 16.125, Od. 7.284, Od. 11.117= Od. 13.378, Od. 11.288, Od. 16.431, Od. 19.133, Od. 20.290, Od. 21.161, 326, Od. 24.125. Absol., to do one's wooing, make court Od. 14.91, Od. 16.77, 391, Od. 19.529. To make illicit suit to, seek to debauch (the wife of another) Od. 1.39.
Something serving to remind, a memento or remembrancer : τάφου μ. Il. 23.619. Cf. Od. 15.126, Od. 21.40.

forms: A bearing in mind (in the sense of μιμνήσκω 2.b), thought or care for something : πυρός Il. 8.181.
Having a good memory, clear in recollection Od. 21.95.
Mindful or heedful of something, keeping a careful eye on something : φόρτου Od. 8.163.

defs: To seek or woo for one's bride, court : ἀγαθὴν γυναῖκα Od. 18.277. Absol., to do one's wooing, make court Od. 4.684.

forms: Dat. pl. μνηστήρεσσι Od. 1.91, Od. 2.395, Od. 15.315, Od. 19.2, Od. 21.3, etc. μνηστῆρσι Od. 1.114, Od. 2.21, Od. 4.790, Od. 20.5, Od. 22.4, etc. A wooer or suitor : μνηστήρων δίκη Od. 18.275. Cf. Od. 18.247.
Of the suitors for Penelope in the absence of Odysseus : Od. 1.91, Od. 2.21, Od. 3.206, Od. 4.625, Od. 5.27, Od. 11.119, Od. 13.193, etc.
A bearing in mind (in the sense of μιμνήσκω 2.b), thought or care for something : δόρπου Od. 13.280.
A wooing or courting : παύσεσθαι μνηστύος Od. 2.199. Cf. Od. 16.294= Od. 19.13.

defs: To suffer toil, hardship, distress, to toil, labour : πολλὰ μόγησα Il. 1.162, ἄλλος μογέων ἀποκινήσασκε [δέπας] (with trouble or difficulty, could just . . .) Il. 11.636. Cf. Il. 2.690, Il. 9.492, Il. 12.29, Il. 23.607 : ἄλγεα πολλὰ μογήσας (after sore toil and distress) Od. 2.343, μογέοντες (tired, weary) Od. 24.388. Cf. Od. 4.106, Od. 5.223, Od. 7.175, Od. 6.214, Od. 12.190, Od. 16.19, Od. 23.307, etc.
With difficulty, hardly, just, only just Il. 9.355, Il. 21.417, Il. 22.412 : Od. 3.119 (only after long years), Od. 19.189.
Toil, labour Il. 4.27.

etym: [μογοσ- (to be taken as a relic of the acc. pl. of μόγος; cf. δικασπόλος) + τοκ-, τίκτω.
forms: Hence pangs-generating, that brings on the woman's pains.' Or perh. μογο-, μόγος + στακ-, to stay.
Hence pangs-staying, that brings the woman relief from her pains.]
Epithet of εἰλείθυια or the εἰλείθυιαι Il. 11.270 (which seems to point to the first explanation), Il. 16.187, Il. 19.103.

defs: The press of battle, battle Il. 6.117, 240, Il. 18.159, 537, Il. 21.310.

(1) (Due) measure. κατὰ μοῖραν, duly, fitly, properly, in the proper way, in seemly wise : ἔειπες Il. 1.286. Cf. Il. 9.59, Il. 15.206, Il. 16.367, Il. 19.256, etc. : πάντα κατὰ μοῖραν Od. 3.457. Cf. Od. 2.251, Od. 3.331, Od. 8.496, Od. 15.170, Od. 17.580, etc. So ἐν μοίρῃ · πέφαται (has met his deserts) Od. 22.54. Cf. Il. 19.186.– παρὰ μοῖραν, unduly, in unseemly wiseOd. 14.509.
(2) A part, portion, division : παροίχωκεν πλέων νὺξ τῶν δύο μοιράων (more of it than two (of the three) watches), τριτάτη δʼ ἔτι μοῖρα λέλειπται (see under λείπω (3)) Il. 10.253. Cf. Od. 4.97.

(3) A share or portion allotted or available : ἴση μοῖρα μένοντι (the same share of the spoil) Il. 9.318. Cf. Il. 15.195, Il. 16.68 : σπλάγχνων μοίρας Od. 3.40, Od. 20.260. Cf. Od. 3.66= Od. 20.280, Od. 8.470, Od. 11.534, Od. 14.448, Od. 15.140, Od. 17.258, 335, Od. 19.423, Od. 20.281, 293.

(4) One's portion or lot in life, one's fate or destiny, what is allotted by fate : οὔ πώ τοι μ. [ἐστι] θανεῖν Il. 6.52. Cf. Il. 15.117, Il. 16.434, Il. 17.421, Il. 18.120, Il. 23.80 : Od. 4.475, Od. 5.41, 114, 345, Od. 9.532. Sim. : ἐφʼ ἑκάστῳ μοῖραν ἔθηκαν ἀθάνατοι (its place or use) Od. 19.592, οὐδʼ αἰδοῦς μοῖραν ἔχουσιν (have no room in their hearts for it) Od. 20.171.
(5) Good fortune : μοῖράν τʼ ἀμμορίην τε Od. 20.76.

(6) Fate that comes upon or overtakes one, evil fate, death, doom : μ. μιν ἀμφεκάλυψεν Il. 12.116. Cf. Il. 4.517, Il. 5.83, Il. 7.488, Il. 13.602, Il. 16.849, Il. 17.478, Il. 21.83, Il. 22.303, etc. : μ. θανάτοιο (fate consisting in death, i.e. death) Od. 2.100. Cf. Od. 11.292, Od. 21.24, Od. 22.413, Od. 24.29, etc.
(7) Fate or destiny as decreed by the gods : μ. θεῶν Od. 3.269. So μ. alone, the decrees of fate (cf. αἶσα 6, μόρος 3) : ὑπὲρ μοῖραν Od. 3.336.
(8) Fate personified Il. 19.87, 410, Il. 24.209. In pl., the Fates Il. 24.49.
Child of (good) fortune Il. 3.182.

etym: [μοιχός, adulterer + ἄγρη. Spoils exacted from an adulterer.]
forms: Compensation levied for adultery : μοιχάγριʼ ὀφέλλει Od. 8.332.

defs: A term of abuse or depreciation of unknown meaning. Of a beggar Od. 17.219, Od. 18.26.
(1) With special reference to dancing : μολπῆς ἐξάρχοντες ἐδίνευον Il. 18.606 := Od. 4.19. Cf. Il. 18.572 : Od. 7.101, Od. 21.430.
(2) To singing : μολπῇ θεὸν ἱλάσκοντο καλὸν ἀείδοντες παιήονα Il. 1.472. Cf. Il. 13.637 := Od. 23.145, Od. 1.152.
A leaden weight Il. 24.80.
To leave alone or without aid : ἐνὶ Τρώεσσι μονωθείς Il. 11.470.
Decreed by fate. Absol. in neut. sing. in impers. construction : μόριμόν οἵ ἐστʼ ἀλέασθαι Od. 3.302.
Of water, to flow with noise, rush, roar Il. 5.599, Il. 18.403, Il. 21.325.

forms: Thus, as if consisting of berries, berry-like, clustering : ἕρματα μορόεντα Il. 14.183 := Od. 18.298.

defs: (1) One's portion or lot in life, one's fate or destiny, what is allotted by fate : μόρος μοί [ἐστιν] ἐνθάδʼ ὀλέσθαι Il. 19.421. Cf. Il. 7.357, Il. 22.280 (i.e. that I was doomed), Il. 24.85 : Od. 11.618.
(2) Fate that comes upon or overtakes one, evil fate, death, doom : ἀλλὰ καὶ ὧς ὀλέεσθε κακὸν μόρον Il. 21.133. Cf. Il. 18.465 : Od. 1.166, Od. 9.61, Od. 11.409, Od. 16.421, Od. 20.241.

(3) The decrees of fate (cf. μοῖρα 7) : ὑπὲρ μόρον (also written ὑπέρμορον), beyond, contrary to, in defiance of, fate : μὴ καὶ τεῖχος ὑπέρμορον ἐξαλαπάξῃ Od. 3.30. Cf. Il. 21.517 : Od. 1.34, 34, Od. 5.436.

Of or pertaining to fate : μόρσιμον ἦμαρ. See ἦμαρ 4.f. Destined to endure a specified fate : οὔ με κτενέεις, ἐπεὶ οὔ τοι μ. εἰμι Il. 22.13. Destined or marked out by fate to achieve something : ἥ κε γήμαιθʼ ὅς κε μόρσιμος ἔλθοι Od. 16.392= Od. 21.162. Absol. in neut. sing. in impers. construction, decreed by fate : σοὶ αὐτῷ μόρσιμόν ἐστι δαμῆναι Il. 19.417. Cf. Il. 5.674.

forms: Acc. pl. neut. pf. pple. pass. μεμορυψμένα.
defs: To sully, make foul : μεμορυγμένα καπνῷ Od. 13.435.
Beauty, grace : μ. ἐπέων (honied speech) Od. 11.367. Cf. Od. 8.170.
Of uncertain meaning : αἰετόν, μόρφνον θηρητῆρα Il. 24.316 (perh. (comparing αἰετοῦ μέλανος, τοῦ θηρητῆρος Il. 21.252) the dark one, the hunter).

forms: App., young, slender, pliant : δίδη μόσχοισι λύγοισιν Il. 11.105.

defs: Alone, by oneself, singly Od. 8.371, Od. 11.417.

(1) Alone, by oneself, without others near, without aider or helper : μοῦνος ἐὼν μετὰ καδμείοισιν Il. 4.388. Cf. Il. 10.225, Il. 11.406, 467, Il. 12.411, Il. 15.611, Il. 17.94, 472, Od. 3.188, Il. 22.456 : Od. 3.217, Od. 6.204, Od. 10.157, Od. 12.297, Od. 16.105, 239, Od. 20.30, 40, Od. 22.13, 107, Od. 23.38.

(2) Alone, only, the only one in the same  predicament : θερσίτης μοῦνος ἐκολῴα Il. 2.212. Cf. Il. 9.335, 340, 482, Il. 10.317 (i.e. the only son), Il. 14.492, Il. 21.443 : Od. 2.365 (an only child), Od. 4.496, Od. 11.68, Od. 16.19, 118, 119, 120. Strenghtening εἷς · ἀμφίπολος μία μούνη Od. 23.227. A single : ἐπιβλής Il. 24.453.
(1) To isolate, leave alone or without aid : μουνωθέντα σε λάβον Od. 15.386.
(2) To make single : ὧδε ἡμετέρην γενεὴν μούνωδε κρονίων (i.e. allowed but one son in a generation) Od. 16.117.

forms: αἱ. The Muses, the goddesses of song and poetry Il. 1.604, Il. 2.484= Il. 11.218= Il. 14.508 =  Il. 16.112, Il. 2.491, 594, 598 : Od. 24.60.
To be afflicted, be troubled or vexed Il. 10.106.

defs: To displace by means of bars or levers : στήλας ἐμόχλεον Il. 12.259.
A bar or lever for moving weights Od. 5.261. Of the bar of wood applied to the eye of the Cyclops Od. 9.332, 375, 378, 382, 387, 394, 396.
Wet, dripping Il. 11.54.
Full of marrow, marrowy. Epithet of bones : ὀστέα Od. 9.293.

forms: Fig. : ἄλφιτα, μυελὸν ἀνδρῶν Od. 2.290. Cf. Od. 20.108.

defs: (2) In indirect discourse. With acc. and infin. Il. 21.462. With ὡς Od. 8.497, Od. 14.151, Od. 19.269. With indirect question : μυθήσεαι ὅττεό σε χρή Od. 1.124. Cf. Od. 4.152.

(4) To tell, declare, reveal, make known : οὔνομά κε μυθησαίμην Il. 3.235. Cf. Od. 2.373, Od. 9.16, Od. 12.155, Od. 13.191. To tell of, declare the meaning or significance of, expound : μῆνιν Ἀπόλλωνος Il. 1.74. Cf. Od. 2.159.

(5) To speak of, mention Od. 12.223. To speak of, tell of, describe : πληθὺν οὐκ ἂν ἐγὼ μυθήσομαι Il. 2.488. Cf. Od. 3.114, Od. 4.240, Od. 6.213, Od. 11.328, 376, 517, Od. 12.451, Od. 19.245, 500. To speak of or describe as being so and so : πόλιν μυθέσκοντο πολύχρυσον Il. 18.289.

forms: To speak of, tell of, describe : τάδε Od. 12.450. Cf. Od. 12.453.

defs: (1) Something said, an utterance or speech : μῦθον ἀκούσας Il. 3.76. Cf. Il. 2.335, Il. 4.357, Il. 6.404, Il. 8.492, etc. : Od. 8.185, 272, Od. 13.254, Od. 20.271, etc.

(2) What one has to say, speech, discourse, words : ἄλλων μῦθον ἄκουε Il. 2.200. Cf. Il. 2.199, 282, Il. 10.61, 190, Il. 11.781, Il. 16.631, etc. : ἵνα μῦθον ἀκούσῃς ἡμέτερον Od. 11.561. Cf. Od. 1.273, Od. 2.77, Od. 3.94, Od. 14.379, Od. 17.57, etc. Contrasted in terms with ἔργον Il. 19.242 : Od. 1.358.

(3) In pl., speech, discourse, words : μύθων ἦρχεν Il. 2.433. Cf. Il. 2.796, Il. 3.171, 212, Il. 7.343, Il. 11.643, Il. 15.284, Il. 18.252, Il. 22.281, etc. : μύθοις τέρπεσθε Od. 4.239. Cf. Od. 1.28, Od. 2.83, Od. 3.23, 124, Od. 4.214, 774, Od. 6.157, Od. 10.189, Od. 15.53, Od. 21.291, etc. Contrasted in terms with ἔργα Il. 9.443.

(4) The sense of the word coloured by the context Il. 1.25 = 379, Il. 1.33= Il. 24.571, Il. 1.221, 326, Il. 16.199 (a charge or injunction), Il. 1.273 (counsel), 388 (a threat), 545 (counsels, intentions), 565 (my charge), Il. 2.16 (the charge or commission), Il. 3.87 (the proposal), Il. 4.323 (counsel), 412 (my injunction), Il. 5.715 (our promise), Il. 6.358= Il. 12.232 (counsel), Il. 6.374 = 388 (what he is prepared to agree to), Il. 6.406 (their answer), Il. 8.412 (his message), 524 (the order), Il. 9.62 (my counsel), 309 (my mind), 522 (their mission), 625 (our charge), 627 (the answer), Il. 10.288 (a message or communication), 337 (word, information), Il. 11.186 (this injunction), 839 (the exhortation), Il. 12.80= Il. 13.748 (his recommendation), Il. 14.127 (my counsel), Il. 15.202 (this reply), Il. 16.83 (of my charge), Il. 19.85 (this reproach), 107 (thy boast), 220 (my counsel), Od. 3.295 (his counsel), 369 (his vaunts), Il. 23.157 (thy counsel) : Od. 1.271, 305 (my counsel), 361= Od. 21.355 (his injunction), Od. 1.373 (an order or command), Od. 2.137 (injunction), 412 (my purpose), Od. 4.676 (the plots), 744 (the matter), 777 (the purpose), Od. 5.98 (the matter), Od. 6.161 (the word from thee), Od. 8.302 (the matter), Od. 11.368 (thy story), 442 (give her all thy confidence), 492 (his story, how it is with him), Od. 13.16, Od. 16.406= Od. 20.247, Od. 18.50 = 290= Od. 21.143 = 269 (the proposal or suggestion), Od. 13.298, Od. 16.420 (counsel), Od. 15.196 (my request), 445 (the matter), Il. 16.387 (what I propose), Od. 17.177 (the proposal or suggestion), 399 =  Od. 20.344 (a command or order), Od. 19.502 (what I say), Od. 21.71 (of a plea or defence), Od. 22.289 (the thing that you would say, the matter), Od. 23.62 (this story of yours), 349 (a charge), Od. 24.465 (the counsel or recommendation).
A fly : ὡς ὅτε μήτηρ παιδὸς ἐέργῃ μυῖαν Il. 4.131. Cf. Il. 2.469, Il. 16.641, Il. 17.570, Il. 19.25, 31.

forms: Pf. pple. (in pres. sense) μεμυκώς Hom. Il. 18.580, Il. 21.237.
3 sing. plupf. (in impf. sense) μεμύκει Od. 12.395.
defs: Of cattle, to low or bellow Il. 18.580 : Od. 10.413, Od. 12.395. So μεμυκὼς ἠΰτε ταῦρος Il. 21.237. Of gates, to grate or groan in opening Il. 5.749 =  Il. 8.393. Sim. of a gate being burst open Il. 12.460. Of a struck shield, to sound or ring Od. 3.260.
A lowing or bellowing : μυκηθμοῦ βοῶν Od. 12.265. Cf. Il. 18.575.
A stone like the stone of a quern, a large stone Il. 12.161.
A handmill or quern : ἀλετρεύουσι μύλης ἔπι καρπόν Od. 6.104. Cf. Od. 20.106, 111.
Like the stone of a quern, of large size : μυλοειδέϊ πέτρῳ Il. 6.270.

etym: [perh. conn. with ἀ-μύνω, a defence, a means of parrying or evading.]
forms: Thus,  an excuse or pretext : μἡ μύνῃσι παρέλκετε Od. 21.111.

defs: Of the tamarisk Il. 7.39.

(1) Numberless, countless, endless, measureless Il. 1.2, Il. 2.272, Il. 4.434, Il. 15.632, etc. : Od. 8.110, Od. 10.9, Od. 11.282, Od. 12.97, etc. Absol. in neut. pl. : μυρία ᾔδη Od. 2.16, μυρίʼ ἕλοντο (sc. ἕδνα) Od. 15.367. Cf. Od. 24.283.
(2) With sing., measureless, infinite, immense : πένθος Il. 18.88. Cf. Od. 3.282 : Od. 15.452. With a collective sb., in measureless quantity, an immensity of . . . : χέραδος Il. 21.320.
Groaning, moaning Od. 24.416.
Innermost, furthest from the door : ἷζεν Od. 21.146.

forms: To the innermost part : μεγάροιο μ. Od. 22.270.

defs: The innermost or most removed part : μυχῷ?̓́αργεος (in a nook of . .) Il. 7.152, μυχῷ θαλάμοιο Il. 17.36, μυχοὺς λιμένος (the creeks or recesses) Il. 21.23, μυχῷ δόμου Il. 22.440 (the same as the μέγαρον of 460; see μέγαρον 3). Cf. Il. 9.663= Il. 24.675 : μυχῷ δόμου (app.= θάλαμος 1.c) Od. 3.402, Od. 4.304, Od. 6.346. Cf. Od. 3.263, Od. 5.226, Od. 6.87, 96, Od. 9.236, Od. 13.363, Od. 16.285, Od. 22.180, Od. 23.41, Od. 24.6.

forms: 3 sing. pf. μέμυκε Il. 24.420. Of the eyes, to close Il. 24.637.

defs: A muscle Il. 16.315, 324.
Struggle, contest, fight : μ. ὀρώρει Il. 17.397. Cf. Il. 2.401, Il. 6.147, Il. 16.245, Il. 18.134, 188 : Od. 18.233.
A magic plant described in Od. 10.304.
To blame, censure, reproach : τρῳαί με μωμήσονται Il. 3.412.

etym: [(σ)μώνυχες, fr. σμ- = σμεμ-, εἷς + ὄνυξ in sense hoof.]
forms: With single, i.e. not cloven, hoofs.
Epithet of horses Il. 5.236, Il. 8.139, Il. 10.392, Il. 11.708, etc. : Od. 15.46.
Emphasizing affirmative particle, truly, of a surety. Followed by δή Il. 1.286= Il. 8.146= Il. 24.379, Il. 10.169, Il. 18.128, Il. 23.626 : Od. 4.266, Od. 18.170, Od. 20.37, Od. 22.486.
In an affirmation, followed by μά Il. 1.234.
Fem. pple. ναιετάουσα, -ης, ναιετόωσα, -ης Il. 2.648, Il. 3.387, Il. 7.415 : Od. 1.404, Od. 8.574.
3 sing. pa. iterative ναιετάασκε Il. 11.673, Il. 17.308 : Od. 15.385.
defs: (1) To live, dwell, abide, have one's home : λακεδαίμονι ναιετοώσῃ (in . . .) Il. 3.387. Cf. Il. 6.9, Il. 11.673 : Od. 7.153, 245, Od. 15.255, 360, 385, Od. 17.523.

(2) Of cities, by a sort of personification, to stand, have their place : Ἰθάκης ἔτι ναιεταούσης (while . . .stands) Od. 1.404. Cf. Il. 4.45. So of islands, to lie Od. 9.23. Sim. with εὖ, of cities, houses, etc., to have a fair exposure or aspect, be pleasant to dwell in : πόλεις εὖ ναιετοώσας Il. 2.648, δόμους εὖ ναιετάοντας Il. 7.370=497, Il. 11.769. Cf. Il. 7.415 : Od. 2.400, Od. 4.96, Od. 8.574, Od. 17.28, 85 = 178, 275, 324= Od. 21.242, Od. 19.30 =  Od. 21.387, Od. 20.371, Od. 22.399, Od. 24.362.
(3) To live in, dwell in, have one's home in, inhabit, hold, have : Ἰθάκην Od. 9.21. Cf. Il. 2.539, 841, Il. 17.172, 308.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative nai/eske Il. 5.708, Il. 16.719.
defs: (1) To live, dwell, abide, have one's home : ἔναιεν ἐνὶ φηρῇ Il. 5.543. Cf. Il. 2.130, Il. 7.13, Il. 9.154, Il. 13.176, Il. 16.233, etc. : Od. 3.292, Od. 4.98, Od. 5.58, Od. 13.240, Od. 15.96, etc.
(2) Of a house, by a sort of personification, to stand, be situated : δόμον δείξω, ἐπεί μοι πατρὸς ἐγγύθι ναίει Od. 6.29. So of islands, to lie : νήσων, αἳ ναίουσι πέρην ἁλός Il. 2.626.
(3) To live in, dwell in, have one's home in, inhabit, hold, have : Ἀσπληδόνα Il. 2.511. Cf. Il. 2.593, Il. 3.74, Il. 7.15, Il. 9.484, Il. 15.190, etc. : Od. 1.51, Od. 4.555, Od. 9.36, 49, 113, etc.

(4) In pres. pple. pass. with εὖ, of places, well inhabited, holding a goodly people : εὖ ναιόμενον πτολίεθρον Il. 1.164, Il. 2.133, Il. 9.402, Il. 13.380. Cf. Il. 3.400, Il. 5.489, Il. 9.149, 291, Il. 13.815, Il. 14.255 =  Il. 15.28, Il. 16.572: Od. 13.285.
(5) In aor., to establish or settle (a city) : Ἄργεΐ κέ οἱ νάσσα πόλιν Od. 4.174.
(6) In aor. pass. in mid. sense, to establish oneself, settle, take up one's abode : Ἄργεϊ νάσθη Il. 14.119.
To flow, be filled to overflowing : ναῖον ὀρῷ ἄγγεα Od. 9.222.
A covering of skin : νάκην αἰγός (of goatskin) Od. 14.530.
A valley or glen : ἔκ τʼ ἔφανεν νάπαι Il. 8.558= Il. 16.300.

forms: To become numbed or deadened : νάρκησε χείρ Il. 8.328.

defs: To press or stamp down, tread hard : γαῖαν Od. 21.122.

forms: Of harbours, in which ships may lie safely, safe, well sheltered Od. 4.846, Od. 10.141.

defs: Intended to be used in sea-fighting Il. 15.389, 677.
Famed for his ships : δύμαντος Od. 7.22.
Famed for ships. Epithet of the Phaeacians Od. 6.39, Od. 8.191 = 369= Od. 13.166, Od. 16.227. Of the Phoenicians Od. 15.415.

forms: To sail, go a voyage : αἴγυπτόνδε ναυτίλλεσθαι Od. 14.246. Cf. Od. 4.672.

defs: To flow Il. 21.197 : Od. 7.292.

(1) Lowest, the lowest : ἔκειτο νείατος ἄλλων Il. 7.295 : = Od. 15.108. Cf. Il. 2.824, Il. 8.478. The lowest part of : παρὰ νείατον ἀνθερεῶνα Il. 5.293. Cf. Il. 5.857, Il. 11.381, Il. 15.341, Il. 16.821, Il. 17.310.

(2) Extreme, outermost, the extreme or outermost : [πόλεις] νέαται πύλου Il. 9.153 = 295. Cf. Il. 11.712 : παρὰ νείατον ὄρχον Od. 6.127.– Forming the extremity of a row, the extreme or last : τὸν ἔβαλεν νείατον ἀστράγαλον Il. 14.466 (here, contextually, the highest).
Newly sharpened : πελέκεσσι νεήκεσιν Il. 13.391 = Il. 16.484.
Newly come, a new-comer Il. 10.434, 558.
A youth. With ἀνήρ: νεηνίῃ ἀνδρὶ ἐοικώς Od. 10.278. Cf. Od. 14.524.
A young woman, a maiden : παρθενικῇ ἐϊκυῖα νεήνιδι Od. 6.20. Cf. Il. 18.418.
The lower part of : νειαίρῃ ἐν γαστρί Il. 5.539 = Il. 17.519, Il. 5.616. Cf. Il. 16.465.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative νεικείεσκε Il. 2.221, Il. 4.241.
defs: (1) To quarrel, contend, dispute : εἵνεκα ποινῆς Il. 18.498. To set quarrel abroach, create a disturbance : ὄφρα μὴ νεικείῃσι πατήρ Il. 1.579.
(2) To use words of reproach, speak in blame : ὣς νείκεσσʼ ὁ γέρων Il. 6.161.
(3) With dat., to throw reviling words at, throw blame upon, revile, abuse, reproach : μή μοι ὀπίσσω νεικείῃ Od. 17.189. Cf. Od. 3.252, 254.

(4) To revile, abuse, reproach, use despiteful language to, blame : μήτε μʼ αἴνεε μήτε νείκει Il. 10.249. Cf. Il. 1.521, Il. 2.221, Il. 3.59, Il. 12.268, Il. 21.470, Il. 24.29 (flouted, humiliated), etc.: Od. 6.303, Od. 8.158, Od. 12.392, Od. 18.9, Od. 19.108, etc.

(1) A quarrel, contention, dispute: τοῦ εἵνεκα ν. ὄρωρεν Il. 3.87 = Il. 6.374 = 388. Cf. Il. 2.376, Il. 4.37, Il. 14.205 = 304, Il. 18.497, Il. 22.116, Il. 24.107 : Od. 6.74, Od. 8.75, Od. 12.440. Contention, strife : ν. ἄριστε (in . . . ) Il. 23.483. Cf. Od. 20.267, Od. 21.303.

(2) The strife of war, lust of battle : ν. σφʼ ὁμοίϊον ἔμβαλε μέσσῳ Il. 4.444. A fight or battle : ὣς ἄγε ν. Ἀθήνη Il. 11.721. Cf. Il. 11.671, 737, Il. 13.122, 271, 333, Il. 15.400, Il. 17.544 : Od. 16.98 = 116, Od. 18.264. Fighting, battle : πόνος καὶ ν. Il. 12.348, ἔριδος μέγα ν. (battle-strife) Il. 17.384. Cf. Il. 12.361, Od. 3.140, Il. 3.513 : Od. 24.543. The tide of battle, the battle: ν. ἀπωσαμένους Il. 12.276.
(3) A reproach, a reviling or abusing : φεύγων νείκεα πατρός Il. 9.448. Cf. Od. 3.251. Reproach: νείκει ὀνειδίζων (in . . . ) Il. 6.95.
From the bottom : ν. ἐκ κραδίης (from the bottom of his heart) Il. 10.10.
At the bottom of. With genit. : ν. λίμνης Il. 21.317.
A fallow field (in process of being ploughed up) : ἑλκέμεναι νειοῖο ἄροτρον (genit. of space) Il. 10.353. Cf. Il. 13.703, Il. 18.541, 547 : Od. 5.127, Od. 8.124, Od. 13.32.
A heap of slain : ἐν αἰνῇσιν νεκάδεσσιν Il. 5.886.

(2) The spirit of a dead man conceived of as departing from the body : ὅσσʼ ἐπιεικὲς νεκρὸν ἔχοντα νέͅεσθαι ὑπὸ ζόφον Il. 23.51. In pl., the shades of the departed, the dead: ἔθνεα νεκρῶν Od. 10.526, Od. 11.34, 632. Cf. Od. 11.475.
The drink of the gods Il. 1.598, Il. 4.3 : Od. 5.93, 199, Od. 9.359. Introduced by divine agency into the corpse of Patroclus Il. 19.38. Into Achilles Il. 19.347, 353.

forms: Dat. pl. (besides νεκύεσσι) νέκυσσι Od. 11.569, Od. 22.401, Od. 23.45.
Acc. pl. (besides νέκυας) νέκς Il. 6.420 : Od. 24.417.
defs: (2) In pl., the shades of the departed, the dead : νέκυας καὶ δῶμʼ Ἀΐδαο ἵξεσθαι Il. 15.251. Cf. Od. 10.518, 521, 530, 536, Od. 11.26, 29, 37, 49, 94, 147, 485, 491, 541, 564, 569, 605, Od. 12.383.
In mid., of birds, to take their food, peck : πελειάδες νεμέθοντο Il. 11.635.

(1) To be righteously indignant or vexed, to conceive, feel or express blame or censure, utter reproach Il. 4.507, Il. 8.198, Il. 10.145 = Il. 16.22, Il. 13.293 : Od. 17.481 = Od. 21.285. With dat.: ἄλλῃ νεμεσῶ Od. 7.286. Cf. Il. 13.16 = 353, Il. 23.494 : Od. 2.101 = Od. 19.146 = Od. 24.136, Od. 21.147. With dat. and with the cause expressed by a pple. : οὐ νεμεσῶ Ἀγαμέμνονι ὀτρύνοντι μάχεσθαι Il. 4.413. By an acc. : μή μοι τόδε νεμέσσα, οὕνεκα . . . Od. 23.213. By an infin.: μή μοι νεμεσήσετε τείσασθαι . . . Il. 15.115.

(2) So in mid. and in aor. pass. in mid. sense : πᾶσι νεμεσσηθεῖσα μετηύδα (her feelings getting the better of her) Il. 15.103, νεμεσσηθείς χʼ ὑποείξω (though indignant, repressing my indignation) 211. Cf. Il. 15.227 : νεμεσσῶμαι δέ τʼ ἀκούων Od. 21.169. Cf. Od. 1.228, Od. 19.264. The cause expressed by an acc. : ὃς νεμεσσᾶται κακὰ ἔργα Od. 14.284. By acc. and infin.: νεμεσσήθη ξεῖνον δηθὰ θύρῃσιν ἐφεστάμεν Od. 1.119. Cf. Od. 18.227. By infin. alone : νεμεσσῶμαί γʼ οὐδὲν κλαίειν . . . (I say nothing against it) Od. 4.195. With dat. : τῷ νεμέσσηθεν Il. 2.223. Cf. Il. 10.115, 129,  Il. 13.119, Il. 17.93, 100, Il. 24.53 : Od. 1.158, Od. 15.69, Od. 19.121.
(3) In sim. forms, to be dissatisfied or displeased with oneself : νεμεσσήθητε θυμῷ (think shame (to stand idle)) Il. 16.544. Cf. Od. 2.64. With infin. Od. 4.158.

(1) Absol. in neut. sing. νεμεσσητόν, something worthy of indignation or blame, a shame or disgrace : ν. κεν εἴη Il. 3.410, Il. 14.336 : Od. 22.489. With infin. : κεχολῶσθαι Il. 9.523. Cf. Il. 19.182, Il. 24.463 : Od. 22.59.
(2) App., capable of or inclined to anger, easily roused to wrath (for the form cf. ἐπιεικτός) : νεμεσητός [ἐστιν] ὅμε προέηκεν Il. 11.649.

(1) = νεμεσάω 1 Il. 5.872. With the cause expressed by acc. and infin.: οὐ νεμεσίζομʼ Ἀχαιοὺς ἀσχαλάαν (I cannot blame them) Il. 2.296. With dat. : Ἥρῃ Il. 8.407, 421. Cf. Od. 2.239. With dat. and the cause expressed by an acc. : οὐ νεμεσίξῃ?̓́αρῃ τάδε ἔργα; Il. 5.757.

(2) =  νεμεσάω 3 : ὑμέτερος εἰ θυμὸς νεμεσίζεται αὐτῶν (if you can see your conduct in its true light) Od. 2.138. Sim. with infin.: νεμεσιζέσθω Πάτροκλον κυσὶν μέλπηθρα γενέσθαι (let the thought sting him) Il. 17.254.
(3) To fear the wrath of, stand in awe of, reverence : θεούς Od. 1.263.
(1) Righteous indignation or vexation, blame, censure, reproach : ἐν φρεσὶ θέσθε νέμεσιν (i. e. the fear of it) Il. 13.122. Cf. Il. 7.335, 351 : ν. μοι ἐξ ἀνθρώπων ἔσσεται Od. 2.136. Cf. Od. 22.40.

(2) Something worthy of righteous indignation or of blame, censure or reproach. With infin. (cf. χάρις 4..b): οὐ ν. Τρῶας καὶ Ἀχαιοὺς ἄλγεα πάσχειν (small blame to them if they . . . ) Il. 3.156. Cf. Il. 14.80 : Od. 1.350, Od. 20.330.
A glade or dell Il. 11.480.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἔνειμε Od. 14.449. νεῖμε Il. 9.217, Il. 24.626 : Od. 14.436, Od. 20.253.
defs: (1) To give as one's lot or portion, assign : οἰκία Od. 14.210. In reference to one's fortune : Ζεὺς αὐτὸς νέμει ὄλβον Od. 7.188. To distribute or give out among a company : κρέα Il. 9.217 = Il. 24.626. Cf. Od. 6.179 = Od. 13.50, Od. 8.470, Od. 10.357, Od. 14.436, 449, Od. 15.140, Od. 20.253. Without expressed object : κήρυκες νεῖμαν ἀρίστοις Il. 3.274.

(2) In mid., to get as one's lot or portion, to hold, occupy, possess, enjoy (places, lands, etc.) : τέμενος νεμόμεσθα Il. 12.313. Cf. Il. 2.496, 504, 531, Il. 7.195, Od. 3.8, etc. : οἳ νεμόμεσθʼ?̓ιθάκην Od. 2.167. Cf. Od. 6.26, Od. 11.185, Od. 20.336. To have one's abode, dwell, be settled : ἀμφʼ (́αρμʼ ἐνέμοντο Il. 2.499.
(3) To drive one's flock : ἐπῆλθε νέμων Od. 9.233.

(4) In mid., of domestic animals, to feed, crop the herbage, graze : σύες νέμονται πὰρ κόρακος πέτρῃ Od. 13.407. Cf. Il. 15.631 : Od. 20.164. To feed on, crop, graze : νέμεαι ἄνθεα ποίης Od. 9.449. Cf. Il. 5.777. Of fire : πυρὸς μένος ἧκε, ὄφρα νέμοιτο (might consume the corpses) Il. 23.177. In pass. of something consumed by fire : ὡς εἴ τε πυρὶ χθὼν νέμοιτο Il. 2.780.
Newly watered : ἀλωήν Il. 21.346.
Newly stripped off : δέρμα Od. 22.363. Cf. Od. 4.437.
Freshly sprouting : ποίην Il. 14.347.

forms: App., the fire or impulsiveness of youth Il. 23.604.

defs: (1) To go or come back or home, return : σαώτερος ὥς κε νέηαι Il. 1.32, ἐς πατρίδα γαῖαν Il. 2.453. Cf. Il. 2.236, Il. 3.74, Il. 5.907, Il. 9.42, Il. 18.377, etc. : Od. 1.17, 87, Od. 3.60, Od. 4.351, Od. 9.95, Od. 12.334, Od. 15.3, Od. 23.23, etc.

(2) To take one's way, proceed upon one's way, proceed, go, come, depart : βουλῆς ἐξ Il. 2.84. Cf. Il. 18.240, Od. 3.6, Il. 21.48, 598, Il. 23.51, 662: ταῦτα τελευτήσας νεόμην Od. 4.585, Od. 17.148. Cf. Od. 2.52, Od. 3.170, Od. 4.8, Od. 12.188, Od. 13.30, 206, Od. 14.261 = Od. 17.430, Od. 14.498, Od. 15.72, Od. 18.186 = Od. 22.434 = 496, Od. 21.374, Od. 22.484. Of rivers, to take their way, run, flow Il. 12.32.

(3) In pres. with fut. sense, to go or come back or home, return : ἐπεὶ οὐ νέομαί γʼ φίλην ἐς πατρίδα γαῖαν Il. 18.101 = Il. 23.150. Cf. Il. 3.257. Il. 14.221, Il. 17.497, Il. 18.136, Il. 19.330 : Od. 2.238, Od. 4.633, Od. 7.110, Od. 11.114 = Od. 12.141, Od. 11.176, Od. 14.152, Od. 20.156, Od. 24.460. To take one's way, go, depart : αὐτὰρ ἐγὼ νέομαι Od. 13.61.
Having its sorrow still fresh : θυμόν Od. 11.39.
Newly washed Od. 7.64.

forms: Newly sawn, preserving its freshness : ἐλέφαντος Od. 8.404.

defs: (2) Absol., a young man, a youth : νέον ἠὲ γέροντα Od. 16.198. Cf. Il. 9.446, Il. 14.108, Il. 22.71. In pl. Il. 1.463, Il. 2.789, Il. 9.36, 258, Il. 11.503, Il. 23.756 : Od. 2.324, 331, Od. 3.460, Od. 8.110, Od. 13.425, Od. 15.331, Od. 18.6, Od. 24.89, etc. In comp., a young man as opposed to an older, one of the younger generation Od. 6.293. In pl. Il. 4.324, Il. 23.643 : Od. 6.294.
(3) New, newly made, constructed, composed : θαλάμοιο Il. 17.36. Cf. Od. 2.293, Od. 21.407. In superl. : ἀοιδήν, ἥ τις νεωτάτη ἀμφιπέληται Od. 1.352.
(4) Fresh, young, newly grown or sprouted : φοίνικος ἔρνος Od. 14.163. Cf. Il. 21.38.
(5) Of recent date : χρεῖος, οὔ τι νέον γε Od. 3.367. Cf. Il. 9.527. Having but lately attained a specified condition : νύμφην (a young wife) Od. 11.447.
(6) A fresh . . . , another : γυναῖκα Il. 2.232. Cf. Il. 7.462.

(7) In neut. sing. νέον as adv., newly, lately, recently, just now, but now, just: χοροῖο ν. λήγοντα (pple. of the impf., just come from the dance) Il. 3.394, δ̔̀ς ν. εἰληλούθει Il. 13.364. Cf. Il. 1.391, Il. 4.332, Il. 6.64, 421, Il. 11.663, Il. 12.336, Il. 13.211, Il. 15.240, Il. 24.444, 475 : Od. 1.175, Od. 3.318, Od. 4.112, 144, Od. 8.13, 289, Od. 16.26, 181, 199, Od. 17.112,  Od. 18.309, Od. 19.400, 433, 519, Od. 20.191, 360, Od. 22.426. Freshly, recently : ν. φοίνικι φαεινός (its fresh colour not yet dimmed) Il. 15.538. Freshly, anew : αἰεὶ ν. ἐρχομενάων (ever in fresh swarms) Il. 2.88.
Newly burnished or polished : θωρήκων Il. 13.342.
A young bird, anestling : στρουθοῖο νεοσσοί Il. 2.311. Cf. Il. 9.323.
Newly twisted : νευρήν Il. 15.469.
Newly wrought : κασσιτέροιο Il. 21.592.
Newly made or constructed, new : δίφροι Il. 5.194.
(1) Youth Il. 14.86.
(2) Youthful vigour : ἀτέμβονται νεότητος Il. 23.445.
Newly wounded, just wounded : χειρός Il. 13.539. Cf. Il. 18.536.

forms: Locative νευρῆφι Od. 11.607. This form as ablative Il. 8.300, 309, Il. 13.585, Il. 15.313, Il. 16.773, Il. 21.113.

defs: (1) A tendon : νεῦρα διεσχίσθη Il. 16.316.
(2) In pl. with collective sense=νευρή.: ἕλκε νεῦρα βόεια Il. 4.122.
(3) A string whipping the head of an arrow to the shaft : ν. τε καὶ ὄγκους Il. 4.151.

(1) To make a quick inclination (with the head), nod Od. 18.154. Of one sitting in a state of helplessness: νευστάζων κεφαλῇ (letting his head drop forwards) Od. 18.240. Sim. of the accommodation of a helmet to the wearer's motion : νευστάζων κόρυθι Od. 3.162.
(2) To convey an order by a motion of the head : ὀφρύσι νευστάζων (with my brows, bending the head forward) Od. 12.194.

(1) To make a quick inclination of the head, bend the head : ψαῦον κόρυθες νευόντων (genit. with κόρυθες, as the men bent their heads) Il. 13.133 = Il. 16.217. Of the nodding of the crest of a helmet Il. 7.470, Il. 3.337 = Il. 11.42 = Il. 15.481 = Il. 16.138 : = Od. 22.124. To bend (the head). Of persons on whom destruction has come : νεύοιεν κεφαλάς δεδμημένοι Od. 18.237.

(2) To nod in token or sanction of a promise, promise, undertake, vouchsafe : ἐπʼ ὀφρύσι νεῦσεν (with his brows, bending the head forward) Il. 1.528 = Il. 17.209. With infin. : νεῦσέ οἱ λαὸον ἔμμεναι Il. 8.246.

(3) To convey an order or make a sign by a motion of the head : νεῦσʼ αἴας φοίνικι Il. 9.223 : ἐπʼ ὀφρύσι νεῦσεν Od. 16.164. Cf. Od. 16.283, Od. 17.330, Od. 21.431. With infin.: στορέσαι λέχος Il. 9.620. With ἀνά, το μακε α σιγν ιν προηιβιτιον (ξφ. ἀνανεύω 3): ἀνὰ δʼ ὀφρύσι νεῦον Od. 9.468.

A cloud : ἐν αἰθέρι καὶ νεφέλῃσιν Il. 15.20, 192. Cf. Il. 2.146, Il. 5.522, Il. 16.298: Od. 5.291, Od. 12.74, 405 = Od. 14.303. A cloud or body of mist, mist : νεφέλῃ εἰλυμένος ὤμους Il. 5.186. Cf. Il. 5.345, Il. 14.350, Il. 15.308, Il. 17.551, Od. 3.150 : Od. 8.562, Od. 11.15. Fig. : ν. μιν ἀμφεκάλυψεν (the mist of death) Od. 3.417. Cf. Il. 17.591 = Il. 18.22 : = Od. 24.315.

forms: (Prob. orig. a voc. turned into a nom., from which the genit. νεφεληγερέταο (Il. 5.631, 736, Il. 8.387, Il. 15.154, Od. 3.10, Il. 21.499) is formed.)
Dat. pl. νεφέεσσι Il. 5.867, Il. 17.594 : Od. 5.293, 303, Od. 9.68, Od. 16.264, etc. νεφεσσι Il. 13.523.
A cloud or body of mist : τοῖόν τοι ν. ἀμφικαλύψω Il. 14.343. Cf. Il. 15.153, 668, Il. 18.205, Il. 23.188.
Fig. : θανάτου ν. Il. 16.350. Cf. Il. 17.243 : Od. 4.180.
Also ν. εἵπετο πεζῶν Il. 4.274, Il. 23.133. Cf. Il. 16.66, Il. 17.755.
To swim : χείρεσσι νέων Od. 5.344. Cf. Il. 21.11 : Od. 5.442.

defs: To spin. In mid. Od. 6.198.

forms: To or towards the ship : ν. ἐπεσσεύοντο Od. 13.19.
Of unknown origin and meaning : χιτῶνα Il. 2.43, κρηδέμνῳ Il. 14.185.

etym: [νη- + ἐγείρω. From which one is not (readily) roused.]
forms: In neut. sing. νήγρετον as adv., of sleeping, soundly, fast : ἵνα ν. εὕδοι Od. 13.74.

defs: The bowels Il. 17.524.

etym: [no doubt (ϝ)ήδυμος = ἡδύς (cf. καλός, κάλλιμος) with adhesion of final Od. 13. transferred from preceding words. Cf. Eng. newt (for ewt, with n- fr. an), and nickname (for eke-name, with sim. n-).]
forms: Epithet of sleep, sweet, grateful, refreshing ( ͂ ἡδύς (2)) Il. 2.2, Il. 10.91, 187, Il. 14.242, 253, 354, Il. 16.454, Il. 23.63 : Od. 4.793, Od. 12.311, 366, Od. 13.79.

defs: The belly Il. 13.290, Od. 3.486 : Od. 9.296. The womb Il. 24.496.

To heap or pile up: ὕλην Il. 23.139, 163. Cf. Il. 23.169, Il. 24.276 : ξύλα πολλά Od. 19.64. To heap up (a fire), make a good (fire) : πῦρ εὖ νηῆσαι Od. 15.322. To heap (a ship) full, give (her) a full cargo Il. 9.358. In mid. Il. 9.137, 279.
Of or for a ship : δόρυ Il. 15.410, Il. 17.744 : Od. 9.384. Cf. Od. 9.498. Absol. in neut. νήϊον, a piece of ship-timber Il. 3.62, Il. 13.391 =  Il. 16.484.

forms: A Naiad, a nymph of a spring or river. Defining νύμφη Il. 7.22, Il. 14.444, Od. 3.384.

defs: Lacking knowledge, unskilled Il. 6.198. Lacking knowledge of, unskilled in. With genit.: ἀέθλων Od. 8.179.
That brings no gain or profit, profitless : βουλήν Il. 17.469 : ἔπος Od. 14.509.
To neglect the behest or summons of. With genit. : θεᾶς Od. 3.14.

With hyphaeresis νηλής Il. 9.632. Dat. νηλέϊ Il. 3.292, Il. 5.330, Il. 13.501, Il. 16.345, Il. 19.266, etc.: Od. 4.743, Od. 8.507, Od. 9.272, Od. 12.372, Od. 22.475, etc. Acc. νηλέα Il. 19.229. Pitiless, ruthless, relentless, showing no feeling for others, hard : ἦτορ Il. 9.497. Cf. Il. 9.632 : Od. 9.272 = 368, Od. 9.287. Absol. in voc. : νηλεές Il. 16.33, 204. So νηλέα θυμὸν ἔχοντας (steeling our hearts) Il. 19.229. Applied to δεσμός Il. 10.443. To ὕπνος (as bringing mischief upon one) Od. 12.372. For νηλεὲς ἦμαρ see ἦμαρ 4.g. Epithet of χαλκός Il. 3.292, Il. 4.348, Il. 5.330, Il. 12.427, Il. 13.501 = Il. 16.761, Il. 13.553, Il. 16.345, 561, Il. 17.376, Il. 19.266 : Od. 4.743, Od. 8.507, Od. 10.532, Od. 11.45, Od. 14.418, Od. 18.86, Od. 21.300, Od. 22.475.

forms: Guiltless: αἳ νηλίτιδές εἰσιν Od. 16.317 = Od. 19.498, Od. 22.418.

defs: Yarn for spinning Od. 4.134. In pl., a weaver's work, woven work: μή μοι νήματʼ ὄληται Od. 2.98 = Od. 19.143 = Od. 24.133.
(1) Unerring, having or speaking with perfect knowledge Od. 4.349 = Od. 17.140, Od. 4.384, 401, 542. Infallibly purposed, that shall not fail : βουλήν Od. 1.86, Od. 5.30.
(2) Consonant with reality, true : μὴ πάντα νημερτέα εἶπεν (that it was all true that she said) Od. 5.300. Cf. Il. 3.204 : Od. 11.137, Od. 17.549, 556, 561.
(3) Absol. in neut. pl. νημερτέα, the truth : νημερτέα μυθήσασθε Il. 7.376. Cf. Od. 3.19, Od. 11.96, Od. 15.263.
(4) In neut. sing. νημερτές as adv.
(5) In neut. pl. νημερτέα as adv., with certainty, clearly : ἐπεὶ τῶν νόον νημερτέʼ ἀνέγνω Od. 21.205.
A stillness of the air, a calm : νηνεμίης (in a time of calm) Il. 5.523.
With no wind stirring, breathless: γαλήνη Od. 5.392, Od. 12.169.

forms: Windless : ὅτε τʼ ἔπλετο νήνεμος αἰθήρ Il. 8.556.

defs: A temple : εἴ ποτέ τοι νηὸν ἔρεψα (app. here a temporary structure of branches) Il. 1.39, νηὸν Ἀθηναίης Il. 7.88. Cf. Il. 2.549, Il. 5.446, Il. 7.93 = 274, Il. 7.269 = 279, Il. 7.297, 308, Il. 6.83 : Od. 7.10, Od. 12.346.
Banishing grief and pain : φάρμακον Od. 4.221.
Childish thoughts or ways. In pl. : νηπιάας ὀχέειν Od. 1.297.
Of a child, to sport or play : ὅτε παύσαιτο νηπιαχεύων Il. 22.502.
Young, of tender years : παισίν Il. 2.338. Cf. Il. 7.408, Il. 16.262
(1) Childishness, childish ways : ἐν νηπιέῃ Il. 9.491. In pl. : ἐπεὶ ποιήσῃ ἀθύρματα νηπιέῃσιν Il. 15.363.
(2) Folly, thoughtlessness. In pl. : νηπιέῃσι ποδῶν ἀρετὴν ἀναφαίνων Od. 3.411. Foolish or thoughtless action. In pl. : τοῖσιν εὐπείθης ἡγήσατο νηπιέῃσιν Od. 24.469.

(1) Young, of tender years : τέκνα Il. 2.136. Cf. Il. 4.238, Il. 5.480, Il. 7.400, Il. 9.440, Il. 16.8, etc. : Od. 2.313, Od. 4.818, Od. 7.301, Od. 11.449, Od. 19.530, etc. In reference to the young of a bird or animal Il. 2.311, Il. 11.113. Absol. in neut. pl. νήπια, the young of an animal: λέων, ᾧ νἡπιʼ ἄγοντι . . . Il. 17.134.
(2) Such as a child's is, feeble : βίη νηπίη [ἐστίν] Il. 11.561.

(3) Childish, foolish, thoughtless, senseless, credulous : φῆ αἱρήσειν πόλιν, ν. Il. 2.38. Cf. Il. 2.873, Il. 5.406, Il. 6.401, Il. 16.46, Il. 18.311, Il. 22.445 (fond heart), etc. : Od. 1.8, Od. 3.146, Od. 4.31, Od. 9.44, Od. 21.85, etc. In voc. νήπιε Il. 16.833, Il. 18.295, Il. 21.99, Il. 22.333. Absol. in masc., a fool : ῥεχθὲν ν. ἔγνω Il. 17.32 = Od. 3.198. In neut. pl., foolish things, folly : νήπια βάζεις Od. 4.32.
(1) With no compensation or penalty exacted in respect of one, unavenged : νήποινοί κʼ ὄλοισθε Od. 1.380 = Od. 2.145.

(2) In neut. sing. νήποινον as adv., without making compensation or recompense, without compensation or recompense made: βίοτον ν. ἔδουσιν Od. 1.160. Cf. Od. 1.377 = Od. 2.142, Od. 14.377, 417, Od. 18.280.

forms: In reference to speech : ἐπέεσσι νηπυτίοισιν Od. 3.211.
Absol., a fool : νηπύτιοι ὥς Il. 13.292 = Od. 3.244. Cf. Od. 3.200, 431.

defs: A daughter of Nereus, a Nereïd or sea-nymph Il. 18.38, 49, 52.

An island : Ἐχινάων ἱεράων νήσων Il. 2.626. Cf. Il. 2.108, 677, 721, Il. 3.445, Il. 18.208, Il. 21.454, Il. 22.45 : εἶδον νῆσον (that it was an island on which I was) Od. 10.195. Cf. Od. 1.50, Od. 3.171, Od. 4.368, Od. 5.13, Od. 9.130, Od. 10.3, Od. 12.143, Od. 13.95, etc.
Without eating, fasting Il. 19.156, 207 : Od. 18.370.
Heaped or piled up Od. 2.338.

forms: This form as ablative Il. 2.794, Il. 12.225, Il. 13.700, Il. 16.246 : Od. 14.498.

In pl. of the Greek ships drawn up on the Trojan shore and with the κλισίαι forming the camp Il. 1.12, 48, 487, Il. 2.398, 794, Il. 7.69, etc.: Od. 1.61, Od. 4.248, 255, Od. 11.545, Od. 14.496, 498, 501, Od. 24.43.
In pl. of the ships of a particular chief Il. 1.306, Il. 9.185, etc.

defs: To swim Od. 5.375, 399, 439, Od. 6.280. In mid. : ἐπήν μοι σχεδίην διὰ κῦμα τινάξῃ, νήξομαι Od. 5.364. Cf. Od. 6.276, Od. 14.352, Od. 23.233, 237.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἔνιψε Il. 16.229. νίψε Il. 10.575 : Od. 19.505.
defs: (1) To wash, cleanse: σπόγγοισι τραπέζας νίξον Od. 1.112. Cf. Il. 16.229.
(2) To wash the feet of : νίψον σοῖο ἄνακτος ὁμήλικα Od. 19.358. Cf. Od. 19.374, 392, 505. With double acc. of person and part : ἥ σε πόδας νίψει Od. 19.356. Cf. Od. 19.376.
(3) To wash away or off : ἐπεί σφιν κῦμα θαλάσσης ἱδρῶ νίψεν ἀπὸ χρωτός Il. 10.575. Cf. Il. 11.830, 846, Il. 24.419. With ἀπό, off: ὕδατι νίζοντες ἄπο βρότον Il. 6.425.

(4) In mid., to wash (one's hands) : νίψατο αὐτὸς χεῖρας Il. 16.230 : χεῖρας νιψάμενος ἁλός (genit. of material, in the . . . ) Od. 2.261. Cf. Od. 10.182, Od. 12.336. To wash (one's body). With second acc. of what is washed away or off : χρόα νίζετο ἅλμην Od. 7.224. To wash one's hands: νιψάμενος κύπελλον ἐδέξατο Il. 24.305. Cf. Od. 1.138 = Od. 4.54 = Od. 6.174 = Od. 10.370 = Od. 15.137 ͂ Od. 17.93.

(1) To overcome, vanquish, get the better of, in fight or in a contest : δοκέω νικησέμεν  Ἕκτορα Il. 6.192, ἀνδρὶ νικηθέντι γυναῖκʼ ἔθηκεν (as a prize for the loser) Il. 23.704. Cf. Il. 3.404, Il. 13.318, Il. 16.79, Od. 3.410, Il. 21.501, Il. 23.634, 680, 756:Od. 13.261, Od. 18.83, 333 = 393.

(2) Absol., to be the conqueror, prove the winner, in fight or in a contest Il. 3.439, Il. 4.389, Il. 5.807, Od. 3.102, Il. 23.669, Il. 3.71 = 92 · =  Od. 18.46, Od. 8.520, Od. 11.548. In aor. pple., the winner : ρῷ κε νικήσαντι κεκλήσῃ ἄκοιτις Il. 3.138. Cf. Il. 3.255, Il. 23.702. In aor. pple. pass., the loser: τῷ νικηθέντι τίθει δέπας Il. 23.656. Cf. Il. 23.663.

(3) In gen., to overcome, get the better of : νόον κίκησε νεοίη (overcame your better judgment) Il. 23.604. Cf. Od. 18.319. With cognate acc.: νίκης, τήν μιν ἐγὼ νίκησα (i. e. I won the cause) Od. 11.545.
(4) To excel, be first or pre-eminent among, bear away the palm from : ἀγορῇ ἑ παῦροι νίκων Il. 15.284. Cf. Il. 9.130, 272 : Od. 11.512.

(5) Absol., to be first or pre-eminentm bear the palm Il. 2.370, 597, Il. 18.252: Od. 3.121. Of an inanimate object: κάλλει ἐνίκα [κρητήρ] (in . . .) Il. 23.742. Of abstractions, to prevail, rule, carry it away : βουλὴ κακὴ ϝίκησεν Od. 10.46. Cf. Il. 1.576 : ͂ Od. 18.404.
(1) Victory, the upper hand, in fight or in a contest Il. 3.457, Il. 4.13, Il. 7.339, Od. 8.176, Il. 13.166 (the victory which had eluded his grasp), Il. 14.364, Il. 16.689, etc. : Od. 22.236.
(2) In gen., victory, getting the better of someone Od. 11.544.

forms: redup. fr. νς- νεσ-, conn. with νέομαι.]
defs: (1) To go or come back, return : ἐκ πεδίου ϝίσοντο Il. 12.119. Cf. Od. 4.701 ͂ Od. 5.19.
(2) To take one's way go, come : πόλεμόνδε Il. 13.186, Il. 15.577. Cf. Il. 18.566.
(3) In pres. with fut. sense, to go or come back, return : οὐ γάρ ἔτʼ αὖτις νίσομαι ἐξ Ἀΐδαο Il. 23.76. Cf. Od. 10.42.
(1) A snowflake G  222, Il. 12.156, Il. 19.357. So νιφάδες χιόνος Il. 12.278.
(2) Snow : ν. ν̓ὲ χάλαζα Il. 15.170.
Snowclad, snowcapt : ὄρεϊ Il. 13.754. Cf. Il. 14.227, Il. 18.616, Od. 3.385 : Od. 19.338.

(1) To perceive with the eye, see, discern, mark, observe (often with complementary pple. or adj.) : τὸν ὡς ἐνόησεν ἐρχόμενον Il. 3.21, τῶν οὔ τινʼ ἰδέειν δύναμʼ οὐδέ νοῆσαι Il. 5.475. Cf. Il. 2.391, Il. 3.30, 396, Il. 4.200, Il. 5.95, Il. 7.470, Il. 12.143, Il. 15.348, Il. 21.49, etc. : Od. 1.58, Od. 4.116, 653, Od. 7.163, Od. 8.271, Od. 12.28, Od. 16.5, Od. 19.232, etc. Absol. Il. 3.374, Il. 5.669, Od. 8.91, Il. 12.393, Il. 17.483, etc.: Od. 4.148, Od. 16.160, Od. 19.478, Od. 22.162, etc.

(2) To perceive with themid, see, mark, undersatnd: οὔ τι δολοφροσύνην ἐνόησεν Il. 19.112. Cf. Il. 1.522 :Od. 7.67, Od. 18.228, Od. 20.309, 367. With dependent caluse : τὸ νήπιος οὐκ ἐνόησεν, ὡς . . . Od. 9.442. Cf. Od. 22.32. Absol. Il. 10.225 : Od. 1.322, Od. 21.257. With dependent clause : νοῆσαι ὅππως . . . Il. 1.343. Cf. Il. 10.224, Od. 3.264, Il. 22.445. In pres. pple., not lacking perception, recognizing quickly the calls of expediency or propriety, intelligent, of good sense : καὶ αὐτῇ περ νοεούσῃ Il. 1.577. Cf. Il. 23.305 : Od. 16.136 ͂ Od. 17.193 = 281.

(3) To think of, propose to onelsef, purpose : μή μοι ταῦτα νόει φρεσίν Il. 9.600. Cf. Il. 23.140 = 193 : Od. 2.382 = 393 ͂ Od. 4.795 ͂ Od. 14.112 ͂ Od. 18.187, Od. 4.219, Od. 5.188, 382, Od. 14.251, Od. 16.409, Od. 17.576 (taken this into his head), Od. 23.242, 344.

(4) To turn over in one's mind, think out, plan, contrive, devise : τοῦτό γʼ ἐναίσιμον οὐκ ἐνόησεν Od. 2.122, Od. 6.299. Cf. Il. 1.543, 549, Il. 6.358 ͂ Il. 12.232, Il. 9.104, 105, Il. 23.415. Absol. :  περίοιδε νοῆσαι Il. 10.247. Cf. Od. 5.170.

(5) To think of, have the wit to say or do : ἄλλʼ αὐτὸς νοήσεις Od. 3.26. Cf. Od. 18.230. With complementary infin.: τό οὔ τις ἐνόησε, μηροῦ ἐξερύσαι δόρυ Il. 5.665. Followed directly by infin.: οὐκ ἐνόησα καταβῆναι ἰὼν ἐς κλίμακα Od. 11.62. In mid.: οὐ μάστιγα νοήσαθʼ ἑλέσθαι Il. 10.501. Absol.: ὅππως οἱ κατὰ μοῖραν ὑποκρίναιτο νοήσας (should hit upon the right interpretation) Od. 15.170.
(6) To think of a thing, have it occur to one : ἤ λάθετʼ ἤ οὐκ ἐνόησεν Il. 9.537.
(7) To think, with the thought directly reported Il. 15.81.
(8) To be minded or disposed, have one's mind made up. With infin.: νοέω καί αὐτὸς  Ἕκτορα λῦσαι Il. 24.560. Cf. Il. 22.235.
(9) To consider the case of, make up one's mind as to : νόησον αἰνείαν, ἢ . . . ἦ . . . Od. 3.310.
(1) A thought, idea, notion: τίπτε τοι ἐνὶ φρεσὶ τοῦτο ν. ἔπλετο; Od. 2.363. Cf. Il. 6.456, Il. 18.295 : Od. 6.36, Od. 15.326, Od. 17.403.
(2) The mind : οὐκέτι τοι φρένες ἔμπεδοί [εἰσιν] οὐδὲ ν. Od. 18.215. Cf. Od. 18.220, Od. 20.82, 326.
(3) Mental power or reach, intelligence : σεῖό κε νοήματι προβαλοίμην (in . . . ) Il. 19.218.
(4) One's mind, nature,  disposition : αἰεί τοι τοιοῦτον ἐνὶ στήθεσσι ν. Od. 13.330. Cf. Il. 24.40 : Od. 7.183.

(5) What one has in one's mind, a purpose, design, intention : οὐχ  Ἕκτορι πάντα νοήματʼ ἐκτελέει Il. 10.104. Cf. Il. 18.328 : Od. 8.559, Od. 23.30. In collective sense : Διὸς νόημα (his purposes) Il. 17.409.
(6) A device or contrivance : νοήμασι κερδαλέοισιν Od. 8.548. Cf. Od. 2.121.
(7) What comes into one's mind or occurs to one : οὔ τι νοήματος ἤμβροτεν ἐσθλοῦ (the right thing to do) Od. 6.292. Cf. Od. 14.273.

forms: Right-thinking : οὔ (τἰ νοήμονες οὐδὲ δίκαιοι Od. 2.282, Od. 3.133, Od. 13.209.

defs: Not born in wedlock, bastard, illegitimate Il. 2.727, Il. 4.499, Il. 5.70, Il. 8.284, Il. 11.102, 490, Il. 13.173, 694 = Il. 15.333, Il. 16.738. Absol., a bastard : ὁ νόθος ἡνιόχευεν Il. 11.103.
To tend or drive (one's flock) : ἐνόμευε μῆλα Od. 9.217. Cf. Od. 9.336, Od. 10.85.

forms: To the pasture : ν. ἐξέσσυτο μῆλα Od. 9.438. Cf. Il. 18.575.

defs: A pasture or grazing-ground Il. 2.475, Il. 7.511= Il. 15.268, Il. 18.587 : Od. 9.217, Od. 10.159.– ἐπέων πολὺς ν. ἔνθα καὶ ἔνθα Od. 3.249, app., much room to roam hither and thither, wide scope.
(2) Mental power or reach, intelligence : περὶ νόον ἐστὶ βροτῶν (in . . .) Od. 1.66. Cf. Il. 10.226, Il. 13.732, Il. 15.643, Il. 18.419 : Od. 10.494.
(3) Sense, good sense, judgment, discretion : ν. ἀπόλωλε καὶ αἰδώς Il. 15.129. Cf. Il. 10.391, Od. 3.133 : Od. 7.320, Od. 6.73.

(4) One's mind, spirit, nature, disposition : σοὶ ἀτάρβητος ν. ἐστίν Il. 3.63. Cf. Il. 16.35, Il. 23.484 : Od. 1.3, Od. 5.190, Od. 7.121= Od. 9.176= Od. 13.202, Od. 8.576, Od. 18.136, 332 = 392, Od. 18.381.
(5) One's mind, will, liking : ὅπῃ τοι ν. ἔπλετο Il. 22.185. Cf. Il. 9.108 (not by my good will), Od. 3.25.

(6) What one has in his mind, his mind, purpose, design, intent, what he has in view : ὄφρα κʼ ἔτι γνῶμεν Τρώων νόον Il. 22.382. Cf. Il. 2.192, Il. 6.447, Il. 8.143 : Od. 2.124, 281, Od. 4.256, Od. 5.103, 137, Od. 11.177, Od. 13.229, Od. 21.205, Od. 22.215.

(7) A plan, design, device, a scheme, system or method of action : τόνδε νόον ἔχοντες Il. 4.309. Cf. Il. 9.104, Il. 15.509, Il. 24.367 : νόον σχέθε τόνδʼ ἐνὶ θυμῷ Od. 14.490. Cf. Od. 5.23= Od. 24.479.
(8) Counsel, concerting of measures, contriving, planning, scheming : νόῳ καὶ ἐπίφρονι βουλῇ Od. 3.128. Cf. Il. 14.62 : Od. 4.267, Od. 12.211, Od. 13.305, Od. 16.197, 374, Od. 19.326.
(9) What one has in his mind, his expectation, hope, desire : τοῖσιν ὅδʼ ἦν ν. Il. 15.699. Cf. Il. 23.149.
(10) What one has in his mind, what he knows or can tell : δαῆναι ἐμὸν νόον Od. 4.493.
(1) To come to or reach a specified place, arrive : κεῖσέ με νοστήσαντα Od. 4.619= Od. 15.119.

(2) To return, come back : ὄφρα μένοιεν νοστήσαντα ἄνακτα Il. 13.38. Implying a safe return Il. 5.157, Il. 10.247, Il. 13.232, Il. 17.207, 239, 636, Il. 18.238, Il. 22.444, Il. 24.705 : Od. 10.285, 419.

(3) To return home, reach one's home : ἢ εὖ ἦε κακῶς νοστήσομεν Il. 2.253. Implying more or less a happy or safe return Il. 5.212, Il. 15.374, Il. 18.330, Il. 23.145 : Od. 1.36, 163, 268, Od. 13.43, Od. 19.463, Od. 24.400, etc. With οἴκαδε Il. 4.103=121, Il. 18.60 = 441, Il. 18.90 : Od. 2.343, Od. 8.102, Od. 12.43, etc. With οἶκόνδε Il. 5.687. With ὅνδε δόμονδε Od. 1.83, Od. 20.329, etc.
(1) Of or pertaining to one's home-coming : νόστιμον ἦμαρ. See ἦμαρ 4.h.
(2) Destined, that may be expected, to return safe home : οὐκέτι ν. ἐστιν Od. 19.85, Od. 20.333. Cf. Od. 4.806.
(1) A coming to or reaching a specified place, a getting to it : νέων ἐπιμαίεο νόστου γαίης Φαιήκων (to the land of the . . .) Od. 5.344.
(2) A returning or going back : νῆας ἔπι Il. 10.509. Cf. Il. 9.622.

(3) A going home, one's return home or home-coming, one's journey home Od. 1.326, Od. 3.132, 142, Od. 4.497, Od. 5.108, Od. 9.37, 97, 102, Od. 10.15, Od. 11.110= Od. 12.137, Od. 11.384, Od. 15.3, Od. 18.242, Od. 23.351, etc. Implying more or less a happy or safe return Il. 2.155, 251, Il. 9.413, 434, Il. 16.82 : Od. 1.5, 13, 77, 94 (to seek for tidings of his homeward bound father), 287 (learn that he has so far safely accomplished the homeward journey), Od. 3.160, Od. 4.519, Od. 7.14, Od. 12.419, Od. 14.61, Od. 22.323, etc.
(I) adv.
(II) Prep. with genit.

forms: Nom. sing. fem. pple. νοσφισσαμένη Od. 19.579, Od. 21.77, 104.
Aor. pple. in pass. form νοσφισθείς Od. 11.73.
defs: (1) To turn away in incredulousness, disdain or aversion : ψεῦδός κεν φαῖμεν καὶ νοσφιζοίμεθα μᾶλλον Il. 2.81= Il. 24.222. Cf. Od. 11.425. With genit. : πατρός Od. 23.98.
(2) To turn one's back, depart : μή μʼ ἄκλαυτον καταλείπειν, νοσφισθείς Od. 11.73.
(3) To turn one's back upon, leave, quit : τόδε δῶμα Od. 19.579= Od. 21.77, Od. 21.104. Cf. Od. 4.263, Od. 19.339.
A shower Il. 8.307.
(1) Flowing, running : ἱδρώς Il. 11.811, Il. 23.715.
(2) Absol. as sb., the part towards the south : ὑψοῦ ἐν νοτίῳ νῆʼ ὅρμισαν Od. 4.785, Od. 8.55 (i.e. just outside the haven (which is thought of as facing south) to await the evening landbreeze).
(2) The south : πρὸς νότου Od. 13.111.

(1) In temporal sense like νῦν 1, νῦν 2 3 : ἤ νύ σέ που δέος ἴσχει Il. 5.812. Cf. Il. 1.28, Il. 2.258, Il. 14.340, Il. 15.440, etc. : τόθι γάρ νύ οἱ αἴσιμον ἦεν ναιέμεναι Od. 15.239. Cf. Od. 1.244, Od. 2.327, Od. 7.275, Od. 10.562, etc. In past suppositions contrary to fact : καί νύ κεν εἴρυσσεν Il. 3.373. Cf. Il. 5.311, etc. : Od. 4.363, Od. 9.79, etc. Strengthening δή Il. 19.95, etc.
(2) Like νῦν 5 : ἦ ῥά νύ μοί τι πίθοιο Il. 4.93, etc.

(3) As affirmative particle : θεοί νύ μοι αἴτιοί εἰσιν (it is the gods that . . .) Il. 3.164, θεός νύ τίς ἐστι κοτήεις (it must be . . .) Il. 5.191. Cf. Il. 3.183, Il. 8.32, Il. 15.128, Il. 16.622, Il. 19.169, etc. : Od. 1.32, 347, Od. 12.280, Od. 19.501, Od. 20.114, etc.

(4) In questions : τί νύ σʼ ἔτρεφον; Il. 1.414. Cf. Il. 4.242, Il. 21.474, etc. : Od. 4.462, Od. 7.25, 149, Od. 20.193, etc. In indirect question : γνώσῃ ὅς θʼ ἡγεμόνων κακὸς τέ νυ λαῶν Il. 2.365. Cf. Od. 1.407.

forms: A bat: τῷ ἐχόμην ὡς νυκτερίς Od. 12.433. Cf. Od. 24.6.

defs: (1) A young woman, a maiden Il. 9.560.

(2) A nymph, one of a class of semi-divine female beings imagined as inhabiting the sea, fountains, islands, caves, etc. : νυμφάων, αἵ τʼ ἄλσεα νέμονται καὶ πηγὰς ποταμῶν καὶ πίσεα Od. 3.8. Cf. Il. 24.616 : Od. 1.71, Od. 7.105, 123, Od. 9.154, Od. 12.132, 318, Od. 13.107, 350, 355, Od. 14.435, Od. 17.211, 240. Of Calypso Od. 1.14, 86, Od. 4.557 = Od. 5.14  =  Od. 17.143, Od. 5.6, 30, 57, 149, 153, 196, 230 = Od. 10.543, Od. 23.333. Defined by νηΐς Il. 7.21, Il. 14.444, Od. 3.384. By ὀρεστιάς Il. 7.420. By νηϊάς Od. 13.104 = 348, 356.
(3) A bride, a woman about to be married Il. 18.492.
(4) A bride, a woman not long married Od. 11.38, 447. Applied to matrons. To Helen Il. 3.130. To Penelope Od. 4.743.
Not long married : παιδὸς νυμφίον Il. 23.223. Cf. Od. 6.65.

(1) At the present time, now : οἷοι νῦν βροτοί εἰσιν Il. 5.304. Cf. Il. 1.109, Il. 2.254, Il. 6.129, Il. 12.271, etc. : Od. 1.82, Od. 3.69, Od. 17.245, Od. 18.239, etc. At the present time, on the present occasion, now, as opposed in terms to the past or future : ἢ νῦν δηθύνοντʼ ἢ ὕστερον αὖτις ἰόντα Il. 1.27. Cf. Il. 1.455, Il. 3.439, Il. 4.321, etc. : τὸ πρίν · ἀτὰρ μὲν νῦν γε . . . Od. 4.32. Cf. Od. 1.369, Od. 3.366, Od. 7.243, etc.
(2) In the time following more or less directly the present, now : νῦν δʼ εἶμι φθίηνδε Il. 1.169. Cf. Il. 1.59, 421, Il. 2.12, Il. 6.226, etc. : Od. 1.200, Od. 2.314, Od. 3.359, Od. 4.685, etc.

(3) Looking back to an occurrence in the past, now : ὃς νῦν Ἀργείοισι κήδεʼ ἐφῆκεν Il. 1.445. Cf. Il. 1.506, Il. 2.274, Il. 4.12, Il. 13.772, etc. : Od. 1.35, 43, Od. 2.28, Od. 7.172, etc. So in a past supposition contrary to fact : νῦν ἂν ὕστατα λωβήσαιο Il. 1.232 = Il. 2.242.

(4) νῦν δέ, but as it is : τιμήν μοι ὄφελλεν ἐγγυαλίξαι · νῦν δʼ οὐδέ με τυτθὸν ἔτεισεν Il. 1.354. Cf. Il. 1.417, Il. 2.82, Il. 9.519, Il. 12.326, etc. : Od. 1.166, Od. 2.79, Od. 14.371, Od. 18.403, etc.

(5) In sentences expressing a command, request, exhortation or wish, with the temporal sense weakened or effaced, now : νῦν ἐμέθεν ξύνες ὦκα Il. 2.26. Cf. Il. 1.407, Il. 5.129, Il. 14.219, Il. 21.428, etc. : νῦν μήτʼ εἴης μήτε γένοιο Od. 18.79. Cf. Od. 1.271, Od. 2.281, Od. 4.395, Od. 8.202, Od. 10.320, Od. 11.441, etc.
(6) Continuing an enumeration, now, and now : νῦν αὖ τοὺς ὅσσοι . . . τῶν αὖ ἦν ἀρχὸς Ἀχιλλεύς Il. 2.681.
(7) In a question, well now : πῶς γὰρ νῦν . . . ; Il. 10.424. Cf. Od. 18.223.

(1) Night, the night, the period of darkness : ἐπήλυθε ν. Il. 8.488. Cf. Il. 1.47, Il. 2.57, Il. 3.11, Il. 6.282, Il. 14.78, Il. 24.366, etc. : νύκτα διὰ δνοφερήν Od. 15.50. Cf. Od. 4.429, Od. 5.294, Od. 9.143, Od. 10.86, Od. 19.66, Od. 23.243, etc.

(3) A night considered as a point or unit of time or as one of a series : δεκάτη ν. Il. 9.474. Cf. Il. 9.78, Il. 10.497, Il. 18.251, Il. 22.102 : τῇδε νυκτί Od. 20.88. Cf. Od. 6.253 = Od. 14.314, Od. 12.447, Od. 14.93, Od. 18.272.
(4) Night personified Il. 14.259, 261.

(5) Darkness, a pall or cloud of darkness : Ζεὺς ἐπὶ νύκτα τάνυσεν ὑσμίνῃ Il. 16.567. Cf. Il. 5.23, 506 : Od. 11.19, Od. 20.351, 362, Od. 23.372. The darkness of death or of stupor : ὄσσε ν. ἐκάλυψεν Il. 5.310= Il. 11.356. Cf. Il. 5.659= Il. 13.580, Il. 13.425, Il. 14.439, Il. 22.466.
A daughter-in-law : νυὸν ἀνδρῶν αἰχμητάων (Helen being regarded as having contracted affinity with her husband's nation) Il. 3.49, θυγατέρες ἰδὲ νυοί Il. 24.166. Cf. Il. 22.65 : Od. 3.451.
(1) The starting-line in a race : τοῖσιν ἀπὸ νύσσης τέτατο δρόμος Il. 23.758 : Od. 8.121.
(2) The turning-post : ἐν νύσσῃ τοι ἵππος ἀριστερὸς ἐγχριμφθήτω Il. 23.338. Cf. Il. 23.332, 344.

(1) To wound, pierce or strike by a thrust with a pointed weapon, make a thrust at with such a weapon : τὸν ἔγχεϊ νύξε κατὰ δεξιὸν ὦμον Il. 5.46. Cf. Il. 11.96, Il. 15.536, Il. 16.346, Od. 3.397, etc. Without expressed object Il. 11.235= Il. 17.48, Il. 13.147 =  Il. 15.278= Il. 17.731, Il. 23.819. Sim. in mid. of reciprocal action Il. 14.26= Il. 16.637.
(2) App. implying no more than striking with the hand : χείρεσσʼ ἀσπίδα νύσσων Il. 16.704.
(3) To give one a nudge (with the elbow) : ἀγκῶνι νύξας Od. 14.485.

This form as  nom. Il. 16.99. Acc. νῶϊ. Also νώ Il. 5.219 : Od. 15.475. Pron. of the 1st person dual, we : καὶ νῶϊ μεδώμεθʼ ἀλκῆς Il. 4.418, νῶϊν ἐπέντυε μώνυχας ἵππους Il. 8.374. Cf. Il. 8.428, Il. 22.88, etc. : Od. 4.160, 172, Od. 15.475, etc.

forms: Our (of two persons) : λέχος Il. 15.39 : ὄπα Od. 12.185.
Without cease, cessation, pause, relaxation of effort, blenching : μάχην ἔχουσιν Il. 14.58. Cf. Il. 17.413.
= νωλεμές. : κίνυντο φάλαγγες Il. 4.428. Cf. Il. 5.492, Il. 13.3, 780 : πίεζεν Od. 4.288. Cf. Od. 9.435, Od. 11.413, Od. 12.437, Od. 20.24.

defs: (1) To distribute or give out among a company : σπλάγχνα Od. 20.252. Without expressed object Il. 1.471= Il. 9.176 := Od. 3.340 =  Od. 21.272, Od. 6.183, Od. 13.54= Od. 18.425.

(2) To handle, wield, move, control : σκῆπτρον Il. 3.218. Cf. Il. 5.594, Il. 6.238, Il. 15.677 : Od. 10.32, Od. 12.218, Od. 21.245, 393, 400, Od. 22.10. To put in motion, ply (the limbs, etc.) : γούνατʼ ἐνώμα Il. 10.358, Il. 22.144. Cf. Il. 15.269, Il. 22.24. In reference to the mind, to apply it (skilfully) to the matter in hand, have it in (constant) practice or readiness : νόον πολυκερδέα νωμῶν Od. 13.255. Sim. in reference to the contents of the mind : κέρδεʼ ἐνώμας Od. 18.216. Cf. Od. 20.257.
(2) Undistinguished, obscure, inglorious : γενεήν Od. 1.222.
(1) Nameless, the very name lost : ὅπως ἀπὸ φῦλον ὄληται νώνυμον Od. 14.182.
(2) Unknown, little known, obscure : οὐδέ τι λίην οὕτω νώνυμός ἐστιν [ἥδε γαῖα] Od. 13.239.

forms: App., gleaming, glancing, or the like.

defs: (1) The back : οὐκ ἂν ἐν αὐχένι πέσοι βέλος οὐδʼ ἐνὶ νώτῳ Il. 13.289. Cf. Il. 5.147, Od. 3.279, Il. 21.69, Il. 23.714 : Od. 17.463. Of horses Il. 2.765. Of sheep Od. 9.441. Of a wild boar Il. 13.473. The back of an animal cut off for use as food, the chine Il. 9.207 : Od. 8.475. In pl., app., slices cut from the back : νώτοισι γέραιρεν Il. 6.321 : Od. 14.437. Cf. Od. 4.65.

(2) In pl. in sing. sense : μετὰ νῶτα βαλών Il. 8.94. Cf. Il. 13.547, Od. 3.414 : Od. 7.225. Of a ram Od. 9.433. Of a deer Od. 10.161. Of a serpent Il. 2.308. Of the surface of the sea : ἐπʼ εὐρέα νῶτα θαλάσσης Il. 2.159, Il. 8.511, Od. 3.228 : Od. 3.142, Od. 4.313, 362, 560= Od. 5.17 = 142= Od. 17.146.
Remissness, supineness, tardiness in action : βραδυτῆτί τε νωχελίῃ τε Il. 19.411.

etym: -ή, -όν. Yellow. Of horses, bay or chestnut Il. 9.407, Il. 11.680.
forms: Of hair, yellow, fair Il. 1.197, Il. 23.141 : Od. 13.399, 431.
As a personal epithet, of the fair hair, fair-haired. Of Meleager Il. 2.642.

defs: (1) Such as may fitly be given by a host to a guest : δῶρα Od. 24.273.

(2) Absol. in neut., a present given by a host to a guest, or given one to the other by persons between whom the ξεῖνος relationship exists (see ξεῖνος 2) : ἀλλήλοισι πόρον ξεινήϊα Il. 7.218. Cf. Il. 10.269, Il. 11.20 : Od. 8.389, Od. 9.267. Sarcastically : τοῦτό (i.e. the stroke with the spear) τοι ἀντὶ ποδὸς ξεινήϊον [ἔσται] Od. 22.290. Cf. Od. 9.370.
(3) Absol. in neut. pl., fare or good things put before a guest : παράθες οἱ ξεινήϊα Il. 18.408. Cf. Od. 3.490, Od. 4.33.

forms: 3 sing. ξείνισε Il. 7.217. ξείνισσε Il. 3.232, Il. 7.174.
To receive or entertain hospitably, treat as an honoured guest Il. 3.207, 232, Il. 7.174, 217 : Od. 3.355, Od. 6.190, Od. 14.322, Od. 19.194 =  Od. 24.271, Od. 19.217, Od. 24.266, 288.

defs: (1) That guards the obligations arising from the relationship of guest and host and the claim of strangers to protection. Epithet of Zeus Il. 13.625 : Od. 9.271, Od. 14.284.
(2) Absol. in neut., a present given by a host to a guest Od. 9.229, 365, Od. 19.185. Sarcastically Od. 9.356, Od. 20.296.
(3) Absol. in neut. pl., fare or good things put before a guest Il. 11.779, Il. 18.387 := Od. 5.91, Od. 14.404, Od. 15.188. Sarcastically Od. 9.517.
(1) A foreigner or stranger.

(b) A stranger, one who comes into, or finds himself in, a land not his own : εἰσῆλθε μυκήνας ξ. Il. 4.377. Cf. Il. 4.387 : Od. 6.24, Od. 18.106 (wanderers or vagabonds), Od. 19.333 (travellers), Od. 21.292. Such a person regarded as being under the guardianship of Zeus, as entitled to protection and aid : πρὸς διός εἰσι ξεῖνοί τε πτωχοί τε Od. 7.208= Od. 14.58. Cf. Od. 8.546, Od. 9.270, 478, Od. 14.57, Od. 16.108, Od. 18.222, etc.

(c) A stranger, a person whom one has not seen before, an unknown person who presents himself before one : πόθεν τοι ξ. ὅδʼ ἵκετο; Od. 16.57. Cf. Od. 1.120, Od. 4.26, Od. 7.209, Od. 8.28, Od. 14.414, Od. 17.10, Od. 18.401, Od. 20.129, etc. Vocativally Od. 1.123, Od. 3.71, Od. 4.371, Od. 7.187, etc. Vocativally by a ξ. to one of those among whom he has come Od. 8.166, Od. 14.53.

(2) One of two persons (in pl. the persons) dwelling at a distance from each other between whom there exists a special tie of friendship and mutual hospitality : ξ. μοι πατρώϊός ἐσσι Il. 7.215. Cf. Il. 7.224, 231, Il. 13.661, Il. 15.532, Il. 17.150, 584, Il. 21.42 : ξ. ἐμός ἐστιν Od. 11.338. Cf. Od. 1.105, 176, 187, 313, Od. 9.18, Od. 15.196, Od. 19.191, Od. 24.104, etc.
(3) A host, one's host : ξείνια παρέθηκεν, ἅ τε ξείνοις θέμις ἐστίν Il. 11.779. Cf. Od. 8.208, Od. 9.268, Od. 19.371.
(4) A guest, one's guest : ξεινοδόκοι καὶ ξ. Od. 8.543. Cf. Od. 3.350, Od. 15.54, 73, 74, Od. 20.295= Od. 21.313, Od. 21.27.
Hospitable bounty :  μίξεσθαι ξενίῃ (in mutual hospitality) Od. 24.314. Cf. Od. 24.286.
(1) That serves as a symbol of the obligations of a guest in reference to his host or of the claims of a stranger to protection : ἴστω ξενίη τράπεζα Od. 14.158= Od. 17.155= Od. 20.230.
(2) = ξείνιος 1 Od. 14.389.
(3) Absol. in neut. pl. = ξείνοις3 Od. 15.514, 546.

forms: Absol. in neut., the dry land, the shore : ποτὶ ξερὸν ἠπείροιο Od. 5.402.

defs: Smoothed, smooth, wrought, polished : αἰθούσῃσιν (of wrought stone) Il. 7.243, Od. 3.11, λίθοιο 244, 248. Cf. Il. 18.504 : Od. 1.138= Od. 4.54= Od. 6.174= Od. 10.370 =  Od. 15.137= Od. 17.93, Od. 3.406, Od. 8.6, Od. 10.211 = 253, Od. 12.172, Od. 14.350, Od. 16.408, Od. 18.33, Od. 19.566, Od. 22.72. Of the Trojan horse : ἵππῳ ἔνι ξεστῷ Od. 4.272.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἔξεσε Il. 5.81. ξέσσε Od. 5.245, Od. 17.341, Od. 21.44. (ἀμφι-)
defs: (1) To remove roughness or irregularities from the surface of, smooth, work up Od. 5.245, Od. 17.341 =  Od. 21.44, Od. 23.199.
(2) With ἀπό, to slice off : ἀπὸ δʼ ἔξεσε χεῖρα Il. 5.81.
To dry up Il. 21.345, 348.
(1) A piece of wood, a post Il. 23.327.
(2) In pl., wood for burning, firewood : ξύλα πολλὰ λέγεσθε Il. 8.507. Cf. Il. 8.547, Il. 18.347, Il. 21.364, Il. 24.778 : Od. 3.429, Od. 8.436, Od. 14.418, Od. 15.322, etc.

forms: See σύν. ξυμ-, ξυν-. See συμ-, συν-.

defs: In common : τεύχεʼ ἀμφότεροι ξυνήϊα ταῦτα φερέσθων Il. 23.809. Absol. in neut. pl. ξυνήϊα, a common store : οὔ τί που ἴδμεν ξυνήϊα κείμενα πολλά (laid up in abundance) Il. 1.124.

etym: -ή, -όν. Common : γαῖʼ ἔτι ξυνή [ἐστιν] Il. 15.193. Cf. Il. 16.262.

defs: A razor. Fig. : ἐπὶ ξυροῦ ἵσταται ἀκμῆς ἢ . . . ἠὲ . . . Il. 10.173.

etym: [neut. of ξυστός, vbl. adj. from ξύω. That which is worked smooth.]
defs: (2) Some kind of long pole used in sea-fighting Il. 15.388, 677.
To remove irregularities from the surface of, scrape smooth : λίστροισιν δάπεδον ξῦον Od. 22.456. To treat so as to produce a smooth surface upon : ἑανόν, ὅν οἱ Ἀθήνη ἔξυσʼ ἀσκησασα Il. 14.179.

forms: Genit. masc. and neut. τοῖο Il. 1.380, 493, etc. : Od. 3.334, 388, etc.
Genit. dual τοῖϊν Il. 11.110, etc. : Od. 18.34.
Nom. pl. τοί Il. 1.447, Il. 2.52, etc. : Od. 1.112, 250, etc.
Fem. ταί Il. 3.5, etc. : Od. 7.90, etc.
Genit. pl. fem. τάων Il. 4.46, Il. 5.320, etc. : Od. 2.119, Od. 6.117, etc.
Dat. τῇσι Il. 7.298, etc. : Od. 7.101, etc. τῇς Il. 5.750, etc. : Od. 4.721, etc.
defs: (1) The substantival article.

(2) The attributive article. With sb. or proper name in apposition : ἡ δʼ ἅμα τοῖσι γυνὴ κίεν Il. 1.348, τοὺς δὲ κατὰ πρύμνας ἔλσαι Ἀχαιούς Il. 1.409. Cf. Il. 4.20, 391, 502, Il. 5.449, etc. : Od. 1.439, Od. 2.365, Od. 3.450, Od. 4.353, Od. 5.94, etc.
(3) Passing into the definite article.
(4) As relative (accented throughout; except in Il. 1.125, Il. 9.167 : Od. 4.349 =  Od. 17.140 following the antecedent, and most commonly referring to a definite antecedent).

forms: With dat. : ᾗ γυναικί Il. 7.516. Cf. Il. 22.127 (of lovers' converse and dalliance), 128.

defs: One who holds familiar converse, is admitted to intimacy, with another : μίνως Διὸς ὀαριστής Od. 19.179.
Familiar converse, lovers' dalliance Il. 14.216. Of the commerce of foemen Il. 17.228. Of grappling with the foe Il. 13.291.

forms: That does deeds of violence, violent : ἀνέρα Il. 22.418. Cf. Il. 5.403.

defs: Daughter of a mighty sire. Epithet or a name of Athene Il. 5.747= Il. 8.391 := Od. 1.101, Od. 3.135, Od. 24.540.
(1) Heavy : ἄχθος Od. 9.233. Cf. Od. 9.241, 305.

(2) Mighty, powerful. Of water Il. 4.453. Epithet of Ares Il. 5.845, Il. 13.444= Il. 16.613= Il. 17.529, Il. 13.521, Il. 15.112. Of Hector Il. 8.473, Il. 10.200, Il. 11.347, Il. 14.44. Of Achilles Il. 19.408. Epithet of spears Il. 3.357, Il. 4.529, Il. 5.790, Il. 11.456, etc.
As a disyllable Od. 6.261, Od. 14.287. =ὀγδόατος. Il. 6.223, 246 : Od. 6.261= Od. 14.287.
Thus, a box or tray for carrying things Od. 21.61.
A barb of an arrow Il. 4.151, 214.
(1) In ploughing, a furrow Il. 18.546.

(2) In reaping, the line taken by a reaper advancing through the field : δράγματα μετʼ ὄγμον πῖπτον (following the line of the reaper, in line on his left) Il. 18.552, βασιλεὺς ἑστήκει ἐπʼ ὄγμου 557 (i.e. watching the reapers from the line of the nearest). Cf. Il. 11.68.
(2) A pear Od. 6.120.
Cargo taken in for the return voyage, a home-cargo (opposed to φόρτος) : ἐπείγετʼ ὦνον ὁδαίων Od. 15.445. Cf. Od. 8.163.
With the teeth : ὀ. ἕλον οὖδας (bit the dust) Il. 11.749, Il. 19.61, Il. 24.738. Cf. Il. 2.418, Il. 22.17 : Od. 1.381= Od. 18.410= Od. 20.268, Od. 22.269.

forms: Dat. pl. masc. and neut. τοίσδεσσι Il. 10.462 : Od. 2.47, 165, Od. 13.258. Masc τοίσδεσι Od. 10.268, Od. 21.93.
defs: (1) This person or thing (in reported speech generally (and properly) referring to what belongs to or concerns the speaker ; cf. οὗτος) : τοῦδʼ ἕνεκα Il. 1.110, τήνδε θεῷ πρόες 127. Cf. Il. 1.257, 275, 302, Il. 2.5, 236, etc. : Od. 1.169, 371, 396, Od. 2.162, 191, etc.
(2) With sb., etc., this : τόδʼ ἐέλδωρ Il. 1.41. Cf. Il. 1.214, 234, 287, Il. 2.252, etc. : Od. 1.232, Od. 2.93, 280, 317, etc.

(3) In deictic or predicative sense=here : Ἕκτορος ἥδε γυνή (this is . . .) Il. 7.460. Cf. Il. 5.175, Il. 9.688, Il. 15.286, Il. 19.140, etc. : ξείνω δή τινε τώδε (here are . . .) Od. 4.26. Cf. Od. 1.185, Od. 7.206, Od. 11.141, Od. 16.205, etc.
(4) In dat. sing. fem. τῇδε, here : τῇδε τετεύξεται ὄλεθρος Il. 12.345. Cf. Il. 17.512, Il. 24.139 : Od. 5.113, Od. 7.173, Od. 12.186.
To go, find passage, make one's way : ἐπὶ νῆας Il. 11.569.
A journeyer, wayfarer, passenger, passer-by Il. 16.263: Od. 6.204, Od. 11.127, Od. 13.123, Od. 17.211, Od. 23.274.
A reward for bearing one company Od. 15.506.

etym: [app. a locative fr. ὁδός + πορ- as in πόρος.]
defs: A journeyer or wayfarer Il. 24.375.
