forms: The first syllable lengthened metrically οὐδός Od. 17.196.
defs: (1) A way, path, track, passage, road : ἐπεὶ πρὸ ὁδοῦ ἐγένοντο (local genit., forward on their way) Il. 4.382, παρὲξ ὁδοῦ κλινθήτην Il. 10.349, ἀμφὶς ὁδοῦ δραμέτην (local genit., apart on their way) Il. 23.393. Cf. Il. 7.15, 391, Il. 6.143, Il. 16.374, etc.: Od. 5.237, Od. 7.264, Od. 8.107, Od. 9.261, Od. 10.103, etc.

(2) A going, journey, voyage, course : τὴν ὁδὸν ἣν (ελένην ἀνήγαγεν (on that voyage on which . . .) Il. 7.292. Cf. Il. 1.151, Il. 9.626 : ἐπειγόμενός περ ὁδοῖο Od. 1.309. Cf. Od. 1.444, Od. 2.285, Od. 3.316, Od. 4.393 (in your absence on a long journey), Od. 7.165, Od. 8.444, Od. 16.138, Od. 21.20, etc.
(3) Means of journeying or passage, facilities for a journey : πάρ τοι ὁδός (your way lies open) Il. 9.43 : ὁδὸν ᾔτεον Od. 10.17. Cf. Od. 12.334.

forms: Dat. pl. ὀδοῦσι Il. 5.75, Il. 11.114, etc.

defs: (1) In reference to bodily pain, a pain or pang : ὀδύνη διὰ χροὸς ἦλθεν Il. 11.398. In pl., pains, pangs : ἀχθομένην ὀδύνῃσιν Il. 5.354. Cf. Il. 4.117, Il. 5.399, Il. 12.206, Il. 15.60, etc. : Od. 9.415, 440, Od. 17.567.

(2) In reference to mental pain, grief, sorrow, distress : ἀζηχὴς ὀ. Ἡρακλῆος (for . . ) Il. 15.25. In pl., griefs, sorrows, distresses : ἐμοὶ ὀδύνας κάλλιπεν Od. 1.242. Cf. Od. 2.79, Od. 4.812, Od. 19.117.

forms: Stilling or allaying pain, soothing: φάρμακα Il. 5.401=900, ῥίζαν Il. 11.847.
3 sing. aor. subj. ὀδύρεται Il. 23.222 : Od. 4.740.
defs: (1) To make lament, weep, wail, mourn, sorrow, grieve : ὀδύρετο δάκρυα λείβων Il. 18.32. Cf. Il. 9.591, 612, Il. 22.79, Il. 23.154, 222, 224, Il. 24.48, 128, 166, 549 : Od. 1.55, Od. 4.194, Od. 5.160, Od. 8.33, Od. 14.129, Od. 18.203, Od. 23.241, etc. With genit. of person mourned for : τῶν πάντων οὐ τόσσον ὀδύρομαι ὡς ἑνός Il. 22.424 := Od. 4.104. Cf. Od. 4.819, Od. 14.40, 142, 174, Od. 15.355. With genit. of something not attained mourned for : γάμου Od. 21.250.
(2) To make lament or complaint, set forth one's wrongs : εἴ που κεῖνος ἐξελθὼν λαοῖσιν ὀδύρεται Od. 4.740.
(3) To lament, weep for, mourn : ἕταρον Il. 19.345. Cf. Il. 24.714, 740: Od. 1.243, Od. 4.100, 110. Of a bird , [στρουθὸς] ὀδυρομένη τέκνα Il. 2.315.

(4) To long for in sorrow, be sick for to the point of tears : πατρίδα γαῖαν Od. 13.219. Cf. Od. 5.153, Od. 13.379. With infin., to express by lamentation one's longing to do something : οἶκόνδε νέεσθαι Il. 2.290.

forms: To be angry, wroth, incensed, to rage : ὀδυσσαμένοιο τεοῖο (in thy wrath) Il. 8.37=468, ἐπεὶ ὠδύσατο Ζεύς (has conceived wrath against us) Il. 18.292.
With dat. of person : τίνύ οἱ τόσον ὠδύσαο ; Od. 1.62. Cf. Il. 7.138 : Od. 5.340, 423 (cherishes wrath), Od. 19.275, 407.

defs: (2) A scion or child (but in this sense perh. another word ὀ- = ἀ-2 + ζ- = σδ-, σεδ-, root of ὁδός, a companion or follower) : ὄζος?̓́ αρηος Il. 2.540, 704, 745, 842, Il. 12.188, Il. 23.841, Il. 24.474. Cf. Il. 2.663, Il. 3.147 =Od. 3.238.

forms: 3 sing. plupf. (in impf. sense) ὀδώδει Od. 5.60, Od. 9.210.
To have a certain scent, smell; of a scent, to spread, come, reach the sense : τηλόθʼ ὀδμὴ κέδρου τε θύου τʼ ὀδώδει Od. 5.60. Cf. Od. 9.210.

defs: (1) From which place or spot, whence : ὅθεν ῥέεν ὕδωρ Il. 2.307. Cf. Il. 10.200, Il. 11.758 : Od. 3.319, 321, Od. 4.358 (see ἀπό II.1.a), Od. 22.460. Sim. : ἐς σικελούς, ὅθεν κέ τοι ἄξιον ἄλφοι Od. 20.383. In reference to a starting - point : τοῦ χώρου ὅθεν τέ περ οἰνοχοεύει (the spot from which the round is begun) Od. 21.142.

(2) In reference to source, origin or birth, whence : γένος μοι ἔνθεν ὅθεν σοί Il. 4.58. Cf. Il. 2.852, 857. To a source from which one draws : ὅθεν ἱδρεύοντο Od. 6.131, Od. 17.206. To a source of (imagined) light Od. 11.366 (see εἴδω I.1).

(1) In or at the place or spot in which, in or at which place or spot, where : λήμνῳ ἐν, ὅθι μιν λίπον Il. 2.722. Cf. Il. 2.572, Il. 3.145, Il. 4.41, 217, Il. 5.8, Il. 8.83, etc. : ἐν δαπέδῳ, ὅθι περ πάρος Od. 4.627. Cf. Od. 1.50, Od. 2.338, Od. 3.326, Od. 4.127, 426, Od. 5.280, Od. 9.50, etc. With subj. or opt. in conditional relative sentences. For the examples and constructions see Table at end III.B.a  1,
(2) To the place or spot in which, to where : ἴθυνεν ὅθι ζωστῆρος ὀχῆες σύνεχον Il. 4.132, etc. Cf. Od. 1.425, etc.
(1) With neg., not to care for, trouble oneself about, have regard for. With genit. : οὐδʼ ὅθομαι κοτέοντος (I care not for your wrath) Il. 1.181. Absol. Il. 15.107.
(2) With infin., to hesitate to do something, shrink from doing it : οὐκ ὄθεται ἦτορ ἷσον ἐμοὶ (ὶ͂σόν οἰ̔ φάσθαι Il. 15.166, 182. Sim. with pple. : οὐκ ὄθετʼ αἴσυλα ῥέζων Il. 5.403.
A cloth (prob. of linen) Od. 6.107. In pl., clothes or wrappings (prob. of linen) : ἀργεννῇσι κσλυψαμένη ὀθόνῃσιν Il. 3.141. Cf. Il. 18.595.
Of horses, having hair of the same colour, one in coats Il. 2.765.

forms: 3 pl. impf. pass. ὠΐγνυντο Il. 2.809, Il. 8.58. (ἀναοίγω.)
defs: (1) To open, set open (a gate or door) : ὤϊξε πύλας Il. 24.446. Cf. Il. 2.809 =Il. 8.58, Il. 7.89, 298 : Od. 1.436, Od. 10.230 = 256 = 312, Od. 22.399, Od. 23.370, Od. 24.501. To draw back (a bar in order to open a door) , [κληῗδα] Il. 24.457.
(2) To broach or draw (wine) : οἴνου, τὸν ὤϊξεν ταμίη Od. 3.392.
To cause to swell. Fig. : χόλος, ὅς τε καὶ ἄλλων οἰδάνει νόον Il. 9.554. Sim. in pass. : οἰδάνεταί μοι κραδίη χόλῳ (swells with . . . ) Il. 9.646.

forms: To swell : ᾤδεε χρόα πάντα (acc. of part affected, his flesh became swollen) Od. 5.455.

defs: A swelling. Of water : ποταμὸς οἴδματι θύων (in flood) Il. 21.234. Cf. Il. 23.230 (with swelling surface).
Of horses, of the same age, one in years Il. 2.765.

(1) Wretched, miserable, unhappy, ill-starred : ὀ. περὶ πάντων ἔπλεο Il. 1.417. Cf. Il. 13.569 : Od. 3.95=Od. 4.325, Od. 4.197, 832. Absol. : ὀ. τις Od. 20.140. Comp. ὀϊζυρώτερος. Absol. Il. 17.446. Superl. ὀϊζυρώτατος Od. 5.105.
(2) Causing, bringing in its train, pain or grief, sorrowful, woful : πολέμοιο Il. 3.112. Cf. Od. 8.540, Od. 11.182=Od. 16.38, Od. 13.337.
(1) Sorrow, grief, woe, distress, hardship : πόνον τʼ ἐχέμεν καὶ ὀϊζύν Il. 13.2. Cf. Il. 7.285, Il. 14.480 : Od. 3.103, Od. 4.35, Od. 5.289, Od. 6.211, 270, etc.
(2) The result of pains or painful toil Il. 15.365.
To suffer grief, distress, anxiety, hardship Il. 3.408: Od. 4.152, Od. 23.307. With cognate acc., to suffer : ἧς εἵνεκʼ ὀϊζύομεν κακὰ πολλά Il. 14.89.
The steering-oar of a ship Il. 19.43 : Od. 9.483 = 540. In pl. app. of a single oar : ἐπεὶ νηὸς οἰήϊα νωμᾷς Od. 12.218.

forms: Perh., guides on the yoke for the reins Il. 24.269.

defs: To one's house or home, home, homewards : οἰ. ἴμεν Il. 1.170, οἰ. δόμεναι πάλιν (hand over to be borne to my home) Il. 6.79= Il. 22.342. Cf. Il. 1.19, Il. 2.154, Il. 3.72, Il. 4.103, Il. 6.335, etc. : Od. 2.176, Od. 4.520, Od. 5.108, Od. 8.102, Od. 10.35, etc.
A house servant, a servant in general: ὅ οἱ βιότοιο μάλιστα κήδετο οἰκήων Od. 14.4. Cf. Il. 5.413, Il. 7.366 : Od. 4.245, Od. 14.63, Od. 16.303, Od. 17.533.
(1) To live, dwell, abide, have one's home : οἴκεον ἐν πλευρῶνι Il. 14.116. Cf. Od. 7.204, Od. 9.200, 400.
(2) To live in, dwell in, inhabit : ὑπωρείας ᾤκεον?̓́ ιδης Od. 3.218. In pass., of a city, to be a habitation, continue in being, stand : οἰκέοιτο πόλις Πριάμοιο Il. 4.18.
(3) In aor. pass. in mid. sense, of a people, to settle, organize or dispose themselves : τριχθὰ ᾤκηθεν καταφυλαδόν Il. 2.668.
(1) A house or abode : οἳ περὶ δωδώνην οἰκίʼ ἔθεντο Il. 2.750. Cf. Od. 2.154, Od. 21.215.

(2) In pl. in the same sense : οἰκία ναίων (dwelling) Il. 7.15, Il. 6.221, Il. 13.664, Il. 16.595, Il. 17.584. Cf. Il. 17.308 : Od. 2.335, Od. 4.555, 798, Od. 9.505 = 531, Od. 14.210, Od. 16.385, Od. 20.288, Od. 24.104. Of the house or realm of Hades Od. 3.64. Of the home of the Dawn Od. 12.4. Of a wasps' nest Il. 12.168, Il. 16.261. Of an eagle's nest Il. 12.221.
(1) From one's house or home : δέπας, ὃ οἰ. ἦγεν Il. 11.632.
(2) From one's store, from one's own resources (cf. οἶκος 3) : καὶ οἴκοθεν ἄλλʼ ἐπιθεῖναι Il. 6.364, 391. Cf. Il. 23.558, 592.
At one's house or home, at home : τοιαῦτα καὶ αὐτῷ οἰ. κεῖται Od. 21.398. Cf. Il. 8.513 : Od. 3.303, Od. 19.237.
At one's house or home, at home : οἰ. ἔσαν Od. 1.12. Cf. Il. 1.113, Il. 24.240 : Od. 8.324, Od. 13.42, Od. 15.15, 178.

(1) To one's house or home, home, homewards : ἔβαν οἶκόνδε ἕκαστος Il. 1.606. Cf. Il. 2.158, 290, Il. 4.180, Il. 7.189, Il. 23.856, etc. : Od. 1.17, 317, Od. 5.204, Od. 7.159, Od. 11.410 (here, app., simply to the palace), Od. 13.125, Od. 23.221, etc.
(2) To the part of a house allotted to one, to one's own quarters (cf. οἶκος 2) : ἡ θαμβήσασα πάλιν οἶκόνδε βεβήκει Od. 1.360=Od. 21.354. Cf. Od. 3.396, Od. 23.292.

(1) A house or abode (sometimes, as in Eng. house, thought of along with the inhabitants or contents) : ἡμετέρῳ ἐνὶ οἴκῳ Il. 1.30. Cf. Il. 3.233, Il. 7.56, 490, 500, Il. 6.127, Il. 8.284, Il. 9.147, 289, Il. 15.498, Il. 17.738, Il. 24.471, 572 : μέλλε ποτὲ οἶκος ὅδʼ ἀφνειὸς ἔμμεναι Od. 1.232. Cf. Od. 1.248, 251, 258, Od. 2.45, Od. 4.4, Od. 7.9, Od. 6.314, Od. 9.35, Od. 11.389, etc. App. including the curtilage of the house : χῆνʼ ἀτιταλλομένην ἐνὶ οἴκῳ Od. 15.174. Cf. Od. 19.536. In pl. in the same sense as the sing. : ἐκ νέκυς οἴκων φόρεον Od. 24.417.
(2) Applied to a particular part of a house (cf. Od. 19.598 and οἶκόνδε 2).
(3) One's store (cf. οἴκοθεν 2) : οὐ σύ γʼ ἂν ἐξ οἴκου οὐδʼ ἅλα δοίης Od. 17.455.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ᾤκτειρε Il. 11.814, Il. 16.5, Il. 23.534.
To pity, take pity on, feel pity for, feel sorry for : τὸν ἰδὼν ᾤκτειρεν Il. 11.814, Il. 16.5 =Il. 23.534. Cf. Il. 23.548, Il. 24.516.

defs: (1) The most pitiable, miserable or wretched : θανάτῳ Od. 11.412, Od. 24.34. Cf. Od. 23.79. Absol. : τοῦτʼ οἴκτιστον πέλεται δειλοῖσι βροτοῖσιν Il. 22.76. Cf. Od. 12.258, 342.
(2) In neut. pl. οἴκτιστα as adv., in the most miserable or wretched wise : ὄπως οἴκτιστα θάνοιεν Od. 22.472.
Pity, compassion, sympathy with one in trouble or distress Od. 2.81, Od. 24.438.
(1) Pitiable : κοιμήσατο χάλκεον ὕπνον οἰκτρός Il. 11.242. Comp. οἰκτρότερος : οἰκτρότερʼ ἄλλʼ ἀγορεῦσαι (more moving) Od. 11.381. Superl. οἰκτρότατος Od. 11.421.
(2) In neut. pl. οἰκτρά as adv., pitiably, so as to move compassion, expressing great grief : ὀλοφυρομένη Od. 4.719. Cf. Od. 10.409, Od. 19.543, Od. 24.59.

forms: Care or thought for one's house or worldly estate Od. 14.223.

defs: Rush, spring, swoop Il. 16.752. Sim. in pl. : αἰετοῦ οἴματʼ ἔχων Il. 21.252.
To spring, swoop, pounce : οἴμησεν ὥς τʼ αἰετός Il. 22.308 : = Od. 24.538. Cf. Il. 22.140, 311.
A lay or poem : θεός μοι ἐν φρεσὶν οἴμας παντοίας ἐνέφυσεν Od. 22.347. Cf. Od. 8.74, 481.
A stripe : οἶμοι κυάνοιο Il. 11.24.
A crying out in distress or pain, weeping, wailing Il. 4.450=Il. 8.64, Il. 22.409, 447, Il. 24.696 : Od. 20.353.

forms: To cry out in or express grief, distress, pain or disappointment : γνὺξ ἔριπʼ οἰμώξας (with a cry of pain) Il. 5.68. Cf. Il. 3.364, Il. 6.125, Il. 12.162, Il. 16.290, Il. 22.33, etc. : Od. 9.395, 506=Od. 11.59, Od. 12.370, Od. 13.198, Od. 18.398.

defs: To get (wine) for oneself, to supply oneself with wine Il. 6.472, Il. 8.506, 546.
Heavy with wine, drunken, in one's drunkenness : ἐρεύγετο οἰνοβαρείων Od. 9.374. Cf. Od. 10.555, Od. 21.304.
Heavy with wine, drunken. Absol. in voc. Il. 1.225.

forms: With soil fit for producing wine, vine-bearing : ἀλωῆς Od. 1.193, Od. 11.193.
In neut. as sb., vineyard land Il. 9.579.

defs: Full of wine, bearing wine in abundance : νῆσος Od. 15.406.
To drink one's wine : ἃς ὑπίσχεο οἰνποτάζων (sitting over your wine) Od. 3.84. Cf. Od. 7.309, Od. 20.262.

forms: A drinker of wine : ἄνδρας μέτα οἰνοποτῆρας ἤϊεν (to join the company at their wine) Od. 8.456.

etym: -ου, ὁ (ϝοῖνος. Cf. L. vinum, Eng. wine).

forms: Nom. pl. masc. pres. pple. οἰνοχοεῦντες Od. 3.472.
3 sing. impf. ἐοινοχόει, ἐῳνοχόει (ἐϝοινοχόεἰ Il. 4.3 : Od. 20.255. οἰνοχόει Il. 1.598 :  Od. 15.141.
defs: (1) To pour out wine for drinking, act as cup-bearer : ἐοινοχόει μελανθεύς Od. 20.255. Cf. Od. 4.233, Od. 15.141, 323.
(2) To pour out (wine) for drinking : οἶνον οἰνοχοεῦντες Od. 3.472. Of nectar Il. 1.598, Il. 4.3.
One who pours out wine for drinking, a cup-bearer : οἰνοχόος ἐπαρξάσθω δεπάεσσιν Od. 18.418, Od. 21.263. Cf. Il. 2.128 : Od. 9.10, Od. 18.396.
(1) Epithet of πόντος, wine-dark, purple Il. 2.613, Il. 5.771, Il. 6.88, Il. 23.143, 316 : Od. 1.183, Od. 2.421, Od. 3.286, Od. 4.474, Od. 5.132, etc.
(2) Epithet of oxen, app., of the characteristic dark hue of most of the species, i.e. dark brown Il. 13.703 : Od. 13.32.
To make drunk; in pass., to become drunk : μή πως οἰνωθέντες ἀλλήλους τρώσητε (in an access of drunkenness) Od. 16.292=Od. 19.11.

forms: Strengthening οἶος by reduplication (cf. αἰνόθεν αἰνῶς, μέγας μεγαλωστί).
App., man to man : οἰόθεν οἶος μαχέσασθαι Il. 6.39. Cf. Il. 6.226.
3 sing. aor. ὀΐσατο [ι] Od. 1.323, Od. 9.213, Od. 19.390.
Pple. ὀϊσάμενος Od. 9.339, Od. 10.232, 258, Od. 15.443, Aor. in pass. form ὠΐσθην Od. 16.475.
defs: (1) To think deem, fancy, imagine, suspect, expect : αἰεὶ ὀΐεαι (are always suspecting something) Il. 1.561. Cf. Il. 9.453 : τῷ ἑπόμην ὀϊόμενός περ (though boding that no good would come of it) Od. 14.298. Cf. Od. 9.339, Od. 15.443, Od. 17.586, Od. 24.401 (beyond our hopes). To bethink oneself of something to be avoided : ὀΐσατο μὴ . . . Od. 19.390.–ὀΐω parenthetically, I ween Il. 8.536, Il. 13.153 : Od. 2.255, Od. 16.309, Od. 23.261. So ὀΐομαι Od. 22.140. Prob. also in Od. 14.363. Impers., to appear, seem : ὧδέ μοι ὀΐεται, ὡς ἔσεταί περ Od. 19.312.
(2) With acc.
(b) To bode, dwell on the thought of : κῆρας Il. 13.283.
(c) To be full of the thought of, be impelled to : γόον Od. 10.248=Od. 20.349.
(d) To imagine, figure to oneself. With dependent clause : τόδε καὐτὸς ὀΐεαι, ὥς κεν ἐτύχθη (can imagine for yourself how . . . ) Od. 3.255.
(e) To suspect the existence of : δόλον Od. 10.380.
(f) To expect, look for the coming of : κεῖνον Od. 2.351. Cf. Od. 20.224.–
(g) To intend, purpose, have in view : τά γʼ οὐκ ὀΐω (I will see that that does not happen) Od. 13.427=Od. 15.31.
(3) With infin.

(b) With fut. infin., to think, expect, deem, ween : ἄμμε παλιμπλαγχθέντας ἂψ ἀπονοστήσειν Il. 1.59. Cf. Il. 1.78, Il. 4.12, Il. 5.252, Il. 7.341, Il. 9.315, Il. 11.609, Il. 12.66, etc. : Od. 1.201, Od. 2.198, Od. 3.226, Od. 7.173, Od. 8.203, Od. 9.213, Od. 11.101, etc. To intend, propose, have a mind, be minded : οὐδέ σ̔οἰ ὀΐω ἄφενος ἀφύξειν (I have no notion of doing anything of the sort) Il. 1.170. Cf. Il. 1.296 : νῦν σευ ὀΐω πειρήσεσθαι (am going to . . .) Od. 19.215.
Lonely, solitary, remote Il. 13.473, Il. 17.54, Il. 19.377, Il. 24.614 : Od. 11.574.
(2) With subj. in conditional relative sentences. For the examples and constructions see Table at end III.B.a  1, (D) (20) (31).

(3) In causal sense (= ὅτι τοῖος) : τὸν χόλος λάβεν οἷον ἄκουσε (because of what he had heard) Il. 7.166, οἷʼ ἀγορεύεις (since you say such things) Il. 18.95. Cf. Il. 2.320, Il. 5.758, Il. 14.95, Il. 24.630, etc. : οἷʼ ἀγορεύεις (to judge by what you say) Od. 4.611, οἷος κεῖνος ἔην βουλευέμεν (for such a man he was to . . .) Od. 14.491. Cf. Od. 5.183, 303, Od. 17.479, Od. 18.143, 338, Od. 22.217, etc. Giving a reason in anticipation : οἷος κείνου θυμὸς ὑπέρβιος, οὔ σε μεθήσει Od. 15.212. Cf. Il. 8.450, Il. 18.262 : Od. 17.514.

(4) Exclamatory in advbl. and other constructions : οἷον δὴ θαυμάζομεν  Ἕκτορα (to think how we . . . !) Il. 5.601, οἷόν τινά φασι βίην Ἡρακληείην εἶναι (what a man they say he was !) 638, οἷον ἔειπες (what a thing is this that you have said !) Il. 6.455. Cf. Il. 13.633 (even as now . . .), Il. 15.287, Il. 17.471, 587 (if now you . . .), Il. 21.57, etc. : Od. 1.32 (to think how . . .!), 410, Od. 4.242, Od. 11.429, 519, Od. 17.248, etc.

(5) In object clauses, of what nature, kind or sort, what kind of a . . ., what : γνοίης χʼ οἵου φωτὸς ἔχεις παράκοιτιν Il. 3.53. Cf. Il. 2.192, 194 (what he said), Il. 5.222, Il. 11.653, Il. 15.94, 97, etc. : οὐκ ἀΐεις οἱον κλέος ἔλλαβεν; Od. 1.298. Cf. Od. 4.689, Od. 8.244, Od. 9.348, Od. 15.20, Od. 19.219, etc.
(6) In neut. οἷον as adv. (see also (4)).
(b) In what manner, how : οὐχ ὁράᾳς οἷον . . .; Il. 15.555. With an adj., how : οἷον ἐεθσήεις κεῖται Il. 24.419. Cf. Od. 19.494.
(c) Seeing that : οἷον ἔθʼ εὕδεις Il. 24.683. Cf. Od. 2.239, Od. 14.392.
(7) In neut. pl. οἷα as adv.
(b) Even as, like. With τε: οἷά τε φύλλα Od. 6.106. Cf. Od. 3.73=Od. 9.254.

(1) With no one near, unaccompanied, alone, by oneself : καθήμενος οἶος Il. 8.207. Cf. Il. 2.822, Il. 3.143, Il. 8.444, Il. 9.438, Il. 12.349, etc. : Od. 1.331, Od. 2.11, 70, Od. 4.367, Od. 9.188, Od. 10.281, etc.

(2) Without countenance, support or aid, from one's own resources, alone, by oneself : οἶον μάχεσθαι Il. 4.156. Cf. Il. 4.304, Il. 5.304, Il. 6.42, Il. 13.481 (in my need), Il. 16.100, 243, etc. : δ̀ν αὐτὸς κτήσατο οἶος Od. 14.450. Cf. Od. 1.79, Od. 9.410. For οἰόθεν οἶος see οἰόθεν.

(3) With no one or nothing in the same predicament or case  or doing the same thing, with no one having the same ability, alone, only, nothing but : ὄφραμὴ οἶος ἀγέραστος ἔω Il. 1.118, κλέος οἶον ἀκούομεν Il. 2.486, ὅς μοι οἶος ἔην (i.e. the others count for nothing) Il. 24.499. Cf. Il. 1.198, 398, Il. 2.247, Il. 5.641, Il. 7.403, Il. 9.190, 638, Il. 11.74, etc. : Od. 1.13, 354, Od. 2.84, Od. 3.424, Od. 7.139, Od. 8.230, Od. 10.95, Od. 14.244, 482, Od. 16.133, Od. 22.130, etc.
(4) In neut. οἶον as adv., only, solely, exclusively : οὐδʼ ἔτι κεῖνον στεναχίζω οἶον, ἐπεὶ... (I have not only to mourn my loss, for . . .) Od. 1.244. Cf. Il. 9.355.
Clad only in a χιτών Od. 14.489.
To leave alone, leave by himself or to itself : Τρώων οἰώθη καὶ Ἀχαιῶν φύλοπις (i.e. by the departure of the gods) Il. 7.1. Cf. Il. 11.401.
To shoot an arrow or arrows Il. 4.196 = 206, Il. 8.269 : Od. 8.216, Od. 12.84, Od. 22.119. With genit. of person aimed at : ὀΐστευσον μενελάου Il. 4.100.
The gad-fly or breeze Od. 22.300.

forms: Of osier, wattled : ῥίπεσσιν οἰσυΐνῃσιν Od. 5.256.
One's fate, fate that comes upon one: κακὸν οἶτον ἀναπλήσαντες Il. 8.34=354=465. Cf. Il. 3.417, Il. 9.563, Il. 24.388 : Od. 1.350, Od. 3.134, Od. 8.489, 578, Od. 13.384.

defs: To go or come, take or make one's way Il. 5.790, Il. 15.640 : Od. 3.322.

(1) To go or come, take or make one's way, proceed : ᾠχόμεθʼ ἐς Θήβην Il. 1.366. Cf. Il. 1.380, Il. 5.495, Il. 11.357, Il. 22.223 (will go and . . . ), Il. 23.564, etc. : πότʼ ᾤχετο; Od. 4.642. Cf. Od. 1.260, Od. 2.383, Od. 9.47, Od. 13.415, Od. 24.333 (when I journeyed thither), etc. Of inanimate objects : ἀνὰ στρατὸν ᾤχετο κῆλα θεοῖο Il. 1.53. Cf. Il. 13.505= Il. 16.615. So of a wind : ὥς μʼ ὄφελʼ οἴχεσθαι προφέρουσα κακὴ ἀνέμοιο θύελλα Il. 7.346. Cf. Od. 20.64. Cf. something immaterial : ̓́οσσα κατὰ πτόλιν οἴχετο πάντῃ Od. 24.413.

(2) With the notion of leaving a place prominent, to go away or off, depart, take one's departure, leave : ὅτʼ ἂν (εἴ κεν̓ Ἀχαιοὶ οἴχωνται ἐς πατρίδα γαῖαν Il. 6.460= Il. 15.499. Cf. Il. 2.71, Il. 13.627, Il. 14.311, 361, Il. 19.356 : εἴ κεν?̓́αρης οἴχοιτο Od. 8.353. Cf. Od. 8.356, Od. 13.286, Od. 16.24= Od. 17.42, Od. 16.142, Od. 17.104, 294, Od. 19.183, 260 = 597=Od. 23.19. Of immaterial things : θυμὸς ᾤχετʼ ἀπὸ μελέων Il. 13.672=Il. 16.607. Cf. Il. 22.213, Il. 23.101.

(3) To have gone, be gone : ἐπεὶ ᾤχοντο (had gone) Il. 4.382, γαιήοχος οἴχεται εἰς ἅλα δῖαν Il. 15.223. Cf. Il. 5.511, Il. 11.288, Il. 13.782, Il. 17.588, Il. 19.346, Il. 23.577 : Od. 1.242, 410, Od. 4.166, 634, 639, 665, 707, 821, Od. 8.294, Od. 13.216, Od. 14.25, Od. 19.193 (since he had left for . . . ), Od. 24.225. Of a heavenly body : φάος οἴχετ [αι] ὑπὸ ζόφον Od. 3.335. Of immaterial things : πῇ τοι μένος οἴχεται ; Il. 5.472. Cf. Il. 13.220, Il. 24.201. In pple., absent, away : πατρὸς δὴν οἰχομένοιο Od. 1.281, Od. 2.215, 264, Od. 15.270. Cf. Od. 4.164, 393, Od. 14.144, 376, Od. 15.355, Od. 4.313, Od. 20.216, 290, Od. 24.125.
One skilled in drawing omens from the behaviour of birds, an augur Il. 2.858, Il. 17.218. Joined with θεοπρόπος Il. 13.70.
(1) A bird : πέλαγος, ὅθεν τέ περ οὐδʼ οἰωνοὶ αὐτόετες οἰχνεῦσιν Od. 3.321. Cf. Od. 11.605, Od. 16.216.
(2) Distinguished as
To shrink from doing something, hesitate to do it. With infin. : ἀρχέμεναι πολέμοιο ὄκνεον Od. 3.155. Cf. Il. 5.255.
Shrinking from action, hesitation : ὄκνῳ εἴκων Il. 10.122, Il. 13.224. Cf. Il. 5.817.

forms: App. to deal in sharps ; hence, to squabble, quarrel : πανθυμαδὸν ὀκριόωντο Od. 18.33.
Jagged, rough : χερμαδίῳ Il. 4.518. Cf. Il. 8.327, Il. 12.380, Il. 16.735 : Od. 9.499.

etym: [no doubt for κρυόεις, the form suggested by ὀκριόεις.]
forms: Causing shuddering. Fig. : δᾶερ ἐμεῖο κυνὸς κακομηχάνου ὀκρυοέσσης (κακομηχάνοο κρυοέσσης) Il. 7.344, πολέμου ἐπιδημίου ὀκρυόεντος (ἐπιδημίοο κρυόεντος) Il. 9.64.

etym: [ὀκτ-, ὀκτώ + -α- (on analogy of numerals in -ἀ + κνήμη.]

defs: The eighteenth : ὀκτωκαιο͂εκάτῃ (sc. ἡμέρᾐ, ον τηε ειγητεεντη δαψ Od. 5.279=Od. 6.268, Od. 24.65.
Happy in the protection and aid of a δαίμων, happy, fortunate. In voc. ὀλβιόδαιμον Il. 3.182.

(1) Happy, fortunate, prosperous : ἀμφὶ λαοὶ ὄλβιοι ἔσσονται Od. 11.137. Cf. Od. 11.450, Od. 17.354, Od. 18.218, Od. 23.284, Od. 24.36, 192. Bringing good luck : δῶρα, τά μοι θεοὶ ὄλβια ποιήσειαν Od. 13.42. In neut. pl. ὄλβια, happiness, good fortune, prosperity : θεοὶ ὄλβια δοῖεν Od. 6.148, Od. 8.413, Od. 24.402.
(2) With special reference to material prosperity, wealthy, rich, of great power or influence : σὲ τὸ πρὶν μὲν ἀκούομεν ὄλβιον εἶναι Il. 24.543. Cf. Od. 17.420=Od. 19.76, Od. 18.138.
(1) Happiness, good fortune, prosperity : οὔ μοι τοιοῦτον ἐπέκλωσαν θεοὶ ὄλβον Od. 3.208. Cf. Od. 4.208, Od. 7.188, Od. 4.19, 123=Od. 20.200, Od. 18.273.
(2) With special reference to material prosperity, wealth, riches, much substance, great power or influence : ὄλβῳ τε πλούτῳ τε μετέπρεπε μυρμιδόνεσσιν Il. 16.596. Cf. Il. 24.536 : Od. 14.206.
Fatal, baneful, deadly : ὀλέθριον ἦμαρ. See ἦμαρ 4.i.

Destruction, bane, death, evil fate : οὐδέ τί οἱ τό γʼ ἐπήρκεσεν ὄλεθρον Il. 2.873. Cf. Il. 7.16, Il. 11.120, Il. 13.773, Il. 18.129, etc. : Od. 1.11. Cf. Od. 2.152, Od. 8.579, Od. 10.250, Od. 14.300, Od. 16.411 (the fate intended for him), etc. A kind or mode of death Il. 10.174, Il. 22.325, Il. 24.735 : Od. 3.93, Od. 10.115, Od. 15.268, etc.

forms: In pass., to perish, die : ὀλέκοντο λαοί Il. 1.10. Cf. Il. 16.17.

defs: A destroyer or slayer : φίλης κεφαλῆς ὀλετῆρα Il. 18.114.

etym: [a ppl. form fr. ὀλιγη-, ὀλίγος + πέλω.
forms: Thus, hardly able to stir, with little life in one's limbs, weak, feeble : ἄπνευστος καὶ ἄναυδος κεῖτʼ ὀλιγηπελέων Od. 5.457. Cf. Il. 15.24, 245 : Od. 19.356.
Weakness, feebleness : μή με στίβη ἐξ ὀλιγηπελίης δαμάσῃ Od. 5.468.

etym: [a ppl. form fr. ὀλίγος + δράω. Able to do little.]
forms: Showing weakness or feebleness, with feeble utterance : τὸν ὀλιγοδρανέων προσέφη Il. 15.246=Il. 22.337. Cf. Il. 16.843.

defs: (1) Not much, little : ὀλίγος ἔτι θυμὸς ἐνῆεν Il. 1.593. Absol. Il. 11.801 = Il. 16.43 = Il. 18.201 (see ἀνάπνευσις). Superl. : ἄμητος ὀλίγιστός [ἐστιν] Il. 19.223.
(2) Of small extent : ὀλίγη ἦν ἀμφὶς ἄρουρα Il. 3.115. Cf. Il. 10.161, Il. 12.423, Il. 16.68, Il. 17.394.

(3) Of no great size, small : σάκος Il. 14.376. Cf. Il. 16.825 : Od. 12.252, Od. 20.259. Of a wave, not rising high, inconsiderable Od. 10.94. Of utterance, carrying no great volume of sound, small : ὀπί Od. 14.492. Of persons, of small stature, short, of small build : ὀλίγος τε καὶ οὐτιδανὸς καὶ ἄκικυς Od. 9.515. Cf. Il. 2.529. Sim. of Eris: ἥ τʼ ὀλίγη πρῶτα κορύσσεται (rears her head but a little way) Il. 4.442.
(4) In reference to time, of no great duration, short : ἐπιδραμέτην ὀλίγον χρόνον Il. 23.418. Cf. Il. 19.157.
(5) Of small value : δόσις ὀλίγη τε φιλη τε Od. 7.208, Od. 14.58 (see δόσις). Absol. : ὀλίγον τε φίλον τʼ ἔχων Il. 1.167. Of small amount : χρεῖος Od. 3.368.

(6) In neut. sing. ὀλίγον as adv., not much, little : ὀ. τί μʼ ἧσσον ἐτίμα Od. 15.365. Cf. Il. 5.800, Il. 12.452. A little, slightly : καὶ εἴ κʼ ὀ. περ ἐπαύρῃ [βέλος] Il. 11.391. Cf. Il. 17.538, Il. 19.217, Il. 23.424, 789 : στιβαρώτερον οὐκ ὀλίγον περ Od. 8.187. Cf. Od. 8.547, Od. 10.24, Od. 19.244. App., leaving a small interval : ἱππῆες ὀ. μετεκίαθον (came up close) Il. 11.52. Slowly, taking one's time, without haste : ὀ. γόνυ γουνὸς ἀμείβων Il. 11.547.
(7) In genit. ὀλίγου, all but, nearly, almost : ὀλίγου σε κύνες διεδηλήσαντο Od. 14.37.
To miss one's footing, slip : ὄλισθε θέων Il. 23.774. To slip out of position : ἔκ οἱ ἧπαρ ὄλισθεν (i.e., app., the edge projected through the wound) Od. 3.470.
(I) In pres. and aor. act.
(II) In pf. and plupf. act. and in mid. and pass.

forms: App., a cylindrical piece of wood for use as a roller: ὅλμον ὣς ἔσσευεν (sc. the mutilated body) Il. 11.147.

defs: An ecstatic religious shout of women Il. 7.301.

forms: To shout in exultation or triumph (always of women) Od. 22.408, 411.
Sim. of an ecstatic shout of women at a religious ceremony Od. 3.450, Od. 4.767.

etym: [app. for ϝολοϝ-οί-τροχος, fr. ϝελυ-, ϝελϝ-, (ϝ)είλω + τρέχω. The -οι- not explained.]

forms: Also ὀλοιός Il. 1.342, Il. 22.5. Destructive, baneful, deadly, painful, mischievous, bringing mischief Il. 3.133, Il. 9.305, Il. 11.71, Il. 13.629, 665, Il. 14.139, Il. 16.567, 849, Il. 22.65, Il. 23.10, Il. 24.487, etc.: Od. 2.100, Od. 3.135, Od. 9.82, Od. 11.276, Od. 12.68, 113, Od. 22.200, etc.
Superl. ὀλοώτατος Il. 22.15: Od. 4.442 (here of two terminations).
Absol. in neut. pl. ὀλοά, mischief: τῷ ὀλοὰ φρονέων Il. 16.701.

defs: Having mischief in his mind, malign Od. 1.52, Od. 10.137, Od. 11.322. Applied to animals Il. 2.723, Il. 15.630, Il. 16.21.

forms: Lamentable, piteous, tearful: ἔπος Il. 5.683 (or here perh. rather, beseeching (cf. ὀλοφύρομαι. 6), Il. 23.102: Od. 19.362.

defs: (1) To make lament, sorrow, weep, mourn, grieve: ὀλοφυρόμενος (ὀλοφυρομένἠ ἔπεα προσηύδα Il. 5.871=Il. 11.815, Il. 18.72. Cf. Il. 15.114 = 398, Il. 21.106: Od. 2.362, Od. 4.719, Od. 10.418, Od. 11.418, Od. 13.199, Od. 22.447, etc.
(2) To lament, weep for, mourn: παῖδα Od. 19.522. Cf. Il. 24.328.
(3) To feel pity or compassion. With genit. of person pitied: Δαναῶν Il. 8.33=464. Cf. Il. 8.202, Il. 16.17, Il. 22.169.
(4) To feel for, pity, take pity upon, compassionate, be touched by the plight of: τὸν πατὴρ ὀλοφύρατο δάκρυ χέοντα Il. 8.245=Il. 17.648. Cf. Il. 11.656, Il. 16.450: Od. 4.364, Od. 10.157.
(5) With infin., app., to bewail the necessity of doing something: πῶς ἄντα μνηστήρων ὀλοφύρεαι ἄλκιμος εἶναι; (why not pluck up heart to face them?) Od. 22.232.
(6) App., to beseech. Parenthetically: καί μοι δὸς τὴν χεῖρʼ, ὀλοφύρομαι Il. 23.75.
(1) Crafty, cunning, malign: δήνεα κίρκης Od. 10.289.

(2) Absol. in neut. pl. ὀλοφώϊα, wiles, craft, cunning: ὀλοφώϊα τοῖο γέροντος Od. 4.410, ὀλοφώϊα εἰδώς (with craft or cunning in his heart) Od. 4.460 (see εἴδω III.12). Connoting malignity Od. 17.248.
Some kind of grain (perh. the same as ζειαί) Il. 5.196, Il. 8.564.
To make a common din or murmur of voices, burst into uproar: μνηστῆρες ὁμάδησαν Od. 1.365=Od. 4.768=Od. 18.399, Od. 17.360, Od. 22.21.
(1) A throng, concourse, company: ἐς Τρώων ὅμαδον κίεν Il. 6.307, ἐνὶ πρώτῳ ὁμάδῳ μάχεσθαι (in the forefront of the battle) Il. 17.380. Cf. Il. 15.689.
(2) A roar or murmur of voices, uproar: ὅμαδος ἦν Il. 2.96. Cf. Il. 9.573, Il. 10.13, Il. 12.471=Il. 16.296, Il. 16.295, Il. 19.81, Il. 23.234: Od. 10.556. Of the roaring of wind Il. 13.797.
(1) To do something together or at the same moment, coincide in action: ἐξ οἴκου βῆσαν ὁμαρτήσαντες ἅμʼ ἄμφω Od. 21.188. Cf. Il. 12.400.
(2) To act as a companion or attendant Il. 24.438. To keep up with something, vie with it in speed: οὐδέ κεν ἴρηξ κίρκος ὁμαρτήσειεν Od. 13.87.
Doing something together or at the same moment, acting coincidently Il. 13.584.
Gathered together, assembled: ἐπεὶ ὁμηγερέες ἐγένοντο Il. 1.57, Il. 24.790. Cf. Il. 2.789, Il. 6.415, Il. 15.84, Il. 24.84, 99: Od. 2.9=Od. 8.24=Od. 24.421.
To call together, assemble: ὁμηγυρίσασθαι Ἀχαιοὺς εἰς ἀλορήν Od. 16.376.
An assembled company: θεῶν μεθʼ ὁμήγυριν ἄλλων Od. 3.142.
(1) One of the same age as another, his fellow in years: ὁμηλικίη μοί ἐσσι Od. 22.209. Cf. Od. 3.465: Od. 3.49, Od. 7.23.
(2) In reference to two persons, of like age or years: εἰ ὁμηλικίη γε γενοίμεθα Il. 13.485.
(3) In collective sense, those of the same age as another, his fellows in years or contemporaries: πᾶσαν ὁμηλικίην ἐκέκαστο Il. 13.431. Cf. Il. 3.175, Il. 5.326: Od. 2.158, Od. 3.364.

Of the same age, of like years: ὁμήλικές εἰμεν Od. 15.197. Cf. Od. 24.107. Absol., one of the same age as another, his fellow in years: νίψον σοῖο ἄνακτος ὁμήλικα Od. 19.358. In pl., those of the same age as another, his fellows in years or contemporaries: μετὰ πάντας ὁμήλικας ἔπλευ ἄριστος Il. 9.54. Cf. Od. 16.419.

forms: With dat.: ὡμήρησέ μοι παρʼ ἑταίρων ἄγγελος Od. 16.468.

defs: In a body: ἕποντο Il. 15.277, Il. 17.730. Keeping close together, maintaining close contact: ἐμάχοντο Il. 12.3.
(1) To come together, gather together, assemble, meet Od. 4.684, Od. 21.156. To be gathered together, form a band or company: περὶ κεῖνον Od. 24.19.
(2) To associate, consort, keep company with. With dat.: μνηστῆρσιν Od. 2.21, 288, 381, Od. 16.271, Od. 18.167. Cf. Il. 1.261. With παρά: οὕνεκα πὰρ παύροισιν ὁμιλεῖς Od. 18.383.
(3) To keep (with others), countenance or support them: μετὰ Τρώεσσιν ὁμιλεῖ Il. 5.834.

(4) To company (with the foe), engage in fight, carry on the fight, take part in the battle, join battle: ἐνὶ πρώτοισιν ὁμιλεῖ Il. 18.194. Cf. Il. 11.502, Il. 16.641, 644, Il. 18.535, 539, Il. 19.158. With dat.: Δαναοῖσιν Il. 11.523, Il. 13.779. Cf. Od. 1.265=Od. 4.345=Od. 17.136.
(5) Senses (4) and (3) united: τυδεΐδην οὐκ ἂν γνοίης ποτέροισι μετείη, ἠὲ μετὰ Τρώεσσιν ὁμιλέοι ἦ μετʼ Ἀχαιοῖς Il. 5.86.

(1) An assembly, concourse, company: πολλὸς χορὸν περιίσταθʼ ὁ. Il. 18.603. Cf. Il. 6.183, 186, Il. 22.462, Il. 23.651, 804, 813, Il. 24.712: Od. 1.225, Od. 8.109, Od. 15.328, Od. 16.29, Od. 17.67, 564, 590, Od. 23.303. In dat. ὁμίλῳ, in a body: ἦλθον ὁμίλῳ προτὶ ἄστυ Il. 21.606. Cf. Il. 13.50, 87. In reference to inanimate objects: οὔ τι μεμιγμένον ἐστὶν ὁμίλῳ [σημάτων] (the mass of . . .) Od. 8.196.

(2) A throng gathered for or engaged in battle, the battle-throng: ἐρχόμενον προπάροιθεν ὁμίλου Il. 3.22. Cf. Il. 4.86, Il. 5.334, Il. 11.546 (in the direction of his friends), Il. 12.191, Il. 17.149 (to his friends), 471, Il. 19.402, Od. 3.178 (so far forth from the . . .). etc.: Od. 8.216, Od. 11.514. Sim.: μνηστήρων ἐς ὅμιλον ἀκοντίσαι (ἀκόντισαν) Od. 22.263, 282. So of a host in bivouac Il. 10.231, 338, 433, 499, 517, 545. Of a body of men gathered to attack or attacking a beast: λέων ἀνδρῶν ἐν ὁμίλῳ Od. 4.791. Cf. Il. 15.588, Od. 3.173.
A mist Il. 1.359, Il. 3.10, Il. 17.649. Of a cloud of dust: κονίης ὀμίχλην Il. 13.336.

The eye. Always in pl.: ὄμματα καὶ κεφαλὴν ἴκελος διί Il. 2.478. Cf. Il. 1.225, Il. 3.397, Il. 8.349, Il. 10.91, Il. 23.66, Il. 24.343:=Od. 5.47, Od. 1.208, Od. 5.492, Od. 16.179, Od. 24.3. The face or countenance: οὐκ ἴδον ὄμματα φωτός Il. 11.614. Cf. Il. 3.217 (keeping his face turned to the earth).

forms: Fut. in mid. form ὀμοῦμαι Il. 1.233, Il. 9.132, Il. 21.373: Od. 20.229.
Imp. ὄμοσον Od. 2.373. ὄμοσσον Il. 1.76, Il. 10.321, Il. 14.271, Il. 19.108.
Infin. ὀμόσαι Il. 19.187. ὀμόσσαι Od. 5.178, Od. 10.299, 343. (ἀπ-, ἐπ-)
defs: (1) To make an affirmation, give an undertaking, indicate a resolve, under the sanction of an oath, to swear: σκῆπτρον λάβε καί οἱ ὄμοσσεν Il. 10.328. Cf. Il. 3.279, Il. 14.278, 280, Il. 19.260, 265: Od. 2.378=Od. 10.346, Od. 12.304=Od. 15.438=Od. 18.59, Od. 14.392. With cognate acc.: μέγαν ὅρκον Il. 1.233. Cf. Il. 9.132, Il. 19.108, Od. 3.313, etc.: Od. 4.253, Od. 5.178, Od. 10.299, Od. 20.229, etc.
(2) To swear to the truth of (something): ταῦτʼ ἐγὼν ἐθέλω ὀμόσαι Il. 19.187. To swear to (an undertaking): τόδʼ ὀμοῦμαι Il. 21.373.

(3) With pres., aor. or pf. infin. indicating what is affirmed: μή ποτε τῆς εὐνῆς ἐπιβήμεναι Il. 9.132, 274, Il. 19.175: νῆα κατειρύσθαι καὶ ἐπαρτέας ἔμμεν ἑταίρους Od. 14.331, Od. 19.288. With μὴ μέν Il. 23.585.

(4) With ἦ μέν and fut. infin. indicating what is undertaken or resolved: ἦ μέν μοι πρόφρων ἀρήξειν Il. 1.76. Cf. Il. 10.321, etc. Without ἦ μέν· μυή ποτʼ ἐς οὔλυμπον αὖτις ἐλεύσεσθαι?̓́ατην Il. 19.127. Cf. Od. 3.313, Il. 21.373: Od. 5.178=Od. 10.343, Od. 10.299. With μὴ μέν and aor. infin.: μὴ μὲν πρὶν Ὀδυσῆʼ ἀναφῆναι, πρίν γε . . . Od. 4.253. Without μέν: μὴ μητρὶ τάδε μυθήσασθαι, πρίν γε . . . Od. 2.373. With clause: μή τις ἐμὲ χειρὶ βαρείῃ πλήξῃ Od. 18.55. Cf. Od. 12.298.
(5) To invoke in sanction of an oath, swear by: στυγὸς ὕδωρ Il. 14.271. Cf. Il. 15.40.
Born of the same mother: κασίγνητον ὁμογάστριον Il. 24.47. Cf. Il. 21.95.

forms: With ἐξ: δοιοὺς θάμνους ἐξ ὁμόθεν πεφυῶτας (from the same root or stem) Od. 5.477.
Of πόλεμος: ὁμοιΐου π̔τ'ολέμοιο (ὁμοιΐοο πτολέμοιὀ Il. 9.440, Il. 13.358, 635, Il. 15.670, Il. 18.242, Il. 21.294: Od. 18.264, Od. 24.543.

defs: (1) Like, the like, resembling: οὔ ποθʼ ὁμοίης ἔμμορε τιμῆς (i.e. very different (from that of common men)) Il. 1.278, οὔ πω πάντες ὁμοῖοι ἀνέρες ἐν πολέμῳ Il. 12.270. Cf. Il. 4.410, Il. 5.441: χρώς τοι οὐκέθʼ ὁμοῖος (like what it was) Od. 16.182, παῦροι Ἀχαιῶν ἦσαν ὁμοῖοι (like him) Od. 19.240.– Absol.: ὁππότε τὸν ὁμοῖον ἀνὴρ ἐθέλῃσιν ἀμέρσαι (one as good as himself) Il. 16.53: ὡς αἰεὶ τὸν ὁμοῖον  ἄγει θεὸς ὣς τὸν ὁμοῖον (as heaven brings one like, so it brings his like) (ὥς seems to be better read than ὡς) Od. 17.218. With dat.: τρήρωσι πελειάσιν Il. 5.778, κόμαι χαρίτεσσιν ὁμοῖαι (like the Graces' . . .) Il. 17.51. Cf. Il. 2.553, Il. 9.305, Il. 10.216, 437, Il. 14.521, Il. 17.475, Il. 23.632: Od. 2.121, 276, Od. 3.468, Od. 7.16, 231=Od. 23.158, Od. 8.14, Od. 19.203, Od. 23.163. With complementary infin.: τῷ οὔ πώ τις ὁμοῖος γένετʼ ἀνὴρ κοσμῆσαι ἵππους Il. 2.553. Cf. Il. 10.437, Il. 14.521, Il. 17.475.
(2) The same, one and the same: εἴ μοι ὁμοίη μοῖρα τέτυκται Il. 18.120. Cf. Il. 18.329.
In pass., to be made like, to liken oneself to, vie with. With dat.: ἶσον ἐμοὶ φάσθαι καὶ ὁμοιωθήμεναι ἄντην Il. 1.187. Cf. Od. 3.120.

(1) To shout together in encouragement, urge comrades to action with shouts: ὁμόκλεον ἀλλήλοισιν Il. 15.658. To shout together in rebuke, reproach or menace: πάντες ὁμοκλήσαντες ἔχον ἵππους (rasing a shout to daunt the foe) Il. 15.354: μνηστῆρες πάντες ὁμόκλεον Od. 21.360. Cf. Od. 19.155, Od. 21.367, Od. 22.211, Od. 24.173.

(2) Of a single person, to shout an order. With acc. and infin.: ἦ λαοὺς ἐς τεῖχος ὁμοκλήσειεν ἀλῆναι Il. 16.714. To shout in encouragement or with a view to urging on to action: μέγα Τρώεσσιν ὁμόκλα Il. 18.156. Cf. Od. 3.365, Il. 23.337, 363. In rebuke or reproach: δείνʼ ὁμοκλήσας προσέφη Ἀπόλλων Il. 5.439. Cf. Il. 2.199, Il. 7.54, Il. 16.706, Il. 24.248, 252.– In menace: τῇ ῥʼ ἔχʼ ὁμοκλήσας (raising a shout to daunt the foe) Il. 16.378. Cf. Od. 3.448: Od. 14.35.
(1) A rebuke or reproach: ἄνακτος (πατρὸς) ὑποδείσαντες ὁμοκλήν Il. 12.413=Il. 23.417 = 446, Il. 24.265. Cf. Od. 17.189.
(2) A menacing or threatening shout: ἔχε τρόμος ἀνδρὸς ὁμοκλῇ Il. 7.137, μάχῃ ἔνι μεῖναι ὁμοκλήν (to stand up to the shouting foe) Il. 16.147.

A shouter. In encouragement: τοῖο ἄνευθεν ἐόντος ὁμοκλητῆρος ἀκούσας (i.e. he heard his voice as he urged on his horses) Il. 23.452. In menace: μή τις ὀπίσσω τετράφθω ὁμοκλητῆρος ἀκούσας (before the shouts of the foe) Il. 12.273.

forms: Aor. pple. mid. ὀμορξάμενος, -η Il. 18.124: Od. 8.88, Od. 11.530. (ἀπ-)
defs: To wipe off or away: ἀπʼ ἰχῶ χειρὸς ὀμόργνυ Il. 5.416. In mid., to wipe away from one's face: δάκρυʼ ὀμορξάμενος Od. 8.88. Cf. Il. 18.124: Od. 11.527, 530.

The same, one and the same: οὐ πάντων ἦεν ὁμὸς θρόος Il. 4.437. Cf. Il. 13.354, Il. 15.209, Il. 23.91, Il. 24.57: Od. 10.41, Od. 17.563. The same as. With dat.: ἥ κέν τοι ὁμὸν λέχος εἰσαναβαίνοι Il. 8.291. Common, in which all take part: τῶν ὁμὸν ἵατατο νεῖκος Il. 13.333.
To the same spot: τῶν ὁμόσʼ ἦλθε μάχη (they joined battle) Il. 13.337. Cf. Il. 12.24.
To go with, accompany. With dat.: βόεσσιν Il. 15.635.
Entitled to be held in the same estimation, equally to be honoured: εἴ μʼ ὁμότιμον ἐόντα καθέξει Il. 15.186.
(1) In the same place, together Il. 23.84. Into the same place, together: θῆρας ὁμοῦ εἰλεῦντα Od. 11.573.

(2) At the same time, together, both at once: εἰ ὁμοῦ πόλεμός τε δαμᾷ καὶ λοιμὸς Ἀχαιούς Il. 1.61. Cf. Il. 4.122, Il. 11.127, 245, Il. 17.362, 745, Od. 3.499: Od. 5.294=Od. 9.69=Od. 12.315, Od. 9.75=Od. 10.143, Od. 12.67, 178, 424.
(3) With dat., along with, with, among: νεφέεσσιν Il. 5.867. Cf. Il. 15.118: Od. 4.723, Od. 15.365.
To be of like mind with another Od. 7.183. To feel with another, sympathize with him Od. 9.456.
Oneness or likeness of mind, concord: ὁμοφροσύνην ὀπάσειαν Od. 7.181. So in pl.: ἥδʼ ὁδὸς καὶ μᾶλλον ὁμοφροσύνῃσιν ἐνήσει Od. 15.198.
In reference to the mind, like that of another, having the same inclinations. Of animals: οὐδὲ λύκοι τε καὶ ἄρνες ὁμόφρονα θυμὸν ἔχουσιν Il. 22.263.
To unite Il. 14.209.
(1) Furnished with a boss. Epithet of shields (cf. ὀμφαλός 2) Il. 4.448, Il. 7.118, Il. 12.161, Il. 22.111, etc.: Od. 19.32.
(2) Of the yoke of a chariot, furnished with a boss (cf. ὀμφαλός 3) Il. 24.269.
(1) The navel: οὖτα παρʼ ὀμφαλόν Il. 4.525. Cf. Il. 13.568, Od. 3.416, Il. 21.180. Fig., the centre: νήσῳ ἐν ἀμφιρύτῃ, ὅθι τʼ ὀ. ἐστι θαλάσσης Od. 1.50.
(2) A boss on a shield Il. 11.34, Il. 13.192.
(3) A boss on the yoke of a chariot Il. 24.273.
An unripe grape Od. 6.125.
A voice. Always of a divine voice or inspiration: ἐπισπόμενοι θεοῦ ὀμφῇ Od. 3.215=Od. 16.96. Cf. Il. 2.41, Od. 3.129.
Bearing the same name Il. 17.720.
All the same, nevertheless: ὅμως δʼ οὐ λήθετο χάρμης Il. 12.393. Cf. Od. 11.565.

(1) Alike, equally, likewise: ἄμφω ὁμῶς φιλέουσα Il. 1.196=209. Cf. Il. 15.98, Il. 17.422: νυκτὶ ὁμῶς πλείειν (i.e. as well as by day) Od. 15.34, ὁμῶς ἐφοίτων (with one consent) Od. 24.415. Cf. Od. 4.775, Od. 8.542, Od. 23.332.

(2) Preceding clauses joined by . . . τε . . . τε, τε καί, alike: πλῆθεν ὁμῶς ἵππων τε καὶ ἀνδρῶν Il. 8.214, κάτθανʼ ὁμῶς ὅ τʼ ἀεργὸς ἀνὴρ ὅ τε . . . Il. 9.320. Cf. Il. 11.708, Il. 15.257, Il. 17.644, Il. 21.521, Il. 24.73: Od. 10.28, 80=Od. 15.476, Od. 24.63.
(3) In the same manner, to the same degree: οὐκέθʼ ὁμῶς τιμῆς ἔσεαι Il. 9.605. Cf. Il. 21.62.
(4) With dat., equally with, like as: ὁμῶς τοι ἤπια οἶδεν Od. 13.405=Od. 15.39. Cf. Il. 5.535, Il. 14.72, Il. 9.312:=Od. 14.156.
A vision seen in sleep, a dream: οὐκ ὀ., ἀλλʼ ὕπαρ ἐσθλόν Od. 19.547. Cf. Il. 10.496: Od. 20.90. In generalized sense, dreams: καὶ γάρ τʼ ὀ. ἐκ διός ἐστιν Il. 1.63.

forms: To his . . . (with the -δε doubled): ὅνδε δόμονδε Il. 16.445: Od. 1.83=Od. 14.424=Od. 20.239=Od. 21.204, Od. 3.272, Od. 17.527, Od. 20.329.

defs: (1) Something that  benefits, a means of aid, an aid, benefit, help: ἐφράσατο μέγʼ ὄνειαρ Od. 4.444. Cf. Od. 15.78. Of a person: πᾶσιν ὄνειαρ Il. 22.433. Cf. Il. 22.486.
(2) In pl., good things, good cheer: παρά σφιν ὀνείατα μυρία κεῖται Od. 10.9. Cf. Od. 15.316. See also under ἑτοῖμος 1.
(3) In pl., goods, substance: τοσσάδʼ ὀνείατʼ ἄγοντα Il. 24.367.

Conveying blame or censure, reproachful, reviling, abusive: μῦθον Il. 21.393, 471. Cf. Il. 1.519, Il. 2.277, Il. 16.628, Il. 21.480: Od. 18.326. Absol. in neut. pl., reviling, abuse: ὀνειδείοισιν ἐνίσσων Il. 22.497.
(1) To use words of blame or censure, speak in abuse or reviling: μετέειπε νείκει ὀνειδίζων Il. 6.95.

(2) To make matter of blame or reproach, cast in one's teeth: ἀλκήν μοι ὀνείδισας (i.e. the want of it) Il. 9.34: τὴν γαστέρʼ ὀνειδίζων Od. 18.380. With dependent clause: ὀνείδισον ὡς ἔσεταί περ (speak out to him and tell him how it will be) Il. 1.211, ἧσαι ὀνειδίζων ὅτι . . . (casting in his teeth that . . .) Il. 2.255.
(1) In pl., words of blame, censure, reproach, abuse, reviling: λέγʼ ὀνείδεα Il. 2.222. Cf. Il. 1.291, Il. 2.251, Il. 3.242, 438, Il. 9.460, Od. 3.246: Od. 17.461.
(2) In pl., shame, disgrace: αἳ ἐμῇ κεφαλῇ κατʼ ὀνείδεα χεῦαν Od. 22.463.
(3) A cause or source of reproach or blame: ἐμοί κʼ ὀνείδεα ταῦτα γένοιτο Od. 7.285. Cf. Il. 16.498, Il. 17.556.
Of dreams: πύλῃσιν Od. 4.809.
One busied with dreams, one skilled in the interpretation of dreams Il. 1.63, Il. 5.149.

(1) A vision seen in sleep, a dream: θεῖός μοι ἐνύπνιον ἦλθεν ὀ. Od. 14.495. Cf. Il. 2.80, Il. 5.150: Od. 4.841, Od. 7.49, Od. 11.207, 222, Od. 19.535, 555, 560, 562, 568, Od. 20.87, Od. 24.12. Personified Il. 2.6, 8, 16, 22, 56.
(2) The state of one who is dreaming, a dream, the land of dreams: ἔν περ ὀνείρῳ Od. 19.541, 581=Od. 21.79. Cf. Il. 22.199.
Good, profit Od. 21.402.

forms: 3 sing. fut. ὀνήσει Il. 6.172, Il. 8.36, 467: Od. 23.24.
defs: (1) To be of service to, confer benefit upon, benefit, profit, help: Ἀχαιούς Il. 6.172. Cf. Il. 1.395, 503, Il. 5.205, Il. 9.509, Il. 24.45: σὲ τοῦτό γε γῆρας ὀνήσει (will benefit you so far, you may thank your years for that) Od. 23.24. Cf. Od. 14.67. Without expressed object: βουλήν, ἥ τις ὀνήσει Il. 8.36=467.

(2) In mid., to get good, benefit, profit, help or enjoyment from something, be the better for it: καὐτὸς ὀνήσεαι Il. 7.260. Cf. Il. 6.173: πρὸς δʼ αὐτοὶ ὀνησόμεθα (will get some enjoyment for ourselves) Od. 14.415. With genit. of that from which good is derived: τί σευ ἄλλος ὀνήσεται; Il. 16.31: δαιτὸς ὄνησο (make the best of it, be thankful for what you have got) Od. 19.68. In aor. pple., blessed (cf. οὐλόμενος): ἐσθλός μοι δοκεῖ εἶναι, ὀνήμενος Od. 2.33.

etym: -ατος, τό. Also οὔνομα Il. 3.235, Il. 17.260: Od. 7.194, Od. 9.355.
forms: The name or fame of a person or of something: Ἰθάκης γε καὶ ἐς τροίην ὀ. ἵκει Od. 13.248. Cf. Od. 24.93.

defs: (1) To address by name: πατρόθεν ἐκ γενεῆς ὀνομάζων ἄνδρα ἕκαστον Il. 10.68. Cf. Il. 22.415: Od. 4.278. In the recurring formula ἔπος τʼ ἔφατʼ ἔκ τʼ ὀνόμαζεν app. meaning no more than to address (the name is often not given in the reported speech, and in Od. 7.254 and Od. 10.319 is not known to the speaker. In Od. 8.194 the name cannot have been used, as it was not then known to the Phaeacians. In Od. 17.215 Melantheus cannot have known any name by which to address the disguised Odysseus. In Od. 14.52 the disguised Odysseus knew Eumaeus's name, but cannot be supposed to have used it) Il. 1.361, Il. 3.398, Il. 7.253, Il. 6.108, etc.: Od. 2.302, Od. 3.374, Od. 4.311, Od. 6.330, etc.
(2) To speak of or mention by name, utter the name of: τὸν καὶ οὐ παρεόντʼ ὀνομάζειν αἰδέομαι Od. 14.145.
(3) To name, tell the name of Od. 4.551.
(4) To name, specify, detail, enumerate: δῶρα Il. 18.449. Cf. Il. 9.515, Od. 24.339.

forms: 3 sing. opt. ὀνόσαιτο Il. 4.539, Il. 13.127, Il. 17.399.

Pple. ὀνοσσάμενος Il. 24.439. Here app. should come as 2 pl. pres. οὔνεσθε, u.l. in Il. 24.241 (see above). To think little of, make light of, look upon or treat with contempt or scorn, disparage: ἔργον Il. 4.539. Cf. Il. 9.55, Il. 13.127, 287, Il. 14.95=Il. 17.173, Il. 17.25, 399, Il. 24.439: Od. 8.239, Od. 21.427.
With dependent clause: ἦ ὀνόσασθʼ ὅτι . . . ; (seems it so light a thing that . . . ?) Il. 24.241: ἦ ὄνοσαι ὅτι . . . ; (is it not enough that . . . ?) Od. 17.378.

defs: (1) To address or call to by name, call upon by name: ἑταῖρον Il. 10.522, Il. 16.491, Il. 23.178, Il. 24.591. To call upon by name in adjuration: θεούς Il. 14.278.
(2) To name, tell the name or names of, enumerate by name: πληθύν Il. 2.488. Cf. Od. 11.328, 517.
(3) To disclose a person's name Od. 11.251.
(4) To name, appoint: σόν με θεράποντʼ ὀνόμηνεν Il. 23.90.
(5) To name, specify, detail, enumerate: δῶρα Il. 9.121. Cf. Od. 4.240. With a promise implied. With fut. infin.: ὄρχους μοι ὀνόμηνας δώσειν πεντήκοντα Od. 24.341.
By name Il. 22.415: Od. 4.278.
Of famous name: Ἄλτης Il. 22.51.
To be named: κακοΐλιον οὐκ ὀνομαστήν Od. 19.260=597=Od. 23.19.
An ass Il. 11.558.
To be made light of or treated with indifference: ὀῶρα Il. 9.164.

forms: Dat. pl. ὀνύχεσσι in passages cited.
In pl., an eagle's talons: νεβρὸν ἔχοντʼ ὀνύχεσσιν Il. 8.248. Cf. Il. 12.202 = 220: Od. 2.153, Od. 15.161.

etym: [ὀξύς + βέλος. The force of the second element app. obscured.]
defs: Sharp, pointed. Epithet of an arrow: ὀϊστός Il. 4.126.
Sharp, pointed. Epithet of spears Il. 5.50, 568, Il. 6.11, Il. 14.443, etc.: Od. 19.33, Od. 20.306.

(1) Sharp, keen, with sharp point or edge: δοῦρε δύω ὀξέα Il. 11.44. Cf. Il. 10.135, Il. 11.392, Il. 12.56 (pointed), 447 (coming to a point), Il. 15.711, etc.: Od. 1.99, Od. 3.443, Od. 5.411 (jagged), Od. 12.74 (rising to a point), etc. Epithet of weapons or parts thereof Il. 1.190, Il. 4.185, 214, 490, 530, etc.: Od. 2.3, Od. 4.700, Od. 10.145, Od. 14.271, Od. 22.265, etc. Sim. of cutting instruments: ἐρινεὸν ὀξέϊ χαλκῷ τάμνεν Il. 21.37. Cf. Il. 23.412: Od. 12.173.

(2) Fig. of the beams of the sun, piercing, penetrating Il. 17.372. In reference to perception with the eye, quick. In superl., with infin.: ὀξύτατον εἰσοράασθαι Il. 14.345. Cf. Il. 17.675. Of sound, shrill, piercing: ἀϋτή Il. 15.313. Of pain or grief, sharp, piercing: ὀδύναι Il. 11.268, 272. Cf. Il. 11.269, Il. 16.518, Il. 19.125, Il. 22.425: Od. 11.208, Od. 19.517. As epithet of Ares, eager, impetuous Il. 6.330. As epithet of battle, keen, fierce: ὀξὺν?̓́αρηα Il. 2.440, Il. 4.352=Il. 19.237, Il. 8.531=Il. 18.304, Il. 11.836, Il. 17.721.
(3) In neut. sing. ὀξύ as adv.
(b) In reference to sound, shrilly, piercingly: βοήσας Il. 17.89. Cf. Il. 18.71, Od. 3.52, Il. 22.141.
(4) In neut. pl. ὀξέα as adv., in reference to sound, shrilly, piercingly: κεκλήγων Il. 2.222. Cf. Il. 12.125, Il. 17.88.
(5) In neut. sing. superl. ὀξύτατον as adv., of perceiving with the eye, with keenest glance, most quickly: οὔτʼ ὀξύτατον δέρκεται ὄσσε Il. 23.477.

(1) To cause to go with, accompany or attend, a person, send with him: ὤπασά οἱ πομπόν Il. 13.416. Cf. Il. 16.38, Il. 18.452, Il. 24.153, 461: Od. 9.90=Od. 10.102, Od. 10.204, Od. 13.68, Od. 15.310, Od. 20.364. To cause to follow a person as chief, give a person rule over: πολύν μοι ὤπασε λαόν Il. 9.483. In mid., to attach to oneself, take with one, as companion: κήρυκα καὶ ἑταῖρον Od. 10.59. Cf. Il. 10.238, Il. 19.238.

(2) To make over, give as a present, give, present: πατρόκλῳ κόμην ὀπάσαιμι φέρεσθαι (I am ready to . . ., I can do no better than . . .) Il. 23.151. Cf. Il. 17.196: χρυσέην ἠλακάτην Od. 4.131. Cf. Od. 4.619=Od. 15.119, Od. 8.430, Od. 13.121, 305, Od. 24.283.

(3) With less definite object, to cause to attend upon a person, attach to him, give, grant, bestow: κάλλος Il. 7.157. Cf. Il. 6.205, Il. 8.141, Il. 12.255, Il. 14.358, 491, Il. 15.327, Il. 16.730, Il. 17.566, Il. 21.570, Il. 22.51 (i.e. as a dowry): ὁμοφροσύνην Od. 7.181. Cf. Od. 3.57, Od. 8.498, Od. 13.45, Od. 14.62, Od. 15.320, Od. 18.19, Od. 19.161, Od. 21.214, Od. 23.210, Od. 24.201.

(4) To press hard upon, chase, pursue: Ἀχαιούς Il. 8.341. Cf. Il. 5.334, Il. 17.462. In pass.: [ποταμὸς] ὀπαζόμενος Διὸς ὄμβρῳ (driven onwards) Il. 11.493. Of an abstraction, to bear hard upon, oppress: γῆράς μʼ (σʼ̓ ὀπάζει Il. 4.321, Il. 8.103.
Having the same father Il. 11.257, Il. 12.371. (See κασίγνητος 1.b.)
(1) = θεράπων 1 Il. 23.360.
(3) Like θεράπων 3 Il. 17.610.

(1) In whichever direction, whithersoever: ἄρχʼ, ὅππῃ σε κραδίη κελεύει Il. 13.784. Cf. Od. 3.25 and Il. 22.185 (as . . .): Od. 1.347, Od. 14.517=Od. 15.339, Od. 16.81=Od. 21.342, Od. 18.242. With subj. or opt. in conditional relative sentences. For the examples and constructions see Table at end III.B.a  1,

(2) In what direction, whither: πάπτηνεν ἕκαστος ὅπῃ φύγοι ὄλεθρον (to see where he could turn to escape . . .) Il. 14.507=Il. 16.283, εἰσορόων χρόα, ὅπῃ εἴξειεν (to see where he might find an opening) Il. 22.321. Cf. Od. 8.573, Od. 22.43.
(3) In what spot, where: εἴφʼ ὅπῃ ἔσχες νῆα Od. 9.279. Cf. Od. 9.457. In what direction or quarter: οὐ γὰρ ἴδμεν ὅπῃ ζόφος οὐδʼ ὅπῃ ἠώς, οὐδʼ ὅπῃ . . . οὐδʼ ὅπῃ . . . Od. 10.190.

(1) To be in attendance on a person, attend him as a follower, retainer or henchman Il. 2.184, Il. 24.368. Of an inanimate object, to be carried or borne by a person, accompany him: ἀνεμώλιά μοι ὀπηδεῖ [τόξα] Il. 5.216. Of a divinity, to cause his protecting or favouring power to go with or attend on a person, act as his protector or guardian: διί, ὅς θʼ ἱκέτῃσιν ἅμʼ αἰδοίοισιν ὀπηδεῖ Od. 6.165=181. Cf. Od. 9.271, Od. 19.398.
(2) Of abstractions, to attend upon a person, be attached to him, be given, granted, bestowed on him: ἀρετὴν σήν, ἥ τοι ὀπηδεῖ Od. 8.237. Cf. Il. 17.251.

To regard with awe or reverence, stand in awe of, observe: μητρὸς ὠπίζετʼ ἐφετμήν Il. 18.216. Cf. Od. 13.148, Od. 14.283. To pay regard or heed to, direct one's thoughts to, think of: ἔμʼ οὐδὲν ὀπίζεο Il. 22.332.

To eye: τί ὀπιπεύεις πολέμοιο γεφύρας; (instead of advancing to the fight) Il. 4.371, οὔ σʼ ἐθέλω βαλέειν ὀπιπεύσας  (holding you in talk and looking out for a weak spot) Il. 6.243 : ὀπιπεύσεις γυναῖκας (will be ogling the maids) Od. 19.67.

forms: The watch (kept by the gods) on the deeds of men, their regard for righteousness and reprobation of evil-doing : θεῶν ὄπιν οὐκ ἀλέγοντες Il. 16.388. Cf. Od. 20.215, Od. 21.28.
So without θεῶν · οὐκ ὄπιδα φρονέοντες Od. 14.82. Cf. Od. 14.88.

defs: (II) With genit., of place, behind, in rear of : ὄπισθε μάχης Il. 13.536= Il. 14.430. Cf. Il. 5.595, Il. 17.468, Il. 24.15.

(1) Of direction, backwards, back : ἀνεχάζετο τυτθὸν ὀπίσσω Il. 5.443. Cf. Il. 3.218, 261, Il. 12.205, Od. 3.119, etc. : Od. 8.375, Od. 11.149, Od. 12.410. In reference to the exercise of a mental faculty : πρόσσω καὶ ὀπίσσω (see πρόσσω 1). Back to the same place, back again : ὀπίσω κίε Od. 16.150. Cf. Od. 6.326. Sim. : ὄφρʼ ἐξεμέσειεν ὀπίσσω ἱστὸν αὖτις Od. 12.437.

(2) Of place, behind, in rear : ἐξακέονται ὀπίσσω (follow and . . .) Il. 9.507, αὐτὰρ ὀπίσσω ἡ πληθὺς ἐπὶ νῆας ἀπονέοντο (behind the screen covering their retreat) Il. 15.304. Cf. Il. 15.735, Il. 17.752, Il. 21.30, Il. 22.137. Sim. : τῷ ἄλγεα κάλλιπʼ ὀπίσσω (left behind her) Od. 11.279. Cf. Il. 3.160 : Od. 23.119.

(3) Of time, afterwards, hereafter, thereafter, in the future, in time to come, later : τρῳαί μʼ ὀπίσσω μωμήσονται Il. 3.411. Cf. Il. 4.37, Il. 7.352, 450, Il. 15.497, etc. : Od. 1.222 (for the time to come), Od. 2.179, Od. 7.273, Od. 11.433, Od. 14.137, Od. 18.132, etc. As quasi-sb. : ἐς ὀπίσσω Od. 18.122= Od. 20.199.
The hindmost, the last. Absol. Il. 8.342= Il. 11.178.

Here prob. should come pres. infin. mid. ὅπλεσθαι Il. 19.172, Il. 23.159 (for ὁπλεῖσθαι). To get ready, make ready, prepare : ἄμαξαν Od. 7.73. In mid., to make ready (a meal) for oneself, prepare oneself (a meal) : δεῖπνον ὅπλεσθαι Il. 19.172, Il. 23.159.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. ὡπλίσατο (ὁ?) Il. 23.301, 351. ὡπλίσσατο Il. 11.86. ὁπλίσσατο Od. 2.20, Od. 9.291, 311, 344, Od. 10.116.
defs: (1) To deck, array : ὅπλισθεν γυναῖκες (came in their finery) Od. 23.143.
(2) To get ready, make ready, prepare : κυκειῶ Il. 11.641 : νῆες ὁπλίζονται πόντον ἔπι (are set their courses over . . .) Od. 17.288. Cf. Il. 24.190 : Od. 2.289.
(3) In mid.
(b) To get ready, harness (one's horses) Il. 23.301, 351.
(c) To make ready (a meal) for oneself, prepare oneself (a meal) : δεῖπνον Il. 11.86 : Od. 9.311, Od. 10.116, δόρπον Od. 2.20, Od. 4.429 = 574, Od. 9.291, 344, Od. 12.292, Od. 16.453.
(d) To don one's harness, make ready or prepare for the fray : τρῶες ἀνὰ πτόλιν ὁπλιζοντο Il. 8.55. Cf. Od. 24.495.
(1) An implement, appliance, tool : ὅπλʼ ἐν χερσὶν ἔχων Od. 3.433. Cf. Il. 18.409, 412. Specifically, a rope or cable : ἐμὲ κατέδησαν ὅπλῳ Od. 14.346. Cf. Od. 21.390.

(2) In pl., the tackle of a ship landed from her when not in use and taken on board before putting to sea : πάντʼ ἐν νηῒ ὅπλʼ ἐτίθει Od. 2.390. Cf. Od. 7.286, Od. 10.404, 424, Od. 12.410. Specifically, the running tackle : ὅπλων ἅπτεσθαι Od. 2.423, δησάμενοι ὅπλα 430. Cf. Od. 11.9, Od. 12.151, Od. 15.288.
(3) In pl., warlike array, harness, armour : ὅπλοισιν ἔνι δεινοῖσιν ἐδύτην Il. 10.254, 272. Cf. Il. 18.614, Il. 19.21.

etym: -η, comp. Younger : ὁπλότερος γενεῇ Il. 2.707. Cf. Il. 4.325 : Od. 19.184, Od. 21.370.
forms: Youthful rather than old : αἰεὶ ὁπλοτέρων ἀνδρῶν φρένες ἠερέθονται (the younger generation, the class of youths) Il. 3.108, χαρίτων μίαν ὁπλοτεράων (one of the youthful . . .) Il. 14.267, 275.
defs: Youngest, the youngest : νέστορος ὁπλοτάτη θυγάτηρ Od. 3.465. Cf. Il. 9.58 : Od. 6.58, Od. 11.283, Od. 15.364.

(1) As relative, of whatever sort or kind. With subj. or opt. in conditional relative sentences (with τοῖος as correlative). For the examples and constructions see Table at end II.B.b, (III) (D) (29).
(2) In object clauses, of what sort or kind : ὁπποίης ἐπὶ νηὸς ἀφίκεο Od. 1.171= Od. 14.188. With the indefinite ἄσσα · εἰπέ μοι ὁπποῖʼ ἄσσα εἵματα ἕστο Od. 19.218.

forms: Fig-juice used to curdle milk for cheese Il. 5.902.

defs: (1) As relative, as many as : κτήμαθʼ ὁπόσσα τοί ἐστιν (all your possessions) Od. 22.220. As much as. Absol. : ὁπόσσον ἐπέσχε πυρὸς μένος (the space that the fire covered) Il. 23.238= Il. 24.792.
(2) In object clauses, how many or great, what : ὄφρʼ εἴπῃς ὁππόσα κήδεʼ ἀνέτης Od. 14.47. Absol. : ποθέων ὁπόσα τολύπευσεν Il. 24.7.
(1) When, at the time when.
(2) Against the time when : δέγμενος ὁππότʼ ἀφορμηθεῖεν (watching for the time when . . .) Il. 2.794. Cf. Il. 4.229, Il. 10.189, etc. : Od. 20.386.
(3) At which time, when : ἔσσεται ἠώς, ὁππότε τις καὶ ἐμεῖο?̓́αρῃ ἐκ θυμὸν ἕληται Il. 21.112. Cf. Il. 13.817.
(4) In an object clause : ἴδμεν ὁππότε νεῖτʼ ἐκ πύλου; Od. 4.633.

forms: In object clauses, in what place, where : δμώων κέ τεο πειρηθεῖμεν, ὅπου τις νῶϊ τίει Od. 16.306 (i.e. at the various ἔργα of 314). Cf. Od. 3.16.
In indirect questions and object clauses, whence : ἐρέσθαι, ὁ. οὗτος ἀνήρ (where he comes from) Od. 1.406. Cf. Od. 3.80, Od. 14.47.
In reference to origin : εἰπὲ τεὸν γένος, ὁ. ἐσσί Od. 19.162.

defs: (1) As relative, where : ὁππόθι πιότατον πεδίον καλυδῶνος Il. 9.577.
(2) In an object clause : σάφα εἰπέμεν ὁππόθʼ ὄλωλεν Od. 3.89.

forms: With subj. in a relative sentence corresponding to sentences with εἰ 4 : ὁππόσʼ ἐπέλθω Od. 14.139 (see Table at end II.D.3).

defs: (1) As relative, whichever of the two.
(b) With subj. in conditional relative sentences. For the examples and constructions see Table at end (III) (D) (20) (26).
(c) In pl. in reference to two bodies of men. With opt. in a conditional relative sentence. See Table (III) (D) (54).

(2) In object clauses, which of the two : Ζεὺς τό γε οἷδεν, ὁπποτέρῳ θανάτοιο τέλος πεπρωμένον ἐστίν Il. 3.309. Cf. Il. 3.317, Il. 22.130 : Od. 12.57. In pl. in reference to two bodies of men Il. 5.33. So in reference to two pairs of horses Il. 23.487.

forms: In an object clause, from which quarter : οὐδʼ ἂν ἔτι γνοίης ὁπποτέρωθεν Ἀχαιοὶ κλονέονται Il. 14.59.

defs: Roasted, roast : κρέα Il. 4.345 : Od. 12.396, κρειῶν Od. 16.50.
A scout : ὀπτῆρας ὄτρυνα νέεσθαι Od. 14.261= Od. 17.430.

forms: To take or have to wife, marry : ὅς [μιν] ἀναφανδὸν ὄπυιεν Il. 16.178, τὴν ὤπυιε ἀμφιγυήεις Il. 18.383. Cf. Il. 13.379, 429, Il. 14.268 : Od. 2.207, 336, Od. 4.798, Od. 15.21, Od. 16.386.
Absol. in pres. pple., a married man : οἱ δύʼ ὀπυίοντες Od. 7.63.
In pass., of the woman, to be taken to wife, be married : ἐξ αἰσύμηθεν ὀπυιομένη Il. 8.304.

defs: (1) The presentation of something to the sight, sight of something : ὅπως ἤντησας ὀπωπῆς Od. 3.97= Od. 4.327, Od. 17.44.
(2) The faculty of sight, vision : ἁμαρτήσεσθαι ὀπωπῆς Od. 9.512.
Late summer, harvest-time : ἀστέρʼ, ὅς τʼ ὀπώρης εἶσιν (in . . .) Il. 22.27. Distinguished from θέρος Od. 11.192, Od. 12.76, Od. 14.384.
Of, that comes in, late summer or harvest-time : ἀστέρι Il. 5.5. Cf. Il. 16.385, Il. 21.346 : Od. 5.328.

(1) In such way or manner as, as.

(a) With indic. : ἔρξον ὅπως ἐθέλεις Il. 4.37 : Od. 13.145. Cf. Od. 14.172, Od. 15.111, etc.–

(b) With subj. or opt. in conditional relative sentences. For the examples and constructions see Table at end III.B.a  1 2,
(2) In object clauses, in what way or manner, how.
(3) In final clauses, so that, in order that.
(4) When : ὅπως ἴδον αἷμα Il. 11.459. Cf. Il. 12.208 : Od. 3.373, Od. 22.22.

forms: Pres. infin. mid. ὁράασθαι Od. 16.107, Od. 18.4, Od. 20.317. From ὅρημαι (cf. δίζημαι).
2 sing. pres. mid. ὅρηαι Od. 14.343. From ὀπ-
2 sing. fut. in mid. form ὄψεαι Il. 4.353, Il. 8.471, Il. 9.359, Il. 24.601 : Od. 24.511. ὄψει Od. 12.101. ὄψῃ Il. 23.620.
defs: (1) In act. and mid., to look, gaze : θαύμαζον ὁρόωντες Od. 6.145. Cf. Od. 3.23 : Od. 4.47= Od. 10.181. To direct one's sight, look, gaze, in a specified direction : θεοὶ ἐς πάντες ὁρῶντο Il. 22.166. Cf. Il. 1.350, Il. 3.325, Il. 16.646, Il. 17.637, Il. 24.633 : Od. 5.439, Od. 18.344, Od. 20.373, Od. 23.91.
(2) To look at or upon, gaze upon. In act. and mid. : αἰεὶ τέρμʼ ὁρόων (keeping his eyes  upon it) Il. 23.323 : τὸν ὁρῶντο Od. 15.462. Cf. Od. 8.459.
(3) To look to something, consider it, judge by it. In act. and mid. : ἐς γενεὴν ὁρόων Il. 10.239 : ἐς μέγεθος ὁρώμενος Od. 18.219.
(4) To look to, attend to, something : ἐς ἐμὰ ἔργʼ ὁρόωσα Od. 19.514.

(5) In act. and mid., to have sight of, see, behold : τῶν ἄλλων οὔ τις ὁρᾶτο [αὐτήν] Il. 1.198, οὔ πω τοιόνδε λαὸν οὔπωπα Il. 2.799. Cf. Il. 3.234, Il. 5.120, Il. 11.651, Il. 13.99, Il. 14.343, etc. : Od. 1.229, Od. 3.93, Od. 11.156, 450, Od. 13.357, Od. 14.343, etc. With indefinite object : ὁρόων ἀκάχημαι Od. 8.314. Cf. Od. 4.226, Od. 21.123. With complementary pple. or adj. : ὅτι θνῄσκοντας ὁρᾶτο Il. 1.56. Cf. Il. 3.306, Il. 5.244, Il. 8.471, Il. 9.359, etc. : μάλα σʼ ὁρόω καλόν τε μέγαν τε Od. 1.301= Od. 3.199. Cf. Od. 18.143, Od. 24.511. With complementary clause : οὐχ ὁράᾳς ὅτι . . .; Il. 6.448. Cf. Il. 4.347, Il. 15.555, Il. 21.108 : Od. 8.313, Od. 17.545. The infin. used epexegetically : εἶδος μάλα μέγας ἦν ὁράασθαι Od. 18.4.
(6) To visit, go to see, see. In mid. : ὀψόμεναί τε γέρονθʼ ἅλιον καὶ δώματα πατρός Il. 18.141. Cf. Il. 14.200, 205 = 304, 301 : Od. 23.360.
(7) To admit to one's presence, see : οὐδέ σε μήτηρ ὄψεται Od. 15.516.
(8) Of mental vision : ὁρόων θάνατον Od. 3.481, οἷος ὅρα πρόσσω καὶ ὀπίσσω Il. 18.250 : Od. 24.452.
The length of the outstretched arms, a fathom Il. 23.327 : Od. 9.325, Od. 10.167.

forms: Pres. pple. (fr. ὀρέγνυμι) ὀρεγνύς Il. 1.351, Il. 22.37.
Mid. 3 sing. aor. ὠρέξατο Il. 5.851, Il. 23.99. ὀρέξατο Il. 7.466, Il. 13.20, 190.
3 pl. pf. ὀρωρέχαται Il. 16.834. 3. pl. plupf. ὀρωρέχατο Il. 11.26.
defs: (1) To hold or stretch out (a hand or the hands) : χεῖρας ὀρεγνύς Il. 1.351, Il. 22.37. Cf. Il. 15.371, Il. 24.743 : Od. 9.527, Od. 12.257, Od. 17.366. So in mid. : ἀνδρὸς παιδοφόνοιο ποτὶ στόμα χεῖρʼ ὀρέγεσθαι Il. 24.506 (but χείρʼ (i.e. χειρί) may be read, bringing the passage under (3)

(2) To hold out, offer for acceptance, bestow, give : θέτις ὤρεξε [δέπας] πιοῦσα (i.e. held it out to return it) Il. 24.102 : αἴ κέν τις κοτύλην καὶ πύρνον ὀρέξῃ Od. 15.312. Cf. Od. 17.407. With immaterial object, to yield, grant, bestow, give : κῦδος Il. 5.33, εὖχος Il. 12.328, τάχος Il. 23.406, etc. : κῦδος Od. 4.275.
(3) In mid.

(b) To make a lunge or thrust. With dat. of the weapon : ὠρέξατʼ ἔγχεϊ Il. 5.851. Cf. Il. 4.307. With this dat. and genit. of the person attacked : ὀρέξατο δουρὶ  Ἕκτορος Il. 13.190. With acc. of part reached : ἔφθη ὀρεξάμενος σκέλος (ὦμον) (app. a construction ad sensum, got his blow in first and struck . . .) Il. 16.314, 322. Cf. Il. 23.805.
Of spears, held out or presented for action : μελίῃσιν Il. 2.543.

forms: dat. pl. of ὄρος + τροφ-, τρέφω.]
defs: Bred in the mountains, mountain-bred. Of lions Il. 12.299, Il. 17.61 : Od. 7.130, Od. 9.292.

etym: [ὀρεσ-, ὄρος + (poss.) a second element conn. with κοῖτος, κεῖμαι.]
defs: Thus, couching in the mountains : φηρσίν Il. 1.268 : αἶγας Od. 9.155.

etym: [comp. fr. ὀρεσ-, ὄρος. Of the mountains (as opposed to the valleys).]
forms: Mountain-bred : δράκων Il. 22.93 : λύκοι ἠδὲ λέοντες Od. 10.212.

defs: A mountainnymph. Defining νύμφη Il. 7.420.
Thus, of oxen, to stretch themselves out, plunge Il. 23.30.
In neut. pl. ὄρθια as adv., in shrill tones : ἤϋσεν Il. 11.11.
(1) Epithet of oxen, with upright horns Il. 8.231, Il. 18.573 : Od. 12.348.
(2) Epithet of ships, with sterns running up into a tall ornamental projection (ἄφλαστον, κόρυμβοκόρυμβον) with tall sterns Il. 18.3, Il. 19.344.

Upright, erect : ἔγχεά σφιν ὄρθʼ ἐλήλατο Il. 10.153. Cf. Il. 24.359. In or to an upright posture, upright, erect : ὀρθῶν ἑσταότων Il. 18.246. Cf. Il. 23.271 = 456 = 657 = 706 = 752 = 801 = 830, Il. 24.11 : Od. 12.51 = 162, 179, Od. 18.241, Od. 21.119. Of sheep Od. 9.442.

To set upright, set on one's legs again Il. 6.272, Il. 23.695. In pass., to stand up, rise up : ὀρθωθεὶς ἔνδυνε χιτῶνα Il. 10.21. To assume from a recumbent a partially upright posture, raise oneself : ἕζετο ὀρθωθείς Il. 2.42, Il. 23.235. Cf. Il. 10.80.

forms: 2 sing. ὤρινας Od. 8.178. ὄρινας Od. 14.361, Od. 15.486.
Pass. 3 sing. aor. ὠρίνθη Il. 16.509. ὀρίνθη Il. 5.29, Il. 16.280, Il. 18.223.
Nom. pl. masc. pple. ὀρινθέντες Od. 22.23.
defs: (1) To put into a state of commotion, stir, agitate, trouble : ὀρινομένη θάλασσα (raised in billows) Il. 2.294. Cf. Il. 9.4, Il. 11.298 : Od. 6.273. To put into violent motion : ῥέεθρα (brought them down in spate) Il. 21.235. With personal object, to throw into confusion or disorder, strike with panic : μνηστῆρας Od. 24.448. In pass., of men, to be thrown into confusion or disorder, be put to disorderly rout, be struck with panic : ὀρινομένους ὑπὸ καπνοῦ Il. 9.243. Cf. Il. 11.521, 525, Il. 14.14= Il. 15.7, Il. 14.59, Il. 16.377 : ὀρινθέντες  κατὰ δῶμα (rushing in confusion) Il. 22.23. Sim. of a single person : σοὶ ὀρινομένῳ κατὰ δῶμα (rushing in your rage) Od. 22.360.

(2) With immaterial object, to stir up, bring about, cause : ὀρυμαγδόν Il. 21.313. Cf. Il. 24.760. In reference to the heart or mind, to stir, rouse, agitate, trouble, touch : θυμόν Il. 2.142. Cf. Il. 5.29, Il. 9.595, Il. 16.509, Il. 24.585, etc. : Od. 4.366, Od. 17.47, 216, Od. 18.75, etc.

etym: [app. neut. of ὅρκιος, adj. fr. ὅρκος.]
defs: (1) In pl., sacrificial victims or other offerings in sanction of an oath, oath-offerings: κήρυκες ἀνὰ ἄστυ θεῶν φέρον ὅρκια (the gods being to be invoked as witnesses) Il. 3.245. Cf. Il. 3.269.
(2) In sing., an oath-sacrifice : οὐχ ἄλιον πέλει ὅρκιον (our . . .) Il. 4.158.
(3) ὅρκια τάμνειν, to make a compact with the sanction of an oath, enter into a solemn treaty or agreementIl. 2.124, Il. 3.73 = 256, Il. 3.94, 105, 252, Il. 4.155, Il. 19.191 : Od. 24.483.
(4) Hence, in pl., a compact, treaty, agreement : συνθεσίαι τε καὶ ὅρκια Il. 2.339. Cf. Il. 3.107, 280, 299, 323, Il. 4.67 = 72, 157, 236, 269, 271, Il. 6.69, 351, 411, Il. 22.262, 266 : Od. 24.546.
(5) In pl., an oath : ὅρκια τοι δώσω Od. 19.302.
(1) Something invoked in sanction of an oath, something by which one swears : ὅ τοι μέγας ἔσσεται ὁ. Il. 1.239. Cf. Il. 2.755, Il. 15.38 := Od. 5.186.
(3) The taking of an oath, swearing : ἀνθρώπους ἐκέκαστο κλεπτοσύνῃ θʼ ὅρκῳ τε (i.e. false swearing) Od. 19.396.

forms: A chain or string of objects Od. 24.8.

defs: (1) To stir up, bring about : πόλεμον Il. 10.28 : Od. 4.146.

(2) To turn over, revolve, ponder, consider, debate, have in contemplation, meditate : ταῦτα Il. 1.193= Il. 11.411= Il. 17.106= Il. 18.15, Il. 10.507. Cf. Il. 10.4 : δολιχὸν πλόον Od. 3.169. Cf. Od. 3.151, Od. 4.120= Od. 5.365 = 424, Od. 4.732, 793, 843, Od. 6.83, Od. 18.345, Od. 23.86. Absol. : ὣς ὁ γέρων ὥρμαινεν Il. 14.20. Cf. Il. 16.435, Il. 21.64, Il. 22.131 : Od. 7.118. With dependent clause. With ἢ . . . ἦ . . . Od. 3.169, Od. 4.789, Od. 15.300, Od. 23.86. With ὅπως Il. 21.137, Il. 24.680. With relative : ὅρμηναν ἅ περ . . . Od. 2.156.
(II) In mid. and pass.
(1) An inciting, urging, starting : ἐμὴν ποτιδέγμενος ὁρμήν (waiting on the word from me) Il. 10.123, θηρὸς ὑφʼ ὁρμῆς (in terror of the beast) Il. 11.119. Cf. Od. 2.403.

(2) A rush, onset, starting : πυρὸς ὁρμῇ (the rage of the . . .) Il. 11.157 : ὑπὸ κύματος ὁρμῆς (the shock of the . . .) Od. 5.320, μελέη μοι ἔσσεται ὁρμή (my endeavour) 416. Sim. : ἐς ὁρμὴν ἔγχεος ἐλθεῖν (that I may come within spear-cast of him) Il. 5.118. In hostile sense, a rush or attack : μόγις μευ ἔκφυγεν ὁρμήν Il. 9.355. A rush to strip a fallen foe Il. 4.466.
In pl., struggles of war, fighting, battling : (ελένης ὁρμήματα (about . . ., for the sake of . . .) Il. 2.356, 590.

forms: To bring (a ship) to anchor, moor (her) Il. 14.77: Od. 3.11, Od. 4.785, Od. 8.55.
To draw up (a ship) on shore Od. 12.317.
A chain worn round the neck Il. 18.401 : Od. 15.460, Od. 18.295.

defs: An anchorage, moorings, a landing-place Il. 1.435 : =  Od. 15.497, Od. 13.101.

forms: Dat. pl. ὀρνίθεσσι Il. 17.757 : Od. 22.303. ὄρνισι Il. 6.59.
defs: (1) A bird Il. 2.459, 764, Il. 3.2, Il. 9.323, etc.: Od. 1.320, Od. 2.181, Od. 5.65, Od. 12.331, Od. 22.303. With a specific name added : ὄρνισιν αἰγυπιοῖσιν Il. 6.59. Cf. Od. 5.51, Od. 19.548.

(2) Distinguished as a bird of omen : ὅ τʼ ἐκ Διὸς ἤλυθεν ὀ. Il. 8.251, ὀ. σφιν ἐπῆλθεν Il. 12.200. Cf. Il. 10.277, Il. 12.218, Il. 13.821 := Od. 15.160 = 525, Od. 2.155, 159, Od. 15.531, Od. 20.242, Od. 24.311. Applied to a person : μή μοι αὺτὴ ὀ. κακὸς πέλευ Il. 24.219.

forms: Infin. ὀρνύμεναι Il. 17.546. ὀρνύμεν Il. 9.353 : Od. 10.22.
defs: (II) In mid., in pf. and plupf. act., and also (Il. 13.78 : Od. 8.539) in redup. aor. act.
(1) To set in motion, stir up, raise, send : ὀρόθυνον ἐναύλους (bring them down in flood) Il. 21.312 : ἀέλλας Od. 5.292.
(2) To rouse, incite to action, spur on, urge on Il. 10.332, Il. 13.351, Il. 15.572, 595 : Od. 18.407.

etym: [ὀρ-, ὁράω. Cf. οὖρος2, ἐπίουρος, θυραωρός, πυλαωρός.]
forms: To keep an eye on something, watch : ἐπὶ δʼ ἀνὴρ ἐσθλὸς ὀρώρει (superintended the work) Il. 23.112 : ἐπὶ δʼ ἀνέρες ἐσθλοὶ ὄροντο (did watchful service) Od. 3.471, ἐπὶ δʼ ἀνέρες ἐσθλοὶ ὄρονται (tend the flocks) Od. 14.104.
This form as ablative Il. 4.452, Il. 11.493.

A mountain or hill : οὔρεα σκιόεντα Il. 1.157, ἀπʼ?̓ιδαίων ὀρέων Il. 8.170. Cf. Il. 2.456, Il. 3.34, Il. 4.452, Il. 12.146, Il. 13.17, etc. : Od. 2.147, Od. 3.287, Od. 5.283, Od. 7.102, Od. 8.569, Od. 11.243, etc.

defs: (1) To rush, speed, spring, dart : ἐς δίφρον ὀρούσας Il. 11.359, 743. Cf. Il. 2.310, Il. 12.83, Od. 3.327, Il. 21.182, Il. 24.80. Of an inanimate object : ἐκ κλῆρος ὄρουσεν (jumped out) Il. 3.325. Of the flight or course of a weapon Il. 13.505= Il. 16.615, Il. 21.593. Of sleep : ἐφʼ ὕπνος ὄρουσεν Il. 23.232. Of the winds Od. 10.47.
(2) In hostile sense, to rush, spring, make onslaught, attack : ἐν πρῶτος ὄρουσεν Il. 11.92, 217. Cf. Il. 14.401, Il. 15.726, Il. 16.258, 430. Of a beast of prey Il. 15.635.
A roof Od. 22.298.

forms: Reeds used for thatching, thatch : ὄροφον ἀμήσαντες Il. 24.451.

defs: A branch : ἐρινεὸν τάμνεν ὄρπηκας (double acc. of whole and part) Il. 21.38.
A back or subsidiary door (in the passages cited app. giving access from the μέγαρον to the λαύρη) Od. 22.126, 132, 333.
Formed by digging : τάφρον Il. 8.179, Il. 9.67, Il. 10.198, Od. 3.49. Cf. Il. 12.72, Il. 15.344, Il. 16.369.

(1) A sound or noise : δρυτόμων ἀνδρῶν Il. 16.633. A noise or din caused by clashing or striking : ὀρυμαγδὸν φιτρῶν καὶ λάων Il. 21.313. Cf. Od. 9.235. In reference to a river, a roaring or rushing Il. 21.256.
(2) Din, noise, shouting, tumult : πολύς Il. 2.810= Il. 8.59, Il. 4.449= Il. 8.63, Il. 10.185 : Od. 24.70.– A din, noise, shouting, tumult : ἀνιηθεὶς ὀρυμαγδῷ Od. 1.133. Cf. Il. 17.424, 741.
(3) The tumult of battle. With the notion of noise obscured : ἐρύεσθαι ὑπὸ Τρώων ὀρυμαγδοῦ (from the hands of the . . .) Il. 9.248. Cf. Il. 10.539, Il. 17.461.
(1) To form by digging, dig : τάφρον Il. 6.341, 440 : Od. 21.120, βόθρον Od. 10.517, Od. 11.25.
(2) To dig up, get out of the ground Od. 10.305.
Orphan, fatherless Il. 7.432, Il. 11.394.–ἦμαρ ὀρφανικόν. See ἦμαρ 4 (j).
Orphan, deprived of one's parents : ἐλίποντο ὀρφαναὶ ἐν μεγάροισιν Od. 20.68.

A leader or chief. Applied to heroes Il. 2.837, Il. 7.99, Il. 14.102, Il. 17.12, etc. : Od. 3.400, Od. 4.156, Od. 10.538, Od. 15.167, etc. To Eumaeus Od. 14.22, 121, Od. 15.351 = 389= Od. 16.36, Od. 17.184. To Philoetius Od. 20.185, 254.
(1) A row : φυτῶν ὄρχατοι Il. 14.123.
A dancer : κοῦροι ὀρχηστῆρες Il. 18.494.

forms: =ὀρχηστήρ. : ὀρχηστήν περ ἐόντα (tauntingly in reference to the agility of Meriones) Il. 16.617. Cf. Il. 24.261.

defs: (1) Dancing, the dance Od. 1.152, 421= Od. 18.304, Od. 17.605
(2) Dancing, skill in the dance : ὅσσον περιγιγνόμεθʼ ἄλλων ὀρχηστυῖ Od. 8.253. Cf. Il. 13.731.
A row (of vines) Od. 6.127, Od. 24.341.

forms: Dat. pl. fem. ᾗς Il. 2.341, etc. ᾗσι Il. 5.54, etc. : Od. 7.272, etc.
defs: (I) Demonstrative pronoun, he, etc. οὐδʼ οἳ ἄναρχοι ἔσαν Il. 2.703. Cf. Il. 7.59, Il. 21.198, etc. : Od. 4.389, 653. Of the second person Il. 6.160.
(II) As relative.
That which is right or permitted. With infin. : οὐδʼ ὁσίη κακὰ ῥάπτειν ἀλλήλοισιν Od. 16.423. Cf. Od. 22.412.

(1) Such in number, quantity or volume as, as many or much as, such as : ὅσοι θεοί εἰσʼ ἐν (ολύμπῳ (all the gods in . . .) Il. 1.566 (θεοί attracted into the relative clause), ὅσοι οὐ βουλῆς ἐπάκουσαν Il. 2.143, ἀγηγέραθʼ ὅσσοι ἄριστοι [ἦσαν] (as many as were . . ., the whole number of the . . .) Il. 4.211. Cf. Il. 2.125, 249 (of all who . . .), 468, 681, Il. 3.57, Il. 5.267, Il. 9.55 (of all the . . .), 401, etc. : Od. 1.11, 278, Od. 2.209, Od. 3.108, 186, 312, Od. 6.68 (of all the women who . . .), Od. 8.36, 214 (in all contests that are practised), Od. 11.329, Od. 12.86, etc. Introducing a simile Od. 4.791. Correlative with τόσος. See τόσος 4. With τοσόσδε. See τοσόσδε 1.
(2) With subj. or opt. in conditional relative sentences. For the examples and constructions see Table at end III.B.a  1 2 (3), (D) (12) (13) (14) (56).

(3) In reference to magnitude or extent, of such magnitude, size, extent or importance as: ὅσον τʼ ἐπὶ λᾶαν ἵησιν (as far as . . .) Il. 3.12, ὅση δύναμίς γε πάρεστιν (as far as my strength goes) Il. 8.294. Cf. Il. 2.616, Il. 6.451, Il. 8.213, Il. 10.351, Il. 17.368, Il. 23.190, etc. : τοῦ ὅσον τʼ ὄργυιαν ἀπέκοψα (i.e. τόσον ὅση ὄργυια γίγνεται) Od. 9.325, ὅσον τʼ ἐπὶ ἥμισυ (i.e. ἐφʼ ὅσον τὸ ἥμισυ γίγνεται) Od. 13.114. Cf. Od. 9.322, Od. 10.113, 517, etc. In reference to stature Il. 2.528. Introducing similes Il. 16.589, Il. 23.431, 845, Il. 24.317. With subj. : ὅσσον τίς τʼ ἔδαφος νηὸς τορνώσεται Od. 5.249. Correlative with τόσος. See τόσος 4.
(4) With infin. in this sense Od. 5.484 (such a thing as might . . .).
(5) In causal sense (= ὅτι τόσος) : κεχολωμένοι ὅσσοι ὄλοντο (because so many . . .) Il. 16.546. Cf. Il. 24.630 : Od. 4.75, Od. 22.46.

(6) In object clauses, how many, who, what, how much, how great : οὐδέ τι οἶδε πένθεος, ὅσσον ὄρωρεν Il. 11.658. Cf. Il. 2.492, etc. : μυθεόμην ὅσʼ ἐμόγησεν Od. 4.152. Cf. Od. 3.105, Od. 4.241, Od. 10.45, etc.
(7) In neut. ὅσ̔σ̓ον as adv.
(b) In reference to distance, as far as : ὅσσον ἀνὴρ ἴδεν Il. 5.770. Cf. Il. 9.354 (and no further), Il. 23.517, etc. : Od. 5.400, Od. 8.229, Od. 16.290, etc. Introducing a simile Il. 23.517.
(c) In object clauses, to how great an extent, how much, how greatly : ὅσσον φέρτερός εἰμι Il. 1.186. Cf. Il. 1.516, etc. : Od. 6.327, Od. 8.102, etc.
(d) Correlative with τόσον. See τόσος 5.d. With τοσόνδε. See τοσόσδε 3.
(1) A rumour or report Od. 1.282, Od. 2.216.
(2) Rumour personified Il. 2.93 : Od. 24.413.
As often as, each time. With opt. in conditional relative sentences (with τοσσάκι as correlative). See Table at end III.B.b  1.
How much. In causal sense : ὁσσάτιον ἀπώλεσε λαὸν Ἀχαιῶν (seeing that he has smitten so much . . .) Il. 5.758.

forms: neut. dual. The eyes, one's eyes : ὄσσε οἱ πυρὶ ἐΐκτην Il. 1.104. Cf. Il. 1.200, Il. 3.427, Il. 4.461, Il. 11.453, Il. 13.3, etc. : Od. 4.186, 704, Od. 5.151, Od. 12.232, Od. 13.401, etc.
In reference to lions : ὄσσε καλύπτων Il. 17.136 : ἔν οἱ ὄσσε δαίεται Od. 7.131.

defs: (1) To look, glance. With quasi-cognate acc. : κάκʼ ὀσσόμενος (looking bale, with baleful look) Il. 1.105.

(2) To look at, look for : ὀσσόμενος πατέρʼ ἐνὶ φρεσίν (keeping his father's image before his mind's eye) Od. 1.115. So Ὀδυσῆα ὀσσομένη Od. 20.81. Of something inanimate : πέλαγος, ὀσσόμενον ἀνέμων κέλευθα (watching for, biding) Il. 14.17.
(3) To bode, portend, betoken : κακὸν ὀσσομένη Il. 24.172. Cf. Od. 2.152.
(4) To bode, forbode, have a presentiment of, apprehend : κάκʼ ὄσσετο θυμός Od. 10.374. Cf. Od. 18.154. Of horses Il. 18.224.

forms: Locative ὀστεόφι Od. 16.145. This form as ablative Od. 14.134.
As genit. (or perh. as instrumental of material; see below) Od. 12.45.

A bone : πέρησεν ὀ. αἰχμή Il. 4.460. Cf. Il. 4.174, Il. 5.67, Il. 6.334, Il. 11.97, Il. 12.185, etc. : πολὺς ἀμφʼ ὀστεόφιν θίς (there is a great heap of bones; or perh., taking ὀστεόφιν as instrumental of material, a heap (is made) of bones) Od. 12.45. Cf. Od. 1.161, Od. 5.426, Od. 9.293, Od. 11.219, Od. 18.96, etc.
In pl., the osseous bodily framework as typifying the body : λίπʼ ὀστέα θυμός Il. 12.386, Il. 16.743, Od. 3.406 : Od. 12.414. Cf. Od. 11.221.
In reference to an animal Od. 3.455.

headword: ὅς τις, ἥ τις, ὅ τι
forms: Nom. sing. masc. ὅτις Il. 3.279, Il. 19.260, etc. : Od. 1.47, Od. 2.350, Od. 5.445, etc. The two elements separated by an enclitic ὅ κέν τις Od. 16.257.
Genit. sing. neut. ὅτευ Od. 17.421, Od. 19.77. ὅττεο Od. 1.124, Od. 22.377. ὅττευ Od. 17.121.
Dat. sing. masc. ὅτεῳ Il. 12.428, Il. 15.664 : Od. 2.114.
Acc. sing. masc. ὅτινα Od. 8.204, Od. 15.395.
Nom. pl. neut. ὅτινα Il. 22.450 (else-where ἅσσα q.v.).
defs: (1) Who, which, with an indefinite force, whoever (whatever) he (it) may be: θεοπρόπιον ὅ τι οἶσθα Il. 1.85, τίπτʼ ἀλᾶσθε, ὅ τι δὴ χρειὼ τόσον ἵκει; (on what account do you wander thus, in respect of which . . .?) Il. 10.142. Cf. Il. 3.286, Il. 5.175, Il. 21.103, Il. 23.43, etc. : ἥ τις σύ πέρ ἐσσι θεάων Od. 4.376. Cf. Od. 2.114, Od. 5.445, Od. 6.150, Od. 8.550, Od. 17.53, etc. With τε Il. 23.43 : Od. 2.114 cited above.
(2) With final force : ὄνομʼ εὕρεο ὅττι κε θῆαι Od. 19.403. Cf. Il. 17.640 : Od. 16.257.

(4) In object clauses, who, what : ὅς κʼ εἴποι ὅ τι τόσσον ἐχώσατο (why) Il. 1.64, ἔσπετε οἵ τινες ἡγεμόνες ἦσαν Il. 2.487. Cf. Il. 3.192, Il. 10.503, Il. 11.612, Il. 14.195, Il. 16.424, etc. : Od. 1.124, 401, Od. 3.16, Od. 4.61, Od. 6.17, Od. 8.28, Od. 22.450, etc.
(1) When, at the time when.
(3) Against the time when : ποτιδέγμενον ἀγγελίην, ὅτʼ ἀποφθιμένοιο πύθηται (waiting for the tidings which shall tell him that . . .) Il. 19.337.

(4) At which time, when : ἔσσεται ἦμαρ ὅτʼ ἄν ποτʼ ὀλώλῃ?̓́ιλιος Il. 4.164. Cf. Il. 2.351, Il. 8.373 (the day will come when . . .), 475, etc. : Od. 18.272. So ἦ οὐ μέμνῃ ὅτε . . . (the time when . . . how . . .) Il. 15.18, Od. 3.188, Il. 21.396 : Od. 24.115.– εἰς ὅτε κε . . . (against the time when . . .) Od. 2.99= Od. 19.144= Od. 24.134.
(5) When, after that, as soon as : ὅτε δὴ σχεδὸν ἦσαν Il. 3.15. Cf. Il. 1.432, 493, Il. 7.191, etc. : Od. 1.332, Od. 3.269, 286, etc.
(6) Since, from the time when : ἐμοὶ χλαῖναι καὶ ῥήγεα ἤχθεθʼ, ὅτε κρήτης ὄρεα νοσφισάμην Od. 19.338. Cf. Il. 21.81, 156 : Od. 24.288.
(7) While : ὅτε δή ῥʼ ἐπὶ νῆʼ ᾔομεν, τόφρα . . . Od. 10.569.
(8) When, whereas : ὅτε τʼ ἄλλοι ἅπαξ θνῄσκουσιν Od. 12.22.
(9) Since, seeing that : ὅτʼ ὀνείδεα βάζεις Od. 17.461. Cf. Od. 13.129.
(10) ὅτε μή without expressed vb., unless, except : ὅτε μὴ διὶ πατρί Il. 16.227.
(11) Written oxytone, ὁτέ. With ἄλλοτε. See ἄλλοτε 2.–ὁτέ alone, at another time, again Il. 16.690, Il. 17.178.

(1) Because, since, seeing that, in that : ὅτι ῥα θνῄσκοντας ὁρᾶτο Il. 1.56. Cf. Il. 2.255, Il. 5.326, Il. 14.407, Il. 16.35, Il. 21.411, etc. : ὅττι μιν ὣς ὑπέδεκτο Od. 14.52. Cf. Od. 5.340, Od. 8.238, Od. 15.342, Od. 22.36, Od. 23.115, etc.
(2) That : οὐδέ μιν ἠγνοίησεν ὅτι . . . Il. 1.537. Cf. Il. 5.349, Il. 7.231, Il. 6.448, etc. : οὐκ ἀΐεις ὅτι . . .; Od. 18.11. Cf. Od. 13.314, Od. 16.131, etc.
(3) Strengthening a superl. See τάχιστα 2.

forms: Quickly, featly, deftly : δεῖπνον ἔθηκας Il. 19.317. Cf. Il. 3.260 : Od. 19.100.
Deft, rendering ready service Il. 1.321, Il. 7.381 : Od. 1.109, Od. 4.23 = 217, Od. 4.38.

defs: A summons : ἄλλην ὀτρυντὺν ποτιδέγμενος Il. 19.234. Cf. Il. 19.235.

forms: Genit. sing. masc. pple. ὀτρύναντος Il. 10.356, Il. 15.744.
defs: (1) To rouse to action, urge on, stir up, set on, encourage, urge, press, incite, exhort, summon, call upon, dispatch, send, to do something or to proceed somewhither for some purpose : ὀτρύνων πόλεμόνδε Il. 2.589, πυμάτας ὤτρυνε φάλαγγας Il. 4.254. Cf. Il. 3.249, Il. 4.73, Il. 10.38 (to play the . . .), 356, Il. 15.59, Il. 19.349, Il. 24.143, etc. : Od. 1.85, Od. 2.74, Od. 7.254, Od. 11.226, Od. 15.37, Od. 17.75, Od. 22.241, Od. 24.405, etc. To rouse or stir (a person's spirit) : ὄτρυνε μένος ἑκάστου Il. 5.470. Cf. Il. 5.563, Il. 12.266, etc. : Od. 8.15. With infin. : ἰέναι Il. 2.94, μάχεσθαι Il. 4.294, ἀνδρῶν δυσμενέων δῦναι στρατόν Il. 10.220. Cf. Il. 5.496, Il. 16.495, Il. 17.654, Il. 23.49, Il. 24.24, etc. : Od. 2.244, Od. 8.90, Od. 9.518, Od. 14.261, Od. 18.61, etc. With fut. pple. : ἀγγελέουσαν Il. 8.398= Il. 11.185. Cf. Il. 19.156 : Od. 15.40.
(2) To hasten on, speed, bring about : πομπήν Od. 6.151, Od. 11.357. Cf. Od. 2.253. To send, cause to appear : εἴδωλον Od. 11.214. To dispatch or send (a message) Od. 16.355.
(3) To press for, urge one's claim to, importune for : πομπήν Od. 8.30.

(4) In mid., to rouse oneself to action, take action, to put oneself in motion, bestir oneself, set oneself, get ready, to do something : ὑμεῖς ὀτρύνεσθαι ἅμʼ ἠοῖ Od. 6.222. With infin. : ὀτρύνοντο νέκυς ἀγέμεν Il. 6.420. Cf. Il. 14.369 : Od. 10.425, Od. 17.183.

forms: Before a vowel οὐκ (οὐχ). Also οὐκί Od. 238, Il. 15.137, etc.: Od. 1.268, Od. 11.493, etc. οὐχί Il. 15.716, Il. 16.762.
Negative particle, commonly denying a predication (cf. μή).
defs: (1) In gen. negation : τὴν οὐ λύσω Il. 1.29. Cf. Il. 1.24, 152, Il. 2.2, 238, etc. : οὐκ οἶδα Od. 1.216. Cf. Od. 1.42, 236, Od. 3.14, Od. 24.29, etc. Repeated Il. 1.114, Il. 23.43, etc. : Od. 3.27, etc. With participles Il. 4.224, Il. 6.185, etc. : Od. 2.50, Od. 11.66, etc. With adjectives, adverbs or adverbial expressions Il. 2.214, Il. 5.366, Il. 8.360, etc. : Od. 2.251, Od. 4.846, Od. 17.153, etc.
(2) Not merely negativing a verb but expressing the opposite meaning. See ἐάω 4, ἐθέλω 3, φημί 6.
(3) In protasis with εἰ.
(4) In conditional  relative sentences (cf. μή 8).
(5) After μή (cf. οὐδέ 6, οὐκέτι 3) : μὴ χόλον οὐκ ἐρύσαιτο Il. 24.584. Cf. Il. 1.28, 566, Il. 10.39.
(6) With infin. after vbs. of saying, thinking, etc. : ἅ τινʼ οὐ πείσεσθαι ὀΐω Il. 1.289. Cf. Il. 17.174, etc. : Od. 3.28, Od. 5.342, etc.
(8) With other particles.

forms: Dat. pl. οὔασι Il. 12.442. ὠσί Od. 12.200.
defs: (2) An ear or handle of a drinking vessel (cf. ὠτώεις) Il. 11.633. Of a tripod Il. 18.378.

(1) The surface of the earth, the earth, the ground : ὕπτιος οὔδει ἐρείσθη Il. 6.145. Cf. Il. 11.749, Il. 12.448, Il. 14.468, Il. 16.612, Il. 23.283, etc. : Od. 8.376, Od. 9.135, 242, 459, Od. 13.395, Od. 22.269, 467.
(2) A floor or pavement : πέπλον κατέχευεν πατρὸς ἐπʼ οὔδει Il. 5.734= Il. 8.385. Cf. Il. 24.527 : Od. 23.46.

forms: To the ground : οὐ. πελάσσαι Od. 10.440. Cf. Il. 17.457.
Negative particle, in general use corresponding to οὐ as μηδέ to μή.
defs: (1) Adversatively, but not, yet not (cf. δέ 1) : βάλεν, οὐδʼ ἔρρηξεν χαλκός Il. 3.348. Cf. Il. 2.419, 753, Il. 3.302, Il. 4.127, 477, Il. 5.621, etc. : Od. 2.182, Od. 3.143, Od. 4.675, Od. 5.81, Od. 8.344, Od. 9.230, etc.
(2) In continuation, and not, nor (cf. δέ 2) : δ̀ν ἠτίμησʼ Ἀγαμέμνων, οὐδʼ ἀπέλυσε θύγατρα Il. 1.95. Cf. Il. 1.97, 170, 173, 220, 330, 406, etc. : Od. 1.166, 296, 410, Od. 2.36, 82, 203, 296, etc.

(3) Preceded by a negative, nor (sometimes rather to be translated or) : οὐ δέμας οὐδὲ φυήν Il. 1.115. Cf. Il. 1.132, 154, 155, 160, 181, 262, etc. : οὔ τι νοήμονες οὐδὲ δίκαιοι Od. 2.282. Cf. Od. 2.44, 63, 185, 210, 270, Od. 4.201, 240, Od. 7.201, etc.
