Il. 1.241, μινυνθάδιόν περ ἐόντα (short-lived though I be) 352, σύ πέρ μιν τεῖσον (since Agamemnon will not) 508, ἀνάσχεο κηδομένη περ 586. Cf. Il. 1.546, Il. 2.246, Il. 3.159, Il. 5.94, Il. 9.301 (if not him), Il. 14.375, Il. 21.185, etc. : ἱέμενός περ Od. 1.6. Cf. Od. 1.288, 309, Od. 2.249, Od. 5.209, Od. 7.136, Od. 9.57, Od. 11.111, etc.– For καὶ . . . περ, καί περ see καί 6. With ἔμπης. See ἔμπης 4.

forms: To convey across; in pass., to pass over, cross, the sea : μὴ φθέωσι περαιωθέντες Od. 24.437.
Thus, the passage of night, the space which darkness traverses in the course of a night Od. 23.243.
3 sing. pa. iterative περάασκε Od. 5.480, Od. 19.442.
Fut. infin. περήσειν Il. 5.646. περησέμεναι Il. 12.200, 218.
3 sing. aor. ἐπέρησε Il. 5.291, Il. 21.594. πέρησε Il. 4.460, 502, Il. 7.10.
defs: (1) To pass, make one's or its way : ἐπὶ πόντον Il. 2.613, διὰ κροτάφοιο πέρησεν αἰχμή Il. 4.502. Cf. Il. 16.367 : Od. 4.709, Od. 5.176, Od. 10.508.

(2) To cross, get to the other side of (an obstacle) : τάφρος, οὐ περῆσαι ῥηϊδίη Il. 12.53. Cf. Il. 12.63, 200, 218, Il. 21.283 : Od. 11.158. To traverse, make one's way over the surface of or across : λαῖτμα θαλάσσης Od. 5.174. Cf. Od. 7.272, Od. 9.129, Od. 24.118.

(3) To pass into or through, penetrate : πέρησεν ὀστέον εἴσω αἰχμή Il. 4.460=Il. 7.10. Cf. Il. 5.291 : Od. 5.480, Od. 19.442. Absol. Il. 21.594. To pass through (an opening) : πύλας Ἀΐδαο Il. 5.646, Il. 23.71.

forms: To sell into slavery : λῆμνόν μιν ἐπέρασσεν (to one dwelling in Lemnos) Il. 21.40. Cf. Il. 21.58, 78, 102, 454 : Od. 14.297, Od. 15.387, 428, 453.
Beyond, on or to the other side of.
With genit. : οἳ ναίουσι πέρην εὐβοίης Il. 2.535 (i.e. to one looking from Asia; by others taken as over against). Cf. Il. 2.626, Il. 24.752.
3 sing. ἔπερσε Od. 1.2. πέρσε Il. 7.415, Il. 11.625, Il. 19.296, Od. 3.92.
Non-thematic aor. infin. πέρθαι (for πέρθ-ς-σθαι) Il. 16.708.
defs: To sack or ravage (a town) : πέρσας ἄστεα πολλά Il. 2.660. Cf. Il. 2.374, Il. 7.415, Il. 12.15, Il. 16.57, Il. 18.342, Il. 19.296, etc. : Od. 1.2, Od. 5.107, Od. 9.40, Od. 14.241.

forms: (Commonly with anastrophe when immediately following the vb. or case-form or beginning a sentence. Also often written πέρι in sense I.3.)
defs: (I) Adv.
(II) Prep.

forms: In pass., of sound, to break about one, echo round : Ἕκτορος [ὂψ] περιάγνυται Il. 16.78.
To bestride and protect a fallen friend (cf. βαίνω I.6.a) : θέων περίβη Il. 8.331=Il. 13.420. Cf. Il. 14.424.
With dat. : πατρόκλῳ Il. 17.80. Cf. Il. 17.313.

defs: (1) To throw round. With genit. : πεῖσμα περίβαλλε θόλοιο Od. 22.466. In mid., to put about oneself, put on : περιβαλλομένους τεύχεα Od. 22.148.
(2) To excel, be pre-eminent, be first : ὅσσον ἐμοὶ ἀρετῇ περιβάλλετον ἵπποι Il. 23.276. To excel, outrival, surpass : περιβάλλει ἅπαντας μνηστῆρας δώροισιν Od. 15.17.

forms: With genit.: ὅσσον περιγιγνόμεθʼ ἄλλων Od. 8.102=252.
To prove superior to, get the better of, beat.
With genit. : μήτι ἡνίοχος περιγίγνεται ἡνιόχοιο Il. 23.318.

defs: Overflowing with milk : πέλλας Il. 16.642.

forms: To round (a promontory) : περιγνάμπτοντα μάλειαν Od. 9.80.
pf. with pres. sense Il. 10.93, Il. 13.52, Il. 17.240, 242
Nom. pl. masc. pple. περιδείσαντες Il. 23.822.
Nom. sing. fem. περιδείσασα Il. 15.123, Il. 21.328.
defs: (1) To be greatly afraid Il. 13.52.
(2) To feel fear on account of, fear for. With genit. : Δαναῶν Il. 10.93. Cf. Il. 17.240. With dat. : ἐμῇ κεφαλῇ Il. 17.242. Cf. Il. 11.508, Il. 15.123, Il. 21.328, Il. 23.822.

etym: [περι- (with what force is not clear) + δίδωμι.]
forms: With genit. of what is staked or hazarded : ἐμέθεν περιδώσομαι αὐτῆς Od. 23.78. Cf. Od. 23.485.

defs: (1) Running round, set round, surrounding : ἄντυγες Il. 5.728.
(2) Running round, rotating : πλῆμναι Il. 5.726.
(3) Such as one can run round, standing apart : κολώνη Il. 2.812 : αὐλή (i.e. with a cleared space round it) Od. 14.7.
To tear all round, lacerate : ἀγκῶνας περιδρύφθη (had his elbows all torn) Il. 23.395.

forms: App., to strip off from round one : χιτῶνας Il. 11.100.
To be superior to, excel, surpass.
With genit. : εἴ τι γυναικῶν ἀλλάων περίειμι νόον Od. 19.326. Cf. Od. 18.248.
In mid., to throw one's arms round; hence, to protect, come to the aid of.

defs: To ring all round : περιήχησε χαλκός Il. 6.267.

forms: To take one's stand round about : περίστησαν ἑταῖροι Il. 4.532.
In pass., of an arching wave, to remain stationary round something, enfold it, cover it from view : κῦμα περιστάθη κυρτωθέν Od. 11.243.
In mid. and non-sigmatic aor., to stand round, surround.
With acc.: μή με περιστήωσιν Il. 17.95, πολλὸς χορὸν περιίσταθʼ ὅμιλος Il. 18.603 : εἴ περ πεντήκοντα λόχοι νῶϊ περισταῖεν Od. 20.50.
So in mid. in sigmatic aor. : βοῦν περιστήσαντο Il. 2.410. Cf. Od. 12.356.
(Like καλός often used merely as a more or less conventional epithet.)
defs: (1) In reference to personal beauty.
(b) Of parts of the body, fair, lovely, beauteous, goodly : δειρήν Il. 3.396 : ὄσσε Od. 13.401, 433.

(2) Of things of use, buildings, constructions, etc., well-made, well-constructed, fair, goodly, fine, beauteous, or the like : φόρμιγγος Il. 1.603, δίφρον Il. 3.262, δόμον Il. 3.421. Cf. Il. 7.321, Il. 8.238, Il. 11.632, Il. 23.897, Il. 24.229, etc. : αὐλῆς Od. 1.425, στειλειόν Od. 5.236, χηλόν Od. 8.438. Cf. Od. 1.153, Od. 3.481, Od. 10.347, Od. 13.149, Od. 17.343, Od. 22.438, etc.

(3) In various applications as an epithet of general commendation, fair, goodly, fine, or the like : φηγῷ Il. 5.693, τέμενος Il. 9.578 : ἔργα Od. 2.117=Od. 6.111, λίμνην Od. 3.1, ποταμοῖο ῥόον Od. 7.85, ἀγρούς Od. 14.263=Od. 17.432. Of light, fair, bright : φάος Od. 19.34.
(1) To be set about, enclose, cover. With dat. : γωρυτῷ, ὃς τόξῳ περίκειτο Od. 21.54. So, to lie upon and embrace : πατρόκλῳ Il. 19.4.
(2) To be laid up for one in excess of others, i.e. to remain as profit : οὐδέ τί μοι περίκειται (it profits me nothing) Il. 9.321.

forms: In mid., to be solicitous for the welfare or good of, care for, take thought for.
With genit. : Ὀδυσσῆος Od. 3.219, βιότου Od. 14.527.
Very dry : δένδρεα Od. 5.240, ξύλα Od. 18.309.

defs: (1) Famed, famous, renowned. Epithet of persons : υἱόν Il. 18.326 : ἀοιδός Od. 1.325, Od. 8.83 = 367 = 521. With a proper name : Ἄντιφος Il. 11.104. Of towns : μυρμιδόνων ἄστυ Od. 4.9, ἄστυ Od. 16.170, Od. 24.154. Of Hephaestus Il. 1.607, Il. 18.383, 393 = 462, 587, 590 : Od. 8.287, 300, 349, 357, Od. 24.75.
(2) Epithet of things, fine, splendid, noble : ἔργα Il. 7.324, δῶρα Il. 6.299, Il. 9.121, Il. 18.449.

forms: Dwelling round about : ἀνθρώπους Od. 2.65. Cf. Il. 17.220.
Absol., the dwellers round about : πάντεσσι περικτιόνεσσιν ἀνάξει (ἀνάξειν) Il. 19.104, 109. Cf. Il. 18.212.
Absol. : τὴν πάντες μνώοντο περικτίται Od. 11.288.

defs: To quest round. With acc. : σκόπελον Od. 12.95.
Very long : ἱστόν (consisting of long threads) Od. 2.95=Od. 24.130, Od. 19.140.

forms: Of great height, lofty : ἐλάτην Il. 14.287 : τηΰγετον Od. 7.103.

defs: (1) Of great length, long : κοντόν Od. 9.487. Cf. Od. 10.293, Od. 12.90, 251, 443.
(2) Of great height, lofty : πέτρης Il. 13.63. Cf. Od. 13.183. Of great upward size, standing high : ἱστοὶ λίθεοι Od. 13.107.

forms: To contrive (something) in regard to someone or to someone's prejudice : ἄλλο τόδε θεοὶ περιμηχανόωνται Od. 6.200.
To contrive (something) in regard to or to the prejudice of.
With dat. : δούλιον ἦμαρ ἐμοὶ περιμηχανόωντο Od. 14.340.
The dwellers round about : κεῖνον π. πείρουσιν Il. 24.488.
To dwell round about : οἳ κατὰ ἄστυ [εἰσὶ] καὶ οἳ περιναιετάουσιν Od. 8.551. Cf. Od. 2.66, Od. 23.136.
Of cities, by a sort of personification, to have their place or lie round about : μίαν πόλιν, [τάων] αἳ περιναιετάουσιν Od. 4.177.

defs: Highly polished, very smooth Od. 12.79.
(1) To have great skill, be highly skilled : ἴχνεσι περιῄδη Od. 17.317. With infin. : νοῆσαι Il. 10.247.
(2) To have greater skill than, excel, surpass. With genit. : καὶ βουλῇ περιίδμεναι ἄλλων Il. 13.728.
(1) To be round about, encircle, compass about. With acc. : ἄστυ Il. 18.220.
(2) In aor. pple. of the revolving year (cf. περιτέλλομαι) : πέντε περιπλομένους ἐνιαυτούς Il. 23.833. Cf. Od. 1.16, Od. 11.248.
Exceeding sharp, piercing Il. 11.845.

forms: In pass. with dat., to put one's arms round, grasp in one's arms : ἱστῷ περιπλεχθείς Od. 14.313.

defs: Having many inhabitants, populous : νῆσος Od. 15.405.
Ever forward, with constant rush : ἔγχεϊ θῦεν Il. 11.180, Il. 16.699.
In pass., fig., of passion, to come upon one, invade the mind : ἔρος περιπροχυθείς Il. 14.316.

forms: With acc. : μοχλὸν αἷμα περίρρεεν Od. 9.388.

defs: Thus, doubled round, sprawling over. With dat. : τραπέζῃ Od. 22.84.
Flowed round (by the sea), sea-girt : κρήτη Od. 19.173.
To be exceeding strong : μή με περισθενέων δηλήσεται (in his might) Od. 22.368.
Exposed to view from every side, open, clear (cf. περιφαίνομαι 2) : χώρῳ Od. 1.426, Od. 10.211 = 253, Od. 14.6.

forms: Of animals, to move about a person and fawn upon him Od. 10.215, Od. 16.10.
To move about and fawn upon.
With acc. : τηλέμαχον περίσσαινον κύνες Od. 16.4.
In pass., to wave or float about something : περισσείοντʼ ἔθειραι Il. 19.382, Il. 22.315.

defs: Standing round : τρῶες π. οὔταζον σάκος Il. 13.551.
To walk or pace round. With acc. : κοῖλον λόχον Od. 4.277.
To dress or lay out (a corpse) : οὐδέ ἑ μήτηρ κλαῦσε περιστείλασα Od. 24.293.

forms: With dat. : δῶμα περιστεναχίζεται αὐλῆ Od. 10.10. Cf. Od. 23.146.

defs: In pass., to be glutted : περιστένεται γαστήρ Il. 16.163.

forms: To enwreathe, cover up : νεφέεσσι περιστέφει οὐρανὸν Ζεύς Od. 5.303.

defs: To whirl round (before a throw) Il. 19.131 : Od. 8.189.

forms: To surround and cut off (cattle) in order to make booty of them (cf. τάμνω 9).
In pple. of the revolving year (cf. περιπέλομαι 2, περιτροπέω 2) : περιτελλομένων ἐνιαυτῶν Il. 2.551. Cf. Il. 8.404 = 418 : Od. 11.295 = Od. 14.294.

defs: To put about. Fig., to endow (one) with. With dat. : αὶ γὰρ ἐμοὶ θεοὶ δύναμιν περιθεῖεν Od. 3.205.

forms: In pass., to become curdled, curdle : ὦκα [γάλα] περιτρέφεται Il. 5.903.
Of ice, to be deposited, grow thick, about.
With dat. : σακέεσσι περιτρέφετο κρύσταλλος Od. 14.477.

defs: To run up and stand round Il. 22.369.
To flee on all sides : λαοὶ περίτρεσαν Il. 11.676.

forms: To tremble or quiver round or about.
With dat., in mid. : σάρκες περιτρομέοντο μέλεσσιν Od. 18.77.

defs: (1) To surround and drive (into a compact flock) : μῆλα Od. 9.465.
(2) In pple. of the revolving year (cf. περιτέλλομαι): εἴνατος περιτροπέων ἐνιαυτός Il. 2.295.
Round, circular : σῆμα Il. 23.455.
(1) Seen from all round, conspicuous : ὄρεος περιφαινομένοιο Il. 13.179.
(2) = περίσκεπτος. Absol. : ἐν περιφαινομένῳ (in, bordering upon, a clearing) Od. 5.476.
With great care, carefully : ὤπτησαν Il. 1.466 = Il. 2.429 = Il. 6.318 = Il. 24.624 : = Od. 14.431, Od. 19.423.

forms: To take counsel concerning (something), devise, contrive : περιφραζώμεθα νόστον Od. 1.76.
Of great good sense, wise, sage, prudent. Epithet of women. Of Aegialeia Il. 5.412.
Of Penelope Od. 1.329, Od. 4.787, Od. 5.216, Od. 14.373, etc.
To grow round; hence, to throw one's arms round a person, embrace him : τηλέμαχον κύσεν περιφύς Od. 16.21. Cf. Od. 24.320.
To throw one's arms round, embrace.
With acc. : κύσσαι καὶ περιφῦναι ἑὸν πατέρα Od. 24.236.
3 sing. aor. περίχευε Od. 3.437, Od. 6.140, Od. 23.162.
3 sing. aor. subj. mid. περιχεύεται Od. 7.232, Od. 23.159.
defs: (1) To shed or spread something round or over another thing : χέραδος περιχεύας Il. 21.319. To shed round. With dat. : ἠέῤ, ἥν οἱ περίχευεν Ἀθήνη Od. 6.140. So of something immaterial : τῷ περίχευε χάριν Od. 23.162.

(2) To spread round, put round as a covering or adornment. With dat. : χρυσὸν κέρασιν περιχεύας Il. 10.294 : = Od. 3.384. Cf. Od. 3.426, 437. So of spreading one metal on the ground of another in, app., some process of enamel : ὡς ὅτε τις χρυσὸν περιχεύεται ἀργύρῳ Od. 7.232 = Od. 23.159.
To be angered or wroth, conceive anger or wrath, about or on account of. With genit. : παλλακίδος μοι περιχώσατο Il. 9.449. Cf. Il. 14.266.
A spot commanding a view on all sides, a look-out place : ἀνήϊον ἐς περιωπήν Od. 10.146. Cf. Il. 14.8, Il. 23.451.

forms: In neut. sing. περιώσιον as adv., beyond measure : θαυμάζειν Od. 16.203. Cf. Il. 4.359.
App., dappled, spotted with dark : αἰετόν, δ̀ν καὶ περκνὸν καλέουσιν Il. 24.316.
To export for sale, sell to foreign buyers : πολλὰ φρυγίην κτήματα περνάμενʼ  ἵκει Il. 18.292.
To sell into slavery : περνὰς νήσων ἔπι τηλεδαπάων Il. 22.45. Cf. Il. 24.752.

defs: (1) To pierce, transfix Il. 6.145, Il. 13.397.
(2) In mid., to fasten (a garment) about one with a περόνη (or ἐνετή) : ἐνετῇσι κατὰ στῆθος περονᾶτο [ἑανόν] Il. 14.180. Cf. Il. 10.133.
Something for piercing; a clasp, buckle, or brooch for fastening a garment about one. In connexion with a woman's dress Il. 5.425 : Od. 18.293. With a man's Od. 19.226, 256.

forms: acc. sing. masc. pres. pple. περάω1.

defs: A pebble or man used in playing a game the rules of which are unknown : πεσσοῖσι θυμὸν ἔτερπον Od. 1.107.
(1) To ripen, bring to maturity Od. 6.119.

(2) To digest. Fig. : γέρα πεσσέμεν (to brood over them, enjoy them) Il. 2.237, χόλον πέσσει (πέσσων) (nurses (nursing) it, keeps (keeping) it warm) Il. 4.513, Il. 9.565, ὥς τις βέλος πέσσῃ (may hug his wound) Il. 8.513, κήδεα πέσσει (πέσσω) (broods (brood) upon them, dwells (dwell) upon them) Il. 24.617, 639.

forms: 3 pl. πέτασαν Od. 7.94. πέτασσαν Il. 1.480 : Od. 4.783, Od. 8.54.
Nom. pl. fem. pple. πετασθεῖσαι Il. 21.538.
Acc. pl. fem. pple. πεπταμένας Il. 21.531.
defs: (1) To spread, spread out, spread wide : ἀνʼ ἱστία πέτασσαν Il. 1.480. Cf. Il. 4.523 = Il. 13.549, Il. 5.195, Il. 8.441, Il. 14.495, Il. 21.115 : ὑπό λῖτα πετάσσας Od. 1.130. Cf. Od. 4.783, Od. 5.269, 374, Od. 7.94, Od. 8.54, Od. 9.417, Od. 10.506, Od. 24.397. Fig., app., to flutter or set agog : θυμὸν μνηστήρων Od. 18.160.
(2) Of a gate or door, to open, throw open, open wide : πεπταμένας πύλας ἔχετε Il. 21.531. Cf. Il. 21.538 : Od. 21.50.
(3) In pass., of clear sky, to be outspread over something : αἴθρη πέπταται Od. 7.45. Of light, to be shed, play : πέπτατʼ αὐγὴ ἠελίου Il. 17.371.
(1) Able to fly, fledged Od. 16.218. Winged. Epithet of birds Il. 2.459, Il. 15.690.
(2) Absol., in neut. pl., winged creatures, birds : αἰετόν, τελειότατον πετεηνῶν Il. 8.247 = Il. 24.315. Cf. Il. 15.238, Il. 17.675, Il. 21.253, Il. 22.139 : Od. 13.87.

forms: 3 sing. subj. πτῆται (app. for πτάεται) Il. 15.170.
Pple. fem. πταμένη Il. 5.282, Il. 16.856, Il. 22.362.
(ἀπο-, δια-, εἰσ-, ἐπι-, ὑπερ-) To fly.
defs: (1) Of winged creatures : βοτρυδὸν [μέλισσαι] πέτονται Il. 2.89, κλαγγῇ γέρανοι πέτονται Il. 3.5. Cf. Il. 12.207 (flew off), Il. 13.62, Il. 16.265 : Od. 2.147, 148, Od. 15.531.

(2) Of the flight through the air of divine horses Il. 5.366 = Il. 8.45, Il. 5.768. Of gods Il. 15.150. Of the flight of Poseidon's horses on the water Il. 13.29. Of rapid motion of mortal horses Il. 10.530, Il. 15.684, Il. 16.149, Il. 23.381, etc. : Od. 3.484 = 494 = Od. 15.192.
(3) Of the flight of the soul of men, etc., from the body : ψυχὴ ἐκ ῥεθέων πταμένη Il. 16.856 = Il. 22.362. Cf. Il. 23.880, Il. 16.469 : = Od. 10.163 = Od. 19.454.

(4) Of rapid motion of men : ἐμμεμαὼς ἰθὺς πέτετο Il. 22.143. Cf. Il. 13.755, Il. 21.247, Il. 22.198, Il. 24.345 : = Od. 5.49, Od. 8.122. Sim. : τρίς μοι ἐκ χειρῶν ἔπτατο [μητρὸς ψυχή] Hom. Od. 11.208.
(5) Of an arrow or a thrown spear : διὰ δʼ ἔπτατʼ ὀϊστός Il. 5.99, τῆς διαπρὸ αἰχμὴ πταμένη 282. Cf. Il. 13.587, 592, Od. 3.99. Sim. of a καλαῦροψ Od. 23.846.
(6) Of other inanimate things : [ὀλοοίτροχος] πέτεται Il. 13.140. Cf. Il. 15.170 : Od. 12.203, Od. 24.534.
That dwells in a rock : σκύλλην Od. 12.231.

(1) A rock or cliff on land or in or bordering upon the sea : πέτρης ἐκ γλαφυρῆς Il. 2.88. Cf. Il. 2.617, Il. 4.107, Il. 9.15, Il. 13.137, Il. 24.614, etc. : πέτρης ἐκ πείσματα δήσας Od. 10.96. Cf. Od. 3.293, Od. 4.501, Od. 5.443, Od. 8.508, Od. 12.59, 241, Od. 13.408, Od. 23.327, etc.
(2) The rock forming the walls of a cave : περὶ δʼ ἴαχε πέτρη Od. 9.395, ὁρμαθοῦ ἐκ πέτρης (attached at each end to the walls) Od. 24.8.
(3) A large detached mass of stone, a rock : κατερχομένης ὑπὸ πέτρης Od. 9.484 = 541. Cf. Od. 9.243.
(4) For οὐκ ἀπὸ δρυὸς οὐδʼ ἀπὸ πέτρης see δρῦς 3.
Rocky, rugged : νῆσος Od. 4.844–Epithet of places Il. 2.496, 519, 640, Il. 9.405.
A stone : βάλε πέτρῳ Il. 16.411. Cf. Il. 6.270, Il. 16.734, Od. 3.288.

forms: 3 sing. aor. opt. πεπύθοιτο Il. 7.50, Il. 10.381, Il. 11.135.
3 sing. plupf. ἐπέπυστο Il. 13.674. πέπυστο Il. 13.521, Il. 22.437.
defs: (1) To hear. Absol. or with object : σιγῇ, ἵνα μὴ τρῶές γε πύθωνται Il. 6.195, Διὸς κτύπον Il. 15.379. Cf. Il. 5.351, Il. 10.207, Il. 18.530 : Od. 1.157 = Od. 4.70 = Od. 17.592, Od. 10.147, Od. 19.486, Od. 23.40. In reference to a report or rumour : πεύθετο κύπρονδε μέγα κλέος Il. 11.21 (i.e. the report came as far as to Cyprus). To overhear : βουλάς Od. 4.677 = Od. 16.412. With genit., to hear : σῆς βοῆς Il. 7.465. Cf. Il. 15.224. So in reference to tidings : λυγρῆς ἀγγελίης Il. 17.641, 685, Il. 18.19. Cf. Od. 2.256.

(2) To hear of, learn of, come to know of or about, something. Absol. or with object  (sometimes with complementary adj. or pple.) : καὶ ἐσσομένοισι πυθέσθαι Il. 2.119, Il. 22.305, εἴ κεν ἐμὲ ζωὸν πεπύθοιτο Il. 7.50 = Il. 10.381, κλέα ἀνδρῶν Il. 9.524. Cf. Il. 5.702, Il. 11.135, Il. 13.674, Il. 19.322 (the object in 326), Od. 3.129 : νῦν δὲ πυνθάνομαι (learn the story, am getting to realize what is going on) Od. 2.315, ὅσσα πεύθομαι (what I hear from time to time) Od. 3.187, εἰ πυθόμην ταύτην ὁδὸν ὁρμαίνοντα Od. 4.732. Cf. Od. 2.31, 43, 411 (knows nothing of the matter), Od. 4.494, Od. 11.76, Od. 16.134, Od. 17.158, Od. 21.255, Od. 23.262, Od. 24.433. With genit. of the person about whom something is heard : οὔ πω πεπύσθην πατρόκλοιο θανόντος Il. 17.377. Cf. Il. 1.257, Il. 13.521, Il. 17.102, 427, Il. 19.322, 337, Il. 22.437 : Od. 8.12, Od. 11.494, 505, Od. 14.321, Od. 17.510. With genit. of the person from whom something is heard : τό γε μητρὸς ἐπεύθετο Il. 17.408. With genit. of a thing heard about : Ἰθάκης Od. 13.256. With clause : ὅτι . . . Il. 24.592.

(3) To have heard, have learned, know (cf. ἀκούω 5) : οὐδέ πω  Ἕκτωρ πεύθετο Il. 11.498. With acc. of the person or thing known about : πεύθετο οὗ παιδὸς ὄλεθρον Od. 16.411. With acc. and clause : ἄλλους πάντας πεύθομεθα, ἧχι . . . Od. 3.87.

(4) To find out about something, seek or get information about it. Absol. or with object : ταῦτα πάντα Il. 10.211, νηῶν σχεδὸν ἐλθέμεν ἔκ τε πυθέσθαι (to get what information I can) Il. 10.320. Cf. Od. 1.94, Od. 2.215, 264, 360, Od. 4.713, Od. 10.152 (spy out the land), 155, Od. 13.335, 415, Od. 15.377. With genit. of the person about whom something is to be found out : πατρὸς δὴν οἰχομένοιο Od. 1.281. Cf. Od. 3.15, Od. 15.270. With genit. of the person from whom something is to be found out : πρὶν τειρεσίαο πυθέσθαι (before getting directions from . . .) Od. 10.537 = Od. 11.50 = 89. With clause : ἠὲ . . . ἦ . . . Il. 10.308, 395. Cf. Il. 11.649: Od. 4.713, Od. 9.88  =  Od. 10.100.
Wise, shrewd, astute : φρεσίν Il. 8.366, Il. 14.165, Il. 15.81, Od. 3.35.

etym: [πευκ-, sharp, prob. conn. with pug-, pungo. Cf. ἐχεπευκής, περιπευκής, πικρός.]
defs: Sharp, piercing. Epithet of war Il. 10.8.
A pine-tree Il. 11.494. A felled pine or a piece thereof : ξύλον πεύκης Il. 23.328.

forms: acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. pass. φαίνω.
nom. pl. masc. pf. pple. φεύγω.
acc. pl. masc. pf. pple. φύω.

defs: (2) At what point? where ? πῇ μέμονας καταδῦναι ὅμιλον; Il. 13.307.
(3) In what way ? how? πῇ κέν τις ὑπεκφύγοι ὄλεθρον; Od. 12.287. Cf. Od. 2.364.
(1) Somewhither : ἠέ πῃ ἐκπέμπεις κειμήλια Il. 24.381. Cf. Il. 3.400, Il. 7.378. With neg., nowhither, not anywhither : πέμψω μιν οὔ πῃ Od. 5.140. Cf. Il. 7.383 : Od. 2.127 = Od. 18.288.

(2) In some region, somewhere : ἀλλά πῃ ἄλλῃ πλάζετο Od. 3.251. With neg., nowhere, not anywhere : ἔκβασις οὔ πῃ φαίνεται Od. 5.410. Cf. Il. 13.191, Il. 17.643, Il. 23.463 : Od. 12.232, Od. 13.207, Od. 22.140.
(3) In some wise, somehow : οὕτω πῃ τάδε γʼ ἐστίν Il. 24.373. With neg., in no wise, not in any wise : οὐδέ πῃ ἔστι . . . Il. 7.267. Cf. Il. 16.110, Il. 21.219, Il. 24.71 : Od. 12.433.
(1) The head waters of a river, a spring : ἔνθα πηγαὶ δοιαὶ ἀναΐσσουσι σκαμάνδρου Il. 22.147. Cf. Il. 21.312, Od. 3.9 : = Od. 7.124.
(2) In pl., the waters of a river, its streams : πηγῇς ἔπι κηφισοῖο Il. 2.523. Cf. Il. 23.148.

etym: [πηγεσι-, πήγνυμι + μαλλός, a lock of wool.]

defs: (1) To set firmly, fix, stick : κεφαλὴν ἀνὰ σκολόπεσσιν Il. 18.177. Cf. Od. 11.77, 129, Od. 12.15, Od. 23.276. To stick (a spear) in the earth when not in use. In pf. in pass. sense : παρʼ ἔγχεα πέπηγεν Il. 3.135.
(2) To set or direct (the countenance) : κατὰ χθόνος ὄμματα πήξας Il. 3.217.

(3) To stick, plunge, plant (a spear) into a foe or his shield, send (an arrow) into him (in pass. sense in plupf.) : μεταφρένῳ ἐν δόρυ πῆξεν Il. 5.40, δόρυ ἐν κραδίῃ ἐπεπήγει Il. 13.442. Cf. Il. 4.185, 460, 528, Il. 5.616, Il. 8.298, Il. 13.372, etc.: Od. 22.83. In pass. and plupf., of a spent spear or arrow, to be stuck (in the earth), enter (it) and remain standing : ἐν γαίῃ ἐπάγη Il. 10.374, Il. 22.276. Cf. Il. 23.877. So without mention of the earth : πολλὰ κεβριόνην ἀμφὶ δοῦρα πεπήγει Il. 16.772, ταρβήσας ὅ οἱ ἄγχι πάγη βέλος Od. 3.283.
(4) In pass., of the limbs, to be deprived of the power of movement, become stiffened : νέρθε γοῦνα πήγνυται Il. 22.453.
(5) To put together, construct, build : νῆας Il. 2.664 : ἴκρια Od. 5.163.
Of horses, of compact bodily frame, stout Il. 9.124 = 266. Of the wave of the sea, big, mighty Od. 5.388, Od. 23.235.
A steering-oar : π. μετὰ χερσὶ νηὸς ἔχοντα Od. 3.281. Cf. Od. 5.255, 270, 315, Od. 8.558.
To spring, bound, leap : ὑψόσε ποσσὶν ἐπήδα Il. 21.269. Cf. Il. 21.302. Of a dart Il. 14.455.
An aor : ἀναρρίπτειν ἅλα πηδῷ Od. 6.328, Od. 13.78.
Put together, the work of man's hands. Epithet of a work of mechanical skill : ἄροτρον Il. 10.353, Il. 13.703 : Od. 13.32.

(1) Bane, mischief, destruction, evil, woe, misery : κατένευσε κρονίων Δαναοῖσι π. Il. 8.176. Cf. Il. 11.347, 413, Il. 15.110, Il. 17.688 : ὅπως ἔτι π. φύγοιμι Od. 14.312. Cf. Od. 3.152, Od. 6.195, Od. 8.81, Od. 12.27, 231, Od. 14.275, 338, Od. 15.345.

(2) An instance of this; with pl. : πήματά κʼ ἔπασχον Il. 5.886, λίην μέγα π. εἰσορόωντες Il. 9.229. Cf. Il. 15.721, Il. 17.99, Il. 24.547 : Od. 1.49, Od. 2.163, Od. 3.100, Od. 5.33, 179, Od. 9.535, Od. 21.305, etc.

(3) A cause of bane, mischief, destruction, evil, woe or misery. Of persons : πατρὶ σῷ μέγα π. Il. 3.50. Cf. Il. 3.160, Il. 7.282, Il. 10.453, Il. 22.288, 421 : Od. 12.125, Od. 17.446, 597. Of inanimate things Od. 11.555.

forms: To bring bane or mischief upon : Τρῶας Il. 15.42.
Absol., to take hostile action, take the offensive, attack : ὁππότεροι πρότεροι πημήνειαν Il. 3.299. Cf. Il. 24.781.
In pass., to suffer harm or damage : οὔ τι πημανθῆναι ἔπι δέος Od. 8.563. Cf. Od. 14.255.

defs: In weaving, the spool on which the woof was wound (cf. κερκίς) Il. 23.762.
A kinsman by marriage Il. 3.163 : Od. 8.581, Od. 10.441, Od. 23.120.
A wallet or scrip : πλῆσαν πήρην Od. 17.411. Cf. Od. 13.437, Od. 17.197 = Od. 18.108, Od. 17.357, 466.

forms: Explained as maimed or helpless : πηρὸν θέσαν [θάμυριν] Il. 2.599.

defs: (2) The middle piece or handle of a bow : τόξου πῆχυν ἄνελκεν Il. 11.375, Il. 13.583. Cf. Od. 21.419.

forms: Hence, rich, fertile soil : μάλα πῖαρ ὑπʼ οὖδάς [ἐστιν] Od. 9.135.
The cream or flower of something : βοῶν ἐκ πῖαρ ἑλέσθαι Il. 11.550 = Il. 17.659.

defs: A spring Il. 16.825.
(1) To press, squeeze, compress : βραχίονα Il. 16.510. Cf. Od. 4.287, Od. 12.174.
(2) To grip, grasp : ἀστεμφέως ἐχέμεν μᾶλλόν τε πιέζειν Od. 4.419.
(3) To load (with bonds), secure tightly : ἐν δεσμοῖς πιεσθείς Od. 8.336. Cf. Od. 12.164, 196.
A large jar : πίθοι οἴνοιο Od. 2.340. Cf. Il. 24.527 : Od. 23.305.
Finding a bitter marriage (i.e. not marriage but death), ruing one's wooing Od. 1.266 = Od. 4.346 = Od. 17.137.
(1) Sharppointed, sharp, keen, piercing : ὀϊστόν Il. 4.118. Cf. Il. 4.134, Il. 22.206, etc. : Od. 22.8.
(2) Of pain, acute, piercing, darting : ὠδῖνας Il. 11.271.
(3) Pungent or bitter to the taste : ῥίζαν Il. 11.846. Cf. Od. 5.323. Pungent to the smell : ὀδμήν Od. 4.406.
(4) Fig. : μὴ πικρὴν αἴγυπτον ἵκηαι Od. 17.448 (you prate of Egypt. You will find yourself in a sorry sort of Egypt, i.e. in trouble).
To be brought into contact with, touch. With dat. : ἅρματα χθονὶ πίλνατο Il. 23.368. With prep.: οὐκ ἐπʼ οὔδει πίλναται (makes contact (so as to be) upon the . . ., touches it) Il. 19.93.

forms: Aor. pple. fem. πλήσασα Il. 16.223 : Od. 5.93.
Mid. 3 pl. aor. opt. πλησαίατο Od. 19.198.

defs: (1) A plank or board Od. 12.67.
(2) A platter : κρειῶν πίνακας Od. 1.141 = Od. 4.57, Od. 16.49.
(3) A writing-tablet Il. 7.169.
To make wise; hence, to teach one a lesson, teach one better : ἤδη μʼ ἄλλο τεὴ ἐπίνυσσεν ἐφετμή Il. 14.249.

forms: Wisdom, sound understanding, good sense Il. 6.289 : Od. 20.71, 228.

defs: Wise, of sound understanding, of good sense : ὅς τις π. γε μετέλθοι Od. 1.229. Cf. Od. 4.211, Od. 11.445, Od. 20.131, Od. 21.103, Od. 23.361.
(2) To drink the contents of (a vessel) : κύπελλα οἴνου Il. 4.346. Cf. Il. 8.232.
(3) In pass., to be drunk up, consumed : πολλὸν μέθυ πίνετο Il. 9.469 : τόδε δῶμα Od. 21.69. Cf. Od. 9.45, Od. 20.312.

forms: 3 pl. fut. in mid. form πεσέονται Il. 11.824.
Acc. pl. masc. pf. pple. πεπτεῶτας Od. 22.384.
(ἀμφι-, ἀπο-, ἐκ-, ἐμ-, κατα-, προ-) To fall.
defs: (1) To fall or drop from a high or relatively high position : πέσε δὲ λίθος εἴσω Il. 12.459. Cf. Il. 1.594, Il. 5.82, Il. 12.156, Il. 15.435, Il. 17.760, Il. 21.9, etc.: τέγεος πέσεν (from the . . .) Od. 10.559. Cf. Od. 11.64, Od. 12.239, Od. 14.129, Od. 15.479, Od. 16.13, Od. 18.397, Od. 19.469, Od. 24.535, 540.
(2) To be hurled or thrown from such a position : φῶτες ἔπιπτον πρηνέες ἐξ ὀχέων Il. 16.378. Cf. Il. 6.16, Il. 23.437 : Od. 5.315, Od. 12.417, Od. 14.307.
(3) To let oneself fall, throw oneself : ἐν γούνασι πῖπτε διώνης Il. 5.370. Cf. Od. 10.51.

(4) Of a missile, to light, find its mark : ἐν δʼ ἔπεσε ζωστῆρι ὀϊστός Il. 4.134. Cf. Il. 13.289. Of a missile that misses its mark, to fall, light, in a specified way : ἡμῖν ἐτώσια [βέλεα] πίπτει ἔραζε Il. 17.633. Cf. Od. 22.259 = 276, 280.

(5) In immaterial senses. Of sleep : ἐπεί σφισιν ὕπνος ἐπὶ βλεφάροισιν ἔπιπτεν Od. 2.398. Cf. Od. 5.271, Od. 13.79, Od. 23.309. Of fear : τοῖς δέος ἐν φρεσὶ πίπτει Od. 14.88. Of falling out of favour : σοὶ ἐκ θυμοῦ πεσέειν Il. 23.595. Of strife : ἐν ἄλλοισι θεοῖσιν ἔρις πέσεν Il. 21.385.
(6) Uses with adverbs and prepositions.
(b) With σύν.
(7) To fall from one's or its own height.
(b) To drop down wounded, be wounded : οὐκ ἀμέλησε κασιγνήτοιο πεσόντος Il. 8.330.

(c) To fall in battle or fight, drop down dead, be slain : τὸν πεσόντα ποδῶν ἔλαβεν Il. 4.463. Cf. Il. 1.243, Il. 3.289, Il. 4.482, 504, Il. 5.561, Il. 8.67, Il. 10.200 (app. pple. of the impf., that had fallen), Il. 12.395, etc. : Od. 8.524, Od. 22.22, 94, 118, 254, 384, Od. 24.181, 449, 525. Of slain animals Il. 16.469 : Od. 10.163 = Od. 19.454.
(8) To come to a lower from a higher level, sink. Of the setting sun Il. 8.485. Of wind, to fall, abate Od. 14.475, Od. 19.202.
A water-meadow : πίσεα ποιήεντα Od. 3.9 : = Od. 7.124.
(1) Of persons : trusty, faithful, true, Il. 15.331, 437, Il. 17.500, 575, 589, Il. 18.235, 460 : Od. 15.539. In superl. πιστότατος  Il. 16.147.

(1) In pass., to give assurance, bind oneself surely. With infin. : ὅρκῳ πιστωθῆναι ἀπήμονά μʼ οἴκαδʼ ἀπάξειν Od. 15.436. In mid., to give assurance to a person, give him confidence ; ἐπιστώσαντʼ ἐπέεσσιν Il. 21.286.
(2) In pass., to feel assurance, be convinced : ὄφρα πιστωθῆτον Od. 21.218.
(3) In mid., to give mutual pledges, exchange troth : χεῖράς τʼ ἀλλήλων λαβέτην καὶ πιστώσαντο Il. 7.233.
Trusting in, relying upon, emboldened by, something. With dat. : τόξοισιν Il. 5.205. Cf. Il. 8.226= Il. 11.9, Il. 9.238, Il. 24.295, 313 : Od. 18.140.

forms: With another numeral : π. καὶ εἴκοσι Od. 16.249.
To spread, spread out : χεῖρας Od. 11.392.
To cause (mist) to be outspread over something, spread or shed (it) Il. 21.7.
In pass., to be outspread, flutter : ἀμφὶ χαῖται πίτναντο Il. 22.402.
A felled pine or a piece thereof : δέδμητο πίτυσσιν ἰδὲ δρυσίν Od. 9.186.

defs: (1) To make manifest to the sight, display, show. In mid. : πιφαυσκόμενος τὰ ἃ κῆλα Il. 12.280. Cf. Il. 15.97, Il. 21.333.
(2) To tell of, indicate, point out : ἵπποι, οὓς πίφαυσκε δόλων Il. 10.478. In mid. Od. 15.518.
(3) To give a signal : ῥοίζησε πιφαύσκων διομήδεϊ Il. 10.502.
(4) To bring forward, propose, tender. In mid. : μή μοι ἄποινα πιφαύσκεο Il. 21.99.

(5) To set forth, communicate, disclose, make known, declare : μῦθον ἅπαντα Od. 11.442. In mid. : ἠέ τι μυρμιδόνεσσι πιφαύσκεαι ; (have you anything to . . .?) Il. 16.12. Cf. Od. 2.32, 44, Od. 21.305 (prophesy), Od. 23.202.
(6) To set forth or utter (words or discourse) : ἔπεα Il. 10.202. Cf. Od. 22.131 = 247.
(7) To make declaration, state one's case, one's wishes, what one sees or knows : δήμῳ πιφαύσκων Il. 18.500. Cf. Od. 12.165. In mid. Od. 2.162, Od. 13.37.

(2) Of land or a country, rich, fertile Il. 5.710, Il. 9.577, Il. 12.283, Il. 16.437, Il. 18.541, etc. : Od. 2.328, Od. 4.318, Od. 13.322, Od. 14.329, Od. 19.173, etc. Of cities or a house, full of substance, rich : πιείρας πόλεις Il. 18.342 : οἰ̔͂κον Od. 9.35. Of a temple or a part thereof, rich with offerings : νηῷ Il. 2.549, ἀδύτοιο Il. 5.512 : νηόν Od. 12.346. Of a meal, plentiful, sumptuous : δαιτὶ πιείρῃ Il. 19.180.

forms: Wandering, a roving life : πλαγκτοσύνης κακώτερον Od. 15.343.
3 sing. aor. pass. πλάγχθη Il. 11.351 : Od. 1.2.
defs: (1) To beat upon : κῦμα πλάζʼ ὤμους Il. 21.269 : δύω νύκτας κύματι πλάζετο (was beaten upon, tossed, by the waves) Od. 5.389.

(2) To drive or turn from one's or its course, cause to take another or an undesired course : δαίμων με πλάγξʼ ἀπὸ σικανίης δεῦοʼ ἐλθέμεν Od. 24.307. Cf. Il. 17.751 : Od. 1.2 (was tossed about), 75, Od. 13.278. To drive back from one's goal, foil, baffle : ἐπίκουροι, οἵ με μέγα πλάζουσιν Il. 2.132. To drive, force to flee, from a place : Ἄργεϊ νάσθη πλαγχθείς Il. 14.120. To daze : πλάζε [μνηστῆρας] πίνοντας Od. 2.396.

(3) In mid. and pass., to wander, rove, roam : εἰ ἄλλου μῦθον ἄκουσας πλαζομένου [̓οδυσσῆος] (have heard from some one else the story of his wanderings) Od. 3.95= Od. 4.325, πλαζόμενοι κατὰ ληΐδα Od. 3.106. Cf. Il. 10.91 : Od. 3.252, Od. 13.204, Od. 14.43, Od. 15.312, Od. 16.64, 151. To stray, lose one's way : πλαγχθέντα ἧς ἀπὸ νηός Od. 7.278. Of a missile, to glance off : πλάγχθη ἀπὸ χαλκόφι χαλκός Il. 11.351.
To deviate from the straight course, go deviously : ἵπποι πλανόωνται ἀνὰ δρόμον (run all over the course) Il. 23.321.
A plane-tree : καλῇ ὑπὸ πλατανίστῳ Il. 2.307, πρὸς πλατάνιστον ὄρουσεν 310.
Wide, broad : τελαμῶνος Il. 5.796. Cf. Il. 6.86, Il. 13.588, Il. 17.432 : Od. 24.82. Of flocks, broad, extensive : αἰπόλια Il. 2.474, Il. 11.679 := Od. 14.101, 103.
(1) Filled to the utmost capacity, full : δεπάεσσιν Il. 8.162= Il. 12.311. Cf. Il. 10.579, Il. 11.637 : Od. 11.359. With contents undiminished, still full : σὸν πλεῖον δέπας αἰεὶ ἕστηκεν Il. 4.262.
(2) With genit., full of, filled with : πλεῖαί τοι χαλκοῦ κλισίαι Il. 2.226. Cf. Il. 9.71 : Od. 4.319 (crowded with . . .), Od. 12.92, Od. 15.446, Od. 17.605, Od. 20.355.

(1) The most numerous, in greatest number : πλεῖστοι καὶ ἄριστοι λαοί Il. 2.577, 817. Cf. Il. 2.580, Il. 3.185, Il. 9.382, Il. 11.148, Il. 12.89 = 197, Il. 15.448 : ὅθι πλεῖστα κτήματα κεῖται Od. 4.127. Cf. Od. 4.229, Od. 5.309. With nouns of multitude : ὅμιλον Il. 15.616, λαόν Il. 16.377. Absol. : ὅθι πλεῖστοι κλονέοντο Il. 5.8. Cf. Il. 5.780, Il. 7.69, Il. 14.520, Il. 16.285 : Od. 16.77, 392= Od. 21.162, Od. 20.335.
(2) The most, the most in quantity or abundance : κόνις Il. 13.335, καλάμην Il. 19.222.
(3) The greatest, the most serious : κακόν Od. 4.697.
(4) In neut. sing. πλεῖστον as adv., the most, to the greatest extent, in the highest degree : ἥ οἱ πλεῖστον ἔρυτο Il. 4.138. Cf. Il. 19.287.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. πλείους Od. 24.464. πλέες Il. 11.395.
defs: (1) More, more numerous, in greater number : πλέας ἔμμεναι υἷας Ἀχαιῶν Τρώων Il. 2.129. Cf. Il. 5.673, Il. 10.106, 506, Il. 11.395, Il. 15.611, etc. : ἀνήϊξαν ἡμίσεων πλείους Od. 24.464. Cf. Od. 2.245, Od. 6.189, Od. 9.48, Od. 12.54, Od. 19.168, etc. Absol. : ἐπεὶ πλεόνεσσιν ἀνάσσει Il. 1.281, οὐδὲ πλείονα ἴσασι μητίσασθαι (have more knowledge so as to . . ., know better how to . . .) Il. 23.312. Cf. Il. 1.325, Il. 5.531, Il. 13.355, Il. 16.651, etc. : Od. 2.251, Od. 12.188, Od. 14.498, Od. 16.88, Od. 18.63, Od. 22.13.
(2) Many rather than few. Absol. : πλεόνων ἔργον ἄμεινον Il. 12.412.
(3) Greater in quantity or amount : πλέων νύξ (more of the night) Il. 10.252. Absol. : ἐπὶ πλεῖον ἐλέλειπτο Od. 8.475. Cf. Il. 1.165.
Formed by plaiting or twisting, plaited, twisted : ταλάροισιν (i.e. of wicker-work) Il. 18.568. Cf. Il. 22.469: Od. 9.247, Od. 22.175 = 192.
(1) To plait, twist, braid : πλοκάμους Il. 14.176.
(2) To form by plaiting or twisting, plait, twist : πεῖσμα Od. 10.168.

forms: In collective sense, the side of the body : πλευρὰ οὔτησε ξυστῷ (in the side) Il. 4.468. Cf. Il. 11.437.
The ribs, the sides of the body : συώδιγγες ἀνὰ πλευρὰς ἀνέδραμον Il. 23.716. Cf. Od. 3.170, Il. 24.10 : Od. 17.232.
Also πλείω Od. 15.34, Od. 16.368. πλώω Il. 21.302 : Od. 5.240.
2 pl. fut. in mid. form πλεύσεσθε Od. 12.25.
defs: (1) To go or make one's way by sea, sail the seas, sail : πλέων ἐπὶ πόντον Il. 6.88. Cf. Od. 1.183, Od. 3.276, Od. 5.278, Od. 9.62, Od. 10.28, etc. Of ships : (ελλήσποντον ἐπʼ ἰχθυόεντα πλεούσας νῆας ἐμάς Il. 9.360. Cf. Od. 3.158, Od. 12.70. To set sail, sail : ἅμʼ ἠοῖ πλεύσεσθε Od. 12.25. Cf. Il. 3.444, Il. 14.251 : Od. 14.253.
(2) To sail over or upon, traverse : πόθεν πλεῖθʼ ὑγρὰ κέλευθα; Od. 3.71= Od. 9.252.
(3) In gen., to be borne on the surface of water, float : πολλὰ τεύχεα πλῶον καὶ νέκυες Il. 21.302. Cf. Od. 5.240.
A blow or stroke : ὑπὸ πληγῆς πατρὸς διός (i.e. his lightning) Il. 14.414. Cf. Il. 2.264, Il. 11.532, Il. 15.17, Il. 16.816 : ὑπὸ πληγῇσιν ἱμάσθλης Od. 13.82. Cf. Od. 4.244, Od. 17.283, Od. 18.54.
Numerical strength or superiority, numbers : πεποιθότας πλήθεϊ σφετέρῳ Il. 17.330. So, app., πλήθει πρόσθε βαλόντες (by being two to one) Il. 23.639.
(1) The whole number, the body, the multitude : πληθύος ἐκ Δαναῶν Il. 9.641.
(2) The general or common body, the host : ἡγεμόνας ἕλεν, αὐτὰρ ἔπειτα πληθύν Il. 11.305. Cf. Il. 2.143, 278, 488, Il. 15.295, 305.
(3) A throng gathered for or engaged in battle : κατὰ πληθὺν λυκίων Il. 5.676. Cf. Il. 11.360, Il. 17.31= Od. 3.197, Od. 3.377, Il. 22.458 : Od. 11.514.

(4) Numerical strength, numbers : οὐ πληθὺν διζήμενος (not wishing merely to swell the array) Il. 17.221. Numerical superiority, numbers, a being outnumbered, an outnumbering : πληθὺν ταρβήσας Il. 11.405. Cf. Od. 16.105.
(1) To be filled or occupied to the whole extent or capacity : τραπέζας πληθούσας (loaded) Od. 11.419. With genit. : πλήθει μοι νεκύων ῥέεθρα Il. 21.218. Cf. Il. 8.214 : Od. 9.8.
(2) Of a river, to be brimming, be in flood : ποταμοὶ πλήθουσιν Il. 16.389. Cf. Il. 5.87, Il. 11.492 : Od. 19.207. Of the moon, to be at the full, be full : σελήνην πλήθουσαν Il. 18.484.
To bandy blows with. With dat. : πληκτίζεσθʼ ἀλόχοισι διός Il. 21.499.
The nave of a wheel : πλῆμναι ἀργύρου Il. 5.726. Cf. Il. 23.339.

forms: A swell or heave (of the sea) : πλημυρὶς ἐκ πόντοιο Od. 9.486.
With genit. : πλήν γʼ αὐτοῦ λαοδάμαντος Od. 8.207.

defs: Smiter of horses. Epithet of Pelops Il. 2.104. Of Menestheus Il. 4.327. Of Orestes Il. 5.705. Of Oïleus Il. 11.93.

(1) Near, close : πλησίαι αἵ γʼ ἥσθην (close to each other) Il. 4.21= Il. 8.458. Cf. Il. 11.593= Il. 13.488, Il. 2.271 (his neighbour) = Il. 4.81= Il. 22.372 : = Od. 8.328 =  Od. 10.37= Od. 13.167= Od. 18.72 = 400= Od. 21.396, Od. 10.93. Near to, close to. With genit. : ἀλλήλων Od. 5.71. With dat. : ἀλλήλοισιν Il. 23.732 : Od. 2.149.

(2) In neut. sing. πλησίον as adv., near, close, close by : ἑστήκει Il. 4.329. Cf. Il. 18.422 : Od. 8.7 (in a body), Od. 20.106 (from near at hand). Near to, close to. With genit. : ἀλλήλων Il. 3.115, Il. 7.245, 249. Cf. Od. 12.102, Od. 14.14. With dat. : οἱ Od. 6.171.
Swelling the sail : οὖρον Od. 11.7= Od. 12.149.

forms: Pple. πλήξας, -αντος Il. 5.588, Il. 16.332 : Od. 20.17, Od. 22.20.
Thematic pf. pple. πεπλήγων (v.l. πεπληγώς) Il. 2.264.
3 pl. thematic plupf. (in impf. sense) ἐπέπληγον Il. 5.504. πέπληγον Il. 23.363 : Od. 8.264.
3 sing. thematic plupf. (in impf. sense) πεπλήγετο Il. 12.162, Il. 15.113, 397 : Od. 13.198.
Pass. 3 sing. aor. πλήγη Il. 13.394, Il. 16.403.
Pple. πληγείς, -έντος Il. 8.12, 455, Il. 15.117, Il. 23.694 : Od. 21.50.
defs: (1) To administer a blow to, strike, hit, smite, beat : σκήπτρῳ Il. 2.266, πὺξ πεπληγέμεν (to fall to with their fists) Il. 23.660. Cf. Il. 16.791, Il. 22.497, Il. 23.363, 694 : Od. 8.264, Od. 10.238, 319, Od. 16.456, Od. 18.57, Od. 20.17, Od. 21.50, Od. 22.20. In mid. : ὣ πεπλήγετο μηρώ Il. 12.162. Cf. Il. 15.113, Il. 16.125, Il. 18.31, 51, Il. 15.397 := Od. 13.198. To drive away with blows :  ἀγορῆθεν Il. 2.264. To whip up (horses) Il. 16.728. Of horses, to kick Il. 5.588. Of inanimate objects : ἱστὸς πλῆξε κυβερνήτεω κεφαλήν Od. 12.412. Cf. Od. 5.431.
(2) With ἐκ, to drive out of one's wits or one's mind (cf. ἐκπλήσσω) : ἔκ οἱ ἡνίοχος πλήγη φρένας (lost his wits) Il. 13.394. Cf. Il. 16.403 : Od. 18.231.

(3) To strike, hit, smite, with a weapon Il. 3.362, Il. 5.147, 763, Il. 10.489, Il. 11.240, Il. 12.192, Il. 16.115, 332, Il. 17.294, 296 : Od. 10.162. Of Zeus and his lightning : πληγέντε κεραυνῷ Il. 8.455. Cf. Il. 8.12, Il. 15.117 : Od. 12.416= Od. 14.306.
(4) To set in motion by striking or beating : κονισάλῳ, ὃν οὐρανὸν ἐς πολύχαλκον ἐπέπληγον πόδες ἵππων Il. 5.504.

forms: Of mules, app., to prance along : εὖ πλίσσοντο πόδεσσιν Od. 7.318.

defs: A lock or tress of hair : πλοκάμους ἔπλεξεν Il. 14.176.
A voyage or course : δολιχὸν πλόον ὁρμαίνοντας Od. 3.169.
Wealth, riches, abundance of substance Il. 1.171, Il. 2.670, Il. 5.708, Il. 16.596, Il. 24.536, 546 : Od. 14.206, Od. 24.486.
A lock of hair : πλοχμοί, οἳ χρυσῷ τε καὶ ἀργύρῳ ἐσφήκωντο Il. 17.52.
A place for washing clothes, a washing-trough : λαΐνεοι Il. 22.153. Cf. Od. 7.40, 86.
To wash clothes : ἴομεν πλυνέουσαι Od. 7.31. Cf. Od. 15.420. To wash (clothes) : ὅθι εἵματα πλύνεσκον Il. 22.155. Cf. Od. 7.59, 93, Od. 24.148.
One of the lungs : πάγη ἐν πνεύμονι χαλκός Il. 4.528.
(1) To breathe Il. 13.385.
(2) To draw the breath of life, live, exist : ὅσσα τε γαῖαν ἔπι πνείει Il. 17.447 := Od. 18.131.
(3) To breathe forth. Fig. : μένεα πνείοντες (πνείοντας) Il. 2.536, Il. 3.8, Il. 11.508, Il. 24.364. Cf. Od. 22.203.
(4) To breathe or inspire into a person, etc. : ἐν δʼ ἔπνευσʼ ἵπποισι μένος Il. 24.442. Cf. Il. 19.159.—
(5) Of wind or a breeze, to breathe, blow Od. 4.361, 567, Od. 5.469, Od. 6.119.
(6) To emit an odour, smell : ἀμβροσίην ἡδὺ πνείουσαν Od. 4.446.
(1) A breathing, the breath : πνοιῇ [ἵππων] μετάφρενον θέρμετο Il. 23.380. A breath : δόρυ πνοιῇ ἔτραπεν Od. 3.439.
(2) Of the breath or blast of fire Il. 21.355.
Water for washing the feet Od. 19.343, 504.

forms: Epithet of Achilles Il. 1.121, Il. 2.688, Il. 7.423, Il. 11.599, Il. 16.5, Il. 18.181, etc.

defs: Reaching to the feet : δέρμα λέοντος Il. 10.24=178, ἀσπίδα (i.e. such as to cover the whole of the bearer when the rim rested on the ground) Il. 15.646.

etym: [ποδ-, πούς + ἄνεμος. Like the wind in feet.]

defs: Swiftness of foot. In pl. : ποδωκείῃσι πεποιθώς Il. 2.792.

forms: Swift-footed : ἵππους Il. 2.764, Il. 17.614. Cf. Il. 10.316, Il. 23.262 (app. with transference of epithet from horses to drivers), 376.

defs: (1) In local sense : τίς π. εἰς ἀνδρῶν; Il. 21.150 : Od. 1.170= Od. 10.325= Od. 14.187= Od. 15.264= Od. 19.105= Od. 24.298, Od. 6.238 (or poss. these passages may be referred to (2)). Cf. Od. 3.71= Od. 9.252, Od. 16.57. In indirect construction : εἰρώτα (εἴροντὀ τίς εἴη καὶ π. ἔλθοι Od. 15.423, Od. 17.368.
(2) In reference to race or origin. In indirect construction : οὐκ οἶδα π. γένος εὔχεται εἶναι (whence in the matter of race, i.e. of what stock he claims to be) Od. 17.373.

(1) From some or any place or quarter : ἐλθών ποθεν Od. 1.115, Od. 20.224. Cf. Od. 1.414, Od. 2.351, Od. 6.52, Od. 14.374, Od. 18.376, Od. 21.195, Od. 24.149. In reference to finding, somewhere : εἴ ποθεν ἐξεύροι Il. 18.322.
(2) From any source : εἴ ποθεν ἄλλα γένοιτο Il. 9.380. Cf. Od. 5.490, Od. 22.62.

(1) To feel the want of, long for, yearn for, mourn for, a person or thing absent or lost: ἀϋτήν τε πτόλεμόν τε Il. 1.492. Cf. Il. 5.414, Il. 23.16, Il. 24.6 : τοίην κεφαλήν Od. 1.343. Cf. Od. 9.453, Od. 11.196 (sick with hope of it deferred), Od. 12.110, Od. 18.204, Od. 19.136.
(2) To miss, to feel the want of, be at a loss on account of or distressed by the absence or want of : ἀρχόν Il. 2.703=726, 778. Cf. Il. 2.709, Il. 5.234, Il. 11.161, Il. 15.219 : Od. 22.387.
(3) To miss, remark the absence or loss of : πρίν [μʼ] αὐτὴν ποθέσαι Od. 2.375. Cf. Od. 4.748, Od. 13.219, Od. 16.287= Od. 19.6.
(1) A longing, yearning or mourning for a person or thing absent or lost : σῇ ποθῇ (through mourning for you) Il. 19.321.

(2) A missing a person or thing, a feeling at a loss or in distress on account of his or its absence or loss : Ἀχιλλῆος Il. 1.240. Cf. Il. 7.362, Il. 11.471, Il. 14.368, Il. 17.690, 704 : Od. 2.126, Od. 8.414, Od. 10.505.
(3) Lack, want, scarcity : ξενίων Od. 15.514, 546.

forms: In what place ? where ? π. τοι πόλις; Od. 1.170= Od. 10.325= Od. 14.187= Od. 15.264= Od. 19.105= Od. 24.298.

defs: (1) Somewhere : ἠέ ποθι πτολέμοιο μέγα στόμα [τεύχων] Il. 10.8.
(2) In negative or conditional contexts, anywhere : οὐδέ ποθι νέφος ἐστίν Od. 20.114. Cf. Il. 13.309 : Od. 17.195. In any part : οὐδέ ποθι μιαρός Il. 24.420.
(4) Qualifying an expression, haply, I ween, no doubt, as it would seem : ἀλλά ποθι Ζεὺς αἴτιος Od. 1.348. Cf. Il. 13.630, Il. 19.273, Il. 24.209.

forms: = ποθή 1 Il. 17.439 : Od. 4.596, Od. 11.202 (mourning for you), Od. 14.144.

defs: (1) To make, construct, form, fabricate, fashion, prepare : δῶμα Il. 1.608, σάκος Il. 6.222. Cf. Il. 7.316, Il. 6.339, 435, Il. 15.363, Od. 3.12, etc. : Od. 1.239, Od. 4.796, Od. 5.253, Od. 7.10, Od. 8.373, Od. 17.207, etc. In mid. Il. 5.735= Il. 8.386, Il. 12.5, 168, Il. 18.371 : Od. 5.251, 255, 259. To make or prepare (a bed) : πεποίηταί τοι εὐνή Od. 6.342.

(2) To make, bring about, cause, cause to come into existence or take place : φόβον Il. 12.432, αἴθρην Il. 17.646. Cf. Il. 12.30, Il. 13.120 : Od. 1.250= Od. 16.127, Od. 5.452, Od. 19.34. In mid. Il. 8.2, 489 : Od. 2.126. To make (a bargain). In mid. : ῥήτρην ποιησόμεθα Od. 14.393.
(3) To put (into a person's mind), suggest : ἐνὶ φρεσὶν ὦδε νόημα ποίησεν Od. 14.274. With infin. : ἑστάμεναι Il. 13.55.
(4) To appoint, nominate : ταμίην Od. 10.21. In mid. : πέντε ἡγεμόνας ποιήσατο Il. 16.171.

(5) To make, cause to be (so and so). With complementary adj. : ἄφρονα ποιῆσαι καὶ ἐπίφρονʼ ἐόντα Od. 23.12. Cf. Il. 1.461= Il. 2.424 := Od. 3.458= Od. 12.361, Od. 1.235, Od. 9.327, 524, Od. 13.42. With sim. sb. : μὴ σέ γε βασιλῆα ποιήσειεν Od. 1.387. Cf. Il. 24.537, 611: Od. 16.456, Od. 17.271. In mid. Il. 3.409, Il. 9.397, 495 : Od. 5.120, Od. 6.66, Od. 10.433. To cause to do something. With infin. : ἐπεί σε θεοὶ ποίησαν ἱκέσθαι οἶκον Od. 23.258.
(6) To do, effect, perform : ἦ σοὶ ἄριστα πεποίηται; Il. 7.56. In mid. : οὐδέ τινʼ ἄλλην μύθου ποιήσασθαι ἐπισχεσίην ἐδύνασθε (could put forward no other plea) Od. 21.71.
Grassy, grass-clad : ἄγκεα Od. 4.337= Od. 17.128. Cf. Od. 3.9 := Od. 7.124. Of places, grassy, with grassy meadows Il. 2.503, Il. 9.150 = 292 : Od. 16.396.
(1) Made, constructed, fabricated : σάκεος πύκα ποιητοῖο Il. 18.608. Cf. Il. 5.466 : Od. 1.333= Od. 8.458= Od. 16.415= Od. 18.209= Od. 21.64, Od. 1.436, Od. 22.455.
(2) Epithet of various products of art, well made, constructed or fabricated (εὐποίητος): δόμοις Il. 5.198, τρίποδος Il. 23.718. Cf. Il. 10.262, Il. 12.470, Il. 23.340 : Od. 13.306.
To make, form, fashion, with curious art Il. 18.590.
In pl., broidery, ornamental variegated work in wool : κάλλιστος ποικίλμασιν Il. 7.294 := Od. 15.107.
Of many and various devices or wiles. Epithet of Odysseus Il. 11.482 : Od. 3.163, Od. 6.168, Od. 22.115, 202, 281. Absol. in voc. addressed to Odysseus : ποικιλομῆτα Od. 13.293.
(1) Parti-coloured, marked with patches of a different colour or shade, dappled : παρδαλέῃ Il. 10.30 : ἐλλόν Od. 19.228.

(2) Wrought or ornamented with curious art, elaborately wrought or ornamented. With reference to broidery or ornamental variegated work in wool, etc. : πέπλον Il. 5.735= Il. 8.386. Cf. Il. 14.215, 220, Il. 22.441 : Od. 18.293.– Of various products of art : ἅρματα ποικίλα χαλκῷ (with . . ., i.e. having the metal parts curiously wrought) Il. 4.226, Il. 10.322, 393, θώρηκα Il. 16.134. Cf. Il. 3.327, Il. 4.432, Il. 5.239, Il. 7.504, Il. 10.75, 149, 501, 504, Il. 12.396, Il. 13.181, 537= Il. 14.431, Il. 14.420 : κλισμόν Od. 1.132. Cf. Od. 3.492= Od. 15.145 = 190.
(3) Elaborately contrived, intricate, complicated : δεσμόν Od. 8.448.

forms: Absol., to tend one's flock, act as shepherd : ποιμαίνων (ποιμαίνοντʼ̓ ἐπʼ ὄεσσιν Il. 7.25, Il. 11.106.
In pass., of flocks, to roam the pastures : αἶγας καὶ ὄϊς, τά οἱ ἄσπετα ποιμαίνοντο Il. 11.245.

defs: (1) A shepherd (in Od. 10.82 app. including herdsman and this sense is possible in all the passages except Il. 5.137, Il. 12.451, Il. 13.493 and Il. 16.354, where the sense shepherd (in Il. 16.354 including goatherd) is required) Il. 3.11, Il. 4.455, Il. 5.137, Il. 8.559, Il. 12.451, Il. 13.493, Il. 16.354, Il. 18.162, Il. 23.835 : Od. 4.87 Od. 10.82.

(2) Of kings and chiefs, π. λαῶν, shepherd of the host. Applied to AgamemnonIl. 2.243, 254, 772= Il. 6.230, Il. 4.413, Il. 10.3, Il. 11.187, 202, Il. 14.22, Il. 19.35, 251, Il. 24.654 : Od. 3.156, Od. 4.532, Od. 14.497. To Menelaus Il. 5.566, 570: Od. 4.24. To Nestor Il. 2.85, Il. 10.73, Il. 23.411 : Od. 3.469, Od. 15.151, Od. 17.109. To Atreus Il. 2.105. To Aeneas Il. 5.513, Od. 3.110. To Glaucus Il. 7.214. To Hector Il. 10.406, Il. 14.423, Il. 15.262, Il. 22.277. To Diomedes Il. 11.370, Il. 23.389. To Machaon Il. 11.506, 598, 651. To Achilles Il. 16.2, Il. 19.386. To Aegisthus Od. 4.528. To Odysseus Od. 18.70, Od. 20.106. To Laertes Od. 24.368. To Mentor Od. 24.456. To various minor heroes Il. 1.263, Il. 4.296, Il. 5.144, Il. 6.469, Il. 9.81, Il. 11.92, 578, 842, Il. 13.411, 600, Il. 14.516, Il. 17.348.
A flock Od. 9.122.
Of or pertaining to a flock : σταθμὸν ποιμνήϊον (a sheep-farm) Il. 2.470.

(1) A blood-price, a sum paid as compensation and satisfaction by a homicide to the family of the slain man : εἵνεκα ποινῆς ἀνδρὸς ἀποφθιμένου Il. 18.498. Cf. Il. 9.633, 636. In reference to requital or vengeance for men slain in battle Il. 13.659, Il. 14.483, Il. 16.398, Il. 21.28 (to pay the price of his blood in their persons). So of the vengeance taken on the Cyclops Od. 23.312.

(2) Something given in recompense for loss or deprivation, amends : ποινὴν γανυμήδεος (for the loss of . . .) Il. 5.266. Cf. Il. 17.207. A sum to be paid by an enemy as compensation for loss or damage, an indemnity : μαχήσομαι εἵνεκα ποινῆς Il. 3.290 (= τιμήν 286, 288).
(1) Of what nature, kind, or sort ? ποῖοί κʼ εἶτʼ Ὀδυσῆϊ ἀμυνέμεν; (what sort of helpers would he find you?) Od. 21.195.
(2) Without special reference to nature, etc., what ? ποίῃ νηΐ σʼ ἤγαγον; Od. 16.222. Carrying on an indirect question : ἐρέσθαι ὁππόθεν οὗτος ἀνήρ, ποίης δʼ ἐξ εὔχεται εἶναι γαίης Od. 1.406.

(3) Rather exclamatory than interrogative, expressing surprise or anger : ποῖον τὸν μῦθον ἔειπες (what a word is this that you have said !) Il. 1.552. Cf. Il. 4.350, Il. 8.209, etc. : Od. 1.64, Od. 3.230, Od. 21.168, etc. Absol. : ποῖον ἔειπες Il. 13.824. Cf. Il. 23.570 : Od. 2.85= Od. 17.406, Od. 2.243.

To show activity, exert oneself, be busy : διὰ δώματα ποιπνύοντα (bustling about) Il. 1.600. Cf. Il. 8.219 (to bestir himself and . . .), Il. 14.155 (showing himself everywhere), Il. 18.421 (nimbly played their part), Il. 24.475 (were doing busy service) : Od. 3.430 (busied themselves), Od. 20.149 (bestir yourselves and . . .).
A fleece Il. 12.451.
Of or for war, warlike : ἔργα Il. 2.338, Il. 5.428, Il. 6.236, Il. 11.719, Il. 13.727, 730, τεύχεα Il. 6.193 : ἔργα Od. 12.116.

forms: Pple. πολεμίξων Il. 10.451, Il. 15.179. πτολεμίξων Il. 13.644.
defs: (1) To fight, do battle, take part in the fight, engage in fight : ἐπεί κε κάμω πολεμίζων Il. 1.168, πολεμίζειν οὐκ εἴασκον Il. 5.802. Cf. Il. 2.328, Il. 4.300, Il. 5.520, Il. 8.428, Il. 9.318, etc : Od. 13.315= Od. 15.153, Od. 14.240. Of horses Il. 16.834. Of single combat Il. 3.67, Il. 6.152, Il. 15.179, Od. 3.85, etc.

(2) To fight, engage in fight, do battle, with. With dat. : πολεμιζέμεναι Τρώεσσιν Il. 9.337. Cf. Il. 2.121, Il. 11.279, Il. 16.89, Il. 19.168, 325 · Od. 3.86. With the dat. suppressed : ῥηΐτεροι πολεμίζειν (to fight with) Il. 18.258. Of single combat. With dat. : εἰ σοὶ πτολεμίξω Il. 21.463. Cf. Il. 3.435, Il. 6.42, 169, Il. 9.356, Il. 15.539. With cognate acc. : πόλεμον πολεμίζειν Il. 2.121, Il. 3.435.

A fighter, warrior Il. 5.289= Od. 3.78= Il. 22.267, Il. 5.571, 602= Il. 16.493= Il. 22.269, Il. 10.549, Il. 13.300, Il. 15.585, Il. 17.26, Il. 21.589, Il. 22.132 : Od. 24.499. With implied notion of stoutness : πολεμιστὰ μετʼ ἀνδράσιν Il. 16.492.
(1) To the fight : κηρύσσειν Il. 2.443, ὀτρύνων 589. Cf. Il. 2.872, Il. 4.264, Il. 6.209, Il. 13.186, Il. 18.452, etc. : Od. 21.39.
(2) To the war Od. 11.448.

(1) War, battle, armed conflict, fighting : πόλεμος καὶ λοιμός Il. 1.61, ἀϋτήν τε πτόλεμόν τε 492. Cf. Il. 1.422, Il. 2.384, Il. 5.388, Il. 7.328, 492, Il. 8.35, etc. : Od. 1.12, Od. 4.146, Od. 5.224, Od. 10.553, Od. 11.537, Od. 14.222, etc.

(3) A battle, armed conflict, fight (in some of the passages more or less of a local sense (field of battle) may be discerned) : ἐς πόλεμον θωρηχθῆναι (for the fray) Il. 1.226, ὁππότʼ ἄρξειαν πολέμοιο Il. 4.335, ἐκφερέμεν πολέμοιο Il. 5.234, λιπὼν πόλεμον Il. 7.254. Cf. Il. 1.491, Il. 3.435, Il. 5.132, Il. 7.480, Il. 11.524, Il. 12.436, Il. 13.11, Il. 17.735, Il. 21.610, etc. : Od. 8.519, Od. 24.43.
(4) In concrete sense, a fighting force or throng, an army or host : πόλεμον κορύσσων (setting the battle in array) Il. 2.273. Cf. Il. 9.604, Il. 13.536, etc.
(5) The art of war, war, fighting : ἰδρείῃ πολέμοιο Il. 16.359. Cf. Il. 9.440, Il. 16.811. In pl. : πολέμων ἐῢ εἰδώς Il. 4.310.
To go about, go to and fro : κατὰ ἄστυ Od. 22.223.
(1) To found (a city) : οὔ πω?̓́ιλιος ἐν πεδίῳ πεπόλιστο Od. 3.217.
(2) To build (a wall) : τεῖχος Il. 6.453.

forms: = πολίτης: κοσμησάμενος πολιήτας (the men of his own city) Il. 2.806.

defs: (1) Of an indeterminate lightish hue (app. without reference to colour), grey, greyish. Epithet of iron Il. 9.366= Il. 23.261 : Od. 21.3 = 81= Od. 24.168. Of a wolf : λύκοιο Il. 10.334. Of the sea (app. referring orig. to the light hue of shallow water) Il. 1.350, Il. 4.248, Il. 15.190, Od. 3.229, etc.: Od. 2.261, Od. 4.580, Od. 5.410, Od. 7.272, Od. 11.75, etc.

(2) In reference to hair, of the hue assumed in old age, grey or white Il. 22.77. In reference to the head or chin, covered with grey or white hair : κάρη, γένειον Il. 22.74, Il. 24.516 : κεφαλῆς Od. 24.317. In reference to men, grey- or white-headed Od. 24.499.

forms: Nom. pl. πόλιες Od. 15.412. πόληες Il. 4.45, 51 : Od. 19.174.
Genit. πολίων Il. 1.125, Il. 2.117, Il. 3.400, etc. : Od. 24.418.
Acc. pl. πόλιας Od. 8.560, 574. πόλεας Il. 4.308. πόλεις Il. 2.648, Il. 9.328, Il. 18.342, 490. πόληας Od. 17.486.
defs: (1) A town or city (cf. ἄστυ) Il. 1.19, Il. 2.12, Il. 4.4, Il. 5.473, etc. : Od. 1.170 (your native city), Od. 2.154, Od. 3.85, Od. 5.101, etc. With the name of a particular town in apposition : πόλιν τροίην Il. 1.129. Cf. Il. 2.739, Il. 7.152, Il. 9.530, Il. 11.711 : Od. 11.510. In genit. : Ἰλίου πόλιν Il. 5.642. Cf. Il. 6.345 : Od. 10.416.

(2) πόλις ἄκρη (ἀκροτάτἠ, the highest part of a city, the citadel : ἐν πόλει ἄκρῃ Il. 7.88, 297, 317, Il. 6.345, ἐν πόλει ἀκροτάτῃ Il. 22.172. Cf. Il. 7.257, Od. 3.52, Il. 22.383. So without ἄκρη · ὣς φάτʼ ἀπὸ πτόλιος θεός Il. 4.514. Cf. Il. 17.144 (see ἄστυ).
(3) With special reference to the inhabitants or community : Τρώων πόλις ἐπὶ πᾶσα βέβηκεν (the whole cityful of them) Il. 16.69, ὄφελος πτόλεΐ τε καὶ αὐτῷ Il. 17.152. Cf. Il. 3.50, Il. 24.706.
In pl., the dwellers in a town or city, the citizens : ὅθεν ἱδρεύοντο πολῖται Od. 6.131, Od. 17.206. Cf. Il. 15.558, Il. 22.429.

etym: -ή, -όν, πολύς, -ύ, πουλύς (the last fem. Il. 5.776, Il. 8.50, Il. 10.27 : Od. 4.709). From πολύς genit. πολέος Il. 4.244, Il. 5.597, Il. 23.475, 521, 562 : Od. 2.126, Od. 8.405, Od. 20.25.
defs: (1) In pl., of great number, many : πολλὰς ψυχάς (many a . . .) Il. 1.3, πολέες περ ἐόντες Il. 5.94. Cf. Il. 2.91, Il. 3.99, Il. 4.143, Il. 5.383 (many a one of us), Il. 7.296, etc. : πολλῶν ἀνθρώπων Od. 1.3, τὰ πολλὰ κατάνεται (these things, many as they are, are wasted, our great substance dwindles away) Od. 2.58 = Od. 17.537. Cf. Od. 1.4, Od. 2.166, Od. 3.262, Od. 4.3, Od. 8.217, Od. 9.352 (of the multitudes of men), etc.
(2) In sing. with nouns of multitude, consisting of many individuals, numerous, great, vast : πολὺν ὅμιλον Il. 5.334. Cf. Il. 8.472, Il. 13.472, etc. : Od. 8.109, Od. 17.67, etc.

(5) In sing., of great amount, quantity, abundance or volume, much : πολὺν λαόν Il. 2.115, πολὺς ὀρυμαγδός 810, πολλὸν φῦκος Il. 9.7. Cf. Il. 3.381, Il. 7.525, Il. 9.469, Il. 10.6, Il. 13.804, etc. : Od. 2.126, Od. 4.258, Od. 5.323, Od. 7.86, Od. 14.136, etc. Absol.: πολέος ἄξιος (ἄξιον) Il. 23.562 : Od. 8.405. So in pl. with sb. in collective sense : κρέα πολλά Il. 8.231. Cf. Il. 8.507, Il. 9.97 (much folk), 116 (many men), Il. 18.560, Il. 24.556, etc. : ἔεδνα πολλά (a great dowry) Od. 1.278, ὄψα πολλά Od. 5.267. Cf. Od. 1.112, Od. 9.266, Od. 11.379, Od. 19.64, etc.
(7) In neut. sing. πολλόν, πολύ, as adv.
(8) In neut. pl. πολλά as adv.

forms: Epithet of Odysseus Il. 9.673= Il. 10.544, Il. 11.430 : Od. 12.184.

defs: Much rushing, impetuous, violent. Epithet of war or battle : πολέμοιο Il. 1.165, Od. 3.328 : Od. 11.314. So κάματος πολυάϊξ, the weariness of many assaultsIl. 5.811.
Much blossoming, flowery : ὕλης Od. 14.353.
The object of many prayers, called upon in many prayers : θεός Od. 7.280. The subject of many prayers, longed for in many prayers : [πάϊς] Od. 19.404.
Rich in sheep : θυέστῃ Il. 2.106.
With many deeps or recesses : λιμένος Il. 1.432 : = Od. 16.324, Od. 10.125, Od. 16.352, ἁλός Od. 4.406.
Of many devices. Epithet of Athene Il. 5.260 : Od. 16.282.
Rich in oxen : ἄνδρες πολυβοῦται Il. 9.154=296.
Bringing the glad changes of the year. Epithet of ὧραι Il. 21.450.

(1) Displaying much curious workmanship, elaborately or richly wrought or adorned : θώρηκος Il. 3.358, ἀσπίδα Il. 11.32, κλισμῷ Il. 24.597, etc. : θάλαμον Od. 7.15, χρυσός Od. 13.11, ὅρμον Od. 18.295.
(2) Skilled in curious arts : σιδόνες Il. 23.743.
Bringing many tears, woeful, baleful. Epithet of war or battle : ̓́ αρηα Il. 3.132, Il. 8.516=Il. 19.318, πόλεμον Il. 3.165, Il. 22.487, ὑσμίνη Il. 17.544.
The subject of many tears, much to be wept for Il. 24.620. Accompanied by many tears, tearful : γόοιο Od. 19.213=251=Od. 21.57.
Abounding in trees, treey Od. 4.737, Od. 23.139, 359.
Having many bands or cords, held together by much cordage : σχεδίης Od. 5.33, Od. 6.264.
Dry, waterless. Epithet of Argos Il. 4.171.

forms: Bringing (her parents) a great bride-price (cf. ἀλφεσίβοιος); or perh., bountiful (cf. ἠπιόδωρος) : ἄλοχος Il. 7.394, Il. 22.88 : Od. 24.294.

defs: Having many benches : νηΐ Il. 2.293.
Gathered together from many quarters : ἐπίκουροι Il. 11.564.
Much desired or to be desired, lovely, charming, sweet : ἥβην Od. 15.366. Cf. Od. 15.126, Od. 23.126, Od. 23.354. Epithet of a place : θήβῃ Od. 11.275.
Much resounding, roaring : αἰγιαλῷ Il. 4.422. Much trilling : φωνήν Od. 19.521.
Bold, dauntless : μένος Il. 17.156, Il. 19.37 : Od. 13.387.
Great prudence or shrewdness. In pl. : νόου πολυϊδρείῃσιν Od. 2.346.

forms: Very shrewd or astute Od. 15.459, Od. 23.82.

defs: Rich in horses : μέντορος Il. 13.171.

forms: Bearing much fruit, fruitful : ἀλωή Od. 6.122. Cf. Od. 24.221.

defs: Great shrewdness, astuteness or cunning. In pl. : πολυκερδείῃσι νόοιο Od. 23.77. Cf. Od. 24.167.
Veryshrewd, astute or cunning : νόον Od. 13.255.
Much embroidered : ἱμάς Il. 3.371.
Troublous, grievous : νόστον Od. 9.37, Od. 23.351.

Written also πολυκληΐς, -ῗδος [πολυ-, πολύς + κληΐς.] App., having many rowlocks (cf. κληΐς 3). Epithet of ships B 74, 175, Il. 6.88, Il. 8.239, Il. 13.742, Il. 15.63, Il. 23.248 : Od. 8.161, Od. 20.382, Od. 23.19, Od. 23.324.
Called together from many quarters Il. 4.438, Il. 10.420.
Much surging or dashing. Epithet of the sea : πόντῳ Od. 4.354, Od. 7.204, Od. 19.277.
Much or elaborately wrought Il. 7.48 = Il. 10.379 = Il. 11.133 : = Od. 21.10, Od. 14.324. Elaborately or richly adorned : θαλάμοιο Od. 4.718.
With many mountain-spurs, hilly : Ἐτεωνόν Il. 2.497.
The rule of many Il. 2.204.
Having many possession, wealthy Il. 5.613.
Having much corn-land Il. 5.613.
Greatly longed for Od. 5.445.

forms: Rich in sheep or goats Il. 2.705, Il. 14.490.

defs: Of many counsels or devices. Epithet of Odysseus Il. 1.311, Il. 3.200, Il. 4.329, etc.: Od. 2.173, Od. 4.763, Od. 5.214, etc. Of Hephaestus Il. 21.355.
Skill or cunning in contrivance Od. 23.321.
Of many devices, resourceful, never at a loss : ἐπεὶ π. ἐστιν Od. 1.205. Epithet of Odysseus (always in voc.) Il. 2.173, etc. : Od. 5.203, Od. 24.192, etc.
Wooed by many Od. 4.770, Od. 14.64, Od. 23.149.
Of many words, having a flow of language Il. 3.214 : Od. 2.200.

etym: [πολυ-, πολύς + παιπάλη, fine flour, fig. of subtlety or wiliness.]
forms: Full of wiles, crafty : φοίνικες Od. 15.419.

defs: Full of sorrows, sorrowful, woeful Il. 9.563 : Od. 14.386, Od. 23.15.
With many springs, many-fountained. Epithet of Mount Ida Il. 8.47, Il. 14.157, Il. 15.151, etc.
In neut. pl. as adv., in right bitter fashion Od. 16.255.
Tossed about or roving from shore to shore Od. 17.425, Od. 20.195. Absol. Od. 17.511. Of the wandering wind Il. 11.308.
With many clefts or glens. Epithet of Olympus Il. 8.411, Od. 3.5. Of Mount Ida Il. 21.449, Il. 22.171.
Rich in wheat : νῆσος Od. 15.406. Of places Il. 11.756, Il. 15.372 : Od. 14.335=Od. 19.292, Od. 16.396.
Rich in sheep Il. 9.154 = 296.
Widely dispersed, spread over the face of the earth : ἀνθρώπων Il. 2.804. Cf. Od. 11.365.
Rich in grapes Il. 2.507, 537.
Much sighing, full of sorrows Od. 19.118. Causing many sighs, grievous, baneful Il. 1.445, Il. 11.73, Il. 15.451.
Much enduring, stout, unflinching. Epithet of Odysseus Il. 8.97, Il. 9.676= Il. 10.248, Il. 23.729, 778 : Od. 5.171, Od. 7.1, Od. 6.1, Od. 8.446, etc.

forms: = πολύτλας. : θυμός Il. 6.152 : πολυτλήμων εἰμί Od. 18.319.
That has suffered much, torn by suffering : γέροντες Od. 11.38.

defs: Haunted by pigeons Il. 2.502, 582.
Full of holes : σπόγγοισιν Od. 1.111, Od. 22.439, 453.
Of many devices, resourceful. Epithet of Odysseu Od. 1.1, Od. 10.330.
(1) Conversant with drugs or medicaments Il. 16.28.
(2) Knowing many charms or spells Od. 10.276.
(1) Where many voices are heard, voiceful : ἀγορήν Od. 2.150.
(2) Knowing many tales or songs : ἀοιδός Od. 22.376.
Loud sounding, voiceful. Epithet of the sea Il. 1.34, Il. 2.209, Il. 7.347, Il. 9.182, Il. 13.798, Il. 23.59 : Od. 13.85, 220.
That feeds many. Epithet of the earth: γαῖαν πολυφόρβην Il. 9.568, πολυφόρβου γαίης Il. 14.200, 301.

Of great intelligence or sense, sensible, discreet. Absol. : ἐφέηκε πολύφρονά περ χαλεπῆναι Il. 18.108. Cf. Od. 14.464. As epithet of Hephaestus, of high intellectual capacity, ingenious, skilful Il. 21.367 : Od. 8.297, 327. In sim. sense as epithet of Odysseus Od. 1.83 = Od. 14.424 = Od. 20.239  =  Od. 21.204, Od. 20.329.
(1) Rich in bronze Il. 10.315. Of place Il. 18.289 : Od. 15.425.
(2) Fig. of the heavens (cf. χάλκεον οὐρανόν Il. 17.425) Il. 5.504 : Od. 3.2.
Rich in gold Il. 10.315. Of places Il. 6.180, Il. 11.46, Il. 18.289 : Od. 3.304.
With many openings or meshes. Epithet of a net : δικτύῳ Od. 22.386.
One who conducts, escorts, sees safe, a guide, escort, protector : οἵ τοι πομπῆες ἔσονται Od. 3.325. Cf. Od. 3.376, Od. 4.362, Od. 13.71, Od. 20.364.
To conduct, escort, see safe : αὐτή μιν πόμπευον Od. 13.422.

(2) A dispatching or speeding on one's way, an arranging for or presiding over one's departure : ὄφρα πομπῆς τύχῃς Od. 7.290, οὐκέτι φαίνετο π. (i.e. they had lost their favouring wind) Od. 10.79. Cf. Od. 5.173, 233, Od. 6.151, 191, 317, Od. 8.30, 31, 33, 545, Od. 9.518, Od. 10.18, Od. 11.332, 352, 357, Od. 13.41, Od. 19.313.

One who conducts, conveys, escorts, sees safe, a guide, escort, protector : τῷ ἅμα πομπὸν ἕπεσθαι Od. 4.162. Cf. Il. 13.416, Il. 16.671, 681, Il. 24.153, 182, 437, 439, 461 : Od. 4.826, Od. 8.566 = Od. 13.174.
(1) To labour or work with one's hands, work, toil : ὅπλα, τοῖς ἐπονεῖτο Il. 18.413. Cf. Il. 6.442 : Od. 16.13, Od. 20.159 (did their work).
(2) To work at : ὄφρα ταῦτα πονεῖτο Il. 18.380. To produce by work, make, construct : τύμβον Il. 23.245.

(3) To be busy, be much occupied, busy oneself, have or engage in toil or labour, exert oneself : ᾔδεε ἀδελφεὸν ὡς ἐπονεῖτο Il. 2.409. Cf. Il. 9.12, 348, Il. 10.70, 116, 117, 121 : Od. 9.250 = 310 = 343, Od. 17.258 and Od. 20.281 (the attendants).
(4) To be busied or engaged, busy oneself (with or about something) : πεπόνητο καθʼ ἵππους (i.e. they were taking up all his attention) Il. 15.447. Cf. Il. 24.444.
(5) To busy oneself about, be engaged or engage oneself in, see to : τάδʼ ἀμφὶ πονησόμεθα Il. 23.159. Cf. Od. 15.222, Od. 22.377. To attend to, look to, set in order : ὅπλα Od. 11.9, Od. 12.151.

(6) To be engaged in the toil and moil of war, take part in the fight, fight : ὅ μιν ἴδοντο πονεύμενον (at work with his spear) Il. 4.374, πονέοντο καθʼ ὑσμίνην Il. 5.84=627. Cf. Il. 13.288, Od. 3.359.

(1) Labour, toil, work, trouble : ἐπεὶ παύσαντο πόνου Il. 1.467 = Il. 2.430=Il. 6.319. Cf. Il. 4.26, 57, Il. 5.567 (all they had gone through), 667 (they were too busy), Il. 7.77 (the chief burden), Il. 10.164 : Od. 2.334, Od. 8.529, Od. 11.54 (they had so many other things to attend to), Od. 16.478 = Od. 24.384, Od. 23.249. In pl., toils, troubles, difficulties : τὸν Ζεὺς ἐνέηκε πόνοισιν Il. 10.89. Cf. Il. 10.245, 279: Od. 4.818, Od. 13.301, Od. 20.48.
(2) Hardship, suffering, distress : ἄνευθε πόνου καὶ ἀνίης Od. 6.192. Cf. Il. 22.488 : Od. 13.423. So, app., πότε κέν τις ἀναπνεύσειε πόνοιο; Il. 19.227 (referring to the hardship of fasting).

(3) Referring specially to the toil and moil of war, war, fighting : καὶ πόνος ἐστὶν ἀνιηθέντα νέεσθαι (we have e'en had fighting enough to disgust a man and send him home) Il. 2.291, ἰαχή τε π. τε Il. 4.456. Cf. Il. 2.420, Il. 5.517, Il. 7.525 (have to bear this heavy burden of war), Od. 11.430, Il. 12.348, Il. 13.2, Il. 14.480, Il. 15.416 (fought their fight), Il. 21.137, Il. 22.11 (app., the slaughtering of them), etc. : Od. 12.117.
(4) In concrete sense, a fighting throng : ἔβη ἂμ πόνον ἀνδρῶν Il. 13.239=Il. 16.726=Il. 17.82. The field of battle : φέρον ἐκ πόνου Il. 14.429. Cf. Il. 17.718.
(5) The result of toil, weariness Il. 7.355.

forms: From the open sea : κῦμα ποντόθεν ὀρνύμενον Il. 14.395.
Towards the open sea, seawards : φέρεν π. θύελλα Od. 10.48.
Into the sea : π. βαλὼν βέλος Od. 9.495.

defs: To traverse the sea, sail the sea Od. 5.277, 278, Od. 6.267.
Cleaving the seas. Epithet of ships Il. 1.439, Il. 2.771, Il. 3.46, etc. : Od. 12.69, Od. 14.339, Od. 15.284, etc.

etym: -ου, ὁ. Ablative ποντόφιν Od. 24.83. The sea, the deep sea, the high sea, the open sea Il. 1.350, Il. 2.145, 665, Il. 3.47, Il. 4.276, etc.: Od. 1.4, Od. 2.263, Od. 3.15, Od. 4.359, Od. 6.109, etc.
forms: With ἅλς · π. ἁλός (the deep of the sea) Il. 21.59.
Distinguished in terms from the land : πείρατα γαίης καὶ πόντοιο Il. 8.479. Cf. Od. 4.821, Od. 5.294, Od. 16.367, etc.
From the heavens : ἐξ αἰθέρος ἔμπεσε πόντῳ Od. 5.50. Cf. Il. 14.258.

Always with ὦ (ὤ, expressing contextually surprise, a being struck by something, grief, anger, remonstrance, rebuke, disappointment, a being balked of something, a drawing of special attention to something, or the likeIl. 1.254, Il. 2.272 (look you now!), Il. 8.427 (ah well !), Il. 13.99, Il. 15.467 (ah me !), Il. 16.745 (see now !), Il. 17.171, Il. 22.373 (why, look you !), etc. : Od. 1.32 (to see now how . . . !), Od. 4.169, 333, Od. 5.286, Od. 9.507, Od. 10.38, etc.

defs: To sack or ravage (a town or land) Il. 4.308 : Od. 14.264= Od. 17.433.
A ferryman Od. 20.187.
A narrow strip of water, a channel : ἐν πορθμῷ?̓ιθάκης τε σάμοιό τε (between . . . and . . .) Od. 4.671=Od. 15.29.
In a spear, a metal ferrule, or perh. a lashing of wire, securing the tongue of the head (see καυλός 1.a) in the shaft Il. 7.320= Il. 8.495.

forms: A place where a river may be passed, a ford Il. 2.592, Il. 14.433=Il. 21.1=Il. 24.692.–πόροι ἁλός, the paths of the seaOd. 12.259.
Nom. sing. fem. fut. pple. πορσανέουσα Il. 3.411. Also πορσύνω.
defs: Of a wife, to prepare (and share) (her husband's bed) : κείνου πορσανέουσα λέχος Il. 3.411 : τῷ ἄλοχος λέχος πόρσυνεν Od. 3.403. Cf. Od. 6.347.
A calf Il. 5.162.

(1) Of disturbed water, gleaming, glancing : πορφύρεον κῦμα ποταμοῖο Il. 21.326, ἀμφὶ κῦμα στείρῃ πορφύρεον μεγάλʼ ἴαχεν (flashing as it fell off on each side of the cutwater) Il. 1.482 := Od. 2.428. Cf. Il. 16.391 : Od. 11.243, Od. 13.85 (the white wake). So in reference to the light reflected from (the irregular surface of) a cloud : πορφυρέῃ νεφέλῃ πυκάσασα ἕ αὐτήν Il. 17.551. Applied to the sinister gleam figured to play on (the cloud or mist of) death : πορφύρεος θάνατος Il. 5.83=Il. 16.334=Od. 3.477. To the lurid gleam of the rainbow set against a storm-cloud : πορφυρέην ἶριν Il. 17.547. To the warm hue of blood : αἵματι πορφυρέῳ Il. 17.361.

(2) Of bright hue, bright, brilliant, gay : δίπλακα Il. 3.126, Il. 22.441, φᾶρος Il. 8.221, τάπησιν Il. 9.200, ῥήγεα Il. 24.645, πέπλοισιν 796 : χλαῖναν Od. 4.115=154, Od. 19.225, ῥήγεα Od. 4.298=Od. 6.337, Od. 10.353, φᾶρος Od. 8.84, σφαῖραν 373, δίπλακα Od. 19.242, τάπητας Od. 20.151.
Of the disturbed sea, to heave Il. 14.16. Fig., of the heart, to be troubled, moved, stirred : πολλά οἱ κραδίη πόρφυρεν Il. 21.551. Cf. Od. 4.427 = 572=Od. 10.309.

forms: 3 sing. subj. πόρῃ Il. 7.228 : Od. 22.7. πόρῃσι Od. 2.186, Od. 16.77, Od. 20.335.
Pple. πεπρωμένος, -ου Il. 3.309, Il. 15.209, Il. 16.441, Il. 22.179.
defs: (1) To give, put into another's hands, hand to him : σήματα λυγρά Il. 7.168.

(2) To give, make another the owner of, present, make a present of : ξεινήϊα Il. 7.218, τεύχεα Il. 6.146. Cf. Il. 10.546, Il. 11.353, Il. 15.441, Il. 16.86, 143=Il. 19.390, Il. 17.196, Il. 19.21, Il. 23.92, 277, 540, 893, Il. 24.234 : Od. 2.186, Od. 4.130, 617, Od. 9.267, Od. 16.77, etc. To cause (a woman) to conceive (a child) : πόρεν οἱ ἀγλαὸν υἱόν Il. 16.185.
(3) To pay (a bride-price or ransom) : ἀπερείσια ἕδνα Il. 16.178, λύμην τρὶς τόσσα πορών Il. 21.80. Cf. Il. 16.190, Il. 22.472 : Od. 11.282, Od. 19.529.
(4) To give in marriage : ἀνδρὶ πόρον παράκοιτιν Il. 24.60. Cf. Od. 10.7. Sim. in reference to a concubine Il. 9.667.

(5) To give, furnish, supply, to another for his use or to meet his needs : φάρμακα Il. 4.219 : Od. 4.228, σῖτον καὶ μέθυ 745. Cf. Od. 5.321, 372, Od. 7.228, Od. 8.477, Od. 9.360, Od. 10.302, Od. 12.302, Od. 14.460, Od. 19.255. To administer (a drug) : φάρμακον Od. 10.394.

(6) Of immaterial things, to give, grant, allow, bestow, confer : μαντοσύνην Il. 1.72. Cf. Il. 24.30 : Od. 10.494, Od. 20.71, Od. 22.7. To inflict or send (evil) : κακά Od. 9.460, πένθος Od. 19.512. To send (death) Od. 18.202.
(7) With infin., to grant, allow : πόρε Διὸς κούρῃσιν ἕπεσθαι τιμήν (let them have their meed of honour) Il. 9.513. With the infin. suppressed : κτείνειν ὅν κε θεός γε πόρῃ Il. 7.228.

(8) In pf. pass., to be decreed by fate, to be fated or destined : ὁπποτέρῳ θανάτοιο τέλος πεπρωμένον ἐστίν Il. 3.309. Impers. with acc. and infin.: ἄμφω πέπρωται ὁμοίην γαῖαν ἐρεῦσαι Il. 18.329. Of a person, to be fated, to have his lot or portion fixed, in a specified way (see αἶσα 4) : ὁμῇ πεπρωμένον αἴσῃ Il. 15.209. Cf. Il. 16.441=Il. 22.179.

forms: Whither ? πόσε φεύγετε; Il. 16.422 : Od. 7.199, πόσʼ ἴμεν; Od. 10.431.
In neut., a temple of Poseidon : Od. 7.266.

defs: For how many days? In indirect question Il. 24.657.

forms: Which in a series of numbers? πόστον ἔτος ἐστίν, ὅτε . .; (how many years is it since . . .?) Od. 24.288.
To, towards or into the or a river Il. 21.13, 120 : Od. 10.159.

defs: (1) A river Il. 2.861, Il. 5.87, Il. 7.508, Il. 12.18, Il. 15.691, etc. : Od. 4.477, Od. 5.441, Od. 7.59, Od. 6.281, Od. 10.351, etc. With the name of a particular river added, the river . . . : ποταμὸν κηφισόν Il. 2.522. Cf. Il. 2.659, Il. 5.544, Il. 11.499, etc. : Od. 14.258=Od. 17.427. Of ocean : ποταμοῖο ῥέεθρα Ὠκεανοῦ Il. 14.245. Cf. Il. 18.607, Od. 3.7 : Od. 11.639, Od. 12.1.
(2) Personified, a river-god : ποταμοὶ καὶ γαῖα, ὑμεῖς μάρτυροι ἔστε Il. 3.278. Cf. Il. 5.544, Od. 3.7, Il. 21.136, etc. : Od. 11.238.

To fly about, fly hither and thither : αἱ μέν τʼ ἔνθα ἅλις πεποτήαται, αἱ δέ τε ἔνθα (are on the wing) Il. 2.90, ἔνθα καὶ ἔνθα ποτῶνται 462 : ψυχὴ ἀποπταμένη πεπότηται (hovers about) Od. 11.222, ὡς ὅτε νυκτερίδες ποτέονται Od. 24.7.

forms: When? πότʼ ᾤχετο; Od. 4.642. Cf. Il. 19.227.

defs: (2) In negative or conditional contexts, at any time, ever : εἴ ποτε δὴ αὖτε χρειὼ ἐμεῖο γένηται Il. 1.340. Cf. Il. 1.155, 166, 490, Il. 2.202, Il. 4.410, Il. 5.700, Il. 10.453, etc. : οὐδέ ποτʼ ἔσβη οὖρος Od. 3.182. Cf. Od. 2.26, 203, Od. 3.127, Od. 4.360, 566, Od. 5.39, 151, Od. 8.562, etc. With οὐ. See οὐ 8.a and

forms: In pl. in an indirect question, which of two groups: οὐκ ἂν γνοίης ποτέροισι μετείη Il. 5.85.
App., flight : ποτῇ ἀνεδύσετο λίμνης (flew up from . . .) Od. 5.337.
Absol. in neut. pl., birds : τῇ οὐδὲ ποτητὰ παρέρχεται Od. 12.62.

defs: (I) Adv. Besides, in addition, too : ποτὶ δʼ ἄσπετα δῶρα δίδωμι Od. 20.342. Cf. Il. 10.108, Il. 16.86.
(II) Prep. (With anastrophe when immediately following the case-form.)

(1) To wait for (a coming or expected event or person), await, look out for : ἐμὴν ὁρμήν Il. 10.123. Cf. Il. 19.234 : ἡμέας Od. 9.545. Cf. Od. 2.403, Od. 6.161, Od. 24.396. With clause : ποτιδέγμενοι ὁππότʼ ἄρʼ ἔλθοι Il. 6.415. Cf. Od. 23.91. Absol. : ποτιδέγμενοι ἤματα πάντα (waiting on here indefinitely) Od. 2.205, Od. 21.156. Cf. Il. 2.137 and Il. 9.628 (looking for our coming). To await or anticipate with apprehension : ἀγγελίην Il. 19.336. Cf. Od. 22.380.
(2) To expect, look for, the receipt of (something) : δῶρον Od. 2.186.
Available for, ready to be taken at or to be used in connexion with, one's evening meal Od. 9.234, 249.

forms: To come, be brought, to a specified place : ἐς Ὀρχομενόν Il. 9.381.
Nom. pl. fem. pf. pple. ποτιπεπτηυῖαι.
defs: To crouch down towards. With genit.: ἀκταὶ λιμένος ποτιπεπτηυῖαι (sinking down in front of it and so closing it in) Od. 13.98.

forms: To engage agreeably the attention of, entertain Il. 15.401.

etym: [ποτι-, προσ- 3 + φωνήεις in sim.  sense fr. φωνή.]
defs: Endowed with speech : εἰ ποτιφωνήεις γένοιο Od. 9.456.
(1) What befalls one, one's lot or fate : δ̀ν πότμον γοόωσα Il. 16.857 = Il. 22.363. Cf. Od. 10.245.

(2) Evil fate or destiny, bane, death : θάνατον καὶ πότμον Il. 2.359, Il. 15.495, Od. 3.337, εἰ πότμον ἀναπλήσῃς βιότοιο (a fate that ends thy life) Il. 4.170. Cf. Il. 4.396, Il. 7.412, Il. 6.52, Il. 11.263, Il. 18.96, Il. 21.588, Il. 22.39 : Od. 2.250, Od. 3.16 (the manner of his death), Od. 4.196, 339, 562, Od. 11.197, Od. 19.550, Od. 24.471, etc.

forms: =πότνια. πότνα θεά, mighty goddessOd. 5.215, Od. 13.391, Od. 20.61.

etym: [ποτ- as in δεσπότης, master. Cf. δέσποινα.]
defs: (1) Mistress, queen : πότνια θηρῶν,?̓́αρτεμις Il. 21.470.
(2) As a title of honour.
Something drunk or to be drunk, drink, liquor Il. 1.470, Il. 11.630, Il. 9.175 :=Od. 1.148=Od. 3.339=Od. 21.271, Od. 2.341, Od. 9.205, 348, 354.

(1) In what place? where? ποῦ τοι τόξον; Il. 5.171. Cf. Il. 10.406, 407 (twice), Il. 13.770, 772, Il. 15.440, Od. 3.83 : Od. 3.249, Od. 7.277, Od. 20.193, Od. 24.299. Carrying on an indirect question : ἐρέσθαι ὁππόθεν οὗτος ἀνήρ ... ποῦδέ νύ οἱ γενεή Od. 1.407.
(2) Whither? where? ποῦ τοι ἀπειλαὶ οἴχονται; Il. 13.219.
(2) In negative or conditional contexts, anywhere : οὐδέ τί που ἴδμεν ξυνήϊα Il. 1.124. Cf. Il. 7.330, Il. 19.327, etc.: εἴ που ὄπωπας Od. 3.93. Cf. Od. 6.320, Od. 11.458, Od. 14.44, etc.
(3) Somehow, haply: ἤν πού τι φόως γένωμαι Il. 16.39. Cf. Il. 6.39, Il. 15.571, etc.: Od. 4.512, Od. 13.418, etc.

(4) In negative or conditional contexts, in any way, haply: εἴ τί που ἔστιν Od. 4.193, μή πού τις ἐπαγγείλῃσιν 775. Cf. Il. 9.371, Il. 10.511, Il. 11.366, Il. 13.293, etc.: Od. 2.71, Od. 10.486, Od. 12.300, Od. 15.403, etc.

(5) Qualifying an expression, haply, I ween, no doubt, as it would seem: θεός που σοὶ τό γʼ ἔδωκεν Il. 1.178, οὕτω που διὶ μέλλει φίλον εἶναι Il. 2.116. Cf. Il. 3.43, Il. 7.438, Il. 9.628, Il. 10.326, etc.: οἵ πού μʼ ἀσχαλόωσι μένοντες Od. 1.304, Ζηνός που τοιήδε γ' αὐλή Od. 4.74. Cf. Od. 2.164, Od. 4.756, Od. 7.155, Od. 8.255, Od. 11.139, etc. Sim. in questions, direct and indirect, can it be that? haply, it may be that: οὕτω που ἔλπεαι υἷας Ἀχαιῶν ἀπτολέμους ἔμεναι; Il. 9.40, ἤ ῤ̔ ἔτι που σχήσουσιν  Ἕκτορα Il. 11.820. Cf. Il. 13.456, etc.: Od. 7.125, 200, Od. 8.584, Od. 13.234, etc.
That feeds many. Epithet of the earth Il. 3.89, 265, Il. 7.213, Il. 8.73, 277, Il. 12.158, etc.: Od. 8.378, Od. 12.191, Od. 19.408. Of Achaeïs Il. 11.770.
The sea-polypus, the octopus or cuttle-fish Od. 5.432.

(1) One of the feet, one's foot; in dual and pl., the feet, one's feet: χωλὸς ἕτερον πόδα Il. 2.217, ὑπὸ ποσσίν Il. 8.443, οὐδὲ χθόνα μάρπτε ποδοῖιν Il. 14.228. Cf. Il. 1.591, Il. 2.44, Il. 9.523 (i.e. their coming hither), Il. 13.205, Il. 19.92, etc.: Od. 1.96, Od. 4.149, Od. 7.39 (on foot), Od. 15.45, Od. 20.365, Od. 22.20, etc. Of animals. Of horses Il. 2.466, Il. 5.504, Il. 9.124, Il. 13.36, Il. 16.794, etc. Of mules Il. 23.121: Od. 7.318. Of dogs Od. 19.228 (in his paws). Cf. Il. 8.339: Od. 19.444. Of oxen Od. 3.497: Od. 20.299, Od. 22.290. Of deer Il. 11.476: Od. 10.168, Od. 19.231. Of birds Il. 23.854, 866: Od. 15.526 (in its claws).

(2) With special reference to speed in running or in the race: ποσὶν οὔ πως ἔστιν ἐρίζειν (in swiftness of foot) Il. 13.325. Cf. Il. 15.642, Od. 3.410, Il. 22.160, Il. 23.444, 792, etc.: Od. 8.103, 206 (in the race), 230, etc.

(3) πόδας ὠκύς, swift-footed. Epithet of Achilles Il. 1.58, 84, 148, 215, 364, 489, Il. 9.196, Il. 11.112, etc. Of Orsilochus Od. 13.260. Sim.: πόδας ταχύς. Of Achilles Il. 13.348, Il. 17.709, Il. 18.354, 358. Of Meriones Il. 13.249. Of Aeneas Il. 13.482. Of Antilochus Il. 18.2.–πόδας ὠκέα as epithet of Iris Il. 2.790, 795, Il. 8.425, etc. Epithets of animals. Of the hare: πόδας ταχὺς πτώξ Il. 17.676. Of the dog: κύνες πόδας ἀργοί Il. 18.578: Od. 2.11. Of the horse: πόδας αἰόλος ἵππος Il. 19.404.
(4) A projecting spur of a hill: ὑπαὶ πόδα νείατον?̓́ιδης Il. 2.824. Cf. Od. 3.59.
(5) A sheet of a sail, a rope or strap attached to one of the lower corners of it and used to extend it or alter its direction Od. 5.260, Od. 10.32.
(1) The midriff: βάλʼ (ἔβαλʼ̓ ἧπαρ ὑπὸ πραπίδων Il. 11.579=Il. 13.412=Il. 17.349.
(2) The heart, breast, soul, mind, as the seat or a seat
(b) Of the faculty of contriving, devising, designing, of ingenuity: ποίησεν ἰδυίῃσι πραπίδεσσιν Il. 1.608. Cf. Il. 18.380, 482, Od. 3.12: Od. 6.92.
(c) Of the emotions, of grief or sorrow: ἦ κέ μοι αἰνὸν ἀπὸ πραπίδων ἄχος ἔλθοι Il. 22.43. Cf. Il. 24.514.

forms: A bed of herbs Od. 6.127, Od. 24.247.

defs: To be pre-eminent, conspicuous, distinguished, noted: ἔπρετε καὶ διὰ πάντων Il. 12.104. Cf. Od. 8.172, Od. 18.2 (was noted for his ...).
(1) The eldest: π. Διὸς θυγάτηρ?̓́ατη Il. 19.91. Cf. Od. 3.452.
(2) That is senior in dignity. Of Here: π. θεά, queen of heavenIl. 5.721=Il. 8.383, Il. 14.194 = 243.
A meed of honour: πρώτῳ τοι μετʼ ἐμὲ π. ἐν χερὶ θήσω Il. 8.289.
The first-born: π. Ἀντηνορίσης (the first-born son of ...) Il. 11.249.
(1) Comp. πρεσβύτερος, the elder: πρεσβύτερος σύ ὲσσι Il. 11.787. A bsol. in pl., the elders, the seniors: πρεσβυ-  τέροισιν Ἐρινύες αἰὲν ἕπονται Il. 15.204.

(2) Superl. πρεσβύτατος, the first-born, the eldest: πρεσβυτά-την με τέκετο κρόνος (app. with an admixture of the sense senior in dignity) Il. 4.59, πρεσβύτατος γενεῇ Il. 7.24. Cf. Il. 11.740. Absol.: πρεσβυτάτην ὤπυιε θυγατρῶν Il. 13.429. Cf. Il. 21.143: Od. 13.142 (he must mean, after himself. He is represented as the elder in Il. 15.204 cited under (1)).

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἔπρησε Od. 2.427. πρῆσε Il. 1.481, Il. 16.350.
Nom. pl. masc. pple. πρήσαντες Il. 6.429, 432.
defs: (1) Of wind, to blow into, swell by blowing: ἔπρησεν ἄνεμος ἱστίον Od. 2.427. Cf. Il. 1.481.
(2) To eject by blowing, spirt out: αἷμʼ ἀνὰ στόμα Il. 16.350.
(3) To burn, consume (with or in fire): πυρὸς θύρετρα (genit. of material) Il. 2.415. Cf. Il. 6.429, 432.
(1) A doer: ἔργων Il. 9.443.
(2) A trader or trafficker Od. 8.162.

etym: [προ- 1 + ἠν-, face. Cf. ἀπηνής, ὑπηνήτης. With the face forward.]
forms: Of inanimate objects, to utter ruin or destruction: πρηνὲς βαλέειν Πριάμοιο μέλαθρον Il. 2.414.

defs: (1) Accomplishment, result, issue: οὔ τις πρῆξις πέλεται γόοιο (no profit comes of it) Il. 24.524: οὔ τις πρῆξις ἐγίγνετο μυρομένοισιν (their weeping profited them nothing) Od. 10.202=568.
(2) An affair or business Od. 3.72=Od. 9.253, Od. 3.82.

forms: Acc. sing. masc. pple. πρήξαντα Od. 3.60.
defs: (1) To pass over, traverse: ἅλα Od. 9.491. To traverse a space, pass, advance, make one's way: ἵνα πρήσσωμεν (ἵνα πρήσσῃσιν̓ (ὄφρα πρήσσωμεν̓ ὁδοῖο (local genit., may get upon our (his) way) Il. 24.264: Od. 3.476, Od. 15.47, 219. To accomplish (a journey or course): κέλευθον Il. 14.282, Il. 23.501: Od. 13.83.

(2) To accomplish, do, carry out, effect, perform: πρῆξαι οὔ τι δυνήσεαι Il. 1.562, οὔ τι πρήξεις ἀκαχήμενος υἷος (it will profit you nothing to mourn for him) Il. 24.550. Cf. Il. 11.552=Il. 17.661: ἐὺ πρήσσεσκον ἕκαστα (were charged with the due arrangements) Od. 8.259. Cf. Od. 2.191, Od. 3.60, Od. 16.88, Od. 19.324. Absol.: ἔπρηξας καὶ ἔπειτα (you have got your way after all) Il. 18.357.
To buy, acquire by purchase Od. 1.430, Od. 14.115, 452, Od. 15.483.

(1) Before, heretofore, theretofore, in time past, formerly: ὡς πρίν Il. 2.344, καὶ πρίν περ μεμαώς Il. 5.135, μένος δ πρὶν ἔχεσκες 472. Cf. Il. 3.132, 430, Il. 5.127, Il. 9.523, etc.: Od. 3.408, Od. 4.212, 724, Od. 5.334, Od. 7.4, Od. 10.393, Od. 11.484, etc. So τὸ πρίν Il. 5.54, Il. 7.125, Il. 9.403, Il. 13.105, etc.: Od. 4.32, 518.

(2) Before the arrival of a specified or indicated time past or future, earlier, sooner: πρίν μιν καὶ γῆρας ἔπεισιν (ere that) Il. 1.29, πρὶν ὑποφθὰς δουρὶ περόνησεν (before he could use his club) Il. 6.144, πρὶν κνέφας ἦλθεν Il. 8.500. Cf. Il. 6.390, Il. 9.250, Il. 14.424, Il. 18.283, Il. 23.190 (before the due time), Il. 24.551, etc.: Od. 2.198, Od. 3.117, Od. 11.632, Od. 13.427, Od. 14.334, Od. 21.36, etc. So τὸ πρίν Il. 15.72.
(3) With or without τό, up to a point of time, so long: τὸ πρὶν μὲν ἀναίνετο Od. 3.265, πρὶν οὔ τι νεμεσσητὸν κεχολῶσθαι Od. 22.59.

(4) With aor. infin., before ... ing ...: πρὶν γνώμεναι Il. 2.348, πρὶν ἐλθεῖν υἶας Ἀχαιῶν (before their coming) Il. 9.403. Cf.
