Il. 1.98, Il. 4.115, Il. 7.81, Il. 8.453, Il. 12.172, Il. 15.588, etc.: Od. 1.210, Od. 2.128, Od. 4.255, Od. 7.288, Od. 10.385, Od. 13.124, Od. 15.210, etc. So with ἤ: πρίν γʼ ἢ ἕτερόν γʼ αἵματος ἆσαι?̓́αρηα Il. 5.288, Il. 22.266. With pres. infin.: πρὶν ... ἄγειν θʼ ἑκατόμβην Il. 1.98. Cf. Od. 19.475.
(5) With subj.: πρίν γʼ ἔμʼ ἴδηαι Il. 18.135. Cf. Il. 18.190, Il. 24.781: Od. 10.175, Od. 13.336, Od. 17.9. Cf. πρὶν ὥρη [ἔῃ] Od. 15.394. With opt.: πρὶν πειρήσαιτʼ Ἀχιλῆος Il. 21.580.
(6) With ὅτε.
(b) With ἄν and subj.: πρίν γʼ ὅτʼ ἄν ἑνδεκάτη γένηται Od. 2.374. Cf. Od. 4.477.
(c) With opt.: πρίν γʼ ὅτε σʼ ὄψου ἄσαιμι Il. 9.488.

(7) In two co-ordinate clauses, anticipatory in the first and resuming in the second: οὐδʼ ὅ γε πρὶν λοιγὸν ἀπώσει, πρίν γʼ ἀπὸ πατρὶ δόμεναι κούρην Il. 1.97. Cf. Il. 2.348, Il. 6.481, Il. 18.189, Il. 24.781, etc.: Od. 4.254, 475, Od. 19.475, etc.

forms: Sawn, cut or fashioned with the saw: ἐλέφαντος Od. 18.196, Od. 19.564.

defs: (I) Adv.
(II) Prep. with genit.
Sloping, forming a declivity: χώρῳ Il. 21.262.
(1) To go forward: ἄστρα προβέβηκεν (have got far forward in their course) Il. 10.252.

(2) To go before, advance in front of. With genit.: πολὺ προβέβηκας ἁπάντων Il. 7.125. In pf. of the state or condition of going before; hence, to be pre-eminent, to excel, surpass; ὅ τε κράτεϊ προβεβήκῃ (in ...) Il. 16.54. With genit.: ὅσον προβέβηκας ἁπάντων Il. 23.890.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. προ-βαλόντες Il. 11.529.
3 pl. aor. mid. προβάλοντο Il. 1.458, Il. 2.421, Il. 23.255: Od. 3.447.
defs: (1) To throw forward or forth: νότος βορέῃ προ-βάλεσκε [σχεδίην] (surrendered it) Od. 5.331. In mid.: ἐπεὶ οὐλοχύτας προβάλοντο (had sprinkled them) Il. 1.458=Il. 2.421: =Od. 3.447. Fig.: ἔριδα προ-βαλόντες (app., throwing it forward, dashing forward in combat) Il. 11.529 (cf. Il. 3.7 cited under προφέρω 2).

(2) To throw before or in front. In mid.: θεμείλια προβάλοντο (set them in the face of the mound) Il. 23.255. Hence, in mid., to excel, surpass. With genit.: σεῖό κε νοήματι προβαλοίμην (in ...) Il. 19.218.
Cattle, flocks and herds Il. 14.124, Il. 23.550.

forms: To advance: ὑπασπίσια προβιβῶντι (προβιβῶντος) Il. 13.807, Il. 16.609. (With προβιβάντι, προβιβάντος from προβίβημι. as uu. ll.)
To stride along forwards, make one's way or advance with a stride: κραιπνὰ ποσὶ προβιβάς Il. 13.18. Cf. Il. 13.158: Od. 15.555, Od. 17.27. (And see προβιβάω.)

defs: Projecting, jutting out: σκοπέλῳ Il. 2.396, στήλας Il. 12.259, πέτρῃ Il. 16.407: ἀκταί Od. 5.405, Od. 10.89, Od. 13.97.

forms: To go or come forward or forth: τὴν ἴδε προμολοῦσα χάρις Il. 18.382. Cf. Il. 18.392, Il. 21.37 (making a descent upon it): Od. 4.22, Od. 15.468, Od. 19.25 (to leave their quarters), Od. 21.239 = 385, Od. 24.388.
To shout in front: προ-βοῶντε μάχην ὤτρυνον Ἀχαιῶν (cheering their followers on) Il. 12.277.

defs: A projecting rock: ἐπὶ προβόλῳ Od. 12.251.
To rank before, prefer. With genit.: κλυταιμνήστρης [μιν] προβέβουλα (prefer her to ...) Il. 1.113.

etym: [comp. of προγενής, fr. προ- 3 + γεν-, γίγνομαι. Born before.]
defs: (1) Older: ὁ γὰρ προγενέστερος ἦεν Il. 2.555. Cf. Il. 9.161, Il. 23.789: Od. 2.29, Od. 4.205, Od. 19.244.
(2) Old rather than young: ὃς Φαιήκων προγενέστερος ἦεν (was an elder among the ...) Od. 6.156=Od. 11.343, οὐδʼ οἳ προγενέστεροι ἦσαν (the elders among us) Od. 24.160.
To come forward, appear, come in sight Il. 18.525.

etym: [προ- 3 + γον-, γεν-, γίγνομαι. Those born before.]

defs: To know something beforehand: μή πώς με προδαεὶς ἀλέηται (forming a suspicion) Od. 4.396.
A place where one may lie in wait, a lurking-place. In pl.: δεδεγμένος ἐν προδοκῇσιν Il. 4.107.

A space in front of the door of the μέγαρον, app. the part of the line of the αἴθουσα into which the door opened: εὗρεν ἐνὶ προδόμῳ δέπα Od. 15.466. Cf. Il. 9.473 (see θάλαμος 1.a). Used as a sleeping-place for visitors Il. 24.673 (Priam and the herald in Achilles's dwelling):=Od. 4.302 (Telemachus and Pisistratus in Menelaus's house) (cf. Il. 24.644:=Od. 4.297). Cf. Od. 15.5, Od. 20.1 (the disguised Odysseus in his own house), 143 (the same in the same). A space in front of the door of the dwelling of Eumaeus Od. 14.5.

forms: To stand in front of someone and debar (him from doing something).
With infin.: πάντας προέεργε ἐπὶ νῆας ὁδεύειν Il. 11.569.
3 pl. aor. subj. mid. προΐδωνται Od. 13.155.
defs: (1) To direct one's glance forward, look forward or before one: ὀξὺ μάλα προϊδών Od. 5.393. Cf. Il. 22.275.
(2) To catch sight of, descry, see: τὰ προϊδόντες Il. 18.527. Cf. Il. 17.756. In mid. Od. 13.155.
(3) To catch sight of beforehand: μή πώς με προϊδὼν ἀλέηται (catching sight of me before the time) Od. 4.396.

forms: To row one's ship forward, row it to a specified place Od. 13.279.
To row (one's ship) forward, row (it) to a specified place: νῆʼ εἰς ὅρμον προέρεσσαν Il. 1.435:=Od. 15.497. Cf. Od. 9.73.
To draw down (a ship) in order to launch her Il. 1.308, Il. 9.358.

defs: (1) To project, jut out: πύργῳ ἐπὶ προὔχοντι (a projecting angle of the wall) Il. 22.97. Cf. Od. 7.138, Od. 10.90, Od. 12.11, Od. 19.544, Od. 24.82.
(2) In mid., to have in front of one: προὔχοντʼ ἐννέα ταύρους (i.e. they faced the sea with the bulls in front of them) Od. 3.8.
(3) To be in front in a race: τὸν προὔχοντα δοκεύει Il. 23.325, φράσσαθʼ ἵππον προὔχοντα 453.
(1) App., from the foundations onwards, i.e. by the roots (cf. πρόρριζος): προθέλυμνα χαμαὶ βάλε δένδρεα Il. 9.541. Cf. Il. 10.15.
(2) App., with base advanced: σάκεϊ Il. 13.130.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative προθέεσκε Il. 22.459: Od. 11.515.
defs: (1) To flee before a pursuer Il. 10.362. To rush to the fray in front of others: πολὺ προθέεσκεν Il. 22.459: =Od. 11.515.
(2) Fig., of speech, to dash forward (for utterance) Il. 1.291.
To leap or spring forward Il. 14.363, Il. 17.522, 523.
Zeal, alacrity. In pl.: ᾗσι προθυμίῃσι πεποιθώς (his heart full of ardour for the fray) Il. 2.588.

(1) The gateway of the αὐλή Il. 24.323: Od. 1.119, Od. 3.493=Od. 15.146 = 191. So in pl. (cf. θύρη 2..b): στῆμεν ἐνὶ προθύροισιν Il. 11.777. Cf. Il. 18.496, Il. 22.71: Od. 1.103, Od. 4.20, Od. 6.4. Of the gate of the steading of Eumaeus Od. 14.34. In pl. Od. 16.12.

(2) The doorway of the μέγαρον· κεῖται ἀνὰ πρόθυρον τετραμμένος (i.e. the doorway of the chief room of the hut) Il. 19.212: εἶκε προθύρου Od. 18.10. Cf. Od. 18.101, 386, Od. 20.355, Od. 21.299, Od. 22.474. Of such a doorway in the palace of Zeus Il. 15.124. In the palace of Hephaestus. In pl. Od. 8.304, 325. In the dwelling of Circe. In pl. Od. 10.220.

forms: To send forth or dispatch on a mission or errand or to take up an occupation: ἐμὲ Ζεὺς τῷ ἐπαλεξήσουσαν προΐαλλεν Il. 8.365. Cf. Il. 11.3: Od. 15.370.
To send away or dispatch for use: σιάλων τὸν ἄριστον Od. 14.18.
To send, dispatch: πολλὰς ψυχὰς Ἄϊδι Il. 1.3. Cf. Il. 5.190, Il. 7.487, Il. 11.55.

defs: (1) To send forth, throw, hurl, launch, let fly (a missile): ἔγχος Il. 3.346. Cf. Il. 3.355, Il. 8.297, Il. 13.662, Od. 3.438, etc.: Od. 24.519 = 522. Absol., to throw, make a throw, make one's throw: ὣς φάμενος προέηκεν Il. 5.290. To throw or let fall (fishing tackle) Od. 12.253.
(2) To send from oneself, let fall from one's grasp: πόδα Od. 19.468. Cf. Od. 5.316.
(3) To let fall (a word), send forth or utter (speech) Od. 14.466, Od. 20.105.
(4) Of a river, to send or roll (its waters): Τιταρησσόν, ὅς ῥʼ ἐς πηνειὸν προϊεῖ ὕδωρ Il. 2.752.

(5) To send forth or dispatch on a specified or indicated mission or to a specified destination: Βρισηΐδος εἵνεκα κούρης Il. 1.336, Ταλθύβιον νῆας ἔπι ἰέναι Il. 3.118. Cf. Il. 1.326, Il. 6.468, Il. 9.442, Il. 10.125, Il. 11.201, Il. 12.342, etc.: Od. 2.147, Od. 4.161, Od. 8.399, Od. 12.9, Od. 16.328, etc. To let go, surrender: τήνδε θεῷ πρόες Il. 1.127.
(7) Of something immaterial, to send: ἀγγελίας Od. 2.92=Od. 13.381. Cf. Il. 11.270, Il. 16.241.

etym: [genit. of προίξ, gift. Of one's bounty, as a free gift (genit. of material).]
forms: Without repayment or reimbursement: χαρίσασθαι Od. 13.15.
App., without paying for it, with impunity: γεύσεσθαι Ἀχαιῶν Od. 17.413.

defs: A beggar Od. 17.352, 449.
To set in front, put forward Il. 4.156.

forms: Of birds, to keep settling (ever) forwards Il. 2.463.
3 sing. aor. mid. προ-καλέσσατο Il. 6.218, 285, Il. 13.809.
In mid., to summon or invite to the fight or to a contest, challenge, defy, dare: μαχέσασθαι ἐναντίον Il. 3.432. Cf. Il. 6.39, 50, 218, 285, Il. 13.809: Od. 8.142.
=προκαλέω. Il. 3.19, Il. 4.389, Il. 5.807, Il. 6.150: Od. 8.228, Od. 18.20 (to fisticuffs).
To be set before one, be set to one's hand: ὀνείαθʼ ἑτοῖμα προκείμενα. See Il. 9.91, etc., cited under ἑτοῖμος 1.

defs: Of report or fame, heard of old; or perh., heard forwards, handed on by tradition Od. 3.204.

forms: App., row after row, in rows or ranks: [νῆας] προκρόσσας ἔρυσαν Il. 14.35.
In mid., of the sea, to roll forward Il. 14.18.
Absol. in pf. pass. pple. pl., the picked men, the flower: Ἀθηναίων προλελεγμένοι Il. 13.689.
Aor. pple. προλιπών Od. 3.314, Od. 15.11, Od. 23.120.
defs: (1) To leave, forsake, abandon, leave to one's own devices or to one's (or its) fate: κτήματα Od. 3.314=Od. 15.11 (with ἄνδρας in the same lines simply leaving behind you). Cf. Il. 17.275: Od. 13.331. Of a quality, to forsake (one), fail (him): οὐδέ σε μῆτις Ὀδυσσῆος προλέλοιπεν Od. 2.279.
(2) To leave, quit, withdraw from: πηοὺς καὶ πατρίδα γαῖαν Od. 23.120.
To act or pose as champion Il. 3.16. To fight with in front of the others. With dat.: μηκέτʼ Ἀχιλλῆϊ προμάχιζε Od. 3.376.

forms: To fight in front of the others Il. 17.358.
With genit.: ἁπάντων (to advance beyond them) Il. 11.217.

etym: [προ- 2 + μάχομαι. He who fights in front.]
forms: In pl., the front rank, the fighting line, the forefront of the battle: ἐν προμάχοισι φανέντα Il. 3.31. Cf. Il. 4.253, 495, Il. 5.134, 250, Il. 11.188, 358, etc.: Od. 18.379, Od. 24.526.

defs: In pass., to have sexual intercourse with in anticipation of another. With dat.: παλλακίδι προμιγῆναι Il. 9.452 (app., to take an opportunity of anticipating his father and so making felt the contrast between the two).

etym: [perh. formed fr. *πρόμνηστις, abstract noun fr. προ- 1 + μένω. Cf. ἀγχιστῖνοι.]
defs: Each waiting his turn before going forward, one after another: ἐπήϊσαν Od. 11.233, ἐσέλθετε Od. 21.230.
Leading, chief: ἄνδρα Il. 5.533. Absol., a leading fighter, a champion:  ἐκ πάντων πρόμος ἔμμεναι  Ἕκτορι (against Hector) Il. 6.75. Cf. Il. 3.44, Il. 6.116, 136, Il. 15.293, Il. 22.85: Od. 11.493.
(1) To perceive or detect beforehand, have an inkling of: δόλον Il. 18.526.
(2) To think of, devise Od. 5.364.
Some kind of deer Od. 17.295.

(1) In front, before: π. κιών Il. 15.260. Cf. Il. 15.355 (going before them), Il. 16.319 (at his feet): Od. 4.225 (before his eyes). With genit. in geographical sense: νῆσος αἰγύπτου π. (lying off ...) Od. 4.355. In front of, before: π. πυλάων Il. 12.131, στῆ αὐτῆς π. Il. 14.297. Cf. Il. 2.92, 811, Il. 4.348, Il. 7.307, Il. 13.205, Il. 15.66, Il. 18.615 (at her feet), etc.: Od. 1.107, Od. 9.482, Od. 10.354, Od. 15.122, Od. 17.357, Od. 24.416, etc.
(2) In temporal sense
(b) Before the happening of something: π. σφι φάνη μέγα ἔργον?̓́αρηος (ere that) Il. 11.734. Cf. Il. 22.197.
(c) In time past, formerly: οὔ τις ἀνὴρ π. μακάρτατος οὔτʼ ἄρʼ ὀπίσσω Od. 11.483.

forms: Strengthened form of, but hardly to be distinguished from, πᾶς.
defs: (1) In sing., all the, the whole: πρόπαν ἦμαρ (all the day long) Il. 19.162, Il. 24.713, Il. 1.601:=Od. 9.161 = 556=Od. 10.183 = 476=Od. 12.29=Od. 19.424, Od. 24.41.
(2) In pl., all the: νῆας προπάσας Il. 2.493.
(1) To send or dispatch on an errand. With complementary fut. pple.: ἄξοντα κύνα Il. 8.367.
(2) To dispatch on one's way, arrange for the departure of: ἐς Μενέλαον Od. 17.117.
(3) To send on ahead of oneself: τὸν προὔπεμψα σὺν ἑτάροισιν Od. 17.54. Cf. Od. 24.360.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. προπεσόντες.
defs: To bend the body forward (so as to swing to the oar): προπεσόντες ἔρεσσον Od. 9.490, Od. 12.194.
To set the foot forward, to advance, march along Il. 13.158, 806.
(1) On the face, prone Il. 24.18.
(2) Stooping forwards Od. 22.98.
(3) In neut. sing. προπρηνές as adv., forwards: σκῆπτρον οὔτʼ ὀπἰσω οὔτε π. ἐνώμα Il. 3.218.
(1) In pass., of a wanderer, to be rolled on and on, be tossed ever onwards: δεῦρʼ ἵκετο προπροκυλινδόμενος Od. 17.525.
(2) In mid., to grovel before the face of. With genit.: πατρὸς διός Il. 22.221 (the genit. app. depending on one προ- (προ- 2), the other προ- strengthening the vb. (προ- 4)).

forms: Of rivers, streams, etc., to flow forward or forth, flow, send their waters: ἅλαδε Il. 5.598, Il. 12.19. Cf. Il. 21.260, 366, Il. 22.151: Od. 5.444, Od. 10.351.

defs: From the roots onwards, by the roots, roots and all (cf. προ-θέλυμνος): ὡς ὅτʼ ἐξερίπῃ δρῦς π. Il. 14.415. Cf. Il. 11.157.
(I) Adv.
(II) Prep.
To bring to an indicated place : τίς δαίμων τόδε πῆμα προσήγαγεν; (has brought hither) Od. 17.446.
To rush in an indicated direction : ἦ λίσσοιτο προσαΐξας Ὀδυσῆα (run up to him and . . .) Od. 22.337. Cf. Od. 22.342, 365.

forms: With dat. : προσάλειφεν ἑκάστῳ φάρμακον ἄλλο Od. 10.392.

defs: (1) To bring help or succour to, help, aid. With dat. : ἤ τί οἱ χἠμεῖς προσαμύνομεν Il. 2.238.
(2) Absol, to bring succour, make defence, show fight for someone or something Il. 5.139, Il. 16.509.

forms: Nom. pl. neut. pf. pple. προσαρηρότα.
defs: In pf., to be fitted to something : ἐπίσσωτρα προσαρηρότα Il. 5.725.

forms: 3 dual non-thematic impf. προσαυδήτην Il. 11.136, Il. 22.90.
defs: (1) To speak to, address, accost : κερτομίοισι διὰ προσηύδα Il. 1.539. Cf. Il. 4.192, 256, Il. 5.30, Il. 7.144, Il. 11.136, etc. : Od. 1.252, Od. 3.41, Od. 9.345, Od. 11.99, Od. 14.484, etc. Without expressed object, to make address, speak Il. 4.24, Il. 6.225, Il. 12.353, etc. : Od. 10.400, Od. 14.79, Od. 15.62, etc.
(2) To say in way of address, speak, utter : ἔπεα πτερόεντα Il. 4.92, 203, Il. 5.871, Il. 16.706, etc. : Od. 2.362, Od. 4.25, Od. 10.377, Od. 16.22, etc.

(3) With double construction of (1) and (2), to address words to : ἔπεά μιν πτερόεντα προσηύδα Il. 1.201. Cf. Il. 4.69, Il. 5.242, Il. 12.365, Il. 13.94, etc. : Od. 1.122, Od. 4.77, Od. 10.265, Od. 16.7, etc.

forms: 3 sing. aor. mid. προσεβήσετο Il. 2.48, Il. 14.292 : Od. 21.5, 43.
defs: (1) To go one's way, proceed, in a specified direction : προσέβη τρηχεῖαν ἀταρπόν (advbl. acc., by a . . .) Od. 14.1.
(2) To go to or towards, approach. With acc. : κνημοὺς?̓́ιδης Il. 23.117. Cf. Od. 19.431. In mid. : ̓́ολυμπον Il. 2.48. Cf. Il. 14.292.
(3) To step upon, set foot upon. With acc. In mid. : κλίμακα Od. 21.5, οὐδόν 43. Without expressed object : λὰξ προσβάς (setting his foot upon upon the corpse) Il. 5.620, Il. 16.863.
(1) To smite. Of the rays of the sun : Ἠέλιος νέον προσέβαλλεν ἀρούρας Il. 6.421 := Od. 19.433.
(2) In mid., to give heed to, direct one's attention to : ταύτην οὐ προτιβάλλεαι Il. 5.879.

forms: To direct the sight to, look towards.
With acc. : πατέρα προσεδέρκετο Od. 20.385. Cf. Il. 16.10 : Od. 17.518.
To speak to, address, accost : Κάλχαντα Il. 1.105. Cf. Il. 1.206, Il. 8.138, Il. 11.602, Il. 16.432, Il. 17.11, etc. : Od. 1.178, Od. 2.39, Od. 4.461, Od. 7.56, Od. 8.144, etc.
Without expressed object, to make address, speak Il. 24.361 : Od. 4.234, Od. 24.350, 393.
With double acc. of the person addressed and of what is said : ὄφρα τί μιν προτιείποι Il. 22.329.

defs: To approach, draw near, draw up : ζωὸν προσιόντα Il. 5.515= Il. 6.308. Cf. Il. 5.682, Il. 10.339, Il. 11.742, Il. 13.615 : Od. 16.5.

forms: Of the sea, to roar, or, perh., to break in foam, against.
With acc. : κύματα, τά τε προσερεύγεται αὐτήν Il. 15.621.

defs: (1) Of place
(b) Before, in the front part : π. λέων Il. 7.181.
(c) In front or in advance of others : ὁππότεροι π. ἵπποι Il. 23.487. Cf. Il. 23.572, etc. With genit. : οἶος π. ἄλλων Il. 4.304.
(2) Of time

(b) Before another or others, first : ἔγνω π. Il. 13.66, Il. 24.698. Cf. Il. 3.317, 346, Il. 5.851 : Od. 9.370. With genit., before, sooner than : ὄφρα π. ἄλλων θάνατον ἐπίσπῃ (that he may be the foremost to perish) Il. 2.359.

(c) Before the arrival of a specified or indicated time past or future, earlier, sooner : π. μιν μοῖρʼ ἀμφεκάλυψεν (ere that) Il. 12.116 : μὴ π. κλέος γένηται, πρὶν . . . Od. 23.137. Cf. Od. 17.7, Od. 23.223.

forms: To be put upon something, be put in position : οὔατʼ οὔ πω προσέκειτο Il. 18.379.

defs: Involving a close tie, that binds closely together Od. 21.35.

forms: To cause to lean, set, support, against.
With dat. : βέλος προσέκλινε κορώνῃ Od. 21.138=165.
In pass., to lean or be supported (so as to be) close to.
With dat.: πατρὸς ἐμοῖο θρόνος ποτικέκλιται αὐτῇ (is set close to the queen's) Od. 7.308.

defs: In mid., to lay oneself down, recline, beside or at the feet of another : εἶσέ τέ [με] καὶ προσέλεκτο Od. 12.34.
To bring into contact with, cause to touch. With dat. : ἄκρῃ προσπελάσας [νῆα] (dashing it against a . . .) Od. 9.285.

forms: To be brought into contact with, touch.
With dat. : νήσῳ προσεπίλνατο νηῦς (made the island) Od. 13.95.
Of water, to beat up against something : κῦμα χιόνα προσπλάζον  ἐρύκεται Il. 12.285.
With dat. : λίμνη προσέπλαζε γενείῳ Od. 11.583.

defs: (1) To fold to one's bosom, embrace Od. 11.451.
(2) To greet, convey good wishes to Od. 8.478.
(3) To speak to, address Od. 3.22. Without expressed object Od. 2.77, Od. 4.647. With double acc. of the person addressed and of what is said : ὄφρα τί μιν προσπτύξομαι Od. 17.509.
Before one : ἐλαύνων πρόσσοθεν ἵππους Il. 23.533.
To make one's way to, proceed to. With acc. : προσέστιχεν Ὄλυμπον Od. 20.73.

(1) Of the direction of motion, forwards, onwards, on : δοῦρʼ ὄρμενα πρόσσω Il. 11.572. Cf. Il. 11.615, Il. 12.274, Il. 13.291, Il. 15.543, Il. 16.265 (straight for his object), 382, Il. 17.734, Il. 18.388 : νῆα πρόσω φέρε κῦμα Od. 9.542. Cf. Od. 21.369. In reference to the exercise of a mental faculty : νοῆσαι ἅμα πρόσσω καὶ ὀπίσσω (to look before and after, be capable of reasoning from the past to the future) Il. 1.343. Cf. Il. 3.109, Il. 18.250 : Od. 24.452.
(2) Of change of position, forwards : πρόσσω κατέκυψεν Il. 16.611= Il. 17.527. Of position, forwards, facing one's front : πρόσω τετραμμένος Il. 17.598.
To set or place in an indicated position : λίθον, δ̀ν προσέθηκεν Od. 9.305.

etym: [προσ-, app. with sense before one's very eyes, in one's view + φα-, φαν-, φαίνω.  (As if) newly revealed.]

defs: (1) To speak to, address, accost. With acc. : σθένελον Il. 5.108. Cf. Il. 1.84, Il. 2.795, Il. 6.405, Il. 9.196, etc. : Od. 1.63, Od. 2.399, Od. 4.59, Od. 7.24, etc. Without expressed object, to make address, speak Il. 2.172, Il. 5.439, Il. 10.369, etc. : Od. 10.422, Od. 11.565, Od. 15.9.
(2) To say in way of address, speak, utter. In mid. : ἔπος Od. 23.106.
(3) With double construction of (1) and (2) : τὴν οὔ τι προσέφη Il. 1.511. Cf. Il. 4.401, Il. 5.689= Il. 7.342, Il. 8.484, Il. 21.478 : Od. 20.183.
Attached to, forming part of, something : θρῆνυν προσφυέʼ ἐκ κλισίης Od. 19.58.

forms: To grow to; hence, to attach oneself to something : τοῦ μέσον ἧπαρ ἔχοιμι ἐσθέμεναι προσφῦσα (burying my teeth in it) Il. 24.213.
To attach oneself to, seize, grasp.
Without expressed object, to make address, speak Od. 5.159, Od. 10.109.
With double acc. of the person addressed and of what is said : οὐδέ τί μιν προσεφώνεον Il. 1.332, Il. 8.445.

etym: [προσ- 1 + ὦπα. The part beside the eyes,  the region of the eyes.]
forms: Acc. προσώπατα Od. 18.192. The face, visage, countenance : χαρίεν Il. 18.24. Cf. Od. 15.332, Od. 20.352.
In pl. in the same sense : πρόσωπα καὶ χεῖρʼ ἀπομόργνυ Il. 18.414. Cf. Il. 6.212, Il. 19.285 : Od. 8.85, Od. 18.173 (ἀμφί advbl., πρόσωπα acc. of part affected), 192, Od. 19.361.

defs: (1) To carry a cutting process forward in a specified direction : κορμὸν ἐκ ῥίζης προταμών (cutting it into shape) Od. 23.196.
(2) In reference to priority in time, to cut off something before : πρίν γʼ ὅτε σʼ ὄψου ἄσαιμι προταμών (cutting thee off the first morsel) Il. 9.489.
(3) In mid., to cut (a furrow) before or in front of one Od. 18.375.
(1) That is in front : ἐν προτέροισι πόδεσσιν (his fore-paws) Od. 19.228.

(2) Sooner, earlier : οὔ τις π. τόν γʼ εἴσεται (before you) Il. 1.548, π. γεγόνει (had been born before him, was the elder) Il. 13.355. Cf. Il. 17.14, Il. 19.219, Il. 21.440 : Od. 2.31, 43. With genit., sooner than, before : ἐμέο π. ἐπέγρετο Il. 10.124. With πρίν: οὐκ εἴων προτέρην αἵματος ἆσσον ἴμεν, πρὶν . . . (to do so before . . ., until I should . . .) Od. 11.88.
(3) In neut. sing. πρότερον as adv., sooner Il. 14.467.

(5) Belonging to time past : ἐπὶ προτέρων ἀνθρώπων (in the days of the men of old) Il. 5.637, Il. 23.332. Cf. Il. 11.691, Il. 21.405 : Od. 8.223, Od. 11.630. Absol. in pl., the men of old : οἱ πρότεροι Il. 4.308.
(6) Born sooner, older : π. καὶ ἀρείων Il. 2.707, Il. 23.588 : Od. 19.184. Cf. Il. 15.166, 182.

(7) Belonging to the past as opposed to the present, the former . . ., one's former . . .: ἀνδρός Il. 3.140. Cf. Il. 3.163, 429 : Od. 15.22, Od. 19.504, Od. 22.264 (to add to the former wrongs). The preceding . . . : ἠοῖ τῇ προτέρῃ Il. 13.794. Cf. Il. 21.5, Il. 23.790 (of the last generation and the men who lived then). Absol. : τῇ προτέρῃ (sc. ἡμέρῃ), the day before Od. 16.50.
(1) Further, further on, to a greater distance : ἦ πῄ με π. πολίων ἄξεις; (local genit., among the cities) Il. 3.400. Cf. Il. 5.672 : Od. 5.417.
(2) Forwards, towards one's front, onwards, on : ἴθυσαν Il. 4.507.

(3) Forward, on (contextually, in reference to persons entering or advancing into a house, in) : βάτην (entered)  Il. 9.192, ἄγε (brought them in) 199, βάτην (pursued their way) Il. 10.469, ἔπεο (come in) Il. 18.387 := Od. 5.91, ἐς δʼ αὐτοὺς προτέρω ἄγε Od. 4.36, πλέομεν (pursued our course) Od. 9.62=105=565= Od. 10.77 = 133, νῆες κίον (set sail) Od. 9.64, βὰν ἰέναι Od. 15.109.

(4) In reference to prolongation or continuance of action or a state of things, further, yet further, longer : προτέρω κʼ ἔτʼ ἔρις γένετο (would have gone yet further) Il. 23.490, εἴ κʼ ἔτι προτέρω γένετο δρόμος (had continued) 526. Cf. Od. 4.667 (see ἄρχω 1.a), Od. 14.356, Od. 24.475.
To cause to go forth, let go forth : τὰ προτετύχθαι ἐάσομεν (regard these things as gone on their way, put them out of our minds, let bygones be bygones) Il. 16.60, Il. 18.112= Il. 19.65.
(I) Adv. Besides, in addition, too : ἐκ χροὸς ἕλκε δόρυ, προτὶ δὲ φρένες αὐτῷ ἕποντο (i.e. the spear drew out the midriff with it) Il. 16.504. Cf. Od. 17.379.
(II) Prep.

forms: With dat. Of something immaterial : τόδε κῦδος Ἀχιλλῆϊ προτιάπτω (grant it to him) Il. 24.110.
To force to take, drive into, a specified course : ἐπὶ νῆας ἀπὸ στρατόφι Il. 10.347.
To set or place before one : ἦέ μιν ᾖσι κυσὶ προὔθηκεν Il. 24.409 : τραπέζας (set ready for the feast) Od. 1.112.
With acc. : ἑὸν υἱὸν προτιμυθήσασθαι Od. 11.143.

defs: (1) To direct the eyes towards, look at Od. 6.31, Od. 23.365.
(2) To bode, forebode, have a presentiment of, apprehend : ὄλεθρον Od. 5.389, θάνατον Od. 14.219. Absol., to see one's fate before one, forebode it Il. 22.356.

forms: App., the cut place in front, i.e. the navel Il. 11.424.

defs: The forestays of a mast (cf. ἐπίτονος) Il. 1.434 : Od. 2.425= Od. 15.290, Od. 12.409.

forms: 3 sing. aor. subj. mid. προτράπηται Od. 11.18.
defs: (1) To go forward or take one's way in a specified direction. Of the sun : ὅτʼ ἂν ἂψ ἐπὶ γαῖαν ἀπʼ οὐρανόθεν προτράπηται Od. 11.18. Cf. Od. 12.381.
(2) To turn and flee in a specified direction : ἐπὶ νηῶν Il. 5.700.
(3) Fig., to betake oneself to something, yield oneself up to it : ἄχεϊ προτραπέσθαι Il. 7.336.
Turning right away in an indicated direction, in downright flight, headlong (cf. προτρέπω. (2)) : φοβέοντο Il. 16.304.

forms: To dash or press forwards : τρῶες προὔτυψαν ἀολλέες Il. 13.136= Il. 15.306= Il. 17.262.
Of passion : ἀνὰ ῥῖνας δριμὺ μένος προὔτυψεν (burst forth) Od. 24.319.
Impf. act. and pass. προὔφαινον, προὐφαινόμην.
Acc. sing. masc. aor. pple. pass. προφανέντα Od. 24.160.
defs: (1) To show forth, show, display : τέραα Od. 12.394.
(2) Intrans., to give forth light, be visible : οὐδὲ σελήνη προὔφαινεν Od. 9.145.

(3) In pass., to come into view, appear, make one's appearance, present oneself : προφανέντε ἀνὰ πτολέμοιο γεφύρας Il. 8.378, τὰ προπέφανται ἅπαντα (lie open to view) Il. 14.332. Cf. Il. 17.487, Il. 24.332 : Od. 13.169, Od. 24.160.–Impers. : οὐδὲ προὐφαίνετʼ ἰδέσθαι (there was not light enough to see) Od. 9.143.

A profession or declaration. Adverbially in acc., as the cause that moves one, as the occasion (cf. ἐπίκλησις 2, χάρις 2.b) : κλαίουσα, ἐπὶ δὲ στενάχοντο γυναῖκες, Πάτροκλον πρόφασιν, σφῶν δʼ αὐτῶν κήδεʼ ἑκάστη Il. 19.302 (i.e. his death was the immediate occasion, and each had her own griefs as well). With genit. : εὐνῆς πρόφασιν (for the sake of . . .) Il. 19.262.

forms: Comp. προφερέστερος, -η, better, more skilled or serviceable : ἐμεῖο προφερέστεροι Od. 21.134. Cf. Il. 10.352 : Od. 8.221.
Superl. προφερέστατος, the best, the most skilled : ἅλματι πάντων προφερέστατος ἦεν (at . . ., in . . .) Od. 8.128.

defs: (1) To bear or carry in a specified or indicated direction or to a specified or indicated destination : ὡς ὄρνις νεοσσοῖσι προφέρῃσι μάστακα Il. 9.323. Cf. Il. 7.346, Il. 17.121 : Od. 20.64.

(2) To put forth, display : κρατερὸν μένος Il. 10.479. To bring forth, utter (abuse) : ὀνείδεα Il. 2.251. To cast in one's teeth : δῶρʼ Ἀφροδίτης Il. 3.64. To offer (battle) (cf. Il. 11.529 cited under προβάλλω 1). In mid. : ἔριδα προφέρονται Il. 3.7. To display, engage in (rivalry) : ἔριδα προφέρουσαι Od. 7.92. So in mid. Od. 8.210.
(1) To flee Il. 11.340.
(2) To flee from, escape from, escape, elude : μένος καὶ χεῖρας Ἀχαιῶν Il. 7.502. Cf. Il. 6.309, Il. 14.81 : Od. 11.107, Od. 22.325.

forms: Zealously, earnestly, seriously Il. 5.810, 816, Il. 7.173, Il. 6.160, Il. 17.224.

defs: Displaying zeal, eagerness, earnestness : ὄμοσσον ἦ μέν μοι π. ἀρήξειν (zealously) Il. 1.77, πῶς τίς τοι π. ἔπεσιν πείθηται; (with alacrity) 150. Cf. Il. 1.543 (readily gratifying me), Il. 8.23 (with a will), 175 (really meaning it), Il. 9.480 (with hearty hospitality), Il. 10.290 (with zealous solicitude), Il. 14.71, 357 (with all your energies), Il. 17.353 (with good spirit), Il. 21.500 (boldly), Il. 22.303, Il. 23.647 (gladly) : Od. 2.230= Od. 5.8 (with honest zeal), Od. 2.387 (willingly), Od. 5.143 (with sincere thought for his good), 161 (without grudging), Od. 8.498 (in full measure), Od. 9.355 (give me more and plenty), Od. 10.386 (in good earnest), Od. 13.359 (take thought for me and . . .), 391, Od. 14.54 (with hearty hospitality), 406 (should be fain to . . .), Od. 19.398 (solicitously), Od. 20.372, Od. 23.314. Of the heart, zealous, eager, earnest : θυμῷ πρόφρονι (in earnest, really meaning it) Il. 8.40= Il. 22.184, Il. 24.140. Cf. Il. 10.244 : Od. 16.257.

forms: In pass., of bodies of men, to pour or stream in a specified direction : τῇ προχέοντο πεφυζότες Il. 21.6. Cf. Il. 2.465, Il. 15.360.
App., utterly : ὀλέσθαι Od. 14.69. Cf. Il. 21.460.
App., of sitting, full on the ground, with limbs extended on the ground : καθεζομένη Il. 9.570.

defs: The place where a river flows into the sea, its mouth : ἐπὶ προχοῇσι ποταμοῖο Il. 17.263. Cf. Od. 5.453, Od. 11.242. In reference to Ocean, app., its stream : ἐν προχοῇς Ὠκεανοῖο Od. 20.65.
(1) A vessel for holding water to be poured on the hands Il. 24.304 : Od. 1.136= Od. 4.52= Od. 6.172= Od. 10.368= Od. 15.135= Od. 17.91.
(2) A vessel from which to pour wine into the cups Od. 18.397.
(1) On foot : πρυλέες ῥώοντο  Ἕκτορι ἑπώμεθἀ Il. 11.49= Il. 12.77.
(2) Absol. in pl., fighters on foot, footmen : ἡγεμόνα πρυλέων Il. 15.517. With the notion on foot not prominent, fighters in gen. : τὸν πρώτοισι μετὰ πρυλέεσσι δάμασσας Il. 21.90. Cf. Il. 5.744.

(1) The stern (of a ship) : τῆς (sc. νηὸς) πρύμνη ἀείρετο Od. 13.84. Without νηός, a ship's stern : ἐν πρύμνῃ καθέζετο Od. 15.285. Cf. Il. 1.409, Il. 8.475, Il. 14.32, Il. 15.385, Il. 16.124, Il. 18.76, 447.

(2) In apposition with νηῦς · νηῒ πάρα πρύμνῃ Ἀγαμέμνονος (by the stern of . . . 's ship) Il. 6.383. Cf. Il. 10.35, 570, Il. 11.600, Il. 12.403, Il. 13.333, 762, Il. 14.51, 65, Il. 15.248, 435, 704, 722, Il. 16.286, Il. 19.135 : Od. 2.417, Od. 12.411, Od. 13.75 (at the stern), Od. 15.206, 223.

forms: From, in the direction from, beginning with, the stern : πρύμνηθεν ἐπεὶ λάβε [νῆα] (by the stern) Il. 15.716.

defs: Cables for mooring a ship's stern to the shore : κατὰ πρυμνήσιʼ ἔδησαν Il. 1.436. Cf. Il. 1.476 : Od. 2.418, Od. 9.137, 178 = 562= Od. 11.637= Od. 12.145= Od. 15.548, Od. 12.32, Od. 15.286, 498, 552.

(1) The hindmost or endmost part of the . . ., the base or root of the . . . (in the case of a part of the body denoting the end next the body) : γλῶσσαν πρυμνήν Il. 5.292, ἄγνυτον ὕλην πρυμνὴν ἐκτάμνοντες (at the bases of the boles) Il. 12.149, ἐξέρυσε πρυμνοῖο βραχίονος ἔγχος Il. 13.532. Cf. Il. 13.705, Il. 16.314, 323 : Od. 17.504. Superl. πρυμνότατος · πρυμνότατον κατὰ νῶτον (i.e. where the back and shoulder join) Od. 17.463. At the base : λᾶας πρυμνὸς παχύς Il. 12.446.
(2) App. in neut. as sb., the root (of the . . .) : πρυμνὸν ὕπερ θέναρος Il. 5.339.
(3) App. in neut. as adv., by the root : ἐξ ὀδόντας ὦσε δόρυ πρυμνόν Il. 17.618.
The base or foot of a mountain : ἐν πρυμνωρείῃ?̓́ιδης Il. 14.307.
Lately, recently, the other day : τὸν σὺ π. κτεῖνας Il. 24.500. Cf. Il. 5.832.
In the first bloom of youth : κοῦροι πρωθῆβαι Od. 8.263. Cf. Il. 8.518.

forms: Too early, untimely : σοὶ π. παραστήσεσθαι ἔμελλε μοῖρα Od. 24.28.

defs: In neut. pl. πρωϊζά as adv., just before : χθιζά τε καὶ π. Il. 2.303 (see χθιζός 3).
In neut. sing. πρώϊον as adv., early this morning : νευρήν, ἣν ἐνέδησα π. Il. 15.470.
A rock, cliff, bluff Il. 8.557= Il. 16.299, Il. 12.282, Il. 17.747.
A ship's bow or prow. In apposition with νηῦς · ἴκρια νηὸς πρῴρης Od. 12.230.

forms: Strengthened form of, but gen. hardly to be distinguished from, πρῶτος.
defs: (2) In neut. sing. πρώτιστον as adv.
(b) Like πρῶτος 6.c.β : Ἀρτέμιδι π. ἐπεύξατο Od. 20.60.
(c) Like πρῶτος 6 (j) : οἶον ὅτε π. ἐλείπετε πατρίδα γαῖαν (when first you . . .) Od. 10.462.
(3) In neut. pl. πρώτιστα as adv.
(b) Like πρῶτος 6.c.α : π. δύσετο χαλκόν Od. 22.113. Cf. Il. 9.168.
(c) Like πρῶτος 6.c.β Κάλχαντα π. προσέειπεν addressed him first Il. 1.105. Cf. Il. 2.405, Il. 18.478 : Od. 3.57, 419, Od. 13.404= Od. 15.38 (go to him first of all).
(d) Like πρῶτος 6.i  : ἐμὲ π. ἕταροι λίσσοντο Od. 9.224.
(e) Like πρῶτος 6 (l) : ἐξ οὖ τὰ π. ἑπόμην Ἀγαμέμνονι (ever since . . .) Od. 11.168.

forms: First-born (of the year) : ἀρνῶν (the firstlings) Il. 4.102=120= Il. 23.864 = 873.
App., put together for the first time, newly made : δίφροι Il. 5.194, ἄμαξαν Il. 24.267.

defs: Of a ship, app., making her first voyage Od. 8.35.

(1) In reference to position, the most advanced in a specified or indicated direction, the first or foremost : οἱ πρῶτοί τε καὶ ὕστατοι Il. 2.281. Cf. Il. 4.480 (in the forefront of the fray), Il. 7.445, Il. 8.83, Il. 12.260 (against the face of the works), 315, 321, Il. 14.31 (next the plain), 75 (next the sea), Il. 15.634, 654 (next the plain), 656, Il. 16.394, Il. 18.579, Il. 21.90 : Od. 8.197, Od. 15.36 (the first in your course), Od. 18.379.

(2) The foremost or front part of the . . ., the front of the . . . : ἐν πρώτῳ ῥυμῷ Il. 7.40, Il. 16.371. Cf. Il. 8.411 (just in front of the gate, at the entrance to it), Il. 15.340 (in the front of the fight), Il. 17.380, 471, Il. 19.50, Od. 3.173, 275 (the edge), 395, Il. 22.66 (before the house-door), Il. 24.272 : Od. 1.255 (just within the door), Od. 21.422 (the top of the . . .), Od. 22.250.
(3) Absol., the winner in a contest : ἄεθλα τῷ πρώτῳ Il. 23.265. In neut. pl. τὰ πρῶτα, the first prizeIl. 23.275, 538.
(4) Absol. in pl.
(b) The most promnent in some sphere of activity : μετὰ πρώτοισι πονεῖτο (with the best) Il. 9.12.
(c) The first in social rank, the leading men Od. 7.60.
(d) Gen., the most distinguished, the first : ἐν πρώτοισιν ὀΐω ἔμμεναι Od. 8.180. Cf. Il. 15.643.
(6) In neut. sing. (τὸ) πρῶτον and pl. (τὰ) πρῶτα as adv.
(b) First, in the first place, first of all, to begin with (as opposed to subsequent action).
(c) In advbl. use corresponding
(d) In reference to the first doing or occurrence of something, for the first time, first.
(e) With a temporal conjunction, when first, as soon as : ἐπὴν δὴ πρῶτα κατευνηθέντα ἴδησθε Od. 4.414.
(f) At first, to begin with (implying a subsequent change).
(g) Before doing something, as a preliminary, first.
(h) In reference to preference or choice, first, before anything else : πρῶτον τοῦ πατρὸς ἑλοίμεθα νόστιμον ἦμαρ Od. 16.149.–
(i) At once, straightway : οὕνεκά σʼ οὐ τὸ πρῶτον, ἐπεὶ ἴδον, ὧδʼ ἀγάπησα Od. 23.214.–
(j) Marking the time of an action or occurrence as a point of departure, a beginning, an opening of a new era.
(k) Denoting fixity of determination, purpose or condition,  or that something is done or brought about finally or completely, once for all.
(k) Denoting inevitability of consequence or of the continuance of a state or condition on the doing or occurrence of something, (when) once . . ., (since) once . . ., (who) once . . .
Having borne offspring for the first time. Of a cow Il. 17.5.
To sneeze : τηλέμαχος μέγʼ ἔπταρεν Od. 17.541.
The heel Il. 22.397.

Feathered, winged. Epithet of arrows Il. 4.117, Il. 5.171, Il. 16.773, Od. 3.68. Of λαισήϊα, flutteringIl. 5.453=Il. 12.426. Of words, fig., winged : ἔπεα πτερόεντα Il. 1.201, Il. 3.155, Il. 4.69, Il. 5.242, etc. : Od. 1.122, Od. 2.269, Od. 4.25, Od. 9.409, etc.

(2) In pl., a bird's wings : σὺν πτερὰ πυκνὰ λίασθεν Od. 23.879. Cf. Il. 19.386, Il. 24.319. App. in sing. in the same sense : ὠκεῖαι ὡς εἰ πτερὸν ἠὲ νόημα Od. 6.36. Fig. of oars Od. 11.125=Od. 23.272.
A bird's wing : ὑπὸ πτέρυγος βάλεν Il. 23.875. Cf. Il. 2.316, 462 : Od. 2.149.
(1) To crouch, cower : κείμην πεπτηώς (cowering for concealment) Od. 14.354. Cf. Od. 14.474, Od. 22.362. To cower, stoop, bend low, in apprehension Od. 8.190.
(2) To strike with dismay : πτῆξε θυμὸν Ἀχαιῶν Il. 14.40.
To terrify, scare, dismay Od. 22.298.

forms: With the name of a particular town in genit. : Ἰλίου εὖ ναιόμενον π. Il. 2.133. Cf. Il. 2.538, Il. 4.33=Il. 8.288, Il. 13.380, Il. 21.433 : Od. 1.2, Od. 3.485, Od. 15.193.

defs: Sacker of cities. Epithet of Odysseus Il. 2.278, Il. 10.363 : Od. 8.3, Od. 9.530, Od. 14.447, Od. 16.442, Od. 18.356, Od. 22.283, Od. 24.119. Of Oïleus Il. 2.728. Of Enyo Il. 5.333. Of Achilles Il. 8.372=Il. 15.77, Il. 21.550, Il. 24.108. Of Ares Od. 3.152. Of Otrynteus Od. 3.384.
A branch of a tree or shrub : ἐξ ὕλης πτόρθον κλάσε φύλλων Od. 7.128.
The parts brought together in folding, a fold : πρόσθε οἱ πέπλοιο πτύγμʼ ἐκάλυψεν (folded the loose part of her robe about him) Il. 5.315.
Of a writing-tablet, folding, i.e. double, made of two hinged pieces which could be closed on each other and (no doubt) in some way secured : πίνακι Il. 7.169.
(1) A fold or cleft in the furrowed side or top of a hill : κατὰ πτύχας οὐλύμποιο Il. 11.77. Cf. Od. 3.22 (in a cleft) : Od. 19.432.
(2) One of the layers of hide or metal forming a shield Il. 6.247, Il. 18.481, Od. 3.269, 270.
A shovel by which grain, etc., to be winnowed was thrown against the wind (͂ἀ θηρηλοιγός) Il. 13.588.

forms: Aor. pple. fem. πτύξασα Od. 1.439, Od. 7.111, 252, Od. 19.256. (προσ-)
defs: To fold (clothes) Od. 1.439, Od. 7.111, 252, Od. 19.256. In pass. : ἔγχεα πτύσσοντο θρασειάων ἀπὸ χειρῶν σειόμενα Il. 13.134, doubtfully explained as bent to the strain as they were brandished, or formed a serried mass (presenting the appearance of folds or layers).
To spit out : αἷμα Il. 23.697.

etym: [πτωκ-, πτώσσω. The cowering or timid animal.]
forms: Joined with λαγωός · πτῶκα λαγωόν Il. 22.310.

defs: (1) To cower or crouch in fear or from cowardice, shrink from the fray Il. 4.371, Il. 5.634, Il. 6.129, Il. 21.26. Of locusts Il. 21.14. With acc. of the person from whom one shrinks : οὐδʼ ἄν ἔτι δὴν ἀλλήλους πτώσσοιμεν Od. 3.427. Sim. of birds : νέφεα πτώσσουσαι (shrinking from the region of the clouds, flying low) Od. 22.304.
(2) To cringe in humility; hence, to go about begging : πτώσσων (πτώσσειν̓ κατὰ δῆμον Od. 17.227, Od. 18.363.

forms: To go about begging, beg one's bread : προτὶ ἄστυ ἀπονέεσθαι πτωχεύσων Od. 15.309. Cf. Od. 18.2, Od. 19.73.
To beg (one's bread) : ὄφρʼ ἂν ἐκεῖθι δαῖτα πτωχεύῃ Od. 17.11. Cf. Od. 17.19.
With ἀνήρ: ἄλλος τις π. ἀνήρ Od. 21.327.

defs: Fighting with the fists, boxing : πυγμαχίης ἄεθλα (for . . .) Il. 23.653. Cf. Il. 23.665.
One who fights with the fists, a boxer Od. 8.246.

etym: [πυγών, a measure of length derived from the forearm, a cubit.]
forms: Of a cubit's length Od. 10.517, Od. 11.25.

defs: A trough or box holding grain for feeding poultry Od. 19.553.

(1) A base or support : δύω ὑπὸ [δέπαϊ] πυθμένες ἦσαν Il. 11.635 (app. the base of the hollow part ran out again after contraction to form a foot). A leg of a tripod : χρύσεά σφʼ ὑπὸ κύκλα ἑκάστῳ πυθμένι θῆκεν (fitted a wheel under each leg) Il. 18.375.
(2) The base of a tree, the part of the trunk next the ground Od. 13.122, 372, Od. 23.204.
(1) To affect with decomposition, make rotten, rot : ὀστέα Il. 4.174.
(2) In pass., to suffer decomposition, decompose, rot, decay : οὗ ὀστέα τύθεται ὄμβρῳ Od. 1.161. Cf. Il. 11.395 : Od. 12.46.

(1) In reference to construction, closely, without breaks or interstices, so as to give good shelter or protection : πύλας π. στιβαρῶς ἀραρυίας (both closely fitted and strong) Il. 12.454, σάκεος π. ποιητοῖο Il. 18.608. Cf. Od. 1.333=Od. 8.458=Od. 16.415=Od. 18.209=Od. 21.64, Od. 1.436, Od. 22.455. In reference to complete protection afforded by armour : λυκίων (Τρώων̓ π. θωρηκτάων (wearing the goodly breastplate) Il. 12.317, Il. 15.689, 739.
(2) In reference to things coming thick and fast : πρίν γʼ ὅτε δὴ θάλαμος π. ἐβάλλετο (was struck by many a dart) Il. 9.588.
(3) In reference to the exercise of mental faculties, with close devotion to the subject in hand, shrewdly, astutely : νόον π. περ φρονεόντων Il. 9.554, Il. 14.217.
(4) In reference to attention or care, with close attention, with anxious care : π. [μιν] ἔτ ρεφεν Il. 5.70.

forms: Pf. pple. pass. πεπυκασμένος Il. 14.289 : Od. 22.488.
Nom. pl. neut. πεπυκασμένα Il. 2.777, Il. 23.503.
defs: (1) To put something round or about (something), cover, cover up, for protection, concealment or decency : νέκυν πυκάσας Il. 24.581. Cf. Il. 2.777, Il. 14.289, Il. 17.551 : ῥάκεσιν πεπυκασμένος Od. 22.488. To protect, shield : πύκασεν κάρη [κυνέη] Il. 10.271. To shelter or conceal (oneself) : μή πως ἐντὸς πυκάζοιεν σφέας αὐτούς Od. 12.225. To cover the surface of by way of ornamentation : ἅρματα χρυσῷ πεπυκασμένα Od. 23.503. In reference to something growing upon and covering a surface : πρίν σφωϊν ἰούλους πυκάσαι γένυς λάχνῃ Od. 11.320.
(2) Of grief overwhelming (a person) : Ἕκτορʼ ἄχος πύκασε φρένας Il. 8.124=316, Il. 17.83.

forms: Shrewd in counsel, clever : γραίης Od. 1.438.

defs: (1) Close in texture, dense, thick : πυκινὸν νέφος Il. 5.751=Il. 8.395, νεφέλην Il. 16.298.

(2) Of things placed close together or at short intervals, close-set, thick : πυκινοῖσι λίθοισιν Il. 16.212. Cf. Il. 12.57, Il. 13.133=Il. 16.217, Il. 21.245, Il. 24.453, 798 : ὀδόντες πυκνοί Od. 12.92. Cf. Od. 5.329, 433, 480, Od. 14.12, Od. 19.520, Od. 23.193. Of things appearing together in a limited space, numerous, many : πυκναὶ σμώδιγγες ἀνέδραμον Il. 23.716.

(3) In reference to construction, closely constructed or made, well fitted together, without breaks or interstices, affording good shelter, protection or security : πυκινὸν δόμον Il. 10.267, Il. 12.301, ἀσπίδα ῥινοῖσιν πυκινήν (made of closely fitted . . .) Il. 13.804. Cf. Il. 14.167 = 339, Il. 15.529, Il. 19.355 : Od. 7.134, Od. 6.81, 88, Od. 13.68, Od. 14.521, 529, Od. 23.229. Sim. of something natural, thick, affording close covert : ἐν λόχμῃ πυκινῇ Od. 19.439. Cf. Od. 19.442. Sim. of a bed, such as to afford good protection, warm, cosy : πυκινὸν λέχος Il. 9.621, 659 : Od. 6.340=Od. 23.291, Od. 23.177, 179. Letting nothing escape from within, holding its contents, tight, well-fenced : δέρμασιν ἐν πυκινοῖσιν Od. 2.291, πυκινοὺς κευθμῶνας Od. 10.283.
(4) Of grief, overwhelming : πυκινὸν ἄχος Il. 16.599. Cf. Od. 19.516. Sim. of ἄτη, overpoweringIl. 24.480.

(5) Consisting of many individual persons or things, dense, close, thick : πυκιναὶ φάλαγγες Il. 4.281, Il. 5.93. Cf. Il. 6.61, Il. 11.118, Il. 13.145, 199, 680, Il. 14.349, Il. 18.320, Il. 23.122, 879 : ἐκ πυκινῆς ὕλης Od. 7.128. Cf. Od. 5.53, 471, Od. 10.150, 197, Od. 14.473.

(6) Doing something at short intervals, thick-coming, coming thick and fast : πυκινοῖσι βελέεσσιν Il. 11.576. Cf. Od. 14.36. Falling quickly one after the other, falling fast or in a shower : ὣς πυκνὰ καρήατα δάμνατο λαῶν Il. 11.309. Cf. Il. 11.454 : τιναξάσθην πτερὰ πυκνά Od. 2.151. Cf. Od. 4.153.
(7) Of the mind, or mental faculties, shrewd, astute, sagacious, wise : Διὸς πυκινὸν νόον Il. 15.461. Cf. Il. 14.294 (though . . .).

(8) Displaying shrewdness, astuteness, sagacity, or wisdom, shrewd, astute, sagacious, wise, shrewdly or cunningly devised or contrived : τυκινὴν βουλήν Il. 2.55=Il. 10.302, Il. 9.76, πυκινὸν λόχον Il. 4.392, Il. 24.779 : Od. 11.525. Cf. Il. 3.202, 208, Il. 7.187, Il. 6.375, Il. 11.788, Il. 18.216, Il. 24.75, 28 = 674, 744 · Od. 3.23, Od. 19.353. Absol. in neut. pl. πυκινά, shrewdness, astuteness: πυκινὰ φρονέοντι Od. 9.445.
(9) In neut. sing. πυκινόν as adv., in reference to grief which overwhelms one, heavily, sorely : πυκινόν περ ἀχεύων Od. 11.88.
(10) In neut. pl. πυκινά, πυκνά, as adv.
(b) At short intervals, often, much : ὣς πυκίνʼ ἀναστενάχιζεν Il. 10.9. Cf. Il. 18.318, Il. 21.417.

(1) In reference to construction, closely, withoutbreaks or interstices, so as to give good shelter or protection : θύρας π. ἀραρυίας Il. 9.475. Cf. Il. 21.535 : Od. 2.344, Od. 21.236 = 382, Od. 22.155, 258 = 275, Od. 23.194.
(2) In reference to grief which overwhelms one, heavily, sorely : π. ἀκαχήμενον Il. 19.312. Cf. Od. 19.95, Od. 20.84, Od. 23.360.
(3) Shrewdly, wisely : π. τοι ὑποθησόμεθα (for your good) Il. 21.293. Cf. Od. 1.279.
The gate-fastener, the gate-keeper. Epithet of Hades Il. 8.367, Il. 13.415 : Od. 11.277.
He that watches the gate, a gate-keeper Il. 21.530, Il. 24.681.
(2) Of the gates of dreams : ἐν ὀνειρείῃσι πύλῃσιν Od. 4.809. Cf. Od. 19.562. Of the gates of the sun Od. 24.12.
Born at Pylus, sprung from Pylus : βασιλῆος Il. 2.54, ἵπποι Il. 23.303.
(1) Of position, the last the hindmost : φάλαγγας Il. 4.254. Absol. in pl., those in the rear, the rear rank : ἐν πυμάτοισι κελεύων Il. 11.65.

(2) That is at the extremity of something : ἄντυξ ἣ πυμάτη θέεν ἀσπίδος (at its edge) Il. 7.118. The extreme part of the . . ., the extremity of the . . .: ἐξ ἐπιδιφριάδος πυμάτης (its edge) Il. 10.475, ῥινὸς ὕπερ πυμάτης (the top of it) Il. 13.616, ἄντυγα πὰρ πυμάτην σάκεος (the edge of the rim) Il. 18.608.

(3) The last in sequence or time : δρόμον Il. 23.373, 768. Cf. Od. 2.20. In oblique cases of that to which action is last directed or which is last affected in some way, last : οὖτιν πύματον ἔδομαι Od. 9.369. Cf. Il. 11.759, Il. 22.66 : Od. 6.138.

forms: With the fist : πὺξ ἀγαθόν (the great boxer) Il. 3.237, οὐ πύξ γε μαχήσεαι (will never box again) Il. 23.621. Cf. Il. 23.634 (at boxing), 660 (to box) : Od. 8.103, 130, 206, Od. 11.300.

defs: (1) Fire : ὄσσε οἱ πυρὶ λαμπετόωντι ἐΐκτην Il. 1.104. Cf. Il. 2.340 (to the flames with . . .), 415 (genit. of material, with fire), Il. 5.4, 215 (commit to the flames), Il. 7.182, Il. 12.177, Il. 14.396, etc. : Od. 4.418, Od. 5.490, Od. 9.390, Od. 12.68, Od. 16.290, Od. 17.23, Od. 19.39, etc. Funeral-fire, the flames of the pyre : ὄφρα πυρός με λελάχωσιν Il. 6.79. Cf. Il. 15.350, Il. 23.76, etc. : Od. 24.65.

(2) The result of the application of fire to prepared combustible material, fire; when a particular mass of fire is referred to, a fire : ἐν πυρὸς αὐγῇ Il. 9.206, ἐν νηυσὶ πῦρ βαλέειν Il. 13.629. Cf. Il. 8.521, 563, Il. 9.211, Il. 15.420, Il. 16.122, Il. 18.344, Il. 19.376, etc. : Od. 3.341, Od. 5.59, Od. 7.305, Od. 8.426, 501, Od. 14.518, Od. 17.572, Od. 22.481, etc. Of watch-fires : ἔνθα πῦρ κήαντο Il. 9.88 (i.e. each band lighted its fire). A funeral-pyre Il. 23.45.
A smith's tongs : γέντο πυράγρην Il. 18.477. Cf. Od. 3.434.
To bring the influence of fire to bear upon, harden by fire : [ῥόπαλον] Od. 9.328.
In line : π. σφέας αὐτοὺς ἀρτύναντες Il. 12.43 (in line of battle). Cf. Il. 13.152, Il. 15.618.

(1) A fortified wall securing a city or strong place; in pl., walls, ramparts : ἧντʼ ἐπὶ πύργῳ Il. 3.153, δείμομεν πύργους Il. 6.338. Cf. Il. 7.373, Il. 6.437 (hardly to be distinguished from τεῖχος), Il. 8.165, Il. 9.574, Il. 12.36, 332 (the part of the wall under his charge), Il. 15.737, Il. 16.700, Il. 18.274, Il. 22.97 (a projecting angle of the wall), Il. 24.443, etc. : Od. 7.262. Fig. of a person : τοῖός σφιν π. ἀπώλεο (so mighty a wall of defence was lost in thee) Od. 11.556.
(2) A tower erected for defence on such a wall : φέρων σάκος ἠΰτε πύργον Il. 6.219=Il. 11.485=Il. 17.128. Cf. Il. 4.462.
(3) A body of troops formed in line : δέκα πύργοι Ἀχαιῶν Il. 4.347, πάπτηνεν ἀνὰ πύργον Ἀχαιῶν (the line of defenders) Il. 12.333. Cf. Il. 4.334.
To surround with a wall, fortify : Θήβης ἕδος πύργωσαν Od. 11.264.
(2) The fire of a sacrifice : πυρὴν ἐμπλησέμεν ἐσθλῶν Od. 10.523=Od. 11.31.

forms: Charred (at the end to prevent rotting) Il. 13.564.

etym: [πῦρ + καίω. A place where fire is kindled.]
forms: A funeral-pyre : νεκροὺς πυρκαϊῆς ἐπενήνεον Il. 6.428=431. Cf. Il. 23.158, 225, 228, 231, 237, 250=Il. 24.791.

defs: A wheaten cake or loaf Od. 15.312, Od. 17.12, 362.

forms: In pl. : πυροί τε ζειαί τε Od. 4.604. Cf. Il. 11.69 : Od. 9.110, Od. 19.112.
Wheat-bearing : ἀρούρης Il. 12.314. Cf. Il. 14.123, Il. 21.602.

defs: To attend to, keep up, a fire. Absol. in pres. pple. pl. : πυρπολέοντας ἐλεύσσομεν (could see men tending their fire) Od. 10.30.
A beacon-fire or signal-fire : πυρσοὶ φλεγέθουσιν Il. 18.211.
(1) With negative, in no wise, not at all : μὴ δή πω χάζεσθε Il. 15.426. Cf. Il. 4.184, 234, Il. 17.422, Il. 22.279 : Od. 23.59. With οὐ. See οὐ 8.b

(2) With negative, not yet, never yet : ἐσθλὸν δʼ οὔτε τί πω εἶπας ἔπος οὔτʼ ἐτέλεσσας Il. 1.108. Cf. Il. 1.542, Il. 2.419, Il. 6.433, Il. 11.497, Il. 16.76, Il. 22.9, Il. 23.73, etc. : οὐδέ πω ὥρη εὕδειν Od. 11.373. Cf. Od. 3.23, Od. 11.161, Od. 23.315, etc. In reference to the future : μὴ δή πω λυώμεθʼ ἵππους Il. 23.7. Cf. Il. 18.134, Il. 24.553 : Od. 22.431. With οὐ. See οὐ 8.b.β, 8.c

forms: Nom. pl. masc. pres. pple. πωλεύμενοι Od. 2.55, Od. 17.534.
3 sing. pa. iterative πωλέσκετο Il. 1.490, Il. 5.788 : Od. 11.240. (ἐπι-)
defs: To go or come habitually or regularly, use or be wont to go or come : εἰς ἀγορής Il. 1.490. Cf. Il. 5.350, 788 : δεῦρο (frequents this spot) Od. 4.384, οὔ τι πάρος γε πωλέαι (it has not been your wont to come hither) 811, ἐπʼ Ἐνιπῆος ῥέεθρα (haunted them) Od. 11.240. Cf. Od. 2.55=Od. 17.534, Od. 9.189, Od. 22.352.
A means of protecting or securing the contents of something : ἴδε π. (the lid) Od. 8.443. Cf. Il. 4.116 (the top), Il. 16.221 (the lid) : Od. 2.353 (with stoppers), Od. 8.447, Od. 9.314.

(1) How? in what way or manner? by what means? πῶς τοι δώσουσι γέρας; Il. 1.123, πῶς κε κῆρας ὑπεξέφυγεν; Il. 22.202. Cf. Il. 6.36, Il. 10.61 (in what sense?), 243, Il. 11.838, Il. 17.327, Il. 18.188, Il. 19.81, Il. 24.519: Od. 1.171, Od. 3.22, Od. 8.352, Od. 10.64, Od. 15.195, Od. 18.31, Od. 20.129, etc.

(2) How? why? for what cause, inducement or reason? on what ground or pretext? πῶς τίς τοι πείθηται; Il. 1.150, πῶς ἐθέλεις ἅλιον θεῖναι πόνον; Il. 4.26. Cf. Il. 4.351, Il. 9.437 (how could I bring myself to stay?), Il. 17.149 (how can we look to you to . . .?), Il. 18.364, Il. 21.481, Il. 24.203 (what can induce you to . . .?) : Od. 1.65, Od. 9.351 (what will bring anyone here?), Od. 10.337, Od. 22.231.

(3) How? in what state or condition? πῶς αἱ φυλακαί; Il. 10.408. Cf. Il. 14.333 (how would it be?) : Od. 18.223.–πῶς γὰρ νῦν; how then? Il. 10.424. How? of what nature or kind? πῶς ὔμμιν ἀνὴρ ὅδε φαίνεται εἶναι; Od. 11.336.
(1) Somehow, haply : αἴ κέν πως θωρήξομεν υἶας Ἀχαιῶν Il. 2.72. Cf. Il. 1.66, 408, Il. 13.807, Il. 22.346, etc. : Od. 9.317, Od. 10.147, Od. 12.113, Od. 22.91, etc.

(2) In negative or conditional contexts, in any way, haply : εἴ πως τόδε πᾶσι φίλον γένοιτο Il. 4.17. Cf. Il. 3.436, Il. 5.250, Il. 16.60, etc. : Od. 4.388, Od. 12.224, 288, Od. 16.148, etc. With οὐ. See οὐ 8.d.
(3) Qualifying an expression, I ween, it would seem : ἀεί πώς μοι ἐπιπλήσσεις Il. 12.211. Cf. Il. 14.104.
To fly. Of missiles : λίθοι πωτῶντο θαμειαί Il. 12.287.
A flock (of sheep) : πώεα οἰῶν Il. 11.678. Cf. Il. 3.198, Il. 11.696, Il. 15.323, Il. 18.528 : νομεὺς ὣς πώεσι μήλων Od. 4.413. Cf. Od. 11.402, Od. 12.129, 299, Od. 14.100, Od. 24.112.
(1) A rod or wand.

(b) A magic wand. Of that of Hermes Il. 24.343. := Od. 5.47, Od. 24.2. Of that of Circe Od. 10.238, 293, 319, 389. Such a wand used by Athene in effecting transformations of Odysseus Od. 13.429, Od. 16.172, 456.

(2) App. to be taken as= ῥαφή· βοείας ῥάψε χρυσείῃς
              ῥάβδοισιν (i.e. with wire) Il. 12.297.

forms: Pliant: ἱμάσθλην χερσὶν ἔχε ῥαδινήν Il. 23.583.

defs: Sprinklings or drops (of blood) Il. 11.536=Od. 3.501. Sprinklings (of dust) Il. 23.502.

forms: To sprinkle, besprinkle : ῥαίνοντο κονίῃ Il. 11.282, αἵματʼ ἐρράδατο Il. 12.431. Cf. Od. 20.150 (i.e. with water), 354.

defs: A smith's hammer : γέντο ῥαιστῆρα κρατερήν Il. 18.477.
(1) To smite, break in pieces, shiver : φάσγανον ἐρραίσθη Il. 16.339. To disintegrate, scatter : ἐγκέφαλός κε ῥαίοιτο πρὸς οὔδεϊ Od. 9.459.
(2) To smite, afflict, shipwreck (a person) Od. 5.221, Od. 7.326. To smite, wreck (a ship) Od. 13.151, 177, Od. 23.235. In mid. Od. 8.569.
(1) An old or worn piece of cloth Od. 7.178.
(2) An old or tattered garment Od. 13.434, Od. 14.342, 349. In pl., tattered garments, rags : ζώσατο ῥάκεσιν Od. 18.67. Cf. Od. 14.512, Od. 18.74, Od. 19.507, Od. 21.221, Od. 22.1, 488.
Mended with patches, patched : χιτῶνα Od. 24.228, κνημῖδας 229.
(1) To sew or stitch together, stitch : βοείας Il. 12.296.
(2) To devise, contrive, plan, plot : κακά Il. 18.367 : Od. 3.118, Od. 16.423. Cf. Od. 16.379, 422.
A stitch or seam : ῥαφαὶ ἐλέλυντο ἱμάντων Od. 22.186.
The backbone and immediately adjoining flesh, the chine : συὸς ῥάχιν Il. 9.208.

forms: (ῥέα in Iliad only. A monosyllable in Il. 12.381, Il. 13.144, Il. 17.461, Od. 3.101, 263).
defs: (1) Easily, with ease, without effort or difficulty, readily : ῥέα πάλλεν Il. 5.304, ὅπως ἵπποι ῥεῖα διέλθοιεν (without giving the driver trouble, without shying) Il. 10.492. Cf. Il. 2.475, Il. 3.381, Il. 8.179, Il. 11.802, Il. 12.381, Il. 13.90 (with effortless stride), 144 (without check), Il. 16.745 (nimbly), Il. 17.461, Il. 18.600 (smoothly), Od. 3.263 (without check, straight), Il. 24.567, etc. : Od. 2.322 (without more ado), Od. 3.231, Od. 4.207, Od. 7.108, 300, Od. 10.573, Od. 17.265, 273 (you saw it at once), 305, Od. 23.188.
(2) At ease, at one's ease : θεοὶ ῥεῖα ζώοντες Il. 7.138 : Od. 4.805, Od. 5.122.

(3) Without thinking of the consequences, lightly, readily : ἄλλον κεν θεῶν ῥεῖα κατευνήσαιμι Il. 14.245. Sim. : τούτοισι ταῦτα μέλει ῥεῖα (they enjoy themselves with no thought for the morrow) Od. 1.160.
(1) A stream : ποταμοὶ καὶ ῥέεθρα Od. 11.157.
(2) In pl., the streams or waters (of a river) : καϋστρίου ἀμφὶ ῥέεθρα Il. 2.461. Cf. Il. 6.135, Il. 8.369, Il. 14.245, Il. 17.749, Il. 21.9, Il. 23.205, etc. : Od. 3.292, Od. 7.317, Od. 11.240.
(3) In pl., the flow or course of a river : ἄψορρον κῦμα κατέσσυτο ῥέεθρα (i.e. in the proper channel) Il. 21.382.

forms: Aor. pple. neut. pass. ῥεχθέν, -έντος Il. 9.250, Il. 17.32, Od. 3.198.
defs: (1) To do, act : ὧδε ῥέξαι Il. 2.802. Cf. Il. 6.353, Il. 9.453 (did as she bade me), Il. 22.259, Il. 24.661 : Od. 9.352. With acc. of person affected by the action : κακῶς οἵ πέρ μιν ἔρεζον Od. 23.56.

(2) To do, perform, accomplish : τόδε μέγʼ ἄριστον Il. 2.274, ῥεχθέντος κακοῦ Il. 9.250. Cf. Il. 5.374, Il. 10.51, Il. 11.502, Il. 14.62, Il. 15.586, Il. 19.90, Il. 22.305, Il. 23.494, etc. : Od. 1.47, Od. 2.232, Od. 4.205, Od. 8.148 (wins), Od. 11.272, Od. 16.381, Od. 20.314, Od. 22.46, Od. 23.222, etc. Absol. in aor. pple. neut. pass. : ῥεχθὲν δέ τε νήπιος ἔγνω (i.e. is wise after the event) Il. 17.32=Od. 3.198. With double acc. of what is done and of the person affected : ξεινοδόκον κακὰ ῥέξαι Il. 3.354. Cf. Il. 2.195, Il. 4.32, Il. 5.373=Il. 21.509, Il. 9.647, Il. 10.49, Il. 24.370 : Od. 2.72, 73, Od. 4.690, Od. 18.15, Od. 22.209, 314.

(3) To do or offer (sacrifice), sacrifice (a victim) : ἱερὰ ῥέξας Il. 1.147. Cf. Il. 1.444, Il. 4.102 = 120=Od. 23.864 = 873, Il. 9.357, 535, Il. 10.292, 294, Il. 11.727, Il. 23.146, 206 : Od. 1.61, Od. 3.159, 144, 382, Od. 9.553, Od. 10.523, etc. Without expressed object, to do or offer sacrifice : ἄλλος ἄλλῳ ἔρεζε θεῶν Il. 2.400. Cf. Il. 8.250, Il. 9.536 : Od. 12.344, Od. 14.251.
Explained as, the limbs : ψυχὴ ἐκ ῥεθέων πταμένη Il. 16.856=Il. 22.362. Cf. Il. 22.68.
To incline or sink downwards : ῥέπεν αἴσιμον ἦμαρ Ἀχαιῶν Il. 8.72. Cf. Il. 22.212.

forms: nom. pl. neut. pf. pple. pass. ῥυπάω.

defs:
(1) Of a river or stream, to flow, run : ποταμοὶ κατʼ ὄρεσφι ῥέοντες Il. 4.452. Cf. Il. 5.88, 773, Il. 7.172, Il. 16.389, 391, Il. 17.751, Il. 18.403, Il. 21.256, 271 : Od. 10.513, Od. 19.207. For εὐρὺ ῥέω, εὐρὺ
              ῥέων see εὐρύς 2.a. Of streaming blood : ἀμφὶ νέκυν ἔρρεεν αἷμα Il. 23.34. Of streaming sweat : κατὰ νότιος ῥέεν ἱδρώς (streamed down) Il. 11.811, Il. 23.715. Cf. Il. 16.110, Il. 23.688 : Od. 11.600. Of the rain of thick-coming missiles : τῶν ἐκ χειρῶν βέλεα ῥέον Il. 12.159. Of bristles dropping off all together : τῶν ἐκ μελέων τρίχες ἔρρεον Od. 10.393. With dat. of that which flows : ῥέεν αἵματι γαῖα (ran with blood) Il. 4.451=Il. 8.65, Il. 15.715, Od. 3.494.

(2) To flow, run, flow or run forth, gush forth : ὅθεν ῥέεν ὕδωρ Il. 2.307. Cf. Il. 3.300, Il. 4.140, Il. 5.339, 340 (i.e. when a god is wounded), Il. 13.539, 655=Il. 21.119, Il. 17.86, 438 : Od. 9.140, 290, Od. 11.36, Od. 17.209, Od. 19.204. So in aor. pass. : ἐπεὶ ἐκ μέλαν αἷμα ῥύη Od. 3.455. Of speech : ἀπὸ γλώσσης ῥέεν αὐδή Il. 1.249. With dat. of that which flows : ἡ μὲν [πηγὴ] ὕδατι λιαρῷ ῥέει (runs with . . .) Il. 22.149. Cf. Od. 5.70.

(1) The broken water or surf beside the beach : ἐπὶ ῥηγμῖνι θαλάσσης (at the edge of the breakers) Il. 1.437, Il. 8.501. Cf. Il. 2.773, Il. 16.67 : Od. 4.430 = 575=Od. 9.169 = 559=Od. 10.186, Od. 4.449, Od. 9.150 = 547=Od. 12.6, Od. 15.499.
(2) The surf or broken surface (of the sea) : ἄκρον ἐπὶ ῥηγμῖνος ἁλός Od. 3.229 (see ἄκρος 3). Cf. Od. 12.214.

forms: Mid. 3 pl. aor. ἐρρήξαντο Il. 12.291. ῥήξαντο Il. 11.90.
defs: (1) To smash, crush : ὀστέον Il. 12.185, Il. 16.310, Od. 3.399. To rend, tear : χρόα Il. 23.673.
(2) In pass., of the sea, to break, become surf : περί σφισι κῦμα ῥήγνυτο Il. 18.67. Cf. Il. 4.425.
(3) To rend, rive, penetrate, perforate : θώρηκας Il. 2.544. Cf. Il. 3.348=Il. 6.259=Il. 17.44, Il. 13.439, 507=Il. 17.314, Od. 3.268=Il. 21.165.

(4) To break asunder or in two, sever, cause to part, snap or give way : ἱμάντα Il. 3.375, ἔχματα πέτρης Il. 13.139. Cf. Il. 5.307, Il. 8.328, Il. 12.459, Il. 15.464, Il. 16.587 : ἱτοῦ προτόνους Od. 12.409. With ἀπό, to break off, cause to part from a fastening : ῥῆξεν ἀπὸ λόφον Il. 15.537.
(5) To break (opposed ranks) : φάλαγγα Il. 7.6. Cf. Il. 6.141, Il. 11.538, Il. 15.615, 617. In mid. : ῥηξάμενος Δαναῶν στίχας Il. 13.680. Cf. Il. 11.90, Il. 13.718, Il. 15.409.

(6) To lay open by breaking, break or make a way through (a barrier) : θαλάμοιο θύρας Il. 9.476. Cf. Il. 12.198, 262, 341, Il. 13.124, Il. 17.751. In mid. : τεῖχος ῥηξάμενοι Il. 12.90. Cf. Il. 12.224, 257, 291, 308, 418, 440. Absol., to break a way through a barrier. In mid. : ἀργαλέον μοί ἐστι μούνῳ ῥηξαμένῳ θέσθαι κέλευθον Il. 12.411.
(7) To cause (strife) to break out. In mid. : ἐν αὐτοῖς ἔριδα ῥήγνυντο Od. 3.55.

(1) App., a cloth, prob. of wool, laid on the rough bedding for the comfort of the sleeper (cf. λίνον 3) : κώεά τε ῥῆγός τε λίνοιό τε λεπτὸν ἄωτον Il. 9.661. Cf. Il. 24.644 :=Od. 4.297=Od. 6.336, Od. 3.349, 351, Od. 7.38, Od. 11.189, Od. 13.73 (here app. simply laid on the deck of the ship), 118, Od. 19.318, 337, Od. 20.141, Od. 23.180.
(2) App., a similar cloth thrown over the back of a chair : ἔβαλλε θρόνοις ἔνι ῥήγεα καθύπερθʼ, ὑπένερθε δὲ λῖθʼ ὑπέβαλλεν Od. 10.352.

forms: dat. sing. neut. aor. pple. pass. εἴρω2.
With complementary infin. : τάφρος οὐχ ὑπερθορέειν ῥηϊδίη (easy to . . .) Il. 12.54. Cf. Od. 3.265.
So in impers. use :  ῥηΐδιόν [ἐστι] θεοῖσι κυδῆναι βροτόν Od. 16.211.
Easy to understand or follow : ἔπος Od. 11.146.

defs: (1) Easily, with ease, without effort or difficulty : ἐνίκα ῥ. Il. 4.390. Cf. Il. 9.184, Il. 11.114, Il. 12.448, Il. 16.690 (i.e. by his divine power), Il. 17.283, Il. 22.140 (with smooth flight), etc. : ῥ. ἀφελὼν θυρεόν Od. 9.313. Cf. Od. 8.376, Od. 14.196 (could go on relating . . .), Od. 16.198, Od. 21.92, 407, etc.
(2) Without thinking of the consequences, lightly : τοὺς σάωσας ῥ., ἐπεὶ οὔ τι τίσιν γʼ ἔδεισας ὀπίσσω Il. 22.19.
The easiest or happiest, the most free from care : βιοτή Od. 4.565.
In neut. pl. ῥηΐτατα as adv., with the greatest ease, with the least effort : ὅς κε ῥ́ ἐντανύσῃ βιόν Od. 19.577= Od. 21.75.

forms: With complementary infin. : ῥηΐτεροι πολεμίζειν (to fight with) Il. 18.258. Cf. Il. 24.243.

defs: That may be rent or torn : ἀνδρί, ὃς χαλκῷ ῥηκτὸς [εἴη] Il. 13.323.
Might to break the ranks of the foe Od. 14.217.
That breaks the ranks of the foe (cf. ῥήγνυμι 5). Epithet of Achilles Il. 6.228, Il. 13.324, Il. 16.146, 575 : Od. 4.5.

forms: Discourse, talk : ἀκούεις μύθων ἡμετέρων καὶ ῥήσιος Od. 21.291.

defs: To beat time : ῥήσσοντες ἁμαρτῇ ἕποντο Il. 18.571.

forms: Stated, specified, agreed upon : μισθῷ ἔπι ῥητῷ Il. 21.445.
A (verbal) agreement, a bargain or covenant Od. 14.393.

defs: Horrible, a thing to shudder at : (ελένης Il. 19.325.

(1) To be physically affected by fear as if by cold, shudder with fear, dread or apprehension : ῥίγησεν Ἀγαμέμνων Il. 4.148. Cf. Il. 4.150, 279, Il. 5.596= Il. 11.345, Il. 11.254, Il. 12.208, 331, Il. 15.34, 436, 466, Il. 16.119. Sim. : αἰεί μοι θυμὸς ἐρρίγει μὴ . . . (was in constant terror lest . . .) Od. 23.216.
(2) To shudder at, dread, shrink from : πόλεμον Il. 5.351, οὐκ ἔρριγα μάχην (it is not my wont to shrink from the fight) Il. 17.175.
(3) To shrink from doing something. With infin. : ὄφρα τις ἐρρίγῃσι ξεινοδόκον κακὰ ῥέξαι Il. 3.353, τούτῳ ἔρριγʼ ἀντιβολῆσαι (does not care to meet him) Il. 6.114.
(4) To be physically affected by a sudden summons or announcement, be fluttered or thrown into agitation : ὣς φάτο, ῥίγησεν δʼ ὁ γέρων Il. 3.259. Cf. Od. 5.116, 171.
(1) Colder : ποτὶ ἕσπερα ῥ́ ἔσται Od. 17.191.
(2) More to be feared or dreaded, worse : τό οἰ (τοι) καὶ ῥίγιον ἔσται (it will be the worse for him (you)) Il. 1.325, 563. Cf. Il. 11.405: Od. 20.220.
The most to be feared or dreaded. Absol. in neut. pl. : ῥίγιστα τετληότες εἰμέν (the worst extremities) Il. 5.873.

forms: Cold : εἴ με μεθήῃ ῥῖγος Od. 5.472.

defs: To be cold, feel cold : οὐκ ἐφάμην ῥιγωσέμεν Od. 14.481.
(1) The root of a tree or plant : δρύες ῥίζῃσιν μεγάλῃσιν ἀραρυῖαι Il. 12.134. Cf. Il. 9.542, Il. 21.243 : Od. 10.304, Od. 12.435, Od. 23.196.
(2) The prepared root of a plant used medicinally : ἐπὶ δὲ ῥίζαν βάλε πικρήν Il. 11.846.
(3) In pl., the roots of the eye, the attachments of the eye within the orbit : σφαραγεῦντο [γλήνης] πυρὶ ῥίζαι Od. 9.390.

forms: To furnish with roots : ἔνθα οἱ ἀλωὴ ἐρρίζωται (there grows his vineyard with its trees) Od. 6.122.
Fig. : νῆʼ ἐρρίζωσεν ἔνερθεν (fixed immovably) Od. 13.163.

defs: (2) Speedily, quickly, with haste : δεῖπνον ἕλοντο Il. 8.54. Cf. Il. 24.799.
(3) In short space, soon : λέπτʼ ἐγένοντο Od. 3.497.

etym: -οῦ, ἡ, also ῥινόν, τό Il. 10.155 : Od. 5.281 (ϝρινός, ϝρινόν).
defs: (1) The stripped-off skin of a beast, a hide : ἕρπον ῥινοί Od. 12.395. Cf. Il. 6.474.
(2) A prepared hide. Used for sleeping or sitting upon : ὑπὸ δʼ ἔστρωτο ρ̀ινὸν βοός Il. 10.155 : ἥμενοι ἐν ῥινοῖσι βοῶν Od. 1.108. For wearing : ἕσσατο ῥινὸν λύκοιο Il. 10.334.
(3) A layer of leather forming part of a shield Il. 6.248, Il. 13.406, 804.
(4) Leather : κυνέην ῥινοῦ Il. 10.262, δοῦπος . . .ῥινοῦ τε βοῶν τε (of leather and the shields thereof, i.e. of the leather shields) Il. 16.636. Cf. Od. 3.276 : Od. 12.423.
(5) A shield : σύν ῥʼ ἔβαλον ῥινούς Il. 4.447= Il. 8.61, ῥινοῖσι βοῶν φράξαντες ἐπάλξεις (of ox-leather) Il. 12.263. Cf. Il. 5.308 : Od. 5.281.

(6) The skin of a man : περὶ ῥινοὶ μινύθουσιν (their skins) Od. 12.46. Cf. Od. 14.134, Od. 22.278. So in pl. : ἔνθα κʼ ἀπὸ ῥινοὺς δρύφθη (would have had his skin stripped off) Od. 5.426. Cf. Od. 5.435.
Piercer of shields. Epithet of Ares Il. 21.392.
(1) A peak or pinnacle of a mountain Il. 8.25, Il. 14.154, 225= Il. 19.114 : Od. 9.191.
(2) A rock or reef projecting into the sea Od. 3.295.
(1) The rush or rapid or impetuous flight of a missile : λᾶος ὑπὸ ῥιπῆς Il. 12.462 : Od. 8.192. The range or carry of a missile : ὅσση αἰγανέης ῥ. τέτυκται Il. 16.589.
(2) The rush of wind Il. 15.171, Il. 19.358. Of fire Il. 21.12.
(3) The rush or furious onset of a warrior : οἵ κʼ ὄλωνται ἀνδρὸς ἑνὸς ῥιπῇ Il. 8.355.
To throw to and fro, toss : ῥιπτάζων κατὰ δῶμα θεούς Il. 14.257.

(1) To throw, cast, hurl : τρυφάλειαν ῥῖψʼ ἐπιδινήσας Il. 3.378. Cf. Il. 1.591, Il. 8.13, Il. 15.23, Il. 19.130, 268, Il. 22.406, Il. 23.827, 845, Il. 24.735 : Od. 7.115, Od. 8.374, Od. 9.398, Od. 20.299. Absol., to make one's throw : τὸ τρίτον ἔρριψεν αἴας Il. 23.842. Of the operation of wind : τὰς ἄνεμος ῥίπτασκε ποτὶ νέφεα Od. 11.592.
(2) To jerk or pull in a specified direction : [ἰχθὺν] θύραζε Od. 12.254.

forms: ῥινός, ἡ (an initial consonant app. lost).
defs: (1) The nose : ἀμβροσίνη ὑπὸ ῥῖνα θῆκεν Od. 4.445. Cf. Il. 5.291, Il. 13.616 : Od. 18.86.

(2) So in pl., the nose (as containing the two nostrils) : ἀπʼ οὔατα ῥῖνάς τʼ ἀμήσαντες Od. 21.301. Cf. Il. 14.467, Il. 16.503, Il. 23.395 : Od. 22.475. With special reference to the nostrils : αἷμʼ ἀνὰ στόμα καὶ κατὰ ῥῖνας πρῆσεν Il. 16.349. Cf. Il. 19.39, Il. 23.777 : Od. 5.456, Od. 22.18, Od. 24.318.
In pl., wicker-work : φράξε σχεδίην ῥίπεσσι οἰσυΐνῃσιν Od. 5.256.
Thus, waving : δονακῆα Il. 18.576.

In pl., the streams or waters (of a river) : μαιάνδρου ῥοάς Il. 2.869. Cf. Il. 3.5, Il. 4.91, Il. 5.774, Il. 7.4, Il. 8.560, Il. 11.732, Il. 16.669, 679, 719, Il. 18.240, Il. 19.1 : Od. 7.216, Od. 9.450, Od. 10.529, Od. 22.197, Od. 24.11. Of a stream of water poured over something : ἔνιψʼ ὕδατος ῥοῇσιν Il. 16.229.

forms: Of waves, rushing, breaking in uproar : κῦμα Od. 5.412.

defs: To swallow down Od. 12.106.
To whistle Il. 10.502.

forms: Whistling: πολλῇ ῥοίζῳ πρὸς ὄρος τρέπε μῆλα Od. 9.315.
The whizzing of missiles in flight : ὀϊστῶν ῥοῖζον Il. 16.361.

defs: A pomegranate-tree : ὄγχναι καὶ ῥοιαὶ καὶ μηλέαι Od. 6.115= Od. 11.589.
(1) The stream or waters (of a river) : ἱκόμεσθα ῥόον Ἀλφειοῖο Il. 11.726. Cf. Il. 12.25, Il. 16.151, Il. 18.402, Il. 21.16, 147, 219, 241, 263, 306, 369 : Od. 5.449, Od. 7.85, Od. 11.21, Od. 12.1.

(2) The moving waters of a river, its current : βέβρυχεν μέγα κῦμα ποτὶ ῥόον (as it meets the current) Il. 17.264, πρὸς ῥόον ἀΐσσοντος (against the current) Il. 21.303 : νῆα κατʼ Ὠκεανὸν ποταμὸν φέρε κῦμα ῥόοιο (the moving stream of its current) Od. 11.639. Cf. Od. 5.451.
(3) The flow or wash of the sea : βόμβησαν ἐρετμὰ κατὰ ῥόον Od. 12.204. Cf. Od. 5.327. A current or set of the sea : κῦμά με ῥόος τʼ ἀπέωσεν Od. 9.80. Cf. Od. 14.254.

(4) The flow or course of a river : ποταμοὺς ἔτρεψε νέεσθαι κὰρ
              ῥόον (i.e. in their proper channels) Il. 12.33, πᾶσι [ποταμοῖσι] ῥόον πεδίονδε τίθησιν (turns their course to the . . .) Il. 17.750 : ἄψ ἔφερε [κρήδεμνον] κῦμα κατὰ ῥόον (down its stream) Od. 5.461. Sim. in reference to water used in irrigation : ὡς ὅτʼ ἀνὴρ ὀχετηγὸς ὕδατι ῥόον ἡγεμονεύῃ (guides its flow) Il. 21.258.

A club or cudgel. Used for beating an ass Il. 11.559, 561. In the hunt Od. 11.575. A stick or staff for support in walking : δός μοι, εἴ ποθί τοι ῥ. τετμημένον ἐστί, σκηρίπτεσθαι Od. 17.195. Such a stick used as a weapon of offence : ἠὲ μεταΐξας ῥοπαλῳ ἐκ θυμὸν ἔλοιτο Od. 17.236. Of the stick carried by the Cyclops Od. 9.319.

forms: Of the sea, to roar, dash in uproar : ῥόχθει μέγα κῦμα Od. 5.402. Cf. Od. 12.60.

defs: In a stream : ῥ. ἀφειοῖο (on whom riches flowed) Od. 15.426.
Impurities, dirt Od. 7.93.

forms: Acc. sing. masc. pres. pple. ῥυπόωντα Od. 24.227.
Acc. pl. neut. ῥυπόωντα Od. 7.87, Od. 13.435.
Nom. pl. neut. pf. pple. pass. ῥερυπωμένα Od. 7.59.
To be dirty or squalid : ῥυπόωντα ἕστο χιτῶνα Od. 24.227. Cf. Od. 7.87, Od. 13.435.
So in pf. pass. : εἵματα, τά μοι ῥερυπωμένα κεῖται Od. 7.59.
Cattle, etc., driven off by way of reprisal : ῥύσιʼ ἐλαυνόμενος Il. 11.674.

defs: That guards the city : Ἀθηναίη ῥυσίπτολι Il. 7.305 (u. l. ἐρῦσίπτολι).

forms: Drawn, wrinkled Il. 9.503 (of the λιταί (see λιτή) as figuring an offender with his face wrinkled by the mental struggle caused by his reluctance to ask pardon).
To haul or pull about, maltreat : δμῳάς Od. 16.109= Od. 20.319.

defs: A hauling or pulling about, maltreatment Od. 18.224.
(1) A (skilful) drawer (of the bow or of arrows) : ῥυτῆρα βιοῦ καὶ ὀϊστῶν Od. 21.173. Cf. Od. 18.262.
(2) In pl., the reins of a chariot : [ἵπποι] ἐν ῥυτῆρσι τάνυσθεν (pulled in the governance of, pulled at, the reins) Il. 16.475.

forms: A keeper or guard : σταθμῶν ῥυτῆρα Od. 17.187, 223.
Prob, drawn out of the earth, dug, quarried : λάεσσιν Od. 7.267, Od. 14.10.

defs: Full of rents or  holes, rent, torn : (εκτόρεον χιτῶνα δαΐξαι ῥωγαλέον (so as to pierce it with many a hole) Il. 2.417. Cf. Od. 13.435, 438= Od. 17.198= Od. 18.109, Od. 14.343.

forms: In pl., app., passages forming continuations or branches of the λαύρη: ἀνὰ ῥῶγας μεγάροιο Od. 22.143.
3 pl. aor. ἐρρώσαντο Il. 24.616 : Od. 23.3, Od. 24.69. (ἐπιρρώομαι).
defs: To move nimbly, speed along : ὑπʼ ἀμφίπολοι ῥώοντο ἄνακτι Il. 18.417. Of nimble motion of the limbs : ὑπὸ κνῆμαι ῥώοντο Il. 18.411= Od. 3.37. Cf. Od. 23.3. Of movement in the dance Il. 24.616. Of rhythmical movement as part of a ceremony Od. 24.69. To rush to the fray : αὐτοὶ πρυλέες ῥώοντο Il. 11.50. Cf. Il. 16.166. Of a horse's mane, to stream (with the wind) Il. 23.367.
Growing twigs Od. 10.166. Cut brushwood used for sitting upon : ῥῶπας ὑπέχευε δασείας Od. 14.49. Cf. Od. 16.47.
Small growing trees and shrubs, brushwood Il. 13.199, Il. 21.559, Il. 23.122 : Od. 14.473.
A break or sudden dip (in the ground) : ῥωχμὸς ἔην γαίης Il. 23.420.
Of dogs, etc., to show delight or fondness, fawn : νόησε σαίνοντας κύνας Od. 16.6. Cf. Od. 10.217, 219, Od. 17.302 (wagged his tail).
Wielder of the shield. Epithet of Tydeus Il. 5.126.

forms: Dat. pl. σακέεσσι Od. 14.477. σάκεσσι Il. 17.354 : Od. 16.474. σάκεσι Il. 4.282, Il. 17.268 : Od. 14.479.

defs: A trumpet Il. 18.219.
To sound the trumpet. Fig. : ἀμφὶ σάλπιγξεν οὐρανός (re-echoed as with the trumpet's sound) Il. 21.388.
(1) A board or plank : σανίδας ἐκδῆσαι ὄπισθεν Od. 22.174. One of the boards fixed on the framework and forming the face of a gate : πύλαι σανίδες τʼ ἐπὶ ἀραρυῖαι Il. 18.275. Cf. Il. 12.453, 461.
(2) In pl., the two wings of a gate or door, a gate or door : σείων κολλητὰς σανίδας Il. 9.583. Cf. Il. 12.121, Il. 21.535 : Od. 2.344, Od. 21.137 = 164 (against the . . .), Od. 22.128, Od. 23.42.
(3) Boarding ; in the passage cited, app. a wooden stage or platform raised above the earthen floor of a room : ἐφʼ ὑψηλῆς σανίδος βῆ· ἔνθα δὲ χηλοὶ ἕστασαν Od. 21.51.

etym: -η, -ον, σῶς (the first only in comp. σαώτερος Il. 1.32).
defs: (1) Free from harm, safe, unharmed, unhurt, safe and sound, in good case : σαώτερος ὥς κε νέηαι (the safer) Il. 1.32, λαὸν σῶν ἔμμεναι 117. Cf. Il. 5.531= Il. 15.563 (find safety), Il. 6.310, Il. 8.246, Il. 15.497, Il. 16.252 : Od. 4.98, Od. 15.42, Od. 16.131, Od. 19.300. Of things, safe, unharmed, whole, intact : οὔτʼ ἠέλιον σῶν ἔμμεναι οὔτε σελήνην Il. 17.367.

(2) Free from danger, in safety, safe, not liable to be harmed : ὅππως σόοι μαχέοιντο (i.e. with the least risk possible) Il. 1.344. Cf. Il. 22.332. So of things : ἵνα περ τάδε τοι σόα μίμνῃ Il. 24.382 : Od. 13.364.
(3) Sure to come or happen, inevitable : σῶς τοι (μοι) ὄλεθρος Il. 13.773 : Od. 5.305, Od. 22.28.
Soundness of sense, good sense, discretion, prudence Od. 23.13. So in pl. : σαοφροσύνῃσι νοήματα πατρὸς ἔκευθεν Od. 23.30.
Of sound or good sense, discreet Il. 21.462 : Od. 4.158.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. pple. σώοντες (σαόοντες) Od. 9.430.
3 sing. non-thematic impf. σάω Il. 16.363, Il. 21.238.
Infin. σαωσέμεναι Il. 13.96. σαωσέμεν Il. 9.230, Il. 19.401.
defs: (1) To save from imminent or present danger, bring off safely, rescue from or bring safe through peril or trouble : τὼ νῶϊ πόλινδε σαώσετον (bring us off in safety to the city) Il. 5.224, ἐκ πολέμου Il. 11.752. Cf. Il. 5.23, Il. 8.363, Il. 9.78, Il. 12.123 (give him way to the ships and safety), Il. 15.503, Il. 19.401, Il. 21.238, etc. : Od. 3.185, 231 (bring him safe home), Od. 4.288, 444, 513, 753, 765, Od. 5.130, 452, Od. 9.430, Od. 10.286, 473, Od. 22.357, 372. In reference to things : νῆας Il. 9.230, πόλιν καὶ ἄστυ Il. 17.144. Cf. Il. 9.424, 681, Il. 10.44, Il. 13.96. In mid., to bring oneself off safely, get off unharmed : ἔνθεν οὔ τι σαώσεαι Od. 21.309.
(2) To rescue from the foe, bring or carry off from hostile hands : τὸν νέκυν περ ἐόντα σαῶσαι Il. 24.35. Cf. Il. 5.469, Il. 15.427, Il. 17.149, 692.

(3) To preserve from danger, keep from harm, see safe, stand by : φράσαι εἴ με σαώσεις Il. 1.83. Cf. Il. 22.56 : αὐτόν σε σάω (look after yourself) Od. 17.595. Cf. Od. 13.230. In reference to things : ταῦτα Od. 13.230.

forms: In neut. sing. σαρδάνιον as adv., of smiling, app. scornfully, bitterly Od. 20.302.

defs: The flesh of the body : διήφυσε σαρκός (partitive genit.) Od. 19.450. In pl. : σάρκες περιτρομέοντο μέλεσσιν Od. 18.77. Cf. Il. 8.380= Il. 13.832 : Od. 9.293, Od. 11.219.
The butt-end (of a spear) (app.= οὐρίαχος) Il. 10.153.

(1) In reference to knowledge, with full understanding, clearly, with certainty, well : οὔ πω σ. οἶσθʼ οἷος νόος Ἀτρεΐωνος Il. 2.192. Cf. Il. 2.252, Il. 5.183, Il. 6.226, Il. 12.228, Il. 15.632, Od. 3.201 = 432 : Od. 1.202, Od. 2.108= Od. 24.144, Od. 4.730, Od. 17.153, 307, 373, Od. 24.404.

(2) In reference to speech, with clearness of exposition, plainly, fully, without concealment : ἀγγελίην, ἥν χʼ ἡμῖν σ. εἴποι Od. 2.31. Cf. Od. 2.43, Od. 17.106. With certainty or clear knowledge : ς. εἰπέμεν ὁππόθʼ ὄλωλεν Od. 3.89. App., truly, correctly : μὴ ψεύδεʼ ἐπιστάμενος σ. εἰπεῖν Il. 4.404.
(1) To put out, quench (fire) Il. 16.293, Il. 23.237, 250= Il. 24.791. To quell, destroy, crush : πάντων ἀνθρώπων μένος Il. 16.621. To put away (wrath) Il. 9.678.
(2) Intrans. In non-sigmatic aor., of a fire, to go out : οὐδέ ποτʼ ἔσβη πῦρ Il. 9.471. Of wind, to cease to blow, fall : οὐδέ ποτʼ ἔσβη οὖρος Od. 3.182.
To be restrained from doing (something) by sensitiveness to the opinion of others, shrink from doing (it), think shame to do (it) (cf. αἰδέομαι 2) : σεβάσσατο τό γε θυμῷ Il. 7.167, 417.
(1) Sensitiveness to the opinion of others, fear of what others may think or say, shame ( =  αἰδώς 2) : σέβας σε θυμὸν ἰκέσθω Il. 18.178.
(2) Wonder : σέβας μʼ ἔχει εἰσορόωντα (εἰσορόωσαν) Od. 3.123, Od. 4.75, 142, Od. 7.161, Od. 8.384.

forms: To be moved by respect for the opinion of others, fear what others may think or say, think shame (cf. αἰδέομαι 4) : οὔ νυ σέβεσθε; Il. 4.242.

defs: (1) To shake, cause to quiver or vibrate : σανίδας Il. 9.583. Cf. Il. 15.321 : Od. 3.486= Od. 15.184. To shake or brandish (a spear) : σείων ἐγχείην Il. 5.563. Cf. Il. 3.345, Il. 13.135, 558, Il. 22.133. In pass., to shake or quiver : ἀμφί οἱ κροτάφοισι σείετο πήληξ Il. 13.805. Cf. Il. 14.285, Od. 3.59.
(2) In mid., to change one's position suddenly, start : σείσατʼ εἰνὶ θρόνῳ Il. 8.199.

forms: Dat. σέλαϊ Il. 17.739. σέλᾳ Il. 8.563 : Od. 21.246. Blaze, glow, brightness : ἥατο σέλᾳ πυρός Il. 8.563. Cf. Il. 8.509, Il. 15.600, Il. 17.739, Il. 18.214, Il. 19.17 (i.e. of fire), 366, 374, 375, 379 : δαΐδων σ. Od. 18.354. Cf. Od. 21.246.
A thunderbolt : δαιόμενον ἧκε σ. Il. 8.76.
3 sing. aor. σεύατο Il. 7.505, Il. 6.208, Il. 14.227 : Od. 5.51.
3 sing. opt. σεύαιτο Il. 17.463, Od. 3.148, Il. 23.198.
(ἀνα-, ἀπο-, δια-, ἐκ-, ἐπισσεύω, κατα-, μετασσεύομαι).
defs: (I) To set in motion : ἐξ ἀμφοτέροιιν αἷμʼ ἔσσευα (caused it to spirt forth) Il. 5.208, διωνύσοιο τιθήνας σεῦε κατὰ νυσήϊον (chased them) Il. 7.133, ὅλμον ὥς [ϝʼ] ἔσσευεν (hurled the body) Il. 11.147. Cf. Il. 11.293 (sets on), 294, Il. 14.413 (sent him spinning), Il. 15.681 (urging them on), Od. 3.189 (chased you), 325 (caused him to shoot up) : Od. 7.89 (drove them), Od. 14.35 (scattered them). In mid. : εἴ περ ἄν αὐτὸν σεύωνται κύνες (seek to drive him off) Il. 3.26. Cf. Il. 11.549 (drive off)= Il. 15.272 (chase), Od. 3.148 (should chase him).
(II) In mid.
To coop up in or as in a pen : σήκασθέν κε κατὰ?̓́ιλιον Il. 8.131.
One who sweeps out pens Od. 17.224.
A pen or fold for sheep, goats or cattle Il. 18.589 : Od. 9.219, 227, 319, 439, Od. 10.412.
(1) A distinguishing mark : γνῶ κλήρου σ. ἰδών Il. 6.189.
(2) A spot or patch of white hair on the forehead of a horse, a star Il. 23.455.
(3) A peg or something similar stuck in the ground to mark the distance of a throw (cf. τέρμα 2) : ὑπέρβαλε σήματα πάντων Il. 23.843. Cf. Od. 8.192, 195.
(4) A guiding mark Il. 10.466.
(5) A sign or token.
(b) Something indicated to a person for guidance of his action Il. 23.326.
(c) A signal for action Od. 21.231.
(d) Something adduced as proof, an evidence : ς. ἀριφραδὲς ἄλλο τι δείξω Od. 21.217. Cf. Od. 19.250= Od. 23.206, Od. 23.73, 110, 188, 202, 225,  Od. 24.329, 346.
(e) A guest-token, the credentials brought by a guest to satisfy his host as to his identity : ᾔτεε σ. ἰδέσθαι Il. 7.176. Cf. Il. 7.178. So in pl.: πόρε σήματα λυγρά Il. 7.168.

(6) A sign from heaven, a portent or omen : ἔνθʼ ἐφάνη μέγα σ. Il. 2.308. Cf. Il. 2.353, Il. 4.381, Il. 8.171, Il. 9.236, Il. 13.244, Il. 22.30 : Od. 21.413. An omen or presage of human origin Od. 20.111.

(7) A mound of earth or stones erected over and marking a grave, a grave-mound or barrow (= τύμβος) : παρὰ σήματι?̓́ιου Il. 10.415. Cf. Il. 2.814, Il. 7.419, Il. 6.86, 89, Il. 11.166, Il. 21.322, Il. 23.45, 255, 257, Il. 24.16, 51, 349, 416, 755, 799, 801 : Od. 1.291, Od. 2.222, Od. 11.75. A wooden post erected on and marking a grave : ξύλον . . . σῆμά τευ βροτοῖο πάλαι κατατεθνηῶτος Il. 23.331.
(1) To put a distinguishing mark upon, mark. In mid. : κλῆρον ἐσημήναντο ἕκαστος Il. 6.175.
(2) To point out, show, indicate : τέρματα Il. 23.358=757. To indicate, tell about : ἕκαστα Od. 12.26.
(3) To give one's orders to. With dat. : πᾶσι Il. 1.289. Cf. Il. 1.296, Il. 2.805.

(4) To take command, act as leader : πένθʼ ἡγεμόνας ποιήσατο σημαίνειν Il. 16.172. To act as master : ἐπὶ δμῳῇσι γυναιξίν Od. 22.427. To be in command of, command, be in charge of. With genit. : στρατοῦ ἄλλου Il. 14.85. With dat. : φυλάκεσσιν Il. 10.58. Cf. Il. 17.250.
(5) To superintend work, act as superintendent or overseer : σήμαινεν Ὀδυσσεύς Od. 22.450. Cf. Il. 21.445.
(6) To guide or direct the actions of, act as counsellor to. With dat. : οἱ Il. 11.789.
(1) A commander or captain Il. 4.431.
(3) He who guides the horses, a charioteer (= ἡνίοχος (1)) Il. 8.127. He who drives the cattle or sheep, a herdsman or shepherd Il. 15.325.

forms: To-day, this day : τούτῳ Ζεὺς κῦδος ὀπάζει σ. Il. 8.142. Cf. Il. 11.431, Il. 19.103, Od. 3.127, 211: Od. 17.186, 252, Od. 18.377.
For to-day : παύσωμεν πόλεμον Il. 6.30. Cf. Il. 6.291.
3 sing. aor. subj. pass. σαπήῃ Il. 19.27.
In pf. and pass., to undergo natural decomposition or decay, rot : οὐδέ τί οἱ χρὼς σήπεται Il. 24.414. Cf. Il. 2.135 (lie rotted away), Il. 19.27.

defs: Strong, of might Il. 9.505.

(1) Physical strength, power, might, vigour : ἐν σ. ὦρσεν ἑκάστῳ Il. 2.451. Cf. Il. 8.32, Il. 9.351, Il. 11.827, Il. 12.224, Il. 16.542, Il. 18.274 (see ἔχω I 14), Od. 3.361, etc. : Od. 8.136, Od. 21.282, Od. 22.237. Of animals : λέοντος σ. Il. 5.139. Cf. Il. 5.783, Il. 12.42, Il. 17.22, etc. : Od. 18.373. Of inanimate objects : οὐδέ τι πρώονα σθένεϊ [ποταμοὶ] ῥηγνῦσι ῥέοντες Il. 17.751.
(2) ς. τινός, like βίη 5,  periphrasis for a person : ς.?̓ιδομενῆος Il. 13.248. Cf. Il. 23.827. Sim.: ς. Ὠρίωνος (the constellation) Il. 18.486, ς. Ὠκεανοῖο 607, Il. 21.195.
(3) The strength of life, vital force : αὐδὴ καὶ σ. Il. 18.420.

forms: A (fattened and full-grown) domestic swine or pig Il. 21.363 : Od. 2.300, Od. 10.390, Od. 14.19, Od. 20.163.

defs: Bright, shining, glittering, glistening, glossy. Epithet of various things : ἡνία Il. 5.226, 328, Il. 8.116, 137, Il. 11.128, Il. 17.479, εἵματα Il. 22.154, δέσματα 468 : θρόνῳ Od. 5.86, εἵματα Od. 7.26, ῥήγεα 38, Od. 11.189, Od. 19.318, 337, Od. 23.180, ἡνία Od. 7.81, ῥήγεϊ Od. 13.118, χιτῶνα Od. 15.60, Od. 19.232, ὑπερώϊα Od. 16.449, Od. 18.206, Od. 19.600, Od. 22.428.
To be silent. In imp. σίγα, be silent ! hush ! Il. 14.90 : Od. 14.493, Od. 17.393, Od. 19.42, 486.

forms: In dat. σιγῇ, in silence, keeping silence, without speech, restraining the lips : ἴσαν Il. 3.8. Cf. Il. 3.134, 420, Il. 4.431, Il. 6.195, Il. 19.255 : Od. 4.776, Od. 6.30, Od. 13.76, Od. 15.391, Od. 18.142, Od. 19.502, Od. 21.388.
Without construction : σιγῇ νῦν (let no more be said) Od. 15.440.

defs: (1) Of iron : ἄξονι Il. 5.723. Cf. Il. 6.141, 144, Il. 8.15 : Od. 1.204. Epithet of the heavens regarded as a vault of burnished metal, the iron . . . Od. 15.329= Od. 17.565.

(2) As if of iron : ὀρυμαγδός (unwearying, ceaseless, incessant) Il. 17.424, θυμός (hard as iron, inflexible) Il. 22.357, πυρὸς μένος (relentless) Il. 23.177, ἦτορ (not to be turned from its course, daring all) Il. 24.205, 521 : κραδίη (stout as iron) Od. 4.293, θυμός (not open to compassion or sympathy) Od. 5.191, σοὶ σιδήρεα πάντα τέτυκται (you are all of iron) Od. 12.280, ἦτορ (unfeeling) Od. 23.172.

(2) Various things made of iron. The point of an arrow : τόξῳ [πέλασε] σίδηρον Il. 4.123. An axe Il. 4.485. A knife or sword Il. 18.34. A knife Il. 23.30. A bar of iron or something of the sort : ὀφθαλμοὶ ὡς εἰ κέρα ἕστασαν ἠὲ σίδηρος Od. 19.211. Cf. Od. 19.494.

(3) Collectively, implements or weapons of iron : πολιὸν σίδηρον (i.e. the articles of iron proposed as prizes) Il. 23.261, τίθει ἰόεντα σίδηρον 850 (defined in the next line) : διοϊστεῦσαι (διοϊστεύσειν̓ (εἴ κε διοϊστεύσὠ σιδήρου (i.e. the axe-heads set up to be shot through by the suitors) Od. 19.587, Od. 21.97 = 127, Od. 21.114, Cf. Il. 7.48= Il. 10.379= Il. 11.133 : = Od. 21.10, Od. 14.324, Od. 16.294 =  Od. 19.13, Od. 21.3 = 81 =  Od. 24.168, Od. 21.61, 328, Od. 24.177.
(1) To hurt, harm, do mischief to : εἴ κε σίνηαι [βόας] Od. 11.112= Od. 12.139. Cf. Il. 24.45.
(2) To harry, despoil : οἵ σφεας σινέσκοντο Od. 7.6. To lay violent hands upon, carry off to destruction : ἑταίρους Od. 12.114.

forms: Ravening : λῖν σίντην Il. 11.481, λύκοι σίνται Il. 16.353. Cf. Od. 3.165.

defs: To take one's meals, eat : ἐν τῷ σιτέσκοντο Od. 24.209.

(1) Food other than flesh-meat (definitely in this sense or distinguished in terms from meat) : σῖτον ἐπένειμε, ἀτὰρ κρέα νεῖμεν Ἀχιλλεύς Il. 9.216, Il. 24.625 : σῖτον ὄψα τε Od. 3.479, ἀνέμισγε σίτῳ φάρμακα λυγρά Od. 10.235. Cf. Od. 1.139= Od. 4.55= Od. 6.175= Od. 10.371= Od. 15.138= Od. 17.94 = 259, Od. 1.147, Od. 4.623,  Od. 9.9, Od. 10.290, 375, Od. 12.19, Od. 14.449, 456, Od. 15.334, Od. 16.51, Od. 17.335, 412, Od. 20.254, Od. 22.21.
