To the ground, on to, on, the ground: ἆλτο Il. 3.29, ἀπὸ πύργου βαῖνε χαμᾶζε (i.e. to the ground level) Il. 21.529. Cf. Il. 5.835, Il. 8.134, Il. 10.528, Il. 15.537, Il. 23.508, etc.: Od. 16.191, Od. 21.136, Od. 22.84, 327, 340.
(1) On the ground, on the earth: χαμαὶ ἐρχομένων ἀνθρώπων Il. 5.442. Cf. Il. 11.145: χ. ἧσθαι Od. 6.160.
(2) With notion of motion= χαμάδις 1, χαμᾶζε: χ. πέσεν Il. 4.482. Cf. Il. 4.526, Il. 5.583, 588, Il. 7.134, Il. 8.320, Il. 13.530, Il. 22.448, etc.: Od. 17.490, Od. 18.28, 397, Od. 22.188.

forms: Epithet of swine: σύες Od. 10.243, Od. 7.15.

defs: Sleeping on the ground: σελλοὶ χαμαιεῦναι Il. 16.235.

forms: 3 sing. fut. in mid. form χείσεται Od. 18.17.
3 sing. aor. ἔχαδε Il. 4.24, Il. 8.461. χάδε Il. 11.462.
Acc. sing. masc. pf. pple. κεχανδότα Il. 23.268: Od. 4.96.
defs: (1) To have or hold in it, contain: θάλαμον, ὃς γλήνεα πολλὰ κεχάνδει Il. 24.192. Cf. Od. 4.96.

(2) To have capacity or afford room for, hold, contain: ἥϋσεν ὅσον κεφαλὴ χάδε φωτός (with as much voice as his head would hold, with his full volume of voice, à pleine tête) Il. 11.462, τέσσαρα μέτρα κεχανδότα (holding . . . ) Il. 23.268. Cf. Il. 14.34, Il. 23.742: ὥς οἱ χεῖρες ἐχάνδανον (as much as they could hold) Od. 17.344. Cf. Od. 18.17.
(3) To repress, keep in, contain: Ἥρῃ οὐκ ἔχαδε στῆθος χόλον (i.e. it burst out) Il. 4.24=Il. 8.461.

forms: Open-mouthed, greedily: ὃς ἂν οἶνον χ. ἕλῃ Od. 21.294.

defs: (1) A mountain-stream, a torrent Il. 16.390.
(2) The bed of a torrent, a ravine or gorge Il. 4.454.

forms: Superl. χαριέστατος of two terminations Od. 10.279. Pleasing, lovely, fine: νηόν Il. 1.39, εἵματα Il. 5.905, Il. 22.511. Cf. Il. 8.204, Il. 9.599: φᾶρος Od. 5.231=Od. 10.544, ἔργα Od. 7.234=Od. 23.161, Od. 10.223.
Of parts of the body, lovely, fair: μέτωπον Il. 16.798. Cf. Il. 18.24, Il. 22.403.
Of incorporeal things and abstractions, pleasing, delightful, acceptable: ἀμοιβήν Od. 3.58, ἀοιδήν Od. 24.198.
In superl.: τοῦ περ χαριεστάτη ἥβη Il. 24.348: τοῦ περ χαριέστατος ἥβη Od. 10.279.
Absol. in neut. pl., what makes for pleasingness: οὐ πάντεσσι θεοὶ χαρίεντα διδοῦσιν Od. 8.167.
3 sing. aor. opt. χαρίσαιτο Il. 7.49, Il. 10.380, Il. 11.134.
defs: (1) To make oneself agreeable or do something agreeable (to a person), to gratify, favour, seek favour in the eyes of. With dat.: χαριζόμενος βασιλῆϊ Il. 11.23. Cf. Il. 5.71, Il. 13.633, Il. 15.449=Il. 16.291: Od. 10.43, Od. 13.265, Od. 14.387. To honour (with sacrifice): οὔ νύ [τοι] Ὀδυσσεὺς χαρίζετο ἱερὰ ῥιέζων· Od. 1.61.

(3) To gratify, conciliate or satisfy a person by giving, bestow on him to his heart's content: τῶν κέν τοι χαρίσαιτο πατὴρ ἀπερέσιʼ ἄποινα Il. 7.49=Il. 11.134. Cf. Il. 10.380: Od. 24.283. Absol. : ἄργαλέον ἕνα προικὸς χαρίσασθαι Od. 13.15. With genit. of material: χαριζομένη παρ εόντων (setting good cheer before them (him) from her store) Od. 1.140=Od. 4.56=Od. 6.176=Od. 10.372=Od. 15.139=Od. 17.95, ἀλλοτρίων χαρίσασθαι (to give at another's cost) Od. 17.452.

(1) Loveliness, charm, beauty, grace, comeliness: χάρις ἀπελάμπετο Il. 14.183 : =Od. 18.298. Cf. Od. 2.12=Od. 17.63, Od. 7.235, Od. 8.19, Od. 23.162. In pl. : χάρισι στιλβων Od. 7.237.  –In reference to something immaterial: οὔ οἱ χάρις ἀμφιπεριστέφεται ἐπέεσσιν Od. 8.175, ὅς ἀνθρώπων ἔργοισι χάριν ὀπάζει (consummation, perfection) Od. 15.320.
(3) Gratification, pleasure, delight, satisfaction: τῶνδʼ ἀντὶ χάριν δοῖεν Il. 23.650. With genit. of the cause: ἧς οὔ τι χάριν ἴδεν (had no joy of her) Il. 11.243.
(1) Joy, pleasure: τὴν ἅμα χάρμα καὶ ἄλγος ἕλε φρένα Od. 19.471.
(2) A source or cause of joy, gratification or comfort, a joy or delight: δυσμενέσι χάρμα Il. 3.51. Cf. Il. 7.82, Il. 10.193, Il. 14.325, Il. 16.636, Il. 23.342, Il. 24.706: Od. 7.185.
(1) Fighting, battle: προκαλέσσατο χάρμη Il. 6.218, 285. Cf. Il. 12.389, Il. 16.823, Il. 16.602.
(2) A fight in progress: μηδʼ εἴκετε χάρμης (from the fight) Il. 4.509. Cf. Il. 14.101, Il. 16.161.

(3) Spirit, stomach, ardour for the fight, one's spirit of fight: μνήσαντο χάρμης Il. 4.222, Il. 8.252=Il. 14.441, Il. 15.380. Cf. Il. 12.203, 393, Il. 13.82, 104, 721, Il. 15.477, Il. 16.103, 759, Il. 19.148: Od. 22.73.
(4) The art of war, war, fighting: εἰδότε χάρμης Il. 5.608.
Epithet of lions of uncertain meaning; perh., with flashing eyes, or the like Od. 11.611.
(1) To be in need, be in straits: ̓ αργείοισιν ἀμυνέμεναι χατέουσί περ ἔμπης Il. 9.518. Cf. Il. 15.399: Od. 2.249.
(2) With genit., to have need of, stand in need of: θεῶν Od. 3.48.
(3) With infin.
(b) To desire, wish: δμῶες χατέουσιν ἀντία δεσποίνης φάσθαι Od. 15.376.
(1) To have need of, stand in need of: θέτις νύ τι σεῖο χατίζει (wishes to see you about something) Il. 18.392.

(2) To wish for, desire, aim at, seek: τέο αὖτε χατίζεις; Il. 2.225. Cf. Od. 8.156, Od. 11.350, Od. 22.50. The genit. to be supplied Il. 16.221. Absol.: οὔ τι χατίζων πωλεύμην (seeking anything for myself) Od. 22.351.
A hole or lurking-place. In reference to a serpent Il. 22.93, 95.
(1) In pl., the lips: χείλεα δίηνεν Il. 22.495. Cf. Il. 15.102: Od. 1.381=Od. 18.410=Od. 20.268, Od. 18.21.
(2) The lip or brink of something, [τάφρου] χείλει ἐφεσταότες Il. 12.52. The rim of a vessel. In pl.: χρυσῷ ἐπὶ χείλεα κεκράαντο (κεκράανται) Od. 4.132, 616=Od. 15.116.
(1) Bitter weather, cold: χ. με δάμναται Od. 14.487.
(2) Winter: χείματος οὐδὲ θέρευς (in winter or summer) Od. 6.118, χ. εὕδει ὅθι . . . (during, in, winter) Od. 11.190.
Flowing with winter force, in flood: ποταμός Il. 11.493, Il. 13.138.
Of, proper to, coming in, winter: ἄελλαι Il. 2.294, ὕδωρ (a winter flood) Il. 23.420. Cf. Il. 3.222, Il. 12.279: ὥρῃ (storm-time) Od. 5.485.
(1) The weather proper to winter, bitter or inclement weather: ἐπεὶ χειμῶνα φύγον Il. 3.4. Cf. Od. 4.566. An access of bad weather, a storm or tempest Il. 16.549: Od. 14.522.
(2) Winter: χειμῶνι περῶντα (in winter) Il. 21.283.

forms: Dat. sing. χερί Il. 8.289, Od. 3.182, Il. 24.101.
defs: (1) One of the hands, one's hand; in dual and pl., the hands, one's hands: στέμματʼ ἔχων ἐν Il. 1.14, μηδὲ ξίφος ἕλκεο χειρί 210, ἄμφω χεῖρε πετάσσας Il. 4.523. Cf. Il. 1.351, 585, Il. 3.270, 363, Il. 4.249, etc.: χεῖρʼ ἕλε δεξιτερήν Od. 1.121, μὴ ἔρις καὶ χερσὶ γένηται (lest it come to fisticuffs) Od. 18.13. Cf. Od. 2.37, 321, Od. 3.35, 51, Od. 4.66, etc. In pl. where the reference is to one hand: ἐρυσσάμενος χείρεσσι μάχαιραν Il. 3.271=Il. 19.252. Cf. Il. 3.367, Il. 12.27, Il. 16.801, Il. 23.384, etc.: Od. 4.506, Od. 5.292, Od. 13.225, etc.
(2) In reference to position: ̓́ αρκτον ἐπʼ ἀριστερὰ χειρὸς ἔχοντα (to the left of his hand, on the left hand) Od. 5.277.

(3) In pl. in reference to fighting or violence or to one's might or strenth: οὔ τις σοὶ βαρείας χεῖρας χεῖρας ἐποίσει Il. 1.89, χερσὶν ὑφʼ ἡμετέρῃσιν ἁλοῦσα Il. 2.374, βιῃ καὶ χερσὶ καὶ ἔγχεϊ φέρτερος Il. 3.431. Cf. Il. 1.166, 567, Il. 7.502, Il. 8.226, 344, Il. 12.135, etc.: Od. 1.238, 254, Od. 8.181, Od. 9.512, Od. 11.502, Od. 13.376, Od. 18.156, etc. Contrasted in terms with ἔπεα: ἐν γὰρ χερσὶ τέλος πολέμου, ἐπέων δʼ ἐνὶ βουλῇ Il. 16.630. Cf. Il. 1.77.

(4) Extended to the arm or the arms: χρυσηΐδα πατρὶ ἐν χερσὶ τίθει Il. 1.441, νεκρός οἱ ἔκπεσε χειρός (his arms) Il. 4.493, ἀπὸ δʼ ἔξεσε χεῖρα Il. 5.81, τετυμμένω ἀμφοτέρω κατὰ χεῖρα Il. 13.783 (in the case of the first, the arm (cf. 529), in the case of the second, the hand (cf. 593)). Cf. Il. 5.344, Il. 7.81, Il. 11.252 (the forearm), Il. 13.534, Il. 15.311 (on his arm), Il. 16.517 (cf. 510), Il. 21.166, Il. 22.426, etc.: Od. 4.454, Od. 5.344, 374, 454, Od. 7.310, Od. 14.351, Od. 21.223, etc.
A covering for the hand, a glove: χειρῖδας ἐπὶ χερσὶν [ἔχεν] Od. 24.230.

etym: [double comp. Cf. χείρων. Cf. also χερειότερος.]
defs: Less warlike, soldierly or skilful in fight: χειρότερός περ ἐών Od. 3.436. Cf. Il. 15.513.

forms: Acc. pl. neut. χέρεια Il. 14.382: Od. 18.229, Od. 20.310.
defs: (1) Of meaner birth, of lower rank or station: ἀνδρὶ χέρηϊ Il. 1.80, χερείονος θεοῦ Od. 3.106. Cf. Od. 11.621. Absol.: οἶά τε τοῖς ἀγαθοῖσι παραδρώωσι χέρηες Od. 15.324.
(2) Less warlike, soldierly or skilful in fight: ἐγὼ σέθεν πολὺ χείρων Od. 3.434. Cf. Il. 4.400, Il. 10.238, Il. 14.377, Il. 15.641. Absol. : χέρεια  [τεύχεα] χείρονι δόσκον Il. 14.382.

(3) Inferior, of less account, less worthy, serviceable or skilful: οὐ χερείων, οὐ δέμας οὐδὲ φυήν Il. 1.114, ἄλλον κεβριόναο χερείονα Il. 12.92. Cf. Il. 16.149, Il. 23.572, 577: οὔ τι κασιγνήτοιο χερείων Od. 8.585. Cf. Od. 5.211, Od. 14.176, Od. 20.45, 82, 133, Od. 21.325. Absol. : χερείονά περ καταπεφνών Il. 16.539.

(4) Of things, inferior, less good of their kind, of less account or estimation, worse: χέρεια [τεύχεα] Il. 14.382. Cf. Il. 23.413. Impers.: σοί [κʼ] αὐτῷ χεῖρον [εἴ] (you would but fare the worse) Od. 15.515.

(5) Bad rather than good. Impers.: οὔ τι χέρειον δεῖπνον ἑλέσθαι (it is no bad thing to . . .) Od. 17.176, αὐτίκα δʼ ἐστὶ δαήμεναι οὔ τι χέρειον (I may as well know it now) Od. 23.262. Absol. in neut. pl., what is bad rather than good, bad, evil: ἐπεὶ τὰ χερείονα νικᾶ Il. 1.576: =Od. 18.404.
(6) Morally bad or unfitting. Absol.: ἐσθλά τε καὶ τὰ τὰ χέρεια Od. 18.229=Od. 20.310.
A swallow: χελιδόνι εἰκέλη αὐδήν (ἄντην) Od. 21.411, Od. 22.240.

etym: [double comp. Cf. χερείων. Cf. also χειρότερος.]
defs: (1) Less warlike, soldierly or skilful in fight: σέο χερειότερον Il. 2.248.
(2) Having this quality rather than the reverse, of small account in the fight: ὅς τʼ ἔξοχος . . . ὅς τε χερειότερος Il. 12.270.
A boulder or large stone used as a missile: χερμαδίῳ βλῆτο Il. 4.518. Cf. Il. 5.302, 582, Il. 11.265, Il. 12.154, Il. 14.410, Il. 16.774, etc.: Od. 10.121, Od. 21.371.
A handworker: γυνὴ χερνῆτις Il. 12.433.

forms: = έβης 2: χέρνιβον πρόχοόν τʼ ἔχουσα Il. 24.304.

defs: To wash one's hands (as a matter of ritual): χερνίψαντο καὶ οὐλοχύτας ἀνέλοντο Il. 1.449.
Water for washing the hands: χέρνιβʼ ἀμφίπολος προχόῳ ἐπέχευεν Od. 1.136=Od. 4.52=Od. 6.172=Od. 10.368=Od. 15.135=Od. 17.91. Used in ritual Od. 3.440, 445.
The dry land, the land: ἐπὶ χέρσου βήτην Il. 14.284. Cf. Il. 4.425, Il. 14.394: κύματα κυλινδόμενα προτὶ χέρσον Od. 9.147. Cf. Od. 7.95, Od. 6.278, Od. 9.486, Od. 10.459, Od. 15.495, Od. 19.278, etc.
A thin plating or coating: θώρηκα, ῷ πέρι χεῦμα κασσιτέροιο ἀμφιδεσίνηται Il. 23.561.

forms: Nom. pl. masc. pple. χεύαντες Il. 23.257, Il. 24.801: Od. 12.14.
Mid. 3 sing. aor. εχεύατο Il. 5.314, Il. 6.63, χεύατο Il. 18.24: Od. 24.317.
Pass. 3 sing. aor. opt. χυθείη Od. 19.590.
Nom. fem. pple. χυμένη Il. 19.284: Od. 8.527.
(ἀμφι-, δια-, ἐγ-, ἐκ-, ἐπι-, ἐσ-, κατα-, περι-, περιπρο-, προ-, συγ-, ὑπο-.)
defs: (1) To pour (liquid): ὕδωρ ἐπὶ χεῖρας Il. 3.270, Il. 9.174, οἶνον ἐκ δεπάων Il. 6.480. Cf. Il. 9.15=Il. 16.4, Il. 14.436, Il. 18.347, Il. 23.220: a 146, Od. 3.40, Od. 4.214, Od. 8.436, Od. 9.210, Od. 20.260, etc. In mid.: χοὴν χεῖσθαι Od. 10.518. Cf. Od. 11.26. In reference to rain: ὅτε λαβρότατον χέει ὕδωρ Ζεύς Il. 16.385. In reference to the bowels: χύντο χολάδες (gushed forth) Il. 4.526=Il. 21.181.

(2) To shed (tears): δάκρυ χέων Il. 1.357, κατὰ δάκρυ χέουσα 413. Cf. Il. 7.405, Il. 6.426, Il. 8.245, Il. 16.3, etc.: Od. 2.24, Od. 4.556, Od. 10.409, Od. 11.183, Od. 14.280, Od. 22.447, etc. In pass., of tears, to flow, well forth: χύτο δάκρυα Il. 23.385. Cf. Od. 4.523.

(3) To shed or spread (mist) (whether actual mist or in reference to blinding or the mist of death): κατ' ὀφθαλμῶν κέχυτ' ἀχλύς Il. 5.696, Il. 16.344,  421, ἠέρα Il. 5.776, Il. 8.50, Il. 16.270. Cf.  321: Od. 6.15, Od. 13.189, Od. 22.88. In reference to dispersing mist, with a word indicating reversal of action: αὐτοῖο πάλιν χύτ' ἀήρ Od. 6.143.
(4) To spread (waves) on the surface of the sea: χεῦε κύματα (raised them) Od. 3.289. In mid., of a ripple, to spread itself: οἵη ζεφύροιο ἐχεύατο φρίξ Il. 6.63.
(5) In reference to granular substances.
(b) To shed (dust). In mid.: κόνιν χεύατο κὰκ κεφαλῆς Il. 18.24: Od. 24.317.
(6) In reference to a number of solid or semi-solid objects, or to masses of solid acted upon together, or with a collective sb.

(b) Generally, to shed, spread, throw, put, place: φύλλα τὰ μέν τ' ἄνεμος χαμάδις χέει (scatters them) Il. 7.147, φῦκος [κῦμ']) ἔχευεν (throws it up) Il. 9.7, ἐπεὶ εἰν ἐλεοῖσιν ἔχευε [κρέα] 215. Cf. Il. 19.222, Il. 23.775: ἔν μοι ἄλφιτα χεῦον δοροῖσιν Od. 2.354, χεῦε ῥῶπας καὶ κῶας Od. 16.47 (with κῶας by a slight zeugma). Cf. Od. 2.380, Od. 8.278, 282, 297, Od. 9.330, Od. 11.588, Od. 15.527, Od. 17.298, Od. 22.20, 85. Sim. of reins: καθ' ἡνία χεῦεν ἔραζε (let them drop) Il. 17.619.
(7) Of persons or animals

(b) In pass., to throw oneself or one's arms (round a person): ἀμφ̓ αὐτῷ χυμένη Il. 19.284: Od. 8.527, ὣς ἐμὲ κεῖνοι ἔχυντο Od. 10.415 (the force of  ἀμφί in ἀμφιθέουσι 413 being app. carried on to this vb.).
(c) In mid., to throw or place (the arms round a person): ἀμφ̓ ἑὸν υἱὸν ἐχεύατο πήχεε Il. 5.314.
(d) In pass., to huddle or be huddled together: [ὄϊες] ἐπ̓ ἀλλήλῃσι κέχυνται Il. 5.141. Cf. Od. 19.539, Od. 22.387, 389.

(8) In reference to immaterial or impalpable things, to shed, spread: ἀμφί οἱ θάνατος χύτο Il. 13.544, εἴ πως τῷ ὕπνον χεύῃ Il. 14.165, νηὸς κάτ' ἀσβέστη κέχυτο φλόξ (enveloped it) Il. 16.123, κατά οἱ κεφαλῆς χἔ ἀϋτμένα (i.e. his breath fell on the other's head) Il. 23.765. Cf. Il. 2.19, Il. 16.414 = 580, 282, Il. 24.445: ἀνέμων ἐπ̓ ἀϋτμένα χεῦεν (sent it abroad) Od. 3.289, κὰκ κεφαλῆς χεῦε κάλλος Od. 23.156. Cf. Od. 2.395, Od. 5.492, Od. 6.286, Od. 11.245, 433, Od. 12.338, Od. 18.188, Od. 19.521, 590, Od. 20.54, Od. 22.463.
(9) With σύν (cf. συγχέω).
(b) To confound, trouble, upset (the mind): σὺν γέροντι νόος χύτο Il. 24.358.

forms: crasis of καὶ ἡμεῖς, and we Il. 2.238.

defs: (1) In the wild state: χηνῶν ἢ γεράνων Il. 2.460=Il. 15.692. Cf. Il. 16.460.
(2) Domesticated: χῆνές μοι ἐείκοσι πυρὸν ἔδουσιν Od. 19.536. Cf. Od. 15.161, 174, Od. 19.543, 548, 552.
To lack, be without. With genit.: ἀνδρῶν Od. 9.124.

forms: Bereft of one's husband, widowed: γυναῖκες Il. 2.289. Cf. Il. 7.432, Il. 22.484, 499, Il. 24.725.
With genit.: ἣ τάχα χήρη σεῦ ἔσομαι Il. 7.408.

defs: To make a widow of, widow: γυναῖκα Il. 16.36. To make desolate: ἀγυιάς Il. 5.642.

forms: App., heirs who in particular circumstances came in to the exclusion of a dead man's surviving father: χηρωσταὶ διὰ κτῆσιν δατέοντο Il. 5.158.

defs: Want, lack: χήτεϊ τοιοῦδ' ἀνδρός Il. 7.463. Cf. Il. 19.324: Od. 16.35.
(1) On the ground: χθαμαλαὶ βεβλήαται εὐναί Od. 11.194.

(2) Little raised above the surrounding level, low: Ἰθάκη Od. 9.25 (but the application to Ithaca causes difficulty), νῆσος Od. 10.196. In comp.: τὸν ἕτερον σκόπελον χθαμαλώτερον ὄψει Od. 12.101. In superl.: ὕπερθε τεῖχος ἐδέδμητο χθαμαλώτατον Il. 13.683.
(1) Of yesterday: χρεῖος Il. 13.745.

(2) Constructed with a sb. or pronoun, yesterday: χ. ἔβη Il. 1.424, ὅσσα χ. ὑπέσχετ' Ὀδυσσεύς Il. 19.141 (really, as in 195 cited below, the day before yesterday). Cf. Od. 2.262, Od. 7.170, Od. 12.451, Od. 24.379.

(3) In neut. χθιζόν as adv., yesterday: ὅσσα χθιζὸν ὑπέστημεν δώσειν Il. 19.195 (cf. 141 cited above): χθιζὸν ὑπηοῖον Od. 4.656. So in neut. pl.: χθιζά τε καὶ πρωΐζ̓ ὅτε νῆες ἠγερέθοντο Il. 2.303 (at the time when, yesterday or the day before, the ships had been gathering,
                i.e. just after they had assembled).

(1) The earth: ἐπὶ χθονὶ δερκομένοιο Il. 1.88, χθὼν κονάβιζεν Il. 2.465. Cf. Il. 2.780, Il. 4.182, Il. 7.411, Il. 11.741, Il. 14.228, Il. 19.362, Il. 23.100, etc.: οὔ πω τέθνηκεν ἐπὶ χθονί Od. 1.196. Cf. Od. 7.153, Od. 6.67, Od. 10.99, Od. 12.191, Od. 19.408, etc.

(2) The surface of the earth, the earth, the ground: τεύχἐ ἀποθέσθαι ἐπὶ χθονί Il. 3.89. Cf. Il. 3.217, 265, Il. 5.13, Il. 7.213, Il. 14.349, etc.: ἐπὶ χθονὶ πῖπτεν Od. 24.535. Cf. Od. 3.453, Od. 8.375, Od. 19.470 (i.e. the floor), Od. 22.86, etc.
A thousand: χίλια μέτρα Il. 7.471. Cf. Il. 8.562, Il. 11.244.
A she-goat Il. 7.181.

(1) A loosely-fitting garment, prob. of linen, worn by men next to the body, a tunic: μαλακόν Il. 2.42, χλαῖνάν τ' ἠδὲ χιτῶνα 262. Cf. Il. 2.416, Il. 3.57 (see λάϊνος), Il. 5.113, 736, Il. 9.490, Il. 10.21, etc.: Od. 1.437, 439, Od. 3.467, Od. 4.50, Od. 7.214, Od. 8.441, Od. 13.434, etc.
(2) χ. χάλκεος, app.= θώρηξ Il. 13.439.

forms: Snow: ὅτε χιὼν ἐπάλυνεν ἀρούρας Il. 10.7, νιφάδες χιόνος (snowflakes) Il. 12.278. Cf. Il. 10.437, Il. 22.152: Od. 7.44, Od. 14.476, Od. 19.205.

defs: (1) An outer garment of wool, app. of the nature of a mantle or cloak, worn by men over the χιτών (app. distinguished from the φᾶρος only by being of a simpler character): ἀπὸ χλαῖναν βάλεν Il. 2.183, χλαῖνάν τ' ἠδὲ χιτῶνα 262. Cf. Il. 10.133, Il. 16.224, Il. 22.493, Il. 24.163, 230: Od. 4.50, 115, Od. 5.229, Od. 14.460, Od. 17.86, Od. 19.225, Od. 21.118, etc.

(2) A cloth or blanket of similar material covering a sleeper: χλαίνας ἐνθέμεναι οὔλας καθύπερθεν ἕσασθαι Il. 24.646: =Od. 4.299=Od. 6.338. Cf. Od. 3.349, 351, Od. 11.189, Od. 14.520, Od. 19.318, 337, Od. 20.4, 95, 143, Od. 23.180.

forms: Of unknown meaning: χλούνην σῦν Il. 9.539.

defs: Epithet of the nightingale. App., of the greenwood: ἀηδών Od. 19.518.

forms: An adjective of colour of somewhat indeterminate sense.
defs: (1) Applied to what we call green. Still green, freshly cut: ῥῶπας Od. 16.47. Cf. Od. 9.320, 379.
(2) To what we call yellow: μέλι Il. 11.631: Od. 10.234.

(3) In reference to the hue of the countenance, livid, pallid: χλωρὸς (χλωροὶ) ὑπαὶ δείους Il. 10.376, Il. 15.4. Epithet of δέος Il. 6.479, Il. 8.77, Il. 17.67: Od. 11.43, 633, Od. 12.243, Od. 22.42, Od. 24.450, 533.
A light flaky substance, a scurf of salt left by evaporated sea-water: ἐκ κεφαλῆς ἔσμηχεν ἁλὸς χνόον Od. 7.226.
A crucible Il. 18.470.
A libation: χοὴν χεῖσθαι (χεόμην) Od. 10.518, Od. 11.26.
A dry measure: ὅς κεν ἐμῆς γε χοίνικος ἅπτηται (draws his ration) Od. 19.28.
Of or pertaining to a χοῖρος. Absol. in neut. pl.: ἔσθιε χοίρεα (sc. κρέα) Od. 14.81 (porker's flesh).

forms: A young fattened pig, a porker Od. 14.73.

defs: The bowels Il. 4.526=Il. 21.181.
(1) Gall: χόλῳ σ' ἔτρεφε μήτηρ Il. 16.203.

(2) Anger, ire, wrath, rage (commonly, but not always, to be distinguished from κότος): χόλος λάβεν Il. 1.387, χόλον κʼ ἐξακέσαιο Il. 4.36, μή τι διατρίβειν τὸν ἐμὸν χόλον (i.e. the giving effect to it) Il. 4.42. Cf. Il. 1.81, Il. 2.241, Il. 4.23, Il. 7.326, Il. 9.157, 525, 646, Il. 15.122, Il. 16.30, Il. 17.399, 255, Il. 24.584, etc.: Od. 1.78,  433, Od. 3.145, Od. 4.583, Od. 8.304, Od. 11.554, Od. 21.377, Od. 24.248. In reference to a lion Il. 18.322. To a snake Il. 22.94.

forms: 3 sing. κεχολώσεται Il. 1.139, Od. 3.301 : Od. 15.214, Od. 24.544.
defs: (1) To provoke to anger or wrath, anger, enrage : ἐπεί μʼ ἐχολώσατε Od. 8.205. Cf. Il. 1.78, Il. 18.111 : Od. 18.20.

(2) In mid. and pass., to be provoked to anger, wrath or indignation, conceive anger, wrath or indignation, be angry, wroth, indignant, enraged : ὁ δέ κεν κεχολώσεται Il. 1.139, θυμῷ κεχολωμένον 217, σὺ μή τι χολωθῇς Il. 9.33. Cf. Il. 2.195, Il. 3.413, Il. 4.391, Il. 9.523, Il. 16.61, Od. 3.253, Il. 21.136, Il. 24.114, etc. : Od. 2.185, Od. 6.310, Od. 8.227, Od. 9.480, Od. 11.544, Od. 14.282, Od. 15.214, Od. 18.25, Od. 22.59, etc. With dat. of the person against whom one feels anger : βασιλῆϊ χολωθείς Il. 1.9. Cf. Il. 2.629, Il. 5.421, Il. 8.407, Il. 15.155, Il. 17.710, etc. : Od. 7.147, Od. 8.276, Od. 15.254, Od. 24.544. With genit. of the cause : τοῦ ἀποκταμένοιο χολώθη Il. 4.494. Cf. Il. 4.501, Il. 11.703, Il. 13.203, Il. 15.68, Il. 21.146, etc. : ἀνδρῶν μνηστήρων κεχολωμένος (enraged by the memory of their deeds) Od. 22.369. Cf. Od. 1.69, Od. 12.348.
Full of, displaying, anger, angry : ἐπέεσσιν Il. 4.241, Il. 15.210 : Od. 22.26, 225.
A string of a musicai instrument Od. 21.407.

etym: [app. a locative form from χορός + τύπτω.]
defs: Beating of the ground in the dance, the dance. In pl. : χοροιτυπίῃσιν ἄριστοι Il. 24.261.

(1) Dancing, the dance : χοροῖο λήγοντα Il. 3.394, ἐς χορὸν ἐλθέμεν Il. 15.508, χορῷ καλή (in the dance) Il. 16.180. Cf. Od. 7.65, 157. In pl. in sim. sense : κίθαρίς τε χοροί τε Od. 8.248. A particular instance : ἐν χορῷ Ἀρτέμιδος Il. 16.183. Cf. Od. 18.194. A throng or company of dancers : πολλὸς χορὸν περιίσταθʼ ὅμιλος Il. 18.603.
(2) A dancing-place : λείηναν χορόν Od. 8.260. Cf. Il. 18.590 : Od. 8.264, Od. 12.4, 318.
An enclosed space : αὐλῆς ἐν χόρτῳ (χόρτοισιν) Il. 11.774, Il. 24.640.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἔχραισμε Il. 14.66. χραῖσμε Il. 5.53, Il. 6.144.
3 sing. subj. χραίσμῃ Il. 1.28, Il. 3.54, Il. 15.32. χραίσμῃσι Il. 11.387.
defs: (1) To ward off, keep off. With dat. of person protected : ὄλεθρόν οἱ Il. 6.144, Od. 3.296. Cf. Il. 11.120. With personal object : μή νύ τοι οὐ χραίσμωσιν ἆσσον [ἔμʼ] ἰόντα Il. 1.566.

(2) To defend, protect, succour, aid, come to the rescue of. With dat. : μή νύ τοι οὺ χραίσμῃ σκῆπτρον θεοῖο Il. 1.28, οὔ οἱ χραῖσμʼ?̓́αρτεμις Il. 5.53. Cf. Il. 3.54, Il. 11.117, 387, Il. 15.32, Il. 16.837, Il. 18.62 = 443.
(3) Absol., to afford succour or protection, come to the rescue : ἐπεὶ τεῖχος οὐκ ἔχραισμεν Il. 14.66, οὐκ ἐδύναντο χραισμεῖν Il. 15.652. Cf. Il. 1.242, 589, Il. 21.193, 316.

forms: Fut. pple. χρησόμενος, -ου Od. 8.81, Od. 10.492, 565, Od. 11.165, Od. 23.323.
3 sing. plupf. κέχρητο Od. 3.266, Od. 14.421, Od. 16.398.
defs: (1) To give oracular response : ὥς οἱ χρείων μυθήσατʼ Ἀπόλλων Od. 8.79.
(2) In mid., to consult an oracle : ὅθʼ ὑπέρβη λάϊνον οὐδὸν χρησόμενος Od. 8.81. To consult (a seer). With dat. : ψυχῇ χρησομένους τειρεσίαο Od. 10.492=565. Cf. Od. 11.165, Od. 23.323.

(3) In mid., to make use of something, use it : ἕξει σόλον πέντʼ ἐνιαυτοὺς χρεώμενος,
                having it in use Il. 23.834. To enjoy the use of, be endowed with, have. With dat. : φρεσὶ κέχρητʼ ἀγαθῇσιν Od. 3.266, Od. 14.421, Od. 16.398.

(4) In mid., to desire, long for, wish to possess or get, have one's heart set upon, seek, aim at. With genit. : οὐκ εὐνῆς πρόφασιν κεχρημένος [αὐτῆς] Il. 19.262 : νόστου κεχρημένον ἠδὲ γυναικός Od. 1.13. Cf. Od. 14.124, Od. 20.378, Od. 22.50.

(5) In mid., to stand in need of, lack. With genit. : ὅτευ κεχρημένος ἔλθοι Od. 17.421= Od. 19.77. Absol., to be in need or want : καὶ μάλα περ κεχρημένος Od. 14.155. The pf. pple. in adjectival use, needy : κεχρημένῳ ἀνδρί Od. 17.347.

forms: 3 sing. aor. ἔχραε Il. 21.369 : Od. 5.396, Od. 10.64.
defs: To attack, assail, lay hands upon, vex : ὅν τε ποιμὴν χραύσῃ οὐδὲ δαμάσσῃ (i.e. wounds him, but not fatally) Il. 5.138. With dat. : στυγερός οἱ ἔχραε δαίμων Od. 5.396. Cf. Od. 10.64. With complementary infin. : τίπτε σὸς υἱὸς ἐμὸν ῥόον ἔχραε κήδειν; (to vex it) Il. 21.369. Cf. Od. 21.69.
(1) App., a consulting of a seer : ἦλθον Τειρεσίαο κατὰ χρέος (to consult him) Od. 11.479.
(2) Necessary affairs, business : ἑὸν αὐτοῦ χρεῖος ἐελδόμενος Od. 1.409. Cf. Od. 2.45.
(3) Something that one must pay, a debt : οἷσι χρεῖος ὀφείλετο Il. 11.686. Cf. Il. 11.688, 698, Il. 13.746 : Od. 3.367, Od. 8.353, 355, Od. 21.17.
(1) Call or demand for the presence, possession, or use of something, need.

(b) Without expressed vb. : ἦ τι μάλα χρεώ (it must be some sore need that has brought you) Il. 9.197. Without expressed vb. and with acc. of the person affected : μάλα χρεὼ πάντας Ἀχαιοὺς ἐσθλῆς [βουλῆς] (they have much need of it) Il. 9.75 : τίπτε σε χρεώ; (what do you want ?) Il. 10.85, τί σε χρεὼ ἐμεῖο; (what do you want with me ?) Il. 11.606 : τίπτε σε χρεώ; (what is your part in all this ?) Od. 1.225. Cf. Il. 9.608, Il. 10.43. Without expressed vb. and with complementary infin. : διδασκέμεν σε οὔ τι μάλα χρεώ (there is no  great need to . . .) Il. 23.308. Without expressed vb. and with acc. of the person affected and complementary infin.: οὐδέ τί μιν χρεὼ νηῶν ἐπιβαινέμεν (why should he . . . ?) Od. 4.707. Cf. Od. 15.201.

(2) Necessity, compulsion : χρειοῖ ἀναγκαίῃ Il. 8.57. Without expressed vb. and with acc. of the person affected and complementary infin.: τὸν μάλα χρεὼ ἑστάμεναι κρατερῶς (he needs must . . .) Il. 11.409. Cf. Il. 18.406.

(1) There is need of, there needs, one should have or display. With acc. of the person affected and genit. : οὐδέ τί σε χρὴ ταύτης ἀφροσύνης (this is no time for such folly) Il. 6.109 : ὅττεό σε χρή (what your business is) Od. 1.124, τί με χρὴ μητέρος αἴνου; (i.e. she needs no praise from me) Od. 21.110, ὄφρʼ ἂν πονήσομαι ὅττεό με χρή (do my work) Od. 22.377. Cf. Od. 3.14, Od. 4.463.
(2) It is necessary or needful, one needs must.
(b) With acc. alone : οὐδέ τί σε χρή (there is no need) Od. 19.500.
(c) With infin. alone : νῦν δὲ χρὴ τετλάμεν ἔμπης Od. 3.209.
(3) It befits, it is fitting or proper, it behoves, one ought.
(b) With acc. alone : οὐδέ τί σε χρή Il. 16.721, Il. 19.420, Od. 3.133. Cf. Od. 9.50.
(c) With infin. alone : χρὴ ἐμὸν θέμεναι πόνον οὐκ ἀτέλεστον Il. 4.57. Cf. Il. 5.490, Il. 9.309, 627, Il. 13.235, Il. 16.631 : Od. 7.207, Od. 15.74, Od. 19.4, Od. 24.324.
(1) To be in need or want : οὕτω χρηΐζοντι Od. 11.340.
(2) To stand in need of, need, want. With genit. : ἰητῆρος Il. 11.835 : ὅττευ χρηΐζων ἱκόμην λακεδαίμονα (what had brought me there) Od. 17.121. Cf. Od. 17.558.

forms: In pl., possessions, goods, effects, property : χρήματʼ ἀπαιτίζοντες Od. 2.78, πῇ χρήματα φέρω τάδε; Od. 13.203. Cf. Od. 2.203, Od. 14.286, Od. 15.230, Od. 16.315, Od. 19.284, etc.

defs: In pass., to approach, draw near : χριμφθεὶς πέλας Od. 10.516.

(1) To rub, anoint : χρῖεν ἐλαίῳ Il. 23.186. Cf. Il. 16.670, 680, Il. 24.587 : Od. 3.466, Od. 4.252, Od. 8.364, Od. 19.320, Od. 23.154, etc. Of rubbing arrows with poison. In mid. : ἰοὺς χρίεσθαι Od. 1.262.
(2) In mid., to rub or anoint oneself : χρισάμεναι ἐλαίῳ Od. 7.96. Cf. Od. 7.220, Od. 18.194.

forms: One's flesh, body, person (= χρώς 2) : παραδραθέειν φιλότητι ᾗ χροιῇ Il. 14.164.

defs: A grinding sound Il. 23.688.
After a long time : υἱὸν ἐλθόντα χρόνιον (long expected) Od. 17.112.

A space of time : ἐπὶ χρόνον (for a time) Il. 2.299, πολὺν χρόνον (for a long time, long) 343, Il. 3.157, Il. 12.9, τόσσον χρόνον ὅσσον . . . (for such time as . . .) Il. 24.670. Cf. Il. 14.206 = 305, Il. 19.157, Il. 23.418 : χρόνον μʼ ἐνθάδʼ ἐρύκεις Od. 4.599 (= πολὺν χρόνον 594), μεῖναι χρόνον (for a time) Od. 7.295, Od. 9.138, ἐπὶ χρόνον (to last us long) Od. 14.193. Cf. Od. 2.115, Od. 12.407, Od. 19.169, 221, etc. The space of time allotted in thought to the happening of something : ἀπολέσθαι ἕνα χρόνον (i.e. once for all) Il. 15.511.
With frontlet of gold. Of horses Il. 5.358, 363, 720= Il. 8.382.
With sword of gold. Epithet of Apollo Il. 5.509, Il. 15.256.

(1) Of gold, golden : ἥλοισιν Il. 1.246, σειρήν (made of strands of gold wire) Il. 8.19. Cf. Il. 3.248, Il. 4.133, Il. 5.730, 744, Il. 8.69, Il. 12.297, etc. : Od. 1.137, 142, Od. 3.41, Od. 5.62, Od. 10.355, Od. 18.294, etc. In reference to the hue of a cloud Il. 14.351. Epithet of Aphrodite Il. 9.389.
(2) Studded, ornamented or fitted with gold : λέπαδνα Il. 5.731, ἱμάσθλην (app., with handle of gold) Il. 8.44. Cf. Il. 24.21, etc. : Od. 1.97, Od. 5.232, etc.

forms: (Cf. χρύσειος. Often with synizesis of the second and third syllables.)
defs: (1) Of gold, golden : δαπέδῳ Il. 4.2, δεπάεσσιν 3, περόνῃ Il. 5.425. Cf. Il. 4.111, Il. 5.724, Il. 7.320, Il. 9.670, Il. 18.375, Il. 23.92, etc. : Od. 3.472, Od. 4.131, Od. 7.79, Od. 8.431, Od. 15.460, etc. In reference to the hue of clouds Il. 13.523, Il. 14.344, Il. 18.206. Epithet of Aphrodite Il. 3.64, Il. 5.427, Il. 19.282, Il. 22.470, Il. 24.699 : Od. 4.14, Od. 8.337, 342, Od. 17.37= Od. 19.54.
(2) Studded, ornamented or fitted with gold : σκήπτρῳ Il. 1.15. Cf. Il. 5.727, Il. 7.236, Il. 11.31, etc. : Od. 11.91, 610, etc.

forms: Epithet or a name of Artemis Il. 16.183, Od. 3.70 : Od. 4.122.

defs: With reins of gold. Epithet of Artemis Il. 7.205. Of Ares Od. 8.285.

forms: Epithet of Here Il. 1.611, Il. 14.153, Il. 15.5.

defs: With sandals of gold. Epithet of Here Od. 11.604.
With wings of gold. Epithet of Iris Il. 8.398= Il. 11.185.
With wand of gold. Epithet of Hermes Od. 5.87, Od. 10.277, 331.

(1) Gold : δέκα χρυσοῖο τάλαντα Il. 9.122, χρυσὸν περιχεύας (gold foil) Il. 10.294. Cf. Il. 2.229, Il. 7.48, Il. 9.126, Il. 11.25, Il. 17.52, Il. 18.574, etc. : ὅθι νητὸς χρυσὸς ἔκειτο Od. 2.338. Cf. Od. 1.165, Od. 3.301, Od. 4.73, Od. 5.38, Od. 10.35, Od. 13.218, etc.
(2) Applied collectively to things made of gold.
(b) To golden armour : χρυσὸν ἔδυνεν Il. 8.43= Il. 13.25.

forms: One who applies gold as a covering or adornment, a goldsmith Od. 3.425.

defs: (1) The flesh of the body : ἀκρότατον ὀϊστὸς ἐπέγραψε χρόα Il. 4.139, οὔ σφι λίθος χρώς [ἐστιν] 510, οὔ πῃ χρὼς (u.l. χροὸς) εἴσατο Il. 13.191 (see εἴδω II.1, ἵημι2 5). Cf. Il. 5.337, Il. 8.298, Il. 11.437, Il. 12.427, Il. 13.574, etc. : Od. 5.455, Od. 13.398, 430, Od. 16.145, Od. 19.204.

(2) One's flesh, body, person : χρυσὸν ἔδυνε περὶ χροΐ Il. 8.43, ἀπὸ χροὸς λύματα κάθηρεν Il. 14.170. Cf. Il. 4.130, Il. 10.575, Il. 11.398, Il. 13.640, Il. 17.210, etc. : ὡς ἂν μὴ χρόʼ ἰάπτῃ Od. 2.376. Cf. Od. 4.750, Od. 7.129, Od. 11.191, Od. 16.182, Od. 19.232, etc.
(3) In reference to the outward appearance or hue of the flesh, i.e. to the complexion : μελαίνετο χρόα Il. 5.354. Cf. Il. 13.279, 284, Il. 17.733 : Od. 11.529, Od. 21.412.

forms: nom. fem. aor. pple. pass. χέω.

defs: A collection, mass or heap of scattered objects : φύλλων χύσις (χύσιν) Od. 5.483, 487, Od. 19.443.
In mid., to anoint oneself : ἧος χυτλώσαιτο Od. 7.80.
Piled or heaped up (cf. χέω 5) : γαῖα Il. 7.464, Il. 14.114. Cf. Il. 23.256 : Od. 3.258.
To walk lame, halt, limp. Of Hephaestus Il. 18.411 =  Od. 3.37, Il. 18.417.
Lame, halt : χωλὸς ἕτερον πόδα (lame of one foot) Il. 2.217. Of Hephaestus Il. 18.397 : Od. 8.308, 332. Of the λιταί Il. 9.503.

To be angry, wroth or indignant, conceive anger, wrath or indignation : χωόμενος κῆρ (with wrath in his heart) Il. 1.44, ὅ τι τόσσον ἐχώσατο 64. Cf. Il. 1.46, Il. 2.782, Il. 3.414, Il. 8.397, Il. 14.260, Il. 16.616, etc. : Od. 2.80, Od. 5.284, Od. 8.238, Od. 11.103= Od. 13.343, Od. 12.376. In reference to self-anger : χωόμενος ὅ τε . . . Il. 1.244. With dat. of the person against whom one feels anger : ἀνδρὶ χέρηϊ Il. 1.80. Cf. Il. 9.555, Il. 21.306, 413, Il. 24.606 : Od. 5.215, Od. 23.213. With genit. of the cause : χωόμενος ἐϋζώνοιο γυναικός Il. 1.429. Cf. Il. 2.689, Il. 13.165, 662, Il. 16.553, Od. 3.29, Il. 21.457, Il. 23.37. With the cause in acc. : μή μοι τόδε χώεο Od. 5.215, Od. 23.213.

To withdraw, retire, give way : χώρησαν δʼ ὑπὸ πρόμαχοι Il. 4.505= Il. 16.588= Il. 17.316, χώρησε τυτθὸν ἐπάλξιος (from the . . .) Il. 12.406, οὐδʼ ἂν Ἀχιλλῆϊ χωρήσειεν (give way to him, retire before him) Il. 13.324. Cf. Il. 13.724, Il. 15.655, Il. 16.592, 629, Il. 17.101, 533, Il. 18.244.

(1) A place or spot : στρέψεσθʼ ἐκ χώρης ὅθι . . . Il. 7.516 : θῆκʼ αὐτῇ ἐνὶ χώρῃ (in the place from which he had taken it) Od. 21.366. Cf. Od. 23.186. The place occupied by one, one's place : στρεφθεὶς ἐκ χώρης Od. 16.352. Cf. Il. 23.349.
(2) A land, country, region : ἅς τινας ἵκεο χώρας ἀνθρώπων Od. 8.573.
(3) A space or extent of ground : ὀλίγῃ ἐνὶ χώρῃ Il. 17.394. Space, extent of ground : χώρης ὀλίγην μοῖραν Il. 16.68. Cf. Il. 23.521.
(1) Separately, apart, so as to be divided or parted from others : ἔρχατο, χ. μὲν πρόγονοι, χ. δὲ μέτασσαι, χ. δʼ αὖθʼ ἕρσαι Od. 9.221. Cf. Od. 24.78.
(2) Separately, so as not to be in common or shared with others or another : χ. Ἀτρεΐδῃς δῶκε μέθυ Il. 6.470. Cf. Od. 4.130.
(3) Separately, besides : χ. [δῶκα] γυναῖκας Od. 24.278.

(1) A place or spot : ἐς χῶρον ἕνα ξυνιόντες ἵκοντο Il. 4.446= Il. 8.60, χῶρον, ὅθʼ ἕστασαν ἵπποι Il. 10.520. Cf. Il. 13.473, Il. 17.54, Il. 21.262, Il. 23.138 : Od. 1.426, Od. 5.442, Od. 6.123, Od. 9.181, Od. 11.22, Od. 21.142, etc.

(2) A space or extent of ground : ὅθι νεκύων διεφαίνετο χῶρος Il. 8.491= Il. 10.199. Cf. Il. 10.161, Il. 12.423. A space, place, region : κάλυψε (βάθυνἐ χῶρον ἅπαντα Il. 23.189, 421. A space set apart for some purpose : χῶρον διεμέτρεον Il. 3.315. Cf. Il. 3.344.
(3) A tract of country, a region : χῶρον ἀνʼ ὑλήεντα Il. 10.362 : Od. 14.2. A land, country, region : χώρου ἄϊδρις ἐών Od. 10.282. Cf. Od. 11.94.
(1) Sand : ὡς ὅτε τις ψάμαθον πάϊς [ἐρείπῃ] (a sand-castle) Il. 15.362 : ψαμάθῳ εἰλυμένα Od. 14.136. In pl. in sim. sense : αὐτόν μιν εἰλύσω ψαμάθοισιν Il. 21.319. Cf. Il. 6.462, Il. 12.31.

(2) Sand as commonly occurring by the sea or by rivers, the sand, the sands : ἐπὶ ψαμάθῳ ἔθεσαν Od. 13.119. In pl. : νῆα ἔρυσσαν ἐπὶ ψαμάθοις Il. 1.486. Cf. Il. 21.202, Il. 23.15, 853 : Od. 3.38, Od. 4.426, 438, 539, Od. 9.546= Od. 12.5, Od. 13.284, Od. 22.387. The particles considered separately with reference to their number : ὅσα ψάμαθός τε κόνις τε Il. 9.385. In pl. : ψαμάθοισιν [ἐοικότες] Il. 2.800.
(1) To be so close together as to touch, to touch : ψαῦον κόρυθες φάλοισιν Il. 13.132= Il. 16.216.
(2) To come into contact with, bring something into contact with, touch. With genit. : ψαύουσιν ἐπισσώτρου τρίχες Il. 23.519, ὸππότερός κε ψαύσῃ ἐνδίνων 806.
Sparse, scanty, thin : λάχνη Il. 2.219.
Falsifying one's message Il. 15.159.
Breaking one's troth. Absol., one guilty of doing this : οὐκ ἐπὶ ψευδέσσι Ζεὺς ἔσσετʼ ἀρωγός Il. 4.235 (u.l. ψεύδεσσιν; see ψεῦδος 1).

forms: Nom. pl. aor. pple. ψευσάμενοι Il. 6.352.
defs: (1) To speak falsely, lie, use deceit : κομιδῆς κεχρημένοι ψεύδονται Od. 14.125. Cf.  Il. 7.163 : Od. 14.365.
(2) To break (a treaty) : ὅρκια ψευσάμενοι Il. 6.352.
(3) To make an inaccurate or incorrect statement, speak erroneously, be wrong in what one says : ψεύσομαι, ἦ ἔτυμον ἐρέω; Il. 10.534 := Od. 4.140. Cf. Il. 4.404, Il. 5.635.

(1) A falsehood, lie, piece of deceit : ψ. κεν φαῖμεν Il. 2.81= Il. 24.222, γνώμεναι εἴ τε ψ. ὑπόσχεσις (whether he promised only to deceive) Il. 2.349. Cf. Il. 21.276 : Od. 3.20 = 328, Od. 11.366, Od. 14.296, 387, Od. 19.203. In pl., sharp practice : ψεύδεσσι βιησάμενος Il. 23.576. An oath-breaking (cf. ψεύδομαι 2). In pl. : ψεύδεσσιν ἀρωγός (an abettor in oath-breaking) Il. 4.235 (u.l. ψευδέσσιν; see ψευδής).
(2) An inaccurate, incorrect or erroneous statement : οὔ τι ψ. ἐμὰς ἄτας κατέλεξας (all you have said is but the truth) Il. 9.115.

forms: = ψεύδομαι 3 : ψευστήσεις (the event will falsify your boast) Il. 19.107.

defs: A liar : ψεῦσταί τʼ ὀρχησταί τε Il. 24.261.
To feel or grope about : χερσὶ ψηλαφόων Od. 9.416.
A pebble Il. 21.260.
A drop Il. 16.459.

forms: Bare: ἄροσιν (freed from trees or other encumbrances, cleared) Il. 9.580 : νῆα ψιλὴν φέρε κῦμα (her timbers gone) Od. 12.421, δέρμα (stripped of the hair) Od. 13.437.
Accompanied by smoke, smoky : κεραυνῷ Od. 23.330. Cf. Od. 24.539.

defs: (1) The animating principle, the vital spirit, the soul, the life, life, one's life (cf. θυμός I.1.b) : λύθη ψυχή τε μένος τε Il. 5.296= Il. 8.123=315. Cf. Il. 11.334, Il. 21.569, Il. 22.257, 325, 338, 467, Il. 23.104, Il. 24.754 : κεκαδήσει θυμοῦ καὶ ψυχῆς Od. 21.154, 171. Cf. Od. 9.523. In pl. in reference to a number of persons : ψυχὰς ὀλέσαντες Il. 13.763= Il. 24.168. Cf. Od. 22.444.
(2) Animate existence viewed as a possession, one's life : ἐμὴν ψυχὴν παραβαλλόμενος Il. 9.322, ψυχῆς ἀντάξιον 401 : ψυχὰς παρθέμενοι Od. 3.74= Od. 9.255.

(3) Animate existence viewed with regard to its duration, one's life or continued existence : περὶ ψυχῆς θέον Ἕκτορος Il. 22.161 : ἀρνύμενος ἣν ψυχήν Od. 1.5, ὥς τε περὶ ψυχῆς Od. 9.423. In pl. in reference to a number of persons : ὅσσοι περὶ ψυχέων ἐμάχοντο Od. 22.245.

(4) The spirit or soul thought of as distinct from the body and as leaving it at death (cf. θυμός I.1.c) : πολλὰς ψυχὰς Ἄϊδι προΐαψεν Il. 1.3, τὸν δὲ λίπε ψυχή Il. 5.696, ψυχὴ πάλιν ἐλθεῖν οὐ λεϊστή Il. 9.408. Cf. Il. 5.654= Il. 11.445, Il. 6.330, Il. 14.518, Il. 16.453, 505, 625, 856= Il. 22.362 : ψυχὴ ἀποπταμένη πεπότηται Od. 11.222. Cf. Od. 10.560= Od. 11.65, Od. 14.134, 426 (of a pig), Od. 18.91.

forms: Of the bronze of a weapon : ψυχρὸν ἕλε χαλκὸν ὀδοῦσιν Il. 5.75.

defs: To breathe, blow : ἦκα ψύξασα Od. 3.440.
A bit or gobbet Od. 9.374.

forms: ὤ μοι. ay me! Il. 1.149, Il. 4.370, Il. 6.96, etc. : Od. 5.408, Od. 11.216, Od. 13.168, etc.– ὤ μοι Ὀδυσῆος Od. 20.209 (ay me for . . . !).
So ὤ μοι ἐγώ Il. 11.404, etc. : Od. 5.299, etc.– ὤ μοι ἐγὼ σέο Od. 19.363.

defs: (1) In this way or manner, thus, so (often (and properly) referring to what concerns the speaker; cf. οὕτως) : ἀπειλήσω τοι ὧδε Il. 1.181, εἰ ἐριδαίνετον ὧδε 574, οὐ τότε γʼ ὧδʼ Ὀδυσῆος ἀγασσάμεθʼ εἶδος (as much as before) Il. 3.224, ὧδε γὰρ ἔβρισαν (so heavily do they bear upon us) Il. 12.346 (or this might come under (3)). Cf. Il. 1.212, Il. 2.258, 271, 802, Il. 4.176, 308, etc. : ὧδʼ ἔρξαι Od. 5.342, ἥμενος ὧδε (sitting here quietly) Od. 18.224, ὄρχους δέ μοι ὧδʼ ὀνόμηνας δώσειν (in the same way, similarly) Od. 24.341. Cf. Od. 1.236, Od. 2.28, 111, Od. 4.159, Od. 9.403, Od. 12.217, etc.
(2) With imp., as you are, as I tell you, without more ado, straightway, at once : ὧδʼ ἐπʼ ἀριστέρʼ ἔχε στρατοῦ Il. 13.326. Sim. : οὕνεκά σʼ οὐ τὸ πρῶτον, ἐπεὶ ἴδον, ὧδʼ ἀγάπησα (at once) Od. 23.214.
(3) Hither : αἲ γὰρ ὧδʼ ἄφαρ ἐλασαίαθʼ ἵππους Il. 10.537, πρόμολʼ ὧδε Il. 18.392 : ὧδε κατήλυθον Od. 1.182. Cf. Od. 17.544, Od. 21.196.

(4) Qualifying an adj., pple. or adv., thus, so : ἀθρόοι ὧδʼ ἴομεν (keeping together as we are) Il. 2.439, ὧδʼ ἀΐδηλος Il. 5.897. Cf. Il. 7.478, Il. 21.358, etc. : ὧδε ἐοικότα Od. 3.125, ὧδʼ ἐκπάγλως Od. 5.339. Cf. Od. 3.376, Od. 4.141, Od. 7.25, Od. 14.139, Od. 19.350, etc.
(5) Correlative with ὡς · ὧδε . . . ὡς . . . ,  in like manner . . . as . . . Il. 3.300, etc. : Od. 3.221, etc.
(1) To suffer pain, be in agony : στενάχων τε καὶ ὠδίνων ὀδύνῃσιν (in agony of anguish) Od. 9.415.
(2) To suffer the pains of child-birth : ὠδίνουσαν γυναῖκα (in labour) Il. 11.269.
In pl., pains, pangs : εἰλείθυιαι πικρὰς ὠδῖνας ἔχουσαι Il. 11.271.

forms: 3 sing. pa. iterative ὤθεσκε Od. 11.596. ὤσασκε Od. 11.599.
defs: (1) To thrust, push, force, shove : ἐς κουλεὸν ξίφος Il. 1.220, ὦσε δʼ ἀπὸ ῥινὸν λίθος (forced it aside) Il. 5.308, ὦσε νεκρούς (i.e. cleared his stream of them) Il. 21.235. Cf. Il. 13.138, Il. 14.494, Il. 15.668 (dispersed it), Il. 17.618 : Od. 3.295,  Od. 11.596, 599, Od. 22.20. Of pushing an object by force applied from a position upon it : ὦσα [νῆα] παρέξ Od. 9.488. To thrust (a spear) Il. 21.398. With personal object : ὅτε φῆρας ἐκ πηλίου ὦσεν Il. 2.744, Ἕκτορα Ζεὺς ὦσεν ὄπισθε χειρί (pushed him forwards) Il. 15.694. Cf. Il. 5.19, Il. 16.410, 863, Il. 11.143, 320, Od. 3.461, 489. In mid. with such an object, to thrust back, repulse (a suppliant) : ἀπὸ ἕθεν ὤσατʼ?̓́αδρηστον Il. 7.62.

(2) To thrust or force back (a foe), cause (him) to give way or retreat : μέγαν ἑ ἐόντα [̔́εκτορʼ] ὦσαν ἀπὸ σφείων Il. 4.535= Il. 5.626= Il. 13.148, ἰθὺς τάφροιο ὦσαν Ἀχαιούς Il. 8.336. Cf. Il. 13.193, 688, Il. 16.45, 569= Il. 17.274, Il. 21.241. In mid. : ὄφρʼ ὤσαιτʼ Ἀργείους Il. 5.691. Cf. Il. 8.295, Il. 11.803, Il. 12.420, Il. 15.418, Il. 16.592, 655.
(3) To pull, draw : ἔκ οἱ μηροῦ δόρυ ὦσεν Il. 5.694. Cf. Il. 5.854. With personal object : σθένελον ἀφʼ ἵππων ὦσε χείρʼ ἐρύσασα Il. 5.835.

(1) With speed, swiftly : ὦκα διέπρησσον πεδίοιο Il. 2.785= Il. 3.14. Cf. Il. 5.88, Il. 13.671= Il. 16.606, Il. 21.261, Il. 23.364 : ὦκα μεγάροιο διελθέμεν Od. 7.304. Cf. Od. 3.157, 176, Od. 4.586= Od. 17.149, Od. 15.182, 472, 555, Od. 24.413.

(2) In short space, soon, before long, quickly, speedily, shortly : οὐδέ κέ μʼ ὦκα τέλος θανάτοιο κιχείη Il. 9.416. Cf. Il. 5.903, Il. 10.350, Il. 14.418, Il. 17.190, etc. : μάλα δʼ ὦκα δόμους ἵκανεν ἄνακτος Od. 17.255. Cf. Od. 12.427, Od. 14.352, Od. 20.27, Od. 21.50, etc.

(3) Without delay or loss of time, with all speed, at once, forthwith, straightway : ὦχʼ ἑκατόγχειρον καλέσασα Il. 1.402. Cf. Il. 1.447, Il. 2.26, 52, Il. 6.337, 417, Il. 11.354, etc. : ὦκʼ ἐνήσομεν πόντῳ Od. 2.295. Cf. Od. 2.8, Od. 7.289, Od. 10.178, Od. 14.33, Od. 18.39, etc.

forms: Epithet of ships Il. 15.705 : Od. 12.182, Od. 15.473.

defs: (1) On whom fate is coming swiftly, doomed to an early death, short-lived : ὠκύμορος καὶ ὀϊζυρός Il. 1.417. Cf. Il. 18.95, 458: Od. 1.266= Od. 4.346= Od. 17.137. In superl. : ὠκυμορώτατος ἄλλων Il. 1.505.
(2) Carrying swift death. Epithet of arrows Il. 15.441: Od. 22.75.
Swiftly cleaving (the seas), swift-sailing. Epithet of ships Il. 1.421, Il. 2.351, Il. 10.308, Il. 12.156, etc. : Od. 4.708, Od. 5.176, Od. 14.230.

forms: Swift-footed. Epithet of horses Il. 2.383, Il. 5.296, 732, Il. 10.535, etc. : Od. 23.245.
Applied to ἵπποι in sense chariot (see ἵππος (3)) Il. 8.129 : Od. 18.263.
Epithet of the falcon : ἴρηξ Il. 13.62.
Nom. sing. fem. always in form ὠκέα Il. 2.786, Il. 5.368, Il. 8.425, Il. 11.195, etc. : Od. 12.374.
Superl. ὠκύτατος Od. 8.331. ὤκιστος Il. 15.238, Il. 21.253, Il. 22.325 : Od. 22.77, 133.
defs: (1) Quick in movement, nimble, swift, fleet (often a merely conventional epithet) : ὀϊστόν Il. 5.395, ἴρηκι Il. 15.238. Cf. Il. 5.106, Il. 11.397, Il. 16.583, etc. : τῶν νέες ὠκεῖαι ὡς εἰ πτερόν Od. 6.36. Cf. Od. 7.104, Od. 12.374, Od. 21.138, 416, etc. Absol. : κιχάνει βραδὺς ὠκύν Od. 8.329. In superl. : ὤκιστος πετεηνῶν Il. 15.238, Il. 21.253. Cf. Od. 8.331. Of immaterial things : ὠκὺς θυμὸς πτάτο (flew swiftly) Il. 23.880. In superl. : ὤκιστος ὄλεθρος Il. 22.325. Epithet of horses Il. 3.263, Il. 4.500, Il. 5.257, Il. 6.240, etc. : Od. 3.478, 496, Od. 4.28. Applied to ἵπποι in sense chariot (see ἵππος (3)) Il. 6.15. Of ships Il. 8.197 : Od. 6.34, Od. 9.101. Epithet of Achilles Il. 19.295, Il. 21.211, Il. 22.188, etc. Of Iris Il. 2.786, Il. 5.368, Il. 11.195, etc. For πόδας ὠκύς (ὠκέἀ see πούς 3.
(2) In neut. pl. superl. ὤκιστα as adv., very soon, speedily, at once : εἴ κε βοὴ ὤκιστα γένοιτο Od. 22.77. Cf. Od. 22.133.

forms: Shedding its fruit early : ἰτέαι Od. 10.510.

defs: Only in acc. ὦλκα. A furrow : ἱεμένω κατὰ ὦλκα Il. 13.707. Cf. Od. 18.375.
Eating raw flesh, preying on carrion : οἰωνοί Il. 11.454, κύνες Il. 22.67, ἰχθύσιν Il. 24.82. Applied to a human being : ὠμηστὴς ἀνὴρ ὅ γε Il. 24.207.
In green or lusty old age Il. 23.791.

In sacrificing, to lay slices of raw flesh on the fat enclosing the sacrificial joints : ἐπʼ αὐτῶν (i.e. on the joints so enclosed) ὠμοθέτησαν Il. 1.461= Il. 2.424 := Od. 3.458= Od. 12.361. In mid. : ὠμοθετεῖτο συβώτης ἐς πίονα δημόν Od. 14.427.
(1) Uncooked, raw : ὠμὰ κρέα ἔδμεναι Il. 22.347 : κρέʼ ὀπταλέα τε καὶ ὠμά Od. 12.396. So εἰ ὠμὸν βεβρώθοις Πρίαμον Il. 4.35. Fig. : ἐν ὠμῷ γήραϊ θῆκεν (premature) Od. 15.357.

(2) Raw, with the skin stripped off, excoriated, bloody : ὅς κε μήδεʼ ἐξερύσας δώῃ κυσὶν ὠμὰ δάσασθαι Od. 18.87. Cf. Od. 22.476. In neut. pl. as adv. (though in sense qualifying rather the object than the vb.) : Ἕκτορα δώσειν κυσὶν ὠμὰ δάσασθαι Il. 23.21.

(1) One of the shoulders, one's shoulder; in dual and pl., the shoulders, one's shoulders : τόξʼ ὤμοισιν ἔχων Il. 1.45, τώ οἱ ὤμω κυρτώ Il. 2.217, διʼ ὤμου ἔγχος ἦλθεν Il. 4.481. Cf. Il. 1.46, Il. 3.17, Il. 5.7, 46, 622, Il. 6.16, Il. 11.593, etc. : Od. 2.3, Od. 4.245, Od. 7.219, Od. 8.416, 528, Od. 10.170, 262, 362, etc. Of animals. Of horses Il. 7.510= Il. 15.267, Il. 16.468. Of a wild boar Od. 19.452.
(2) Regarded as a seat of strength : ἐν βίην ὤμοισιν ἔθηκεν Il. 17.569.
Eating, preying upon, raw flesh, ravening : λείουσιν Il. 5.782, Il. 6.256, Il. 15.592, θῶες Il. 11.479, λύκοι Il. 16.157.

forms: Bought : ἔμʼ ὠνητὴ τέκε μήτηρ, παλλακίς (i.e. a slave) Od. 14.202.

That which is given or paid as an equivalent, a price: ὦνον ἔδωκεν Il. 21.41, υἷος Πριάμοιο ὦνον ἔδωκε [κρητῆρα] (as the ransom for him; referring to the same transaction) Il. 23.746 : ἐπείγετʼ ὦνον ὁδαίων (i.e. your buying, your bargaining) Od. 15.445. Cf. Od. 14.297, Od. 15.388 = 429, 452, 463.
(Cf. βλοσυρῶπις, βοῶπις, γλαυκῶπις, εἰσωπός, ἑλίκωψ, ἐνῶπα, ἐνώπια, εὐῶπις, κυανῶπις, κυνώπης, κυνῶπις, μέτωπον, πρόσωπον, στεινωπός, ὑπώπια.)
defs: The eye (always with εἰς) : θεῇς εἰς ὦπα ἔοικεν (looking at her in the eye, to view) Il. 3.158, ἔμοιγε εἰς ὦπα ἰδέσθαι (to look me in the eye) Il. 9.373, ἐπὴν Διὸς εἰς ὦπα ἴδησθε Il. 15.147. Cf. Od. 1.411, Od. 22.405, Od. 23.107.

(1) A natural season, a period of the year : ὅσσα τε φύλλα γίγνεται ὥρῃ (in their season, i.e. in spring) Il. 2.468, ὥρῃ ἐν εἰαρινῇ 471= Il. 16.643. Cf. Il. 7.148, Il. 21.450 : βαθύ κε λήϊον εἰς ὥρας ἀμῷεν (in due season) Od. 9.135. Cf. Od. 2.107 =Od. 19.152 = Od. 24.142, Od. 9.51, Od. 10.469, Od. 11.295 = Od. 14.294, Od. 18.367 = Od. 22.301. Personified. In pl. Ὧραι Il. 5.749 = Il. 8.393, Il. 8.433. A season or time marked by special characteristics : ὥρῃ χειμερίῃ (in storm-time) Od. 5.485, ὁππότε Διὸς ὧραι ἐπιβρίσειαν (the rainy seasons, rain-showers) Od. 24.344.
(2) The season or time for something : ὥρη εὕδειν Od. 11.330, 373, ὥρη δόρποιο Od. 14.407, ἐν ὥρῃ (in the due season) Od. 17.176. Cf. Od. 3.334, Od. 11.379, Od. 15.126, 394, Od. 19.510, Od. 21.428.
Proper to a season : φέροι κεν ὥρια πάντα (all things in due season) Od. 9.131.

(1) In this way or manner, thus, so : ὣς ἔφατο Il. 1.33, ὣς τὰ πένοντο 318, αἲ γὰρ ἐγὼν ὣς εἴην ἀθάνατος ὡς . . . (as surely as . . .) Il. 8.538. Cf. Il. 1.68, 217, Il. 2.35, 207, Il. 14.142 (by his own folly) , etc. : Od. 1.42, 96, 125, 166, Od. 2.106, 320, Od. 3.148, 228, etc. With αὔτως. See αὔτως 2.
(2) Absol.
(b) οὐδʼ ὥς, not even so, for all thatIl. 6.263, Il. 9.351, 386, Il. 11.255, Il. 12.432, etc. : Od. 1.6, Od. 2.23, Od. 5.324, Od. 10.291, etc.
(3) Qualifying an adjective or pple., thus, so : ὣς πυκνοὶ ἀλλήλοισιν ἔφυν ἐπαμοιβαδίς Od. 5.480. Cf. Od. 13.389, Od. 18.202, Od. 19.442.

(4) Thus, so, therefore, accordingly : ὣς λίπον [ἵππους] Il. 5.204. Cf. Il. 1.601, Il. 9.597, etc. : ὣς οὐκ αἰνότερον ἄλλο γυναικός (thus we see that . . .) Od. 11.427. Cf. Od. 2.137, Od. 4.93, Od. 9.161, etc.
(5) Correlative with ὡς ·
(1) In such or the same way or manner as, even as, as.
(b) With subj.
(c) Introducing a simile with opt. : ὡς ὅτε Od. 9.384.
(d) For ὡς εἰ, ὡς εἴ τε see εἰ 6, εἰ 7.
(2) Introducing similes without expressed vb. : ὡς Il. 17.4, Il. 21.282.– ὥς τε Il. 5.136, Il. 9.14, Il. 12.299, Il. 15.630, etc. : Od. 1.308, Od. 7.130, Od. 22.384, etc. For ὡς ὅτε see ὅτε 2.
(3) Introducing a clause reduced to its subject or object, after the manner of, as in the case of, in the likeness of, like.

(b) ὥς τε · ὥς τε θεός (as might be expected of a goddess) Il. 3.381, ὥς τε λέοντα Il. 5.136. Cf. Il. 2.289, Il. 9.14, Il. 11.239, Il. 13.564, etc. : ὥς τε κτάμεναι μενεαίνων (like one minded to . . .) Od. 10.295, ὥς τε θεῷ Od. 22.349. Cf. Od. 1.227, Od. 3.246, Od. 4.45, Od. 5.371, etc.–.

(4) Following the word to which it relates and accented : κακὸν ὥς Il. 2.190, ὄρνιθας ὥς 764. Cf. Il. 2.781, Il. 3.60, 196, Il. 5.78, Il. 8.306, etc. : ἀθάνατος ὥς Od. 7.309. Cf. Od. 1.320, Od. 2.47, Od. 4.32, Od. 10.124, etc.

(5) In what way or manner, in how high a degree. In exclamatory use, how . . . ! to think how . . . ! to think that . . . ! ὡς οὔ τίς με θεῶν ὑπέστη σαῶσαι Il. 21.273. Cf. Il. 21.441, Il. 24.388 : ὡς ὅδε πᾶσι φίλος ἐστίν Od. 10.38, ὡς ἐπιτροχάδην ἀγορεύει Od. 18.26. Cf. Od. 15.381, Od. 16.364. Sim. : ὥς μοι δέχεται κακὸν ἐκ κακοῦ (showing how . . .) Il. 19.290 : ὡς ἀγαθὸν καὶ παῖδα λιπέσθαι (from which we see how good a thing it is) Od. 3.196, ὡς οὐδὲν γλύκιον ἧς  πατρίδος (so true it is that . . .) Od. 9.34. Cf. Od. 22.319.
(6) In object clauses, in what way or manner, to what extent, in what degree, how.
(b) With subj. (here and in c tending to pass into sense (8)).
(c) With opt. : πειρᾶν ὡς πεπίθοιεν πηλεΐωνα Il. 9.181.
(7) In such way or manner that, so that.
(b) With opt.
(8) Infinal clauses, so that, in order that.
(b) With opt.
(9) In which way, i.e. wherefore, and so : ὡς ἂν ἀπὸ σεῖο οὐκ ἐθέλοιμι λείπεσθαι Il. 9.444. Cf. Il. 21.291.

(10) ὥς τε with infin., so as to . . . : οὐ γὰρ ἔτι τηλίκος εἰμί, ὥς τε σημάντορι πιθέσθαι Od. 17.21. This construction where the simple infin. might be expected : εἴ τοι θυμὸς ἐπέσσυται ὥς τε νέεσθαι Il. 9.42.

(11) Seeing how, in what way or manner, to what extent, in what degree, seeing that thus (= ὅτι οὕτως): ὡς ἐλέλιχθεν Il. 7.109, ὡς ἀγορεύεις (as to judge by your speech you think them to be) Il. 9.41, ὡς πυκνοὶ ἐφέστασαν ἀλλήλοισιν (so close together did they stand) Il. 13.133. Cf. Il. 4.157, Il. 9.689, Il. 10.116, Il. 11.689, Il. 15.698, Il. 16.17, 600 (when they saw how he had fallen), etc. : ὡς οὔ τις μέμνηται Ὀδυσσῆος Od. 2.233, ὡς δὴ δήθʼ ἐνὶ νήσῳ ἐρύκεαι (seeing that so long . . .) Od. 4.373, ὡς ὄνομʼ ἐξαπάτησεν (to think how . . .) Od. 9.414, θαῦμά μʼ ἔχει ὡς . . . (to see how . . .) Od. 10.326, ὥς οἱ ἔειπεν Ἀθηναίη (reassured by her speech) Od. 13.251, ὡς ἐπάγοντες ἐπῇσαν (with such a din did they . . .) Od. 19.445. Cf. Od. 4.841, Od. 11.419, Od. 19.230, Od. 21.123, Od. 24.194, 512, etc.

(12) When, after that, as soon as : ὡς ἴδον Il. 1.600. Cf. Il. 2.321, Il. 3.21, Il. 4.149, Il. 7.237, 374, Il. 18.222, etc. : φαῖνεν ἀοιδήν, ἔνθεν ἑλὼν ὡς ἀπέπλειον (from the point when they had . . .) Od. 8.500, ὡς ἐνόησεν Od. 10.375. Cf. Od. 3.34, Od. 8.272, Od. 22.148, etc.

(13) With opt. expressing a wish : ὡς ἔρις ἀπόλοιτο Il. 18.107. Cf. Il. 22.286 : ὡς ἔλθοι Od. 17.243= Od. 21.201. Cf. Od. 1.47. Anomalously with κεν · ὥς κέ οἱ γαῖα χάνοι Il. 7.281 (app., Il. 15. that the earth could gape for him). For ὡς ὤφελον (ὄφελον̓, ὡς ὤφελλον, see ὀφέλλω1 5.

(14) Introducing a dependent substantive-clause, that, how : ἀγορεύεις ὡς . . . Il. 1.110. Cf. Il. 1.558, Il. 6.402, Il. 10.160, Il. 17.450, Il. 22.10, Il. 23.611, etc. : ἦ οὐχ ἅλις ὡς . . . Od. 2.312. Cf. Od. 3.347, Od. 4.377, Od. 5.24, Od. 9.443, Od. 14.152, Od. 17.157, Od. 19.94, Od. 21.209, Od. 22.351, Od. 23.60, etc. Introducing a clause with opt. in oratio obliqua : ἕκαστα εἰπεῖν, ὡς ἔλθοι (that he had come) Od. 24.237.
(15) In Od. 17.218 (ὡς αἰεὶ τὸν ὁμοῖον ἄγει θεὸς ὣς τὸν ὁμοῖον) if ὡς be read for ὥς it must app. be taken as = εἰς or πρός. See ὁμοῖος 1.
(16) Correlative with οὕτως. See οὕτως 1. With τόσσον. See τόσος 5.d. With τώς. See τώς 2. With ὧδε. See ὧδε 5. With ὥς. See ὥς 5.
Furnished with ears or handles (cf. οὖας 2) : τρίποδα Il. 23.264, 513.

forms: crasis of ὁ αὐτός. See αὐτός 3.

defs: To turn pale or pallid : ὠχρήσαντα χρόα κάλλιμον Od. 11.529.
Paleness, pallor : ὦχρός μιν εἷλε παρειάς Il. 3.35.
(ἀ-1.) Before a vowel ἀν-.
(ἀ-2.) [(σ)α- as in ἅμα.]
(ἀγα-) [ἄγαν, very, much.] Intensive.
(ἀμφι-) Before a vowel ἀμφ-. Also ἀμπ-.
(ἀνα-) Before a vowel ἀν-. Also in assimilated forms ἀγ-, ἀϝ-, ἀλ-, ἀμ-.
(ἀντι-) Before a vowel ἀντ-. Also in assimilated form ἀνθ-.
(ἀπο-) Before a vowel ἀπ-. Also in assimilated form ἀφ-.
(ἀρι-) Intensive.
(δα-) [δια- 10. Cf. ζα-.] Intensive.
(δια-) Before a vowel δι-.
(δισ-) [δύο.]
(δυσ-)
(εἰσ-) Also ἐσ-.
(ἐκ-) Before a vowel ἐξ-.
(ἐν-) Also in forms εἰν-, ἐνι-, and in assimilated forms ἐγ-, ἐμ-.
(ἐξ-) See ἐκ-.
(ἐπι-) Before a vowel ἐπ-. Also in assimilated form ἐφ-.
(ἐρι-) Intensive.
(ἐσ-) See εἰσ-.
(εὐ-) ἐϋ- Also ἠϋ.
(ζα-) [δα-, δια- 10.] Intensive.
(ἡμι-) [Cf. L. semi-.] Half-.
(κατα-) Before a vowel κατ-. Also in forms καται-, κα-, and in assimilated forms καβ-, καδ-, καθ-, κακ-, καλ-, καμ-, καν-, καπ-.
(μετα-) Before a vowel μετ-. Also in assimilated form μεθ-.
(νη-) Negative or privative.
(ξυν-) ξυμ- For words with these prefixes see the same words with συν-, συμ-.
(παρα-) παραι- Also in form παρ-.
(περι-)
(ποτι-) See προσ-.
(προ-)
(προσ-) Also προτι-, ποτι-.
(προτι-) See προσ-.
(συν-) ξυν- Also in assimilated forms συγ-, συλ-, συμ-, συρ-.
(ὑπερ-) Also in form ὑπειρ-.
(ὑπο-) Before a vowel ὑπ-. Also in assimilated forms ὑβ-, ὑφ-.
(-δε) enclitic.
(-θεν) Also -θε.
(-θι) Place at or in which; time when.
(-σε) Motion towards; place whither.
